text: Their warmth is world class They run their airline like their country. Quietly efficient. Check-in was quick, boarding was seamless and on-board overhead lockers are larger on their new aircraft. They tended to me pre-flight and served a delicious meal. If any passengers experienced discomfort with cabin pressure they'd alert the pilot and a more gradual lift/landing was exercised. I found the seats to be comfortable and roomy with a great selection of in-flight entertainment.
label: positive

text: Great service We began using Singapore Airlines the same year they began their service out of Houston IAH, and we have flown with them numerous times since. The service, even in economy, was great. You couldn’t ask for more. The cost of their flights are much more economical than other airlines flying the same route. Although we would prefer to fly into London, we cannot pass up on this flight because of the cost and the service. Try Singapore Airlines. You won’t be disappointed.
label: positive

text: The omly way to fly. Great airline. On time and the flight crew were professional and courteous the entire long flight. Will fly them again.
label: positive

text: Some Singapore Airline sectors have terrible service The flight service was pitiful both going and returning.  From the start the TV was not wotking.  My husband asked several times if they could correct this - he waited for hours and finally gave up and went to sleep.  The flight attendant then comes around a couple of hours into his sleep and wakes my husband up to let him know that the TV was working!!   They give us a menu for food choices and then told us that they had run out of our choice at the beginning of the flight!! Why bother to give a menu then?  Time came for drink orders and my husband asked for a brandy/cognac and got nothing.  He waited very patiently but had to remind them four times before they finally brought it.  We used the same airline from Delhi to Singapore and back - the service on those flights were fine.
label: negative

text: Stress free flight and excellent customer service before, during and after the flight. I've flown QANTAS (excellent), Etihad (great), Air New Zealand (average) and now Singapore Airlines overseas from Australia and all economy class.  I know there are loads of airlines out there that I haven't flown, but if I had to pick one right now to fly overseas, I'd pick Singapore Airlines.  We had a midnight flight that we missed (I had midnight of the next day in my head)! Despite booking with Opodo (which I don't think I'll ever do again, but that's another story) the Singapore Airlines customer service people couldn't have been more helpful.  Check in staff were cheerful and helpful at Tullamarine (there was an issue because one of the tickets hadn't been issued with a middle name) and during the flight both to Phuket and back, the onboard staff were professional and cheerful.  My husband also left his phone on the plane on the way over, which they found and delivered to our hotel's shuttle bus driver the next day when he went to pick up other guests.  I was very impressed with the whole trip and would highly recommend their economy class facilities.
label: positive

text:
Changi has lost its way I recently transited through  Changi with Singapore airlines  (business class) .l have flown with Singapore airlines well over 40 times but something is now drastically wrong..
Changi terminal was a nightmare, everything was shut ,despite walking 2km through terminal 1 and 2 l couldn't find a coffee shop open at 9am.
Then l was forced to stand in line for over 30 minutes in sweltering temperatures (not adequately air conditioned) only to be herded though like animals. Obviously without adequate staff or screening facilities our flight was going to be delayed, well over half an hour. 
The flight was not much better. Why send staff around taking drink and food orders only for passengers to wait 30 /40 minutes to receive them.The food was terrible, nothing fresh,tasteless  ,in fact l was ill for a couple of days after the flight. 
So in summary my experience was so bad l won't be using Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text:
Loved the customer service! This is the first time on Singapore Airlines, the airplane we were on was apparently one of their newer ones. We booked Premium Economy, which allows you to choose your meals. They have tons of options and several for those with dietary restrictions. In between each meal you also get "snacks" which includes anywhere from chips to sandwiches! I had the bland meal and boy was it BLAND! I have a lot of stomach sensitivities so this worked for me, however many of the items I couldn't eat because I am also lactose. However, the portions you get are quite decent.

As someone mentioned as soon as you get seated you are given a hot towel to wipe your hands on. Each seat has a footrest (thank goodness), however when you use the footrest it doesn't leave you much space underneath the seat in front of you. The seating was two, four and two, then there are actually (at least what I saw) three seats in the back left that are individual seats which look pretty large. The flight looked to only have Business class and Premium Economy. 

There were tons of movies, shows and music on the flight to keep you busy. Each seat comes with a pillow, blanket and a set of ear phones. There is even a USB port hook up. For the night flight they even give each passenger a small toiletry bag that has socks, ear plugs, sleeping mask, and toothbrush/toothpaste. 

There are three bathrooms for the back of the plan and then two I believe for those in Business class, however I saw multiple people from my side and sneak in and use those bathrooms! 

I would say the only “complaint” I would have was trying to get out of the airplane, the Business class were sooooo slow and it took forever! Upside, when you board they have at least two different lines that allow people to go in. However, right as you line up to board they didn’t really call anyone in any specific order, it was more confusing coming back. 

Overall, we had a good flight, it was quick, staff is efficient, the plane was clean and the staff was extremely courteous!
label: positive

text:
Very impressed with Singapore Airlines Very happy with Singapore Airlines once again.
The condition of the aircraft and service and meals proved by the cabin crew was excellent.Will definitely travel with them again in the future.
label: positive

text:
A great airline to travel with Most of the time, I am travelling with Cathay Pacific as Hong Kong being its hub which makes it more convenient than any other airlines. I was flying with SQ for a couple of times this year and it really impressed me. Service is no doubt on the top since you can always receive warm welcome on board and your request are fulfilled promptly. Seats are comfy on the new A350-900 and their entertainment choice is very updated. 

One thing I was not so happy with was the mile redemption that whenever it came to the issue that you needed to make any change, the only way was to call the hotline and it took like ,forever to be connected. Very inconvenient.
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight Flew with SQ in my most recent flight from SGN to SFO via SIN and HKG. In overall, the experience on Premium Economy Class was absolutely great with nice service, good food, thoughtful crew. The aircraft was Boeing 777-300ER. Departure was on time but arrival to SFO was a bit late as we had to wait on tarmac approx 30 minutes before parking.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines A 380 Business Class from Singapore to Sydney From Check in at Changi Airport to Kris Flyer lounge to boarding the aircraft was seamless. My wife had walking disabilities and nothing was too much trouble for the ground staff and also the on board staff. After a meal the cabin crew showed my wife all the features of the Lie Flat bed, TV controls and kept checking on her health all night. Then at 5-00am in the morning for our 48th wedding anniversary a special cake and Teddy Bears for us. On arrival in Sydney the cabin crew ensured my wife was able to get from the aircraft to the wheel chair and right through immigration and customs! I only wish the flight had been longer, if I rate Singapore Airlines Business Class and cabin crew I would have to give 11 out of 10! Perfect service
label: positive

text:
A350 uncomfortable seats Airbus A350 economy seats the hardest and most uncomfortable I have ever had to sit in.

If Singapore Airlines staff read this,  I suggest they travel economy on an A350 and see for themselves.  Of course, when they travel, they fly premium or business so would have no idea.

I will never in future travel on a flight using A350
label: negative

text: Need to improve business class One of the best airlines but i dont understand why singapore to india segment they have old planes ... the business class is soooo very old .. horrible seat and not at all good toilet .. it does not loook like business class .. all other segments have great business but why singapore to india route is neglected ... .... great food though .. all the onboard staff is really good and very helping
label: neutral

text: Disappointing  After leaving our cruise ship in Tokyo, we flew to Melbourne via Singapore on Singapore Airlines. I had flown with this airline many years ago and thought that it was good, so I was disappointed by our recent experience of it. The Premium Economy seats were tighter than I expected them to be and, on one flight, the seat in front of me showed signs of poor upkeep. The meals served ranged between poor and scarcely edible. The attentiveness of the pleasant staff was the only saving grace. It will be a long time before I think about flying Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text:
None Stop SF/Singapore MY First No ne stop in a while from SF to Singapore. 17 hours but none stop allowed for much better rest. Service was excellent especially from one Indian stewardess.
Very help full and frequent enquiries to help me with any services needed. 
I would recommend this flight
label: positive

text: Trip to New Zealand with Singapore Airlines I used to work with Singapore airlines as a flight stewardess before having a kid. What I always love about this airline is that it is kid friendly, we are always provided with kids amenities and meals and usually the crew will even help warm the milk or clean the bottles for the parents. We were also taken care of during meal times where we can take turns to eat while the other watch the kid. The recent flight was good, the service was good even though I had a much better flight to auckland at the start of our trip, the crew was such an amazing team. Its always a pleasure to fly with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Sq224 The plane was spacious and the staff are friendly and food was good and nice with clean environment
They provide me with wheelchair but left me stranded at travelettor
I manage to use m walking stick and walk to arrival hall
I would recommend to average travellors but please dont leave us stranded
label: positive

text: Great flight and airline It was such a pleasure travelling with this airline. The flight attendants were very friendly and the ground staff were amazing considering we required special assist as this was our first time flying abroad. They made our travel easy and care-free. Thank you.
label: positive

text:
Waiting more than six weeks for a refund I requested a refund on 18th June and I not heard heard from Singapore Airlines. I tried emailing, but my booking reference number is not valid so it can't be sent.  I tried calling too but I got a recorded message stating that it not the number to enquire about the refund. 

Singapore Airlines I used to love, but now I don't trust this airline. I should never have booked with the airline. I have booked other airlines and got the refund quicker.
label: negative

text:
Utterly disgusted, discriminatory and prejudice Had a horrible nightmare experience traveling from Vancouver to Singapore with Air Canada (AC) and Singapore Airlines (SQ), supposedly Star “Alliance” partners. The first leg of my flight is YVR airport- HKG airport by AC and the 2nd leg of the flight is HKG-SIN by SQ. After queuing for 1.5 hours at Vancouver airport, I was informed by AC staff that I am not allowed to fly as they are unable to print out the flight tickets for SQ and Hong Kong’s airport transit criteria is to have both printed boarding passes. They brushed me off at the counter and told me bluntly to go purchase a new ticket that does not involve SQ or go fly with another airline. I repurchased the same route on AC for YVR-HKG right at the airport but with a 20 hours layover in Hong Kong flying my second leg with Cathay Pacific. For some bizarre reason, Star “Alliance” partners do not have the rights to issue tickets for their alliances but AC can issue a ticket for Cathay. 

To avoid a 20h layover, I contacted SQ and was advised to get another ticket for my second leg, the flight I was supposed to be on. To my horror in Hong Kong, not only did SQ not allow me to board with the new ticket that I repurchased under their advice, I was also made aware that there is a White male business class passenger flying the same original route that I was refused boarding with AC7 and SQ883. Would AC and SQ care to explain what’s with the prejudice? Is it due to racism or a flight class discrimination? Maybe sexism? 

As I thought my nightmare will be over, I looked at my baggage tag sticker and it reads AC7 and SQ883 not Cathay. After spending over 3 hours with the AC staff, he is still unable to locate it in Hong Kong and we had to file a missing baggage report. I left Hong Kong finally after 20 hours without knowing the location of my bag and if it went on the same Cathay flight as me. 

After the torturous 38 hours journey, I was informed in Singapore that my bag is still in Vancouver and they have no confirmation when it will be arriving. Just when I thought it couldn’t get worse, they told me that there is no AC staff in Singapore and no one will deliver my bag to me while I am serving my quarantine, I had to send someone to the airport to pick it up for me. No word of concern if I have everything I need with me, no apologies nothing just AC faulting me again for their mistakes. 

My advice, if you are not a white male flying business/first class, do NOT travel with Air Canada and Singapore Airlines. 

Utterly disgusted.
label: negative

text:
Only one criticism of our flight with Singapore Airlines on A380 The only criticism we have on both flights between Heathrow and Sydney is the poor quality headphones.  The sort you have to squash into your ears.
Emirates have decent proper headphones.
We don't want to have to carry our own headphones with us
Please consider changing them.  
Other than that, the service is wonderful, the food quite adequate and good quality
label: positive

text:
Best in the world!  Despite having a basic economy ticket, I was able to get a exit row seat on all the flights (free of charge). SQ has one of the most well organised boarding process in the industry. The zone wise boarding is strictly followed. 

Nothing to complain about the onboard service. Through they are a little more expensive than some carriers, the extra money is will worth.
label: positive

text: Really been let down Usually I love flying through Singapore and can’t fault their service however on my flight to London I got food poisoning from the eggs not being heated up correctly as they were served barely lukewarm (never had food poisoning before don’t judge me for my poor choice) and I contacted Singapore to let them know and heard nothing back at all, not even a simple apology. After spending 6 hours in hospital on an IV drip because I was unable to stop vomiting longer than 3 minutes I would think the least they would do is apologise? It’s really put me off flying with them next time I come to the UK
label: negative

text: Generally excellent - but look out for small print I had booked Singapore Airlines from Sydney London return. ON 3 of my l;egs I got SQ with an A380 and everything was great. ON the way from Singapore to Sydney I got Scoot. BEWARE - never accept a Scoot operated flight when you have paid for SQ. You get no inflight entertainment. the food is inedible, and you even have to pay for an extra cup of tea. Leg room is terrible, they did not even give you a pillow and the head rest was not adjustable. All I could do on this packed flight was hope it landed OK and warn others about the situation, especially as I heard of a friend paying Premium Economy and getting Scoot. Seriously puts you off Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text:
Uncomfortable seat and horrible food The business class seats are so uncomfortable and would not be suitable for someone of a larger size.

I ordered the Japanese set and it is so horrible tasting.  Rice and fish which is supposed to be served hot is lukewarm.  The portion is also so small.  I think this is the result of cost cutting.

SQ instead of improving with the rest of the competitors have lagged behind them now.
label: negative

text: Comfortable and on time Always satisfied with this airline.  Service is good, meals are good and planes are comfortable.  My only issue on this flight was that the entertainment screen was old fashioned (not touch screen) and the movie selection was not great, but since my screen did not work, neither mattered.
label: positive

text: Enjoyable Night Flight We flew the night flight at 22.05 to Singapore then onto Adelaide....which I would really recommend if you all want to pass a few hours by sleeping...after about an hour we were served a meal..my husband had a veggie meal and I was surprised he ate it as he is so very fussy. The lights dimmed and we all settled down..me hubby and 14 year old...I bet we slept 5 hours. I wore a simple black eye mask and I really think I made a difference...we had cushions and blankets and were quite alright to say it was a economy. On waking we all just started watching the movies again and this passes time. The crew are friendly and are passing thru with water and juice. I did go up to the galley and they greeted mw lovely and offered me goodies...crisps,, chocolate bar , apple and more juice. we looked forward to breakfast as we knew we were nearly at Singapore....then we were all prepared for  our onward journey to Adelaide..which at just 7 hours flew by..again with Singapore Airlines. Would fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Exceptional Service I have sent an email to Singapore Airlines complimenting them on their level of service. After flying many airlines (including, in recent times, Emirates and Qantas), I found that the crew on this flight were exceptional in their service. They apologised to me for delay with the meals...even though this was due to them giving exceptional service to those who had special dietary requirements. Many thanks to the flight crew  on SQ232 on 25 August from Sydney. I enjoyed the in flight entertainment, and did suggest to SA that they might consider perhaps some additional language lessons in addition to the Spanish lesson provided as part of the in flight entertainment (perhaps Mandarin, Cantonese, and even Malay - wonderful to know to give some respect to the wonderful people of Singapore and Malaysia). Ten points to you all.
label: positive

text: Great experience everytime Our annual trip to Japan will always be with Singapore Airlines. The service is perfect, the food were delicious, there's really nothing to complain about. The cabin crew is very attentive, the flights are on time, Captain communicates with us about the flight. The cabin crew will also constantly help us with anything that we may need. Wide choices of inflight entertainment to suit everyone's tastes too.
label: positive

text:
Best Airline Singapore Airlines is always the best among others. 

Great service from checked in to disembarked. No fault.
label: positive

text:
Enjoy the flight The flight was on time. The checking in was smooth and seamless. At the gates the hand luggage was done swiftly.
The boarding was done systematically, so that the won't be crowding at the aisle.
The SIA team was welcoming and had great smiles.
Service was efficient and fast.
label: positive

text: West Jet direct flight available from Calgary to San Diego. it only takes 3 hours and 11 minutes or so. They charged for check in luggage. $30 each bag USD & CAD each way. they provide a drink and snacks. other foods have charges. good flights, but both are delayed.
label: neutral

text:
Singapore Airlines is on Top of their game when it comes to customer service & comport Everytime i Fly with Singapore Airlines i get wowed with their service ,
seats for comfortable , Entertainment is on point , well experienced staff , great food selection , Ecomomy class is so good no need to Fly business class.
label: positive

text:
Their tenacity at absolute safety was good to see and experience. Singapore Airlines continues to be one of the best airlines.
In fact the return part of our journey was from Amsterdam, Singapore for a stopover, then onto Brisbane.
The flight over was by far the best experience, the food was great, and so was the service.
Sadly on the return journey, there were just a couple of minor hiccups with their serving of food, ie not getting a cup of coffee until there second time around of asking, and then getting totally forgotten for a meal, which was quickly rectified after I pressed the call button.  
Overall, I love flying with Singapore Airlines. Due to no fault of their own, leaving Amsterdam late, but we arrived earlier than scheduled in Singapore, and they do ensure that you are always made to feel welcome.
label: positive

text:
Good but not the level I expected given this airlines ratings WLG-SIN via MEL.  Its one of their older 772’s in the previous regional configuration.  Suffice to say a bit tired and the seating, while perfectly adequate, falls well short of their current business class standard.  That said the convenience of departing from Wellington makes up for it.  Service and food very good but the entertainment options were, in my view, somewhat limited.
SIN-CDG.  A380.  Surprised at the seats which I found uncomfortable when in a sitting configuration.  OK however as they were good as a bed and this was a night flight.
Again service and food very good though entertainment once again limited - I did not even bother as literally nothing appealed.  No movies worth the effort and only two documentaries.     
Check in very efficient and both aircraft kept clean.
label: positive

text:
Delightful inflight experience from SQ Given the on-going outbreak of Corona Virus, I salute those crews who still showed up to work on a flight some crews may consider "sensitive" for various legitimate reasons.

Those cabin crews in this particular flight worked very well, supporting each others' tasks, with impeccable attention to details throughout the flight.

A special shout out to one of the Cabin Crew, Yan Ting LAM, for the most courteous service, delivered with genuine care and concern for her passengers. It's staff like Ms LAM and others like her that truly set SQ apart from others.
label: positive

text: Absolute bliss on such a long flight We travelled to Singapore then Los Angeles on our way to Canada and return journeys with this amazing airline! Despite such long flying time we were made extremely comfortable with exemplary service along with courteousness, wonderful smiles and genuine care! Much pleasure in recommending Singapore Airlines thank you to all.....
label: positive

text:
One of ther Best ! We recently flew return, with stopovers in Singapore, both ways Sydney to London and return. Excellent service -
 strangely on some flights far too much food - on the return they quickly ran out of two of the good meals :-( 
One problem is the foot rests  - they are on the side of the back of the seat in front, meaning one cannot sit straight but has to organsie himself to use the foot rest, rather than recline the seat for the seat foot rest to come up - Bad design.
We left late May and returned home early July
label: positive

text:
Singapore airlines poor communication being trying to get a refund/credit for an unused  flight for over a year! I can see from the reviews that Singapore airlines is not what it used to be in terms of customer service and communication they are atrocious!
been trying to get a refund for over a year since March 2022.
1st of all they changed my flight so I said i can not use that flight tried several times on the website to comminicate about it and it was so difficult and response times up to 15 days! finally I had to go to Jakarta to a Singapore airlines office to speak to someone. They acknowledged and accepted my claim but said I can just call to make a new flight resevation at a later date. During that time trying to speak to someone over the phone was impossible. Huge wait times I mean over an hour. I gave up. This year I requested a refund and I received an email saying I would get the refund within 6 weeks? this is after a year had gone by. Still waiting for the refund 6 weeks late no confirmation it had been refunded. I wrote again notifying the airline my email address had changed which I did through the Singapore airlines FF portal on the website. you have to go through a security text message to verify its you to do this. Then I get another email saying they need to verify who I am  and I need to send all the information again. OMG sooo Frustrating! Still waiting! I am wrting this review because of my frustration. I will not use this airline agian and want to warn others about my experience. This was business class flight & I am a Gold star alliance member. This is totally unacceptable as an airline and if there is a consumer complaints portal in Singapore I would love to know who to submit my complaint to about Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text: Consistently great service Flight from Singapore to Manila was pretty fuss free, except for the change of gates 30mins before boarding time. Service on the flight was consistently good, stewardesses were very personal, thoughtful and professional, and the food was delicious as usual.
label: positive

text:
Very very average We had high expectations having used Singapore before.  However, the only good thing in this flight was the staff and service.  The food was awful.  Bearing in mind I am not fussy, I just can’t say anything nice.  
We thought we were flying in the A380 but no luck.  It was a A 350 or similar and the seat pitch was pathetic !  My husband was so crammed in he couldn’t move.  Luckily I asked around and found a spare seat elsewhere so we were marginally more comfortable.  The seating was definitely very uncomfortable.
label: neutral

text:
Great service but uncomfortable seating The service and professionalism of the staff was excellent. Good choice of meals that were well presented and tasty. 
The one problem for me was the seating. Despite possibly being the largest seat I have experienced across different airlines in Business Class it was easily the most uncomfortable. The only way to sit with my feet up or lay down was to have my feet raised at a 45 degrees angle to the side (rather than straight in front) to fit down a ‘hole’ in the side of the seat in front. This meant that there was very little room to move my legs and required sitting/sleeping at an angle in the chair with my back across the corner - all very uncomfortable, especially in a long flight and overnight on the return journey. 
So, sadly, despite the rest of the experience being excellent (especially the staff) I would not fly on a Singapore Airlines flight with this seating configuration again.
label: neutral

text:
Very nice experience Great service, always smiling, quick to response, new A350 and so on.
There is nothing bad to say about our trip,
label: positive

text: Singapore Air: Not Overrated! Just completed the 18 hour+ flight from Newark International Airport to Singapore. I have travelled from the States to Singapore many times, but have previously flown via United from Newark to San Francisco, and then SFO to Singapore. I decided to try the nonstop flight just to have the experience. Overall, it was as good as an 18- hour flight can be. Sitting in business class with the flat-bed seats was certainly worth the cost. The food was delicious and the movie selection was outstanding. I watched five movies (all recent releases), and as a result was throughly entertained for the first 9-10 hours of the flight. When I finally decided to go horizontal, the flight attendant helped to convert the seat into a bed and I was reasonably comfortable; my only complaint is that the flat bed configuration requires that you sleep on an angle, and there isn't a lot of room to maneuver on the bed. When you want to switch positions, you feel like you are on a rotisserie. However, the plus factors greatly outweigh the inconvenience of not being able to truly sleep comfortably when you are a very tall person. I also like the fact that the flight arrives into Singapore about 5:00pm, and during the summer--this is a plus (at least for me), since it is still daylight in Singapore and I felt that I had a few hours to be active before I crashed.  I don't think I will ever say that I am looking forward to a 18-hour nonstop flight, but if you have to fly from the US east coast to Singapore, it is the best way to go.
label: positive

text:
First time on new business class Singapore Airlines excellent overall business product as usual. Check in a breeze at Perth. Small lounge, well stocked, but only one toilet (!).
5 hour flight to Singapore on new 787-10. New business seats several inches narrower and two inches shorter. Now simply a good version of Thai/Eva etc. rather than anything exceptional. Service impeccable as always. IFE state of the art.
Lounge in T2 Changi huge and busy, but able to have shower without a queue.
Flight from SIN to BKK was 'old business' class, which has a much better seat (go figure!).
label: positive

text:
Premium economy not worth the extra cost We have flown with Singapore in economy class a few times and decided to give the premium economy a try. After watching a documentary on the airline and their supposed attention to detail we went ahead and booked. What a disappointment and waste of money. The short leg to Singapore was fine but the onward leg to the UK and return was absolutely terrible. Broken seat, very little service,entertainment system not working,ran out of refreshments or then just didn’t offer anything,no room to get in an out of seats if the row in front were reclining. When we spoke to the staff they said there was nothing they could do.
Not sure we will fly with them again.
label: negative

text: Awesome Airline Super experience, on an Airbus A 380 on the Mumbai - Singapore sector. Even Silk Air was a good experience.
label: positive

text: Consistent Quality Service I have flown Silk air for short bound trips around SEA for many years. They have consistent good quality services when compared to many other airlines. Due to the short flight duration and the need to serve the meals, the flight crew are always on high tempo. Despite that, they carried out their roles professionally.
label: positive

text:
Budget Air When did Singapore become no frills? I Al not a fan of writing bad reviews but….

I’ve always rated Singapore Air number one. No longer. Definitely now a budget airline and  with a premium tariff. 

Service is still lovely but don’t bother forking out for business. It’s the new economy. Very BYO. PJs, travel kit all those extras that you to forward to when you go premium are gone. Definitely don’t get what you pay for. Disappointing.
label: negative

text: What a great flight Ok 8 hours. Wear comfortable clothes and long pants as it got cold on the plane. Wide variety of entertainment. Economy had two great meals
label: positive

text:
Short & Sweet & the same great service Short flight but as always service is beyond reproach. 5 start airline, well deserved.

I'm on a plane on average 60+ flights per year. Over the years I have travelled on their Economy, Business Class, First Class and Suites, (not yet on premium economy) and while the first and suites class service can sometimes be too much of a good thing, service has always been excellent, with never any incidents to complain about.
label: positive

text:
All good, except the food  Thursday 19th September and our adventure in Lombok and Bali was  coming to an end and the first leg of the long journey back to the UK was due to begin on board Singapore Airlines flight SQ949, from Bali to Changi Airport, Singapore.

Our flight was due to depart at 21.45 arriving in Changi at 00.20, a scheduled flying time of 2 hours 35 minutes.

We were airborne by 21.55. We were informed that the actual time would be 2 hours and 20 minutes flyingtime. We actually landed at  00.10, which was good news as our connecting flight to London was departing at 01.10. 

About 45 minutes into the flight food and drinks were served, the food option was fish and potatoes or chichen and rice. 

We opted for the chicken, it looked uappetising in fact it was disappointingly awful and was not eaten.

The legroom was very good and the seats were comfortable and the Cabin Crew were attentive and charming.

Both previous flights, outbound, with this Airline, were rated as excellent, sadly the food affected this rating.
label: positive

text: Excellent fight company Me and my partner used Singapore airlines for a 12.5 hour flight. I was dreading flying that long! The economy seats were standard but definitely nicer than some economy flights I had been on like Emirates. The staff looked great in traditional long Singaporean dress it looked very smart and professional. The service was excellent from all crew who were very attentive and friendly throughout. I had ordered ahead online as gluten free and the staff checked/confirmed this at the start of the flight and then served all allergens first, all labelled and coded to the allergen. I got a really gold meal, a tomato and vege chicken dish, salads, veg, GF breads. I was really impressed, for ‘plane food’ it wasn’t half bad - again certainly better than other companies. The flight had great television systems and options for film, flight tracking, games etc. I would be more than happy to choose this company again for a long haul flight.
label: positive

text:
Excellent service I would like to give a feedback of my SQ983 flight, 25 May 19, Business Class, BKK-SIN. 

I flew with my dad and mom. Thought it was a short haul flight, I really enjoyed the facility provided in the lounge and aircraft. I would like to especially thanks the Business Class crews, 

IFS DOREEN AW
IFS SEAN
LSS MAIRA
FS ZACK PEEH
FSS LAI

The service they provided was excellent. They really care about the comfort of passengers. Although my mom and my dad cannot speak English, the crews try their best to make this flight as smooth as possible. 

I really really appreciate the service.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable & Spacious Flight That Kept Us Occupied The business class seats on the Wellington-Melbourne-Singapore Route are not the newest but nonetheless, they were relatively good enough for a long-haul flight.

The meals served were outstanding and we enjoyed the personalised meal service. The seats were ultra spacious and had more than sufficient leg room.

In flight entertainment wasn’t the best and the latest but well, still acceptable. The headsets blocked out most of the cabin noise and that was awesome because we could have a comfortable and “quiet” flight throughout.
label: positive

text:
Cancelled leg but no followup Bought a business class ticket from Copenhagen to Darwin with a short 2 hours transit in Singapore. Singapore Airlines changed it to a FOUR DAYS stop over in Singapore.
Of course this is unacceptable. But you can't get a hold of anyone at customer service. I have called multiple times (waited up to 2 hours on the phone). They don't respond to your emails.  
You can't change the flights online, you can't cancel. Basically only option is to accept the change. And then what? Sleep in Singapore airport for four days straight? Flying out beginning of April. I still hope someone will have contacted me by then but I am starting to loose hope.
label: negative

text: Comfortable flight I travelled home from Vietnam a couple of days ago via Changi. Great service, comfortable seat/bed, the meal I had was very good & we were lucky to have very little turbulence. The Airport transactions were also done efficiently . I  Would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: This was my first time flying Singapore Airlines and it won't be my last. The staff at the check in were extremely friendly and helpful followed by the air crew being some of the friendliest faces I have seen in the air for many years and many dozens of flights. as always the economy seats are a little tight but the service, food and in flight entertainment were all top class.
label: positive

text: Holiday flights  Good service well look after and and excellent food we use them those time for our long flight to bali and they live up to being number one airline in ever way looking forward to our return home with them
label: positive

text: SIA differing customer care SIA has Customer Service Plan that states its commitment to providing airline passenger protection covering assurance of providing lowest fare through that booking channel, prompt refunds and a 24hr free cancellation, etc. All these should be basic and standard BUT THEY ONLY APPLY TO FLIGHTS IN AND OUT OF US! What about a similar customer service plan for flights in and out of Singapore to ensure that its Singapore passengers are treated just as fairly? Other airlines have the same 24hr cancellation policy for all flights not just only those in and out of US which is transparent and fair!
label: negative

text:
Using miles for flights I wanted to express my frustration regarding the difficulties I've encountered while attempting to redeem miles for flight tickets with Singapore Airlines .

I've consistently faced challenges with the redemption process, often finding myself placed on waitlists for flights. Furthermore, on multiple occasions, approximately two weeks before the scheduled flight, I've received notifications of cancellations, despite my repeated attempts to secure bookings. This uncertainty and last-minute cancellations have greatly inconvenienced me.

Compounding the issue, despite my efforts to utilize my miles within the required timeframe, I've faced expiration of my miles due to these ongoing challenges. As a loyal customer, this experience has left me deeply disappointed and discouraged from further engagement with Singapore Airline.

I urge you to review and address the issues within your miles redemption system to ensure a smoother and more reliable experience for your customers. Your attention to these matters would greatly enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.
label: negative

text:
You pay $10,000 for a flight on ANY other airline and … You are on board 45 minutes before takeoff, you are settling in either to do work or to go to sleep because you have precious little time, and you are not besieged with a fully mask policy.  Not here.   

And you are suffocating with masks in a stuffy hot waiting area (and on board). These non-N95 masks do little to prevent anything (half the meetings I just had in Singapore had locals who were suffering from COVID, but I it had been a while since someone in my US world was sidelined).  Further, do the epidemiological work of looking at how hyper clean airplane environments provide cleaner air than anything, except perhaps for 100% wearers of N95 masks—and even that is not clear (and, BTW, look around at all the people who are constantly pretending to eat and drink to avoid wearing a mask—who then really believes that masks are doing anything). 

This is probably a good—maybe great—airline for coach. But for people who pay premium, LET ME OUT of the COVID theater that somehow forgot about the people who pay a little bit extra. 

And BTW, I am a liberal Democrat who happens to be a fact-based scientist who realizes we need to find a balance between living and an hyper-controlled environment that has kept me from even getting a common cold in the last 3 years.
label: negative

text: Istanbul to Singapore: SQ391 Cashed in some SQ points to travel in business class back to Singapore from Istanbul. Operated by a B777-200ER but still quite comfortable. Food and service were both very good. Perhaps I enjoyed it all the more as this year I've been taking a lot of flights operated by Budget airlines. Arrived 15 mins early. Only negative was the lounge at Ataturk airport which resembled a zoo - far too many people crowded into the Turkish Airlines lounge. One can only hope that things improve once services are moved to the new airport. Otherwise no complaints.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines I flew from Sydney to Rome return with Singapore Airlines
I have to say they are one of the most professional airlines I have had the pleasure of flying with! The Airline  stewards are always there to help and are always gracious and go about there job in a professional manner. 
The flight is long with a three hour stopover in Singapore and there is lots to see st the Airport and you can stretch your legs as there is a lot of walking as it’s so big!
Unfortunately on my return there was a baby which cried for most of the journey and this is an issue with any airline but they gave out earplugs to relieve the noise ! 
Food and entertainment was great ! Leg room was sufficient for a small to medium built but I could see men with longer legs it was a l bit uncomfortable. 
But service wise they were amazing!
label: positive

text: Great service that was beyond expectations ! The level of service provided by the crew onboard was unexpectedly awesome ! They were very prompt to attending to the needs of passengers and were all SMILES ! It has made my flight a pleasant and memorable one. I will definitely fly with SIA again.
label: positive

text:
Pre Covid ..The Best  //  Post Covid .. An Expensive Mistake Pre Covid.  The A380 Suites are superb. The crew are attentive but discreet. As  regular 1st Class travelers, my wife and I would not dream of flying with anyone else.  The 777 flight Auckland to Changi is OK, the private room is a bonus while we wait for our next flight to Paris CDG on SQ's A380.  The suites and service 'WERE' incomparable. 
Mid Covid (June 2020). The A350 used on the Changi - CDG leg was frankly a disgrace.  It was old, tatty and dirty.  The crew were at their usual best.  The seat was uncomfortable and in need of new upholstery. This aircraft was a salute lesson on how to disappoint a customer.  However, we blame Covid.
Post Covid (June 2021 and 22).  Same awful aircraft, nothing has changed. Crew are still superb though. The purser on board whispers to me that lots of passengers are complaining.
Post Covid (June 2023)  We have booked on Emirates A380.  NZD18K each. These fares are insane. At least we're not an old clunker that needs to be retired.
label: negative

text: OK Our trip was was above average 4.5  /  5.  the staff were friendly and the food was really nice.  our trip back from Japan to NZ was 2.5 / 5.  The staff we not as friendly.  the meal from japan to singapore was terrible and we could not eat it.  we know a japanese couple that flew back weeks after us and said the same.  from singapore to nz the staff were not as friendly as well.  breakfast was a disaster and may in front of us as ourselves were left with a choice of fish for breakfast which we declined.  if flying singapore airlines I would recommend taking your own food aboard.
label: neutral

text:
Fantastic airline Fantastic service, great food and very comfortable seats.
Enjoying the trip. Nothing was to much for the crew to make your journey pleasant!!
label: positive

text:
Amazing Premium Economy--SQ is amazing I flew round trip from NYC JFK to DEL via SIN and tried their premium economy product.  It is an exceptional well thought thru.  The seats are on the A380 in the 2-4-2 layout on the main deck and are wider than economy. 

Check in:- The SQ check in was smooth and quick---being Star Alliance Gold and Premium Economy allowed a Business Class check in and they gave the lounge pass right away both in JFK in the outbound and DEL in the inbound.  The JFK lounge is the Swiss lounge and it was small and crowded with minimal food offerings but the coconut chicken curry and swiss chocolates were good.  Frankfurt had the Lufthansa Senator Lounge and Air Canada Maple leaf lounge which accept Singapore and both were good.  The Changi lounge is a disappointment was SQ does not let Star alliance Gold members use the Silver Kris lounge but a much stepped down Star Alliance lounge.  The Delhi lounge is amazing ( see photos attached) in space and gastronomy.

The boarding of the plane was orderly in all 6 sectors.  They right away offered a drink and hot towel.  Champagne offered was good oubound and disappointing on the way back.  The seat is very comfortable and spacious.  It is the old First Class seat on US domestic flights and it reclines quite a bit while also having a thigh support and leg rest along with reading light.  The only downside is Premium Economy passengers have to use the Economy toilets.  The drinks, nuts were offered right after take off.  I had the flight attendand make me the "Singapore Sling"- an iconic gin cocktail invented in Singapore's Raffle Hotel--SQ offers it as a special national symbol.

The meal selection was excellent--I had used the "Book the Cook" option which is different from the menu--the "Nasi Lemak Singaporean Meal;" , "Dimsums" and "Shrimp with Ginger Sauce and Rice" options were finger licking good.  Desserts were ice cream or chocolate cake in different sectors.

I was well rested after long flights including my stop over in Singapore.
label: positive

text:
Amazing experience  Traveling as it should be!

After some difficult financial years, I started flying with “normal” airlines again..........
Many flights we AirAsia, Lion Air, Jetstar.
My first flight with Singapore Airlines, after 4 years felt like a warm bath.
To be treated like a guest, from the moment you book until you leave the plane at your destination.
We should all should have the possibility to experience this.
Traveling must be comfortable, welcoming and  give you the feeling of respect. 
Singapore airlines always offer you this experience.
On this moment I’m waiting for my flight from Surabaya to Singapore and I’m looking forward to “board”. 
What a huge difference with all Budget airlines, where flying becomes a way to move from point A to point B. Not a experience you look forward too.
And the price? If you book a 2 way ticket and you want to bring some luggage the prices are very competitive.
We all want to fly safe and feel welcome.
Wish you all safe travels and thanks to Singapore airlines for having me as a guest.

Regards,

Jac de Gooijer
label: positive

text:
Excellent We took off in the late morning and had a very pleasant flight. A delicious lunch arriving at Changi in time for dinner.
The cabin crew were very pleasant and helpful and I caught up with a whole series of my favourite tv series. 
I last flew with Singapore Airlines in 1990, they were excellent then and still are!
label: positive

text:
What Happened? I had always trusted and recommended SQ's quality of service until I boarded this flight. The crew did not seem to be fully focused. Our row (last row) was skipped a few times during service. Even when we requested for our food, the cabin crew mixed up our order with other row's passengers. From our seats, we can hear 'ruckus' happening in their service preparation area. There was only one lady who seemed to solo-fight her way saving their flow of service.

What happened SQ?
label: neutral

text: World's best airport/-line...  While I would usually pride myself on absolute neutrality and write reviews that run the gamut, I have to warn and admit that I live in Singapore and might be slightly biased by our fantastic airport and many fond memories of taking the early-morning Frankfurt-New York flight years ago on many occasions. That being said, and notwithstanding a slight drop in food quality, Singapore Airlines delivers. Friendly service, best entertainment system, modern planes such as the Airbus 350 on some long-distance flights and reliable and fast for the quick Singapore-Saigon hop I often frequent. They also don't cheat on the customer service - having experienced one 5-hour delay in my many years of flying SIA, I was compensated fairly and swiftly. I am always looking forward to a SIA flight and can't wait to try the new 350 Singapore-NYC route, hopefully very soon...
label: positive

text:
Worst flight experience ever Got from dempasar (Bali) to singapure (2h30 flight) in a brand new plane, very nice experience, but for a 11h flight from singapure to Istanbul we got a old plane, not confortable at all- our flight on the 28th of June was terrible, got late to singapure, and when we were boarding my seats which were payed in advance 30dolars got swith to a very poor location because the intertaiment screen was not working. The boarding staff was not nice at all and not helpful at all, and we stayed in a much worse seat and with no apologies. 
The seats were dirty with food from the previous flight glued to the screen and food table disgusting!!! 
Don’t know how you could me elected best company last year! For a 11h flight such a poor experience! 
And the flight attendant on our row was not friendly at all, forgot to give our row towels to clean hands and in one occasion beverage...and when questioned was rude...
Worst experience on a flight ever...
label: negative

text:
seats close together & terrible food On all  flights London to Singapore + Singapore - Bali, then return, the seats are so close together that it is impossible to watch the TV screen as it is too close to your eyes. There is littel leg room too.

The food is the worst I have had for a long time. Singapore Airlines used to be the best but now it it is as if they do not need to bother trying to be good because as long as their prices is the same as others why should they waste money provinding a better service. I will use Emirates next time - but they are not really much better!
label: negative

text: Above and beyond! Singapore airlines went above and beyond to help us at a very difficult time. 2 weeks into a 5 week holiday my brother suddenly died. At the time we were in the UK and were supposed to travel to Europe in 2 days time for the European leg of our holiday and were supposed to fly home from Berlin. We phoned SA in London to explain the situation and asked what our options were. SA asked what we wanted to do and we explained that we wanted to get home to Australia as soon as possible. They then proceeded to find the first available flights for the next day so that we could get home and swapped our original return flights from Berlin to return flights from Manchester. When I asked about the price difference they said that they would waive the fee. Months ago when we booked our original flights I booked gluten free meals for my husband as he is a Celiac and were told that he would not be able to get gluten free meals due to the short notice which we understood and were totally fine with so we packed some food for him so that he could eat on board. However when we boarded the flight and spoke to the flight attendant regarding our situation he gave my husband first choice of suitable meals and even phoned Singapore to ensure that gluten free meals were on board for my husband for the second leg of the journey home. I cannot thank Singapore Airlines enough for making such a difficult time for us so much easier, we are very grateful. We have flown with Singapore Airlines a few times now and have always had a good experience with them. We will definitely continue to fly with them in the future.
label: positive

text:
Punctual, Pleasant and Smooth Flight with Good Service from Entire Crew Smooth check-in all the way to boarding.  In-flight service was great.  Crew was attentive and had good memory.  She remembered what I had asked for on my way to my seat and delivered it to me as soon as she was free. Thank you so much!  Food was healthy and very good too, not too oily and not too dry from over-heating.  Many thanks to the entire crew for bringing me home safely.  It was, indeed, a very pleasant flight.

My sincere thanks and appreciation to all of you on MI 802 for helping to fly the Singapore Flag really sky high!  Keep up the good work!  We, Singaporeans, are very proud of you!
label: positive

text: Back to the airline we can trust We loved our flight to Osaka a couple of years ago, but last year we decided to use another airline so we could fly direct from Bangkok to Tokyo. I was not very impressed with this airline, especially the food, so this year's trip we went back to the airline we can trust & were not disappointed. The service is impressive & the hot towels before take off & landing are a great touch. The 30kg baggage allowance is another reason we use Singapore airlines. See you next year!
label: positive

text: Good airline Good airline, good service, great airport in Singapore and well maintained aircraft. The food was average and cabin temperature far too cold.
label: positive

text:
SQ983  30OCT  Bangkok Singapore We flew SQ983 which was on B787-10, the new regional business class for SQ. Honestly, we both (my husband and I) were not a fan of this type of cocoon seating. We sat at middle bulkhead, felt really cramp and tight, very different feeling from B777-300ER. Also, it is very difficult for us to talk to each other because of the high barrier between our seats.

For an hour flight, the service from cabin crew was exceptional
label: positive

text: Cancelled Booking without my Auth i had a reservation with Singapore Airline. i request them to change the destination from Melbourne to Toronto. one of their  agent told me they dont have any availability so i asked her refund if i will cancel the reservation what will be the penalty of airline and how much money i am getting in my account. she told me to pay 25000 INR so i asked her if i will pay penalty of airline how much money i am getting in my account she told me for that  you will receive a callback. i had never received any call and without my permission they cancelled my reservation and deducted penalty from my refund amount but i never authorized for cancellation. Now i am calling again and again they are not helping me out to resolve this issue.
label: negative

text: It is really world class It is actually the best airlines in the world and really world-class, the air hostess is genuinely very good and very helpful
label: positive

text:
Great service I enjoy flying with Singapore Airlines and find the service excellent. Very friendly staff. 
However, when on a special diet, the food leaves much to be desired. I am on a gluten free diet, but found the food tasteless and very boring . Gluten free does not mean it has to have no taste. And the bread was inedible.
It’s possible to make gluten free food tasty.
label: positive

text: Quality Airline Plane clean; service by flight attendants good; quality of airline food better than average; good variety of in-flight entertainment; departure and arrival on time.  No complaints
label: positive

text: World's longest non-stop commercial flight Finally I was onboard the world's longest non-stop commercial flight from Newark to Singapore! It was a very pleasant flight though I was on the sky for 19 hours. Service was really great, fast with dedicated and thoughtful crew. Meals were absolutely tasty while legroom was good enough to stretch my long legs. In-flight entertainment was updated! Absolutely and 5-star-plus flight.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service as usual This was our first time flying Singapore Airlines during the day,  they have always been over night.  The experience was just a good as any other time we've flown with them.  I took a group of orchid enthusiasts on an orchid tour of Singapore and the airline staff assisted our group well with enquiries, food, drink and more.  I'll always fly with Singapore Air, when I can
label: positive

text: Not sure what all the hype is about Whilst we were overall happy with the flight and service, we found the interior of the aircraft dated and tacky. The flight attendants were polite and friendly but the food was average. Our flights were not on time. I'm not sure why they are so highly rated. The best part was the $30 we could use in the Club lounge at the airport, which was a definite plus (free delicious food, tea, coffee and juice for three hours).
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines got us home We booked flights in August 2020 to travel to Australia in November. These flights were cancelled twice: the first time by a flight number change, and the second time by a process error. Thanks to Randi at Singapore Airlines Copenhagen; she ensured we were put back on our flights and worked hard to guarantee our seats. She then took my multiple calls calmly and empathetically when I was worried about changing arrival caps and our ability to travel. Without Randi in Copenhagen, we would never have made it home. Thank you Randi and Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Best sleep ever Had a night flight from Singapore to Heathrow managed to sleep for ten hours approximately out of 12.5 hours. Best sleep ever on a plane.
label: positive

text:
Best Airlines only for First Class? Singapore Airlines is trying very hard to be the best airlines in the world. 
Probably it only applies to First Class.

First of all, inflight meals of economy class were terrible.  And I’m trying to reclaim my miles of my flight from SFO to YVR. (I booked that flight on SQ official homepage), Air Canada is the Star Alliance and SQ partner.
The first stfaff (VK) replied me that “we will not be able to add miles for your Air Canada flight”.
He has no knowledge that Air Canada is SQ partner.
I  told him that Air Canada is SQ partner airline and shows him a screenshort of my my KrisFlyer account,  the claim missing miles page shows AC (Air Canada) is SQ airline partner and is able to choose to claim for missing miles.
Then the 2nd staff asked me to attach all the documents to reclaim my miles. 
I’m still dealing with them and so far they have all different staff to reply me. (Aleady dealed with four different staff already).

I think Singapore Airlines can do better than this. This is such a disappointment with the Airlines that chosen as the BEST in 2023. You really have to improve your inflight meal (economy class) and customer support’s quality.
label: neutral

text:
Highly recommended for long flights Recently flew Singapore airlines on a trip to USA from Japan. 

From Narita to LAX we flew the near on 10 hour trip in economy (which in itself is better than 99% of other airlines economy sections). On the return 10 hour trip from LAX to Narita we flew business class which was well worth the money having arrived fresh, completely relaxed and full of energy compared to the economy leg cramps and mental fatigue from being unable to sleep in the limited space. 

The cost for the flight (both outbound and inbound) was just short of ¥200,000 ($1,800) which may seem expensive but compared to other airlines is a lot cheaper. Highly recommended experience and will definitely do it again.
label: positive

text:
poor airline very poor flight with defective seats very poor food and staff who really didn't care.
two defective seats on the journey both seats would not recline and on an 11 hour flight a non working monitor as well .
complained to the airline and not even an acknowledgement from them let alone an apology.so no not no1 in my world and no will not long or short haul flights with them again.
label: negative

text: Flown nearly all European and Asian airlines and these are definitely the best for comfort and food. Flown nearly all European and Asian airlines and these are definitely the best for comfort and food.
label: positive

text:
What is all the fuss about. Disappointed with this flight. Thought Singapore Airlines was the gold standard. It was just ordinary. We took off on time which was great as it was a late night flight and arrived ahead of schedule. 

Premium economy was a small cabin (24 seats) but there was not much to suggest this class and the massive upcharge over economy. The seat recline was quite clever (A350) in that on full recline it slide so as not to encroach too much on the passenger space behind.  The noise cancelling headphones were effective and the entertainment screen was larger than in economy with a very good selection of films, music, TV etc. but there was not other amenity except a bottle of water. 

You could 'book a cook' which expanded the food selection considerably (mainly Asian cuisine though) but nearing midnight, who can face a meal? There were two full service meals. We only had the second one and it was acceptable.

The cabin crew did the bare minimum and hid away for much of flight. However, when called, they responded quickly and politely. The wearing of masks did not help their cause, it was difficult to understand them and it felt like a medical flight!

The lavatories deteriorated over the length of the flight and things like paper towels etc were poorly managed.

I always thought BA were poor but they aren't that bad having now flown Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text:
Nothing much to expect, just ok As usual, we expect certain standard from SIA. However, our flight including Korean stewardess and therefore they are not as good as our truly Singapore stewardess.
Also there are limitations on travelling on tour package as you are not on par as normal economy passenger.
We hope that this can be improved.....
label: neutral

text: A very comfortable trip The flight was in an A380 that seemed brand new. Premium Economy is very comfortable and the service by the flight crew was excellent. I could not fault it in any way. We were served lunch that was quite palatable accompanied by good quality wine and the entertainment package helped while away the 7 hours or so for the flight.
label: positive

text:
Fading Glory Singapore Airlines used to represent the epitome of air travel, or at least business class travel. And while it is still an elite airline, a recent flight from SFO to Bangalore (BLR) via Singapore bore out how the airline has slipped in recent years.

First, the good: the new A350 we flew nonstop from SFO to SIN (16:40)  is just, simply, a beautiful airplane. The flat-bed seats (more like beds that seats) and the impeccable service were also marvelous. 

What has slipped considerably is the quality of the food. As a frequent international business class traveler, the quality of food on other carriers such as United (yes, United) is better. (What keeps United business class mired in mediocrity is the unpredictability of its flight attendant service, which can range from inspired to downright rude. But -- for another review). Singapore's food has never been its strength, and it has slipped from there. Gloppy, tasteless noodle soup, rubbery chicken not worthy of what is served in coach, tough steak, and a selection of mediocre wines.

Yes, these are first-world problems, and to the average traveler this sounds like privileged whining. But at business class prices ($5K and up per person), lousy food on a 17 hour flight is enough to drive our business to other carriers who are (no pun intended) eating Singapore's (lousy) lunch…!
label: positive

text:
Great flight It was a great flight back home. Been on the road for 2 weeks and i was more than ready to go home. 
The crew on this flight was attentive and friendly. I was surprised they'd address me by name which is amazing considering that there are several hundred people on board. The Business class seat and service is impeccable. 
As much as possible, Singapore Airlines is my preferred airline. A great way to fly indeed!
Keep up the good work!
label: positive

text: Mix of feelings SQ operates different types of aircrafts. Perth to Singapore was A350, its newest fleet that absolutely a great one. Quite, spacious and modern. Comfortable flat seat with great entertainment - big screen HD display and noise reduction headset. The food and wine were brilliant. Singapore to Jakarta however operated older B777 version. Limited inclined seat and the seat next to me did not even operate properly. Something has jammed the motor, poor customer. The flight was rather short and inflight service was not as expected. The lounge in Changi was top notch, it helped for a couple hours of lay over. In conclusion, SQ is great when you ride newer or latest version aircraft and for longer leg.
label: positive

text:
Exceptional service  My wife and I plus 2 kids (5 and 3 year old) had the pleasure of flying to Singapore on flight SQ232 on 10/05/2019. 
We were lucky to have the new A380 fit out and absolutely loved it. 

Besides the fit-out of the business class cabin, the Service by the attendants was exceptional. After we boarded and sat down, my 5 year old son asks me ‘why is everybody so nice here’ (referring to the attendants). 
For a 5 year old to raise this question just shows how lovely and polite the attendants are. Even greeting me by my name every single time. 

The meals were great as well and there was a wide variety of onboard entertainment. 

Would definitely recommend the A380 with the middle seats if planning to travel with young kids. Best to stay away from the Boeing 777-300ER though if possible as the middle divider is too high and it’s difficult to access the next seat.
label: positive

text: Zoos needs improving As always with Singapore Airlines everything runs like a Swiss Watch. Aircraft is clean, staff pleasant and efficient, good choices on the entertainment system but the food is not up to standard. This flight has an early lunch, the main choices looked as though they had been prepared days in advance. I think they'd be better off offering salads or even rolls. Food for thought.
label: positive

text: Business meeting in Bangkok Took early morning flight to Bangkok for business meeting. Flight was smooth and on time. Inflight services was good and friendly. Landing was soft and gentle.
label: positive

text:
Bad service My recent flight with Singapore Airlines didn't have a happy ending. I didn't get my luggage at my final destination. I receive my suitcases three days later. I have to do some shopping because my stuff was in my checked bags.

Moreover, I receive an email 24 hours before departure that I can check-in online. And when I want to check-in, it wasn't possible to choose a regular seat without surcharge. I ended up going to the airport and check-in there. 

The flight was conducted by SN Brussels and transfer to Singapore Airlines in Milan Malpensa Airport, Italy. Another worst scenario I've experienced, while we're already waited on the specific gate in Milan airport, 20 minutes before the boarding time, they suddenly announced that the gate number has changed.

Furthermore, no headsets available onboard -  I usually take my own, but I haven't thought about it. I end up watching movies without sound. Singapore used to be one of the top airlines several years ago; somehow, they're not the same anymore. Very disappointing!
label: negative

text: good flight One of the best, Good service, old airplane but no complaints. Always like enjoy Singaporian/Asian smile and support.
label: positive

text:
Singapore to Bali, Indonesia We have 4 flights each way and all were great.  Economy Class was very comfortable.
The only problem was serious turbulence on one of our return flights, but the pilot did well and got us to our next destination safely.  That particular flight was one of the worst I've experienced as far as turbulence was concerned.... frightful.
label: positive

text: Shame about the new business class configuration I recently flew to Singapore from Zurich. I used to do this flight quite often in the A380. In this flight they have re configured the seats replacing the big manual seats for modern electric ones. Now here is a perfect example of changing something just for the sake of changing. The previous seats folded down into a spacious bed. Ok you had to do it manually but honestly nobody minded doing this and the crew was always very helpful to make the bed when needed. To my huge disappointment they have now put some standard seats. They are small and your feet don't fit. I am an average man, height 180, shoe size 44 EUR and weight 80 kgs. Neither big nor small. My feet fit but there is insufficient space to fit. What a shame SQ has made this change!
label: neutral

text: Smooth and awesome Travelled to Jakarta with the Airbus and had an amazing experience. We obviously are impressed with the service, the staff, punctuality, entertainment system and seats. Had a great flight! I would definitely fly with them again when I get chance
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airline Mumbai and SG trip is Excellent Overall the service provided by the Crew was great. Air Steward and Air Stewardess took pride in their work and show care and concern to the passengers onboard. One of the Air Stewardess has assisted an uncle with his cabin luggage. 
There is one passenger who keep asking for more stuffs (Drinks etc), the staffs are very patience and provided all requests. Even though I was kind of irritated seating on the aisle but disturb by fellow passenger.
label: positive

text:
Coffee Everything was fine during this flight on an Airbus A380 except the food and the Coffee served on board
Really terrible especially Coffee with no taste at all 

Not in line with the Rest of the prestation
label: neutral

text: Like Singapore Airlines Like Singapore Airlines a lot. Very good customer service, very kind and very quick response to passengers needs. The plane was very new and clean, however leg room was not great and the seat felt a little bit small. Food was okay but i noticed the meal sizes have gone smaller since i traveled with them back in 2016. The in flight entertainment system is good but internet is not free. Have used internet services free of charge with different airlines, however i would recommend Singapore Airlines to any one. They got my tick of approval
label: positive

text:
Very Good, but perhaps not as good as expected We had very high expectations about going business  on Singapore Airlines on a long distance flight. Having read reviews about service etc. Outbound we were on a 777-300 which had very good seats with good storage space for "things". Return was on a A380 that was nearly empty and 4.5 hours delayed due to problems with a generator on one of the engines. Seats were very wide with plenty of space (Old business class seats ?) but there was really lack of storage space for books, glasses etc.
Foot was very good as one should expect on a business class flight. Vine selection good. Return flight being a day-flight was kept with windows close during all flight. Not sure why. We arrived at Heathrow early evening so keeping it dark did not in my case help on my jet-lag.
label: positive

text:
Top notch I flew Singapore AL on an Asian round trip through Bangkok and Singapore, and the quality of service on board was simply excellent.  Unfortunately I have to fly regularly with the consistently poor British Airways on one of their monopoly routes, so the contrast was even greater. 

On the long haul flights to and from Singapore, I was fortunate to fly on aircraft with their 'old' business class seating, which is quite a bit more spacious than their new style, which I experienced on one of their 787s between Bangkok and Singapore.

But the real difference is the attentiveness and personal quality of their service.  Nothing is too much trouble, and they really bend over backwards to make the flight as comfortable and pleasant as possible.  British Airways should send all their Customer Managers on a crash course with either SIA or Thai to see how it should be done.
label: positive

text: Best Service in the Sky. Had a most wonderful flight with exceptional service from the cabin crew led by Colin Stuart.He also confirmed for me that my checked bags would go to my final destination even though on a separate airline. This put me at ease as I had not flown this route before.
label: positive

text:
“GREAT SERVICE – GREAT AIRLINE.” We had good reports about Singapore airline and we were no disappointed.  We had a return flight to Singapore from London – in economy class. 
From the time we bordered the 300-380 aircraft, the service was ‘brilliant’. Helpful and Cheerful stewards. A good amount of space for an economy seat. The food was good with a printed menu from which to choose. 
The staff  [including the male stewards] had a really good empathy with children who were on board.  

I would travel with this airline again.
label: positive

text: Offensive experience of a new launch without respect  New evening flight to Singapore from Johannesburg and the day I flew was the launch. If I had known this I wouldn’t have flown on that day. Checked in myself and had my e-boarding passes so went through to their partner lounge and we were notified by lounge attendants that boarding was taking place. Went to the boarding area to find a camera crew, various publicity people and no boarding taking place at all. While waiting they were interviewing people, having a raffle and waited for another 30 minutes while music blasted out of speakers. When it came time to board they started filming people boarding without any consent from me. I was so enraged I had to let them know they were offensive and needed my permission to film me. The gentleman checking Business Class in did apologize and asked them to stop filming but this made me feel like I was in a freak show. The experience on board to start with continued to disappoint me when I was served orange juice with alcohol in it, which I don’t drink, the meat starter and I am a vegetarian and ordered the vegetarian meal! What has happened to this airline that I used to love and respect? Not a fan anymore.
label: negative

text: Disappointing flights We were disappointed with our Flight from Melbourne to  Barcelona and return. The food was only average, we were not given a travel pack, only socks and eye shade and the seats were not very comfortable. We felt we were not treated any differently from economy class passengers- needing to ask for help to set up our bed  - which was not easy. The bed was very uncomfortable and you had to lie at an angle as the section for your feet is set off to one side. When we arrived home we had very sore hips and backs from the poorly designed bed. The other complaint we had was that the Business Class lounge at Barcelona was appalling - overcrowded, worn out seating and very little food. It was a shared lounge and was full of Flight staff and their luggage! We did write to the airline with our issues and they responded quickly and offered us vouchers to spend at their at their Flight shop - which we appreciated.
label: neutral

text:
Poor service, no refund for seats re-allocation Singapore Air was good years ago, not anymore. We bought tickets with prepaid seats. A month before flying Singapore Air changed our seats without paying a refund. It is unclear what we paid for if seats can be changed by Singapore Air without giving our money back. 
Service was very average.
We will avoid flying with Singapore Air in future.
label: negative

text: Totally Relaxed If you have the money business class is the only way to travel.  Access to The Lounge provides great opportunity to refresh after a long flight.  The in flight service is second to none. Seats that recline to a flat bed together with complimentary slippers,  blanket and pillow make for an enjoyable flight and you will arrived totally fresh and ready to start you holiday experience.  Make sure you take advantage of the online menu ordering for a spectacular feast. I highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Food not good Was not that impressed with Singapore airlines 
The crew were brilliant, Poor food quality, entertainment was a bit out of date, On the flight from Singapore to Brisbane we had no entertainment as the screen was not working. 
We would not fly with Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: Perfect every time! Rated best airline in the world and rightly so. From punctuality, safety to brilliant service.  I would fly SA above any other in the world.  Book the cook just brilliant!
label: positive

text:
Will ruin your trip Went to Maldives with a transit flight via Singapore. First of all, they put us on scoot airways for the first flight, which appeared to be a budget version of Singapore airlines. The plane was old, had no in flight entertainment and was definitely not singapore airlines. Then after being put on a singapore airlines flight for the 2nd part of the journey, to our horror our baggage never made it to the Maldives. We put in a baggage tracking support ticket, went to our resort and waited for 2 days. We had to stay at our resort with nothing but the clothes on our back for two days. Eventually we learned that our luggage had been put on to a flight to Sri Lanka. How the f*** do airline staff do something so stupid? Then instead of sending it direct to Maldives from Sri Lanka, they put it back on a flight to singapore. We received no apology, no compensation and the customer support is impossible to contact. This airline is not worth any chance no matter how good a deal the flight tickets are.

Apparently the resort staff also said that it is not uncommon for singapore airlines to lose your luggage too. So yeah definitely avoid.
label: negative

text: Quality, legroom and baggage allowance The extra legroom compared to some carriers gave comfort, the quality of service, food and entertainment was impressive and the baggage weight allowance removes the headaches when packing. First time flown SA and thoroughly recommend them. Good number of staff at Heathrow to help, great Changi Airport was a breeze for plane change. Note, you are screened again at the gate - reassuring.
label: positive

text: This has good reviews and they are well deserved! We were so fed up with substandard travel we decided to try Singapore Airlines even though it meant travelling to Manchester. Incredibly it was cheaper even after paying train fares and one night in an hotel! The booking system was easy and straightforward, the checking in on line the same, and choice of seats was so easy for us. Once we got to handin in our luggage the staff again were so helpful and made the suggestion to change our seat so we would have three seats to use for the two of us.
