Passing through security and into the departures was a cinch, We were welcomed on to the aircraft by beautifully turned out crew, who were so welcoming and helpful. The plane was clean and smart, the entertainment system easy to manage. We were offered water/orange juice so regularly throughout the trip, and the food was glorious, a choice between European and eastern. Nothing was too much trouble and they remembered everything they said they would do. I can't recommend them enough, and will be flying with them in the future, wherever possible.
label: positive

text: 2 conflicting announcements on board Sq 119..2nd March 2019 Comfortable uneventful flight,left at 20.30 and arrived at Changi at 21.25,within schedule.Midway,well spoken pilot named Chua,announced landing at terminal 3. 10 mins later, air stewardess announced landing at terminal 2 . Looked around, some passengers were shaking their heads.Finally landed at terminal 3.An interconnecting flight for us, to board flight 285 to Auckland at terminal 3 at 22.25. Made it just in time! Whew
label: neutral

text: Good in parts We have flown Singapore airlines for many trips now and always been happy with the service.  Don't know what happened this time but it wasn't quite up to scratch.  On the way to Singapore my husbands connecting flight (Canberra to Sydney) was cancelled on about 9 occasions which was both frustrating and time consuming.  We paid additional money to travel premium economy on the way to Singapore - it was very good and worth the money. Staff were friendly and food was good and plentiful and the additional space in the seats made it comfortable.  On the return journey from Singapore to Sydney however we were in economy and there was a limited amount of food.  The flight left at 7.30am and we did not eat at the airport.  Breakfast on the plane was a bread roll and a container of juice. There didn't seem to be enough staff and those that were there seemed tired and over it (they probably were).  It just didn't seem to be up to their normal standard.
label: neutral

text: Great Service and Comfort The new Business Class arrangement on long haul flights is great. Plenty of set width and the service, food and overall comfort is excellent.
label: positive

text: Experience was quite alright.. Have flown with Singapore Airlines earlier as well but this experience was sub par. Food was bad, toilets were unclean and seats in economy too crammed. Would use their services only if I run out of choices again.. or if there is way too much of a difference in price compared to other airlines.
label: positive

text: Flight To Bangkok, Thailand SIA services are smooth, great and efficient.  The staffs are always prompt in their service and with a great smile.  The flights time are usually on time unless due to unforeseen circumstances.  The flight are loaded with great selections of movies, sitcom, music, etc, to keep you entertained during the flight.  The meals are not the best, however, if compared with many other airlines, the meals served should be considered much much better than the others.
label: positive

text: Best Airline for good reason Johannesburg to Singapore is a long flight. The aircraft is one of the more comfortable. The crew are professional and friendly. I have always been on flights that are on time or early and I have flown this route many times. I would highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines is not anymore what it used to be  I always book emergency exit because I am a quite told person. Today, they have changed the plane and my new seat did not have extra leg space. As a PPS member I requested an upgrade to business because all emergency seats were occupied. After 30 minutes arguing with the person in charge I was told to do an upgrade online ( paying for it!!) dear Singapore airlines people: not everything is money and you have disappointed a very loyal customer.
label: negative

text: great service awesome service. flight attendants were obliging and walked the plane during the trip to bring drinks and snax . toilets were kept clean . we appeared to have more legroom than previously... it was comfortable enough anyway.
label: positive

text: Economy good As economy flights go this was pretty good. Boarding take off and landing we’re good and the flight time was quick.
label: positive

text:
World's Best Airline vs Low Cost Airline I left my wallet on seat 58E.  Ten days later, SQ Customer Service informed me that the wallet was found handed in by their staff but no money inside.  

Three years ago, my cousin left his wallet in the seat pocket in one of the low-cost airline, he got the wallet back with no cents missing.  

Be very careful as there might be a thief on this World's Best Airline.
label: negative

text:
Frequent Singapore visitor Perfect ! You are made to feel exceptionally special ! If you take an evening flight there is a meal of several choices, wine or drink of choice. Tea coffee & lights out for a hopefully long snooze. The staff encourages you to drink plenty of water to keep hydrated & are extremely caring. You can request a snack at any time during the flight.
Films are current & I always love the fact I am watching a good film that is still on in cinema. Would highly recommend!  Off again in October ✨
label: positive

text:
Singapore bound A380 business class Having always wanted to fly in an A380, I got my chance on this trip to Singapore (my end stop being Bali). I found the Singapore lounge in London Heathrow was of good size, with plenty on offer and friendly staff. The seating saw spacious and comfortable! The view was not the greatest as there was a lot of construction going on outside, but you could still see flights coming and going as you sipped and pecked at the numerous bites on offer. 
Upon entering the upper floor of the A380, you are amazed at the sheer amount of business class seats that are laid out along the entire upper floor (apart from the small number of 1st class pods that were on offer at the upper front cabin). 
The business class seating I chose was a window seat. With a seating arrangement of 1 - 2 - 1 with the two Center seats having the ability to transform into a double bed, should you need it! 
The seats were wide, with ample storage all around. The entertainment system was more than ample for my 13 hour flight with more to watch than you could watch on a round the world trip or two. The screens are large touch sensitive screens. 
Besides the blanket/pillow and cushion there are plenty of other items for your comfort at your seat like a set of quality noise cancelling headphones and the usual items like flight socks, sleeping eye covers etc with more items available in the lavatories (shaving kits etc).
The cabin crew were all very attentive and called you by name (which I found a very nice touch). Pre departure drinks in hand after hot towels was just a sample of what was to come!
Being up in the upper deck of the A380 I found it a strange experience barrelling down the runway from such a different perspective before the feeling of being launched with the grace of a majestic Swan into the air and the effortless climb into the blue where our outbound route around London guided us towards our final direction. Up up we climbed and before we knew it we were levelling our in a cruise.
For the entire flight I felt completely taken care of. There was such a selection of food and drink that just seemed to come, just at the right time. From a drinks menu and food menu you were not left wanting. 
The seats were lie flat seats, if you wanted to sleep or just take a snooze. 
If I could say anything negative about the flight it would have to be the lack of grasper air over head! There were no air vents overhead! There were moments that I felt a little warm, but had no means to cool down (except for a cool glass of water). 
Would I fly again with Singapore airlines? The simple answer is yes!
Singapore airways service is very punctual! The crew were ever so helpful and attentive, and I enjoyed every minute.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline! We found the crew staff to be very friendly and obliging. The plane it self was comfortable, well as comfortable as you can get in economy class flying long distance. The food was nice all though it would have been good if you could  pre-order your meals online like QANTAS offer because they would run out of the more popular meals. Also it would have helped me feed my fussy eater of a son.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Timely. Professional service always with a smile. Stewards lovely nothing too difficult pleasant experience all round.
label: positive

text: Great airlines Though expensive, this airlines is so far the best I have traveled in. Be it the cabin-crew or the ground staffs all are friendly and patient with the passengers. They have very professional pilots who fly safe and talk less. The inflight menu, special menu are all amazing. Carry an Eye-Mask if you intend to sleep without any hindrance. They provide a mini-pillow and a sheet.
label: positive

text: Reliable and comfortable Singapore Airlines in my opinion is always reliable and comfortable. Inflight entertainment is also good. Not as much variety as some other airlines but good enough. Seat spacing was average. It was quite cramped. Meals to and from Perth also left a lot to be desired. The menu as well as taste of food was very average. Didn't receive any drink service on the way to Perth. However, from Perth drinks were served separately. The kids meal was excellent, both times. Toilets were quite clean and the crew were doing clean ups in between. Service was slightly indifferent. I would recommend this airline because flight was on time both times, the journey was comfortable, aircraft was clean and well maintained and there were no major pain points at any time.
label: positive

text: First time flying with SIA. Not happy about the flight attendants The flight attendants in our section where not friendly at all. There were hardly any drink services during a 12 hour flight. I had to get the drinks always in the back of the plane. We where a group of 6 people, and 1 of use is a vegetarian, and also ordered the vegan meal upfront. But we changed seats among use 6 so, that was a real big problem for the staff. we had to change seats before we where given the meals! We had 6 seats in two rows at the outside, so just give the meal and its okay. No, 3 other staff members came to clear this "big" problem!
label: neutral

text: A step backwards I am writing this review because we travelled on from Singapore on an aircraft which had the older Singapore Airlines's business class seats and what a difference they are from the new ones. Wide, comfortable, plenty of places to store items, a solid table and a wide area in which the stretch legs.  The new seats are a step backwards as the seat was hard and uncomfortable, the table a folding affair, apart from a pocket near the legs which can't be accessed when the seat is in the lying position, there is nowhere to put items and the area to position legs is so narrow that it is only possible to lie on one side or on the back.  The cabin crew, as always, were the very best but why change the seat design from one which was one of the best?
label: neutral

text:
Fantastic service SQ 861 - HKG to SIN
Fantastic and professional service throughout the flight. Hot towels were distributed at the start of the flight, followed shortly by a drink and meal service. Stewardesses were quick to respond when the call light was on and services were provided quickly.

Entertainment system was touch screen and stocked with a wide variety of the latest films, tv series, music, podcasts and games. Toilets were clean.

At approximately 200 USD for a return flight during promotions, it is no wonder why Singapore Airlines remain the number one choice for casual and business travellers alike!
label: positive

text:
Return flight from Bangkok 16th July 2019 What a surprise - a brand new plane. Seat was so comfortable, Entertainment good. Food was excellent with wine. Flight not full, service very good. 

Keep up the good work Singapore Airlines!!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Review Great flight, food was good everything was smooth! Leg room was pretty narrow but for the price I can't complain. Service is awesome & price is great as well! Total hours was around 1.5hrs, which is considered fast traveling from Singapore to Seattle.
label: positive

text:
Always A Positive Experience I always find 10+ hour trips to be tiring and not the most pleasant.  However, my return trips on Singapore Airlines were much easier thanks to the service and quality of flying with this company.  The flight attendants work hard but are very polite and friendly and provide excellent service.
I paid for extra legroom seats as I find it easier to sleep this way and another benefit is that I was seated across from two lovely flight attendants during the take-offs and landings.  Note that if you opt for this legroom option the entertainment systems need to be put away during those times.
I always prefer to fly with Singapore Air if possible.
label: positive

text:
Class service, timeliness and screens  I used to like Cathay Pacific for this route but SQ now beats them hands down. 

We were scheduled to take off 7.55pm but due to late passengers, were only wheels up at 8.20pm. Still landed punctually at 11.55pm. 

Great entertainment, ok food but class service even in economy. Love all treated well regardless of sex or race. Kudos SIA!
label: positive

text:
I Would Travel this airlines even if we never touched down. It is a LONG WAY from LAX to Singapore. But if you have to be in an airplane for 17 hours count yourself blessed to travel via Singapore airlines. I did have the luxury of traveling Business Class, but 17 hours is still 17 hours. The flight crew were so friendly and attentive. I even received a little Singapore AirlinesTeddy Bear when they found out I was going to be a grandma. 

The seats were superb. The crew made the bed for me when I was ready to take a nap. Lying recumbent on the seat was very comfortable. Only draw back was the leg cubby. It was small and restrictive. If you can, choose the bulkhead seats which offer double the leg room when in lying position. 

And choose the Book the Cook menu. There are many more choices available. You must do this in advance of your flight. 

If you have a choice for your final destination, I highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Smooth flight Amsterdam -  Jakarta v.v. My son and I flew with Singapore Airlines to Indonesia for a four weeks vacation. We have booked a quite transfer at Changi Singapore Airport. The cabin crew was very friendly and helpfully. We enjoyed the meals. There was a choice between western and asian food.  I recommend this airline as I have experience with KLM and Emirates.
label: positive

text: The Best in the Sky On our way back from Penang - we  flew Silk Air (subsidiary of Singapore Airlines) and it was a good flight. A big surprise was waiting for us on the flight from Singapore to Perth. A Boeing 787 Dream liner. Wow it is big / comfortable and the service is the Best airline service ever. We have flown to either Singapore and Penang a combination of possibly 20 time on different airlines. You cannot beat Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: It’s just perfect Top notch service!! From A-Z. Very highly recommend . Most definitely will fly again with Singapore airline . I love it
label: positive

text: A GOOD EXPERIENCE This was our sixth return flight with Singapore Airlines.  We have always flown Business Class and been very impressed with the hospitality on board, the friendly caring attitude of the crew, and the level of service they offer.  On this last flight the care and service offered by the crew was even more exceptional than usual.  We fly to Singapore at least twice a year, and would never consider using any other airline.
label: positive

text: Cabin crew is excellent We've learned not to expect too much when flying economy, i.e. cramped seats.  However, the crew on our flight made extra effort to make our experience as pleasant as it could be on such a long flight. They even found a meal my wife wanted when they had run out of her selection. Happy wife, happy life.  Food service included a mixture of oriental and western type dishes. Most was good for airline food.  Wine for meals was included. We sat in bulkhead seats which provided plenty of legroom but weren't as convenient when it comes to using the entertainment system or having a place to put your things - phone, book etc.  The entertainment system worked well and had an excellent selection of movies, TV shows, music, games.  The only thing missing in the bulkhead row was a USB port to charge my phone but was able to run my charging cable to the row behind me. If you fly economy this is one of the best airlines I have flown.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Flying in Singapore Airlines is unique The secret of the services is a matter of the training one gets. The maintenance of high  quality is the end result
label: positive

text:
Amazing Service Great service, great food, flight on time - what else can I ask for?

From the ease of seat selection during online check in to the baggage drop, it was smooth and hassle free. Upon boarding the flight, we received warm welcomes from the crew and great service throughout the journey. Am a frequent flyer of SIA and will continue to support them in the future!
label: positive

text:
So disappointing This is not the airline I have travelled with so many times in the past.
Terrible waiting time for boarding...so disorganised.
Food disappointing too.
Wouldn’t recommend them anymore
label: negative

text:
First class overrated  I took twice First. On 777 first class has one row and 4 seats, located in a small box crating the feeling of claustrophobia. Service is standard and not personalized, food below Swiss and Lufthansa standard. If you take Swiss or Lufthansa as benchmarks you will be quite disappointed.
The flight from Singapore to Copenhagen was very late, absolutely no help for catching connecting flight. Something unseen for  first class passengers on other airlines.
label: negative

text: Singapore airlines The first leg of our trip was London Heathrow to Changi Singapore. It was a very long 13 hour flight but everything was fine. The food was good and we were offered free wine and other drinks with our meals. Snacks and drinks were also available free of charge throughout the flight. The flight attendants were courteous and friendly and made us feel welcome. We would have liked to have been in premium economy as the seats looked very wide and comfortable but even though we were in economy it wasn't as cramped as with some other airlines. The seat back video screens offered lots of different entertainment such as movies, tv, music and games to keep most people occupied. On the whole a very pleasant flight.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Best airline in the world.  Can’t go wrong flying with them.   Excellent service, attentive crew. No regrets.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service from Ground Jakarta's check-in attendant was very nice, she even ask about my seating preference and very accommodating. Once I went in the cabin, they had this garland ornaments and play Christmas themed music which gave me a homey feeling, and they gave a feel-like-home service too in flight. The food was nicer than any other flight, and their IFE works without glitch.
label: positive

text: Very comfortable flight I like to fly with Singapore airline as they are one of the best in my eyes. Very courteous staff. excellent amenities. very clean and nothing is too much for the staff to help you with.
label: positive

text:
New a350 I fly singapore to/ fro Vietnam sector a lot. Most of the time I am on Vietnam airlines. I with their lotus program highest tier. In term of members benefits wise, definitely more compare to Singapore airline ( cos I am only Kris flyer basic member). 

If its not for my frequent flyer with skyteam, I would any time choose Singapore airlines. Of cos sq is abit more pricey compare to Vietnam airlines. But recently Vietnam airlines up their fares in recent year. Will consider not taking vn if the fares goes any higher

Comparing both these full service airlines sq win hands on.
Service during flight, remembering ur name, smile, friendliness etc. Vietnam airlines can't beat the sq flight crews. 

On ground service wise. If u are on biz class, sq lounge is way better.

In term of support, vn definitely out. As a lotus platinum tier members, I never receive any lug tag, renew tier letter or even the member card. Can't be bother to ask anyway. 

Sq ground, support etc is good. Any changes via sms n email etc. Vn on the other hand, like to change plane type, schedule or even cancel flight, and they will just email a few days in advance. I actually miss connection once cos of their flight delay and landed close to midnight, and miss the next sector connect,  and don't bother to apologize just issue u a next day 6am flight. No hotel offer. Nothing.  theres another time, reach airport and get  to know they email 2 days before my fliggt and put me on an early flight, I miss the flight.

Anyway, maybe I fly more with vn and tendancy to get more of the sh*t . . haha. 

For more reliable service to vn. Go for reputable airlines. Its when things screw up, there's where a good n a so so airline differ.

Miss flying sq. Must put in a few good word. Hahahaha
label: positive

text: Superior flight experience wonderful service on both parts of the trip. great movie selection, good food, spacious, and attentive staff.
label: positive

text: World's best I don't think I would travel any other way with any other airline. This was the new business class 1-2-1 seat configuration so seats were new and very wide. Service was excellent as usual, and the food I had, nasi briyani, was surprisingly delicious. With such royal treatment you never want the flight to end!
label: positive

text: Very basic exprience Travelling in the A350-900 economy class was a very basic experience.   The seating not that comfortable.  The service standards were OK, meals passed the test.    Costs not competitive.
label: neutral

text: Disappointed  Flew recently to Europe on Singapore airlines. We were looking forward to flying with them as they already get good reviews. I must say we were disappointed with the plane, extremely small seats, they ran out of food, and the service was just ok. Return trip from Rome was better with Singapore airlines, this plane was newer but then when we changed planes from Singapore to Perth the plane was old and the seats tiny and less leg room then Jetstar...probably won't fly with them again, wish we had flown with Qatar again.
label: neutral

text:
Seamless Lost and Found! Just flew on a long flight from Singapore to San Francisco (which was extraordinary for economy seating) and left my kindle in the pocket of the plane. Called the airline when I got home (they answered the phone!) and they found it. All I had to do was email them a FedEx address label and they put it in the mail the same day! 

The communication back and forth with staff person Axel on first locating my item and then instructions on how to proceed was excellent. Very impressive and I am very grateful for their attention to detail and follow-thru. 
One happy customer!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines: Simply the Best!! 3/31/19 we flew Business Class on Singapore Airlines Flight 31, an Airbus A350-900, nonstop from San Francisco to Singapore. At check in, the agent stepped from behind the counter and greeted us warmly. Check in was a breeze and we were soon on our way to the United Polaris Club at SFO (No Silver Kris Lounge any more at SFO). I took a hot shower, changed into comfortable clothing for our long flight, and joined my wife for breakfast. We were greeted at the door of the aircraft by the very friendly Singapore flight crew who escorted us to our seats in the beautiful Business Class cabin. We soon had a welcoming drink in hand (a mimosa) as we explored our seats and the extraordinary variety of entertainment options. The cabin is very comfortable and quiet. Within an hour after takeoff from SFO, we were served our dinners which had been pre-selected through Singapore's "Book the Cook" option. The appetizer, entrée (NY steak with asparagus, carrots), and dessert (a wonderful mango pana cotta) were all delicious. Mid way through the flight, I had the Chinese chicken stir fry (again, delicious). Finally, prior to arrival, a final light snack was served. This was the longest flight we've ever taken anywhere at 16 hours 45 minutes. But throughout the flight, the attentiveness and kindness of the crew made every minute of this epic flight most enjoyable. This is what an airline should be. We can't wait to fly with Singapore again some day.
label: positive

text: Good Experience with SQ we got the good rate from travel online in Indonesia, the flight was nice, the aircrew was nice, seat was fine, the food was delicious and they gave us Ice Cream. no delay and good location on CGK and HKG airport. we transited on Changi Airport
label: positive

text: Excellent Recently flew home from Phuket via Singapore and the plane and service was the best have ever experienced will definitely use Singapore airlines whenever possible Thank you for outstanding trip
label: positive

text:
MEL to CPH Business Should be 5 stars for the excellent attentive service received by staff on board the MEL to SIN leg(One attendant in particular, Soleha is the best Ive ever met). 
Missing the last star in this review however due to the following.
The red wine selection seemed to have slipped, the return trip a month later still had the same entertainment already previously viewed on the way there and lastly the Changi business lounge is getting far too overcrowded when it gets to the point where 3 people cannot fit a spot to sit together. 
Oh, another useful tip. Their partner airline SAS do NOT give you an empty seat in the middle of 3 in business as most other European short business flights between countries do. They put 3 passengers in a row together and you need to move yourself after takeoff.
label: positive

text: Trip to Australia This is a lovely airline, the stewardesses in their neat uniform cannot do enough for you, and their smiles are so sweet. And the planes are lovely too with enough legroom not to really need spending more to get the ones at the front in Economy class. We flew late 2019 so had a full flight with lovely food and snacks. My wife is semi- disabled and we asked for the full assistance, so when you get to Singapore Airport on stopover on the way out, unless you ask for it, your own wheelchair goes to the next flight with your luggage. This is ok, but, you get taken in one of their wheelchairs to a drop off area inside the vast flat very large terminal which houses all 4 terminals, and dumped. I could have gone to get coffee visit toilet etc, but my wife was stranded for 90 minutes. The nearest shops were 50 yards away, unaccessible to her. The only up side is that when its time to board your next flight you get taken by someone who knows where they're going and when you reach your gate they push through everybody else to get to the front with me following behind going, 'sorry, sorry', to people. the trick is to ask for your wheelchair back at Singapore and it arrives out of the hold in a nice big plastic bag, so you can explore the large terminal and shops to your hearts content, there is even a smoking room 'inside' near the butterfly area-which is very hot!
label: positive

text:
Terrible after support / customer service (operational) I have been a loyal customer of SIA, albeit I am not a frequent flyer as such, but every year for many years (apart from Covid) i have flown a multi itinerary trip from UK down to Australia and back again inc using their code share partners within Australia (Virgin). I lso fly business class every trip.  This year I can for sure say the non-flight customer service aspect of the company has degraded considerably. I have tried to make changes to dates only, and its been like pulling teeth! Firstly I attempted to change a MEL - PER flight with Virgin Australia as it was on an SIA ticket, They advised there was no seats available however on the Virgin website there was dozens of seats throughout the day. I ended up cancelling the flight (without any refund might I add) and having to pay $1200 for a one way trip to Perth! Now in Perth I am trying to simply change my PER-SIN flight by 5 days and my SIN - CDG flight by 6 days. THREE days ago I made the request and the outbound is due tomorrow, and STILL they cannot give me pricing! Furthermore,  do not understand why as I booked the seat 100% on SIA website that I cannot cannot make simple changes like this on their website. Instead I have to call their beyond useless call centre and each time I can be on the phone for over and hour. My request is so simple...... just a date change only! What is so difficult?? 
Sadly having always been extremely loyal to SIA for this yearly trip, I will now likely use middle eastern airlines, as I have never had any issues with their customer service, and flight changes are pretty simple. My experience is with Emirates and Qatar Airlines. 
SIA need to up their game else the middle eastern giants are going to scoop up your market as they offer a far easier product. We book business not only for comfort, but also ease to make changes, as many business people need to do. SIA make it so difficult. Coupled with the fact the middle eastern carriers offer limo transfers both ends as part of the ticket too.
The staff on board are still amazing ,and flight is pretty good, but the whole operation is being let down by the administration side which spoils the overall experience.
label: neutral

text:
Singapore sets the standard There is a reason Singapore Air is rated year after year one of the top international carriers. 

I’ve been flying Singapore for decades and have always been impressed with the level of service.  I no longer fly enough to secure business class so this time I elected to travel Premium Economy. I would say that Singapore’s economy is better than any US carrier flying to Asia but due to the length of the flight decided to go Premium Economy. 

The Premium Economy is not business class but is sufficiently better than economy that if you can get a reasonable price for the seat, it is worth the upgrade. You receive some of the same amenities as business class-convenience package, up graded entertainment center including full head phones and the ability to select your meals in advance. The big difference is the seat. The seat is reclinable and there is a leg support and a foot rest. The seat is also wider. I was able to get a reasonably comfortable sleep in the flight. 

What sets this airline apart is that the planes and cabins are immaculate and the cabin crew are extremely pleasant and attentive to any needs you may have. 

I’ve flown on three classes of service on Singapore and they have never disappointed.
label: positive

text:
Worst Customer Service We booked flights to Thailand for 4th February 2022 for our 5th Year wedding anniversary. We checked all the Covid and travel requirements 

Turned up to Heathrow Airport 3hours before departure time with all the required documents - only to find out on the 1st of February the Thailand Government reintroduced their Thai Pass scheme (which was previously suspended) the Thai pass needs at least 5 days to process and they advise 7 days before you can follow it up. Therefore if we applied for the Thai pass we would not have it in time. 

We explained our situation at the check in desk and even showed our attendant the UK government website which states the Thai pass is not required. Our Singapore check in attendant went and showed his manager. I also explained to the manager that we have all the required documents other than the Thai pass as it was impossible to attain the Thai pass in the timeframe we had. 

The manager then just shrugged his shoulder and said tough luck I’m not going to let you board the flight without it. At which point I said “I understand and I really need a help to find a solution because I’m not sure what I can do.” He replied to me saying “it’s not my problem - you have to leave”. 

The manager was completely rude and showed no empathy towards our situation. We pleaded at the ticket desk for some help but none was available. The staff at Thai Airways showed more empathy and care to answer our questions and explain the process. We literally had to turn back with all of our baggage and get a cab home. 

I will never book another flight with Singapore Airlines again and will definitely be sharing more segments of my ordeal online. 

They clearly do not care about their customers and have horrible Customer service
label: negative

text: Travel for a tradeshow business class has gargantuan bucket seats. service is impeccable, i'd have to say this is one of the top airlines for service/comfort and luxury.
label: positive

text: Professional staff Would highly recommend this airline booked in easily no delays comfortable seats very friendly professional staff and yummy in flight food
label: positive

text: Comfort and service The aircraft was a bit old, found the seating a bit cramped,Air New Zealand aircraft new and more spacious.. Crew were friendly, good service, good food.

text: Wonderful flight experience Extremely comfortable flight on an excellent aircraft with an excellent airline.  The staff were attentive and very helpful indeed.  The cabin was clean and comfortable.  Could not fault Singapore Airlines.  Would choose them everytime.

text:
Newish planes, AirAsia service Cockroaches crawling out of overhead lockers.
Quite a small plane used for an international, four hour leg to Kolkata - I think the seats on an AirAsia flight I took in India had more leg room than this flight.
Meals were generally quite poor with some exceptions (the food served in 2nd class on Indian Railways was better) and one breakfast consisted of a bread roll, a yoghurt and a small cake (see photo below). Staff slow to bring water and drinks.
I don't understand how Singapore Airlines has achieved such a high ranking.

text:
What a great flight Even though we were in economy class we felt like we were treated as very important. The delightful flight attendants greeted us with smiles and offers to help, and made sure we go to our seats (way in the back).

The entertainment on the tv screen on the back of the seat in front of us was very extensive and had many choices of things we enjoyed seeing.

The dinner and breakfast we were served were outstanding. Even my wife, who is very picky about food, raved about how good the meals were. The choice of beverages (especially the wines) were excellent and we felt like we were in a high class restaurant. (again, we were in the lowest class section).

The hot towels before and after meals were appreciated.

The flight itself was very smooth, on time, and the captains remarks appreciated.

Wouldn't it be wonderful if IS airlines were like this??

text: Preferred choice for long haul flights Over many years Singapore Airlines has been our airline of choice wherever possible. The staff are always wonderful - nothing is too much trouble; they are helpful and courteous. On the whole, the food quality and choice is good. In-flight entertainment has good range of options. My only regret - that we've never been able to travel Busininess Class!

text: Fully Enjoyed #FlySQ I am so happy flying with SQ due to all things are prefect. The served with very professional one. Also I fully enjoyed during my flight to Singapore because I got big portion of meal and also enjoyed my Wine. This is my 3rd time together flight with SQ and its lovely experience ever. Congratulations for being the best airlines and also keep moving forward for future memorable experience with you.

text:
Fantastic service Never flown with this airline before but will definitely use again.
Fantastic service on board with nice in-flight meals and drinks.
Flight crew were very attentive nothing too much trouble.

Positives
1. Nice seats 
2. Good in-flight entertainment

Negatives
1. None really

text:
Booking nightmare I had an extremely disappointing experience with Singapore Airlines.
My holiday plans changed and i needed to make some changes to the dates and times of the flights, but this appeared to be impossible to complete.
On 2 or 3 separate occasions i called the Singapore Airlines telephone helpline and talked to operators in the Philippines. On each of these occasions i spent 2 to 3 hours trying to undertake and confirm some simple changes to my flights. On each occasion the operators were not able to process and confirm the requested changes.

I also (on numerous occasions) emailed Singapore Airlines with the details of the required changes and the details of the telephones conversations.

From all of my attempts to communicate with Singapore Airlines i did not receive a single communication or confirmation in response. Incredibly there was no audit trail or evidence of any of my conversations with them.

I checked my itinerary through the Singapore Airlines website about 3 weeks before i was due to leave to find that my return flight to NZ had been completely cancelled. I then decided to cancel the flights, but was incredulous when i found that i would have to pay the flight cancellation fee - this despite the debacle that had occurred up to this point. 

In the end i had to purchase a last minute, expensive flight with an alternative airline - which was a very simple and straightforward process.

In summary, i spent and wasted significant amounts of time dealing with Singapore Airlines, had to pay a cancellation fee and incurred significant additional cost as a result of Singapore Airlines ineptitude. I have flown with Singapore Airlines previously and have found their aircraft and services to be good, but i am disgusted with how i have been treated on this occasion. On this basis i would recommend other airlines (such as Emirates) in preference to Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text:
Best in class Best in Class , a cut above most Airlines , what makes it more special is the warm cabin crew , who are turned out so well all thectime and remain so right throuh even on long hauls .
The cabins are well maintained and ditto the toilets .
Food and Beverage is served with a smile and efficiently too .A very good choice too

text: non-existent customer service We flew coach class from SFO to Bangkok in November 2021. We found that Singapore Airlines was not the airline of old. It used to be the best airline in Asia. No more. The seating was cramped, not China Air cramped, but certainly not on par with other competitor airlines such as ANA, and certainly no better than EVA or Cathay Pacific. Their customer service was non-existent. They canceled our connecting flight on their subsidiary airline, Scoot, booked through Singapore Air, from Phuket to Singapore on the return leg. We were notified by email just 16 days before the scheduled flight. We were informed that we had to now fly out of Bangkok to Singapore, not Phuket, and we had to re-book through Singapore Air, not Scoot, and had to telephone a customer service agent to do so. This meant a total revision of our itinerary and losing the non-refundable tickets we had already purchased for flights in Thailand. We spent a total of 4 hours on hold attempting, without success, to reach an agent. We called both the Bangkok and Singapore offices to no avail. We even had a travel agent call for us on the agent's line. She gave up after 1/2 hour on hold. We tried email. They told us they would get back to us in 7-14 days! We had gone to both the Phuket and Bangkok airport Singapore Air offices but both were closed, seemingly permanently. We gave up and flew ANA home. They answer their phones. When we returned we found that all they would refund were the taxes. Sent a letter by post to the corporate headquarters. One month later no response, not even an acknowledgment of receipt.
label: negative

text:
Nice flight with good leg space It was night journey and from Check-in to arrival everything went excellent as per schedule.  Food on board was good. Service was good. Weather was not friendly for long time. Entertainment was also good. 
Great value for money...

text: Singapore Airlines This is one of the best airlines I have ever traveled, the seats were roomy the in flight entertainment was excellent and the bathrooms were very clean. I flew round trip from Bangkok to Singapore and both flights were excellent.

text: Average, with seat problems and mediocre meals Took 4 regional flights - 3 on A330 and 1 on B787. What was common in all four was poor meals. They were quite substantial, but of low quality. What was said to be "beef" was beef burger patty. Staff were on the whole good and efficient, though there were a variety of attitudes. None were bad, though; just that some were tired while others were friendly and enthusiastic. Entertainment was extensive, though on the A330s it was still old-style and not on-demand. On the B787, the entertainment system was completely out of order. The seating is the thing that causes the most pain. The A330s were old and tired, and legroom was very tight. The seat was too upright and was very painful to be in. As for the B787, it had the correct angle of recline, making it very comfortable to sit in. This has been commented on by many travelers. However, with 9-abreast, the seat is extremely narrow. With this 9-abreast for B787 and 10-abreast for updated versions of B777, Singapore Airlines joins the rest of the world in the competition to squeeze and squash, and inflict torture on passengers. No longer a premium airline, I'm afraid, at least for regional flights. I had intercontinental flights on Singapore Airlines years ago, and they were superb. But those were on the 9-abreast B777, whose days are numbered now, sadly.
label: neutral

text: It’s really disappointing that such a long haul airline has such terrible ground service. Rude of indifferent ground staff. Use really dirty lounges for long haul flights. Their Singapore located lounges are horrendously over crowded. Not an airline to use for business

text:
Why can't Singapore Airlines act in good faith when altering bookings. "Complimentary / No penalty" should mean that. We booked return business class flights to Europe on flexible tickets.

It was then necessary for us to change the Sydney Paris leg to Sydney Istanbul on a later date.
The ticket conditions stated "Booking change fee Complimentary (a fare difference may apply)" . We expected this fare difference condition to be applied in good faith.

Singapore Airlines imposed a 30% penalty for this change.

I questioned the Singapore Airlines staff on this 30% penalty in two regards

Firstly, we were changing to a shorter, cheaper flight, why was the cost increasing?
* Flight Time for Singapore Paris is 13h 35m.
Flight Time for Singapore Istanbul is 11h 0m
* The fare for Sydney Paris is AUD7792.39-8217.25
The fare for Sydney Istanbul is AUD 6342.59 at the time we proposed the change to the booking.

Secondly, part of this change is that an airfare Singapore Paris on 26 Aug is now made available for sale by Singapore. The price of this fare is higher than the Istanbul fare which would be taken off the market by our change. So as well as charging an extra 30% for the outward bound leg of our journey, Singapore profit further by the higher sale price of that Paris fare. Singapore may well say that they might not sell this fare. Perhaps, but they also may not sell the Istanbul fare.

Despite interactions with many many Singapore Airlines staff, not one person ever answered the issues raised, or in any way "owned the problem"

To make matters worse the Singapore Airlines representative proudly told me there was "no penalty" for the change in booking. In such case why the 30% charge for changing to a cheaper flight ?

So while I understand “revenue maximisation models” I also understand concepts of acting in good faith with customers. How does this latter concept factor in their penalty ? Singapore Airlines talks with pride about the experience it provides to people who fly with them. The process we are going through now is part of that experience. All we were looking for is that people act in good faith and with fairness.

These practices should really be reviewed by Australia's consumer protection authorities. The statement "Booking change fee Complimentary (a fare difference may apply)" is clearly grossly misleading. That should be our next step.
label: negative

text:
Korean Air LH and EK are better than SQ in Economy class I flew one way flight ticket for $880  USD Economy Lite from BKK Thailand to JFK New York City via Germany. It was average than my expectations based on facts:
Seat issue: If you are with Economy Lite ticket, your seat is guaranteed in middle row or at worst - in end of economy class cabin. I flew in middle row and in end of Economy class cabin. Economy seat was uncomfortable at A350-800 for 13-14 hours. Painful ride with the uncomfortable hard seat. My legs had spasms and my back was sore and stiff after the poor seat cushion on SQ flight A-350-800 Singapore Airlines to New York City.
Koreain Air, LH, and EK would treat you better with seat options that it depends on cost of the ticket and class you paid for. I paid $880 for one way - a long international flight with SQ.
Meal Issue: Koreain Air, LH, and EK meals in economy cabin are superior and best quality than Singapore Airlines poor quality meal. I was shocked that SQ provided me a dinner meal: potato with previously frost green beans without a dessert. No fruits and no desserts at all on 13-14 hours international long haul flight.
I miss Korean Air, LH, and EK economy class and liked their meals so much delicious not SQ.

I asked Singapore Airlines crew members of the flight from SIN to FRA. They said that they do not have any dessert and no fruits.

During snack break and down service - there was available only mini potato chips and mini ice cream. 

Service Quality Issue: Singapore Airlines crew often missed or skipped my requests for 4th time during flights BKK-SIN and SIN-DUS. I noticed SQ lacked punctuality and SQ has flaws with sloppy service that I noticed and observed. I requested for water, snack, and coke. They ignored my requests and continued to smile politely. My fellow passengers were puzzled and they witnessed. LH, Korean Air, and EK crew members are very punctual and attentive with each passenger's request. 

Economy class overall experience is impressive and wow factors are offered only with international flights on Korean Air, Emirates, and Lufthansa. 

Do not waste your money for SQ Economy Class trip! There you would not get any better treatment or best experience. Singapore Airlines earned an award only for a business class product and business class service thats all. It is just speculative hype by SQ based on my past experience in economy class. Nothing impressive with SQ Economy class and its service. Fly with Korean Air, Lufthansa, and Emirates instead of Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text:
17 1/2 hour flight I had wanted to fly the Airbus A350-9000 aircraft since I became aware of it.  There are two classes.  Business Class and Premium Economy.  I got a good airfare where it was BC going out and Premium Economy for the return.

This review is the outbound in business class.
The inbound is a few weeks away.

The good:
Boarding.
Cabin Service.
Food (great). I used the Book the Cook service prior to the flight
Large Entertainment screen

The NOT SO Good:
The seat.  Yes the seat.  It was a lie flat seat but one had to angle one's legs into the left corner instead of straight on.
To get into the lie flat position one had to get up and pull the seat back down. Make up the seat, etc.  The reverse when going back to a sitting position.
The entertainment selection was not by using a touch active screen but a overly sensitive controller.

Would I fly it again? Doubtful.
label: neutral

text: Best business class seat I have flown many business class flights on 5-star airlines such as Cathay Pacific, Qatar Airways, and Korean Air. However, on long-haul flights, Singapore Airlines' business class B777-300ER has great service, seats, and food onboard. The flight crew is very friendly. They care about me and respond quickly if I request something. The food is really tasty, especially the Western style. I ate lobster thermidor, and it is one of the best foods I have ever eaten on an aeroplane. Besides that, their hard product is the top reason why I chose Singapore Airlines. I chose 11K for my seat on this flight. The bulkhead seat provides a spacious bed, and it is wide enough that my companion and I can sit together.
label: positive

text:
Great Product and excellent service despite full flight Singapore Airlines operates several aircraft types between Singapore and Bangkok. For this flight, we flew with Singapore Airlines B787-10 which is one of the newest aircraft in the Singapore Airlines fleet.

Singapore Airlines B787-10 has a two-class configuration, capable of carrying up to 337 passengers with 36 Business Class seats and 301 Economy Class seats. Economy Class is split into two sections. All seats in Economy Class are arranged in the 3-3-3 configuration. The seats in the Economy Class cabin are generally decked in light grey fabric with some seats in light blue. The use of purple and orange mood lighting used during boarding makes the cabin looks bright and refreshing.

The lavatories in the Economy Class cabin are located in the mid and the aft part of the aircraft. The lavatories are no bigger than those found onboard other Singapore Airlines aircraft. The use of mirrors in the lavatory makes the lavatory looks larger than it actually is. Singapore Airlines is perhaps one of the few airlines that stocked their Economy Class cabin lavatories with amenities such as toothbrush, combs and razors on top of the handsoap. Passengers can also find hand lotion and Eau de toilette in the lavatory. Singapore Airlines installs sensor-activated tap and toilet flush making the use of the lavatory more hygienic.

The seats onboard Singapore Airlines B787-10 features their new Economy Class seats. The seats in Economy Class cabins are very comfortable with a pitch of 32" and width of 17.5". The legroom in the seats is very good, adding more comfort for the 2-hour flight time to Bangkok. Seat recline button is found on the armrest.

Most of the seat features in the Economy Class seats can be found on the panel in front of each seat, making it look very clean and well designed. It has everything that a passenger needs for their flight. There is a small compartment below the TV screen that allows passengers to stow small items such as mobile phones or the earphones that the airlines provide for the In-Flight Entertainment System. Tray tables can be folded into half and are large for Economy Class standards, capable of allowing passengers to do some work on their laptops. The seat reading light is situated on the ceiling above the seat.

There is a cup holder in every Singapore Airlines Economy Class seats making it convenient for passengers to place their cups into while not deploying the tray table. Flight attendant call buttons and switches for the reading light can be found on a small panel on the bottom left of the TV screen. The USB charging port and headphone jacks are located next to the call buttons. There is a small coat hook in each Economy Class seat. On top of the USB charging port, Singapore Airlines is thoughtful enough to install a universal power plug for every two seats for passengers to charge their lifestyle devices, conveniently located under the armrest in front of the passengers.

The seat pocket is large enough for passengers to store their iPads. There are two other smaller pockets in front of the main seat pocket, which I find useful to put small items like a passport. The main seat pocket contains the usual inflight magazines such as Singapore Airline's travel magazine - SilverKris, the in-flight entertainment catalogue - KrisWorld, and the in-flight duty-free catalogue - KrisShop.

Each Economy Class seat onboard Singapore Airlines B787-10 comes with an 11'1" personal TV with touchscreen function. The touchscreen function is very responsible and is the only way passenger can control the In-Flight Entertainment system. There is no IFE controller found in the seat since IFE controls can be done on the TV. Singapore Airlines' KrisWorld has an extensive library of entertainment options, arranged in easy to navigate menus. KrisWorld has the latest blockbuster movies from Hollywood as well as regional movie titles. Scrolling through the KrisWorld is similar to how one would scroll through on their tablet, passengers can swipe left or right to get to the type of entertainment option they desire and click on the large icon to launch the movie or TV show they want to watch.

Meal service commenced about 30 mins into the flight. Flight attendants went around distributing dinner together with drinks. Passengers were given the option of Char Siew Rice of Green Curry Chicken with fried rice. The Char Siew Rice I opted was very tasty and the pork meat was very tender and well marinated. The rice is a tad hard. I did not like the Quinoa and Vegetable that was served as an appetiser was less to be desired. The Mango pudding dessert is good though.

Service onboard this Singapore to Bangkok flight onboard Singapore Airlines in Economy class was good. Despite being a busy full flight, service onboard Singapore Airlines Economy Class was not compromised. Flight attendants are seen offering help to passengers with their carry-on luggage during boarding. Meal service was done with a smile. As soon as the seat belt sign was turned off, one of the flight attendants approached my friend and me to inform us that they have taken note of our food allergies and told us the options for dinner prior to the meal service run. After taking our preference, the flight attendant emerged from the galley with our food ahead of the rest of the passengers. When requested for a can of coke to share with my friend and the flight attendant happily hand us the coke and even asked if it is sufficient for the two of us.

Singapore Airlines new Economy Class product on the B787-10 is very good. The seats are very comfortable and the legroom is generous for Economy Class. The IFE menu is very easy to navigate via the touchscreen function on the TV and the touchscreen is very responsive. There are loads of entertainment option on KrisWorld that kept me entertained throughout the 2-hour flight to Bangkok. Interactions with the flight attendants were rather minimal as this is a full flight. Despite that, service is always done with a smile. This short flight with Singapore Airlines is quite enjoyable.
label: positive

text:
Excellent long flight Good legroom and very comfortable seat.  Service and food was excellent.
This made a long flight most tolerable.  Will definitely fly them again.
label: positive

text:
Great Airline To Fly With Singapore Airlines is always a pleasure to fly with and a fantastic airlines. We recently flew to New Delhi & Back on Business.

The journey has four legs, so I will comment individually

Brisbane to Singapore - Small Plane Seats & Average staff, poor food, book the cook is useless

Singapore to New Delhi - A380, great seats, fantastic staff and great food.

New Delhi To Singapore - A380, great seats fantastic staff and super food

Singapore to Brisbane - Small Plane, Small seats, fantastic staff and great food. 

Singapore Airlines lounge food needs an revamp and upgrade.

Overall great experience.
label: positive

text:
Amazing service and great food!  Had found Singapore airlines has gone back to the top in my airline experiences! Their service was so friendly and helpful on the a380 
and they would do anything they could to help travelling with two kids! The food was fantastic I had a biryani and kids had pasta which they loved! Thank you Singapore airlines!
label: positive

text: Best airline for long haul flight This was my first flight with Singapore airlines but I confirm the positive remarks previous passengers have shared. By far it is the best airline!
label: positive

text: Rudest Customer Service I have ever experienced They changed my flight without proper notification. And then when I asked them for any possible solutions they were extremely rude. They refused to take any responsibility and were just horrible to deal with. I even asked to speak to a supervisor and the guy simply said there is no one else to talk to. They will send an email to your spam folder, tell you that you didn't see it and it isn't their problem. Horrible company will never deal with them again.
label: negative

text:
Always nice but sometimes they just don't I travelled a lot with Singapore Airlines throughout my life probably my second most after Garuda Indonesia. I went to Tokyo (via Narita) with Singapore Airlines in Business Class twice this year and I only got a problem when I was in my flight back from Narita to Jakarta via Singapore where the flight attendant shoo me away while I was in line waiting for lavatory (it was the new dreamliner and pretty small). I was with other passenger who was also confuse being told to get back into our seats. It wasn't a very pleasent experience since they only have two lavatories available in Business Class.

The Aircraft - My first flight from CGK to NRT was in January where they still use the old 777-300/800ER (the specified brown one) and it was very very nice since you got a very wide and comfy Business Class, but my latest flight was using the Dreamliner which was has a very small seat compare to the previous one. I hope SQ can fix this.

Food - Everything was nice since they were serving international choice and Japanese choice both are fine.
label: positive

text:
Clean efficient airline Efficient alright.  Smooth boarding, clean interiors, on time departure and arrival. 
A bit too efficient. Staff not warm enough. too distant. Dinner was served at 3:30 a.m.! Food was average.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline Singapore air is simply the best, I love the way cabin is sectioned, feels like your in a lounge. Food and service cannot fault!
label: positive

text: Best experience fly with Singapore airline It’s very very good if you fly with Singapore airline like on time performance, all is very good, better fly with this airline.
label: positive

text: Poor customer service Singapore air was my most favourite airline. But they are getting worse day by day. Booking related customer service is becoming the worst. I think they are over proud of their fame, which will bring them to the ground very soon. Shame on them!
label: negative

text:
Singapoer Airlines do not live up to its reputation - never again We left Auckland on 22 December and returned 19 January (total of 4 flights) and was booked in premium economy.  I had a expectation of what the service would be like having flown the same class on other airlines.  
BUT :  The service was poor, the one hostess in our section serving on the right hand side was very abrupt on the Auckland to Singapore leg, the food very disappointing, and the toilets were never cleaned during the flights, causing the paper disposals to overflow and making using the bathrooms unpleasant.  The only leg of our journey that was an exception was the flight from Johannesburg to Singapore.  We also were not seated together on 2 legs of our journey and the check in staff were unapologetic and unhelpful.  10.5 hours is a long time to sit with strangers if your family is sitting somewhere else.
I have seen Singapore airline's advertising and was looking forward to the flights (even if the trip was 25 Hours) but the reality was shockingly different. I will never fly them again and would actively advise others not to.
label: neutral

text:
Good Airline But too Long We are over 80 & chose to fly with Singapore Airlines as they offered most direct flight to Shanghai where we joined a cruise ship. As we have some mobility limitations, the airline provided us with wheelchair transport between check-in, gate lounges & exit.
The service on board was good, catering was good & seating relatively comfortable, with a good selection of movies.
In retrospect for us, the 9 hours to Singapore, 3 hour stop over & 5 hour flight to Shanghai was too long & we would have been better off to  do the flight in 2 separate stages.
label: positive

text:
Two trouble free flights to Auckland We were off to visit our son and grandson in New Zealand and chose to go via Singapore stopping for a couple of nights before flying on to Auckland.
The booking in and luggage drop at Heathrow was quick and simple with no queues to speak of, also boarding was organised and easy.
The crew on the plane were as friendly and helpful as normal and the food was better then expected for economy class. The A380 seemed to be new and comfortable.
Our short stay in Singapore was very good but when i went to book in for the flight to Auckland I hit a problem in that NZ immagration said my visa was not valid and so I went to the Singapore Airline and a young lady there got it sorted speaking to NZ immagration to find the problem then got it sorted so I could fly and I can't speak to highly of the service she gave us. 
Our 2nd flight from Singapore to Auckland was not so good with a much older A380 plane and the food not to our tastes but the service was as good as ever.
label: positive

text:
You get what you pay for Flight was ok - slept mostly.  Stewardess and steward were rather efficient going about their tasks.  Friendly, kind of though not engaging, but efficient in meeting requests.  Aircraft toilets were not the cleanest. probably passengers were the culprits too.  Will be nice to have some air-fresheners or a fan to draw out the staleness.  Food quality was ok, beverages were good.

Hot towels were a welcome upon boarding and just below landing.  Overall flight comfort 8.5/10
label: positive

text: Fantastic airline  I traveled to Phuket via Singapore and return on Singapore airlines in March and all i can say is they are fantastic. They look after you so well. On my return trip i became ill and the crew couldn't do enough for me. They did everything that was humanly possible to make me comfortable and to care for me. I would recommend this airline to anyone
label: positive

text: Perfect Seervice The cabin crew could not do more for you, always polite and keen to be helpful. The food was first class up to restaurant standard.
label: positive

text:
Perth to Singapore to Kochi India and return. Having flown with Singapore Airlines before, I was not disappointed. Beautiful, well presented cabin staff. A little cramped but isn't all economy class?
Hassle free check in and bags were waiting for us at both ends.
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline This was the first time we used Singapore Airlines and it was superb! The excellent service started when I contacted them and they booked all my flights, incl stopover in Singapore with no hassle. Check in staff, cabin crew, food, cleanliness were all great.  What a good experience!
label: positive

text: Poor seat assignment and Service Upon check in receptionist didn't bother to establish eye contact. Me and my hubby were sandwiched in between 2 couples who obviously only wanted to seat in ailes and we're probably gold members as they were served food an hour ahead of us. Finally we were given a choice of food but after 10 minutes attendant came back that there is only fish left. What's the point in giving choices when there's none. So ended up disappointed and hungrier. I think it's only good to travel business in this airline as tried it the first time we flew with them. Seats though in premium economy are not bad if they could have managed the seating assignment better. Was surprised how unthoughtful service was as heard only good stuff about Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Excellent Flight I've always been very proud of Singapore Airlines being Singapore's own International Airline.  I would like to commend on a senior crew which for the 1st time I have very good impression of how this senior steward tried to make contact and he was very friendly and made passengers who walked past him felt so comfortable and at ease.  He will cracked some jokes and this definitely helps those who have flight phobia to felt at ease.  He was also very helpful and offered passengers who needed help willingly. Though my flight was just a short flight of about 2 hours, I would say, this is 1 of the BEST experience I had with Singapore Airlines. Thank you for that friendly gestures and your kind & helpful attitude in serving.
label: positive

text: Spoilt Now I've flown Business Class on other airlines and have been reasonably satisfied, however I'm afraid Singapore Airline is a different class, no wonder their always up there in the ratings year on year. The only problem? Next flight I'll know that I'll be disappointed as I'll be comparing it with this airline.
label: positive

text: System fault can’t check in online Due to SA system fault I can’t check in online and therefore have to check in last minute at the airport!! (Can’t check in online means can’t choose seat very annoying) Was given the middle seat which I’m not happy at all as I was travelling alone and always wanted an aisle seat! Despite telling the ground staff at check in counter of my preference they just said ‘sorry we can’t help you should have checked in online) but it’s not my fault that I can’t check in online.. this is not the 1st time... I have since try not to travel with Singapore airline but choose other airline instead because there is no customer service in their vocabulary unfortunately..
label: negative

text:
Not as good as we expected We were disappointed with our first experience of Singapore Airlines, we expected far better.
The plane was old, the seat back touch screens were in need if maintenance and repair, I like to play the games but you couldn’t.  The food was only just warm (health risk?) and the staff were not very visible, they seemed really keen for everyone to sleep, although it was a morning flight.  There was a distinct lack of drinks and no alcoholic drinks were offered at all.
This said the flight was boarded on time and arrived on time.
label: neutral

text:
Nice lounge in Melbourne Nice business class seat with plenty of clever storage and a very airy cabin.
Cabin crew a little distracted but when called they were immediately present and performed professionally throughout.
Very good lounge in Melbourne.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable flight We were allocated seats in the top deck at the very back... perfect! Had more room and even storage and shelf to the side of my window seat. We were looked after by the immaculate air crew. Food was very pleasant , only criticism was the film choices. Not many recent films to choose from unlike Cathay Pacific .
The return flight was through the night and we found the crew less attentive , possibly because of the timing ? Other than that we would choose Singapore Airlines again , but Cathay Pacific just pipped them to the post .
label: positive

text: Bathrooms are disgusting In both flights (Melbourne to Singapore and Singapore to London ) after the first few hours  the toilets were so messy and filthy, unlike emirate flights no one takes care of the toilets,  they don't even  empty the trash during the whole 16 hours flight ! I was really disappointed !!!
label: negative

text: Friendliest airline The moment you check in, you”ll feel you are pampered already. The check in staffs were so helpful so are the FAs, all the way to Perth, Australia. I like taking this airlines because they care so much of their passengers.
label: positive

text: Trip to Rome with Singapore Airlines Excellent service from the moment I boarded the plane, Very helpful and welcoming staff. Great service, tasty meals and plentiful. Inflght service very good. Will continue to fly with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Still the best Airline. But on this sector, the special meal was an unusual disappointment. When it comes to choosing an airline for our travel abroad, my first choice has always been Singapore Airlines. Yes, indeed the cost for flying this premium airline is often higher than others but what price would one pay for safety, punctuality and good meals and excellent service. 
However, our recent return flight from Colombo to Singapore was surprisingly a big disappointment in that our special meal was far below par. Both my wife and I just could not eat what was suppose to be our “sea-food” meal. So too was the plain shrimp salad and obviously stale bun! We just left them uneaten.
I only hope that competitive pricing in airline flights won’t make this worse.
Despite this, our flight to Singapore was smooth and relaxed. No drama, which is what we want in an airline.
label: positive

text:
We won a Ballot and got a Better Trip!!! We were offered to place a bid to upgrade our Economy Class seats to Premium Economy seats.

After much discussion & thought we decided we would give the Balllot a go, so we placed a fairly minimalised Bid of $550 ($275 per seat) and much to our surprise, some two days later, we were advised that our Bid was successful!!!

Neither my Husband or I regretted making that Bid because we were allocated two very comfortable seats with plenty of leg room at a bulkhead up the front of the Economy Section.

The seats were a tad larger than the Economy Class Seats so they were a lot more comfortable and made our eight hour flight much better and so much more pleasant!!!

The Cabin Attendants were very attentive, polite & pleasant - so they were great ambassadors for the Airline!!! The flight was on time and quite smooth.
Meals served were nice enough and tasty!!!
label: positive

text: Excellent !! A great experience once again with Singapore Airline. We were in transit. The boarding was very orderly. On board service was excellent. The crew was very helpful and polite. The only slight problem was the food  tray table. It was too small to keep food tray on it and eat comfortably.
label: positive

text: Low Quality Business Class This is a good route from Singapore to Wellington as it saves going via Auckland. There is a short stopover in Melbourne. However business class is old - no lie flat seat, no usb, poor entertainment system. I recommend you dont waste points on this class/route, and if you want a good business class, fly via Auckland. Sometimes I wonder how SIA win all these awards!
label: negative

text: Excellent Service We booked several Singapore award business class flights for regional travel around SE Asia in the fall of 2018. The process of booking award flights was easy and straight forward. Unlike USA legacy carriers and some other alliances, seats were available and released for awards, even for two people. This leg was DPS (Bali) to CNX (Chiang Mai). Excellent service and comfort on A330 and B737. Excellent air crews and attentive service. Slightly disappointed with the Silver Lounge in Changi Airport T-2, with it's dark interior, but it's a minor gripe as we always enjoy the lounges especially as compared to other airlines/alliances. We will continue to book award flights on Singapore Air, the product is very good and consistent.
label: positive

text: Great entertainment. Service excellent. Food so-so. As always, SQ never fails to disappoint in terms of flight efficiency and outstanding service standards. The air stewardess serving our row is clearly still a newbie, guided and assisted by several senior staffs throughout the flight service. Although nervous and made a few clumsy mistakes, she was very sincere and hardworking. The calm and helpfulness of her senior colleagues were also heart-warming to see. Taste of food has declined over the years with SQ, so was not expecting much.
label: positive

text: Excellent service by the crew members Great airline to begin with. Food was great served with Udders ice cream. Love the inflight entertainment, full of movies and short films. Fantastic overall
label: positive

text: Hopefully we will not have to travel with Singapore Airlines again Twice now we have had to add over 5 hours to our trip due to Singapore Airlines. Once in 2017 over 5 hours in Singapore Airport missing connections and resulting in another 3 hours waiting for new connections and they gave us a multi plug for power points in different countries only to have it break first time.  Last Friday their flight was late leaving Bangkok creating another 5 hour delay in Melbourne only to be given a $15 voucher each to use in Singapore airport for something to eat. We bought 2 drinks and it still cost us an extra $10. Maybe just bad luck but really we have flown with other airlines without any delays. What an exhausting trip home both times. The staff are nice and do well to work with such a crap product.
label: negative

text: Worst food served During my recent trip using silk air; had the worst food experience ever on airlines. Uncooked raw chicken meat served; will be the last time i book silk air flight. Ensure when you book singapore airlines you dont get any partner airlines.
label: neutral

text:
Overall impressive experience Excellent flight, on time with reliable service. Friendly staff. Efficient check-in. What distinguishes this connection from other flight from Zurich to Perth is the ease with which one changes planes in Changi airpot in Singpoare. No long lines security lines, no annoying passport controls: simply a short security lines in front of the gate. And the transfer is not in the middle of the night but at some reasonable hour. The terminals are very nicely designed and off a relaxing environment. 

I have flown many times from Zurich to Singapore using Singapore airlines, and then further to places in Australia and South East Asia. Only once I had a major problem (super late flight that required staying at the airport hotel for half the night), and I was impressed that the customer service replied to my emails in time, and offered a compensation that seemed fair. Compliments for such a great customer service!
label: positive

text:
So terribly disappointed! A long haul flight Melbourne - Singapore -Rome in premium economy with pretty much no service!  We hadn’t pre booked meals and got left over economy food poorly presented!  Had to ask for a glass of poor quality wine and no seconds offered!  Flight home, Frankfurt-Singapore-Melbourne just as bad!  After take off from Singapore the lights weren’t not even turned on!  They wanted us to just go to sleep!  That flight we buzzed and asked for a drink and snacks, as did most of the cabin!    Breakfast the only meal served 5 hours into flight!

Bathroom was shared with economy and quite a long walk back!  No amenities kit or pre flight glass of bubbles either!
label: negative

text: Singapore A In my recent travels to Asia I've found Singapore Airlines to be the best.Their very friendly welcome greeting lasts the entire trip.Given a warm towel to freshen up was a nice touch.
label: positive

text: First time flyer For a first time flyer I was terrified but wow what an amazing experience. I literally loved every moment of my flight there and back and my thoughts on being on a plane has changed forever! Comfy, friendly. Just amazing!
label: positive

text: Makes long haul travel with children much easier! We travelled with our three children from Melbourne to London with a (very) brief stopover in Singapore. The flights were extremely comfortable, on time, and we enjoyed excellent customer service from the fabulous SQ staff.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines Flew from LHR to Singapore, it was a 13 hour night flight.
I was seated behind a rather huge gentleman.
The seat he was in was faulty, meaning, when he put his seat back, every time he moves, the seat moves.
It also meant I was unable to use the screen. He moved a lot. Not able to watch anything for entire flight.

Babies were crying the entire flight, I could hear them through my noise cancelling headphones. I know you cannot stop a baby from crying but would it not be lovely if airlines can make a soundproof compartment and put family with babies in there.

I complained about the seat to a crew, they managed to find me a seat but it was a between 2 persons compared to my aisle. I did not accept the change. It would be changing a problem to another problem.

Food was good, snacks were available. They have taken away the amenities pack unless you ask for it.

Toilets were quite clean, but, there was a stench of urine even though the floor was dry.
I believe it’s from nooks and cranny not throughly cleaned.
That really could be improved.
The toilet door will not shut properly, meaning after a person has left the toilet, unless you physically close it, the toilet door always remain ajar.
I was seated very near the toilet, the light and smells were not good news.

This is not the first time I have flown on Singapore airlines, however, I could say it is one of the not so nice ones.
I would have given it less stars had the crew not been attentive and friendly.
label: neutral

text: Good premium economy This was our first experience with Singapore premium economy and it was quite good but still not as good as that with Air New Zealand. The food was good, the seats comfortable and the quality of the wine was good. What lets them down is the personal service. It's good but Air New Zealand seems much more personal and genually friendly.
label: positive

text: one of my fav airlines i flew to singapore on my last trip with Singapore Airlines because of flight promotion. The SQ services is great. The schedule is on time too. in flight meal was great too
label: positive

text: cutting cost - ground crew below average I might be wrong but after observing the attitude of the cabin crew over couple of flights, I feel that the cabin crew feels too good to be humble to passengers from certain country and possibly speak the language even if most of them are the native speaker in that language.  , ground crew at Singapore airline is equal to the low fare airline. The food is very good but one can tell that Singapore airline is cutting cost. Less flight attendants on flights, water ? well this is the first airline I see that does not have bottled water but serves you water out of the water tank on the plane. The quality of the water or at least the taste of it is not very good. Are you a gold member from star alliance ? you will get treated equally with other airlines with the exception of Singapore airline, clear differentiation between treating their own members first, including boarding, lounge etc. Unfortunately I have two fly with Singapore couple of more times and then I will try to avoid purchasing tickets from Singapore Airline.
label: neutral

text:
