Great Consistent Airline Over the years we've used several airlines to make our regular annual visits to Western Australia but Singapore Airlines, in our view, are head and shoulders above other airlines which we have used. Singapore Airlines have the added bonus of flying out of Manchester, which means we can avoid the hassle of Heathrow.
The staff are welcoming and friendly and the in-flight service is second to none. Just one small negative is the quality and lack of variety of the food, particularly the vegetarian options. That said, we don't expect 'haute cuisine' but SA, as with other airlines, could step up their food quality/variations.
The A350-900 used on this sector is a brilliant aircraft, as is the older 777 used on the shorter sector from Perth up to Singapore.
label: positive

text:
Best of Business  Singapore Airways are fantastic the service in discrete and extremely polite.
The book the cook service is great the food, and there plenty of it, is fresh and tasty.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Amazing service on Singapore airlines, attendants were constantly offering refreshments and snacks between meal time, the seats were comfortable and good entertainment
label: positive

text:
Perhaps not the best on the world, but still very good Flew over to Singapore in economy.  I am tall, and seat space was an issue though the seats could not recline much, which was useful.
Screen was great for entertainment.
Food was good, some of the best for long haul, though for such a long flight only food runs, with no separate drinks. Limited alcohol (no jack daniels). 
Staff were fine…
Needed to go and requests more food and drink if required, and they tried to limit extra drinks 
Perhaps n the past best airline, but Middle Eastern airlines more superior.
label: positive

text: SQ185 SGN to SIN Kudos to the crew Flight was in the new Boeing 787, enough leg room and comfortable seats. Special shout out to the crew for the 22 Oct flight, who had to rush through the food service due to a pause in service due to bad weather (and of course the pilot for looking out for the crew). Patient and professional and with a smile.
label: positive

text: very nice airline The staff were really friendly and attentive, meals were nice my only complaint was the person in front putting their seat back and knocking over my drink, not the staff's fault, ignorant passenger,
label: positive

text:
Checking in Brisbane Very unhelpful desk staff changed our selection of seats made to feel very uncomfortable and embarrassed 
Told flight was full but there were at least 8 rows with 1 person in each row we were assigned seats where a stranger was put in middle of us
Very difficult to get answers from Singapore Airlines and still waiting for $150 vouchers for 2 people which were offered over 7 months ago 
It is the ground crew that are outsourced for check in that are the problem no matter how nice you are to them 
Upon reaching Singapore the staff there were more than accommodating to re seat us
label: negative

text: Great service I have never been disappointed with Singapore airlines. The service is excellent - the cabin crew are attentive and very professional. Nothing is ever too much trouble.
label: positive

text:
Courteous and helpful staff I was travelling with my wife who was on wheel chair assistance. The staff was very helpful and made us comfortable even with our cabin luggage. 
The cabin service was great.
label: positive

text: Hardworking crew the crew didn't disappoint.. regular walkabout in the cabin with drinks, that is so essential for a long flight. there was something wrong with my entertainment system and it was attended to right away. appreciate the great service. putting the amenity kit on demand basis, didn't bother me too much but thought that its more of a basic gesture if its long flight.
label: positive

text: First time using Singapore Airlines It was our first time using  Singapore Airlines we were not disappointed, the staff were extremely efficient
label: positive

text: Best Airline by far Flight from Brisbane to Singapore was great with excellent service from all staff (far exceeds Emirates who we flew with last year). Our flight from Singapore to Bangkok had a hiccup when the aircraft had to be replaced. We were fully informed by staff and each were given a snack pack whilst we waited for the new aircraft. The thing is they were honest and kept us up to date frequently. Well done Singapore Air.
label: positive

text:
5 star service, 5 star Airline. simply excellent. Airbus A380 LHR-SIN was great, very clean, spacious seats in econ and the CC were excellent. Food is a choice of Chicken or Noodles with fish, both were very good, plenty of drinks on offer and a good standard of service. CC very professional. Toothbrushes available in the toilets and earplugs / eyeshades available from CC if you ask.
IFE is brilliant, headphones and cleaning kit given out prior to boarding.

Flight departed on time, landed early. Singapore airport is awesome.

Airbus A350 SIN-MNL again, a new aircraft, very clean and every bit as good as the previous leg. Boarding is ordered, well organised and slick.

Airbus A350 MNL-SIN - As above.

Boeing 777-300  SIN-LHR Very old and sadly tired out 777 on the night flight ex SIN to LHR. Seats were hard and worn, headrest was stiff and uncomfortable and overall it was a very tired plane. IFE was still very good however.
Food was still very good, CC excellent and of a very high standard.
label: positive

text:
Outstanding long haul economy experience. All the accolades you’ve read about Singapore Airlines are true. A knock here and there in economy over 16 hours, but all minor in the over all scheme. 
Looking forward to my next flight on SA.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Business Class Had a great flight … great food ( book the chef)...fantastic seating and very good staff
who bent over backwards to please.. would fly with them anywhere
label: positive

text: Nice seats Usually fly from/to Seoul via Asiana. Thumbs up to the seats and in-flight entertainment. Good service from the ladies. Whereas the service from the male cabin crew could be better. Overall, Asiana service seems to be better.
label: positive

text:
Terrible customer service / no response Purchased business class LAX- Singaore - they canceled flight 5 months in advance- rebooked us with a 27 hour layover.   To get on a flight on the correct dates they put us in coach- without offering a refund for downgrade of service.

finally 6 months later- after over 30 hours on hold received a whopping $352 credit-  

This review is based on their lack of response and basically stating at the gate I was lucky to be going to the maldives at all.  Our friend who we booked with had to fly in a day early after being dropped by airline completely....so maybe we were lucky.
label: negative

text:
Review of Singapore Airlines The flight to & from Adelaide to Singapore was most uncomfortable,  the seating was uncomfortable,  with very little room. The flight to & from Singapore to Heath Row was a little better. The food was very poor quality. We will never fly Singapore Airlines again, & wouldn't recommend anyone else to do so. There appears to be to many seat's crammed into the economy class compartments.  
The only positive thing I can say, is that the cabin crew's were excellent.
label: negative

text: Singapore airline suite  It’s an amazing experiences during this trip.  The staff were really helpful and provide good services except they were changed our seat without informing us.
label: positive

text:
Service is excellent, food was terrible What can I say?  It was amazing even if we're sitting in economy class.  Very accommodating especially with my son who has special needs. 
 However, if you booked your flight to a travel agent, Singapore Airlines-MNL, is useless.  They do not want to touch our booking.  I want our seat to be upgraded and they can not do anything.  Also, they have the worst food.
label: positive

text: thanks to singapore airlines for very good service. Very good service & organise arrangement.good food quality and service my first time journey my first time experience is very well .
label: positive

text:
Best in its class If you think of premium class airline, Singapore Airlines is probably the best for your destination. Here some pros & cons of it:

Pros:
Ground: You may expect very good cooperation from ground staffs. I sincerely regret to disclose this but I really thank to ground staff to allow my excess weight with smile.

On board: You will start with smile and right after sitting a hot towel to refresh yourself. Food are delicious. Good number of movies, serials, documentaries, games and so on. Shaving kit, comb, sanitary napkin and other necessary items available at lavatory. You may get them if you need. Overall, you won't get boar so far.

For kid: If you have a little angel with you, it means you are in first row. They welcome the angel with gift box, special meal (if takes weaning food) and a bassinet for baby's comfort. 

Cons: Nothing remarkable. But it is expensive. Although service worth it, yet expect Singapore Airlines authority will consider this.

My experience: It was our honeymoon trip so far. They somehow noticed and surprised us with gift, drinks and food!!! However, it is highly recommended.
label: positive

text: Classy Airline Booked a trip to Australia via an online travel agent and was pleased to find that the airline was Singapore after reading reviews and we werent disappointed. There were 4 of us travelling and I had booked extra legroom seats for 2 of our party as the were 6ft and 6ft 4. We are also tall but were quite comfortable in our regular seats. From the moments we got on board the lovely hostesses in their beautiful "uniforms" made us feel welcome. Nothing was too much trouble and they came around with water and snacks all through the night without disturbing anyone. Meals were served with menus and proper cutlery although the food was average. All there flights boarded (3) on time without delay
label: positive

text: Worst website ever.  Bad business practice of bumping ticketed passengers to less desirable flight routing. Ticketed on direct SFO to Sin for almost 9 months.  Then they changed me to a SFO - HKG - SIN that leaves on the next morning simply because they can sell my ticket to another for higher price.  They must be investigated and fined for this bad business practice.  Unreliable, undependable, crooked. That is Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text:
Excellent Flight Company We booked flight 4 months before need date.
Order process was very easy and included meals order.
Flight was comfortable and all departure process was easy.
Stuff were excellent.
Most recommended flight company.
label: positive

text: (Almost) Always a Great Experience Flew a direct flight from Osaka to Singapore leaving late at night and arriving before dawn. The airline is highly service oriented and operations are almost always smooth and easy. The check-in scanner had trouble reading my passport but there was someone to help. Boarding was well-organized and disciplined, there was plenty of on-board staff and they quickly went to dim lighting shortly after takeoff. The flight arrived a little early and baggage was delivered quickly. Happy to fly them.
label: positive

text:
Safety issues on SIA flight from Shanghai to Spore-01Sept 2018 On 01 Sept 2018 boarded SQ Flt from Pudong, Shanghai to Spore. Flight was almost full of passengers including from South Asia and many from China.
The south Asian couple with baby opened overhead compartment to retrieve their item during flight and didn’t bother to close it. Other passenger have to do it as flight steward was not observant.
During landing a PRC passenger stood up to peek at granddaughter seated forward at next row. Steward seated 2 rows in front signaled him to sit, which he did but didn’t bother to wear safety belt!! The Steward presumably from PRC appears tired and couldn’t care less.
Shocking that safety standard in SQ planes had dropped and worsened by PRC and South Indian passengers, who blatantly switched on HP when plane was descending.. why can’t SQ install HP jamming if this was considered a serious safety issue. SQ cabin staff standard dropped and coupled with reckless unsafe passengers, makes flying unsafe.
label: negative

text: Worst experience ever I been trying to book online for days now and I keep getting an error message so i decided to call and book it over the phone. Due to the language barrier I can bearly understand what the customer service rep is saying. Long story short on the website my premium tickets are 2500.00 after we book everything I get a pending charge for 20k. I call back and they tell me I agreed to the charge. How can I agree to pay 20k for tickets online priced at 2500 that's makes no sense at all. Then they tell me they have to investigate, log online and type in my itinerary and you'll see the price is not 20k, what's to investigate???  Excused the grammatical errors I'm still mad at this whole situation. 20K for premium economy seat ticket? Not business, not first class but economy? The rep couldn't realized she about toncharge someone 20k for economy seats. Smh
label: negative

text: Superb flight Was booked on the Boeing 777-300ER for my biz trip to Canberra and I have to say the flight to and back was more exciting than the destination itself. The service was good and was quickly served a welcome drink and some warm nuts. As I was on a day flight I was constantly stuffed with food (in a good way). The Book a cook service is a must if you are travelling on SQ biz class and I ordered the Chirashi Don and the barramundi on the way back. Was a little disappointed that the raw fish on it wasn’t exactly raw but slightly cooked probably due to freshness issue. The appetiser was pretty good and you get to choose your type of bread and cheese to go with. The wine collections as well as the coffee and tea selections were pretty good as well. The tv screen spans across the back of the seat in front of me and it’s def a very comfortable ride. After 4 hours of non stop eating and movies, I flatten the bed to catch a quick nap. Was def easy to set the bed and it comes with a plush pillow and comforter. I arrived at my destination feeling fresh and will def take the SQ Biz class on my next Long personal trip with my wife.
label: positive

text:
Superb inflight service No doubt , I trust my journey using SQ for the air transpotation. Their services from check in staff till inflight crew are superb. 
Inflight entertainment very good. Food ok. The surprise is a bday cake for my friend on route Sin-Bkk 28 Feb 2019. Thank you SQ. You always be mu favourite airlines.
label: positive

text: Excellent seating in premium economy. Very friendly flight crew. Lots of space and a very smooth flight. Vegetarian food selection not as varied as expected.
label: positive

text: Holiday We have travelled with Singapore Airlines in the past and found the service impeccable. We flew Singapore Airlines to Singapore and then SilkAir from Singapore to Male. These legs of our journey were very good and we couldn’t fault them. The service coming back to Singapore from Male was good even though we were experiencing turbulence, the flight attendants were still able to give us a meal and plenty of drinks. It all unraveled once we boarded in Singapore to come back to Sydney. Our seats were fine it was just the service. We declined the meal and I wasn’t even offered a drink, ever again. When we woke for breakfast by the time they got to us there wasn’t anything eatable left. The people beside us couldn’t even eat theirs. This is so unlike the airline we have flown with before. I was able to get an OJ, thankfully. I will be hesitant to fly with them again the service was terrible.
label: negative

text: Very professionnal team on board! Excellent service, excellent crew, excellent aircraft A380. A peaceful flight in extremely good conditions.
label: positive

text: No Surprise  Well, it may sound I am going towards to free perks. I was travelling to Delhi 4 days. I am returning on the day of my birthday. No surprise from the airlines nor any greeting. Yes, I may sound cheapskate looking for free upgrade but I do hope that the so-called best airlines will impressed me with some surprise. But, sadly nothing was happen.
label: neutral

text:
Very cramped A380 economy I today flew from London to Singapore on the A380.  On this particular Aircraft it was very cramped my knees were up against the seat in front.
Onboard service was good, excellent meals service and complimentary drinks.
Arriving in Singapore I transferred to an older model 777.  Here I had much more legroom than the A380 and it felt less cramped overall.  Again service and meals were excellent.

Pre purchased aisle seats, rather than risk being cramped in the middle.
label: positive

text: Not as nice as I expected & seating issues Even though our travel agent had booked our tickets at the same time, Singapore Airlines was going to seat my husband and I in separate rows. I frantically contacted our travel agent back in New Zealand hoping she could do something but she said it was out of her control.  Singapore Airlines wasn't particularly empathetic to the situation and offered to ask if one passenger could swap their seat so we could sit together.  They weren't willing to ask others (or demand). Thankfully the person said yes. The plane was older than expected.  Service on the plane and the food were rather average.
label: neutral

text:
Completely unprofessional - Unknowledgable staff - DO NOT RECOMMEND Had such a terrible time dealing with people from Singapore Airlines as well as Scoot. Refunded a ticket without letting me know causing me to not be able to fly home on the intended day. No one would take blame or responsibility. 

Do not recommend anyone fly with this airline!
label: negative

text: Singapore are a great airline New planes, new seats, plenty of room and an enjoyable journey made easier by the food and service. Screens bigger and the seats more comfy for a long haul trip.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines do not like Western passengers The ground crew at Singapore airport behaved like riot police, they were snappy, rude and unhelpful.  Once on the plane, the cabin crew asked anyone who wasn't Western if they were vegetarian, western people were ignored.
I asked for a glass of water but never received it, and my plate was not cleared away after my meal.
I thought it might just be the crew on one flight but they were the same on all four flights. The last leg of my journey I sat with two other white women and we were treated appallingly.  In the end we could just look at each other and shrug our shoulders.
I will never travel with Singapore Airlines again, and would advise any other Western travellers not to use them.
label: negative

text:
Beware, you will be spoiled You will be forever disillusioned with all of the American carriers.

Service service service...always with a smile.  The flight was over the top.  We had a very tight connection in Singapore and there was an agent with a golf cart waiting for us.  He communicated with the gate agents on our next flight and they held the gate open within the 10 minute departure time.  He let us know our bags would not not make the flight but there would be someone in Male who would coordinate their delivery to us the next day...all true.  We were also compensated for our bags not making the connection...wow.

Food...amazing.  Wine selection...excellent.  Lounge in Singapore is fantastic (return trip).

My only complaint, and this is pretty minor, I thought the movie selection was very limited for an 18 hour flight.
label: positive

text:
business class is expensive the staff were good
different to flying qantas where the staff look directly down the aisles and avoid eye contact with passengers
the space is roomy, food and service good
but the cost is about $8,500 return
Worth it???
not sure
label: positive

text: Can't fault the Singapore Airlines Service Of course you expect a better service in Business Class, and Singapore Airlines deliver.  Very attentive staff who greet you by name, great food and drink options, and nothing is too much trouble.  My wife's seat table developed a fault (after the meal service) and could not be stowed.  Four staff were involved in getting it fixed over a period of maybe 10 or 15 minutes.  Later in flight there was an invitation to spend some money from the in-flight shopping, to make up for the inconvenience.  This was above and beyond, and was not asked for or expected.  Thank you Singapore Airlines for a great trip.
label: positive

text: One of the World's Best Airlines Each time I fly with Singapore Airlines I find it so pleasurable, the flight attendants are caring and nothing is too much travel.  The planes are also very clean and well maintained.
label: positive

text: best airline i have travelled with easy checkin great food and service so quiet, attendants excellent also  easy access to club facilities
label: positive

text: A bit disappointed The airport lounge in Manchester not solely Singapore Airline.It was cold crowded and the food was terrible.So not a good start.The airline and staff were OK .The food was good ,wine selection very poor American Chardonnay or German Riesling.I needed help to alter the seat to a bed but had to go looking for someone no response from the buzzer.Extertainment was average.I ordered coffee during the flight but it never came.At one point I went to the loo had to make my way past 4 staff and was not acknowledged by any of them. A very disappointing experience for the so called best Airline in the world.
label: neutral

text:
Best flight I’ve been on The staff on the flight are so attentive, decent amount of leg room and great choice of movies. Even though we were on a 9hr flight it flew in.  

You will also never go hungry as they just constantly bring out food and snacks!  I will definitely be flighting with them for my next flight....
label: positive

text:
Dated plane but service was good The plane used was Boeing 777-200. Seats were wide and there were sufficient leg space.  

Service was fast and brisk. Food quality was so-so which is typical of many airlines' food. 

Only 2 negative points - old plane so entertainment system was the 6 inch non-touch screen with remote at the side of the seat. 

A bit noisy from not sure the aircon or engine.
label: positive

text: Not a satisfying experience I was disappointed with SA compared to recent flights with Emirates. The food, particularly out of Singapore was dreadful and overall the service offered by the staff was below the standard expected.
label: neutral

text:
Great Experience The airline is rated as the best in the world and I can see why. Check-in online was easy and at the airport, the staff met us and accompanied us to the counter for baggage drop.

We flew on a Boeing 777-200 for the first flight and an Airbus 330 for the second. If you compare the seat map of Singapore's aircraft to something like Air Canada or Air France, there is one seat less in each row making individual seats roomier than on the same class of aircraft.

The food offered was a choice between Western cuisine and Asian cuisine. The service from the flight attendants was fantastic as they were always patient and kind.
label: positive

text: Great Experience Singapore airline is more expensive but it is reliable, easy to book with great economy service. Flight attendants are extremely attentive and polite. It is SOOOO much better than United Business. Asia airlines, in general, are great and bring back the pleasure of travel we used to have in the USA 10 years ago.
label: positive

text: Singapore no more I have just returned to Adelaide with my elderly mother from Singapore on flight SQ279. It was by far the worst flight I can ever remember. I’ve been regular on this service, for over 30 years and also have travelled around the world, using nearly every airline there is. The food and drink service on this flight was appalling. Every time I had used this service, we were all served dinner shortly after departure so we didn’t have a dinner in Singapore. There was nothing to eat at all for around 4 hours when we were served breakfast, which was totally inedible. I tried both options and the standard was totally appalling. We were not offered any drink receiving only one or two small glasses of water. People on the plane all complained. I personally spoke to the supervisor and he offered me apology and sandwich which consisted of a stale roll with some sort of spread. It was also inedible and not of Singapore Airlines standard. You must offer water to your travellers as we get it taken away from us when we go through customs etc. There’s a real problem within Singapore Airlines on this service which I will never use again. The supervisor was embarrassed and he offered his apology and agreed with my complaint. I asked for a customer feedback form of which I never received. I tried to do feedback on the screen, but because I’m not a member my feedback was invalid. I’m never flying Singapore Airlines and everyone in Adelaide needs to know all about this. They all need to be warned and advised to take their own food and drinking water on this Singapore to Adelaide flight. I’ve now tried to contact Singapore Airlines via numerous means, but they appear to be hiding and not willing to engage with me. Very sad.
label: negative

text:
A very comfortable journey Great staff making a long journey a good and pleasant experience. 

We have flown by a few different airlines and Singapore Airlines is by far the best in our option would not hesitate to recommend them.
label: positive

text: Touch down  Flight SQ633 from Haneda Airport to Singapore Changi Terminal 3 landed on 13 Aug 2230 was not smooth. Once the wheel touches the ground, the plane was swinging left to right. Many passengers are swinging left and right. Many are frightened. Hope to have a better landing the next time.
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline and service. Once again we had a really good, comfortable flight to Phuket via Singapore. A380 Flights left on time and arrived early which gave us ample time to make connection to Phuket. The on board staff and service were excellent and there was always a steward/stewardess nearby to assist with any thing we needed. Due to empty seat in middle rows we were able to stretch out a little more both ways, even though their seats are comfortable and seem to have an extra inch for long legs if needed. We would not hesitate to fly with Singapore/Silk airlines in the future as they seem to be way ahead of other companies that fly to Singapore and Phuket from Australia.
label: positive

text: Non-existent customer service False advertising states that you are able to change the destination of your flight by contacting their office telephonically or by email. It has now been two weeks and despite being on hold for up to 2 hours at times, not once has the phone been answered. No reply to emails. On Instagram they say they have forwarded my concerns to the relevant department. No replies. Our flight date has come and gone and still no reply. We are also due a refund for extra legroom. Might as well write that off. This seem to be their business model. Disgraceful!
label: negative

text: Comfortable Flight Pleasant flight for both of us seated in 46D & 46E. All efficient and friendly at check-in which helped us oldies understand new systems in use. Efficient boarding and on time departure. Well informed during flight. Enjoyed our meal and drinks. Very good selection of movies and music. WIFI available.  All good.
label: positive

text: Airline reveiw How could you fault this top service provided by the cabin crew  on this overnight service to Sydney as l have difficulties walking long distances l was provided with wheelchair assistance throughout the flight l could not fault the 5star service provided on today's flight  all the passengers needs where taken care of with class as Singapore Airlines is famous for l will be traveling again with them they are always good world's no 1airline top marks to all concerned highly recommend traveling on this airline have never been disappointed
label: positive

text: comfortable and enjoyable Good food, no delay, great service with a smile always. Very helpful. Tons of movie and games. Great price.
label: positive

text:
Need to review other airlines Premium Economy.. But in SIA.. There wasn't too much 'premium' in Premium Economy. Little legroom, tight seats with difficult-to-access plugins. Overall felt claustrophobic.
As always ground crew were excellent.
label: neutral

text:
Awesome Airline SQ are my first preference whenever I fly... and I fly a lot, never have any issues and can’t beat the service. I must admit though the A380’s are much more comfortable than the 777’s. 

Keep up the good work 🇦🇺🇦🇺🇦🇺🇦🇺
label: positive

text: There's a reason it keeps getting rated the best airline in the world I flew from Bali all the way to Houston with two very short layovers in Changi and a quick transit in Manchester. The premium Economy seats are large and comfortable. They don't lie flat but I was able to sleep just fine.  The entertainment screens are huge with tons of options. The staff is so kind and attentive. I was able to order a vegan meal that was quite tasty. I always book on Singapore if it's available.
label: positive

text:
7 Hours 45 Minutes Delay at Manila Airport We flew to Singapore with SQ numerous times but yesterday flight of SQ915 (October 10,2018) was the worst experience ever.  Received text message from SQ on Oct 9 advising us that our flight will depart st 7.20 am and will arrive in Singapore at 11 am, we’re all checked in and ready to board at 6 am in Gate 113 at NAIA Tetminal 3, at 8 am we’re advised that our flight will be delayed for 30 minutes. Around 9 am we’re told that the plane has technical problems and will leave at 2 pm instead then the flight attendants were serving our breakfast meal at the same airport gate. There was never any mention or options for us to change our flight to the next one when I asked the ground staff so we’re all waiting. Then lunch was served (picture attached)  and our flight was finally scheduled to leave Manila at 3.05 pm in the meantime at gate 114 the passengers of SQ917 were boarding their plane at 1.50pm and that flight leave on schedule (2.15pm).

At that point no further explanation given from the ground staffs, I received generic email and text message from SQ regarding the flight delay and that they’re sorry for any inconvenience caused. 

We boarded the plane at 3.05pm, got another half an hour delay in the runway until it finally take off, we landed in Singapore at 8pm! Immigration took us less then 2 minutes but our luggage took half an hour, it was the longest day ever to travel and we’re very disappointed at Singapore Airlines lack of service.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines best way to fly Love this airline because of their service always add a personal touch which goes a long way. Comfortable good entertainment but most important the flying crew are very friendly and approachable .
label: positive

text: Amazing experience What a great long haul flight experience with fantastic service. Pleasant check-in service and flawless transfer. One of the best airlines in the world. The staff are so nice and helpful. Comfy seats, great onboard food and entertainment to make the long journey enjoyable. Cannot wait to fly again.
label: positive

text: As expected and delivered, 100% pure quality and pleasure. Great flight, very comfortable and smooth flight. Ample leg room with superb quality service on both legs. The in-flight entertainment is still the best around, super clean plane with exceptionally clean toilets throughout flight. Check in early to enjoy the lounge facilities. On the ground service was also exceptional. Overall deserves the number accolade it gets. Rightfully so.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable flight Food basic but seems to be about standard for economy. Not very imaginative. Drinks okay with the meal. Served water through the night and was available for self service as well.
The in flight entertainment is okay for one flight but as we used Singapore Airlines 4 weeks previously it was the same selection. The new movies weren't that new.
A means of getting from A to B as quickly and as cheaply as possible. Flight on time and no delays.
label: positive

text: Paid top dollar for business class. Horrible. New beds horrific I can't understand why the bean counters are able to make a decision without spending the 8 hours in the seat. So easy to go from best airline to worst. Great service great people but at end of day it's all about the seat. Rubbish. This is how airlines die.
label: negative

text: Since ever the best For over 30 years doing regularly this trip. Tried many airlines but SQ stays the best. Good service, nice staff and perfect entertainment system. Food is ok there can be improvements but who is flying to get perfect food!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines - Super I enjoy flying with Singapore Airlines. The planes are always spotless, food is good, the crew are friendly - nothing is too much trouble. Overall this, one is aware of their outstanding safety record. Singapore Airlines code-shares with Virgin Australia, a good duo.
label: positive

text:
Singapore airlines, Worst airline ever Had the most horrific dealings with Singapore airlines check in manager at Changi airport, firstly my wife is registered as disabled and my wife and i are both in our 60's.
We booked extra legroom seats because of my wife's disability and returned from Singapore to London Heathrow on flight SQ306 on Monday 29th May 2023, we had a really upsetting and stressful experience after we boarded the flight, this was also witnessed by the cabin crew who have submitted a separate report by leading steward Benjamin Khoo.
The problem was caused by the boarding gate manager in Singapore, we boarded at gate 9.
The first issue was that the seats we had booked were 31A and 31C in premium economy were emergency exit seats and we were told that we would have to be moved because of my wife's mobility issues, this was fine and we were allocated seats 32H and 32K, we were taken to the gate (my wife in a wheelchair) and boarded with no issues and got settled into our seats for the long 13 hour flight home.
Obviously the people who were originally in the seats that we moved to were offered the free upgrade for the extra legroom seats we had originally booked, this is where the problems started.
One of the passengers ( a male in his late 20's early 30's  )who was moved was not happy with the free upgrade and there was obviously a lot of discussions taking place which we could witness from where we were seated but did not know the content of, eventually the check in manager entered the plane ( the same man who gave us our new seats ) and after a few minutes of talking to the man in his 20's / 30's came over to where we were now settled and said that the man was not happy with his new upgraded seat and wanted his original seat back, he ordered us to move to seats 33F and 33G which were middle aisle seats, i told the manager that my wife needed to get up and move around to stop her seizing up, but he was not interested and said move or he would have us escorted from the plane, he was extremely rude and arrogant and was not interested in my wife's disability and the pain it then caused her to move again, he was more interested in letting a fit and able young man have his original seat back. this exchange was witnessed by multiple passengers and crew, the lady who was moved with this young man was not happy either and would have been happy to stay in her upgraded extra legroom seat, if this is the quality of management that Singapore airlines wish to employ we will never travel with Singapore airlines  again, this man has single handily destroyed my faith in Singapore airlines.
The stewards on the plane were very sorry for what they had witnessed and truly did all they could to try to make up for what had happened but ultimately this check in manager represents the whole of Singapore airlines and this individual had no concern or care for my wife's disability, my wife was extremely upset and we both felt stressed and anxious by this extremely unpleasant experience and would like to think that some form of action be taken against the manager that caused this issue. 
I emailed Singapore airlines on our return and received a reply which blamed the crew on the plane, i replied telling them the facts again but received no reply, i have tried contacting Singapore airlines a few times and have given them plenty of time to reply but now is the time to tell the world just how Singapore airlines deal with disabled passengers.
Finally, i was promised a refund for the upgraded seats we had paid for but have still not received anything, my next email will be to the AviationADR as Singapore airlines clearly do not care about disabled passengers
label: negative

text: Flight Confirmation Error I booked a flight from Hong Kong bound to Singapore, 3 weeks before the flight date. September 6, 2019 I was at Hong Kong International Airport and as I went to the check in counter of Singapore Airlines, they told me that it was cancelled. It’s quiet bizarre, since 2 days before the flight they sent me an online check in noticed. Their reason was the bank did not authorized the charge, however it is in contrast to what the bank is saying the moment I called them on the date I am at the airport. I checked the booking confirmation on their website again, the status of the flight is still confirmed and the crew wants me to pay it AGAIN. What a horrible experience. pfft!
label: negative

text: Hugely disappointing  After experiencing this journey last year with Emirates the standard had been set! Singapore airlines disappointed! We only had one good leg with them, one average leg and two hugely disappointing legs!!! If you have a choice pay the extra and fly Emirates who actually understand how to look after customers and actually go the little extra mile for the passengers!!!
label: negative

text: Upgrade from Premium to Business? Forget about it Despite having over 100K points, gold status and always choosing premium economy fares, not once have I been able to request an upgrade. Even on flights with business half empty - never happens. You can't bid prior like other airlines, if it's disabled in manage booking you will only get deflected answers from kris flyer support team. So if you're looking to build status with a view to getting the occasional upgrade from premium to business - forget about it. Go with another airline.
label: negative

text: SQ is best! One of the best airlines. Very attentive, very friendly, (and also very good looking) flight attendants. Great aircrafts with spacious seating. Excellent food. Top in class logistics (flights always on time, luggage is transferred quickly, etc).
label: positive

text:
Flying to the Rivers Flying from Sydney to Amsterdam ( 8 hours ) with a stop over in Singapore to break up the flight. The staff as always were friendly and well mannered we had a good flight. Arrived at midnight,  stayed for 18 hours in a hotel in the airport, had a good sleep, had breakfast in the morning and walked around the shops in the airport.

Continued on with flight at midnight to Amsterdam ( 14 hours ) arrived at 7 am in Amsterdam. Singapore Airlines is always a good airline to fly long distances with as thee seats and legroom is great.
label: positive

text: Worth it On time flight, friendly staff both at the airport and in flight, comfortable seating with enough legroom, clean
label: positive

text: 380 on premier to singapore 777-33 ER Dubai to singapore We have always liked Singapore airlines and of the two planes we preferred the 777-300 ER for seating comfort and leg room. On both flights the food, the service and the entertainment was great. We will keep flying by Singapore when available for the routes we choose.
label: positive

text:
Best airline for stressless flight Jakarta Singapur From check in to Boarding and flight a very stressless experience , New York Times and Singapore papers on board, full meal served by excellent and friendly staff, 30 kg luggage 
If the price is in an competive area ( off course not so cheap as low cost carrier, but still ok) SQ is my No.1
label: positive

text: Great airline Singapore airline is a great airline ; can’t fault them at all ; have flown with them before and will continue to do so
label: positive

text: Will definitely fly Air Singapore again The flight  experience was excellent. As we boarded I was helped to place my hand luggage in the overhead locker(a help when you're short!) .We sat for over 14 hours, as a result I often get back ache. However the very comfortable seats resulted in no backache whatsoever! The staff were helpful and courteous. The food was plentiful and we were poured drinks very regularly. There were very good films and programmes on board. I would certainly fly Air Singapore in future.
label: positive

text: excellent very good from checking in to getting off at the other end.  The new planes are really nice however seats are a lot more closer together so a lot less leg room.  Had an emergency exit seat on one leg of the flight and it was so good did not feel cramped at all.  Would recommend these seats even if it was an extra charge.  Food was really nice and service could not fault.  Movie choice was excellent .  I do always choose virgin as first choice and what with singapore being a partner this is so good for us when travelling.
label: positive

text:
Broken promises to their customers I was looking to earn 1,800 elite miles to qualify for Silver status (status doesn't mean that much to me, but it gets you further up the waitlist when redeeming miles for flights, which I do care about). I contacted their customer reps prior to booking on a partner flight since I don't live in Asia and was told I would earn elite miles on this partner airline. After I flew, I saw regular miles accrue, but nothing credited to my elite miles balance. I contacted their customer service, who told me they would fix this but it would take 2 weeks. I contacted them after those 2 weeks and was told they would address it, but they would need at least 4 weeks. It's been about a month so I followed up and am now being told I won't be able to get those miles credited. 

I'm so incredibly angry about the fact that I booked a flight to earn this nominal amount of miles--and had confirmed I'd earn elite miles with them--only to be told I was given misinformation by them THREE times--and that they won't resolve this for me. I've flown with them quite a lot this past year and have an insane amount of frequent flier miles with them and am shocked at how poorly they're handling this.
label: negative

text: A Great Way to Fly Everything from lounges to air Steward and stewardess on the plane are faultless . Service are tip top. Extremely helpful and polite. Indeed a Great way to fly.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic Customer Service We flew from Melbourne to Singapore with 4 young children and the flight attendants were all amazing. They went out of their way to ensure we were comfortable and one gentleman by the name of Xavier, went above and beyond. Our son’s name is also Xavier and he came and spoke to him and gave him a little teddy bear and was absolutely lovely.
Wouldn’t hesitate to fly with Singapore Airlines again, even if they are dearer as their service is amazing.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Singapore Airlines has always provided excellent service whether you fly economy, premium economy or a higher category.  The quality and service of food is much higher quality than North American airlines.  The TV screen definitely more high definition.  Only down side is that the seating configuration of aircraft has reduced space for economy passengers.  For short hops no problem.  Unfortunately, the airline does charge you for seat selection.
label: positive

text:
Excellent Airline, Great Cabin Crew I can understand why Singapore airlines is always ranked in top 10 airlines every year.
Food on the flight was good. 

Great selection of food in the lounge, particularly at Changi Airport.  Flight crew were professional and attentive.  I slept pretty much most of the flight from LHR > SIN, and enjoyed the flight from Singapore to Sydney.  Business class seats were roomy and comfortable.

Tip: If you’re considering premium economy, i would recommend just sticking to economy and selecting seats at the front with extra leg room.  I’ve done this in the past and it’s just as comfortable as flying PE.

We flew premium economy from SIN to Amsterdam, and we felt the price difference we paid was not worth it - You do get an upgrade on the food selection, plus a tiny bit of extra leg room but it’s not really that more comfortable as an economy seat. If you really wish to be comfortable then spend the money on Business Class seats so you can really sleep in comfort + lounge access + priority check in.
label: positive

text:
Premium Econy on Singapore Airlines no where near as good as Qantas Premium Econ on this airline means more comfortable seats.  Nothing more.  Our experience on Qantas last year to Dallas was much better.  We were welcomed with a drink in a glass
Addressed by name.  Given Linen on our tables, glasses of fine wine etc.  Singapore Airlines treated us like Economy but with better seats.  Flew back to Sydney Economy one having paid extra for exit row.  Just as comfortable.  PE was a waste of money on this Airline.  Qantas heaps better.
label: neutral

text:
Not the very best Expected more, the flight itself was excellent, but the food was really bad. Tastless and watery. Sorry. On the way to Singapore it was good, but coming back was bad.
The entertainment has not much new films.
label: neutral

text: Great flight The food for coeliacs on board this flight was stunning. Both my son and wife are coeliacs as pointed out before in past reviews. However any long distance flights taken usually result in them having to take food onboard. This time it definitely was not necessary! Full marks for the quality and standard of the food available for them. Definitely use them again. Even if you aren't a coeliac , it was a great flight and my meals were also lovely!
label: positive

text:
Hate long Haul Cattle Class Flight From the moment we took off the person in front of me put down their seat.The plane was full.I had minimal room.I am not a big person.I had to ask the stewards to have this person put there seat upright for food service.Water was served often is plastic cups.
After food the shutters were shut and I sat miserabley for 12 hours.My body ached,I tried to go to the toilets, mostly to just to stretch,but had to inconvenience a complete stranger to do so.A totally miserable experience.
label: neutral

text: Excellent in-flight  service. Flew to Ho Chi Minh City with my wife for a week's holiday with few days stopover in Singapore and Kuala Lumpur. As always, the in-flight service in Singapore Airlines is top-notch.  The flight attendants are always friendly and polite.
label: positive

text:
good staff but food menu was not good no need to discuss of course it us good airline company.
This time i was disappointed with Singapore airlines food menu. Cabin personal was quite helpfull .. During this long flight they have also many snack offerings like chocolate, cookies and icecream if you like them. Only healthy snack was 🍏...Food menu which we had was quite low quality and many passangers were agree with me as well. 
Except foods, they have plenty of movies in their entertainment system which you can enjoy during your long flight
label: positive

text: Quality as usual As good as it gets for economy always a good experience with Singapore Airlines. All the basic were excellent service ,food, boarding,check in and baggage collection.
label: positive

text:
Highly recommended! Non-stop PDX to SIN on the Airbus A350-900. Greater than average legroom even in economy. 
Great flight. Great entertainment options. Professional, young, friendly attendants. Wish I'd found Singapore Air years ago. 
Flight attendants were constantly serving water and beverages, probably twice as many trips down the aisles as other airlines. Staff is well trained and take pride in their work. 
Nearly 18 hours in the air is a challenge for anyone, but the attendants seemed to take it in stride. 
I missed the last leg of my trip. My fault entirely: I misread the departure board. Sleep deprivation, and for me, Changa was an unfamiliar airport.  But the agent at the transfer station helped me out by giving me my options, and for an extra $100 changed my ticket to the same flight, next day. It was seamless. He arranged for my checked bags to be there on the carrousel at my destination on the next day's flight. Such a relief. 
A hint: For connecting flights at Changa, read the departure board carefully. The screen scrolls through fast. The flight I should have been on announced a change to a gate and then disappeared from the screen. The flight I inadvertently waited for was a different airline but just one digit off from the flight I should have been on. 
Singapore Airlines is definitely my new airline of choice.
label: positive

text:
The worst experience ever I am yet to fly with Singapore Airlines as my tickets are booked for October but I can honestly say this is the worst booking experience we have ever had. We booked through an authorised agent and the booking including an infant in seat. 

We checked all the requirements on Singapore Airlines website and purchased a car sear which fit all their criteria. This was particularly expensive  as the seat needed to be CAA certified. We were then notified by SA that we couldn't have the infant with seat even though we had paid for it and even though we had followed their own guidelines. They advised that the infant had to be over 6 months which it doesn't state on any of their literature. 

SA took weeks looking into this issue during which time my tickets were voided incorrectly causing issues with my credit card. I called 11 times to the helpline when managers promised to call back but failed to do so. 

The whole process has been a nightmare and other than offering hollow apologies Singapore Airlines have been incredibly unhelpful. I would never book with them again and would warn anyone else used to Emirates or Etihad to steer clear.
label: negative

text:
Great Counter & In Flight Staff, Miserable Admin Processes While I cannot fault the counter check-in staff and in-flight crew, my grouse lies with the back room/admin department of this airline.

I made a cancellation of a hotel booked on their web site that was part of their Singapore Stop Over vacation booked in conjunction with my air ticket and am still awaiting a refund almost two months from the cancellation, despite repeated follow ups on their web site through chats with their agents.

I got an e-mail from them today stating that I was not entitled to any refund owing to a "no show", even though they acknowledged the cancellation and I verified it by going back to manage my booking on the airline's web site, where the hotel arrangement did not show any more.

Truly awful service and way, way below what one experiences upon checking in and in the air.
label: negative

text: Outstanding service and efficiency I have flown long-haul several times with Singapore Airlines  and rate them very highly. The cabin stewards and stewardesses are charming, helpful and efficient. The food and drinks are excellent and plentiful, and the toilet facilities on board are kept very clean. The aeroplanes have more leg room than many I have travelled in and the in-flight entertainment is superb. Overall an excellent choice at a competitive price.
label: positive

text: Always on time In my experience Singapore Airlines always leave within minutes of scheduled times and arrive the same. The staff are always friendly and helpful and make the flight a pleasant experience.
label: positive

text:
Great airlines, delicious food and good service. Great airlines, delicious food and good service. 
Some of the staff were more friendly, some less, but overall, no problem at all. 
Excellent service !
Hope to fly again.
label: positive

text: Yeah Singapore Airlines! I had a great experience on this airline from check in to boarding service meals to disembarking. We got help with luggage hot towels to clean hands and a tasty meal. My one tip would be to fly at least premium economy!
label: positive

text: Once again a very enjoyable flight Singapore airline is such a great flight we try and fly every time. For a stop to connect the airport is very comfortable and an interesting place. Always plenty of information desks to help you on your way. Shopping is a dream.
label: positive

text: A Good Airlines very courteous staff . though the flight was late by an hour the crew made up with the service . The plane was a new one and spacious .. the food served was very good .
label: positive

text: Great to travel with Very welcoming, friendly and helpful staff. Food was fine  and plenty of it really, and a roll supplied each time as well as dessert. Probably one of the better long haul flights I have done, although in fairness not done too many.
label: positive

text: Truly 5 stars!!!! A perfect, truly 5-star flight. From the moment I entered the aircraft, the cabin crew, in this case Leading Stewardess Oy Mei Yen and Leading Steward Steven Goh, were utmost professional and welcoming. Although they were extremely efficient, what most impressed me about them was their genuine commitment to look after passengers from the heart. I strongly recommend Singapore Airlines and its amazing crews!
label: positive

text:
Best flight ever My friend and i were traveling to Singapore, but were booked on separate flights connecting to Indonesia. Aesha at DXB airport helped us out, such a lovely woman.

Onboard: the staff is very friendly and helpful. Even had a chat with one of the air hostesses. However, they could improve on their on-board entertainment. My favorite part: Ice-cream for dessert. :)

The flight from Singapore to Indonesia was not so bad, their breakfast however was horrible. I don't know what eggs those were but they were nasty. I was very disappointed because i love eggs. So basically, i didn't eat
label: positive

text: Excellent service Recent trip to Singapore we were spoilt with plenty of smiles and both the guys and girls were so friendly and helpful. Very comfortable seats with good size screen to watch movies considering we were in economy. Plenty of leg room. The food was really nice and overall a comfortable airlines to fly with
label: positive

text: Comfortable long haul flight with Singapore airline Singapore Airlines has a reputation for excellent service and they lived up to that reputation. Nothing was too much trouble for the crew and they kept us comfortable all the way. From snacks in the middle of the long flight to keeping the toilets clean all was good.
label: positive

text:
my 1st time flight with 5stars airlines Check in & boarding was good. but unfortunately you can't choose your seat until 48hours before flight day.
I ask special treatment for my baggage (food and souvenir for my japanese relation). 1 of chips was broke, I am not sure when and how but it still ok.

entertainment absolutely good
I got front seat of Economic class and the leg space soooo spaces. but I don't have leg compartment for keep my bag.

the food is so so, I asked muslim meals
label: positive

text:
Comfortable seats on a lo g flight. Snacks- just ask. Drinks - just ask. Children - things to keep them amused. Last It's a long old flight, especially if you have children. Amusements for kiddies, comfy seats. Food great going out. Not quite so good coming back. Snacks - just ask. Drinks - just ask. Films - the latest. Headphones distributed. Blankets and pillows on seat. Winged seats, plenty of clean toilets, staff lovely.
Not the cheapest airline but worth the extra.
label: positive

text:
Just don’t eat or drink Boarding poorly managed - Ike a mob of sheep being herded down the gate, then trying to separate us into some sort of order.
Water, just purchased, confiscated at security at the gate.  Yet we had real cutlery on board.
Seat comfortable enough.  
In flight entertainment - better off downloading your own choices before flying.
Food - dire, bland, over cooked.
Wine - still only offering red or white - and pretty awful at that.  
Reverted to drinking spirits.
label: neutral

text: Newly retrofitted A380 I traveled on SQ856 on the 12 Dec 2018 from Sin to Hkg and had seat 14D.The seating configuration is 1-2-1 and the middle aisles have a partition. i was surprise by the condition of the partition, which had almost "dislocated" at the base. i was afraid that it could fall off the paneling groove. i was a little worried and highlighted this to the stewardess. the flight supervisor came and was helpful and offered me a change of seat. How can the world's best airline treat a customer in this manner, offering a seat with damaged furnishing/parts on a flight?   On the return flight SQ863 (A350 - new plane) of 16 Dec 2018, seated at 14F, i could not even get connected to the wifi on board. the stewardess tried to assist, resetting several times but to no avail. The flight supervisor did not even bothered coming to explained what the problem was. This is contrary to what they had advertised as having the best on board entertainment. i am really disappointed with the service standard of this airline.
label: neutral

text:
Excellent, caring service & delightful food A wonderful flight, with very helpful & attentive cabin staff. Great food, quality papers & magazines like The Economist. 
One concern I have is the narrow entrance space of the overhead locker in the Airbus 380. I was unable to fit my backpack through it.  It needs to be at least 10 to 12 inches (25-30cm) wide.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing after expectations We had been looking forward with much anticipation to flying with Singapore as we usually fly Qantas which has had so many bad raps lately. We flew to Bangkok with Qantas and back via Singapore from Singapore. However in our economy flying  experience, Qantas wins hands down for food and service.  
The food was to put it mildly abysmal. Breakfast consisted of a small sweet muffin, a dry bun with a pat of butter and jam and a pot of yogurt - not a protein in sight. My lunch was tasteless fish with overcooked broccoli and peas if some sort of sauce.  We have had better food offered on an hours flight with Bangkok Air.
Unlike Qantas there was no offer of a pre-meal drink and nibble and in fact very little choice - red or white wine and no spirits. 
On the plus side, the entertainment was good and the steward were very polite and willing and the toilets kept clean  and regularly sanitised.
label: neutral

text:
Disappointing  Looking out of the terminal at the aeroplane on the apron, the Airbus A350-900 looks pretty cool with the ends of its wings turned up.
Inside the plane was clean and new with a spacious feel to it.  3x3 seat configuration with ample overhead storage. 

The mid cabin toilets were large and un-cramped and the in-seat entertainment system has a large flat touch screen and mains power socket.

Everything looked good for an enjoyable flight ... then I sat down!

The legroom was ample for me as a short fella (5’7”) but the seat itself was less than comfortable.  The seat base was well padded, but the back and lumber support were such an odd shape/angle that sitting comfortably in any position other than laying the seat back fully was uncomfortable and verged on causing pain in very little time.

I spent the whole flight adjusting my position to try to ease my discomfort.  This experience was reminiscent of, but not quite as bad as the Cathay Pacific economy seat fiasco of circa 10 years ago.  Not Good at all and frankly disappointing.

The service was Singapore Airlines normal exemplary standard and the food was as expected for any international flight.
label: neutral

text: Fantastic all around! I flew from Heathrow to Melbourne via Singapore and was extremely impressed with everything! The ground staff, crew, food quality, seat and priority baggage were all excellent. I would highly recommend travelling Premium Economy as the extra space, food options and smaller cabin are all great. The noise cancelling headphones were a great benefit too. The staff couldn’t do enough for you and always with a smile. I’m looking forward to my next flight already!
label: positive

text: Great service and food  I travelled on Singapore Airlines on 15th January 2019 from Singapore to London Heathrow on SQ318. The service on the airline was great  meals were good, service was great. The staff were friendly and professional as always. My cabin crew attendant was friendly and professional at all times. She had no issues with any of queries or request for food and drinks.  She was also happy to have a photo taken with me too. I would recommend this airline company to everyone.
label: positive

text:
Fair flights I had four flights on this trip, Heathrow to Singapore, with a couple of days stopover, before going onto Melbourne and returning the same way. The first flight was fine but the flight to Melbourne the plane looked old and tired, some seat covers were tatty and worn and a first for Singapore Airlines the food was poor. On all the flights they had trouble with at least one toilet putting them out of use i.e.sink would not drain and others with no toilet paper.
To be fair I've done this trip several times before and found Singapore Airlines to 5* all the way, hopefully they'll get back up there.
label: neutral

text: Downgrade service of the airline after Covid situation My route is flying back to the US using SQ from Bali, and transit in Frankfurt. Bali to Singapore operated with their low cost airline, scoot. Very basic service like the other low cost airline, so I cannot command much. Singapore to Frankfurt, 12 hours flight: terrible Meals, no snack in between this long hours flight, no in flight meal purchase option despite their terrible meal option. So basically you stuck with their horrible meal and other amenities. Cold bread, no salad or fruit, and very poor meal selection. No game in flight as you need your own device, poor selection of movie. The only thing they offer I observe during my total 20++ hours flight back to the states is WATER. Frankfurt to NY, 8 hours flight, another horrible experience. Same movie selections from the previous flight (Singapore to Frankfurt), the meals option is even worse as the flight attendants refer this as not a long flight despite it is 8 hours flight with no other option of their poor meals and limited entertainment. 1st meal is maincourse, second one is a very basic pork/vegetarian sandwich. The flight attendant mention "we don't have in flight purchase meal or snack for passengers, whatever we have we will give it to you." However, they do not have anything to offer to you. Comparing to my experience with SQ before the covid situation, flying with them in the same economy class, they used to give you warm towels after you boarding to the airplane, and before each meal, warm bread, fruit or salads in every meals, ice cream in between of the flight hours or different variety of snacks, eye masks, which I refer it as a great memorable experience with them. With my recent flight with them, I don't have any good thing to remember during my flight from Bali to NY beside a boring long hours flight. Based on my recent experience with SQ, I don't think this airline deserves a 5 star airline rating if I compare it with another 5 star airline like Emirates or Qatar, flying in the same economy class. For me SQ nowadays is like a budget low cost airline which claim to be a 5 star. For the price that slightly cheaper than Emirates, I don't think is worth it to fly with SQ and I will definitely not recommend this airline for a long hour flight to anyone.
label: negative

text: Give this airline a miss. A combination of delayed flights and lost baggage for all 4 travellers in our party made this an experience to forget. Waited at the carousel for almost an hour but no sign of luggage. Went to the baggage service desk to be told they already knew our bags were still in Singapore. Why didn't they save us the time and call us on the tannoy??? Customer service person then told us the bags would be arriving that evening and would be couriered to us asap. After 3 days of emails, phone calls and text messages to Singapore Airlines we finally received our luggage. My brand-new hard-shell suitcase had the lock broken off and was also damaged and squashed. I subsequently submitted a complaint to Singapore Air but was told basically to bugger off. Absolutely shocking customer service.
label: negative

text: Incredible Service and Tasty Meals If you are traveling for leisure internationally, Singapore is a great option.  Not only were we able to score some pretty cheap airfare, the service was amazing.  The service began at the check-in, where the employees were very respectful and helpful.  Once the flight began, they offered hot refreshing towels.  During the flight the team members were very receptive to customer requests and they served 2 meals, one right after take-off and one before landing.  Free beer and free wine as well.
label: positive

text:
The way to travel. We mostly fly with Singapore Airlines as we feel they are one of the best.  We booked Premium Economy for extra space. When we booked there was a special offer where we were able to "Book the Cook".  This meant we had first class food and was served first.

Haven't flown for three years and must say that Singapore Airlines have updated their entertainment system with so much more ....films, music and games.

The stewardesses/stewards are always obliging in making your flight as comfortable as possible.  I would definitely recommend flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Poor transfer service at the Changi International Airport We flew from Bangkok on premium economy and the flight was delayed by two hours. So we missed our connection flight in Singapore to Melbourne. Transfer desk at Changi was not helpful. Computer system was down. Had to spend nearly seven hours from midnight at the airport. No offer of lounge access nor accommodation. No meal provided. No seat upgrade as compensation too. What a scam!!
label: negative

text: excellent Flight was excellent, the flight crew were fantastic, the seats on the upper deck were comfortable, service was impecable, there are a lot of airlines that would benefit from taking a leaf out of Singapore airlines method of operation
label: positive

text:
A Good Airline to fly My Flight to Brunei onboard SQ 182 on 21/09/2018 at 8.40am, was a very satisfying trip, with the cabin crew doing a great job for the passengers on this flight.

The Chief Stewardess did an excellent service during this flight. When I asked for some extra packet of nuts and croissants for breakfast, she readily gave me more than i expected, with a smile on her face. 

Overall, it was a great way to start the day and a great way to fly SIA.
label: positive

text: They make the travelling a lovely part of your holiday We have flown Singapore airline before & this time also booked a flit to Chiang Mai on Silk Air too. Both airlines are great. The food is excellent. The staff professional & well groomed. An excellent airline I am happy to highly reccomend.
label: positive

text: Good airline but extortionate fees and fare difference to change flight I have flown Singapore Airlines (economy) to and from Australia and the UK or Europe on a number of occasions. The airline is invariably good, with attentive flight attendants, edible food (even in economy) and sufficient inflight entertainment for long haul flights. This time, on the outward flight the cabin was very cold however.  I wanted to bring my return flight forward by 7 days and when I contacted Singapore Airlines about doing so I was advised that it would cost in excess of an additional £800 for the same flights at the same times of day but just one week earlier than those originally booked. The most that I was able to have this extortionate fee and fare difference reduced to was £475. As a result I elected not to bring my return flight forward and also as a result I will now be looking for an alternative airline for all of my future Australia to Europe flights. I am a Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer member, but this made no difference at all to the airline. Overcharging for a flight change is a very good way to lose loyal customers.
label: negative

text:
Great flight great service SQ916 on 22nd Nov 2018

Smooth flight and service was Great! 

I was seated 18H and the crews serving us were great - attentive and always service with a smile. Sorry I couldn’t get their names. Both Chinese. He was always checking on my warm water and ready to top up. She was always checking on us whether we needed anything.
label: positive

text: Always same food without vegetarian option I do not find the business class service as good as I was expected. As a vegetarian, each time we are offered to start with satay meat and if duly requested for vegetarian option, then some other not good vegetarian meal (I am always said that I should ask in advance). in 2020, they should offer per default a vegetarian option. During the night, we can stay hours without service.
label: neutral

text: Great flight & service Always a pleasure flying with this airline. The staff a great & always willing to help with customers wishes.
label: positive

text: i cannot believe the service provided first I cannot pre assign my seat till online check in, so 48 hours before , I log in my booking and try to get a window or aisle seat but only had middle seat left to pick.  so I had to paid extra for the return flight to avoid middle seat again.  on the day of travel, I run to airport to catch my flight, so I don't have my lunch, so very expected the meal delivery.. since I seated in the middle , I had ready my table and looking forward for my meal, but they can forgot to pass it to me , both next to me had meal, just only me... I cannot believe it.  when my neighbour inform the crew , she even no apology to me. what is the 5 stars they get from ?  I believe only from Business or First class passenger.. I won't take SQ again , which was very bad experience for few times already this year .
label: negative

text: No hassle flight. Both legs were hassle free. The slightly more generous pitch gives enough room to be comfortable and although I can't sleep on planes I did manage to doze. This trip I broke the flight with a night layover in Singapore and a good night s sleep made a world of difference at the other end, suffering merely a body clock issue not being over tired. The cabin staff are always friendly and helpful and the food is ok (you don't expect luxury in economy) which is fine as I am not flying for the food! The film selection was not great but the number of to series has increased so I found enough to watch.
label: positive

text: SMILES ALL THE WAY! Travelled on Singapore Airlines (SIA) for most of the trips, 8 out of 10 times.  Like the cleanliness and warm care received on board by the SIA crew. The in-flight entertainment selection is fantastic!  So many good TV shows and Movies to choose from.  I will not miss even though I am tired and sleepy on a long haul flight to Europe. Food wise..? average as expected on most airlines. The only comment is that SIA should serve coffee or tea at end of our meal, rather together, by then our coffee is cold.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Seats Singapore Airline has always been my number 1 Choice. The reason is because the seats is comfortable and space is wide enough for big size and Long legs people. But I realise the food is not getting very good recently. They should improve on this. They have wide range of entertainment on the tv as well.
label: positive

text: Consistently great but... Singapore cabin staff are consistently awesome. Nothing is a problem, they are quietly attentive and the food is always excellent too. Loved the A380 flights and most of the 777 flights with the exception of the 'old nail' 777 they fly into Wellington via Melbourne. This thing is so old and tired even the staff are embarrassed. You can't even lie completely flat to sleep which is simply not competitive these days.The entertainment is archaic too. Limited choice and the optics are of poor quality. Not what you expect in Business Class today and the sooner Singapore Airlines upgrade their aircraft on this route the better.
label: positive

text:
Satisfactory Right from checking in & then boarding smooth process
Comfortable seating Good service for drinks with lots of options
Food was sumptuous hot 
Good staff particularly Jane Wee
Chai Wei Chin & Jane Tan were polite & caring
Overall very good
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines I found the economy section lacking in leg room and width compared to other long haul economy class. Food good and plenty of drinks. Stewards very kind and friendly
label: positive

text: A bit cramped The flight was relatively uneventful but my wife and I did notice that the legroom was much smaller than any other Singapore flight we've ever been on. It was perhaps an older aircraft they are yet to replace but still...not the most comfortable 7 hours.
label: positive

text:
High class standard  When we travel from Bali via Singapore to Amsterdam, my wife had diarrhea and through out everything. The cabin staff was really helpful and take care fore her. She even get some “alternative medicine”
When we become at home she feel much better. 
I can recommend Singapore to everyone!!
label: positive

text: Still one of the best I flew to Paris via Singapore in November 2019. For the past few years, I’ve done most of my travel with Emirates because they are (usually) significantly cheaper - but you get what you pay for! The staff on my flight were cheerful, helpful and efficient. The in-flight entertainment was good (though any flight that long will stretch even the most up-to-date movie catalogues) and the seat was comfortable. An added bonus is a stopover in Singapore. As far as airports go, Changi remains almost impossible to beat. I’ll definitely fly Singapore again!
label: positive

text: Premium Economy A380 versus A350 While Premium Economy was great on both aircraft we felt that the A380's seating was a bit more roomier. Our only complaint was the food. Very ordinary!
label: positive

text: Excellent Service I use this airline yearly when I fly to Davao, Philippines.  The transfer is smooth and hassle free.  The flight service as well as the food is good.  The entertainment is excellent and the seats are comfortable.  Over all I always have a pleasant journey.
label: positive

text:
Premium Economy is worse than Economy Singapore Airlines are in a sad state - they have been dropping their service quality in front of our eyes over the last 3 years, ever since Lee Kwan Yew died. 
We started using Premium Economy (PE) as soon as they started this class of service between LHR and SIN, flying return three a times a year. We hoped that it would get better with time and mature into a comfortable option, but the reverse happened.
    We'd love to know, which designer is responsible for the distinctly uncomfortable seats: back decline angle, bad lighting, inconvenient foot support, lack of space for storage during the long flight (13-14 hours). On top of poor ergonomics, the whole seat doesn't function properly: opening and folding foot support often requires getting up to operate.
    Since the space is cramped, the super-sensitive control of the screen keeps kicking in against passenger's wish, preventing sleep - this problem does not occur in the Economy class!
   Toilet visit requires going all the way to the back of the economy section. 
   Good food is only served on the way from London to Singapore - the supply on the return is poor. Champagne does not save the day.
   The worst part of the story is that we have already tried twice to get through to SIA with our comments. The response that we received was formal and lacked any substance, and did not have any evidence of trying to understand and improve.
   In the end, we gave up on their PE, and decided that flying Economy was altogether less stressful.
  Basically, PE isn't worth the premium they want the passenger to pay! Too bad ....
label: negative

text: Still the best way to fly, but quality beverage offerings is slipping The inflight service is still something to cheer about. And so is the food - the local fare of bak chor mee (minced pork noodles) is most comforting. But the wine offering is getting more and more pedestrian. Also the removal of malt whiskey (used to be Highland Park) choice from the list of beverage offerings for Business Class in a premium airline such as Singapore Airlines is in word - unbecoming
label: positive

text:
Start your holiday the moment you fly SQ It’s really worth spending the extra bucks flying SQ to Perth.

1) inflight entertainment is impeccable 
We are totally spoilt for choices. The system kept us entertained throughout the flight.
2) spacious cabin and comfortable legroom. 3) service oriented . Staff are friendly and patient. 
4) food and beverages: food wise , SQ used to serve warm buns, but they seemed to have remove this added touch. Perhaps deliberately done to keep pricing competitive. The alcohols are still complimentary, much appreciated.
5) smooth flight, steady take off and landing . 
The only thing that makes my trip less satisfying is the service on the ground.
We were very early at the airport during our return flight in Perth . Even though our flight was 6 hours later (sq 224 ,640am), the auto check in counter was able to check us in , and we printed bag tags and 3 of our boarding passes, except for my daughter. We approached the customer service counter for SQ, telling her we faced difficulty in checking in. Without even first hearing us out,  the staff directed us to the bag drop queue. Apparently the ground staff are handling an earlier flight sq216. We told the staff that we are not able to print our daughter’s boarding pass, But again the bag drop counter staff did not check with us. 
She went ahead to tag our luggage’s and sent 2 of our luggages to the plane through the conveyor belt. Upon tagging the 3rd luggage she finally realized we were supposed to be on the next plane. 
She apologized and told us to wait for the luggage team help us retrieve the luggages. The customer service staff also came to us to apologize.
I personally feel that there’s a lack of customer care. These 2 staff’ mechanical treatment of our situation shows that they are more concerned with getting things done quickly than serving the customers. Both staff failed to understand our situation
