The wrong tagging could easily been avoided had either of them bothered to hear our situation.
Whilst SQ excel in providing great service in the air, I think the service standard especially when it comes to customer care during check in plays a critical role in the overall customer satisfaction.
As a Singaporean, I am deeply concerned in this discrepancy in standards 
Hope there could be better training on this aspect 
 I think SQ is still the go to airline.
label: positive

text: First Premium Economy flight. We fly to SE Asia twice a year with Singapore Airlines. This was our first Premium Economy flight and we loved it. The seats were so comfortable and the service was great. We have already booked another trip in Premium Economy for July and would recommend it to anyone thinking of flying Premium Economy.
label: positive

text: Great service Service and food were good. Staff frequently cleaned the laboratory which was great to see especially when you were a long haul flight. I was on the upper level of the aircraft, so the leg space was quite good. The only downside was the entertainment screen was not a touch screen, you had to use the control panel to choose entertainment. Overall, as the airline did not disappoint each time I flew with them.
label: positive

text: Birthday Pleasure Very convenience and great service flight, updated entertainment from movies, music even the updates tv-serial
label: positive

text: Terrible experience Disappointing service, paid for extra legroom seats but they re-allocated them, wouldn't refund. Have made several complaints but no responses, just ignore the customers needs, have vowed never to fly with them again
label: negative

text: Great Service Airlines Singapoe airlines is always one of the best airlines in the world. It's inflight entertaintment is excellent and unbeatable. The cabin crew is also very care to the passenger's request.
label: positive

text: helpful and friendly services Singapore Airline is Moslem friendly. I requested for Moslem meals when I checked in on website. The food was delicious, the services were great, the toilet was clean and the entertainment flight was great. It's always updated with new movies and musics. Thank you Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Always good service, but be aware changing inflight menu This time we were flying on economic. Last time business. A world to difference.
But never mind the staff very helpful and smiling!!!
Before we travelled,  I had changed my inflight menu to menu without fish!
It was really a mistake! I was jaloux at my husband's food.
I got dinner as if I was a diabetic and also had allergies to gluten.
I have never eaten so much chips!
I think they have to listen more carefully about food,  if it's only fish you can't have.
So at once on our holiday I have changed to inflight menu. If I get fish, I will give it to my husband. 
This is our 46 travel with this company. And in April 2020 we do it again. 
Our best recommendations.
label: positive

text: Very good Service, exceptional wide seats in Business Class We did fly to Singapore (and from there to Phnom Penh and back from Saigon via Singapore, all in Business Class). Seats in Airbus 380 were very good and extremely wide. Food was excellent, the lounge in Frankfurt and Singapore (waiting for our connecting flight) as well and I could take a nice shower there. We especially liked the "Book the cook" service: Up to one or two days before the flight you can book a dinner our of a very long list.
label: positive

text:
Good Price, Flights On time, Poor booking experience, Not so great food Poor On-Line booking experience. Site kept crashing. Told to book by phone, but bu far more expensive.  Wrote and complained and received a refund.  Shouldn't have be necessary.
Five flights over five weeks all on-time. 
Cabin staff polite.
Not so great food.
label: positive

text: Professionally Efficient As to be expected, the aircraft was clean with all amenities provided for our comfort.  Cabin crew were professional and efficient but I cannot say to be candidly friendly.
label: positive

text:
DEL to SIN on an A380 Check-In : At the dedicated Business Class check-in desk , which was very quick & smooth.

Immigration / Security : Dedicated counters / lanes for First / Business class passengers. Quick clearance as usual.

Lounge : Air India Lounge
Since SQ's own lounge at DEL has shut down , the airline diverts all its premium passengers here.
Very underwhelming. Portions of the lounge were dirty. Horrible F&B options. Expected much more considering the recent privatization of AI.

Boarding : Very streamlined. Dedicated queue / gate / aerobridge for Suites & Business Class passengers. Attentive ground staff & crew made it even better.

Seat / Layout : 
All the Business Class seats ( along with the 6 Suites ) were on the Upper Deck in this newer A380 variant , arranged in 1-2-1 pattern. Plush & comfortable , as long as you don't sleep. The moment you convert it into a lie-flat bed , you'll encounter the infamous angulated coffin-style hole for your legs / feet , which is uncomfortable for even someone as short as me.
The seat control panel on my particular seat was not smooth / a bit erratic . Even the FA Call Button did not work , thus had to rely on the remote control option. This wasn't the case for the other seats occupied by my family members , where things worked perfectly fine.

Service : Extremely professional & quick.

Food : Used 'Book The Cook' service. Herb Crusted Pork Chops were undercooked. The Chilli Basil Prawn was quite good though.
label: positive

text:
Has the food quality dropped? I must say that we had always been happy customers of Singapore Airlines - although my last review was negative due to a very unpleasant check-in experience in Jan 2018. 

This time, it was mostly about the food. Normally, I can’t fault the professionalism of the flight attendants. However, something was awry on this flight. We took off at 8.40 pm Singapore time, but dinner wasn’t served until 11ish pm - that’s 3 hours later. After the meal and tray collection, we managed to have some sleep, only to be woken up at 2ish am as they were serving breakfast.  

The dinner was just ok, but the breakfast was the worst ever - a stale bread roll and a cold muffin. Seemed like a cost-cutting measure to me. Very disappointing in-flight experience.
label: negative

text:
comfortable flight Flight was very comfortable. Good Service.
Good In-flight entertainment
sufficient leg room 
good in-flight service
label: positive

text:
Uncomfortable  Seat was narrow and front row had no windows. The extendable seat was totally useless as it was too low to support my legs.
Service was average and food was pretty ordinary. 
Wine was delivered in a begrudging manner and coffee was served luke warm.
label: neutral

text: Nothing premium about premium economy I booked premium economy as I wanted more leg room and a foot and calf rest. I have a disability and need to be comfortable. Staff were excellent on boarding and I was shown to my seat. Leg room was good and seat seemed comfortable. However there is nothing premium about premium economy. After takeoff we were given a snack, but nothing to drink. I asked if I could have a drink and was advised that drinks would be offered later. Why would I want to eat a snack with nothing to drink. I waited and waited. There was no bottle of water in the seating area which should have been there. After 1 hr and 20 mins finally it looked like drinks were being offered. Juice or water only. Me and my husband were missed out. We thought they would realise so waited patiently. Staff had got to economy when I got up and asked if I could have a drink as we had been missed. After waiting nearly 2hrs we finally got a drink of orange juice. Another round of drinks was offered later again juice/water tea or coffee. After nearly 5 hrs we were again offered juice or water. I asked for wine by that stage as sick of juice. To the staff members credit he got it for me. Dinner was offered with a bottle of water only. Once the trays where cleared about finally the drinks trolley with champagne was offered. My seat did not recline correctly and my TV froze twice. The staff are all lovely but there is nothing premium about premium economy. Not enough staff and very slow service. They clearly do not want to offer more than 1 alcoholic drink on an 8hr flight. The seat eventually reclined with the help of staff and was comfortable. Will never pay the cost for premium economy. As no premium food, service , and dirty toilets. The foot rest is poor and the calf rest only very minimally offers support. Emirates premium economy if far superior.
label: negative

text: Great in flight experience but pooor customer service otherwise. We had a great inflight experience. The cabin crew was attentive and the plane accommodations were comfortable. However my over the phone experiences with this Airline was horrible. Long wait times (over an hour) and there didn't seem to be any urgency to attend to customer service needs.
label: neutral

text: Best customer service from an airline so far I have flown on many airlines over the years and I can say personally that Singapore Airlines definitely provided the best service I have received so far. Friendly, accommodation and even in economy, comfortable. Top marks.
label: positive

text:
Book the Cook - fail I bought Premium Economy flights so I could actually request the food that I would like as I get travel sickness and even the smell of airplane food can make me feel queasy. 
The first meal from Melbourne was meant to be bland and came with full spice, making it hard to eat.
The second meal I had booked was a fruit platter and it never arrived at all. I was served the inflight meal with no choice as to what I wanted. I questioned why I didn't get the booked meal and was told it didn't up load from the computer correctly.
I then asked if the second flight would be correct, which they confirmed yes it would. For the inconvenience I was given a voucher for $75 SGD to spend on the next flight.
On the second flight my first requested meal was a fruit platter and it arrived , I thought great, but as it was now heading for 5:00am Melbourne time I fell asleep and the hostess took the meal away before I could eat it and never brought it back. I woke up about 8 hours into our 14 hour flight and asked for some food, only to be brought a left over roll and packet of nuts. I thought well if my next meal does come it will do. 
I had booked pancakes and scrambled eggs but when they served the meals, nope it didn't come, again I asked about our Book the Cook meal and was again told it didn't upload in the system.
We are now trying to Book our return flight food and the system says it's not working. I find this rather poor as we paid more than double the price for the Premium Economy seats with an extra cost to choose the seats as well.  
Although the seats we chose gave me extra leg room and seat width, I guess I will just accept what ever the inflight meal is and hope I can stomach it.
label: neutral

text:
Crew service thumb up I will get SQ ticket whenever is within my budget. This round we bring our youngest boy to experience long haul flight A350-900 to Brisbane. We board the flight before other passengers so that we can settle both kids in advance. They did not provide any kids toys for kids at this time. Only one Disney luggage tag on the pocket seat. Our boy feeling unwell when in the flight and we seek advice from the service crew. She is very patient to comfort us and get advice from flight captain. Luckily we can off from the flight. 

From Brisbane to Singapore, we choose to take midnight flight. The crew give each of the passengers a pouch of amenities kit which include of toothbrush, toothpaste and a pair of socks. Inflight entertainment not good as compare to last year we did take SQ to Bangkok. Breakfast is taste better than previous flight to Brisbane. 

Keep up the good work!
label: positive

text: Perfect flight Wonderful service and great experience, had no problems treated really well and would highly recommend to others.
label: positive

text: singapore airlines in general very good from ground   staff help to air crew very helpful and polite ,only gripe was 3 out of 4 flights the menu choice was gone by the time we had to pick
label: positive

text:
Excellent Service, but issues with new Entertainment System & new seats My feedback was based on both the above-mentioned flight, and the previous flight SQ328 from Singapore to Munich.

I flew on SQ328 on 19 May 19 and SQ317 on 3 Jun 19.

1. Professional Cabin Crew and Excellent Service.
I would like to commend the cabin crew on both flights, although I was unable to recall any particular names. Especially on SQ317 from LHR to SIN, the cabin crew serving us during the flight when the lights were dimmed have provided excellent service. My wife and I were very grateful that the crew have been very attentive and expedient to our needs, including requests to fill up our water bottle and for cup noodles during the wee hours.

2. Audio on Entertainment System
I was initially very pleased to get to use the new Krisworld systems installed on both flights (A350 for SQ328 and A380 for SQ317). The touchscreens are definitely a better interface than using manual controllers in older systems. I was also delighted that I could enter my Krisflyer number or email address to create a personal profile. However, the quality of the audio in the new Krisworld system in Economy class left much to be desired. On SQ328 when I first encountered the issue with the audio, I had thought it was only a one-off perhaps due to faulty earphones. However, my concerns were verified on SQ317 when I experienced the same problem with the audio even though I was on a different aircraft and using a different set of earphones. The bass volume in the audio feed was too loud relative to the treble volume. This was especially apparent when listening to music in flight, as it resulted in muffled, unclear, and even flat tones when playing lower pitch sounds. The higher pitch sounds were okay. What made it worse was that the bass and treble volumes could not be adjusted in the settings. There was only one volume bar to adjust.

3. Lack of Footrest
I was rather taken aback that the new economy class seats on the A350 and A380 aircraft now had no footrest.
label: positive

text: Overseas Travel The flight was very nice and considering the time on the plane, the attendants made it quite bearable.  The attendants are very professional and nicely dressed in traditional fashion.  The only downside of the entire experience is the airlines website. I had difficulty trying to check in and get seats.  the "manage your booking" tab does not always get you to the correct link.
label: positive

text:
Great food, Best airport, may have new and old airplane Don't hesitate to fly SQ if you have a chance. but i think it's a little bit pricey when you fly SQ. In my experience i got lucky had the good price info from ticket search engine (forgot the name) after few weeks that the normal price is already go up, then i buyed it ASAP from SQ website. 

Entertaiment was good, on board food was great
Make sure you have enough time when having transit 2 hours minimum to 4 hours if you want to enjoy their Changi Airport
Flown new A350, A380 and old B777
label: positive

text: Shocking service They damaged my bag (deliberate, forceful opening of bag) and after many months emailing them, they still haven't paid a cent in damages. Business class was such a rip off - felt like it was marginally better than Economy class.
label: negative

text: Very nice trip Very smooth take off and landing, great cabin crew and food.  They make you very welcome and comfortable and the premium economy is well worth it.
label: positive

text: The only way to fly This the 3rd time we have flown to Brisbane by Singapore airlines & we were very happy. We had one stop in Singapore which has recently been revamped & is looking fab. The staff on both flights were so efficient & kind. They actually look as if they enjoy their work, hope that is so. We paid for extra leg room & that did help a lot. It also helps that we were on the fab A380.
label: positive

text: Enjoyable flight Reasonable food, good selection of in-flight entertainment, good leg room, excellent cabin crew, clean facilities.
label: positive

text:
A380 Singapore Airline (SQ) type A380, famous airline of Singapore Airline, this is a fantastic airline model, amazing interior double decker design, upper level for first class/business class ...
Bigger seat, more leg space, good tv monitor, nice toilet ...
label: positive

text:
More training for your staffs please. Travelled with my family to NZ for our holiday last November. The trip to NZ was fine, its the trip back that made us question if we should ever consider flying Singapore airline again. Recently flying SQ we faced the issue of the meal times were always late. This round the meal time was delayed for more than 1 hour, and when the flight attendant was distributing the snacks, I asked if they can spare one more sandwich for my young child, The attendant had turned me down and said they do not have enough food for everyone. For normal circumstances I can be more understanding, however during the whole flight I witnessed the passengers (a family of 3 - parents and a teenager) seated in front of me had been requesting snacks and drink non-stop. If you are worried that you do not have enough food for all, why ain't your staffs trained to turn down the request from passengers that had been requesting food non-stop? And it was my 1st request for an extra sandwich for my young child, and it was due to your delay in meal time. At the end I had to tell my crying child that the airline does not have enough food. 

As a well know airline, shouldn't you planned and stocked enough food for all? And the attitude from the flight attendants were very bad.
label: negative

text: Better than the last time Checked in and chose seats on line. Lie flat beds were unsuitable on outward leg from Stockholm so crew told me to try getting specific seats. We did this but at check in were told not possible although we had confirmation. Refused to accept other seats and after I requested a manager and had a discussion with said manager seats suddenly could be allocated. Seats were very good but why the hassle? At Singapore the business class lounge was almost standing room only and food in short supply. I have had better flights from rivals and on this return trip have sadly not been impressed.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines - All Smiles No Action My wife and I unfortunately chose Singapore Airlines instead of flying all the way with KLM. Service on outbound flight was good standard however return flight was awful from point of check in. My wife was moved from the allocated paid for seat to sit in middle of four people separated from me. Despite an hour trying to sort out their system issues neither Duty Manager Harwan Bin Jaffar not Eric Foo would rectify the problem - so spent entire flight apart - missed opportunity to make use airport facilities but were offered sweets to make up for mix up !! In flight refused to rectify seating mix up Clifford Chua stated he was governed by Ground Staff - awful service and only one person out of entire Singapore Airline crew offered my wife a complimentary drink to make up for the issue - Mohamad Raimi unfortunately one man unable to change our view on this all smiles but no action airline - will never fly with Singapore Airlines again !
label: negative

text: It doesn't get any better than this Before I could even sit down, Stewardess Tracy helped me out of my coat and made sure that I had what I needed.  She continued to be there for me throughout the 18 hours of the flight.  She was lovely and gracious to a fault.  I must also praise the food staff who provided excellent meals throughout.  They even brought out a cheese cart at the end of the two main meals!  The wine was great too.  Finally, I loved the selection of films on the monitor.  There were multiple Asian films with English subtitles that are probably available nowhere else.  I look forward to flying Singapore again.
label: positive

text: Excellent service I used to fly in the economy class often but this year is the first time I flew in the premium economy class and it’s awesome! Food on board was great. I pre ordered the food online before my flight. The carrot cake on the way back from Singapore to Amsterdam was so delicious. I finished it all. Normally I never finished my meal on board I just took a couple of bites and that’s it but not this year 🥰 it was all so good. The stewardess were all very friendly as usual when you fly with Singapore airlines no matter which class you take. They treat you very well. Singapore airlines is the best!
label: positive

text: Lets Fly in A Very Fascinating Airlines This is my first time flight with Singapore Airlines and that was awesome! The airline serves passengers very well. They always offer us a variety of services. Before entering the plane, we were offered a headset and newspaper. Then we were given a variety of foods and it tasted good
label: positive

text:
Good flight I fly with SQ only when. I find the fare is competive and the flight is ditect 
This time, both conditions were met.
The flight is smooth. And like my previous SQ experience, the flight attendants are mechanistic in their services.  Professional but lack of sincerity and emotions.  No friendly conversations like in Air NZ or others.
It is good I suppose for a job done.
label: positive

text:
Best airline service I have had yet! In flight experience was extremely comfortable.
Service when checking in and on board was perfect.
Will definitely be flying with Singapore again!
label: positive

text: Best airline out there! This was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines, but it won't be my last! They made a 15 hour flight "fly" by. With all the entertainment and food/drink options, you aren't bothered by how long your flight may be.
label: positive

text: Calm trip over Singapore It was a pleasant, quiet flight in the A380 to Singapore. I am amazed about the quality of food servied in the economy class. Excellent service, good price. Only the seating is narrow, even on this airline.
label: positive

text: Great airline to travel long haul Singapore is always my first choice for long haul travel. Modern well equipped planed with lovely staff and good food in economy. The bonus for New Zealand to the UK is only 2 flights and the delight of stopping at Singapore. Looking forward to the flight home tomorrow.
label: positive

text: The BEST service from end to end From arrival at Singapore Airport, the airline staff were wonderful, as they made sure all was easy and comfortable for us, on the ground from arrival, to the very comfortable lounge, between terminal buildings to the aircraft, as well as within the aircraft. Excellent service and immaculate attire from all attendants. The in-flight food choice, made easy with pre-flight selection, was top class, and surely would satisfy all tastes.
label: positive

text: Great Hospitality As Always Had a great flight with Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Tokyo. Still love the hot towels provided each time we come on board, and the in-flight entertainment was updated with a wide range of movies and TV shows. We were hungry in the midst of the flight (even after inflight meal was served) and the air stewardess gave us a variety of cookies as snacks to fill our tummy. She even asked if we would like to opt for a cup noodle, which we were quite surprised. Very hospitable, definitely looking forward to flying again with Singapore Airlines when travel is back to normal again.
label: positive

text: The Flight Crew on all legs of our recent travel with Singapore Airlines were exceptional. My husband and I completed 4 legs with Singapore Airlines in October and November.  The service from checking in to getting off can not be faulted.  One small glitch on the final leg to Brisbane from Singapore.  Being in Premium Economy we found it surprising that they were out of a particular meal and the ice-cream when they came to us.  As I say, it can be the little things and these certainly were small in the overall experience.  Service, attentiveness throughout the whole trip, top shelf.  Assistance getting overhead bags organised etc.  Best thing - another small thing however in the air for 14 hours also a big thing.  The loos were constantly cleaned and freshened.  Just lovely!
label: positive

text: No sign of economy here We had researched Singapore airlines before we flew and it came up as the best in economy airlines - I really couldn’t see anything economy about it. There was plenty of room for us - my husband is 6ft 1, choice of films was excellent and meals were absolutely gorgeous - cheesecake was yummy!!!! Efficiency of checking in was faultless and always someone around if you did need help. Use them again? 100%,hopefully pretty soon.  As a foot note - we flew to Hong Kong with them as well and between Singapore and Hong Kong we flew on the A380!! Fabulous airline and definitely recommend it.
label: positive

text:
Mixed The trip from Heathrow to Brisbane means a connecting flight in Singapore.

The first flight felt  a little cramped in economy and we are not large people, the food on the flight was very good as was the service, the screen to watch the films was of a good size.and touch screen

The transit time was very tight about an hour and we had to get from one end of Changi airport to the other

the second part of the journey was in an older plane and the entertainment screen was a waste of time, so small , the food and drinks though was agian  good
label: positive

text: Good service and facilities We were provided with a blanket, pillow and headphones as we boarded the plane. Entertainment options were very good and food options were great. Real cutlery provided
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines Was good service,/choice off food could improve.it was nice food but a lot of it has spice in it.which I cant eat. I think they need to offer a spice dish and non spice dish.otherwise good service
label: positive

text: out dated inside I have been flying for many years now and most flights are enjoyable but when I fly from Singapore to Brisbane, the plane is always full, no room to move, the toilets are always in constant use. Long waits for food and drinks. Not a very good ending to a long holiday. I presume the oldest planes are used for this flight. Different flying to Sydney, but Brisbane is a shocker. Maybe buying a business class ticket for this concluding journey would relax and entertain us. After all, it is a long flight of 9 hours. Yet, the flights going from Brisbane to Singapore are the opposite. Seats are more comfortable, the entertainment is better and the service is pleasurable.
label: negative

text: COMFORTABLE FLYING An airline that has professional cabin crew, expert pilots and good food. Singapore airlines will make you feel at ease when flying. They also have spacious leg room and choices of entertainment while flying. Sinagpore airlines is my preferred airline.
label: positive

text: Very Good Service Travel was with change over in Singapore.   Staff were friendly and helpful to my wife as she needs a wheelchair to get to and from the airplane.   Never had a problem with Singapore Airlines.   I consider the food they provide on the inflight menu to be bland and boring so always use Book the Cook to order something different.   The entertainment provided did not offer much to suit our tastes.  Notwithstanding those minor points always happy to recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Consistent & Efficient Smooth and comfortable as always.  Service was attentive and adequately staffed.  Starters (satay skewers) was good.  Special Nasi Padang was a tat cold and chicken drumstick was somewhat small.  What was missing was the traditional condiments like Sambal chilli with anchovies.
label: positive

text:
Damaged luggage Service on the ground and in the air good but planes and seats very dated. Leg room ok but design of seat still old style - legs have to be curved to one side when lying flat. 

On arrival, one of the wheels of my 4-wheel checked in luggage had fallen off. Didn't have time to report the damage as had another connecting flight to Europe. Took photos and when we got to Europe put in a claim to the airlines. Despite numerous emails (each time received an automated acknowledgment) chasing after the claim and making new claims, nothing has happened. Even rang SIngapore Airlines in Singapore and spoke to customer service. Put in more applications and still nothing. 

If you look at Singapore Airlines' sites in Australia and SIngapore, they are designed not be contactable.  Many of the phone numbers are out dated and ring out. They don't want your opinions. They are not interested in what you think. 

I had a similar issue with a third rate airline many years ago and had the same issue of no follow up after numerous emails and phone calls. I thought SIA is a first rate and premium airline. Most disappointed. It's just another airline with poor customer service. If this is how they approach customer service, how do they approach airline safety?
label: negative

text:
Great airline, beautiful airport, pathetic service. Flying to Singapore on Singapore Airlines is something people dream of. We took the flight and loved it, the airport was amazing but when it comes to security and immigration, it appalling.  The airline is great, economy seats are good, pitch is perfect and a guy like me 185cm sits pretty comfortable and I did enjoy the flight. 
The greeting by immigration was like "why the hell did you just arrive at midnight, I'd better be in bed". Well, the flight was scheduled to arrive 0010. Sorry guys. 
Three days later we left to Hanoi, again, the security were nasty and bored, hated every moment of their job. 
Then on our way back with transit in Singapore Changi. Straight after landing, we disembarked to find a massive amount of passengers in front of us in a Que, wondering whats happening, we finally saw from distance what's the issue, its security checking passengers just as when boarding!!! I couldn't believe my eyes. We just landed and came out of a plane, what possibly could we have bought or manufactured on board a A330 of Singapore airlines? I travel like 6 to 12 times a year on international and domestic flights. Never ever was I required to go through security after landing, just to go again through security at the departure gate (the same terminal). We were delayed like at least 45 minutes till they cleared the 3 A330s and a 777-200 that just landed, I asked why is this check? The officer replied just a random security check! That resulted in loosing our time to go to the duty free and enjoy the airport facilities.  Had to run to our gate so we won't miss our flight home. But the airline is definitely A1. 
The waste of time of passengers in the name of security will cost the Airport it's reputation and the duty free loosing customers like us, we were looking forward to buy few things but our time was consumed by useless unnecessary checks.
label: positive

text: Inexperienced Pilots My husband is a Miami based International 777 Pilot on another airline. He served as a Captain in the US Air Force and flew the F-16. We boarded and took off as planned. The cabin crew was kind and professional. We were up in the air about 20 minutes and were at 35k feet and food/drink service was about to begin when the pilot announced that due to weather there would be turbulence, buckle up and no food/drink service for the next 1.5-2 hours. It was a harrowing experience and at one point I considered asking my husband to confer with them on a workaround/option. They could have slowed the speed down and/or called in for a variance to move either up or down to get out of the turbulence. They didn't. We were tossed around for almost two full hours. I fly all the time (both domestically and internationally) and my flies for a living. Never have we seen a flight crew that would subject the passengers and the jet to this type of turbulence for such a long period of time. Since our final destination was Bali and we had to change jets at SIN we'd thought about cancelling our return flight via Singapore Airlines and non-revving back through Hong Kong/Dallas. In the end, we weren't able to cancel and paid for the flight home but switched over to American and did the additional flight to HKG/DFW and then worked our way back to Florida. It was a bad experience that could have easily been remedied. They chose not to exercise options for passenger safety. We choose to not fly them again.
label: negative

text:
Not the best airlines I never flight with Singapore Airlines before, and always heard it's the best airlines, I compared the ticket with different airlines, finally tried with Singapore Airlines.
Because it's a 15 hours flight, want to have more comfortable flight. My priority is wishing to sleep on the flight. My reviews of Singapore Airlines Premium Economy are listed as follows:
Good
1. Priority Boarding
2. Priority luggage handling - I get my luggage rapidly on the belt within 5 mins after I passed the immigration.
Bad
1. The seat is not comfortable than I expected, feel not much wider than standard economy seat. The seat recliner is fine, the cal rest not so helpful. The control of the seat recliner and cal rest have to do it manually, not like business class which is adjusted by machine without pushing it hard. Although it has 38 inches leg room, it's comfortable, but when I need to go to bathroom, still need to ask the passenger on aisle seat to let me out. Even it's better and comfortable than economy seats, I still not able to sleep during the flight, I think I can only sleep well if I can sleep on a flat bed.
2. The meal - they offer Book the cook, but the food quality is so-so, feel exactly same quality as economy class. They didn't distribute mid flight snacks to you, only water. Also they didn't put the snacks out for self services, you have to ask, I tried to ask for a sandwich and they said it's all gone. Seems they didn't have enough supply for all economy passengers.
3. The bathroom - there are only 5 bathroom for both the Premium economy and Economy passengers. But they have 4 bathrooms for Business class passengers, but not allow for Premium Economy passengers. That's too bad.
4. Just like I read before, there's no designated flight attendant for Premium Economy passengers, so they  treat you just like the economy passengers.
Overall I want to say Singapore Airlines is not the best, personally I think Cathy Pacific or China Airlines are better than Singapore Airlines in terms of foods, services and overall experience.
label: neutral

text: Keeps the high standard  Singapore airlines, better than Thai. Hot towels just after take off and before breakfast is served.  Great variety of entertainment, clean plane and the food is quite good.  Given they beat Thai substantially on price of economy ticket and gave a better product, once I rated Singapore and Thai as equals but now Singapore has taken a clear lead.  Service was great, efficient and friendly, Singapore I think has improved on their already high standard. Well done Singapore airlines in the age of charge the consumer more and give less.
label: positive

text:
Friendly and helpful staff The staff made our flight amazing and relaxing. We had our 7 month old child with us and the staff made us and him feel so welcome and calm that the 13 hour flight was relatively easy going.
The food on board was nice and the entertainment system kept us and our boy entertained
label: positive

text:
BEST AIRLINES AND BEST CREW IN THE WORLD Dear Singapore airlines team

My name is ferdi
I was travelling to Singapore from dubai on 12th august 2019 by Singapore airlines and here i would like to put a review for special crew that is serene tan, she treats me very well, very friendly, and she has good hospitality, she should get promote from the management, i was traveling around the world but this is my first time i use Singapore airlines well i just wanna say Singapore airlines is the best airlines and the best crew ever in the world.

Ferdi

text:
Rough ride I flew from Singapore to Perth last month after a premium flight from the uk, which was fine but not great. The plane we boarded on the next flight from Singapore to Perth was likened to a cattle truck. Tatty seats uncomfortable , the tv were not working for hardly anyone . Children were standing on seats and parents and children were walking up the isles.
Obviously there was no room to nurse a child and I felt sorry for them . Yes I had come off a premium flight of 17 hours but the last five hours of flying on this flight was awful. I won’t fly that route again or with them. The staff were great rushed of their feet.

text: Very good Airline Very good Airline  a value for money you  do not to pay extra. The food  is ok.I will take this airline again
label: positive

text: The cabin crew are friendly, they provide good service The cabin crew are friendly, they provide good service. The ladies leader with green uniform is helpful. She help to make my seat comfortable when the person seating in front is in-considerate (adjust the seat all the way down)
label: positive

text: Non stop to Singapore. Lovely comfortable flight, outward journey selected bulkhead seat and had extra legroom. The choice of entertainment provided on the individual seat screens was great with recent films available. Meals were better than your usual inflight meal. The added bonus for me was the Singapore Sling served as a complimentary drink. The crew were lovely and attentive regularly circulating with trays of water and juice. In addition delectables were readily available from the galley during the flight. All in all a very pleasant trip, it certainly beats going via Abu Dabia or Dubai and having to hang around and change planes. My airline of choice when travelling to Singapore.
label: positive

text: I love Singapore Airlines! I love flying Singapore Airlines when I get the chance.  Service in SQ economy class surpasses the North American business class airlines.  My most recent trip on SQ was in business class - an overall enjoyable experience.

text: Best service ever It is very punctual. The staff is very helpful and sincerely. Check in is easy. Boarding is very organized. I enjoy my flight very much. Looking forward to having others with SQ. Even at economic class.the legroom is spacious.
label: positive

text: Friendly Crew The Crew from Singapore Airlines are very friendly, accomodating and Helpful.One Male Crew was very funny,i Just forgot to ASK His Name.Facilities are good.Everything was okey...Thanks to the Pilot and Crew For Sending us Back Home safely☺️
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines deserves its high reputation We recently enjoyed a 5 day holiday in Singapore and flew return by Singapore Airlines. The plane left and arrived on time for both legs of the trip. We have generally used budget airlines in the past to get savings however we really do believe it is better to pay that little bit more for the full service and timetable reliability. In addition we found the flight crew to be professional and very friendly. Will use this airline more often in future, highly recommended.
label: positive

text:
Amazing My direct flight from Melbourne to Singapore last month left on time. The welcoming smile by a cabin crew was reassuring that this is going to be a pleasant experience. Of course all cabin crew in all airlines give passengers a welcoming smile and greeting. But, this time the SIA hostess was more genuine.
Service in the economy class section is delightful and the back toilets were maintained clean.
label: positive

text:
Poor meals I recently travelled with Singapore Airlines from Brisbane too Zurich and have done so many times on the last 20 years. I have always been happy with the service and food provided and do not usually complain. But on my last flight I found the food offerings on the Brisbane too Singapore flight to be lacking, we were served one meal (lunch) and a couple of rounds of drinks for the entire 8 hour flight. I understand two meals may not be feasible on such a flight but in years gone by a snack or 'light refreshement' was always served a couple of hours from Singapore and vice versa. 
I also don't find using Covid a valid excuse for cutting the inflight food service as other airlines such as Emirates and Qatar and even Qantas still serve a full meal and snack on flights of similar lengths. 
I hope Singapore Airlines improves there catering offerings in the future as one meal for 8 hours is definitely not 5 stars!!!
label: neutral

text: Amazing We had a nightmare trip due to my husband's eardrum perforating half an hour into the flight, the aircrew was stunning, caring, helpful and attentive during the flight to Singapore - arranged medical assistance, I can't say enough about them, will definitely be flying with Singapore air again.
label: positive

text:
A Great Way to Fly! I have always trusted the Singapore Airline for their professionalism and aircraft safety. 

I am particularly impressed with one of the air steward's impressive customer service standard.  As I was seated by the window (seat 57K), I did not get the chance to get his name - a Singaporean Chinese gentleman.

His professional and sincerity in helping made my flight experience very pleasant.  i also noticed that he will go the extra mile to ensure all passengers' needs were met.

I highly recommend the Singapore Airlines anytime as the airline service does not start from the air crew but from the entire travel experience (airport to airport).

text: Consistently Great Been flying Singapore for many years & tried some more obscure flights from Chennai (SQ529) & (SQ938) to Denpasar.  I can honestly say they are consistently great.  Service is always fantastic & staff are always smiling.  Planes are always presented neat & tidy.  Their food is the best of any airline I’ve used.  I’ve already got my return European flights for 2020 booked & at the cheapest price out of all the major airlines.

text:
It's maintained its class Whilst most airlines diminish their service to passengers, Singapore Airline (Manchester to Singapore) continues to value its customers
Food good, drinks good,snacks available throughout flight, really nice and professionalcrew,
Will fly Singapore at every opportunity
label: positive

text: very pleasant flight. lots of good food on board. attentive stewardesses. so pleasantly different from economy but understandably so. very nice sleeping quarters for the long flight. the visual wasn't tough screen though and the AV control wasn't user-friendly dummy-proof enough. stewardess were very attentive. food was very good except for the noodles i chose for "Book your Cook" menu.

text: Great crew,service and wonderful interior First time flew Singapore airlines and must say it was worth it afterall. text:
I do not recommend booking a flight with Singapore Airlines. I am very disappointed with your ground staff at Tan Son Nhat International Airport .I had a horrible experience at the check-in counter. My flight was SGN to Zurich.

ground staff, Ms.Pham thi    Hoang Anh, had no idea of the regulations and entry requirements of foreign nationals to Switzerland. A very low level of knowledge and poor service.

MsPham thi     Hoang Anh,told me that Israelis must show their departure flight from Switzerland. Israeli citizens do not need exit flight tickets from Switzerland.

She updated me that she had called the manager of Singapore Airlines and it would take him more than two hours. Maybe more I told her I would miss my flight. I felt I was having a heart attack! I asked him to give me the boarding pass. She refused! 
I do not recommend booking a flight with Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Thought this was the No.1 airline Unfortunately our flight was cancelled just before we were boarding. We stood around for 3 hrs before we were put on a bus down to Heathrow from Manchester. We did receive compensation but we were offered two gestures of good will. Neither of which we could use. Two meal vouchers as we had missed the evening meal but we were given them as we were boarding. Also in flight gift vouchers were offered. We received these 2 weeks after we got home !!! We were told we could order things from their shop and it would be delivered to our home. But we have to pay duty & postage and can only select from a very limited selection. Great PR !!!!!
label: negative

text:
Singapore airlines economy better than Qantas business class I flew Singapore Airlines A350 from Singapore to Bangkok in economy and had recently flown Qantas business class and Singapore Airlines economy service left Qantas business class for dead.

The service on Singapore Airlines was great it was top notch with super friendly and efficient staff who were on top of everything. Great service, good food. the aircraft was clean and modern and quiet not like the old A330 we flew on Qantas and seriously it was like chalk and cheese. Singapore Air was so much better in every aspect, from friendly great service, good food, clean modern plane it jsut won out in every aspect

text: The greatest airline I have ever flown Everything is superb. Excellent service, luxurious and very comfortable Business Class cabin and good food and wines.
label: positive

text: unbelevable compensation Long delay due to breakdown after this airline did all it could to compensate in fact financial compensation was paid with no need to make a claim and turned out to be more than cost of flight we were given the impression airline took pride in what they provide and did not want to dissapoint
label: positive

text: Clean and efficient I was on a tour and it included a flight on Singapore Airlines in economy class.  The plane was clean, the seating cramped, the food (at least there was some that you didn't have to pay for) was edible, and the flight attendants were rarely seen.  I don't often fly in economy class and now I know why.  I understand that Singapore business class is great and I might try them one of these days when I am going on another Southeast Asia trip.
label: neutral

text:
Charming Crew, arrived early- food disappointing Saturday 26th October and our stay in Singapore was over and it was time to return to Goa via Mumbai.

We were travelling on board Singapore Airlines flight SQ 424 to Mumbai which was scheduled to Depart at 19.00 and arriving in Mumbai 22.10, Mumbai 2 hours and 30 minutes behind Singapore

A scheduled 5 hours and 40 minute flight

Like our outbound flight we were travelling in Premium Economy cabin.

We were seated in the second row of the Premium Economy Cabin, seat 32 A and C. The opposite side to the Cabin for our outward journey.

Normally the configuration in the cabin is 2 - 4 - 2, there was no seating in the middle row, for the first few rows, to make room for the staircase, which led to the upstairs area of the aircraft, an A380 800. The space underneath the stairs was used as storage cupboard space by the cabin crew, this was right beside my seat. The crew visited there on numerous occasions during the flight. This was rather irritating as the door rattled when opened and closed and a bright light shone when door opened, even worse when cabin lights were dimmed. Unlike the outbound flight the cabin crew were aware of this and did their best to keep the noise to a minimum.

We did also preorder our meal online, herb roasted chicken, which was served on a bed of black lentils. Sorry it was not very appetising and very disappointing and was not eaten.

We landed at 21.30, which was 40 minutes earlier than scheduled, which is always good news.

The cabin crew provided a courteous and efficient high level of service. 

This was a better flight that the outbound flight on Friday 18th October. 

Would certainly fly with Singapore Airlines again and would use the Premium Economy Cabin but would select seats further back in the cabin.
label: positive

text:
Don't bother with premium economy - poor experiance and not worth the money Paid $500 for a premium economy update. Was not worth it. Headrest on seat was broken and wouldn't go up. Footrest and seat both designed for short people and useless and uncomfortable for someone 183cm tall. Footrest spring and wouldn't support my legs anyway. Uncomfortable and not worth the money. Poor sleep compounded by cabin service - see below.

Infotainment worked well but screen was offset in my seat and so far away the screen was effectively tiny.

Checkin was painless albeit clunky on a smartphone with a pre smartphone era process.

Onboarding was bizarre in surabaya with an attendant using a poor quality belt amplifier and microphone to blare incomprehensible instructions at passengers. 

Boarding the a380 and then waiting 20mins for take-off was very slow- downside of a large plane most probably. Egress and baggsge was also slow probably also due to the size of the aircraft.

There was no food choice from surabaya as the better smelling option ran out. The laksa was average but the included bread roll was gross and tasted like it was full of sugar and preservatives and baked a week ago. The cake was also sickly sweet. Would have preferred some healthy food although a meal order may be a way to achieve this.

Order of serving passengers was also seemingly random on both flights. Waited 10 mins while passengers in front, beside and behind were served and yet others were waiting.

Most irritating part of the a380 flight was being knocked and brushed against by the stewardess 20 times for an overnight flight without leaning into the aisle significantly. Use of a quiet voice at night time would have been great too. This problem could be mitigated by avoiding the a380 seats with extra legroom - I had no choice as other passengers had already selected seats.
label: neutral

text: Great flight to Houston average return  First time flying with Singapore Airlines the flight out in economy was very good with nice service food and good setback entertainment however we were disappointed on the return flight after paying for premium economy the food was poor as was the seatbelt padding was awful and the service was below average I know it was a night flight however I was parched on landing we may use the same flight next year but would only do economy
label: neutral

text: Singapore airline but not silk air As my title Yes to Singapore airline but not Silk Air from houston to Singapore it was a pleasure trip not until Singapore to Davao Silk air there airplane is felty faded saggy hood its a short flight
label: positive

text: Comfortable and lots of movies variety The new seat is very comfortable and quite a good amount of leg space. The screen is also big and there are lots of variety of movies selection in SIA inflight system.
label: positive

text:
Flying with Singapore Air The flight with this airline to Singapore was a pleasant experience. The air craft had modern amenities, the service including food and beverages were good. The crew were tirelessly moving around to look after the passengers. 
After I got off the plane, it was a bit of a guessing game to ascertain the correct terminal. There were signs but they did not have clear notification especially of terminal 2. Either on the plane or after after getting into the terminal it would be helpful if they could review the remaining instructions to be more user friendly.
label: positive

text: Never again... Food was disgusting. Two flights in a row that no choice was given. Fish revolting, bread roll like rocks. The wait staff were lovely however that didn’t make up for the lack of quality or freshness of meals. Back to Qantas for us!
label: neutral

text: Great long haul with Singapore It is always a pleasant experience to fly with Singapore even on a long haul.  They are just a cut above. Nothing is too much effort for the staff.
label: positive

text:
Superb service  From start to finish the service I got was second to none, the food was above par and the response speed from pressing the service button was like a personal service! 

First time I’ve flown with Singapore airlines and would suggest this airline to anyone
label: positive

text: Great flight and great crew We flew on one of their 777-300er's. It was my first time on that particular type of plane as I usually fly to Asia on the Airbus a380. The plane was well laid out and the seats were comfortable.  Boarding was quick and easy for a plane this size. The food was pretty good and plentiful.  The crew however was amazing.  I somehow injured my arm during the flight and was in extreme pain.  The crew made hot and cold packs for me and wrapped my arm for compression.  There was an empty row that they allowed me to lay down in to make me more comfortable.  The really went above and beyond for me.
label: positive

text: Easily the best in the Airline industry I can't think of any other brand in the industry that works so consistently to be number one in a lot of areas. From their service, the type of products (premium economy being my favorite) the courtesy of the staff and their entire motto/ value system they follow is remarkable. I always believe, that for a company to be so successful and consistent, it generally starts from management and trickles down. SQ is a perfect example. Great vision and it shows. How i wish they flew from abu dhabi as well.
label: positive

text: Best airline in the world?  For sure! I have been flying 100,000+ km a year for 20 years.  Singapore Airlines is by far and away my preferred airline.  The standard in every class is exceptional.
label: positive

text:
Awesome Service It was an awesome experience always flying with Singapore Airlines. The service and cleaniness is great. The free flow of drinks and crackers are good. The food is ok but the ice cream that comes after the meal makes the experience complete.

It is always a great way to fly with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
AMAZING STAFF AND LEGROOM To start, Singapore Airlines contacted me before my flight saying that they have changed my seat to an economy seat which has extra legroom (due to the seat in front being missing). This was AMAZING as I had a very comfortable flight!!

I must say that the staff in Singapore Airlines are very welcoming and are friendly. They also are very helpful during the flight as well as before departure and once arriving. They offer eyeshades and other amenities at request for economy and to get these you need to ask the cabin crew to get these. 

Our flight departed LHR at 22:00 and arrived in SIN at around 6pm. Our a 13 hour flight was perfect- enough legroom for my son who's 6ft 2in tall (although the person in front must also have their seat reclined for this to be comfortable). The food service was impeccable; staff were very quick at serving food and cleaning up so we could grab a bit of shuteye. The IFE was quite outdated as the screen was not touchscreen - if this was updated I would say this is the best flight in economy ever!! Also, it's quite difficult to see whether the toilets are vacant or not as the sign is too small and difficult to see from afar (especially when the cabin is dark). 

Also the passenger who was previously in the toilet before me did not flush the toilet. Perhaps in newer aircraft automatically-flushing toilets or sensor-flushing toilets would be good as this was a bit of a bummer (both metaphorically and actually😂)

Overall, GREAT SERVICE, LOVELY STAFF, GOOD FOOD but aircraft IFE needs to be improved for economy flights to and from SIN - retrofitting may be a good option!!
label: positive

text:
Hassle-free. This flight was the second leg for my brother and I on our international journey to Indonesia. After arriving in Singapore in the early hours of the morning, and then departing later (still early morning), we spent most of this flight in either dozing or in a daze from our lack of sleep.

From what we both can remember,  this one and a half hour flight from Singapore to Jakarta was hassle-free. All flight staff that we encountered were very friendly and accommodating.

Breakfast service was part of the flight, however we both declined the offer.
label: positive

text:
Who won between Singapore Airlines and Air New Zealand? My husband and I traveled from NZ to Singapore in Premium Economy class on Air NZ and made the return trip on Singapore Airlines. How did they compare?

Air NZ won hands down. Why? 

On Air NZ the cabin was more modern; better functions in our seats. The staff dedicated to our cabin introduced themselves and made conversation; their manner made us feel like we were “mates”. The meals were nicer. Service was instant (on Singapore I waited 30mins for an extra blanket).

Overall, we felt Premium Economy on Air NZ was a premium class of travel and on Singapore Airlines, it was nothing special at all.
label: neutral

text: Great Service Had a great flight on this airline.  Staff are exceptional, especially on the A380.  We were upgraded to the exit seats. Would definitely fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text:
Not  good as Singapore Airline earned rating Took off from Changi AP at 00:45 13/11/2022

Singapore Air used to be an excellent Airline in the past, not anymore and its service goest down to the tube. Its airfares are not so competitive with other, similar to its cousin SCOOT.

Not a welcome drink ( orange juice or water), put guests to sleep straight away and no sign of crew around.
Only one meal served during 8 hours flight, 2 hours before landing at Sydney AP, no snack, no refreshment. 
Crew served meal, rushed out to traveller and did not offer refilling tea or coffee as usual, rudely and walked away with few requests from other travellers. Perhaps guests on board are beggars.
label: negative

text:
Great Service We have 6 members of family with 2 child 1 infent and 1 senior citizen to avail singapore airlines while travel to Malaysia. The mentionable good things are

1. Cabin crue are extremly supportable.
2. They are taken care of child and todler nicely.
3. Food standard is good
4. Time conscious and good management.

Negative side:
May be from Bangladesh they are not using upgraded Plane so that we feel so jerking sometime without bad weather.

Overall it was agreat journey in both return way.
