text:
Pretty average In comparison to other airlines' Premium Economy, Singapore Aiirline's would rank fairly low. In fairness, the cost of their premium economy is a fraction of those others. So if you're simply after more leg room and a better recline, then you'll be fine. But if you're expecting anything more than that, you'll be sorely disappointed.
I actually found the seat rather uncomfortable. More so than the economy seats of other airlines. But again, in fairness, given a choice of the better recline and leg room, I would take that over the comfort of the other economy seats.
Interestingly, the main difference in the P. Economy offered by Singapore Airlines compared to that offered by others s that other airlines basically offer business class service with their P Economy so it's like flying business with the business class seat of yesterday. Singapore Airlines basically offers economy class service with their P Economy so it's like flying economy with the business class seat of yesterday.
Overall, I wasn't particularly impressed with the meal service or the cleanliness of the plane (which I found very surprising). But the service received from the crew was excellent (not that we needed anything much).
label: neutral

text:
Unimpressed We followed their instructions and printed our check in and boarding passes but this was a complete waste of time and paper as we had to do self boarding passes when at Heathrow. Flight took off 40 minutes late. It was very hot but no drinks were offered until the meal.
The air vent controls were well out of reach when sitting.
I printed a copy of Singapore airport as the airline couldn't tell us what terminal we were landing at Singapore for transfer to Darwin.
Breakfast was served, after the usual sleep period,at mid afternoon local time.
The transfer at Singapore, only 2 hours, was ok.
another meal was served almost immediately on our leg to Darwin-very similar to the one we had before.
Both planes were very clean and the attendants quietly efficient.
label: positive

text: very efficient.........great plane well organised flights    everything went smoothly  flight was ontime and even early returning   fantastic big 787 with good meal and drinks  staff were friendly and always availeable definately fly with singapore again
label: positive

text: Best Airline To Fly With Service of this airline is very good. The food they serve is delicious and hot. There are vegetarian options as well. I like the ambience and interior.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing experience on Los Angeles --> Singapore --> Delhi Flight I have flown multiple times (using a multitude of airlines) from the US to other destinations around the world. Although quirky, my airline of choice has been Turkish (due to their in flight service, entertainment and the food, which I find above average). I had to make a trip from Los Angeles to Delhi (India) and decided to check out Singapore Airlines as I had heard so much about their food and entertainment. The flying time on this sector is extremely long as the flight (SQ 11) makes a stop at Narita in Tokyo for an hour, before proceeding to Singapore. 

Let me just say that I was really disappointed - the food was among the worst I have eaten in economy. Bland pasta and hard fish soaked in an unappetizing sauce - really bad! The dessert was just an ice-cream. In contrast Turkish Airline's food in economy is just fantastic. Great kebabs, chicken, excellent warm rolls, tasty dessert... and the ticket costs less (while the travel time is shorter by many hours). The only saving grace was that I had pre-ordered a Hindu Non-Veg meal on one of the sectors and it was delicious. So I guess the trick is to pre-order a meal if flying via Singapore Airlines. 

The entertainment was lacking too - most of the 'new releases' were old and tired movies and the selection was very limited. Even Turkish Airlines offers a wide selection of movies (and they really do have 'new releases'). The FAs were great and polite - so no issues on that front. It was odd that they never offered an amenity kit to passengers (which Turkish offers to all). 

In conclusion, I am glad I tried it once, but would never fly with Singapore Airlines again. I am not sure how people find this airline to be good (and how has it won so many awards) - the only thing I can think of is that people haven't flown with some of the other airlines. And am now dreading the long return trip back to the US (23 hours flying time) with them in a few weeks. Maybe I will just pay for the extra-legroom seat and pre-order my meals.
label: negative

text: amazing trip Singapore airlines were excellent on all our flights. Good food and excellent service throughout. would definitely recommend.
label: positive

text: The Longest nonstop flight in the World I flight a lot around the world ans since this route was opened I had in my list this flight, finally it happens in may this year... and in fact it was an excellent flight, very friendly staff by checking in and on board  the service was rewarding.... comfortable seats, attentive cabin staff. Although it is over 18 hour flight the time was not that boring and I arrived full of energy. On the way back I use the route via Frankfurt and service on A380 was also very good.!
label: positive

text: great service Comfortable seating great service from the on board staff , heaps of movies , what I noticed was the staff did a lot to help travellers with small and crying children with drinks or treats to minimise the discomfort to other travellers well done Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Staff were lovely The plane was clean and the staff were so lovely! Food was good and the movie selection was vast. We had no turbulence.
label: positive

text: Nice comfortable and friendly flight My first experience and I was nicely suprised, everything was clean, staff extreamly nice and helpful, I got even hot water and my vegan meals were tasty. They provide realy good service, thank you
label: positive

text: Very good Everything was very good. The staff, the food the entertainment. They even waited for late connecting passengers in Singapore. REally good experience.
label: positive

text: Disappointing This was a very disappointing experience considering the hype around the SQ soft and hard product in business.  Firstly let me say the Silverkris Lounge at Changi T3 was excellent. It was the highlight of my flight.  Normally the lounge is just the teaser with the inflight experience the main event.  Unfortunately the inflight experience was just disappointing.  At pre-departure I was offered a juice or champagne and I asked for water.  The FA literally told me to just drink from my water bottle.  No big deal but just not the right tone to set in a premium cabin.  Then there is the seat.  I flew the a380 with their new a380 business seats which i just didn’t like.  I found the seat uncomfortable and the seat padding pretty hard.  Their seat configuration was just really limited and the seat buttons very unresponsive when pressing them.  This was a night flight and this seat is just a terrible for sleeping.  The design when in flat bed mode forces you to lie on an angle  which was very awkward and uncomfortable.   The “seat cover” provided was very thin and no padding meaning you felt all the padding and upholstery of the seat which was just not very soft or giving.  The blanket provided was just too small and meant that either my arms or my feet were sticking out the entire time.  The seat looks good but for me was a total functional fail for comfort and awful for sleeping.  Sadly the food service was a real let down on this flight as well.  I “booked the cook” for my meal which certainly raised my expectations but what I got was average, bland  noodles that looked no different from the other inflight offerings.  My travel companion took the inflight breakfast offering and this was literally one of the worst meals not just in business but in any cabin class.  The scrambled eggs were quite literally inedible.  A goopy stream of “bits” of egg that must surely have been powdered or reconstituted egg,  It was just disgusting.  Totally unbelievable offering on a business class flight.  Whilst the flight was on time and the FAs polite and efficient I would not fly SQ business again unless it was a discounted ticket and I would be very hesitant even then to book a night flight on the a380 with this seat.
label: neutral

text: World Class Airline Not my first time flying in SQ, never disappoints me for their tip-top services. The crews are very helpful and attentive. In-flight entertainments were good enough to accommodate my 6 hours+ flight. Although the legroom is not as spacious as Emirates, it is still comfortable enough. Always a pleasant experience to fly with this airline.
label: positive

text:
The return leg of a previously reviewed flight with SQ Recently I had reviewed an overnight flight on SQ288 from Canberra to Singapore accompanied by my wife to escape the below zero mornings in Canberra during winter . Canberra , the capital of Australia , is at an average altitude of 650 metres and is surrounded by the mountains that lead up to the Australian Alps , where our snowfields are . We will have snow once or twice a year on our front lawn which lasts for 6-12 hours . Our four year old male Labrador who weighs 48 kilos , all muscle , thinks the cold is lovely as one of his grandfathers was imported from Finland for breeding .  I crack the ice with my knuckles on his water bowl in the morning .
Anyway , the return leg of SQ 288 from Singapore to Canberra, with a stop of just over one hour in Sydney brought us back to minus one degree in Canberra .
SQ 288 departs Singapore at 10.30 am  , arrives in Sydney at just after 8 pm , although enormous tail winds brought us in at 7.40 pm , to wait for a 9.30 pm departure to Canberra, arriving at 10.20 pm .
It then heads back direct to Singapore at 11.15 pm arriving at 5.15 am Singapore time . All previously mentioned times were local at their ports .
All passengers from Singapore are off loaded at Sydney , with those finishing at Sydney leaving and going out through the usual channels .
Those going on to Canberra are diverted into a separate channel to re-enter the normal concourses , except that you must go through another luggage check inspection by Australian staff before you are released to await the flight to Canberra .
Just what you want after getting up about 5 am , going to Changi airport and then catching SQ 288 for a 10.30 am takeoff for the 8 hour flight to Sydney .
This flight appears to often take off from B 9 in Terminal 3 so we were pre warned that it was a longggg walk from the SQ lounge or the main shop areas . Be warned .
Regarding the shops, be aware that Singapore is anti smoking , with penalties for dropped butts and a recent law that corrals the Orchard/Scott’s Roads vicinities into dedicated smoking areas . These areas are in the open , with no shade nor cover , marked by painted lines . Enough said . I am not sure if it is enforced all over the island . I have never smoked but I pity my poor wife . 
On the subject of nicotine be very aware that Singapore does not appear to allow the sales of some nicotine-containing medications to replace actual cigarette use from pharmacies . My wife , a mild smoker , more nervous , carries an aerosol nicotine-containing spray Nicorette spray . You spray it under your tongue .
As my wife was running out of her supply after three weeks away we visited a local pharmacy where the pharmacist told us that the spray was not available in Singapore, but they could offer the same name in a lozenge to suck or a patch to wear .
My wife has tried both of those and the patch brings up bloody wheals on her skin whilst the oral dose causes gastric irritation . 
She would usually use the oral spray on long haul planes, but had run out on her second last day . Fortunately, during the transit time in Sydney I was able to rush to a pharmacy near the boarding gate and buy one for her .
Back at Changi airport , it does have dedicated areas where , open to the air , smokers can satisfy their craving.  Two things to remember . 
My wife had used all her cigarettes at the place that we were staying at and thought that she could buy a small packet at the airport duty free to get her blood levels up before the flight .
Tricky , as the major retailer who owns the shops will only sell a minimum of three packs of 20 you have a problem . Australia only allows one lot of 25 back in duty free .
Begrudgingly I bought the three packs , my wife went into the smoking lockup and got her blood levels up , and then kept the open pack and gave away the other two packs to the smoker who seemed to be the only one in the crowd who had a lighter .
Do you know that it seems impossible to buy a light or matches inside Changi .
No shop seemed to have them , we tried .
Anyway , overall Singapore has the cheapest and best taxis in the world , each driver is helpful and eager to practise his English , they all have meters and think you are crazy if you tip , not a Singaporean practice , jewellery shops seem happy to discount certified Jade by 80 percent , and it is hot and humid .
Maccas are spotless and more tasty than those in other countries .
Alcohol and car prices are ridiculous but saw more Mercedes , McLarens and Lamborghinis  than in fashionable Sydney suburbs .
The flight , comfortable , food ok and the drinks ok on daytime flights .
My steak was very palatable but cutting it was like trying to cut up a rubber eraser.
Staff always pleasant, my wife , a movie buff , was not impressed by the choice .
Typical huge SQ Business seats but I still cannot work out the controls after many flights . One major annoyance with the food table . Because of the layout of the Business seat the table rises from an angled side wall and will not swing around in front of you , so that you have to eat at 45 degrees . If I had short arms it would be fine but I am tall so have long arms and have to eat with my elbows up around my ears .
I just wish Qantas would fly out of Canberra internationally with big planes , rather than out of Sydney or Melbourne
label: positive

text: A great way to fly! It was a treat to fly home to Singapore from NYC after a 12 day business trip in Suites. I usually fly Business and the inflight service and hard product are already very good.  In Suites, the service was a notch higher than in Business (if that is at all possible). The food was also a notch higher than in Business (which is already very good). The Suites product (the first generation suites product) is still very good.  The full length bed was extremely comfortable. All of this led to an excellent flight.
label: positive

text:
World class service I would like to compliment the crews on the flight SQ 387 from Barcelona to Singapore. It was such an exceptional experience as compared to any other airlines that I had been on.

I was welcomed into the aircraft by a steward named Reuben, whom had shown a welcoming smile and pointed me in the direction to my seat.

I had sprained my right ankle as I was travelling through Barcelona the day before, up till the flight, I was still walking with a slight limp. I guessed that the slight limp had caught the keen attention of the crews as I was walking to my seat. They had checked for my well-being with empathy and politeness, offered me a change of seats to ensure better convenience which I had declined.

Shortly after the first meal service, the crew had made an ice pack for my ankle and it came along with a small towel. It was a great relief as the walking that happened before the flight had caused my ankle to swell even more. The ice pack was changed for a total of 5 times throughout the flight by different cabin crews. They had been so consistent with their sincere and genuine service by doing so.

They had also informed me that should I require any assistance for the movement around the aircraft, I could always press the “call” button to alert them, and they would ask the steward to assist me as soon as possible. Even though I had not asked for this assistance during the flight, it was such a warm gesture and an extra mile in service. I was not sure if all the crews in Singapore Airlines had this level of service, but the crews on this flight had definitely set the bar for me.

I would like to specially commend these crews Eileen, Pek Yun, Rong Yan, Ee Hua, Charles, Pantha and Sanjani. They had shown me their utmost care and concern in absolute kindness and professionalism throughout the 13 hours of the flight. They had managed to make this flight as enjoyable and comfortable for me to the best of their efforts.

The flight had departed smoothly and arrived on time with a great landing, thanks to Captains Morgan and John, and Senior First Officer Jeremy in the flight deck.

I would like to thank the airline, the in-flight manager and the crews for making this wonderful experience possible. I would definitely share this experience with others and would surely travel with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Very disappointing  We traveled from Melbourne to Singapore premium economy. I have flown premium economy previously with Virgin Australia and you could not compare the two services. We were not offered a drink before takeoff-on Virgin you are offered champagne or water. The cabin crew also serviced the economy section as well as premium economy but with Virgin you have your own designated premium economy crew. The food was terrible-a doughy pastry and that was all-it was an overnight flight but would have expected something lighter and tastier. This food was the same as economy so no different. Virgin serves you individually and you are given crockery and cutlery not plastic. Also cabin was not really separated from economy- they didn’t even close the curtain dividing the two areas! Also we had to use the economy toilets as there are none in premium economy-Virgin have designated toilets. The seats were spacious but other than that, I am not sure why we paid double the economy fare for this premium economy. Virgin also have a cabinet filled with snacks and drinks which you can help yourself to during the flight -nothing available on Singapore. A generally disappointing experience and definitely not worth the extra money.
label: negative

text:
Wonderful Experience The overall experience made the trip an enjoyable one. 
The crew were, professional, attentive and care about details. 
The adjustable headrest made it easier to rest my head.
The entertainment system is by far the best. It has a wide range of selections and the movies are up to date.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines A380---better that A350..but still inferior In my previous review of the A350 flight to Christchurch, I pointed out that their business class seats were most uncomfortable for stretching out or sleeping, as one could not stretch out straight or lie straight; \but at an acute angle. I expected more from the A380 and was disappointed ; once again you could only stretch at an angle. The angle was less steep in this aircraft and there was better support. The seat belt arrangement too, was better and not uncomfortable. But when Qatar, Emirates, Etihad etc can give you seats that stretch out straight and are super comfortable when fully flat, I wonder why SQ chose such an awkward seat design.
The SQ service was , of course, top notch,though one thing stumped me. I ordered a cappucino after lunch; the stewardess brought it and left it on my table without any sugar or a stirrer. I assumed sugar was already added; and tasted it...no sugar. So I had to buzz for sugar and a stirrer. Intrigued, and wondering whether it was just an oversight by my stewardess, I asked my wife to order one. Can you believe it, the same thing happened!
label: neutral

text: Professional but expensive I have flown out by Singapore Airlines many times and among the airlines plying on that sector Singapore Airlines would probably rank above some others. I like their regimentation for boarding as it cuts the confusion that gets created in the isles of the airplane. The food served from Singapore to Melbourne which I travelled in premium economy lacked taste and its presentation was poor. Flying out of its base - Singapore, using a caterer that can add a taste of Singapore would improve the food quality. The premium economy provided slightly larger seat and recline was perhaps a wee bit more than that on economy – not a flat bed. Even on premium economy one shares the toiletso the wait can be long. Instead of earphone I got head phones and leg rest but at what cost.  As regards beverage, Smirnoff Vodka ranks at the bottom of Vodka's and that is what I had which I left and changed over to a reasonably OK red wine. The sector from Singapore to Melbourne should cater for one to two more variety of red and white wine as the travellers on that sector are more exposed to drinking wines especially in the premium economy.
label: neutral

text: Bad customer service/ good inflight service I have a mixed review for SIA. The inflight service was excellent and the staff on the both to and from Kuala Lumpur were excellent. However, the customer service in Changi is terrible. Our flight from Kuala Lumpur to Singapore was delayed by 50 minutes and SIA had changed their schedule, so we had a 10 hour stop-over at Changi. Our request for a meal vopucher or the use of a lougnge was refused. Apparently SIA no longer provides meal vouchers. This came as a bit of a shock to us as we have been flying with SIA since 2008, sans the Covid years, and they were well known for their customer service then. Not anymore.
label: negative

text: Terrible Check in was very slow, worse then easyJet or Ryanair, boarding was slow, seats were very very cramped on the Boeing 777 plane, the food was inedible! Vegetarian roll was just grated carrot, 1 roll was rock hard, chicken dish all sinew and gristle, tea cold, I expected great things from the world number one, boy was I disappointed!! The stewards were very pleasant and helpful but other than that it was very poor. I have flown with easyJet and Ryanair and both met expectations, but I expected better from Singapore air. . Customer service terrible, complained about daughters flight and didn’t even get a reply.

text:
SQ 421 Hey guys just flew SQ 421 and it was simply awesome. It was a perfect business travel.
The lounge in mumbai was quite good and so was the food.
Flight was amazing, so comfortable . Travelled with my parents and wife and it was simply amazing. Cabin was great as well. 

Must try people .

text: Felt cheated and disappointed, have no way to response to SQ due to the way they had design the customer serbice system. Received an email from Singapore Airlines on an upgrade which cost EUR384/pax/per trip. So I quickly jump in and paid, however when I receipt the email, then did I noticed that it was an upgrade for premium economy only. I felt sad and wanted to request to change back to original seats, however was unable to, and also had a hard time trying to contact customer service team of Singapore Airlines. It was like they design the system in a way which we can't get through to a live agent via FB messaging and SQ apps. very disappointed in the service rendered.
label: negative

text:
Economy vs Premium Economy Pros: Awesome in-flight service, solid safety records, young and modern aircraft/fleet, clean, reliable and efficiently operated 5-star airline. 

Cons: Expensive, the huge price difference between SQ economy and the Premium Economy doesn't match with the service/seat upgrade you get. In-flight wifi is expensive and limited compared to other airlines. Uploading or downloading a single picture on Wifi did not work on my 13+ hour flight due to slow speeds. GSM roaming doesn't work (you will know this only after you have paid).
label: positive

text: Top class airline  Everything about this flight was exemplary. The food was excellent with a choice of local or western, the seats where comfortable and the staff where very friendly. Would definitely recommend to anyone.
label: positive

text:
Not the Best I hadn't flown Singapore Airlines for about 30 years, so decided I should try them again. To be honest, I wish I hadn't. In the past I had found them to be pretty good but over recent years have flown Cathay and Virgin. 
On all four legs of my flight, I had selected (and paid extra) for the front row of Premium Economy. The extra leg room was great. When boarding my flight from Singapore to Melbourne, I found a woman and her child in my seat. I had to argue with her to return to her ticketed seat. Non of the cabin crew came to assist. That aside, I would have to say the whole Premium experience with Singapore Airlines fell way below that of other airlines.No welcome drink, a WAY below average amenities travel pack, no dedicated toilet, no dedicated staff, poor on-board service, and not clean! (I had to clean the tray table that the previous traveller had spilt red wine all over).

I chose Singapore Airlines as their flight times suited my itinerary, but, for the extra price paid, I would be reluctant to fly them again.
label: neutral

text: Great vegan experience  We had an absolutely amazing trip with Singapore airlines. Both of us travelling requested vegan meals and the airline was so efficient in both their recognition of this dietary requirement and also the delivery. Within minutes of being on the flight one of the friendly team came round and placed a sticker on our seat, we were then offered meals in advance of other guests ( Advantage of having a vegan meal), the food was incredible quality, lots of vegetables and  Nutritionally well-balanced, would definitely fly with Singapore again
label: positive

text: Home away from home! The familiar feeling. Home away from home. Excellent service and facilities. Should never be taken from granted.
label: positive

text: Staff and aircraft amazing From check in to reloading in Singapore for Sydney everything was quality. Food was a little weird...Curley or noodles for breakfast, but there was always something for others to eat.
label: positive

text: 13 hours of flying never felt better I’ve flown this leg multiple times and I’ve been impressed with the consistency in the service, food, and experience. The attendants never fail to impress and go out all the way to make you feel at home and to help you. I’m forever loyal to Singapore air!
label: positive

text: Chef meal I ordered the chef choice for dinner on my way back. The spicy Thai fish dish was well prepared and way better than the Rock Pool inspired Qantas Business flight. However the lobster thermidor was too creamy for my liking. It was a beautiful flight served by professional airline crew. My favourite is Cathay followed by SQ.
label: positive

text: Used to be better The service quality has been drop. Variety of food and beverages is not comparable to  Malaysia or even Sri Lanka airlines.
label: neutral

text: First time to Singapore for my sister. As always a very pleasant flight with attentive crew. The online check-in was so easy. Food and drinks were very good and got to enjoy a couple of movies I had previously missed out on seeing.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic airline Travelled to Australia via Singapore with a 12 hour stay in Singapore.we didn’t get a chance to see Singapore but it looks a beautiful city.Singapore airport is fantastic and my flight flew in and out of Terminal Three in Singapore the airport is fabulous great food on offer shops.The butterfly garden is lovely they were all asleep when we went in.Pools with koi carp and displays of orchids make this one of the nicest airports.
I flew economy to Australia as my family were in economy and my return was in premium economy.Economy seats are ok you just get a little extra leg room in premium plus you get off the plane a little sooner and you can book the chef also you are given noise cancelling headphones which are great,the amount of onboard entertainment is emended.All in all economy is ok.The cabin crew on board are very attentive and regularly come around with water or fruit juice for hydration.The meals are alway good with a good selection depending on where you are seated sometimes the meal is unavailable but they ensure on the next round of meals they start serving at the other end so you don’t miss out a second time.The cabin staff are always kind and courteous.One other thing that impressed me was the toilets,on some other long haul airlines I have flown on don’t pay attention to the cleanliness of the facilities which can get very untidy and wet under foot.The toilets seemed to be cleaned and stocked up on a regular basis with mouth wash and hand cream available.I would not hesitate to recommend this airline
label: positive

text: Never use this airline Flight was delayed, I was switched to an inferior airline for my second flight with no food or drink, my luggage was delayed and singapore airlines refused to help find it saying it was not their responsibility. Three months after raising a formal complaint with the airline I have had no answer and my follow up emails are ignores and there is no way of phoning them.  I had also booked direct with the airline which was more expensive wrongly thinking I would get better service
label: negative

text: 1am Flight Melbourne to Singapore on the 19th January 2019 First I tried to use points with additional cash upgrade online. It was approved, then SIA reneged on it after debiting my credit card. I spent over two hours on the phone trying to sort it out - then was asked to prove they had debited my Visa account - I said excuse me are you saying i am lying ? Then I asked for a supervisor, they didn't want the escalation. Reason, because I ran a 4000 person call centre - they lose points if they don't resolve it, bad luck about me and their attitude. I got the supervisor and he looked at the copy of the transaction i sent. Then 20 minutes later after rubbish music someone came back to me and said Finance will get back to you - when oh in 4 days time. They never got back to me!!! they did reverse the debit payment on my credit card. So, I still decided on an upgrade to Premium Economy - the seat didn't go back, and the legroom was no better than economy. I flew home Qantas on a A380 and sat in 83H, the seat went well back and legroom was better than Singapore Airlines - disappointing as I have used them for years.
label: neutral

text: The Best Airlines Myself and Partner traveled to Brisbane from LHR and after a lot of planning we decided to stop over in Singapore at the teminal Airport Hotel with a 13 hr stopover the 1st part was flying in a A380 BRILLIANT plane even in Economy 5* travel and drinks and Food the service was 2nd to none great hotel at singapore and 2nd Leg in a A360 also Brilliant When its a Journey of a lifetime WE was not Dissapointed and We have traveled with Multiple airlines over the Years INCLUDING 1st class with some ,SINGAPORE is NO 1
label: positive

text: Good flight Great inflight service!  Customer service can be improved.  We were on hold for about an hour, to make changes to our flight, and also received poor communication when it came to modifying changes for our flight.
label: neutral

text:
The little bit extra is worth it Couldn’t have been better.

Check-in, including baggage, was self serve at Changi and even though I hadn’t done previously, took no more then 5 minutes. Departure was as scheduled. Flight was as I always expect of Singapore Airlines. Staff were courteous, professional, friendly and attentive when required. I was pleased with the meal, a quality beer and the media options were plenty. Seats were comfy and as I’m over 190 cm, that’s not always the case. 

I have flown with many airlines. They are proficient, I get to my destination and the planes are clean. They do the job. For me Singapore Airlines have found that extra couple of percent. It’s not much but the difference is huge. I get to my destination feeling relaxed and content. I don’t dread the flight and the time it takes from my holiday, I enjoy it as a part of the experience.

If I have the option, I travel only Singapore. I generally costs more but quality costs more. Always exceptional.
label: positive

text: Worst airlines experience in 25 years They lost my baggage and destroyed my holiday. No compassion no revert to follow up emails for compensation. Zero accountability airline
label: negative

text:
Comfortable seat I flew in Singapore Airlines early this year to Singapore. 

After a while this was the first time I was flying from Colombo to Singapore in Singapore Airlines.

They have upgraded the aircraft to new A350-900s. This allowed more leg space and better facilities within the aircraft.

As always the service of the crew was very good and very friendly.

I noticed that even for some passengers with low communication ability, they were very patient.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Our long flight was made less onorous by the excellent staff and service provided by this airline. The inflight entertainment was excellent, catering to a large variety of genres. The food was very good also
label: positive

text: One of the best airlines known for inflight service Singapore airline’s service is consistently well above average amongst all the premium airlines. We have flown this airline many times and were satisfied each time with their overall performance.
label: positive

text: Very good airline, with one disappointment Definitely one of the best airlines in the world for service, we flew business class between Singapore and Brisbane return, mostly it was a great experience but on both sectors they advertised 2 Chardonnay choices, one being excellent and the other not at all a business class standard wine, unfortunately both sectors only had the very average wine, this maybe petty however both myself and my husband only drink Chardonnay, no other style of wine so this was very disappointing considering how much you pay for a business class ticket.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines  flights This is the second time I have flown with Singapore airlines.  I would highly recommend flying with them they are comfortable and plenty of food and drink
label: positive

text:
They cancelled the flight now I have to pay the travel agent £50 for rebooking with Singapore Airlines great!!! NOT They cancelled the flight now I have to pay the travel agent £50 great!!! NOT

They dont care about their customers, if they cancel the flight, we just shoulder the additional admin fee for it to be transferred. No offer for pay per lounge . My original booking was only 2 hour wait from Chianggi now it will be 8 hours. I have to bite the bullet and pay the travel agent otherwise I will lose the seat.

I WONT TRAVEL WITH THEM IN THE FUTURE THAT IS FOR SURE
label: negative

text: Poor seating design Terrible business class seat design. Although the seats are lie-flat beds, there is a very small hole to put your feet and you have to sleep in diagonal. I am 185 cm and the seat is simply not long enough. It is not comfortable at all. The food is very ordinary for business class. Wine selection is however good. Entertainment is average with not enough movies.
label: neutral

text:
Our Flight Experience When we booked we had middle row window side seats, or back row middle section seats as our choice. Took window side. 24 seats all up. The good stuff. Priority check in. Ample baggage allowance which includes priority stickers, so bags usually come through more quickly.  Priority boarding after Business Class. First served for drinks and meals. Menu has a starter, choice of 3 mains and a dessert, plus cheese and crackers. Limited wine choice of 1 white (Sav Blanc)and 1 red (Cab Sav), though it does include champagne. Food choices are pretty much the same as economy. Generally we enjoyed the food, but chicken salad starter had chicken so overcooked it couldn't be cut let alone eaten. The not so good. We had 2 lots of 2 x 10 hr flights and the firm seats were getting rather uncomfortable by the end of all flights. No toilet specifically for Premium Economy passengers, just use the economy ones with everyone else. Seats slightly wider with each row being 2 x 4 x 2. Seats do recline a little more than economy, but when the person in front of you reclines their seat and you are dinning, you can still end up with your wine being knocked over and food pushed on to the floor. Person in the aisle seats still has to get out to let the person beside them get out. Only the front row has more leg room. There is a box (possibly the entertainment box) that sits under all the aisle seats which limits foot room. Good variety of
movies and other entertainment to chose from. We take our own noise cancelling headphones, so can't comment on the headphones
provided by the airline. The crew are lovely and very helpful and the
safety video is beautiful. Is it worth the extra cost for Premium
Economy, possibly, but next time we will go Premium Economy on Air NZ, it's far better.
label: positive

text: Very pleasant experience, if you can afford it :-( Late overnight flight to LHR, departing Singapore. Krisflyer lounge at T3 was really quite busy for that time of night - so don't look for a relaxed peaceful experience. Boarding was efficient, as always. Flying on A380-800 version 3, which comes with the latest 2017 J seating (see MainlyMiles.com for more details). Business class on an all-upper deck configuration. The cabin is missing the centre row of luggage compartments, which gives the cabin a very airy spacious feel. The seating is really luxurious, with ample storage space and the latest touch screen IFE boasting crystal clear vision for those of you who *must* watch these things. Seats have a privacy divider for the centre aisles, which allows you to interact or shelter from your neighbour. The wraparound wings on the seat give you great privacy overall, if that is your wish. Seat controls are electronic and allow you to configure your seat in multiple positions, including the lie flat position. A pair of noise cancelling headphones is provided. I found the lie-flat seats perfectly comfortable, but other feedback was that due to the slant angle, it was slightly difficult to get a comfortable position. All other aspects of service were as good as SQ usually achieves, but then, to be honest, I am not very demanding there - a friendly smile will tick the boxes for me! There is no denying that the price of business class is high on SQ (very high??!), but if you get the new layout, I think this is a really special way to travel.
label: positive

text: Don't expect any customer service Be warned, book anywhere else. Singapore Airlines used to be great but those days are gone. They will happily and quickly take your money but good luck ever getting it back if you are owed a refund. I have been given the run around for 8 months now. Call center is absolutely useless with no power. Refund department does not reply to emails for months. You can't talk to a real person in refunds. They don't write down your information in the call center, calls aren't logged with you information. I have provided them my contact details on 5 occasions and when i call, every time they say there are no contact details on file. Basically a fraudulent company using customers as a bank. There should be a lawsuit against this company.
label: negative

text: London As always we choose to fly with Singapore Air and the trip was part of the visit. Excellent service, comfort, lovely food. We had another wonderful experience and will definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Excellent service We flew Singapore Airlines from Heathrow to Adelaide via Singapore using both the airbus 380 and the dreamliner. The 380 was a brilliant and extremely comfortable plane with plenty of legroom including rockers for your feet, this aircraft was far superior to the dreamliner which we took to and from Changi to Adelaide although this was also a comfortable plane. The service provided throughout all flights was beyond reproach with in flight food and drinks on tap served by the politest staff you can imagine. 5star treatment even in economy class.
label: positive

text: Fly the best We have two flights, kolkata-singapore, singapore-bali. Both the flights were very much adhere to the timings. The service given by air hostess and stewards are very much appreciable. The food served was hot and delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our flight.
label: positive

text: Good flight Our flight on Singapore Airways was as expected, on time and as comfortable as you could expect in economy. In flight meals were tasty.
label: positive

text: On the top of my list. Impeccable service, good food and just a very comfortable flight on this long route and also for the connecting flight to Manila. I will definitely choose this airline again.
label: positive

text:
They used to be the best, but not any more! Due to Covid, my husband and I have been in separate countries for the last 7 months, him in Cambodia me in Vietnam.  My husband was due to fly from Phnom Pneh to LA this weekwhere I would meet him and we would then travel on to Mexico, but because of the ineptitude and attitudes of ground staff at PP this has not happened.  We have been in constant contact with the airline since then requesting a refund - they refused him a boarding pass, saying because he travels on a UK passport then he is not allowed entry into the US.  This is totally wrong, he only cannot travel to US if he has been in UK in the last 14 days (remember, he's been in Cambodia for the last 7 months).  Yesterday I got that in writing from the US embassy in PP. 
I won't got into the attitude given - that's for another time and place.  Back to the refund - they either want to charge us a cancellation fee, or we have to wait until they 'conduct a full investigation' before they will 'consider' issuing a full refund.  This is not acceptable treatment from a 5 star airline, and far from what we would expect from Singapore Air
label: negative

text: Day time flight Good flight en excellent service starting by check in, during flight and luggage handling. The food was better than average and a wide range of drinks available.
label: positive

text: Super Flight Excellent flight, very polite friendly stewardesses - paid for extra legroom, which was great - food was good the service very attentive, lots of overhead room, and the 13 hour flight passed away so quickly - boarding & disembarking went without a hitch just smoothly & well oiled - what a difference efficiency makes - very pleasnt journey - highly recommended
label: positive

text: The non-stop between Newark and Singapore was an expensive personal disappointment! I can't believe that I spent so much of my own money (over US$7000 RT) for the convenience of a non-stop that was so uncomfortable that I didn't get a moment's sleep (in either direction).  Nor could I sit comfortably!  In my opinion, the seat design is weird and requires one to twist one's body in order to sleep flat or even sit.  I noticed that the leg support only supported 3/4 of the seat so one leg was essentially unsupported -- when it worked.  And on my flight between SIN and EWR the leg support malfunctioned and wouldn't stay elevated.  There was only one other seat to move to in that section of business class so I guess the seat issues don't seem to bother other passengers.  But honestly, I would have been happier paying for United Polaris service with a stop than to be subject to these seats for so many hours!!!  For the sake of full disclosure, there are a handful of seats in Business Class where it is possible to sit and lie with a straight spine.  Even though I asked for one of these and they were available at the time I booked back in August, SIA said they were reserved for mothers traveling with infants.  Well, in reality, on my flights these seats were occupied by businessmen who must have had greater clout than me!  I was not very happy....  SIA are reputed to have the best service in the air and that was fine.  But this was business class and NOT first class and I thought that this was nothing special....  The meals were ok and not great.  The western dishes were almost accompanied by bland carrots and green beans which were too al dente for me to chew.  I was slightly happier with the Asian meals.  Further, the cabin crew made no effort on either flight to ask whether non-sleeping passengers would like any of the snack options.  Nor did I see the packaged ones on a tray where people could help themselves...  But what really got me is that there were no amenities to speak of on the way back to EWR whereas there was a kit on the flight to Singapore.  I asked for some lip balm and was told that there wasn't any on board.  I protested saying that I was given some on the flight between EWR and SIN (although I had to ask for some because it wasn't in the kit).  It blew me away when I was informed that lip balm is a First Class item and we were, after all, only in Business Class.  I consider that to not be a luxury on a 17 hour flight!!!  And then I was informed that the kits were only being handed out in the first 90 days of service but, in fact, my outbound flight had been 3 1/2 months after the initiation of this service....  To the credit of the crew serving my area of the cabin, they appreciated how miserable I was and offered a very small service recovery gesture.  It was a kind gesture and probably all they could do inflight but it was woefully inadequate considering the value of my airfare.  I'm sure there are enough business people whose companies are willing to pay for the non-stop service but for me this was a SABENA (for those old enough to remember: Such A Bad Experience Never Again)!!!
label: neutral

text: Superb flight and service As a frequent travellers and flyers,  I can only say,  my title says it all from booking in to disembarkation.  everything went so smooth and the ground staff, airline staff, Pilot and crew made our 12 hour trip a breeze.  No complaints or negatives from us, we'll defiantly use Singapore Airlines again.  One thing they could inprove on, is the inflight the film selection, it's pritty boring!!! hope you enjoy your flight as we did. If you found this review helpful, I'd appreciate your tick, thanks. BM
label: positive

text: FLY IN COMFORT This is a really comfortable airline.Food is very edible for air flight food.If your wanting to watch movies during your flight you need to sign up throughsilk air before boarding your flight.This is my second flight to Phuket using this service and I highly recommend it.If wanting more leg room you can organise this when booking or before your return flight.I personally found it pretty good.But opted for more leg room on the return flight home.
label: positive

text: Excellent experience, hugely improved cabin Very well designed and improved comfort on this A380 aircraft in the business class sector. The seats were very comfortable, easy to adjust, bed making is easier, everything is at a finger touch ! Very very comfortable and bravo ! The food was very good with different choices of meals, wines and good champagne. Inflight entertainment was a real deal with touch screen comfort - this is a HUGE improvement. Well done Singapore Airlines - not a wonder you are the world's best airline !
label: positive

text: A Great Way to Fly Good timing.  Fly there in the morning at about 8.20am and reaching around 12+.  Service was good which was why it has always been my preferred choice of airline whenever I travel.
label: positive

text: Flight back to the uk  I have travelled on many airlines , however this airline is by far the best. The staff are like robots never stop always smiling and helping that was for 10 hours straight . The food was good , thumbs up 👍
label: positive

text: Always a Great Way to Fly Singapore to Bangkok onboard Singapore Airlines’ new B787-10 was a very pleasant experience. The hard product was great as the seats boasted great leg room and recline which is good for an aircraft that is servicing regional routes. The service and catering is what one would expect from Singapore Airlines and the Krisworld IFE is also world class with a myriad of entertainment options to chose from. Overall, it was a joy to fly with Singapore Airlines, a great way to fly!
label: positive

text: Good but inconsistent service My family of five have had good experiences while travelling on flight number SQ346  on a A380 from Singapore to Zurich in Switzerland  on 18 December for our holiday in Europe from 18-27 December 2018. The service on our first encounter provided by flight stewards were amazing and lived up to the high standards of Singapore Airlines especially by Mr Teo Ming Zhong and his colleagues whom we were deeply impressed. Food were great and services were first class. However, on our return night flight on Singapore Airlines via SQ321 also on a A380 on 26 December, the service provided was a let down though. Food were as good anyway as expected of SIA. The flight stewardesses attended us were of sub standard quality where simple requests like asking to remove used cups and little food containers at the very moment when they came over to serve main courses were met with blunt refusals and excuses like " I can't do it now as I am serving food" and the like. My request to redeem the small fruit pack were also turned down after I missed my turn when I was asleep and woke up to see the handing out of the same had just passed me a few seats in front. Reply given was there wasn't anymore left. When I insisted my share as I observed many were also bypassed during the serving round and there had to be some more available and fair enough, one of the flight attendants came back minutes later with a pack and told me on my face that this was the only one left. As the flight was a long haul of 13 hours continuous flight, I took the trouble of walking around the cabin area for some simple stretching and  went  to the loo and to my surprise, I saw the same little fruit packs were available in abundance both at the serving area in front of our seating section and also at the upper deck serving area together with the packets nuts, crackers, biscuits and buns. This is displeased to say the least. The service I encountered this time round was a far cry compared with the  experience I had on 18 December. In addition to the bad experience of the 2 young flight stewardesses, one of the toilets at the far end on the plane has no water for washing hands and a bottle of mineral water was used as a replacement and most of the time it was emptied and no one was filling it up. I hope that being part of a group tour and be seated at the far end of a plane would not be the reason for the indifferent quality of service provided.
label: neutral

text:
Fantastic flight to Denpasar Travelled on Singapore Airlines Flight SQ 942 from Singapore to Denpasar-Bali in the first week of November.

The aircraft was a brand new 787-10 - vibrant and fresh-looking aircraft. As in Singapore Changi T2, the security screening took place at the boarding area. We were given a customs declaration form post security screening which had to be shown to the authorities at Ngurah Rai International Airport.

As I was arriving from Ahmedabad and connecting to Denpasar, I unfortunately can't comment on the check-in part.

Once inside, the experience was wonderful. Hot towels were given to passengers of all classes, hot meal (brunch) was served. Being vegetarian, a special meal (Vegetarian Indian Meal) was served to me, which was tasty.

The flight departed on time and landed on time, too. The landing was good. Cabin Crew were all smiles and helpful and efficient. 

Recommend Singapore Airlines for a comfortable journey.
label: positive

text:
I heard it was the best, but After 4 long flights(2 each way on Singapore) and the 4 short flights (2 each way on other airlines) we made it to our destination. We had a 16.5 hour flight from San Francisco to Singapore and then a  10 hour flight to Johannesburg. Long flights, one flight crew was better than the other, but I can't remember which. One had their act together and their other seemed like they were in training.  That being said, it must be hard for the employees to work such a long flight, I give them all kudos for that. I would rate Singapore Air # 2 after Emirates AIr.
Sorry
label: neutral

text:
Keep up the good work So many airlines are cutting costs which are noticeable when travelling economy class.
I have travelled on many airlines and would definitely rate Singapore airlines at the top for economy travel. They still have the little extras like hot towels, numerous trips up and down the aisles throughout the flight with a tray of juices and water and snacks if required. They have very pleasant staff and a decent selection of meals. For the past couple of years I have used Singapore airlines as they have also offered the best price for long haul travel for the time of year I required.  Will definitely use them again next year.
label: positive

text:
Great flight Always like flying with Singapore Airlines. The staff are very nice, and you usually take off on time. This time I found the meal service just a little chaotic, but otherwise nothing to grumble about.
Bonus is that I think Changi airport one of the best in the world, so hanging around waiting for your flight is not so bad!
label: positive

text: Great long haul experience Probably best premium economy flight we have taken. Flight our from Manchester on A350 was best leg going out. Service was very good and extra leg room was really appreciated
label: positive

text:
Reliable airline from best airport I know anywhere.  Singapore airport really is the top of the list and so full of trop Staff are on the go all the time and keep toilets clean and supplied with toilet paper.
The staff work as a team and respond quickly to requests such as that extra pillow.
label: positive

text: Efficient flight Just a typical economy flight, all went smoothly, food was fine but we waited a long time to get our meals. Singapore airport was interesting.
label: positive

text: Top-rate airline I don't really enjoy flying but Singapore Airlines do make the experience as good as it can be.  The staff are lovely and the food is better than on most airlines.  I feel safe with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Good Flight,  great staff  We  recently flew to  London Heathrow from Singapore airport. It was a long flight but the staff made it a slick service from start to finish.  Economy is ok, not terrible but obviously not the best. The cabin crew    frequently offered drinks both alcoholic and non-alcoholic.  The food options were of good quality ,tasty and plentiful. 
The earbuds  were  cheap quality and  not particularly comfortable,  however,  the choices of entertainment were very varied. Really enjoyed the films etc on offer. 
The cushion and blanket were very comfortable. 
Would recommend airline in future.
label: positive

text: Good time to check in Was a good flight just took a bit of sorting, we originally booked to fly from Wellington to Singapore via Canberra and arranged hotels to suit, however Singapore airlines changed their schedule to Tavel via Melbourne instead and leave a day earlier (thank goodness for travel insurance) Good time of day to depart 1.30 pm and a nice short 3 1/2 flight and stretch our legs for 1 1/2 hours. The next leg was also a relatively easy 7 1/2 hours arriving @10.30pm local time. I find the seats and legroom on the Singapore Boeing 777 much better than other airlines (they use a 3-3-3 wide seat configuration not the tight 3-4-3. Food was good (for airline food) good service, very polite and helpful cabin staff, good baggage allowance 30kg. The restrooms were kept really clean throughout the flight. Good flight from Wellington, I will use this again both to Singapore and to Melbourne, easy and hassle free and good arrival times at both stops. Flight left and arrived on time. Also...forgot to mention the hot towels... nice touch
label: positive

text: Krysflyer Customer Service I have never and I mean never been treated so poorly by the Krisflyer redemption desk. I’ve been trying to book my first class plane ticket for over four months and I cannot get any answers out of anyone. All they do is hang up on me and I am being really nice? They cannot speak good English so I’m very patient and kind and they always put me on hold for long periods of time and then hang up. I can say, I wish I never transferred my miles to Singapore because this will be my last trip I ever do and I have not even gotten off the ground yet! We are so excited about flying Singapore but after the ground experience I am not so sure that this is going to be as good as we thought? I have the miles and the money but they just want to overcharge me for a first class ticket from LAX to BKK. The system will only let you book the last segment because it is business class so all you should have to do is call and ask to add the last segment at no extra miles but I always want to charge more miles and more money! Can anyone help at Singapore airlines?
label: negative

text:
Enjoyable Business Class Experience Osaka to Singapore A relatively short but enjoyable overnight flight. 

Check-in only starts around 2.5hrs before departure. For business class passengers, you get a choice of using either the JAL Sakura Lounge or some restaurants as the lounge gets very crowded with a couple of airlines using it. However, I don't think a crowded lounge is of any big issue to me as long as I can get a seat, in which mostly, people do. Offerings wise quite standard but not too bad overall. Three different type of beers available and spirits and Japanese plum wines. 

As having been on the Dreamliner several times in business, hence, seat is pretty good as usual. As flight time is only around 6 hours and they offer a sleeper service in which you can have your meal either after take off or 2.5hrs before touch down in which they will wake you up. I selected right after take off and had the hot soba with tempura, changing from the famous Hanakoireki as the outbound from SIN didn't taste as good as expected. The soba definitely tasted very good. 

Something happened just before meal service (I will not say it..haha) but as a result, chatted with the crew, the IFM Ms. E. Chan whom was really amazing. She is probably the second best ever SIA crew I ever encountered and ask her about the sleeper service as it did say passenger can choose to have a meal after take off or 2.5hrs before landing or both. I asked how does 'both' works and she say if there are remaining, they will try to serve passenger requesting for second, but she say will wake me up for the second meal. Second time round try the Hanakoireki and it certainly tasted much better than the outbound from SIN one, and being a supper service, it was half the portion which was just enough.
label: positive

text: SUPERB absolutely AMAZING WOW, what an airline - breakfast 1.5 hours outside of SIN is incredible. Eggs benedict, Singapore Airlines wow, you are incredible in EConomy, cant wait ti try in Business!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Love you
label: positive

text: FLY DURING THE DAY Just wish they could give you a little more leg room. It's just so cramped in Economy. On the way to Japan we had a nigh time flight it was almost imposable to sleep as it's just too uncomfortable. On the way home we had a day time flight I feel this is better as you can read watch movies or play games the time seems to go more quickly.
label: positive

text:
Wonderful Experience From the moment you board Singapore Airlines it is such a wonderful experience. Australia and back couldn’t have been better. The standard professionalism attention to detail, kindness and smiling throughout service is amazing. Nothing too much trouble. Their uniforms are so lovely and they pride themselves in appearance. If only other airlines took a leaf out of their book. 
The cuisine is incredible, such a fantastic choice served on crisp linen. 
For me business class is worth every penny and their lounge in Singapore is also a wonderful
Experience. This airline deserves to be No 1
label: positive

text: They Changed my seat last minute from Bulkhead Waited 5 months to get a round trip ticket with bulkhead seating due to blood clotting Disorders. Finally got middle row bulkhead. Then at last minute they switched me and did not seem to care about my medical condition that could result in DVTs  and Pulmonary embolisms on this 18 hour flight. They asked for medical proof, which was sent, and they then ignored the medical need. So so very disappointed. They know I am very prone to blood clots and have a high probability of getting one yet they gave. Away the special seat that would prevent such a problem, a seat I waited for months to get . Also separated me from my wife when they switched my seat. So for 18 hours we are now at opposite ends of the plane.
label: negative

text:
Sigh.... Used to fly SQ for SIN-JPN route often prior to pandemic, but every aspect of the flight quality level has dropped significantly after the pandemic. Not asking for more than what economy class should be, but upset to see the economy class standard is no longer the same as before. 

Like many passengers have reviewed, no more hot towel service, a few items taken off the meal tray and reduced baggage allowance. During a recent flight back from Osaka-KIX, the meal tray really look embarrassing for a top notch airline. It was Japanese curry rice which consist of 4 very small pieces of beef cubes, 3 small cubes of potato and 2 slices of carrot, with plenty of gravy on top of an onigiri sized rice; there is a bun with butter, a packet of biscuit with cheese spread and ice cream. If cost is an issue, I guess just provide each passenger a packet of Hainan chicken rice or Nasi Lemak, which probably will look more presentable and representative of SG.
label: neutral

text: Great Airline Great Airline - I would highly recommend using them. Flights arrived early or on time. The food served was delicious.
label: positive

text: Decent experience in Business Class Singapore Airlines touts itself as the best in the business.  This review is based on that benchmark.  It was a decent experience in Business Class, but not my best ever.  They have a separate entrance for business class.  Your ticket is checked as you enter and as you seat.   The FA's were helpful smiled.   The aircraft was punctual in landing and departing.  Check-in was smooth enough.  The aircraft was old, with old seats. Although no complaints with them.    The food selections were already mentioned in the menu online.  It was a decent dish of rice and meat.   My flight was during the breakfast times.  The airline did not serve any alcohol.  This was a drawback.  I would expect no time constraints.   The in-flight service was friendly and attentive.  The bathroom had a lot more amenities like shaving blades, combs etc.   I enjoyed my experience.  The Airline did its job and was punctual with its timings.  The in-flight entertainment has the most selection of movies of any airline, I have flown.  There were different languages to choose from too.
label: positive

text: Finest flight I’ve ever been on I heartily recommend Singapore Airlines to anyone going to the north of England or Scotland. A direct flight which bypasses the craziness that is London will get you To Manchester — a small convenient airport where you can easily take the train up to Scotland or rent a car and tour the north of England comfortably. The flight experience was amazing and has spoiled me for all future flights if they are not on Singapore!!
label: positive

text: Expected more from Singapore Air Funny how alot of people told me that Singapore Airlines was a great airline to fly with but I really did get this!! I am not a great flyer and do get nervous and do not prefer the back of plane. I was totally annoyed to find I was put in row 60 after advising staff of a forward seat, window or aisle or anywhere and the flight was not full. I was told I was sitting with my group (group booking) although we were all placed in different seats. The only bonus was the couple next to me moved to centre seats so I had a row of 3 to myself. The booking was group with meant I couldnt manage it online which is not usually the case with booking references unique to the traveller so couldnt request special meals or seat allocations. The service was fine, staff seemed friendly enough although check in was slow at Brisbane as there is no electronic booking. The meals were not grand as when you are at the back you have little to no choice in meals by the time they got to me so I didnt get to eat on the way over. Entertainment was very average, not much choice of decent or current movies and screens were hard to see, very low quality on the plane I had. Embarking and disembarking were fine but did feel the cleanliness was a bit below average. There was dried drink on my trays etc so felt a bit dirty. Same issue on the way home, except I had organise to have my seat changed and my ticket linked to a colleague to sit together but when we check in they had me in row 60, my colleague in row 58!! Not happy but they did change us to sit together on a full flight and up front. Only annoyance was it was a red eye flight and they still served dinner at near on midnight and we had to put our seats up so the people behind could eat there fish meal so we couldnt sleep. We had about 90 minutes of lights down before they woke us again for breakfast. Overall not my first choice for airline and think I will avoid flying again us necessary.
label: neutral

text: Visiting Australia Great airline. Really looked after. Loved the flights. Staff on board were very attentive. Choosing meals before flight was amazing. Great seat room in premium economy. Won’t travel any other way again on long haul.
label: positive

text:
Great as usual  On my flight on Monday 4 November from Johannesburg to Singapore, the cabin crew really went beyond the call of duty. 
They were super friendly and efficient.
It is always great to fly SQ and crew like this even make it better
label: positive

text:
Xmas in Ho Chi Minh City Here goes.
Online booking of flight - Excellent - Easy to do
Online check-in of flight - Excellent - Easy to do
Airport arrival check-in - Excellent - Very quick and painless
Airport lounge - Excellent - Very clean, food selection great and service from staff just right.
Flight - Excellent - Could not have asked for a better flight in all aspects. Staff, seating, food, entertainment, you name it. Definitely better than 1st class in other airlines that we have used in the past. Will be changing airline and loyalty program for all future flights.
All of the above was repeated for the return journey home. That made us very happy as it would have been a pity if one leg differed from the other.
label: positive

text: The best airline Singapore airlines is the best - from checkin to the inflight service, the flat beds in business class, everything is always perfect. They have good vegetarian options and that is a relief on long haul flights.
label: positive

text:
Dishonesty re changing flights OK 9 months out from my trip I needed to bring my flights forward by a day. According to the T&C on my booking I could do this for $70 fee. OK no worries. So I called them. Was told that there were no more seats in the class I paid for available and it would be an extra $1600 pp. more than the actual flight I paid for. So I said no. 
Did my homework, found there were seats in the class I paid for for the day before. So called them again, was told the exact same spiel as the day before and when I said I had the booking page up and there were seats at the same price/class I was told it was an "old price" not available any more. Obviously a lie. So I was fuming and got some information re trade practices. 
Called the next day and spoke to a guy this time who tried to feed me the same old lies but I was prepared this time and lo and behold he said that seats just became available on that flight I wanted to change to. I should not have had to work this hard to get what was right and fair. I have read others who have been through the same thing as this so be aware of this common lie and obvious money grab. It is disappointing that an airline such as this who prides itself on its integrity stoops this low and treats their customers like fools. 
However the flight itself was fine, the food was good and the service good,entertainment was not that great, however my experience in changing flights was what really made me upset and not enjoy the experience as I wish I could have.
So my advice is that if you want to change flights, arm yourself with all the information you can as well as laws and don't accept nothing except what you are entitled to based on their own T&C.  Next time I will go Royal Brunei business class for not much more in price but far more in value for money.
label: negative

text: AWESOME AIRLINE Such great staff - food excellent - service prompt - clean and in air TV entertainment very good - would definitely fly with them again they made every effort to make sure we were OK
label: positive

text: So impressed!!! i flew back a couple of days ago with singapore airlines, all the way from new zealand to amsterdam. I was a bit scared to go because of the whole corona, but was met with such kindness and understanding by the phone operator even before I left which calmed my nerves. during the flight everybody was so kind and understanding, which is admirable because they are constantly being exposed to all kinds of people/maybe corona. everything was thought out off, even guiding us through singapore airport, so that we would never come in contact with anyone who was staying there (i was a transit ofcourse) forever grateful for all the happy faces and impeccable customer service. will always fly with Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Excellent staff and service The staff on Singapore Airlines were wonderful. They were very professional and friendly throughout the whole flight. We were flying for our honeymoon and they made us feel very special throughout the trip. Would highly recommend flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Watch your weight My wife and I recently flew to Stockholm on Singapore Airlines code share with SAS to celebrate Christmas and took along with a lot of presents for the family. In all our four bags weighed 96kg. We thought this was ok working on the normal SAS business class allowance of 2 x 32kg. However the leg Sydney to Singapore was under an SIA flight number rather than SAS and SIA has a weight allowance of just 40 kg each. This took some frantic repacking at the airport to squeeze under the limit. Incongruously coming back the other direction all the way to Sydney our bags could weigh 2 x 32kg under the flight rules. This would seem to be an anomaly that needs fixing.
label: positive

text: MORE THAN A FIVE STAR AIRLINE Had not flew with Singapore Airlines for some years. Recently flew SQ to Nagoya and back via Tokyo. Service was superb. Cabin staff that took care of us were cheerful and attentive especially Aldora and Eddie Neo. We had some problem with the screen and both of them were very apologetic. Looking forward to fly with SQ again
label: positive

text: Perth -Singapore-Frankfurt-New York. LA-Tokyo-Singapore-Perth Singapore to Frankfurt was a long flight, especially with tweens but the service and inflight entertainment along with the food was great and made it that little bit more enjoyable. If you can afford the upgrade to at least Premium Economy -  do it.
label: positive

text: attentive crew Very attentive flight attendants. Food very good even in economy.Would definately fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Cancelled flight then empty promises Unfortunately our flight was cancelled as we sat waiting to board. We reclaimed our cases then stood in a queue for 2hrs. We put on a bus to Heathrow after another hour. Nearly 4 hrs later we arrived at a very busy check-in. During this time we were given a sandwich,bag of crisps & bottle of water as we had missed lunch. We also had missed tea so were given £15 voucher to spend at Heathrow. Unfortunately we had to go straight from check-in to boarding they they were of no use whatsoever. We were told at Manchester that we could claim compensation. I had paid for extra leg room but of course didn't get that on the new flight (13hrs ).We arrived 10hrs 30 mins late and so missed a full day in Singapore. During the holiday I was promised 200SD in-flight vouchers as a gesture of goodwill and then heard NOTHING. I have sent e-mails to a couple of people but nobody is bothering to reply. NOT my idea of the no.1 airline !!
label: negative

text: First class on the 777 Flying Singapore first is such a treat. The 777 only has 4 first class seats and I traveled with my two parents so it felt like we had the plane to ourselves. Food was great, we did the Book the Cook option, and the flight attendant serving us was extremely attentive throughout the 15 hours of the flight. Definitely the best way to get from the US to East Asia.
label: positive

text:
Better fly to Aussie with SQ, humble crew,attentive,care,great Chang I even longer air time Longer hours from surabaya,since have go through Chang I.
My sacrifice totally redeemed by discipline,care,humble crew,excellent service.
Great food and drinks.
Chang I environment, food court are so great, economic
label: positive

text:
Restful 10 1/2 hour flight. Our original flight booking was from IAD> LAX, Los Angles with Alaskan Air(5 hours), then LAX> NRT, Tokyo with Singapore Air(10 1/2 HOURS), with our luggage checked through from IAD to NRT. 2 seats cost $1,202.
Because of my recent surgery, we decided to bid $300 to upgrade to Premium Economy being notified 48 hours before the flight that we won, providing 2 inside seats on a 2-4-2 seating configuration). This gave us more seat width(as Economy had a 3-3-3 configuration, which included a double armrest solving the inevitable encroachment of an oversize passenger. Today my neighbor was a 75 year old born in Arkansas internment camp for Japanese in 1943, who returned to Japan to teach English before retiring.
Premium Economy includes gourmet meal choices for lunch and dinner(if selected online before boarding), complementary wine/champagne, and even Ben and Jerry's Cookie Dough ice cream. The beautifully dressed stewardesses twice provided hot towels, and multiple drink and snack selections throughout the flight. At other times the room was darkened for sleeping where many passengers utilized the noise cancelling head phones to utilize the large seat monitors for its huge selection of movies, TV, games and music. 
We walked back the 2 aisles to share the ample economy restrooms stocked with mouthwash, hand lotion and toothbrushes and toothpaste.
This was our best long term flight that we truly enjoyed rather than endured.
label: positive

text:
Long trip - friendly crew Always dread a long flight and we have always found Singapore Airlines offer a good service. 
Staff are always so courteous. We are entertained by the in-flight service, catching up on favourite television shows and movies. 
Sometimes the food is to our liking or not (we tend to be fussy), but on this flight we enjoyed it all.
The toilets were close at hand and we were lucky and did not have to join a queue.
We prefer to pay the extra on flights rather than go with some of the cheaper airlines, though we would, of course, love to be upgraded one day!!!!!
label: positive

text:
High expectation but not fulfilled. Our route were between Stockholm via Moscow to Singapore. The ticket was advised as direct flight but said to have a technical stop in Moscow. 
I turned out to be a full transfer through security and rather long wait at a very depressed airport in Moscow. 

As airline I can only compare to other such as, Thai air, Qatar, Emirates and SAS when coming to long distance flights. 
Singapore is  not bad at all, but compare to what you pay Qatar has been most affordable. Qatar, Singapore and Emirates are all good airlines, but for me Qatar has impressed me the most. 
Though I must say, that Singapore Airlines has the most professional cabin crew I've met. They are almost perfect from outer appearance to being accomodative friendly. 
But the aircraft itself did not impress! 
The toilets were not very fresh and badly cleaned between the routes.  And they were super small so you had hard time turning around.  
The food (at least at the economy class) was terrible, with dry and crumbly bread and tasteless food. The other airlines I mentioned earlier had all better food and drinks. 
The seats were narrow and the only good thing about them were the adjustable food rests that I missed on the other airline's air crafts. 
But for what we paid compare to what we could get from the other airlines, I must say that I'm disapointed with Singapore. 
Going back to Singapore again, I'll rather take other airlines next time.
label: neutral

text: No doubt as Most Awarded Airline Comfortable with leg-room. polite and smiley aircrew. food was quite good. and aircrew responded to your needs quite immediate. well done SQ!!
label: positive

text:
Great service We had a great flight and the staff and service was first class 
Everything we asked for was there
My partner did not like the main course for dinner so was offered 
Somethong that was not on the menu
label: positive

text:
A little bit of luxury Having to sit in economy for 14 hours is not fun. We have flown this leg of our journey before, in both economy and premium economy. If there is any chance you can pay that bit extra for the premium economy then do it! It makes that long flight just a bit more bearable. 
We sat at the front in this section... so much more leg room.  It was worth paying the extra just for this. 
We have always had good food and service from the cabin crew. With the food and flying premium economy, we were able to order our food before flying (that way you’re guaranteed to get what you want and not what is left.)
Headphones are better too. 
We have always flown to Oz with Singapore airlines, wouldn’t think of flying with any other airline.
label: positive

text: Never again  Very disappointed with their service. Very rude FA’s to start (on my return) . Bad energy overall. Horrible food, the worst I have ever experienced on any airline. Premium economy is a joke. For double the price it’s absolutely the same as economy. Don’t be fooled. There are way too many choices/companies to fly with. Be warned.
label: negative

text: Good in flight facilities with friendly service I seldom fly with Singapore airlines but this time I choose it for the lower ticket price. To my surprise, all flight attendants are beautiful girls or handsome guys, they always smile and are willing to help. Besides, there are many tv programs and the space of the seat is enough for feet sketching. Inside the toilet, there are different stuff for usage, eg napkins, toothbrush, lotion, etc.
label: positive

text:
