Excellent once again I have been lucky to fly with Singapore airlines on several occasions.
I have also flown with other big name airlines to similar destinations and quite simply Singapore is easily the best.
This flight 13 hours from the UK to Singapore was unfortunately delayed about 3 hours. We were given a £15 voucher to spend in the departure lounge during our delay. Not great I know but last year we’re suffered the same fate with a different big name airline but received nothing.
The flight itself was as always great. Good food, snacks in between, and good service from the cabin crew. The toilets must have been regular restocked and cleaned as they were of a high standard throughout the long flight.
The Economy seats are good with a decent amount of room with plenty of pillows and blankets provided.
The entertainment system in the seat back in front of you is good with a large selection of films, tv shows, games and music.
The only negative I have is that I am still waiting to hear from Singapore airlines about my claim for compensation around the delay as I missed my connection meaning I was significantly delayed to my final destination. Under the EU laws this claim should be straight forward but Singapore seem to be dragging their feet a little.
Regardless of this issue I would always travel on Singapore if possible.
label: positive

text:
Relaxing flight Relaxing flight with very attentive and friendly crew
Food good 
Legroom ok after paying for extra legroom 
Would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Mrs Barb Well catered for with gluten free.  Comfortable and plenty of space.  First leg last row of premium economy so you don't have to worry about people behind. Second leg paid for front of premium economy.  Huge space so well worth the money.
label: positive

text: Odleif The table at the seat was not ergonomically well designed as it forced me to sit sideways. In addition, when turning the seat into a flat bed, my feet had to be turned to the right in order to get into the «tunnel» to get enough space. On most other airlines, the design allows the passengers to stretch your legs straight forward.
label: neutral

text:
This version is dated.. but it still delivers in every single way! Over the past few years I’ve flown with a lot of different airlines’s business classes, and I’ve learnt that the key to providing an amazing onboard service is getting a good grasp on all the elements, rather than doing really well with one and letting the others suffer. 

As we all know, there is no such thing as perfection.. especially when it comes to airlines, and there are always flaws but I’m reasonably confident in  the statement that Singapore Air is one of the best and covers all the relevant bases pretty damn well. 

As I said, no airline is perfect and Singapore airways is no exception. There are definitely things that I would change but on the whole they are one of my preferred airlines to travel with.  I’ve flown with Singapore a few times, but this particular review is of their old version business class on their A380-800. For those of you who aren’t plane geeks, the A380 is the double decker giant of their fleet, with downstairs holding 333 economy & 38 premium economy seats and the upper deck holding  60 business & 12 first class seats. You might be lucky to still get a version of the A380 with the old business class but if you do them your in for a treat.. savour the moment as this won’t be around for much longer!  

Although lacking an onboard bar, SQ's superjumbo’s old Business class is home to some of the widest business class seats to grace our skies. In fact the Singapore air old business class seat puts most airlines’ first class products to shame, it really is a positively enormous seat!  

Anyway before I get into it, heres some basic useful info for check in that might be useful if you decide to travel Singapore business: 
* Frequent flyer program: KrisFlyer, Star Alliance.
* Priority check-in: Keep a look out for the blue carpet and 'business class' signage at the check-in hall.
* Checked baggage allowance: 40kg, raised to 60kg for Star Alliance Gold, KrisFlyer Gold and Velocity Platinum; and 80kg for all PPS Club tiers.
* Carry-on baggage allowance: 2x115cm bags at up to 7kg each, plus one additional item such as a laptop satchel or duty-free goods.
* Priority security screening: Most airports will accommodate a priority screening lane.
* Priority boarding privileges: Business class was called to board with Suites Class (first), and airline members prior to opening the economy passengers.

  On this particular journey I was travelling back from Singapore to London Heathrow. On the way out I had sampled the New business class on a different aircraft which ill review another day! 
If you’ve ever been to Singapore you’ll know that Changi airport is one of the best in the world, its beautiful and offers endless entertainment for its guests including its own cinema, butterfly garden, and even a fully kitted out 5* Crowne Plaza hotel inside the airport.
 But for me, it was straight to the lounge to enjoy the benefits of some of the money id just spent.. 
With showers, Charles Heidsieck Champagne at any hour and calming instrumental music playing in the background, it's a great place to both relax and be productive. This particular lounge in terminal 3 is also entirely separate to the adjacent KrisFlyer Gold lounge used by frequent flyers travelling in economy, but can also be accessed by airline members flying with SQ in any class of service.
You'll also find a SilverKris business class lounge in Terminal 2 should your flight depart from there, although SQ's flights to Australia and Europe all use T3. I highly recommend taking advantage of the lounge if you have time as its a great way to have a much needed refresh before a Long flight, especially if you’re on a stopover.

After having a quick shower and freshen up and also making the most of the alcoholic beverages in the lounge, it was now time to board the plane. As I said before, SQ waste no time getting the premium passengers onboard so there is minimal waiting around.
 As soon as you’re on board you’re greeted with a smile by one of the singapore air staff who are renowned for having some of the best hospitality of any other airline. Once my ticket was checked I was guided to my seat, where I was seated for all of 30 seconds before someone brought me a glass of champagne and a hot towel. A really nice touch by SQ, and one now adopted by other airlines is that the crew have your name memorised from the manifest and for the whole flight you’ll be addressed as ‘Mr Mitchell’.. or whatever. Singapore even go there extra mile and if you’re with their loyalty programme and they have your previous flights on record, they’ll even have noted small details from your previous flights such as you having a coffee before landing for example, and just like Magic they’ll come round and offer you a coffee just before landing. It really is the nice touches like that which I love about Singapore air.

  Anyway, lets talk about the seat, as thats where you’ll be spending the next 12 hours.. Singapore Airlines old A380 boasts one of the widest business class seats in the industry, measuring a whopping 30 inches when upright.. I’m a big guy and you could’ve fit 2 of me in this huge armchair (a squeeze but still doable) it really is crazy big.
 just to do a quick comparison, emirates’ a380 business class seats are a mere 18.5 inches wide, while Etihad's business seats are at 20 inches.. a massive difference.
 However after flipping the seat into bed mode this huge width does become somewhat limited. If youve flown Singapore business before you’ll know they don’t use any conventional seat design, its unlike any other, and with these you aren’t able to turn your seat into a bed by just clocking a button. Actually its a matter of getting up and folding the back of your seat over to make it a bed. I always thought this was a bit of a bad feature and a bit of a ’steam method’ compared to other airlines but hey ho. Once this is done because of the seat configuration you have to sleep kind of diagonally so your feet slot into the space in front of the seat in front of you. Its a strange design but I’ve had it before and its not uncomfortable and still offers good space.   A little tip, get the bulkhead seats as they don’t have this problem and you’re able to practically starfish in bed!
I got the bulkhead on this flight, and even with me being 6Ft1 tall I had plenty of space and it was so bloody comfortable!
I was able to get a good 7 hours sleep on the overnight journey home to London.You can also signal that you don't wish to be disturbed from your bed If you don’t want to be woken up for meals.
When I did wake up a handy cover in front flips open to reveal a mirror so I could inspect how mental I looked after my nap.
Also tucked away are two USB power ports and a multi-country outlet so you can keep your tech juiced!
 The seats were great as far as size and comfort goes, but regrettably they were starting to show their age after debuting in 2007.
 the controls and remote were all proper old school and the buttons were mostly worn down. But you know what is just aesthetics and I can forgive them for that.  

Now I don’t remember a great deal of the taste of the food on this flight because, big shock, I was trashed.. ironically I’m not actually a great flyer and I tend to get a bit heavy on the champers when I’ve got a Long flight.. its basically tradition now and its not going to change! 
while were on the subject of champagne.. champagne lovers will also take comfort in the 2007 Taittinger Brut Millésimé.. an impressive choice when most other airlines typically reserve vintage bubbles for first class passengers. 
As for food, I know SQ offer An extensive delectables menu to fill the gaps in between meals, with 13 snack choices including noodles and sandwiches and that kind of thing which I took advantage of after breakfast.
Later in the flight lunch was served.. I had the chicken and mutton satay sticks with onion, cucumber and peanut sauce which was pretty damn good.
I also ordered a goose liver foie gras which again I really enjoyed.
For my main course I was presented with a staggering amount dishes to choose from.. there was literally like 50 choices, which lets be honest is absolute madness.. but pretty damn impressive. After taking my time reading the menu, I opted for SQ's classic lobster Thermidor. Sautéed in butter, flambéed in brandy, sprinkled with cheese and served with creamy mushroom sauce, garlic and spicy mustard, buttered asparagus and yellow rice.. it was mouth watering and beautiful.. it's again something I’d expect to find only in first class.. but it's still  a real treat for business class passengers.

  For the people like me who enjoy using a long haul flight to catch up on movies, lets just talk about their entertainment systems.. KrisWorld, SQ’s inflight entertainment system, delivers a great variety of movies and TV shows on a 15.4-inch seatback LCD screen, or you can also connect your iPhone/iPod via the data ports or something more conventional such as a portable DVD player using standard TV RCA connectors. There was a good selection on my flight and I didn’t even have enough time to watch everything that I wanted!
SQ provide Noise-cancelling headphones which do the job perfectly.. although a little uncomfortable on your ears after a few hours they’re a welcome necessity.
They offer wifi onboard at extra charge but I wouldn’t use it unless I really had to as its pretty useless at the best of times and pricey for what you get. 

Service on this flight was totally exemplary, whats great is that because of the small segregated sections of the upper deck you'll generally always be served by the same two or three crew members, who in this case took no more than 30 seconds to answer call bells and were so attentive that often two flight attendants would arrive simultaneously to offer assistance. I expect nothing less from Singapore air and this is of course where they get their ‘best of the best’ reputation from.   
As I said at the beginning, a great in flight service counts on a good balance of all the elements required. Singapore air time after time delivers on this with a consistently above average service on all counts (with most elements being nothing short of excellent). The service, entertainment, food, and all the little touches are top notch and you really are extremely well looked after throughout the entire flight. 
Yeah, sure this versions’s seats were a little dated. But you know what? I actually prefer this, if you can get past the aesthetics and concentrate on the comfort then its actually a much more pleasant hard product than some of its more modern versions.  The of course, the Singapore a380 also lacks an onboard bar which many of its competitors now offer, but to be honest I always see the bars as more of an unused novelty. I’ve often popped to the bar on a flight for a picture but rarely for anything else. When I can get drinks delivered to my seat at the push of a button I’m not sure why everyone gets so excited about getting up to have a drink at the bar? So its no biggie for me and I wont mark it down for that.

  Overall, Singapore air is hands down my favourite airline to fly with. Their hard product is always amazing (old or new) for space and comfort, and its also unique in the sense that no other airline has the same as them.. meaning its a totally unique experience. But even as far as their soft product, customer support, in-airport care, lounges, loyalty programmes, onboard service, hospitality, in flight entertainment and food.. they excel in all of them and give all other airlines a good run for their money! Even being on an older plane does not mean you get worse service.. their amazing service is provided throughout their fleet. The only thing they don’t offer which some of their competitors do is airport chauffeurs for premium customers.. which is something they should look into as its a great seeing point and a nice touch.

 Of course, all these luxuries do come at a price, SQ is one of the most expensive airlines for premium seats but they justify it with the product that they offer.. if money is no object then of course opt for Singapore air as they really are second to none in my books!
label: positive

text: Astounding. Literally astounding. There literally aren't sufficient words to sum up how pleasant this flight was. This is the standard to which other airlines should aspire. Mesmerisingly elegant crew, fantastic food, great entertainment and unbelievable service. As much as I'm somewhat of a (slight) aircraft enthusiast, I'm jaded these days with the part between takeoff and landing. Singapore may have just reversed that for me!
label: positive

text: No birthday cake on my birthday onboard SQ flight I was excited to fly out of Singapore on my birthday for the first time. I had heard of passengers given birthday surprises onboard the plane and I was anticipating if I will have one since I am flying SIA. Well, as in the title of my review...I received none, not even a birthday greeting from any crew onboard. Guess I think too much and too highly of myself (probably I am sitting in the economy class). Apart from the boo-boo, everything are nice and well thru out the flight both ways (departure and arrival). The new plane 787 was good, big screen for entertainment.
label: positive

text: Best Service By Far Singapore staff are truly amazing. Service and food is the best. Leg room and comfort vary from plane to plane as the are not all the same A380 and A350 are great planes for economy. More room. The Boeing 777-300ER is very squeezy for long haul in economy. Staff are still exemplary though. Will be traveling with this airline in the future 100%
label: positive

text:
great once again the service on this airline was out standing. the food was lovely and hot and plenty of it.the air crew were very friendly and chatty.
lots of movies to watch as it's a long flight.
I would recommend this airline to anyone.
label: positive

text: Great in flight service !3 hour flight which seems to pass quickly due to the efficient FAs and great IFE. Food was great and beverages served whenever you liked.
label: positive

text: Good service Very good service, they actually came straight away when call button pressed and then brought drinks quickly with a smile. Adequate room in Economy onA380. On time. Only thing that let it down was what we considered to be a very poor selection of in flight movies.
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight. We flew Premium Economy because of our ages (70+). The extra leg room is important for creaky joints. It was a night flight, and the slightly more reclining seats than Economy helped with sleep. Service from cabin crew was good. Food was good also. I felt that the entertainment selection was not quite as good as some other airlines.
label: positive

text: comfortable and classy such a comfortable and classy airline with the most gracious hostesses good food altho we stopped at Singapore then on a larger airplane of the same airline we did 13 hours to Paris.Such a long trip but we were well looked after and have flown with Singapore airlines since to Phuket also good
label: positive

text:
Excellent Airlines Excellent experience,service, staff, safety measures and catering! Highly recommended , even at economy class the space is decently comfortable; the staff are unbelievably helpful, smiling all the time and they treat you like a king.
Simply the best 👍🏻
label: positive

text: Great but late take off! I am a huge fan of Singapore Air and a frequent flyer KrisFlyer member. I would have given 5 stars but the boarding of passengers was very chaotic, which is normal for Dhaka, Bangladesh. While the crew was very professional, they ignored the dozens of people moving about the cabin near the time of departure. Because of being one of the first to board, I sat for nearly 45 minutes before take off. This has happened to me before on the same route. Nonetheless, I highly recommend Singapore Air.
label: positive

text: Disappointed Flights where booked with Singapore air and we were put on a silk air flight paid extra to get the seats we wanted check in and didn’t get the seats that we paid for,we had no in flight entertainment as we had packed our laptops in check baggage very disappointed with Singapore air if I wanted to fly a cheap budget air line I would have booked with Jetstar or air Asia and saved a lot of money and you know what you get with these budget flights will be checking out other airlines for future travel
label: neutral

text: Singapore airlines was pretty good It was good, food was not great. We were comfortable with adequate leg room. Disappointed with the movies, but that's me, would have liked a few more choices.
label: positive

text: Scope for improvement Checking in at Mumbai was excellent. Catering service started very late and all of us were kept waiting for a long time while we were falling asleep. Food was so so
label: positive

text: Good flight in nice new aircraft This was the last leg of our trip to Europe, on a newish A350-900. The seats seemed to be better than the A380, and were quite comfortable. There were new movies on offer, and the service was typical SIA great. The seats were three abrest, and a bit squeezie , but typical economy class. We have been very impressed by the service from Singapore Airlines throughout our trip, and this one was just as good. Great airline.
label: positive

text:
Bad We had booked a flight BNE-BKK and return SGN-BNE. We picked SIA for a quality airline and very good connection. Than they delayed the first flight that we could not get the connecting flight in SIN. We had to pick a night flight ( which I hate) and lost a day in Thailand. While in SGN SIA cancelled the afternoon fight and fly 3 hours early. So we hadover 5 h to kill in SIN airport.They treated us like Airasia. Reply to my complaint was they have the right to change flights. We too we change airlines.
In the nightflight from BNE as a meal they served  a mini  taoster 2"x2", that was no meal that was a sample !
label: negative

text:
Excellent Service and Flight Excellent seating (extra legroom purchased). Excellent Service.

Experienced in flying around the world with a number of airlines. Singapore is now my first choice.
label: positive

text: Wow what an airline Such a pleasure to fly with such an experienced airline and crew. Nothing too much trouble even with a short stop in Changi to refresh. Anything you wanted to know they were able to help you out,  This was our second trip to Australia in 2012 and was rather an emotional one and the crew were very sympathetic and helpful.
label: positive

text:
SINGAPORE AIRLINES - NEW SERVICE WELLINGTON TO MELBOURNE We chose to fly Singapore Airlines who offered exceptional $ value return flights Wellington/Melbourne when launching this new service.  We had flown with this airline previously to Europe so knew we should get pretty good service.  This proved to be the case.  The 777 aircraft flown are the largest passenger jets currently flying into Wellington.

The outward flight aircraft was obviously quite old.   The return flight, the aircraft was obviously newer. Both aircraft were clean and comfortable.   It appeared the bathrooms were kept clean and replenished during the flight - something other airlines could take note of.  

There was good leg space.

The only grip was that the meals, for me,  weren't overly appealing and I ate little of either. Fortunately the flights wasn't too long.  My husband however ate and enjoyed both his dinner and breakfast.

Would hope to use this airline again when we next travel to Melbourne.
label: positive

text:
That's why they are number 1 !!! You can't expect beeter service of this!!! a plesant trip, confortable seat also if in economy class. Very tasty food. Always with smile and very polite. THey never leave alone....always ready for every needs!!!
Amazing the hot towel before leaving!!!

TOP!!!
label: positive

text:
Bye Bye SQ As I have stated in an earlier post this was my last flight with SQ I will book for private travel. Premium Economy seat is bad compared to LH or Air New Zealand. Service is not better than pure Economy except baggage allowance. No lounge access, IFE needs a dramatic upgrade. Food was ok, drinks on board, too. I am wondering  how a world renowned airline can decline in such a way... Anyhow, SQ performed an ahead of schedule arrival, which is
not standard by any means. But the criterias are
not only on time arrival on a long haul route...

Good Bye and thanks for the fish.
label: negative

text:
Space between seats. Flew on the new airbus A350 from Singapore to Jakarta and felt like I was on a budget airline because the space between the seats was so tight. The screen on the back of the seat was right in my face and I had barely any space left to breathe when I put the tray down for food service.
This is a disgrace especially when you pay a premium price and have to be crowded in like sardines. Normally fly premium economy or business and had no idea things were this bad in economy. Seems like the Boeing 777 had more space in economy.
Will definitely not use this airline if they are going to try to squeeze so many seats onto their new planes.
label: negative

text: Consistently good airline with quality staff & service. Flew on a return journey with a singapore stopover for the Gran Prix. As ysual, great airline & staff - clean on time & friendly. New style aircraft (Airbus 350-900). Modern aircraft, comfy seats & plenty of room. Our seat selection was not ideal being adjacent to storage cupboards, used by flight staff. Meals & service was quite good, though turbulence created problems with breakfast service. Ticketing & check-in was trouble free.
label: positive

text:
Direct flight from SIN to NGO Each passenger have our own screen to watch and service wasn't too bad with the air crew. A 7 hour flight where all was usual and normal with no bad encounter. It is considered a decent flight with no major hiccup. I didn't quite enjoy the food which was served as breakfast since we were travelling at night, but that to me was also normal of all airline food. 

Overall treated as a good enough flight on economy class after hearing from ex-colleague that their service was different between Asians and Caucasians but that's not true in my case.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Air The service,efficiency and timliness on this 5 hour flight from Mumbai to Singapore was excellent. It was a new Airbus 350 aircraft, the flight was very smooth and took off and landed on time. Food service was good. Even though my wife and I were in economy, the entire journey was very pleasant and comfortable. I would definitely fly Singapore Airlines again if I have a choice.
label: positive

text: Great planes - quiet and we are tall and seats had good space to stretch Their plans are nice and quiet and good leg space and actually comfortable seats for such a long journey. Actually first time I and my wife have slept for more than a couple of hours (seven) due to cramped conditions or hard seats. Service is exceptional on this airline and staff very nice. Not a lover of airline food but some dishes were very nice but to avoid jetlag we normally only eat very small amounts.
label: positive

text: Best flight experience from over 1Million miles of flying It's 20 years since I flew Singapore Airlines, and I was looking forward to experiencing them again and this time in their business class.  The A350 I was on was and is one of my favourite planes to fly.  The Business Class seat the best from the many I have flown in Star Alliance. The food was very very good (usual I detest all in-flight meals).  And most of all the service was spectacular.  Singapore Airlines deserve all the awards I get and I will be looking for an opportunity to fly them sooner than later.
label: positive

text:
"Excellent Airline" We flew from Sydney to Singapore and Amsterdam with our usual 3 night stopover in Singapore. Highly recommended break in Stamford Hotel. 

Singapore Airlines check ins are seamless and never a  problem. You actually get to deal with real people, not like some airlines where you are forced to deal with frustrating check in computers that won't work, !

Our flights to Amsterdam and back  were perfect, especially on the new A380 business class. The new  seats had a wall in between us which was easily brought down and therefore we were able to talk to each other during the flight  and even cuddle up during the night . Much appreciated.
label: positive

text: Cabin Crew always excellent Always excellent service on Singapore Airlines from the cabin food, faultless. Changi airport is one of the best airports for service provided.
label: positive

text:
The best airline. Cabin crew amazing, comfortable even in economy and the food is actually pretty good for airline food, 
Will always travel long haul with Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: Super good hospitality and customer service & support Singapore Air is one of the world best airlines. The hospitality, service and support are great. Aircraft are top class and seats along with the entertainment system is top class even in economy class
label: positive

text: The only way to fly We flew Premium Economy and were very happy with the level of comfort and service For long haul travel, Singapore Airlines is the only way to fly for us - no one else comes close the the level of service and brilliant airline staff.
label: positive

text:
New aircraft nice flight Flew on new A350-900 aircraft from Cape Town to Jakarta with transit in Johannesburg and Singapore. We stayed onboard in Johannesburg for about an hour while the plane was being cleaned and refueled. 

Big TV with tons of movies to watch. Service was good and food was fine.

No delays which was great. Singapore Airlines is pretty dependable. The 48 hour online check in was fast and easy to do on their mobile app. 

For families travelling in and out of South Africa don't forget to bring copies of birth certificate for children under 18 years of age. The airline will ask for them during check in.
label: positive

text: MNL - SNG Business Class Truly excellent. Equipment is beginning to see its wear and tear - the interior needs some upgrading.
label: positive

text: Service and food on board The seat on board Boeing 777 is very crampy. Food is poor and the stewardess is very inexperience. To make it worse, the chief steward is rude
label: neutral

text: Best Service The crew on the flight have been amazing! Very polite and happy people who are eager to please and genuinely seem to love their positions and their airline. Overall the experience was great.
label: positive

text: Still the best! I was actually longing to travel with Singapore Airlines since the first time I flew with them a few years ago. I'm so glad I paid a bit of a premium and selected this airline to fly me to New Zealand. My faith in their services has been restored. I hope they keep up the good work.
label: positive

text:
Excellent customer service by LEO (based in LAX - Los Angeles Airport) My sharing was experienced last year, 2022.  I just got to busy when I arrived home last October 2022, but then, I feel that I have to be fair and share my gratitude for SAL event though my review is 3 months late.  So, bear with me and read so you can decide whether to fly Singapore airlines in your next travel or not.
We boarded for our trip from Cebu to Los Angeles, U.S.A last September 3, 2022.  We had to fly via Scoot airlines from Cebu to Singapore, where we had a lay over of about 2 hours before our departure for L.A on the same day via Singapore Airlines flight SQ038.  When we arrived L.A. at around 9:30 in the evening, we found out that 1 of our checked-in luggage was missing.  Accompanied by my L.A. based sister-in-law, we went to file an irregularity report in LAX because none from the Singapore airlines was around that late evening.  Honestly, it was such a disappointing feeling for a tourist to miss a luggage and not being able to speak personally with personnel from the airlines.  And upon arriving the place where we staying in California, I found out we had another issue with Singapore airlines.  One of my luggage got badly damaged and that it was impossible to be fixed.  We had to throw it away as it was useless already.  Since the luggage that had all of my clothing as well as most of my husband’s, we had to buy everything we needed especially that our tour includes places with different weather conditions.  We were to go to Temecula, where the heat wave was really mean.  And had to go to Oakley and San Francisco where the weather was cold especially for us, who are used to the tropical weather.  
At first, I was very much disappointed with Singapore airlines because there was no way for me to contact them from L.A.  I had to get help from a cousin who lives in Singapore to contact them.  I also got help from my brother-in-law, James, who works at LAX.  He found a way to relay my concern to SAL and to connect me with the said airlines.  It took several days for the airlines to locate my lost luggage, which was eventually found in Singapore.  I learned from my cousin that my lost luggage never got on board the flight I was in.  To cut the long story short, my lost luggage was delivered to my sister-in-law’s residence sometime on the 23rd day since our arrival.  Prior to that, I have been communicating with Leo of Singapore airlines.  He was the person who ensured that I get my luggage back, as well as, be compensated well for my damaged luggage.  Aside from my luggage returned and delivered to me, he promised me an extra check-in luggage with a weight of 32 kilos to be free of charged and that the airlines was going to compensate for my lost luggage and damaged suitcase when we fly back home.  
I was flying back home on Oct. 10, 2022 via SQ 037 with my 3 children and we had free check-in luggage of 23kilos times 2 each passenger PLUS the bonus of 32 kilos that Leo promised me.  However, my to-be-checked in luggage reached 10 and all 10 exceeded the required 23 kilos weight.  So, I tried to pre-purchase extra baggage via online but failed.  I’ve contacted the same contact number I was using to contact Leo but then he was unavailable.  It was another guy who took the call.  I just forgot his name but he sounded Indian and I’d like to mention that he was quite unhelpful.  I am definitely not being racist but I wanted to share that I was one unhappy customer with how he communicated with me.  He doubted that I couldn’t purchase extra baggage online.  He thought that I was doing it the wrong way so I had to send him screenshots to prove to him that it was impossible.  Anyway, he only told me to take screenshots and if I could prove that it was impossible even though I was doing it correctly, then he would give me the discount for excess baggage.  But clearly, he doubted that I was doing it right.  He probably thought I was that incapable of using their website.  When I arrived the Singapore Airlines counter (in the airport) before my flight to check in, I was politely greeted by a guy named Brennon ( I hope I got the name right). When I told him that I was supposed to meet Leo, he asked me if I was “me” (he mentioned my complete name).  And then he smiled upon my approval, and mentioned that we spoke on the phone.  Just to clarify, Brennon is not the same guy I was speaking to regarding the excess baggage.  I actually saw the (Indian) guy in the other counter.  (If I remember it right, his name was Nash.)  Anyway, Brennon introduced me to the guy behind him in a suit and it was Leo.  I was super glad to see the smiling face of Leo.  A lady, whom I presume is a co-worker, handed me the cash settlement (for the lost baggage and damaged suitcase) and Release and Indemnity form that I needed to sign.  Leo made up for the hassles I’ve gone through BIG TIME.  He checked in all my 10 luggage at no extra cost.  (Remember, everything was over 23kilos each!), gave us (the whole family) free access to the Star Alliance Lounge, boarded with the business class (It’s always convenient to board ahead of the rest so you get to put your hand carried items on the cabin above you), seats in the forward seat zone for all 4 of us, and 3 of us were in the extra leg room seats (it was like seating in the Premium Economy or even better.  I only booked on economy class, just so you know).  And all these were for FREE!  I could not thank Leo enough for making up for everything.  When we were entering the boarding area, I could not help but be teary eyed for all the blessings that the Lord has bestowed upon me and my family.  It was a trip worth remembering!  We are all so glad to have flown via Singapore airlines.  Would love to travel again with them this year.  God bless Singapore Airlines!
P.S.  The amount I received from the settlement?  It was an amount that I would always be grateful for.  😊
label: positive

text:
Good one way; average on the way back We were in premium economy.  From SYD to SIN, a day flight, the service was good, the food good and very generous.  It was comfortable throughout. Staff were lovely.
On the way home (a night flight) the aircraft was bigger so a slightly smoother flight.The seats not very comfortable - I couldn't rest my head on anything - the window nor the head rest (JAL's PE seats for example can wrap around your head somewhat).  It was also difficult to get out of the seat when the passengers in front had their seats fully reclined.  This is surprising in premium economy.  Economy looked quite squashed too. 
 The food was not good at all (yuk) and such a surprise given how good the flight SYD to SIN was.
Toilets for PE are way down the back of the plan.  I'd probably go with another carrier if possible.
Inflight entertainment was good but on the flight home, it wasn't touch screen which is annoying (oh, I'm spoilt).
label: neutral

text:
I wonder how brilliant First Class can be  The hostesses were the nicest, most welcoming people and you could see they actually cared about you. The entertainment was very up to date, the seats were super comfy and clean. The bathroom was clean with luxurious toiletries. 

I had restaurant worthy food for the 1st time inflight and everything on my plate tasted really fresh. To crown it all they served beautiful ice cream on the way to and an ice cream sandwich on the way from the Philippines. 

From the point we checked in to the point we got off the airport, we felt like royalty. This is truly the best airline in the world. Flying economy and getting such amazing treatment,  I am going to save up and upgrade to Business class on my next flight and be literally on top of the world.
label: positive

text: Long trip home Very professional airline.  On time and smooth service (announcements, food, etc).  However, this is my second trip with this airline where I felt that the air hostesses were giving us the economy service.  On a 10 hour flight, surely you don't have to rush me with my food and drinks?  A few times I was also asked why I had called for service (in a slightly rushed manner) when the call was from someone two seats down the row.  Just felt "economical" with their "friendly" service.  On board entertainment is super with lots of options of movies/TV/books/games.  Kids were kept entertained.  Good flight and well managed.
label: positive

text:
Jammed in between seats is pathetic and harmful to customers Left Heathrow Airport at 2205 hours and tried to sleep for some of the 13 hour flight to Singapore. This is a big joke and damn near impossible to do with RUDE passengers in front of you WHO just push the button and their seat back as far as they can without even asking if it's ok to do it. Comfort for other passengers with legs should be considered.

Hopefully I will not fly with them again.
label: negative

text: The best airline in the world indeed Our return flight home was just as good as the one over. SIA delivered their world class service consistently again!
label: positive

text: Quick Night Flight Our family flew business class home from Singapore. The flight took off at 12:45 this we booked business class seats so we could enjoy the lounge, have a shower etc....we were very disappointed. Everyone speaks about Changi bring awesome.., the lounges are not. They are under staffed, overfilled & the bathrooms were not up to Singapore standard in business class. We started at the terminal 3 lounge & because it was so busy thought we would try terminal 2...it was worse. There is not enough comfortable seating or quiet areas.
label: positive

text: Wonderful cabin crew On our recent trip to Australia and back to the UK we flew with Singapore Airlines, business Class. The aircraft were all roomy and comfortable and the cabin crew were simply amazing - such lovely girls who spoiled the passengers to bits! Will always fly with them in future where possible.
label: positive

text:
Do not fly Singapore Airlines  Definitely not the best airline and I wouldn't consider it to be anywhere in the top class.

Absolutely the worst experience one could imagine. Toilets were disgusting and dirty. Staff were unpleasant and not very friendly. Seating is basically on top of each other so you can't eat. I would highly recommend you utilize another airline for the amount of money you pay.
label: negative

text:
Premium Economy  Poor Service We travelled last week for the first time with this airline.  We had heard good reports but our service was very poor quality. The price of the upgrade was over £600 each.  We have travelled in Premium Economy many times with Virgin and TUI.  They both leave  
 Singapore way  behind.  There was no pre take off drink.  There was  one drink before lunch and one drink with lunch. And no refills. The flight attendants seemed all to have had their personality surgically removed. Maybe we just had a terrible rooky crew of flight attendants but this kind of poor quality service on a 12 hour flight was not worth the extra cost.  Goodbye Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text: A Wonderful  Experience On June 30th  I flew long haul  from Hanoi to Dublin and travelled the first leg of my journey with Singapore Airlines.  The flight was on schedule, the check in and boarding was painless and the cabin crew were most attentive and pleasant. I had never flown with Singapore Airlines before and, I must say they lived up to my expectations and well deserve the good reputaion they enjoy.
label: positive

text:
787-10 Singapore Airlines 787-10 seats configuration for business class is the worst of all their business class seats.  It is so small, so difficult to get inside, so difficult to sleep in (even thought it is fully flat) and you will get bruises all over of you try to move around while lying down. 

And if you are full size, don’t ever think of getting into their seats at all.

Choose other plane types and not their 787-10 and you will have a pleasent joirney.
label: negative

text: Flight Cancelled due to intoxicated pilot The cancellation of this flight was incredibly poorly managed. It was a flight en route to Delhi, for a lifetime travel experience, The only reason I got to meet my connecting trip in Delhi was because of my persistence in insisting I got to Auckland before the end of the day. Rebooking was shambolic with 2 personnel organising 200 passengers rebooking. It was inefficient, impersonal, unprofessional and incredibly stressful. A giant fail for Singapore airlines followup procedures when things go wrong from me. I will never fly with you again!!!
label: negative

text: My Go To Airline Thanks Singapore Airlines for another great flight.  My husband and I have flown Singapore before and have been very happy.  The friendly service and attentive stewards make a long flight pleasant.  As I require a gluten-free meal on flights, I am always very pleased with the service and food that I am provided with.  The bathroom facilities are always of a good standard too; most important on a long flight.  Thank you.
label: positive

text: Good But Not the Best Don’t get me wrong, this was a nice flight.  But after all the press on Singapore Airlines being the top rated airline in the world I expected more from Business Class.  The service was excellent but the amenities and food were not up to the excellence of Virgin, or BA, or even the new Delta planes.   No toiletry bag; food choices were limited and not outstanding; bedding felt very used; wines were not great.
label: positive

text: The Best Outstanding legroom. They fly a 747 american configuration, not the cramped 747  Asian configuration.  The American 747  configuration which also allows greater hip room. Amenities are nice, and it seems that they are much better at staffing aboard the plane.
label: positive

text: Good experience Comfortable seats, good food and excellent service by the flight attendants. Leg room was also fine.
label: positive

text:
Pleasant journey Travelled in the first week of November in Singapore Airlines. The aircraft was an A330-300.

Previously, I had travelled 12 years ago with Singapore Airlines, and personally, their great service levels have remained what they were years ago - serving hot towels in economy class may be considered a thing of past, but not by Singapore Airlines.  It's a great way to start a journey.

Check-in process at AMD was smooth and quick, the same goes for the security check and immigration. Boarding was on time and efficient as well. Firstly, the boarding call is announced for business class passengers and then for the SilverKris and Star Alliance members, and finally, for the economy class, in the following sequence: group 4, 5, and 6.

Cabin crew was smiling and enthusiastic and customer friendly. The meal served on board was tasty, adequate in quantity and well-cooked. Lights were dimmed so that passengers could catch some sleep while on board. An Amenity Kit, comprising a pair of socks and a dental kit was given to all passengers.

Landing was smooth and before time (flight arrived 30 mins earlier than schedule). Great experience!
label: positive

text:
Never Flying Again!!  Our story is a very long and complicated one! For those who are interested please read on, for those who want the short version: I am never flying SingaporeAir again thanks to their total lack of customer service and terrible ability to follow up on issues regarding refunds and changes to flights!! 

Here we go: I was booking flights for my husband and I flying from Darwin Aus to London UK but when we landed in the UK we were going to the passport office to get his passport updated which would mean his name would change. I called SingaporeAir to confirm if I booked return flights that I could change his name on the way home. They said yes that would be fine as long as you had copies of the old and new passport. So I booked us both return flights!l for our first international holiday together!! 
On arriving in the UK we got the passport updated and sent through to SingaporeAir straight away to which I got the response, “No we can’t make any changes as it is against SingaporeAir policy” and that I would have to cancel his part of the return flight and re-book him a new flight home. 

After calling them for 3 days I finally got through to someone who could actually help me (all while on Holidays and not being able to relax and enjoy ourselves) they finally canceled his return flight and re-booked under the new name. 

I was then told to expect a call back from the refund team in the next 48/72hrs. This was on the 20th of August 2019. We are now at the 10th of September and after 6 phone calls and 3 emails I still have not received this phone call. Each time I do contact them I get the same response! “It has been escalated to the department responsible and to expect a call in the next 48/72 hours”... I thought that meant 2-3 days not 2-3 weeks.

Now, for those wondering, when I booked the flights originally I did buy the more expensive tickets that said they allowed changes for a fee so we could make the necessary changes and pay the fee but still have a seat secured for him to fly home. Nowhere in their terms and conditions does it say they cannot change a name (same person new name). But apparently this was against company policy. Oh and lets not forget I was now out of pocket!! I paid something along the lines of $1,800 for return flights but had to pay $1,700 for a ONE WAY FLIGHT!!!!! For a seat he already had but under the wrong name now.... 

Each time I call I also ask to speak to their supervisor and have always gotten the same response. “Our supervisors are not trained in this matter and will only be able to tell you what I already have”. I always say thats fine I just want to speak to someone with authority and then they say “let me see if I can find someone” and proceed to put me on hold for an indefinite time hoping I will go away. I have waited 20min once!! All on my phone bill. 

I am lost with what to do now, I am out of pocket, could not enjoy my first international trip with my Husband and now will never fly SingaporeAir again because this is getting beyond ridiculous! 

Crazy thing, the flight itself was great! Friendly staff, good food and clean plane! Just TERRIBLE SERVICE from their administrative team. So because of that I am NEVER flying SingaporeAir again. 

NOT HAPPY!
label: negative

text: Cabin and entertainment system in need of a bad refresh I am really surprised how old the cabin is ... it is the same one that I flew more than a decade ago.  While Singapore projects an image of a up-mart airline that is modern and progressive, my experience tells the reverse.  Just before joining the flight, I was on Air New Zealand and their cabin & entertainment system - hardware, software and content  is so many times better than SQ.  There is a big gap between their advertised image and reality -- maybe it is profits that has pushed back upgrading their planes.  WHAT IS HAPPENING TO SQ? A great airline feels like it is cutting too many corners.  To be fair, the service by the crew on board remains exceptional.
label: neutral

text: 2 flights connecting to Frankfurt from Brisbane Really enjoyed the trip. Seating was great. Good in flight movies and food on the trip. No delays. Good service from the stewards.
label: positive

text: Very impressed with this airline Have flown with most airlines but this one is now my favourite. The staff were very attentive and couldn't do enough for you. Food and drinks good as was entertainment a good choice of films.
label: positive

text: A smooth trip to Singapore and back Singapore Airlines continues with its efficient  and good service. Whilst other airlines oversell their seating, change and cancel flights without notice and have bad check in service, Singapore Airlines keep their long-standing approach of being a good carrier.
label: positive

text:
No longer my favourite Airlines, from bad to worst, it's a shame. First: 5 star for flight attendants, always friendly and helpful.
then the rest have dropped dramatically
1: The A350 3x3x3 seats are thin and hard, no room for an average person.
2: Boarding process was very unorganised.
3: Quality of food now is terrible.
4: Disembarking is the worst among all airlines, has to wait at least 10 mins more until all business class passengers to leave then open the curtain.
5: No longer an punctual airlines.
6: SilverKris lounge at Changi airport was chaotic, impossible to find a seat.
label: negative

text: Great flight A great flight wouldn't fly with anyone else, although the food wasn't that great , I think they have gone down hill a bit with their food but I still wouldn't use anyone else
label: positive

text: A must for a long trip Singapore airlines are my airline of choice where possible. They are always friendly and helpful and the business class lounge is great.
label: positive

text:
Traumatic Rescheduling Experience Recently I booked a ticket from Brisbane to Bangalore, however due to Visa delays I had to reschedule the dates. One of my Sigapore airlines ticket was rescheduled at a nominal fee, which was done through makemytrip. But I have faced a very traumatic experience rescheduling the one with goibibo.
I bought the ticket for 38k INR. The rescheduling fee on goibibo website shows 3.5k INR plus the fair difference.
Now here comes the funny part.
I checked the prices of the ticket before calling and rescheduling and the flights were cheaper, around 35k INR on my preferred date.
So when I called them the estimate first time given to me was 25,500 INR. The breakdown was 14K INR rescheduling fee and 11K INR fair difference. 
I will never know how rescheduling fee got there, neither will I know how the fair difference came in picture.
When I called goibibo for the same, I was told that Singapore airlines can adjust the fee(apparently to whatever they want).
And when I asked about the fair difference they said, that they cannot book me in the fresh ticket which costs lesser than my ticket, they will book me in some another ticket for which the fair difference exists apparently.
Now the next day apparently when I got a call back from goibibo for rescheduling, they are quoting the charges above 1,00,000 INR. Can you believe it?
The ticket still costs 35k INR. But if I have to reschedule it, it will cost that much.
Here they are practically forcing me to cancel my non refundable ticket. And making me buy a fresher one.
So much for the facility of rescheduling?
I am attaching the picture of the cost of available ticket on the date I want it rescheduled. Now you decide what is fair? Or maybe learn that how one can loot from another getting a superior position. Do learn from my mistake and do not book such dicey tickets.
label: negative

text:
Two excellent flights this time! My previous experience three weeks earlier was a little bit disappointing (BOM-SIN-BKK), however, there were two excellent flights this time: SQ707 BKK-SIN on 26 July and SIN-BOM 31 July. The crew on the SQ707 on 26 July were  exceptional (IFM Geradine, LSS Jane, FSS Gift, FSS Moon & FS Arif), wanted to get their names since great and dedicated work must be recognized.

As already said, superb crews on both flights, excellent lunch/dinner, and flights on-time. The only gripe is that I don't seem to get a comfortable position on the B777-300ER: the angled position is quite awkward and my back hurts after two hours - prefer the A350 over the B777-300ER. This, of course, is a matter of personal taste only.
label: positive

text:
One of the best private business class seats in the sky today I had high expectations, but I was not disappointed. Incredible crew, thank you Rebecca and Juanita taking care of me so well. The seat is 30 inches wide (10 more than most) and you have a side table that is at the right height with several storage compartments. The seat side wall does reduce the visibility out the window somewhat, but this was not a big negative. The seat was very comfortable as long as I found the right sitting position or it it could have felt hard. For sleeping you do need to angel yourself as your feet will go in to the footwell on one side of the seat in front of you. 
As for the ground staff, I believe that they were all subcontractors so I could not expect them to live up to the standard of the inflight crew.
label: positive

text: Enjoyable flight I have recently flown from Manchester to Melbourne and back, stopping off in Singapore with Singapore Airlines and all my flights were great! The flight attendants couldn’t do enough for you which made the flights that I was on my own on, that bit easier. I was able to select my seat way in advance to put my mind at ease and all the processes were easy. Inflight entertain was relatively up to date and the plane was kept clean the whole time.
label: positive

text: Still a great way to fly! The cabin crew are always extremely courteous, well mannered and attentive. Excellent seats, excellent food. As a private pilot, I appreciate their high maintenance standards.
label: positive

text:
Great flights! We had wonderful flights from California all the way to Bali, then back home.
We flew Economy and had enough room.  Small foot rest , seats reclined nicely and a ton of food!
I couldn't believe all the food!  Handed out snacks inbetween meals.  They even gave us a sandwich as we were landing in case we got hungry waiting for our luggage!  Nice touch.
The staff kept us very hydrated on the flights.  Always offering water and orange juice frequently through out the flight.
My daughter was so impressed with Singapore, that she wants to study abroad in Singapore for a semester.  She's currently studying Electrical Engineering at San Diego State University, and can't wait to go back to Singapore.  Of course, she will be flying Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Amazing business class product We had the chance to test Singapore's Business Class in their A350, A380 and their 787. All in all a very good experience!
label: positive

text:
Premium product Our first experience flying Singapore Airlines surpassed our expectations. From the moment we boarded our 777 we were greeted with a warm welcome, chilled champagne and felt like royalty.
Travelling for a special birthday the crew surprised my partner with a special gift and card - a beautiful touch that meant so much.
Great selection of food and refreshments.
Thank you SQ, we look forward to many more flights.
label: positive

text:
Our unexpected flight change was no problem On checking in with Singapore Airlines at Brisbane airport we were informed that we could not fly into Vietnam that day as the Vietnamese embassy had entered the incorrect date (4/8 not 3/8) on our visas.
The airline were more than happy to let us fly on to Singapore as planned then changed our flight (at no extra charge) on to Ho Chi Minh to the following day with a stopover in Singapore.
Luckily there was a Flight Centre office on site and they happily booked us overnight accommodation in Singapore (which we were able to claim on our travel insurance).
What started out as a disaster was quickly and easily handled by these wonderfully
helpful people and we would have no hesitation in recommending both of these companies.
label: positive

text: Traveling to Singapore or Malaysia, use Singapore Airlines I'm often hesitant about flight times from OR Tambo however although our flight was delayed, the excellent service onboard made up for our initial frustrations. Our special Hindu meal was yummy and the pilots made up for the delays and kept us well-informed about connecting flights from Changi to Kuala Lampur. Awesome Singapore Airlines. I'll be using you frequently.
label: positive

text:
Travelling with a wedding dress & honeymoon treat Top tip for flying with your wedding dress:  Before flying to NZ from the UK, I tried many times to get a clear answer from Singapore Airlines about the best way to take my dress on board (obviously not going to put it in my checked luggage!), with all answers being vague and with no guarantee that dresses can be hung in the cabin. In the end I bought a special wedding dress box which fit Singapore's carry-on dimensions (must be 115cm or less in total), but the total weight of the box + dress was over the 7kg limit. So I ended up carefully stuffing my dress into a small carry-on sized suitcase and it was just fine. Wrapped in tissue paper and plastic, there weren't even many wrinkles when I opened it. 
Another top tip: if you're on your honeymoon, let your travel agent know and you may get a lovely treat like we did! A couple of Singapore Slings and some chocolate cake were a lovely way to end our very long flight back to the UK.
label: positive

text: SQ 318 Changi to LHR Hello again. As like before,we paid a little extra for the exit seats on our flight back to Heathrow. This helps with the flight time back. Again the cabin service was excellent as well.
label: positive

text: Best as always! This is my 3rd time flying with Singapore Airlines. My last roundtrip of Bangladesh-Japan via SQ 447-SQ 622 & SQ 637-SQ 446 as always was so comfortable. The ever smiling and cooperative crews,good food,easy choice of my desired seat (I checked-in via the Singapore Airlines App) and in-flight huge entertainment availability obviously would make me fly with them again.I cannot imagine a comfortable long airjourney without Singapore Airlines.Highly Recommended!
label: positive

text: Brilliant Service! SIN - DXB On this flight to Dubai, I was flying business class. For the first time, they gave out amenity kits. The food was amazing and I highly recommend it. I was traveling in December, so the cabin had a lot of night decorations. I did book the flight in July 2018, I highly recommend booking 6 months earlier as Christmas time gets fully booked.
label: positive

text: extremely poor service for disabled passengers Extremely poor wheelchair service for disabled elderly mother who travelled with this airline recently.
label: negative

text: A Great Way to Fly To travel on your own airline, Singapore Airlines, is a great joy simple because they are efficient in providing the best service to their passengers no matter which class you are on. They serve with a smile! Indeed, it is a great way to fly!!
label: positive

text: Food and staff excellent Excellent service,staff offer water and juice regularly, check in a breeze, seat and cabin area comfortable in exit seats which I choose due to being very tall, food always good.
label: positive

text: Excellent flight and good service We flew from Milano to Singapore then onto Australia.  We selected premium economy.  We found that the service was very good and the attendants were attentive to our needs.  Check in was a breeze at Milano
label: positive

text:
Disappointing Customer Service We were planning a holiday to Paris in Oct 2020 and booked the flights months ago.
Now that COVID 19 is an issue and travel insurance wont cover us if we get sick while we are away, we decided to ask if the flight can be moved to 2021 to give this time to blow over and Singapore Airlines would not help. We have flown a few times with Singapore and always liked them but I find it a bit disappointing when you cant travel due to circumstances beyond our control and no one wants to give any assistance. Looks like that is $2500 we will never see again.
label: negative

text: Premium economy fantastic! The cost of Premium Economy is more than justified once you settle into the larger seat, better foot space, lift up leg rest and ease back the  armchair with more arm room also. The only downside for me was they are leather, hence slippery, seats. Otherwise, service, comfort and even Singapore Airlines way of boarding by group, and enforcing it, made our trip fantastic.
label: positive

text:
Fabulous Every Time Flying can be a very uncomfortable experience but Singapore airlines have changed all that. Their attention to detail, service, comfort and dining experience was exceptional.
This long haul flight is a killer usually but travelling Singapore Airlines, and yes I am lucky to be able to afford to fly first class, is like being in heaven. I don't want to sleep the in flight entertainment and service is just so good ! 
Caviar, Dom Perignon Champagne, (or would you rather Krug) is flowing followed by fine dining all the way. When I finally sleep my bed is made up and the size and comfort of this flat bed experience is so comfortable I'm asleep before I know it.
The sleep attire is comfortable and cosy as well as smart and the bathroom although not as big as some airlines ( you could improve on this Singapore Arlines) are clean and have plenty of Lux toiletries.
I'm traveling again next week back to London and cant wait to do it all again !
Highly recommend this delightful spoil with  this fabulous Airline.
label: positive

text: An airline with great service! The crew are always there at your call.  Efficient, always smiling and courteous to passengers. They never fast to impress.  Check in staff are also very helpful and friendly which makes a big difference overall when you are on a long haul flight. Worth the price difference
label: positive

text:
Long, dark and depressing flight Having flown in business class on the outbound trip, we returned but used Premium Economy. Seats were generally ok as was the general service. As we left Singapore at 2.30am it meant we were flying mostly at night. The flight was about 14 hours long, which we knew and had prepared for. What we did not prepare for was the depressing feeling of the flight as the cabin was ‘dark’ for 12 of those hours. I do not understand why, after 8 hours of fight, the cabin could not be illuminated. Yes, I know you have your own reading lights but it’s not the same.
The flight attendants were very good and kept you supplied with water, juice and apples but you just kept looking at the time and thinking how much better it would be if it was lighter.
No doubt Singapore Airlines are very good but I am glad we were not in Economy!
label: positive

text: Don't be fooled they aren't that great... Poor food quality (Chef stuff-cold multiple times), aging aircraft interior, insincere flight attendants, quirky check in (weighing a backpack,,,really?), below par flight management (ticketing and gate notification). Sorry to say any domestic carrier exceeds them without the fake smiles.
label: negative

text:
Poor Service! Just flew with Singapore Airlines for the first time, travelling Adelaide to Singapore for a family holiday, returning this morning (SQ279). Very upset that on arriving very early at Changi to check in for return flight we were told that flight was overbooked. Instead of simply explaining this and asking if we would be interested in an incentive to change to an alternative flight we were initially made to wait at check in while staff disappeared with our passports, indicating there was a problem of some kind. As our anxieties increased a more senior staff member returned after about 10 minutes. As he described the overbooking situation, we were told that it was either going to be us or a woman with 2 children who would miss the flight. This was despite there being 260 other passengers on the flight and us being 4.5 hours early. I was travelling with my wife and 83 year old mother in law and had specifically chosen this direct flight home to avoid transfers and delays for her, given her advanced age. I believe that we were placed under unfair pressure and deliberately made to feel guilty if we decided to displace the woman and her children (if she even existed) - we were encouraged to feel this was our problem and our decision rather than the airline’s issue. Overbooking obviously is an airline strategy to maximise profits - selling more tickets than you have seats. Just be honest about it and don’t put pressure on people! This experience left us with a bad feeling at the end of our holiday - this is not good customer service!!

The onboard experience was ok although the legroom was cramped (I’m 175cm tall) and sleeping on the night flight was uncomfortable. Definitely better to fly during waking hours. Singapore Airlines is often mentioned as having great customer service however I think our experience was only average regarding onboard service. The cabin crew on the outbound flight were observed to be a bit sharp and impatient with some other passengers. As previously described the check in service was very poor indeed.

Unfortunately I can’t provide a positive recommendation for this airline.
label: negative

text:
Very good flight as always!!! Great flight connecting in Singapore. 
Food fantastic with a great menu handed out on take-off. This is the reason for travelling with Singapore airlines as even in economy the small things are taken care of. 
Staff very helpful at all times
Airbus a380 is outstanding and another reason we choose Singapore airlines!! Very comfy + roomy. These planes are much better than the others including the new dreamliner which is small and uncomfortable in comparison.
label: positive

text: Great Experience Self check-in so easy and quick. Cabin crew were so friendly and helpful. There was plenty to eat and drink and a good choice. A vast range of things to watch or listen to. Will definitely fly with them again
label: positive

text:
Vintage fleet The standard legroom is average, too small for me, 6'3", so I'm forced to pay for a seat big enough for a tall westerner.  This means I sit alongside the bassinet seats with the screaming babies, will receive service last, am unlikely to have a meal choice, or time for a second drink, and I can't check in online, or through the machine as they have to see that I'm physically able, so I have to que up to check-in, and yes, I have to pay extra for all this when flying SQ.

On this particular trip, the USB port on my seat didn't work, so I couldn't charge my noise-cancelling headset to drown out the screaming babies, and the in-flight entertainment system is so old that when I missed some dialog through the SQ earpiece (no noise-cancellation technology here) then tried to rewind a couple of seconds, it jumped back 8 minutes, so I had to sit through all that again.  It's first generation, I've not seen these for some years now.  The attendant offered a change of seat, but having paid extra for the babies and legroom, that seemed somewhat unappealing.

They also have no air control at the seat, they just hope that all 200 passengers want exactly the same temperature, somewhat ambitious during boarding, where many are hot from the process, and the cabin seems hotter.  The attendant told me that the cabin is set for the "ideal cabin temperature", and I remain unsure how this was intended to solve the problem.

On the positive side, it was clean, and we didn't crash, which was great, but in the 21st century, we expect a little better than SQ currently provide, especially when they financially discriminate against tall people.
label: neutral

text: Foods are plentiful I took the direct flight from SF to Singapore. We took off around 11am local time and arrived in Singapore 7pm local time as well. So I think it was around 16 hours. I know it sounds a Long flight but I did not feel so. The business class seat has a big enough space. I spent my times reading couple of newspapers and magazines. Continuing my readings on my kindle. And watched couple of latest films as well. I slept around 6 hours during the whole flight. The bed was nice. But I do not like how it is slanted. The flight attendants are also friendly but professional. The foods are amazing. Sometimes I felt they are a bit too much. Between the first meal and the second meal there are quite a big gap in term of timing but you can always ask for a nice warm noodle to the flight attendant. I would not take the business class if it was a personal trip though. It can cost you up to 4 times of the economic class. I know it is cozy and all but it does not really worth it.
label: positive

text:
Painless Travel I had a cycle accident breaking elbow and hand, loosing front teeth, upper lip severely cut and face grazed from contact with road surface and after emergency treatment decided to return home to have elbow/arm reconstruction surgery.

Sadly I had to purchase new flight ticket but as always had travel insurance.

Singapore Airlines staff from moment of arrival at booking counter at Munich right up to baggage collection in Brisbane were exceptionally helpfull. As were the passengers seated next to me on each sector.

Whilst I declined the multiple offers staff at each airport viz Munich Changi Brisbane offered to provide transport and assistance with my carryon luggage.

I was already a Singapore Airlines supporter but more so now.
label: positive

text:
Everything so good except! We opted for Singapore Airlines for our trip to Japan. We booked our tickets online. Smooth experience. A couple of days before the departure, we got an intimation for Internet Boarding. We did that. Being vegetarians, we wanted to make sure that we get the right food. The website took us to a page where we could register our requests. We did that diligently.

Smooth check in and boarding. Great! On board, I asked the stewardess about our special meal booking. Apparently they had none. But she asked us not to worry, as they had adequate vegetarian meals available. And it was good.

Our problem started in the Singapore Tokyo Sector. There they hardly had vegetarian options. They too didn’t have any special meal request. It was a long flight, and all we had was some salad and breads. This is where our experience got a big jolt. The stewardess was apologetic, but it wasn’t her fault.

The airline has to improve it’s website.
label: positive

text: Best of the best  I wouldn't think twice about recommending it. All yiu would expect from a top airline like this. They made the long haul as comfortable as possible possible as they could. Full marks from us for all they did for us ☆☆☆☆☆
label: positive

text: Flying with Singapore Airlines A very long flight however fairly comfortable. Food requires improvement. Staff was helpful and friendly. Pilots did a great job considering the conditions.
label: neutral

text: business class a350 lucky enough to do this class again and of course everything from check in to the seats is awesome , it  was let down by some very average service on board and some sub standard meals but what the hey , you cant beat a lie down seat on long haul
label: positive

text: Flying to Europe, 1st leg Brisbane to Singapore - Always good service This is the 3rd time we've flown with Singapore airline and we still enjoy their service. The flight out of Brisbane was on time. We didn't have reserved seats and were given 67J&K and we didn't have anyone else in our 3 seat row so we spread out which was nice. The service by the crew is always professional. They served the meal then the lights were dimmed. They constantly bring water and refreshments around so we kept our fluids up and didn't get dehydrated. The Kris inflight entertainment system is great with heaps to chose from. They have some of the latest movies out so it was nice to watch them. It was only a 7hr flight so nice and short for the 1st hop. The plane landed on time in Singapore to a warm barmy night. Cant recommend Singapore airlines enough.
label: positive

text: Business trip to China Took SQ flight to Guangdong on business trip. Flight was on time at departure and arrival. Inflight service, entertainment and meal were good. Smooth flight and comfortable landing.
label: positive

text: Great service Though the flight lasted only a few hours; Singapore Airlines lived up to its reputation. Flight attendants were very attentive and almost always referred to passengers by their names. Food and beverage were excellent. Choice of meal requested was provided. The plane was very clean. Flight was on time. Business class seats were very comfortable. Having flown business class on many airlines; one notices that staff is more attentive to passengers but what I appreciated the most and found most unique was the array of choice in terms of music and movies in their entertainment system - truly amazing - have never experienced such a vast selection. I would fly with them again just for that reason
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline surely one of the best in the world, but recently didn't feel the warmth from their attendance as much as used to and others start to invade their friendliness with competing prices as well.  still best connection to other countries in the region and their airport is one of the best, if not the best, in the world, so if you have long connection book their in the airport hotel and enjoy really nice but if you have a longer connection they will allow you to take tour of the city regardless if your nationality and in a moderate price surely worth it .
label: positive

text: just hope this Airline finds our Bags that Lufthansa Lost . having finally left Singapore for a final leg of our journey Home, when we arrived at Brisbane Airport and got through passport control , we were waiting at the carousel for our bags to head home , after watching the carousel for what was the 4th rotation I was beginning to think there was something wrong no bags had shown up . I then hear over a loud speaker my friends name and then mine , to go to baggage services and I then had my doubts confirmed by a member of staff that our bags had not left Frankfurt to make the connection to Singapore then Brisbane . I started to panic as I had medical stuff in the bag that I desperately needed and no matter how I tried to explain my situation . all I was told my bags would hopefully arrive the next day , I was told to make a complaint to the first Airline I was on Lufthansa , then Singapore , but no real comfort was ever given or I felt from any of the Airlines, it was a case of no bags made there connecting fights . THATS A FACT ...
label: positive

text:
Kris flyer experience Business class flight,  asked them when we hot our Kris flyer point report why we had zero.
6 months later still no points after going back and forth with repeated information requested.
We have given up just not worth the stress, robbed and disappointment all round.
Do not recommend Kris or Singapore airlines, very average.
label: negative

text: Excellent service by staff we upgraded to Business Class and that was the best thing we could have done, especially on the long legs (Singapore to Frankfurt and Amsterdam to Singapore).
label: positive

text: Great airline Great flight, excellent chairs and food, great cabin crew. Flight was right on time, wide choice of inflight entertainment!
label: positive

text:
Discrimination, rudeness and destroyed property The contribution of my nightmare trip in August, on the way to India another round of rude people, discrimination and smashing my Samsonite hard cover through bad handling!

Singapore airline by far the worst airline experience in last few years.
label: negative

text: Awful journey We didn’t eat at Singapore airport thinking our £900 fare One way each would include 2 substantial meals.  Took off.  Got a sandwich and coffee.  Maybe a bowl of tiny fruit.  8 hours later a small hot breakfast.  Worst catering for a long haul.  The seats are so cramped and when the person in from reclines it’s game over for any kind of comfort.   Crew lovely but working with a bad service.   A few safety concerns such as blankets left on floor around exit door during landing (trip hazard in evacuation).  Crew talking during take off and landing (should be focussing in their safety drills in case of sudden emergency).  Toilet doors not locked during take off and landing.  Also too many announcements which could have been all done at once instead of the constant interruption. Never again. Singapore have lost my vote.
label: negative

text: Absolutely faultless. Me and my boyfriend travelled with Singapore airlines on the 8th of November 2018, to Bali, DPS. My boyfriend travels regularly for work, however this flight was the first long haul (17 hours) that I’d been on and our experience was faultless. The staff made us feel comfortable and were so polite a friendly, the food was absolutely fine. There was plenty of content on the screens to keep us happy throughout the duration of the flight. We were also quite nervous about this flight at first as not only was it my first long haul flight, it was our first ever one way flight as we started our travels around the world. We are still travelling and I look forward to travelling home with Singapore airlines. Absolutely would recommend.
label: positive

text:
Poor service, Liars and generally disgusting Firstly 1 star cause i cant put zero
My family and I travelled to the Philippines via Singapore ?
To start with a stupid little man split my family up
When we realised we talk to a supervisor who said it would be fixed at the boarding gate.
It wasn't, we spoke to someone again and we were assured we could sit together ?
We couldn't.
I took it upon myself to sit with my family, the guy who's seat I took was very understanding and sat in my seat.
That was just the 1st leg.
We had similar problems on the 2nd leg.
I was not expecting to be blatantly lied to not once not twice but 3 times.
We won't be using this s##t show airline ever again.
I was full of praise for this airline before covid.
Now the food I wouldn't feed to a dog.
How times and standards have changed, not for the better.
There are plenty of choices out there do yourself a favour and steer clear of these people.
label: negative

text: First Class Airline! Flew Singapore Airlines ti Rome via Singapore.  Went Business Class for the first time ever. What an amazing experience it was.  Treated like absolute royalty. Everything from the food, the service, the space, the ease of embarking and disembarking, the lounges etc. Loved every minute of our flight. Staff were friendly and very accommodating to our needs. Singapore Airlines all the way for me!
label: positive
