text: Only one issue The actual flight was great,  the crew were attentive and the service was excellent, I would definitely recommend them for any flight except one that traverses Istanbul.  Being part of the star alliance I had expected to have my suitcases transferred but instead had to  pay a fee for a Visa to enter the country,  just to pass through the airport, collect my cases and then check them back in.  I actually booked the flights because of the star alliance and was very disappointed.
label: positive

text:
Left Stranded abroad by Singapore Airlines, with no help or refund I paid for a return flights from London to Brisbane in August 2019 through The People's travel agent in London.I was scheduled to return home
on the 7th of May 2020 via Singapore.
However,I received an email from Singapore Airlines on 20th of April 2020 to say my return flights were cancelled. Singapore Airlines had been extremely unhelpful to me, I was left stranded. No alternate flight was arranged nor any support or assistance provided by airline or travel agent. I had to buy a separate ticket from Qatar Airline in order to return home safely on 7th of May 2020! I had no refund even though I wrote to the CEO of Singapore Airlines (Mr Goh) in May 2020 to complain which was totally ignored. Singapore Airlines provides very poor customer care and services. I will not travel by Singapore Airlines again and will not use the travel agent.
label: negative

text: Good Service and leg room. As usual found Singapore Airlines service very good and the leg room was good. Had a recent return flight from Perth to Singapore using Qantas and the leg room was terrible, for some reason their economy leg room seems to be tighter. If my choice of airline to use i will be using Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
comfortable flight Chose to upgrade to Premium Economy on the overnight flight to Singapore. As my flight arrived early in the morning I wanted to try to get a comfortable flight.
Seat was comfortable, and the leg rest a great idea. Quiet cabin with very lovely attentive staff. Liked the noise cancelling headphones and there were  great in-flight entertainment choices. 
Food was good and the meals were hot. I loved being able to choose my meal prior to the flight on book the cook program. I had Hianise chicken for breakfast and it was tasty.
I would have loved to have been able to lift the arm rest in the middle of the 2 seats for more sleeping room as i had no one next to me. I do understand why they are fixed to accommodate all the extra bits in PE. I have to admit I am not a great sleeper on a flight, but it was more comfortable to rest. It was back to Economy for the flight home, but on the Airbus I was upstairs so still an OK flight daytime home.
If I can will always fly Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Skip This Flight.  Service and Experience Is Trash They had very few items on the business class menu or snack items. If you asked for something the standard answer is that they ran out. I sat in 21k. I would not reccommend flying this airline. The service is slow and poor. If you want a drink they loudly repeat your order. The drink never comes or it comes 30 mins later. The mid flight meal service took 3 hours from start to finish. The toilets smelled and two of the toilets had a perpetual green light on although there was a passenger in the toilet. I was so happy to get off this plane. The seats are horrible. Not restful. Take Cathay and stop in HK. I wish someone else would take up this route
label: negative

text: You just can't fault them. For the first leg of journey we flew premium economy to Singapore. We booked economy but just before our journey we placed a bid to upgrade. You can get a really good deal by doing this. The assistant on check in was really friendly and helpful. He even found us better seats so we had extra leg room. The seats were very spacious and comfortable. The entertainment system was really good as well, the screen was a really good size. It was also really nice having an extra rest under your legs. The food was really good and you could ask for any snacks throughout the flight. The attendants were really helpful and attentive. On the second leg we flew economy but there was still ample leg room and the seats were comfortable. I was able to have a snooze on the plane. The food was just as good in economy. When we arrived in Australia I didn't really feel jet lagged.
label: positive

text: a long comfortable trip It was a long trip, about 12 hours. I spent the time watching films (there were a lot of interesting titles), eating (at least 3 complete meals), drinking (you can drink what you want alcoolic or analcoolic drinks when you want, just ask to the staff) and sleeping (before take off, the staff give to the travellers a cover and a pillow). I usually don't like so much travel with plane, but in this case I had a good trip and I would do it again, of course with Singapore Airline.
label: positive

text:
Cabin crew attitude My wife and me travelled from Auckland to Singapore on Singapore Airlines ( SQ 0286 ).
on 5th November 2018.It was a very pleasant flight even in economy class with the cabin crew attentive and friendly and service the promise of Singapore Airlines.
We returned after our Asia tour ( Singapore/Bangkok/Seam Ream Cambodia/Ho Chi Min City ( Saigon ) on Singapore Airlines (SQ0285) also in economy class. Our seat numbers were 61F and 61G which were at the rear of the aircraft.There was nothing wrong with the seats and were quite comfortable.
However the cabin crew for this section of the aircraft left a lot to be desired.Either this cabin crew were new or they were just not carrying out their duties with the high standards of Singapore Airlines.The aircraft was delayed on the runway because another aircraft had broken down in front of ours and we couldn't take off.There was cold air blowing on my wife's head and I stood up in front of my chair to see if I could shut off the flow of cold air.This male cabin crew sitting in his crew seat in front called loudly" Sir please sit down". I can understand him doing his duty but we were stationary for many minutes.I immediately sat down. A short time later a passenger stood up and started removing something from his hand luggage fro the overhead locker. Nothing was said to him.
At both supper and breakfast which were both unappetising I had to make a special request for salt and pepper. Is Singapore Airlines cutting cost on this basic items?
Overall the service was poor and substandard not with what Singapore Airlines prides itself.
label: positive

text: Good airline, unfortunately flying economy sucks Good airline, unfortunately flying economy sucks, especially with sears at back of plane on a 13.5 hour flight. Never enough leg room.unfortunately as there were loads of kids in the flight, all the extra leg room seats were taken.  Checked in online 3 minutes after receding email advising check in had opened and all the decent seats were taken. In-flight entertainment was good. The staff are very polite, helpful and friendly. The plane was modern with wi fi (paid for).  Meals are above average and drinks and snacks are freely available.
label: positive

text:
Don't use Paris as a stop - atrocious!! Having flown from Manchester to Perth with one stop in Singapore where the flights went well, on time with the high level of comfort, service, food and drink, hot towels, inflight entertainment etc. we decided on the return fight to stop at both Singapore and Paris. 

Although we checked in on-line for the outward flights, we couldn't do it for the return flights due to the Paris to Manchester section. It didn't cause a problem as we just checked our luggage all the way through at Perth although the boarding cards for the Paris to Manchester section had to be picked up at the Singapore Airlines desk in Singapore. Again not a problem.

The trouble started when we landed at Paris. We arrived slightly late and the turnaround time to the last flight (Flybe under Singapore Airlines) was very tight. To ensure we didn't miss the flight Singapore Airlines ensured we quickly went through personal security checking etc., and onto the bus to the correct terminal. We arrived and although Singapore Airlines had confirmation that we were ok to come through, the French in their usual fashion said "Non". It wasn't helped by the fact that no Flybe representative was contactable. The representatives persevered while we had bus tours around the airport. In the end we were allowed through onto our flight leaving 40 minutes late. There is always a sting in the tail where the French are concerned and it came when we tried to collect our luggage. Amazingly it was still in Paris.

Talking to other passengers who had flown into Paris with us, it appears this is not a unique case. Suggestion - avoid Paris and use Amsterdam or Dusseldorf.

No problems with Singapore Airlines but the French and Flybe are a different story,
label: positive

text: No enough food served in long flights Over an 8 hour flight, food served once within a couple of hours of taking off and then nothing at all. In the past, I was never hungry after arriving in Singapore airport in the past but this time was very different. Arrived around 10 pm and needed to eat dinner. Airlines did not serve dinner, and no good restaurant or café is around in Singapore airport.  I had 22 hours transit and desperately needed to eat good food but nothing is available in Singapore airport. By the way, paid twice as much for the tickets, was hungry on the plane and could not purchase any decent food in the airport. Never again with Singapore airlines and never go via Singapore airlines if there is a long transit.
label: neutral

text:
Good carrier and experience  Flew Singapore Airlines from London Heathrow to Bali connecting through Singapore. Had an Airbus A380 from LHR to Singapore which was great, modern and comfy. By contrast, from Singapore to Bali we had an Airbus A330 which seemed a bit dated.
Crew very friendly and helpful and patient!!
Really detest the self-service baggage labelling that larger carriers seem to be adopting, Singapore Airlines included.
label: positive

text: top 3 airline now that's funny  Flew economy. Felt like I was flying Ryanair. Cramped for 15 hr flight. The food ok but really. I'm 5'10" , should have had some leg room. Thanks Singapore Airlines for nothing. Next time I'll fly anybody else.
label: negative

text:
Absolutely freezing! I travel Singapore Airlines a couple of times a year but this flight in November was strange. The plane was freezing at take off and remained so for the duration of the flight. As it was hot in Perth the majority of passengers, myself included, were wearing shorts and tees. We were all having to use the blankets provided. I don’t know why it needs to be so cold..

I also don’t understand why these Dreamliners are automatically darkening their windows for a daytime flight. It doesn’t feel right to me.

As usual the staff and food were great but I’m disappointed by temperature.
label: neutral

text:
The best airline  I have flown to Singapore on long weekend.
The airplane is very new and modern. I had the separated seats with my friend, but the ground stuff was very helpful and found the adjoining seats for us.
label: positive

text:
Wish they would improve their Singapore - Maldives planes Have flown them many times and funny enough their plane going from Singapore to Bali was the newly style compared to the old planes used for the Maldives >< Singapore route. 

They charge a good fare for the flight and would imagine flying better planes for such a luxury route. Hope the new airport in Maldives would sort this issue.
label: neutral

text: Excellent value for money We Hadd flight as you would expect it to be. On time, clean interior of the aircraft, friendly accommodating staff and good meals.
label: positive

text: Good flight Good flight, service was was excellent & the staff were the best I have encountered. Food wad good without being exceptional. Only complaint was inhouse entertainment system which was very cumbersome to use & selection was limited.
label: positive

text: Not worth it We thought to treat ourselves a bit and pay extra for Premium Economy, it was a waste of money. Nothing special from a service point of view, food was below average and comfort not really that much more. We have used Cathay Pacific Premium Economy and would recommend that by far. Not sure if it was just the Premium Economy Experience or everything that went backwards but one expect much more from an airline claiming to be number one. When we fly again it will definitely not be Premium Economy and possibly not Singapore Airlines as the other deals out there seem to offer much more. However, on the positive side, we were safe and mostly on time.
label: neutral

text: Singapore airlines great service The seats were comfortable and the leg room adequate The stewards were friendly and helpful and very professional  The only problem I encountered was the meal I chose was unavailable as I was sitting in the lasr row and I didn't enjoy the meal I was given  None the less free Singapore Slings were a bonus
label: positive

text: GOOD SERVICE Clean plane. Friendly cabin crew. Good service. Good menue options and food. Cavin crew always checking on passengers. Will recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: World class travelling  Thoroughly enjoyed my flight from Singapore to Bangkok.  The seat is comfortable.  Love all the movies selections and enjoyed the services that are rendered.  The food is ok not deliciously yummy but for a flight is ok not bad for the hungry.
label: positive

text:
One of the best flights I've 🐝 on This is a.new route for Singapore and my first time flying with this airline. I was very impressed with the whole.experience. On time.both ways, comfortable seating with reasonable leg room and good entertainment screens. In flight complimentary food was of a good standard and the staff bey attentive and pleasant.
Well done Singapore!
label: positive

text: Non-stop to Singapore Even though we were a little hesitant about taking an 18 hour, non-stop flight to Singapore it turned out to be ok. The flight attendants were very kind & friendly, always making sure that we were comfortable.  The Premium Economy seats were comfortable, there was a great selection of movies & shows. We were able to sleep. The time went by pretty quickly. I would highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Very old plane and no amenities bag The plane is very old and the seat is the type which need to get out and fold/unfold. Entainment system is no touch screen.
Service maintained as usual.
But the most unbelievable is not providing a small bag of lotions/lip balm etc.
label: neutral

text: Truly deserving of all the awards  I Flew in December 2022 and had an amazing flight. The seats were comfortable. Food, service and entertainment was amazing. I was flying back to Singapore this December and booked Singapore Airlines again but made the mistake of getting a non-refundable flight ticket. My mother-in-law unfortunately got diagnosed with cancer and couldn't travel anymore so emailed Singapore Airlines thinking that there was no way I would get a refund. Was I proved wrong their customer service team got back to me the next working day and was extremely empathetic. I sent them my mother-in-law's consultant letter and swiftly they responded that the refund had been processed. Singapore Airlines is not only an amazing flight but a truly empathetic airline that puts human emotions above business.
label: positive

text:
Positive experience but can improve Overall positive experience where little things like hot towels, variety of decent meals, cleanliness of toilets, aircraft, etc  matters especially on long haul flights. Great service by friendly staff. Was a bit disappointed when our 2 prebooked economy seats upstairs in the a380 was unexpected downgraded downstairs due to ‘change in aircraft’. The a380’s are starting to show their age especially with the seats, entertainment etc. Was quite pleased with the Old Chang Kee chicken curry puffs!
Would definitely fly again with SIA but other airlines have lifted their game in terms of newer aircraft, price competitive, premium economy/business class options and service
label: positive

text: Enjoyable and Comfortable We have flown Singapore Air before and enjoyed the experience, so were happy to fly with them again to the UK. Singapore Air has always provided us with a comfortable flight even for the long hauls. I find their Economy seats to be the most comfortable of all the other Economy seats we’ve had. The cabin staff are always friendly and attentive and the food and drink are of quite a decent standard for Economy travel. A further enticement to fly with them is to have a stopover in the wonderful city state of Singapore. Changi Airport is a marvel. This time we landed, were processed through Immigration, collected our luggage and in a taxi to our hotel within 30 minutes! Unbelievable, the fastest of any airport we’ve been to. I highly recommend Singapore Air.
label: positive

text: Last two outward flights from Melbourne well below there standard The last two flights out of Melbourne well below there standard. This flight over was on a A380. There entertainment system was complete shut down due to problems in every class. Just found general service lacking not as good as latter years. There seems to be a problem  when leaving from Melbourne as if they do not care. On arriving in Singapore we were greeted with packets of different tea in a box. FOR THE TROUBLE WE HAD COMING OVER. But after paying money for premium economy and the people who paid business and first class fares a box of mixed tea for compensation, come on Singapore people should have been compensate better than a box of tea. Coming back was excellent up to there standard in the past flights. But flying out of Melbourne is lacking there standard.
label: neutral

text: A really wonderful experience from start to finish We flew with them in April and May, because of my wife's visual impairment, we used their special assistance. Every single member of each flight was very helpful, polite and very kind. It was a pleasure to fly with them
label: positive

text: Worst Premium Economy flight ever What a disappointing flight. Probably the worst crew I ever had, very inattentive, they looked stressed and tired. It was very hard to get any attention at all (the attendant button at your seat was completely useless, no reaction by the crew whatsoever) I had 2 drinks in a 12 hour flight. I wasn't asked for a drink with our meals and the meals unfortunately didn't save the day either. Most of the time we had to queue at the lavatory (the layout of the plane is horrible), because the 2 lavatories were used by Economy as well. The lavatory situation in Economy was much much better, nobody surely had to queue there (11 lavatories according to the seat map!).  It didn't help that a family with two toddlers and a crying baby was sitting in the same row. On the positive side were the headphones (even if they had to replace my headphones straightaway) and the entertainment system. Avoid booking Premium Economy with Singapore Air, you have a much better deal in Economy (or Business of course). Another weird point was that Economy class was disembarking before Premium Economy, another novelty for me. There are much better Premium Economy products out there (eg Air New Zealand with more pitch and ).
label: negative

text: Early flight Very early morning flight to HK- left on time with smooth check in time. Easy and comfortable with good food.
label: positive

text: Awful service. Worst ever! 3 years agio this business class product used to be a quality one. Now it is absolutely awful. Aircraft is messy, old and dirty, but that's not even the headline of awful. It is the staff. From the minute you enter the lounge to the time you exit the flight, it is so unpleasant bordering on hostile. I have never experienced a worse business class airline experience in my life, and I can't even imagine how bad the economy class must be!!!
label: negative

text:
Singapore Airline Experience Travelled with Singapore Airlines from Manchester to Houston, Texas. Was a direct flight - one of the main reasons we chose this airline. Flight time was 9hrs. The flight was not full so we ended up with a spare seat which allowed us to feel more comfortable as we could spread out etc
Staff were friendly and attentive... 
plenty of inflight movies etc to watch and although the headphones provided were an in-ear bid style, you can use the adapter plug provided to use your own! They provided snacks and drinks throughout flight, and you can request larger snacks (wraps etc) if you wish. Singapore Slings are their speciality but I found these quite sweet! The only negative we had, was that there was an error with our meal choice on the way to Houston, Texas and despite raising this with the air hostess, they refused to amend this, meaning my father was stuck with the vegetarian meals which he didn’t eat. This obviously left him hungry. We did manage to amend this on the flight home both through the check-in staff and air hostess. I would recommend this airline to friends and family!
label: positive

text: Scheduled Flight UK to Auckland Singapore Airlines (SA) are often voted the best airline and long haul business class travel is a luxury if you can afford it. SA team up with New Zealand Airlines to get you to and from New Zealand. I preferred SA business class to NZ but I prefer NZ premium economy to SA premium economy. The service was excellent by both carriers. However, its worthwhile checking the time your are given to make your connection. In our case, although the flight was advertised as a scheduled flight we had about 30 minutes to make the connecting flight. Any delay results in missing the connection and then you have a minimum 10 hour wait. Singapore Changi is a huge airport and the distances between Terminals is huge. The crew organised us a golf buggy which sped us to our connection.
label: positive

text:
Best Airline I have used First flight with Singapore, I have used many airlines for business and leisure in the past 40 years, these guys just go that extra mile to make sure your flight is as pleasant as possible. We were in economy, plenty of leg room I managed ok and I'm over 6ft. 
Had trouble trying to book in online, both ways, each time I just rang the office not a long wait and they booked us in.
label: positive

text: Excellent service with Singapore airlines I had never flown with Singapore Airlines before this trip, but I had missed out as this was a welcome surprise. Great service and really good facilities.
label: positive

text: Best airline in the world We've been travelling with SIA due to our honeymoon from Germany to Bali with stop in Singapore. Never had such a nice flight experience, great service level even at the eco class with own menu. Always smiling employees, one felt very welcome. For our honeymoon we got a cake made of white chocolate - it was so delicious!
label: positive

text: Popular flight Flight timing is perfect, depart BKK at 1830pm gave us ample time to have a relaxing lunch and go to the airport at 1500pm and to do some duty free shopping.  Therefore it's not surprising to find this flight is extremely popular with travellers especially those with codeshares.  I did not reserve seat with fees so was not able to get window seats in this flight of 2-4-2 configuration, still not bad getting aisle & middle seat.  Inflight entertainment and Krisshop were great, I managed to purchase one item with discount.
label: positive

text: My Trip to Bangkok, Thailand on SIA Great Airline to fly with to any destination.  However, I find that being serve cold bun, that coms along with the meal, is not really appertizing. I believe many passengers would prefer having warm bun over cold bun.  Other than that, the meal is quite good. The inflight entertainment movies should be updated more frequently with latest.
label: positive

text: Signapore airliner Flew out from Johannesburg to Signapore on a 10.5 hours flight and enjoyed every minute of it Air Hostess are always friendly and helpful to every passenger  Good movies and ample room place Awesome meals and drinks to meet every travellers needs The most beautiful air hostess and the smiles gives you the pleasure to travel with them
label: positive

text: Very Comfortable _ Premium Economy The Premium Class in our A380 was very good. Roomy seats & attentive Cabin Crew. We used "Book the Cook" & were happy with our selections. As always a huge amount of media to choose from with large screens to watch your movies or TV series from.
label: positive

text: First time with Singapore Airlines. We have just returned from a trip to Singapore and Vietnam which we booked to fly with Singapore Airlines. We had heard good reports of the service provided and we weren't disappointed. Our return journey was via Paris Charles de Gaulle where we were met off the inbound flight at Terminal 1 by an airline representative who escorted us to Terminal 2E for our ongoing flight. We had not expected this but having completed the rather torturus transfer we were pleased that this had been arranged. We would certainly look to use Singapore Airlines in the future.
label: positive

text:
Singapore airlines The flights were smooth to and fro
The floods were nice and service good with clean environment 
On the way from Singapore to Perth I was given a wheelchair but got left stranded halfway 
I had to walk to immigration and was
Upset and disappointed
label: neutral

text:
Singapore Airlines Food We travelled with Singapore Airlines from Europe to NZ for Christmas. It has been four years since we last travelled with them. The staff, as always, were excellent. However, the food was not good at all and has taken a notable decline in quality. We were in economy, and we can’t expect the 5 star food that is served at the front of the plane but the economy food, on all four flights was poor. The highlight were the pot noodles…

This is important when travelling with children, that they have something tasty to eat to see then through the long flights. Our kids didn’t eat any of the meals they received and they aren’t fussy eaters. There was no fruit or entree offered. 

We were disappointed with this aspect of the flights. Hopefully Singapore can get back to the standard they used to have with their economy food, as they have always been our first choice for our flights to NZ.
label: neutral

text: Impossible to talk to a human, website booking can’t be complicated but still the best in the Pacific I have been flying Singapore Airlines for 42 years. There is no question that it is not the airline it once was. However, on this route it is still far far better than any other option. Service is far better as is the food, etc than United. My last business flight with United was shocking. Service was non existant and food on the long flight was just sad. As one passenger said who had slept through a meal - “Do you just have kids food for snacks?”.  Cathay Pacific was a form of torture with tight seats and flight boarding that is total mayhem. SIA is trying and still the best. I would warn you that having traveled with them after two surgeries in the past the wheel chair service in Changi  is abysmal and the United Polaris clubs are nicer.  SIA is also particularly hard to get a status match - even for United 1K or Million Milers. They also have a website that rejects a lot of itineraries meaning you have to book separately. Where they REALLY  are TERRIBL is communication as it is nearly impossible to get a human. The chat feature proved useless for me recently, even after he forwarded an itinerary that an agent said was impossible. Very frustrating! At least United has good Milage Plus service and no PIN is needed to contact them. However, I JUST booked a flight with SIA and know I will have several more in the next year. They are the best over the Pacific if you don’t mind the nightmare of their website and customer service.
label: positive

text:
Excellent service and comparatively spacious seating Singapore Airlines impressed us with the extremely innovative flight safety announcement on the video screen. Very imaginatively done video!
The seats in economy were reasonably spacious. 
Food was good. But for Indian vegetarians, prior intimation is advised. Did not like the airline serving drinks in Paper cups but other than that, satisfied with the taste and variety of food.
Amazingly pretty air hostesses added to the charm of the flight 😊
label: positive

text: Singapore to Shanghai flight Nice and comfortable seats via airbus A380, punctual arrival and departure. Clean toilet and service oriented cabin crew.
label: positive

text: Quality decline Slow poor service - waited 10 minutes for surly female attendant to respond to call, had to argue to get a drink before meal service, appalling food, uncomfortable seat, cabin freezing even with 2 blankets on!  Very limited drinks - no diet alternatives.  Will not fly Singapore airlines again. Sad because they used to be very good, how they have declined!
label: negative

text: Excellent Services From the moment at the check in counter until you boarded and leave the plane, their staffs showed excellent services towards my needs and makes the journey more comfort and relaxing as all well taken care of.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable Seats and Friendly Staff This was one of the most comfortable flight I have experienced. My only regret was that it was relatively short, one of my next flights which was much longer was with Malaysia Airlines and that was atrocious.
Thoroughly recommend Singapore Airlines, top class service
label: positive

text:
Singapore airlines Simply the Best 🎶 Great customer service.
Seats comfortable and reasonable leg room.
Flights on time. Good food.
Flown with them a few times and will continue to do so .
label: positive

text:
Comfort and service 1st half I had a great first flight from Amsterdam to Singapore. The plane travelled in had more legroom than usual and seats more comfortable, the crew were constantly around with trays of water or juice. Each time I got up for a stretch I returned to my seat loaded with snacks which really helped the 6 movies go by. Flight crew were all lovely and extremely friendly, would fly with them again. Main meals were very good.  
Second leg not so great, legroom almost nonexistent and the seats were nowhere near as comfortable, while the service was still good, this crew were not around the cabin as much and this really let them down, meals very ordinary. Nowhere near as good as the first flight, hence I am giving 4 stars instead of five but overall not too bad for a fully packed plane.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Customer Service I travel frequently and i have to Singapore Airlines is one of my favorites. Great customer care, very attentive staff; Always kind and helpful. In general flights leave and arrive in time (I am based in china where this is very often not the case).  I enjoy the entertainment system, good quality and many new movies to watch. I was seated in the Economy Premium this time and found the seating quite spacious and enjoyed the extra leg space. Singapore Airlines = Happy landings.
label: positive

text: Best airline In flight services and food good.  Services great. Arrive ahead of schedule time. Smooth flying despite a little turbulence.  Friendly professional in fight crew.
label: positive

text: Home in the skies Singapore is probably one of the best airline I have flown. The staff are extremely attentive and the planes are well maintained and clean. Inflight food and drinks is good and the portions are good. In flight entertainment is great with a huge selection of movies, TV shows and even games. Something that is not often mentioned, the toilet to passenger ratio is decent.
label: positive

text: Disappointed with broken promises I brought a Ticket from fly365 which went under liquidation last year. In contacting Singapore airlines I was told that my flights were paid for and that I could use it by the end of 2021. I called them on a few occasions to check if the flights were still valid and I was told that Singapore airlines has taken over my flights as it was paid for and if I want to change my flight to a country that has opened their boarder l can with a $50 US change fees. I rang them a month ago to confirm by when can I change my flights  and I was told by the end of June, than I don’t have to pay extra fees on top of the $50 US. I called on the 2nd June to rebook my flights and I was told that the money was refunded to the company that went under liquidation in august. This came as a shock as for months I was told that my tickets were paid for and that Singapore airlines will hold my tickets. I also received a email from the airline manager ( Dejan Eminagic), who stated that my tickets were confirmed. I was fed with false information by the Singapore airlines staff for more than a year. I’m so disappointed with the lies I was presented to by the Singapore airline team.. a apology does not mean anything when they can’t honor their word.  Very disappointed with the staff and the way they managed my tickets.
label: negative

text: Excellent flight Check in was easy and staff were helpful. The flight was on time and the journey smooth. The inflight entertainment and food was good . The staff were extremely friendly and cheerful. They provided us with refreshments throughout the flight and the toilet facilities were kept clean and tidy.
label: positive

text: The BEST service in the air and on the ground The airline staff were wonderful, as they made sure all was easy and comfortable for us, on the ground from check-in to the aircraft, as well as in the air. Excellent service and immaculate attire from all attendants. The food choice, made easy with pre-flight selection, was top class, and surely would satisfy all tastes.
label: positive

text: Unsuitable business class beds We pay to go business on long haul so that we can have a bed to sleep. On both legs of our flight we could not use this precious facility. The design made it impossible as I have a knee problem and my husband is recovering from a stroke. We normally fly with another air!ine but decided to try Singapore all I can say is we dread the return journey. We will not use them again. Flights were SQ361 and SQ285. I also found the service at mealtimes haphazard and felt neglected at times. We normally fly Qatar.
label: negative

text:
New seats are the worst I’m a regular Singapore Airlines customer and am always impressed by their service and comfort. And I try to choose their A380.
But no more.
The new business class seats are the most uncomfortable business class seats on any carrier I’ve ever flown with. Impossible to sleep — you can only do so sideways but even then your feet fit into an impossibly small slot.
Whoever chose this product really needs to be held accountable as the crew told me they are getting so many complaints from business class passengers. 
Shocking! 

Now I prefer the A350 or 777 product with SQ.

Be warned!!
label: neutral

text: Not to usual SIA standards Not a full flight but the staff were not as attentive as you would expect, maybe as it was a night flight. For the first time the food was inedible, very poor quality. I know this must have been a one off as I have flown SIA many times and they were faultless.
label: positive

text: Great airline to fly Great flight, seat is spacious, service is great. Able to charge your device on the go and more importantly, movie can be screen right when you are seated.
label: positive

text: its 5 stars Easy check in, great lounge and boarding goes fast. Friendly staff, short delay but it wasnt a problem. Service on board is great, seats are comfortable. Perfect flight again.
label: positive

text:
SQ 442 - Get a Better Plane for the Singapore-Kathmandu Route! The Boeing 737-800 had a business class cabin for 12. The seats must have been taken from a provincial bus somewhere in the 1970s and bolted onto the floor of this aircraft. They had no redeeming feature. The recline was almost unnoticeable, The footrest had to be brought up 6 inches from the floor by manually pulling on a lever that seemed obstinate. We had bulkhead seats - there was zero stowage; the pillow and the blanket were in our laps (unless we put them behind our backs and made our ride more uncomfortable than it already was). The entertainment system comprised an iPad with headphones. 
The food choice was limited, and the wines even more limited. One red (a cheap Chianti) and one white was all that was available. 
This was a 5-hour flight that was uncomfortable from beginning to end - to put it mildly. Couldn't wait to land in Kathmandu. And this was after paying more than $3,000 each for a Manila-Kathmandu-Manila ticket (via Singapore), Shocking!
We chose NOT to fly on this aircraft on the return journey; didn't make much sense in sitting bolt upright for 5 hours at night when a business class seat should be offering you some semblance of lie-flat.
Never again! This was a complete rip off.
label: negative

text: the best airline! Wow the absolute best. Spent about 40 hours with this airline within the last 2 weeks and have been so well taken care of. Great food on every flight, no delays, incredible cabin crew, spacious and comfortable, great movies and snacks upon snacks! 🙌🏻🙌🏻 sooooo glad I chose this airline
label: positive

text:
another excellent flight another excellent flight. Early morning flight. check in and boarding very smooth.

Once on board the A380, usual attentive service, great legroom and excellent IFE movie selection.

Still cannot get over how quiet the A380 is , especially noticeable on take-off where you could hardly hear the engine noise.

As i pre-ordered my daughter's kid's meal , it was served before everyone else.
I think the kids pack (wristband pouch) is not as good as previous kids pack. The purpose is to pre-occupy the kid's time on the plane, so i don't think it achieved the objective.
label: positive

text: Perfect service Very responsive and friendly staff ‘ always available on request . New plane is another big plus . Food is the only complain that requires attention
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines are World Class Singapore Airlines are world class!  The captain and his crew were always professional and pampered the fliers!  Highly recommend!
label: positive

text:
Disappointed Had not flown SQ since the days their "BigTop" used to land at CYYZ. Their new Ultra Long Range 350, while technically impressive, had sub-par seats/lie flat beds; passable catering and a cabin crew member with attitude!
In fairness, my interaction with other members of the cabin crew were most cordial.
A poorly designed seat and tasteless meals detracted from an enjoyable flying experience. Not looking forward to our return flight - to EWR.
label: neutral

text:
Excellent service Singapore airlines is a very polished airline up there with best. The female staff are dressed beautifully in their original uniforms, from when I remember from the 1980’s.

They are polite and attentive.

Just one hiccup was check in at Delhi airport.  There was a quite a long queue, suddenly a staff member, stopped us where we were in the queue and told us we could go to another check in point to ease the congestion.  Of course we were at the front and all the people behind us hurriedly marched along and got there in front of us! Hmmm,, disadvantaged, seeing as we were up the front originally.

Then a woman in front of us was with her two young sons, held us all up for up to 40 minutes as she decided to upgrade to business while checking in.  We were furious and called the manager, she wasn’t too apologetic about it. Only explained the reason, which we guessed anyway.
label: positive

text:
Mr Very disappointed with our overnight flight from Singapore and would be hard pressed to go with them again.
After take off the staff came with a tray of water, juice and white wine. I asked for something else but never received it. The staff then all disappeared until breakfast was served about 6 hours later.
Supper would have been nice.
This must be the he easiest roster in Singapore Airline.
label: negative

text: One of the best airlines no flaws with Singapore Airlines, luxury economy travel. We were on our way to Athens from Singapore and unfortunately for us I selected a flight that was operated by Scoot Airline which was the worst experience over the 11 hour flight with no Movie screen or movie, no food, no drinks. Terrible terrible. Actually a nightmare over that period of time after travelling in comfort from Auckland to Singapore for 1 hours and to have to have the next 11 hours (after 2.5 hour layover) in Scoot. Singapore airlines, do something about this please. My rateing is for Singapore Air not Scoot which would be zero
label: positive

text: Quick and easy Singapore Airlines and Silk Air are the only way to travel to Phuket. Despite some of the aircraft appearing a little tired, the service was great, staff very friendly and food and entertainment are pretty good. Our inbound flight was late so we fully expected to miss our connecting flight to Phuket but the Ground Staff both in Singapore and Phuket were pretty amazing! They arranged our speedy transfer through Changi Airport and ensured that even if our luggage didn’t make the connection, we did ! More th an adequate compensation was paid to us on arrival in Phuket and our luggage greeted us in the hotel lobby by 10.30 the next morning. Awesome service! Thank you!
label: positive

text: Efficient and Excellent We flew Melbourne Via Singapore to Colombo, and on our return Colombo to Australia with a 5 day stop over in Singapore. All flights were on time and the service brilliant, Will fly with Singapore Airlines on our next overseas journey.
label: positive

text:
Two families travelling yogetger We recently flew from Melbourne to South Africa via Singapore return. The Singapore Airlines experience is a refreshing change from the Middle Eastern Airlines we have been choosing for travel over the last few years.
I feel the folks at Singapore understand the meaning of hospitality and service and deliver both in spades. 
The flights themselves were very good despite the turbulence which we experienced especially on the legs between Singapore and South Africa.
Take offs and landings we so smoothe. Food quality was very good by economy class standards as were the variety of beverages on offer. 
The only downside were the overly demanding Indian passengers who are condescending towards flight attendants and behave as though their needs are the only ones requiring attention.
Overall, a great job by Singapore Airlines. Well done.
label: positive

text: unbelievable ,extremely  poor service when asking for a quotation. my wife and i are planing a trip to melbourne in march ,we were also going to  visit family in new zealand for a few days but as it became apparent singapore airlines could not offer any flights to or from wellington ,they said that they had no partner airlines and no code shares so we would need to make our owm arrangements from wellington to melbourne.we were very keen to fly with singapore airlines and especially in the wonderfull suites and keen to book with only one company we decided to drop the wellington part of our trip and simply fly london to singapore, stay at the fullerton hotel for a 3 night  stop off then go to melbourne for 18 days with friends then back to singapore for 4 nights at raffles , then back to london.  the problem started when i telephoned singapore airlines and passed on my itinary, the chap that i spoke to obviously had trouble understanding what i was trying to say , and i really struggled to understand him. i was put on hold a number of times and when i suggested that he lookup the details and call me back , he said that it was not possible .when i received an email it had not included the hotels that i had requested ,so i sent an email to ask why, I  was told that singapore airlines could not book the fullerton hotel so i would have to book it myself ,i then asked to stay at the manderine oriental hotel and again i was told that i would need to book this hotel myself as singapore airlines did not offer this hotel. i m not sure if that is true or if the person dealing with my enquiry just could not be bothered,but i was sent a link to a list of hotels that i could choose from.i was astonished as all of the other airlines that i had sent the same information to had replied with no problems, and because we wanted to travel on a single booking i did not want to book a separate hotel.i sent a complaint to singapore airlines and not only did they not take me seriously but if anything the service got even worse.each time i emailed it took at least 2 days for them to reply ,even though they sent an immediate acknowledgement. when they did reply it was as if they did not understand that all i wanted was a quotation that included the items listed on my enquiry . finally after 9 emails i received a telephone call from a member of staff who seemed to imply that it was probably my misunderstanding before hanging up just as i started to speak. i have sent a follow up email stating that i feel that it was probably time to move on and spend my £19,000.00 with another airline, but i have received no more correspondance . it is a real shame because as i explained to singapore airlines on a number of ocasions, we were both really looking forward to traveling in the wonderful suites.
label: negative

text: Long Haul A most enjoyable experience flying with the very friendly and helpful staff of Singapore airlines. The level of service friendliness and attention to ensuring the flight was as enjoyable as possible is to be commended. The staff made the flight - the inflight meals were excellent and the overall comfort level was very good.
label: positive

text: DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS AIRLINE! So I thought hey, let's book with a 5 star airline for my honeymoon! Boy was I wrong, they can't even make the booking? Waited for confirmation and received nothing so I call my bank and they confirm money has been sent, call the airline and on multiple occasions, they tell me they have no booking for me and received no money, after abusing my bank refund as Singapore airlines refused any knowing of this booking, finally received some food news that Singapore airline had a glitch and the money would be refunded in 10 business days, never had I gone through so much stress and I asked for compensation and kept getting oh we cannot confirm any compensation as there was never a booking....
label: negative

text: Great movies! Pleasant flight, very good service and very impress by the great selection of recent movies. I saw 7 movies!
label: positive

text: service good food rubbish Singapore Airlines have always been a favourite for service food and on time.however post COVID still very good service but food unacceptable terrible no taste like eating cardboard.they have lost me . things didn't get any better on the return home.maybe we should give Jetstar. a chance.
label: neutral

text: Nowhere near the calibre it used to be We have flown SIA in Economy for years and years. The friendly service and great food is what always brought us back.  On our most recent flight on 31 August 2022 from Brisbane to Singapore it was so different. The staff were surly and had a particularly poor attitude towards caucasions. They were friendly enough towards their fellow Asians.  We have never experienced this before on any airline, but found this particularly surprising in an airline like SIA.  We did a further flight in early September in Premium Economy from Singapore to London - see separate review. Lift your game SIA. We won't be back. We did not feel welcome.
label: negative

text: YES! YES! YES! Check in has become automated, meaning we were on our own from the printing of boarding pass at at the airport to the checking in of luggage. But there are staff roving to assist anyone if needed. Late boarding due to the late arrival of aircraft but we arrived 30 min earlier than expected. I was lucky as I had the whole row to myself. Thai cabin crew was all smiles and helpful and they were always going around with drinks after the meals. I had to request for some snacks midflight and was given. The special meals I ordered were delicious! Legroom was fantastic. Only complain was, movies were limited. 107 movies but mixed of new and old. But I spent 8 hours sleeping and managed about 3 movies before we landed in BCN!
label: positive

text:
Relaxing Flight  I continued my lucky upgrade streak with a timely upgrade to business class on my flight from Hong Kong to Singapore.

The seats were comfy but a little on the older side.  Service was quite attentive and the food was delivery was timely and very good.  For brunch, the fresh fruit were sweet and the bowl of crunchy granola came with plump blueberries, cranberries and sliced strawberries.  The main entree of beef ribs was a little tough but had a flavorful sauce.  The chocolate peanut butter mousse was delicious (highlight of the Meal).

I enjoyed the custom drinks they served on this flight which I did not see on other airlines.  I only tried the Mid Summer Breeze which was a fizzy concoction of 7-up, pineapple, apple and orange juices.  Quite refreshing.  

When we landed our gate was less than  couple minutes walk from immigration.  By far the best arrival into Singapore to date.
label: positive

text: Sad Paid 3,000 for premium economy.the flight attendants look beautiful. That’s because they don’t do anything. Never again. So disappointed. No service. Don’t pick up trash. You get one bottle of water for a 17 hour flight. Food was awful. Looked like economy. Why would I pay for upgrade??? Dirty. No tooth brush. You might find one in the economy bathroom when flight first starts otherwise forget it. Seats are uncomfortable. You ask a question, they don’t have an answer. Fly another airline. Heard so much about this airline. So disappointed!
label: negative

text:
Singapore airline still the best in term of quality and service  Interior :I love the full black colour seat layout. It look so class and spacious

Food : interesting experience.. Even the western menu come with a little hint of India ( outbound flight from Delhi could be the reason)

Entertainment. There probably having the best collection of music and movie

Atmosphere : I love the decoration of Christmas in flight 。it had really ease my tense for a 6 hours flight journey

Service :the cabin crew never fail to address each and every passager.. With their hearty smile. 

So.. Going for a long journey.. SQ is your first choice
label: positive

text: The Best By Far This airline deserves to be number one, there is an old saying, that the customer is king and yes that is just the way all of Singapore airlines staff treat their customers.
label: positive

text: A league of its own The inflight service is impeccable. SIA has a great product but it's the people that elevates the whole experience of flying. Professional but personal at the same time. Special call out to the crew on SIN-CDG flight on 24 Apr.
label: positive

text: London Return Business Class We traveled in Business Class with a 2 year old and the cabin crew were really helpful. Most of the food was ok and the coffee was good. Would definately fly with them again even though they cracked our new pram bag and daughters suitcase. Also if you check your pram in the weight comes off your luggage allowance and I do not remember seeing that written in the fine print.
label: positive

text:
excellent service Excellent service.
I request wheelchair for my mom urgently when we arrived at Changi Airport for transfer and they really help. Also the service lounge for special service was very good.

Food also good, they serve the kids first for priority, very nice. My kids enjoy the flight and SQ give my kids some goodies too
label: positive

text:
best airline yet my wife and I where celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary by going to Thailand for the first time, we where flying out on my wife's birthday from Manchester.
when we got to the airport I realized I had forgot to pick up the passports and had to dash back home to get them taking my wife's mobile with me, the Singapore airline staff at Manchester was extremely helpful towards my wife, especially a member of staff call Steven, who let my wife use his phone to check on my progress, when I got back to the airport I thanked him for helping my wife and looking after her.
The helpfulness and cheeriness didn't end there it was the same on the aircraft, always smiling and always ready to help and assist.
On our return journey back home to England, my wife got bit by a mosquito on her left finger and arm, we thought nothing of it at first but when it started to swell up I got a bit concerned as she doesn't normally react like that, I asked a stewardess if they had anything my wife could apply to the bite, she came back with a cleansing wipe and some antiseptic cream them the chief steward came and ask if she was ok and that if she needed a doctor they could arrange it for when we land, he kept checking on her and offered a cold compress to help get the swelling down, I thought the attentiveness and concern was exemplary, it put us at ease.
On the first leg of our 3 leg trip back to England a member of the staff gave my wife a birthday cake and a small gift, and said it was from Singapore Airlines, we thought that was a great gesture which (pardon the pun) put the icing on the cake for our holiday. 
We would love to fly with Singapore Airline again and would highly recommend them to anyone, they really look after you from start to finish, that's why we have given them top mark's
label: positive

text: Quickest flight to the UK Flew Wellington, Melbourne, Singapore, Heathrow. It was the fastest we’ve flown, with minimal stopovers (1.5hours) in Melbourne and Singapore. Great way to go if you don’t want to hang around unnecessarily in airports.
label: positive

text:
Lacklustre, impersonal, task driven service. I used to fly regularly with Singapore Airlines between London and Sydney but had not done so for about ten years. I booked this trip on the basis of previous experience when I remember excellent and faultless service, great attention to detail, good seats and great entertainment. One feature of that service was that you were unfailingly addressed by name by the crew. I looked forward to my journey and bear in mind that I paid a premium for it over and above what I could have paid another airline but I was willing to pay it because Singapore Airlines presents itself as unmatched and the best in the business. They might have been once but they are certainly not now and are at best average. 

Check in at Heathrow was rather chaotic, there were five desks open for first and business class although two of them were designated first class and bear in mind that Singapore Airlines only have six first class seats on the A380 so rather overkill. The queue moved reasonably quickly and the person working was polite. 

I made my way to the lounge, there are four choices of lounge in terminal two, all accessible with a business class boarding pass. Having been to them all I would rate the Singapore Airlines lounge as last of the four, the food offering is the poorest of the four and on other fronts it's certainly no better. 

Boarding was efficient but then that's self managed through automated gates and the same for any airline in terminal two. 

The A380 on the London - Singapore sector was one of the newest with their latest business class seats. I found the seat most uncomfortable. It's way too hard for a long flight, the leg rest is totally useless and doesn't elevate to any useful angle and to put your feet up you are forced to sit at an angle which is not particularly comfortable and after a while I had a sore back so was left with the choice of a sore back or don't put my feet up. The seat does go fully flat but I doubt most people spend more than 50% of the flight in a fully flat position so something of a fail. The seat also boasts a high level of privacy. I would define that as claustrophobic as the seat is so enclosed that's what it felt like. 

The service of food and drinks was very task driven and impersonal. Over both the sectors I was not addressed by name on a single occasion. I found it quite disconcerting that the norm for the crews seemed to be to take things from a trolley and put them down on your tabel without even acknowledging you, on several occasions things were put down while the crew member had her back to me and she talked to her colleague across the trolley. Most airlines do not even have trolleys in the aisles in business class these days. 

The food was at best average. There is no choice of starter, a choice of mains, two puddings and a cheese course. There is no flexibility in the times of service and you eat when the crew decide you should. Between meals there is a range of mediocre snacks. 

The inflight entertainment system is good but no better than that of others. 

The aircraft between Singapore and Sydney was a 77W and it features an older version of the seat with still no possibility of using a leg rest and the impossibility of putting your feet up unless you sit at an angle. This was a day time service so a flat bed was inappropriate. The older seat is slightly more padded than its newer relation so slightly less uncomfortable. The service on this sector was no better and just as task driven and impersonal. 

The return journey was no better, just more impersonal, task driven service. The older A380 was poorly maintained internally with lots of scuff marks and poor seat controls. 

I also find in 2018 the previously iconic 'Singapore girl' sexist and outdated. It really is time this was dumped and the crew were allowed to dress more appropriately for their role. You do not see women in vibrant and forward thinking Singapore going around dressed like this!

So, I wouldn't again be willing to pay a premium for Singapore Airlines as I don't consider that they are now in any way industry leading, in fact they are definitely in the lower half of the pack and trading on past glory while charging a lot of money for the average offering. Others offer better for less money and on future journeys I will look to them for my travel needs.
label: neutral

text: Enjoyable trip. Very pleasant flight, great service from cabin crew, food very good and choice available. Comfortable seat and leg room. Wide choice of entertainment during flight. Would wholeheartedly recommend this airline.
label: positive

text:
Not much to differentiate the big guys Managed to get an upper deck economy seat which definitely helps with trying to get some sleep. The side bunker is useful if you want to try and work as you can spread out a little bit - don't get excited I said a LITTLE bit.
I'd say Singapore Airlines headrests are the best of the bunch as I didn't need the added travel scarf that I use for support. 
Meals were very average I had a lacto-ovo vegetarian as prefer to get heaps of veg and fruit.
Air stewards did a great job on a very bumpy last leg which saw them sitting on the floor at one stage because they couldn't get back to their seats before some really big turbulence hit. I couldn't do their job - all credit to them.
As per my title there is not much to differentiate the big airlines from each other so the choice comes down to routes and times and how it all fits.
label: neutral

text: Great customer service Clean cabin with service almost to full perfection. Staff very concerned of the comfort of the passengers. Meals served when younare ready not just at any time.
label: positive

text: Great airline Very attentive crew, comfortable seats, food was really nice, loved the hot towels, did not like the long journey
label: positive

text: Amazing service Best service I have ever had on an airline which is really really important if the flight is extra long - 17 hours!
label: positive

text: Mediocre service in Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines Oh how the Premium Economy (PE) service has dropped on Singapore Airlines (SA) - not good compared to other PE serviced airlines. In PE you pay extra (a lot extra) this normally includes individual welcoming, a hot towelette and in many cases a drink prior to takeoff.  None of this on SA it was an extraordinary amount clutter and confusion through out the PE cabin. One alcohol drink prior to meal service with there wine pours being half a small plastic glass , no offered alcohol drink at meal service, meals through "Book the Cook" were not good at all but oh offered plenty of glasses of water throughout trip. Come on SA what has happened to your past extraordinary service that was legendary.  Folks if you choose to have a little more comfort and service, choose another airline as Singapore Air has chosen to be a just another mediocre airline.
label: negative

text:
Training on the go! SQ655 My first encounter was the cabin crew at the tail end, I witness for the first time requesting my violin placed in a safe storage from a young stewardess. The 
Chief Steward Mr Alex Lee took this opportunity to ask her a few question if she knew what’s the procedures to the passenger and she did and also answered well. Good training and guidances from a senior!

Unlike the last trip where there’s a team of leading stewards and chief seniors, this was like a group of apprentice and new crew learning and they’re doing an excellent job!

Good improvement in the cabin spaces and seat comfort. Legroom increased and I can even cross my leg easily while seated down. Recliner is slightly lower for the 787 and it lowered smoothly unlike its predecessors. However the Side panel control still gets triggered if passenger is too plump eg. reading light and calling steward assistance by accident!

As for extra leg room the touch screen is where it’s a slight pain to one who has short arms. It’s mounted on the wall unlike the former fittings where it is housed inside the armrest therefore you may need to stretch a little to reach the touch screen...
label: positive

text: Enjoyable flight One of the better airlines by far. The staff are all friendly and helpful, throughout the flight they offer snacks and drinks and the meals are really good. Would fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Number one My first time flying with Singapore Airline and do not regret it one bit now I know why it was voted number one,
label: positive

text: Best Airline I have travelled with Singapore Airlines several times. The service & food is excellent. Enough leg room, seems a little more than other airlines. Staff are very friendly & attentive.
label: positive

text:
fly singapore airlines had four trips with this airline recently, excellent service and attention to detail from all staff.
on one trip my suitcase was badly damaged  this was picked up by airline staff, who took me to the appropriate desk to report it.  a new suitcase of the same size was given to me
within half an hour, that to me was sterling service, i was astounded to say the least, i will now look to see if this airline goes to my destination in future, will always be my 1st choice.   rgds
label: positive

text: Very Professional Service I found the service from Boarding to Landing is extremely professional. Quite a few times, I traveled with SQ and I found the services are very standardized and consistent. Airline timetable, food quality, cleanliness, professionalism from the cabin crew, entertainment system all are adequate for a very great and comfortable journey. One thing i loved most that they tell you which food is Halal and which is not. Then it's your choice. I recommend this airline for family travel as well. They are very caring about the kids.
label: positive

text:
Two meals for 15-hour flight Despite its stellar reputation and exorbitant pricing, SIA serves only two meals during a 15-hour flight from Singapore to San Francisco. The first meal was served about two hours after takeoff and the second, about 10 hours after the first. 

You would have to take the initiative to request snacks instead. 

Oddly enough, two meals were also served during another shorter eight-hour flight from New York to Frankfurt.
label: neutral

text: Nice trip as to be expected (RT) Had a very pleasant trip on Singapore Airlines. Customer service from the time we checked in to the time we arrived was very good. The flight attendants were very accommodating. The trip was on schedule.
label: positive

text:
Tedious Manual Process for Redemption Ticket I needed to use all my accrued points that were about to expire from not being able to travel during the last 2 +years of Covid.

The process of trying to get a flight was 100% manual, i.e. calling in to speak with an associate, and relying on the associates to verbally relay to you what flight is available.  The website and app do not work.  I have been playing with it for a long time. I consider myself to be a tech. savvy user.  

I had to call 4 times, and finally actually got the mileage redemption ticket via United associates who were able to identify the mileage redemption class ticket on Eva Air for me.  Shame on KrisFlyer team!

Singapore airline is totally overrated.  Having a good in-flight service is only one component of customer experience.  But having an outdated system that does not bring convenience needs to be highlighted when considering being a long-term value member.
label: negative

text: Hopeless service from SIA. Expect worse service when they biy Air India Useless airline that employ foreign indians to handle customer service. Slow and hopeless service. Dont travel with SIA when they buy Air India.
label: negative

text: Family holiday to family in Australia Singapore airlines where fantastic and made you feel at ease.. comfortable and relaxed. Would definitely recommend Singapore airlines
label: positive

text: dont think the blankets are launder correctly After arriving at Heathrow my son and I developed a rash wich has been diagnosed as scabies wich I think we contracted on our flight from Singapore to Heathrow while being wrapped in our blankets .i think perhaps these blankets are not being properly laundered and need looking into .while scabies is easily treated it has been very annoying I hope Singapore airlines will keep up there high standards as I have always found them excellent.also I may be just me but I didn’t think the meals were as good as usual
label: positive

text:
Amazing service & flight The pilot made the flight a smooth & relaxing affair. We were in the large airbus plane & we didn't even realise we have taken off, it was seamless, as was the landing.  It was the best flight I have been on.

The staff on-board were very pleasant & helpful.  Our seats were roomy & the screens on the back of the seats were very good & they have a lot of variety of things to watch.

We pre-booked our seats & it was seamless.  the only thing is you now have to pay to pre-book your allocated seats.
label: positive

text: Best Economy Class Still my favorite airline. Best Economy Class, spacious sets with nice legroom, pleasing color fabric on seat covers. Each seat had a pillow and a blanket. You should ask to offer you an amenity kit (with socks, eye cover, toothbrush / paste). Pity they do not have inflight magazine due to covid, (same excuse to save money and weight_ a lot of airlines are using the same excuse). Both flights were on perfect A350 and on time. After takeoff they started the first service which was tasty and there was selection of wine, beer, drinks. After food was desert which was ice-cream. During flight the crew was passing by the bottle of water for the passengers. At the galley there were some sandwiches and drinks. In the WC there were toothbrushes, cologne and cream. One hour before landing the second meal was served which was as good and plentiful as the first.  IFE was great with a good selection of movies and easy to use. Great airline, keep the good work.
label: positive

text: Enjoyed this Airline I enjoyed this flight.  I have long legs and found the leg room very reasonable even with a bit to spare.  Food was good.  Cabin crew very polite and excitely presented.  Flight times were spot on.  I would definitely be happy to fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: It”s a great airlines!!! I have a two little kids. Air hostesses all the the time help us. Regarding their food and etc. it” really nice airlines. You will get reasonable price if you buy long time advance.
label: positive

text: Tech great Passenger comfort not. We looked forward to the flight as it was a new A350-900 - The aircraft was great but the airline economists (bean counters) went for lightweight seats that were not comfortable for a long flight. Seats with an additional 1-2 cm of padding would help with comfort over long distances.
label: neutral

text: A classy flying experience The Singapore Airlines flight to Manchester has been operating for a couple of years now - and it's certainly one of the best routes to the UK from Houston, although the price is beginning to get up there with the likes of BA and United now. However, the flight crew are SO attentive and really want to make the flight an enjoyable and thoroughly pleasant experience. For a cocktail, the Singapore Sling is a must! The food is always good and snacks, drinks and food plentiful. The A-350 is a good workhorse for this route - spacious and quiet. My only criticism is that the carry on baggage allowance weight is strictly enforced - meaning that very often, even if only a kilo over the carry on allowance, your hand luggage has to be checked. I really don't see the point in this as the overhead bins are usually half empty. Altogether though, a great flight, reminiscent of how flights used to be.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic 1st class The experience of flying 1st class with Singapore on their A380 suite exceeded my expectations. 
The suites are spacious,the champagne,  wine and food fantastic. 
The staff were friendly and met our every need.
It ticked all the boxes on my bucket list.
It was well worth it.
label: positive

text: Most disappointing Used to be a big fan of the airline till they screwed up one time too many. To be sure, the actual service on the flight is great, but the lead up to it is anything but. The website is slow. The customer service representatives do not respond to emails at all. The people on the chatbot are not very useful. With my latest trip, I just found out that after confirming my seat, that was cancelled and I now have to book another seat that is in a worse location. Yet the airline can't offer any satisfactory explanation. For an airline that is charging a serious premium over its peers, this is unacceptable. Will not be flying with Singapore Airlines again in the foreseeable future.
label: negative

text: Smooth Flight, Adequate Food Easy to drop your bags and get your boarding passes. We are able to combine our luggage weight instead of having to worry about individual luggage. Highly recommend online check in 48 Hours before flight time. Smooth boarding in groups. Ample luggage storage space on board. Food we had was a choice between asian rendang and international breakfast. Smooth landing to boot. Enjoyed it.
label: positive

text: Long flight made easy + COVID safe and Clean Staff regularly checked in on my mom, and for her, it didn't  feel like 17 hours at all. On SQ47 flight on Sep 4th, my mom was taken care of by Viona, Alvin, Grace, Albert, Philip Artha, and Cecilia. I am really appreciative of the wonderful service and peace of mind the staff gave me, knowing that my mom is well taken care of. They are the finest representation of SAs reputation. Also a very covid safe experience as they handed out sanitation kits at the start of the flight.
label: positive

text:
Easily sets the bar for Business Class Airline travel I try to review Business Class travel as well as hotels, because i like noting the comparisons and approaches in style of different airlines. If i were an airline executive trying to consider my Business Class experience one of the first things i would do is to go on this flight between LAX and Singapore with Singapore Airlines. If only to see what the current benchmark in business class travel is.

Now i am sure that you can buy your own first class apartment on a plane with a Gulf based carrier these days and i am sure you could argue that there is a level above this in commercial air travel and i am sure you are right but this is regular business class.

Apart from the nice lounge and delightful service when boarding the plane you essentially get your own entire private capsule, looking away from everyone else you get this tremendous feeling of space. Whereas Virgin and Delta point you inwards, Singapore point you outwards. It gives a tremendous sense of space, you dotn really feel like you are with a lot of other people.

And then there is the space they actually give you - it is a gigantic personal area you have, not only the seat - which i remember being massive on Singapore - but the lying space, the space at the side of you to put things, the charging space for your devices, all of it, there is just a really lovely sense of space. Clean, bright, private space, and that is above everything else is what you want.

But then add to that the proper lie flat bed (this is a 16 hour flight you are bound to need to sleep during some of it), which isnt a seat that goes flat but rather the kind that folds forward to create a proper flat bed, and in this case it cant be too much smaller than a normal single bed. Comfortable bedding and nice toiletries.

Couple that with the legendary Singapore service, the attentive staff, good food, plenty of water and it is a very very well put together offering.

But not perfect - here are two things i would call out, one is physical, one is a question of timing. So in the physical space, it is not quite long enough. When you have the bed out its just an inch or two too short, so you find yourself having to curl your knees which is a bit frustrating and i can imagine for someone taller than i am (Im 6ft) would be an issue. The other thing is the way they time the flight, i couldnt figure it out, they serve dinner after about 7 hours which means that they expect you to sleep before dinner - which is weird because you are leaving LA at 1130 in the morning and so bedding down for a nights sleep is weird. They told me it was because they were working on Singapore time but that sounded like a strange answer when youve just left LA. So i think there is some work they could do on their flight plan to get the timing and inter-sections of when things happen more logically defined. I guess that is flight specific though and shouldnt detract from the great effort they have made to continue to define the bar in Business Class travel.
label: positive

text:
One of the better airlines. I have flown with them many times and they are consistently very good. 

The one BIG negative to me is that they provide the front seats to people with infants to utilise bassinet clips. One previous flight I was in Premium Economy and had a screaming infant directly behind me on the bulkhead, hence I won't pay the extra any more. It is also a dangerous practice as they rows with extra room are those to be utilised in an emergency, for example one exit side is blocked these rows would be the crossover point.

The staff are always friendly and efficient and food better than average.

With the exception of their bassinet policy one of my favourite airlines.
label: positive

text:
Viaggio in Indonesia It was the first time I was traveling with this Asian company, I made two legs in the first leg (12 hours + 3 hours) and two legs on the way back (3 hours + 12 hours)
The planes were A350-900 aibus, so a very recent model and very clean inside.
The distance between the rows of seats was sufficient even for a robust adult and each station was equipped with a touch monitor with joystick, free there are available to the traveler numerous films (recently produced) in multiple languages and also several games with which my son was entertained for hours.
The trip was comfortable and the on-board staff was really courteous and helpful.
The ground staff was always very courteous and even in the first leg, although there had been a problem with the stroller that had remained in Singapore, they solved it in a few hours making it arrive immediately with the next flight.
In the future, I will definitely try to travel with this company again
label: positive

text: Just meh! Was expecting better from Singapore airlines but premium economy is nothing besides a bigger seat. Food was just ok, No amenities kit, not a great selection of entertainment. The poor passenger in front of me had a seat that wouldn’t recline. Overall it was not worth the price. Definitely have had better experience with other airlines. Only saving grace was the ground staff and flight attendants were wonderful.
label: negative

text: A wonderful flight with Singapore as usual. We fly reasonably regularly to London Heathrow and we just love Singapore business. My wife now needs wheelchair assistance at big international airports like Changi and Heathrow and this is organised seamlessly. The lounges are comfortable well stocked and have very helpful staff. Seating in business is spacious and very comfortable with seemingly endless adjustments. The flat bed allows a pretty good sleep although I can never work out how to get it in sleeping mode although there is always cabin crew there to help me. The food is very good and beautifully presented. There is a huge entertainment library and the system is easy to use. Deservedly Singapore is always at the very top of best long haul airlines. We would always prefer to use SIA business.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines A350 Regional to Perth Singapore Airlines regional A350 has all the advantages of a modern wide body airplane. The high ceilings, wide aisles and extra large windows give an airy feel. The pressurisation to a lower equivalent altitude makes one feel refreshed at the end of the flight. SQs inflight entertainment system remains one of the best in the business. I like the position of the earphone connector which takes it away from the tray table and passenger- this avoids entangling of the cord with your food and clothing. Inflight service was spot on- even with "special requests" for green tea or White Russians. My one complaint with this plane and the 787-10 is the thin seat cushion( I am told it is an elastic sling like a hammock)- this causes buttock aches on longer flights. My suggestion is to ask for an extra blanket or pillow for extra padding. Perhaps SQ should avoid fitting this seat in the future.
label: positive

text: PROFESSIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE We have travelled many times to Singapore over the years and always with Singapore Airlines.
