In September 2019 we had the pleasure of travelling Perth/Singapore/HoChiMinh and SiemReap/Singapore/Perth Business Class and it was everything we could have wanted. Our flights and lounge visits exceeded our expectations and we have again booked Singapore Airlines for May 2020. We received the most amazing customer service from every staff member but the highest credit must go to Patricia of the Singapore Airlines Business Class Lounge in Singapore.  Patricia observed that my husband was unwell and a little concerned about the distance from lounge to gate.  She used her initiative and went above and beyond by arranging transport for us, and kept us fully informed which was greatly appreciated.  Patricia has definitely made an impression on us and we hope to see her again in May.
label: positive

text:
Economy service at twice the price The chair space is 8 seats across the plane as compared to 9 seats in economy.
The service is the same as economy, same meal, same staff rushing to service you with the economy section.
You compete with the economy passengers to use the toilets.
Why pay twice the full economy airfare for an extra 2” of space.
label: negative

text:
Used to care about customers--not anymore I have flown Singapore Airlines from the past 20 years regularly to India from SFO. They used to care about customers before; apparently, being named the best airline in the world has gone to their head and they think they no longer have to satisfy their customers.
I flew Premium economy recently to Bangalore--the flight was ordinary. I was expecting an offer to upgrade to business class before my flight (like Emirates, or even China airlines, offers) and I have more than 50,000 pts. No offer came--I tried to offer a bid, the system didn't allow me to. When I saw the flight, there were plenty of seats empty in Business class. Not sure why they don't want to offer the premium economy passengers to upgrade to business.

Warning to everyone travelling from SFO--some connections to India have a very short layover--less than an hour. SA doesn't have any consideration that if the landing is a few minutes late and the connecting flight is within 30 minutes, they shouldn't make the passenger run from one terminal to another even using Skytrain. I barely made it before the gate closed (with my bad knees). Remember, you have to go through security in Singapore when you have a connecting flight. I had to rush from Terminal B to C.  

While returning from Bangalore, I had ~4 kgs extra. Instead of asking me to pay using my over 50000 points, Singapore airlines charge me for a whole piece. So watch out, even if you are just 3- 4 kgs over the limit, they will charge the cost of a whole suitcase. This is another example of not caring for customers. They can charge per Kg weight instead of an additional piece of luggage like other airlines do--no, they are special because they go the tag of 'World's best airlines' :(. Not allowing me to pay extra baggage with my points, no consideration if you are Kris flyer member with 1000s of points, they just don't care about you but want to make you pay for everything. 
Flight and food was ordinary (food quality has declined from SF to Singapore)  and the bathroom cleanliness while going and coming was not up to par like it used to be. Changi airport is exceptional of course.

I am not sure I will  be flying this airline again while there are so many carriers who offer upgrades for reasonable price, cheaper tickets. Not sure what to do with more than 50,000 points though.
label: negative

text: Best experience ever! Ifedi had the best experience with Singapore airlines best service and amazing stuff you are on s business coast or bot they all make you feel special and very looked after. Thank you for a very nice relaxing trip I recommend to everyone no matter what class that will be.
label: positive

text: Never using I used Singapore airlines cuz friends & Co workers said it is very good service. I had problem from the start. First flying scheduled change then the seat cannot be assigned ahead of time unless you pay extra.
label: negative

text: Great crew Flew from Melbourne to Singapore and the service was exceptional. The crew was attentive and authentic, unlike some Middle Eastern airlines.  The seats in business class was very comfortable and spacious although sleeping at an angle was not ideal.  Book the Cook was worth the effort as it was a step up from the norm.  Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: Good Experience  Flew Singapore Airlines - London Heathrow to Singapore and in to Sydney. Stayed two nights in Singapore on the outward journey which was really worthwhile. Flew back with a three hour lay-over  in Singapore which was manageable as we had free access to the Singapore Airlines Lounge to shower eat and rest. All the way in one day is however a challenge and what I would say is that paying to upgrade for that flight might have been worth the money as we were economy for all flights. Economy is still a good experience with this airline with excellent in-flight service and very modern aircraft - however for the 14 hours for Singapore to London flying West ... economy plus or even business class would be money well spent and easier all round.Overall Singapore Airlines are nice to fly with, staff and service excellent and worth the money.
label: positive

text: Better than expected I was worried about flying to Singapore with my Disabled husband and a Mobility scooter but I was put at ease on arrival at Manchester check in which the process went as smooth as it possible in could. We were in Economy but compared with other airlines we found the seats and space quite comfortable. Food on the first leg to Singapore was excellent but the second leg to Manilia was poor with choices running out quickly. Lucky for us this leg was only 3hrs. Staff were very helpful and could not do enough despite a full plane and long flight. Would definitely  book again with these. A big bonus for me because I and Deaf was subtitles on all the new films so made my journey so much better. Thank you for all the help with my husband.
label: positive

text: Tryin SQ for the first time! This is my first time using SQ, I have a KF silver tier but SQ only allow gold member and above to queue in Business class line. Seat was comfy but inflight entertainment not touch screen but its okay the range of entertainment was very good, my mom enjoy her movie. Food was soo gooddd and the cabin crew were very helpful and caring.. one of the cabin crew even took a good care of my dad who suddenly having fever... very on time, boarding process already started 1 hour before take off so everything went smooth. Surely will fly again with SQ
label: positive

text: Not what I expected Having only flown charter or budget airlines we were excited to fly on this renowned airline. Was left dissapointed to be honest. The seats weren't very comfortable and less room than Thomas Cook or Tui in long haul. The food was hit and miss. Some OK some absolutely disgusting, with fish bones and scales in a meal described as chicken. Getting water was a chore and served in thimbles. Worrying on a 13 hour flight. Had no idea until near the end of a 13 hour flight that you could request snacks and alcohol (as none offered) from back of plane but pretty poor selection. IFE system very poor, irritating to navigate and poor selection. Games didn't work on any of the 4 legs we had. Again, much better selection on the cheap charter airlines. Only positives were the short legs from Singapore to siem reap and back. Much better service, same size seats! 737 cleaner and newer than the a380 or 777. Also enjoyed flying a380, very smooth flight on such a large aircraft. Would recommend Changi airport as a layover but not their national carrier.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable Although the flight from Singapore to Manila was delayed for operational reasons,the Airlines more than compensated that with their hospitality and the delicious food. The communication was unambiguous  and the satisfaction of the passengers was ensured.
label: positive

text: There is no way better to fly as with Singapore Airlines It was my 18th flight from Berlin-Zurich-Singapore-Melbourne/Sydney-Singapore-Munich-Berlin. And my first flights in Premium Economy from ZUR-SIN-MEL-/SYD-SIN and I was so happy and lucky with all my flights with Singapore Airlines. In Premium Eco.  You have more legroom, bigger screens, 3 options for oder a meal for Lunch/Breakfast or Dinner. A bwater bottle on your suit. And the suits are most comfort for this premium eco. class for sleep on long flights. So was very happy to enjoy the flights.  And of course the Crew Members are so helpful in every service on board and very friendly.
label: positive

text: first leg of flight beautiful flight very friendly and helpful employees tsof movies and shows to watch on 13 “ screen for a 17 1/ hr flight. A+ in my book
label: positive

text:
No more flying with Singapore Airlines.. complete scam Initially bought the ticket for December 2021 for €920, agreed with the complimentary unlimited rebooking with no rebooking fee policy as well as the "Fare difference" 
I thought in case when i rebook to next year April which is 4 months later, it would not have any "Fare difference"... 
turns out that's how the airline make money right... they charge 100euro in "Fare difference"!!! 
and when i go separately to search for a new ticket in April 2022, the price is only €600, so where does the rest of €300 go? and they still charge extra €100 for "Fare difference" ??!!!
is this a joke?
label: negative

text:
Not worth the price Constant disappointment with SQ lately. Food is extremely bad, I fell sick after my last short flight to HK. Customer service and benefits for Krisflyer members are mediocre and the website is constantly failing. Not sure what they do with the money they charge cause their product quality has clearly dropped. 

Not what it used to be. Flying Japanese/Middle Eastern airlines moving forward.
label: negative

text: Trip to Bkk by Singapore Airlines Depart from Changi Airport Terminal 2 Singapore. Airport was superb. Can check yourself or at counter. Assistance available if you need help. At departure gate everything was orderly and on time. Greeted at the plane door by cheerful staff down to the aisle. At the entrance can take your choice of earphone for inflight entertaintment and choice of newspapers.Overhead compartment is spacious. Staff constantly smiling while attending to passengers request. Few minutes after departure passengers were given hot towels to refresh.Meals were served later on which passengers were given two options. If you are on a particular diet restriction pls inform when making bookings prior to departure. I have always like this airline bec they depart on time everytime seldom experience any delays. The staff are very professional.
label: positive

text:
Makes economy travel bearable Ok..the A380 was a bit delayed around the edges. The staff however were great and worked their socks off bringing drinks and snacks around.
Food is excellent for economy and you get a menu which is a nice touch. Makes it feel less like cattle class.
Seats are not amazing but tell me an airline whose economy seats are comfortable after 13 hours.
Overall a bearable experience with totally professional staff who do a great job.
label: positive

text: SQ2, best flight to Hong Kong Being a long haul flight, SQ2 that flies from Singapore to San Francisco via Hong Kong, it is the best flight to fly to Hong Kong as they serve on full, and utilize best equipment, i.e. They use the latest 777 with the latest interior (full flat bed). I had the Book the Cook menu of Lobster Thermidor with fresh asparagus, very delicious and well presented. Always choose the bulk head seat of row 11 to get more leg-room.
label: positive

text: No stress Wonderful flight attendants ultra clean great food no stress airline have flown many times with them and all the flights are of a consistent quality
label: positive

text: First Class Airline Quality airline, very professional staff in looks/service, nice food, good in-flight enertainment, what you would expect from a top airline, could not fault anything
label: positive

text: Terrible customer service We couldn't board the flight because I tested positive for Covid pre-flight. The rebooking process was a nightmare. We called their customer service so many times, each time almost an hour of waiting and talking. They always promised to follow up after a manual fee calculation has been done. But they never called, and the whole process repeats itself again and again like in a horror movie. In my last call, the lady was very rude, so I have to write this review to let people know that Singapore airline is not what it used to be.
label: negative

text: Genuinely Caring Our daughter suffers badly from air sickness, after our initial trip to England where she was sick the whole way on Qantas, understandably she was worried and upset about the long flight ahead going home, shortly after we took our seats, and as all would be aware how hectic it is during the boarding,  one of the fantastic flight attendants noticed her and asked if all was OK, to which we advised her concerns, he said he would keep checking on her to make sure she was OK, he was back in no time with water, cold flannel etc etc, and continued to keep on checking and paying extra attention to her during our flight, a breath of fresh air compared to our fight on Qantas. It was so assuring to see genuine concern and care, surprisingly she made it all the way without being or feeling sick! coincidence or not?
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight I fly with this airline often and although I have had one issue with them earlier in the year I find them to be Fair with there prices and the flights to be comfortable. The food is ok and the staff on board are welcoming.. inflight entertainment is of good selection. On a scale of 1-10 I would give them a 8 there is always room for improvement and if I was to choose where that is I would say the price even though they are fair but could be fairer when it comes to holiday period
label: positive

text: Very efficient operation Singapore Airlines was extremely efficient at getting over 200 people & all of their luggage to transfer from one airplane coming into Singapore to another going to Bali in less than 30 minutes!
label: positive

text:
Truly A Great Way to Fly Always a very pleasant flight with Singapore Airlines. Premium economy was definitely a worth while splurge. Seat was comfy with super fluffy pillow. Champagne was nice, food was ok. Entertainment selection was good. Luggage service was quick.
All and all, highly recommended.
label: positive

text:
Very good when everything works, but if not... Because the direct flight to Singapore was fully booked when I needed to travel I had to transfer in Milano. Because of the fact that I could not check in until Jakarta in Frankfurt (I booked it as a connecting flight) my luggage got lost in Milano. In Milano there is no transfer desk for Singapore airlines.
I finally got my luggage 2 days later. I asked for compensation and after 5 weeks (!) they responded that I'm not eligible for that. Basically they are hiding behind hotlines and e-mail and only reply with the standard Q&A. 
Their level of service is not even dependent on your status of the class of travel (I got Krisflyer Gold).
So, if everything works well its a nice airline, but beware if they make a mistake...
label: neutral

text: Excellent Service Flew to Brisbane on SQ265 last month and was really impressed with their new Airbus A350-900.  The seats in economy were very comfortable and they have simplified their TV system by going only touch screen.  The awkward remote is gone and doesn't complicate the seat armrests any further.  There is a USB port located under the TV screen as well as an earphone port, making it all fuss free.  The service was really good but having flown a few different airlines over the last few years, nothing beats Singapore air.
label: positive

text:
NOT WHAT IT USED TO BE I have flown many times on Singapore Airlines over the past 15 years except during Covid 2020-2021.
I was looking forward to my flights booking again, but how the level of service has changed for the worst.
Cebu - Singapore was on budget airline Scoot, the low-cost carrier of the Singapore Airlines Group.
Nice meal served chicken and vegetables - up to standard for a budget airline. I paid $4 for a cup of tea. I was ready for the usual very good meal on the 2nd leg Singapore to Sydney. It used to be entre fruits with beautiful main meal, This time is was one meal - 6 chunks of chicken on a huge bed of noodles. And that's it. No veges - very plain cheap meal. I had a cup of tea and later an ice cream. Guess what - the meal on the Scoot the budget airline was far better than what was served on the main Singapore Airlines flight. No chance of a second cup of tea - the crew zoomed down the aisles with trolleys so fast, call out and they don.t stop. No drinks later in the flight except just before landing and water only. used to be regular service of juices AND a snack meal 60-90 minutes before landing in Sydney.
It appears this airline is making up for lost income during covid by giving less food and beverages during flights. Well on a nearly 8 hour flight on a top reputation international airline you do expect a meal of reasonable quality not at a standard below budget airlines. 
Best they jack up the price by say $25 and give passengers the food and beverage service they are used to. I also might add I greatly miss the Chess game that was always in the Games in In-flight Entertainment. Chess should be a standard inclusion but they have taken it out. A budget decision?
label: negative

text: In style When we decided to travel to Singapore and Hongkong we chose Singapore airlines as they had a good name the price was good and also being their home area, we were not disappointed although we were in enonomy class we were treated first class from the time we boarded until we left the plane the staff always with a smile doing everything to make your journey enjoyable. The meals are first rate hot tasty and plentiful plus a good drink selection, inflight entertainment consists of a great range of movies music enough to cover every ones needs seats are comfortable, plane was presented spotless and kept that way throughout the flight by the crew we have been back twice now and are looking for our third trip and would not fly with anyone else.
label: positive

text:
Still the best This flight from Manchester employs the Airbus A350-900 whereas the Heathrow option is on the larger A380. I much prefer the benefits of higher pressurisation and humidity with the A350 which do make a difference.
Manchester Airport is very busy but efficient and less of a hassle than Heathrow.
I have travelled with Qatar and Emirates but still prefer Singapore Airlines for consistency and connections at Changi.
label: positive

text:
Pleasant red eye flight Wonderful to be flying in SQ, this time to Christchurch. We were the first to board the Boeing 777-200ER. Seats were in 1-2-1 configuration with aisle access to every passenger in business class.

The food, as expected, was amazing; keeping in mind that we are in a pressurised cabin 30,000ft up in the air and our taste buds go nuts.

Seats were comfortable; better than the 2007 business class version. Lots of thoughtful storage spaces. Managed to get 5 hours of sleep in the flat "bed".
label: positive

text: The best by a long way Numerous round trips Manchester - Houston  in economy all consistently as good as it will ever get. Two full meals and a mid flight snack better than the journey’s end fare supplied by other airlines. The roast turkey on Christmas Eve was worthy of a good restaurant as was the later meal. The cheapest and best every time.  Good service from checking in to getting off. Brand new planes, better seats, excellent service. I doubt the authenticity of some of the “reviews” I’ve been reading. I cross the Atlantic frequently with a cross section of airlines flying into various hubs. Singapore Airlines economy is better then premium economy in any of the competitors I’ve tried.
label: positive

text:
Shoutout to leading steward Mr Cheong Paid premium price for SQ (most expensive as compared to other international carriers) only to receive basic service. I think this is the only airline that does not allow us to choose our preferred seats in advance, well unless you wanna fork out extra money. *roll eyes* Got stuck in the middle seat of a full flight on the way back home, with the SAME TYPE of meat for our halal food option which is lamb. Whats worst is both of us do not eat lamb and we cant even specify this down when we were selecting our halal food requirement. Luckily the leading flight steward, Mr Cheong, was empathetic towards us and help us change to a seafood meal instead. He also came checking up on us every now and then to see if we were doing fine and accommodating to our every needs. Its nice to come back home to this kind of impeccable service... With that said, SQ has still so much to improve in terms of food quality (fish has some kind of smell, lamb was not cooked properly, pudding was not nice at all - better stick to ice creams) Only delicious thing was the Turkish baklava.

On another flight to Heathrow, my sister asked for seafood instant noodles but was also not provided. One of my friend did not get her Halal food even though she has already requested for this way in advance, reason because they had "overlooked" it and they do not have any extra to cater for her. Next time we will just stick with Emirates... well at least we have the option to choose a window seat without paying extra.
label: neutral

text:
basically hassle free apart from being late at the changeover which suited as we were late from BNE - all else was perfect.
even the seat was bearable
the refreshments were great
service by hosts was efficient
OVERALL a quality airline WILL FLY AGAIN
label: positive

text:
Very good Flew on several legs London to Singapore 
Singapore to Bangkok
Bangkok to Phuket 
Using Silk Air and Singapore Airlines 
Lots of legroom and quite comfy as far as economy class goes.
Would always try to book bulk head or aisle seats so you are free to get up as you wish. 
Staff are really good and attentive and the service is very good.
Lots of food and drink even on the short legs of our trip. The choice and quality was really good. 
I didn’t think the entertainment choice was that good to be honest, not many films I would of wanted to watch. 
The amenity kit is rubbish compared to the likes of Qatar and virgin. yes we got a pillow and a blanket and could get a set of headphones on the way onto the aircraft. But only a toothbrush, toothpaste and a pair of socks. No earbuds or eye mask but not the end of the world. 
All in all no long haul unless your fortunate to afford the upfront seats which you can lay down on is ever going to be lots of fun, but they do what they can to make you comfortable and happy.
label: positive

text:
Surprisingly Bad Service For long haul flights (especially going to Europe), my husband and I usually fly with Qatar Airways but this year because QR"s rates were higher than expected, we explored other airlines. Though other airlines like Saudia and Etihad were substantially lower than QR, SQ and EK, we decided to go with Singapore Airlines (SQ) because we previously experienced good service over all. Unfortunately, not for the SG-ZRH leg of our trip. 

We were seated near the galley and we found out that wasn't a good place to be assigned. We were always served last and by the time the attendants reach us, there were no more choices of food. Also, they always rush past you in and out, hence, if you have a request you have to wait a while to be served or noticed.

Also, for some reason, SQ provides amenity kits only when you ask to be given one when the attendants with big plastic carrier pass by. If you're not paying attention or is asleep, you won't be given one. 

Disappointing because our previous experiences with SQ were good. The premium cost we paid to fly with them was not worth it. 

We'll be going back to QR next time.
label: neutral

text: Fantastic Service Flew from Wellington, New Zealand to London wirh my husband and two children.  What fantastic service all the staff provide. Thank you.
label: positive

text:
Huge payment glitch at booking - Poor recognition of frequent flyers This happened when booking a ticket for a trip in June 2020. Singapore airlines website has a timeout bug at the payment level and I had to book several times the same ticket. After my card got rejected on the fourth attempt I realized that they have been charging my card each time. I had to increase my card limit and top up big time to book a fourth time over the phone with an agent. What follows is a nightmare. Extremely difficult to get the failed bookings payments removed from my card. Took very long (still not over) with all the impacts you can imagine on using my card for any other expenses
Singapore airlines proposed to give me 2000 miles for the inconvenience which I refused. This was an amazingly cheap offer for the tens of hours spent over the phone with them, with my bank, organizing conference calls, managing my credit card failed payments and all the emotional impacts this all triggers.
Singapore airlines, you are too greedy. Now I understand why in 15 years being with you as a PPS and gold member I have never been upgraded. I will try other airlines.
label: negative

text:
SQ experience It jus gotten worst  Flew on 21st Oct 23, flight seems almost full.
Last Flew on SQ was almost 10yrs ago, which I remembered the flight was cold and cozy.
But this flight has been a very terrible experience,  seat was not comfortable,  front seats is too closed , very difficult to view the screen on the seat in front of u.

Worst part is the air control,  its not cold but very warm and stuffy!  There wasn't any air vent hole for u to control the cold air blowing at you. But seems to come from the top. It's more like a dehumidifier setting rather than aircon . I saw ppl around me all fanning themselves! 

Yes ppl have to fan themselves like in the 80s where buses have no aircon , hot stuffy and soaking with perspiration atvthe end of the 5-6hr flight!!!

Will not take this flight ever again , horrible experience!
label: negative

text: Holiday We have been flying wjth Singapore Air fot the last 15 years always The Best. Staff service all the best. Right trough the night theyvwill serve you and be there for your comfort. Thanjpks to staff of Singapore
label: positive

text: Good as it always is with Singapore Airlines Good as it always is with Singapore Airlines. Planes are clean, Flight attendants are prompt, friendly & professional. Flight was on time.
label: positive

text:
Best flight and service, ever!!!! The Check-in service is spot on and very professional and staff are well trained.
On board the new A350 aircraft and you are greeted with sheer luxury. The Singapore girl greets you with a smile as you are directed to your seat.
This followed by a lovely breakfast.
The seats are very comfortable with good leg-room. The in-flight entertainment is top notch.
label: positive

text:
🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬 I used to fly business with sia before Covid but with their ridiculous fares now I tried economy premium (business class ) price previous.   Not worth the money   It seems flying south from Asia is where they rip everyone as friends flying opposite pay way less
Very disappointed and will look for alternatives in future.  As they say let your feet do the talking
label: negative

text:
Always an amazing experience Singapore Airlines never cease to amaze me. My latest trip saw my partner and i leave from Sydney heading to Male. We stopped by for 4 nights in Singapore also. 
Both Singapore and Silk Air (smaller flight from Male to Singapore) were very friendly and nothing is ever too much trouble. I always try to fly with Singapore Airlines now over other options available.

text: Wonderful in flight staff and services  What a wonderful ppl lively food extremely comfortable seats/bed.  For it's Business class lounge and free foot message 7 🌟 to Singapore airlines. Though Singapore airlines Economy class is also amazingly comfortable. Food it's presentation all was just perfect
label: positive

text: Losing its edge? Like most people, I have a high regard for Singapore airlines. So I was quite disappointed on a recent flight from Brisbane to Singapore. Most aspects were very good: entertainment, food, service. However, the seating was well below expectations. Not only was the seat uncomfortable, but the row spacing was also very tight. I am below average height but I could barely move my legs. Moreover, the entertainment screen on the seat in from was very close to my face, even when that seat was not reclined. This might be tolerable on a short flight but for 8 hours it was very hard to take. Are Singapore Airlines resting on their laurels? If this is what I can expect in the future I will be looking to travel on another airline.
label: neutral

text: great service I was not looking forward to this long flight but with movies and meal service shortening the hours it was not so bad
label: positive

text: Business between Bali and Singapore First time flying with Singapore Airlines.  Check in was easy, meals delicious and plenty of it. Getting extra drinks was not difficult. Selection of on board entertainment was good. Great new plane
label: positive

text: As always As always the staff particularly the aircrew are what makes long distance flying in economy class bearable. Singapore airlines crew are hugely respectful whilst being in control. Always responsive and where possible positive to requests.
label: positive

text:
Great service but.... We flew from Adelaide to Rome, Paris to Adelaide and felt that the service was great. For some reason, Singapore Airlines don't have Premium Economy on the Adelaide-Singapore (and return) leg of our journey so that remains a disappointment. The Premium Economy legs were so much more comfortable and have spoilt us for travelling Economy for the long hauls, if we can ever afford the extra expense again. The food, drinks and service were great, as in a previous trip, but the IT side of the airline really needs some serious work as we had a ridiculous amount of trouble with the website time and again. So much so, that both times we've travelled to Europe we had to spend ages on the phone while we were overseas trying to sort out an issue.
We really enjoyed the service and personnel, but both times we travelled the website was painful and resulted in phone calls instead. The difficulty we've experienced with the website for checking in, securing seats, payments etc, would be the only thing that would cause us to look at another carrier.
label: positive

text: Great service Great Great service, Great food, Loads of space. Accommodating crew. connecting via Singapore was a pleasant quick experience. I would highly recommend this airline and will use them again when traveling any where in Asia
label: positive

text: Wonderful flight to Melbourne We took Singapore Airlines for our trip to Melbourne in Jun 2019. The flight is smooth and wonderful. The service is awesome. It is our preferred choice airlines for travel. Thumbs up for Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Cheerful and helpful staff with good service I haven't flown with Singapore Airline for a while but this time because the ticket price was very reasonable and flight time were perfect (arriving Istanbul early), my friend an I choose Singapore. 
Overall the flight experience was very pleasant. Plane from Taipei-Singapore was very new with good leg space and comfortable chair. Movies on flight entertainment system was also new and has an USB charger. In-flight food was also delicious, can choose from Chinese or Singaporean style dishes. Plane from Singapore-Istanbul was not so new, no USB charger, but seats were also comfortable. During the 10 hour flight, the crew provided good service, always asked if passengers needed anything. Overall I recommend this flight and would choose Singapore Air again when visiting Istanbul. 

PS. If you happen to take Singapore Airline, their safety demo video is the most elegant demo videos I've seen.
label: positive

text: excellent cabin crew Food was very good.  Used to entertainment on Emirates so hard to review this, but not a great selection for me.  Cabin crew were very attentive and friendly.  Lots of coming round with refreshments.
label: positive

text: World’s best airline What can be said about the world’s best airline!  The planes are clean, staff are very friendly and helpful, the food is good (for plane food), and the entertainment is good.  I have travelled on other airlines, but this airline always get# a 10/10
label: positive

text:
A pleasure to fly with Singapore For years I've had to change flights when flying MAN to IAH, so the introduction of a direct flight by Singapore airlines was great news to me.  But it's not just the faster journey time and the benefit of a single flight that made this journey great... the service provided by Singapore is simply light-years ahead of the alternatives.  The planes feel so much better; they are cleaner, more comfortable, the seats feel more spacious, and the entertainment is fantastic. Unlike US airlines, all drinks are included in the price.  And also unlike US airlines, the staff are pleasant, helpful and don't make you feel like you are ruining their day simply by being on their plane.
Highly recommended... I'll definitely be using Singapore Airlines for all future flights to Houston.
label: positive

text: Crew members were EXCELENT! Don;t want to use any other airline == wish they flew domestic (USA)!!!!! Non stop food and drinks of all kinds!!!!
label: positive

text: Very lousy service! my check in luggage was damaged! SIA claimed that they are not the handler hence they are not liable! But I checked in my luggage with them and they should be liable! i don’t care whom they outsource to! Very lousy customer service!
label: negative

text:
This airlines scams customers Beware, this airlines scams their customers:
The airline refuses to refund my ticket. The request to instead rebook my ticket if a refund is not possible was also never replied to. I had contacted the airlines on april 20th via their portal and have not received any answer until now. I had also called their customer service last week and had to wait 1 hour until someone picked up. The person that picked up was not helpful at all, putting me on hold for at least another 20 minutes in total. In the end my request to refund the ticket into credits or money or at least rebook the ticket in the same class for another date was not fullfilled. I was told I could expect another call from a manager in the same week which did not happen. If you think of buying tickets from this airlines please don't, because they clearly do not care about their customers and basically scam them of their money.
label: negative

text: Care about customers The company really cares about their customers. We were about to spend the whole day at the airport when they offered us an earlier flight with an excellent connection. A special thank you to Chris. Unfortunately I don't know his second name, but he was working there on 23/11/2019.
label: positive

text: Its the best airline in the world for a reason It seems so wrong to sleep in a business class flight that has the potential to check so many boxes for entertainment, food, drink and comfort. However, the wide lay flat bed is exactly the reason it is worth the extra. I love Singapore Airlines and will go well out of my way to fly with them.
label: positive

text:
Did not wow me this time After the last premium economy from london to singapore where i was impressed with service this did not wow me 

Trippel7 300 with 2 4 2 config in premium.had window seat. 
Inflight entertainment was good. 

Food was not as appealing  last time. Both dinner and light bites. Passed on dinner. 

Orange juice was
label: positive

text:
Double payment for flight I recently purchased flights from Melbourne to Koh Samui return.  Singapore Airlines has taken the payment from my account twice.  They tell me that they are holding it for pre-authorisation.  So they take the flight money out on 12th July, then take the same amount again on 17th for pre-authorisation?  This is ridiculous.  Has anyone else ever experienced this before?  By going overdrawn on that account, it has given me no end of problems, least of which was being left stranded at a petrol station with no way of paying for the fuel.

Singapore Airlines response and concern has been almost non-existent.  I've probably been using SA for 50% of my business flights recently.  If there isn't a satisfactory outcome to this, I will insist that Singapore Airlines never be used again.
label: negative

text: What’s happened to one of the best airlines? Singapore airlines have always been our preferred overseas airline based on the quality of service and especially their food quantity. We travelled to and from Melbourne to Phuket via Singapore, 4 flights and did not enjoy any of the food served on the flights. Based on what we saw, we were not alone in returning meal trays barely touched. Surely this should tell the catering staff to lift their game.
label: neutral

text: A good experience marred by faulty in-flight entertainment system Flying through Singapore Airlines is something I looked forward to because of the reputation they have built for themselves. And, overall, it was a good experience but I would not recommend it. Before getting into the cons, let me address the pros. The flight is well maintained. Courteous, smiling crew welcomes you into the flight. The seats were comfortable, legroom was sufficient, temperature controls were good, and in-flight entertainment provides the passenger with a lot of options to choose from.The food served was delicious(All of the other airlines I have traveled so far in have not yet managed to do this!), lot of options are available for alcoholic/non-alcoholic beverages. But, unfortunately, in the flight I was in, the in-flight entertainment stopped working the moment cabin crew started with the safety instructions. This problem persisted for pretty much the entire duration of the flight and was fixed about an hour before landing. So, there was nothing to do but sleep in the flight! For the amount they charge, I expected a better/quicker resolution of the issue. Nonetheless, a good flight, overall.
label: neutral

text:
SINGAPORE AIRLINES NEW PREMIUM ECONOMY CABIN A350-900 The past 10 months Singapore Airlines has centered a lot of focus around their new A350-900 planes and the newly improved Premium Economy class product so we decided to hop on the direct service at 11.55pm on SQ246 from Brisbane to Singapore to see for ourselves. 

Premium economy was spacious and head height was great for all those tall people.  

The plane flight in itself was superb, it was so smooth it didn’t even feel like you were flying.  Plane was very clean and well maintained. 

New comfortable leather seats with reading lights extended from the seat but the big plus the extra recline, more legroom, extendable footrest and larger windows.  

If you’re aren't able to splash out on business class as the average traveler can’t I say spend that little extra on Premium Economy for the extra comfort on a long haul flight. 

Menu was good but presentation needs a little bit of tweaking, it’s not economy food and certainly not at the business level neither and don’t be offended by drinking champagne out of a plastic glass. 

Cabin crew for the flight were very polite as always but felt both meal services were very rushed and the service level is not what Singapore Airlines was well known in the early days.

They’ve upgraded the headphones with noise cancellation including a superior quality pillow and blanket. 

You receive an amenities pouch but don’t expect to much you get a pair of socks with a miniature toothbrush and toothpaste. 

Configuration is 2-4-2 with a total of 24 seats in the class. Our tip, choose Row 31 even more legroom (as per photo) our choice was 31A-B on the window and aisle. 

Paying for Premium Economy does not give you privilege to the Silver Kris Lounge however if you are a Gold Kris Flyer or a Gold Velocity Frequent flyer and above you receive that access where you can sit upstairs for e.g. Brisbane International airport lounge and watch over gate 81 where you will embarking for your journey as it prepares for it’s departure.  

When in Singapore you have access to Kris Flyer Gold Lounge which is great to refresh and recharge for your connecting flight.  Safe travels and happy flying ✈️

🔴 See my Singapore Air highlight on instagram @sophie_sikalas
label: positive

text:
13.5 hour flight Flew on a 777 which we found to be more spacious than the A380 of our outbound flight. Both flights were on time. 

Cabin crew were great, very attentive. Food and drinks were very good and plentiful. 

Entertainment was also very good with a large selection of tv and film

We would definitely use the airline again. Highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Krisflyer program Please beware of this, they have absolutely no incentive to keep you on your present Krisflyer status, even if you have not even accrued more needed miles in previous years to re-qualify you for the same status. If you do go above and beyond what is needed, would recommend you fly with other airlines as you may get better treatment.
label: negative

text:
First time. Not the last. I have always known that Singapore are good but I have never before flown on an airline where a steward comes out of the rear galley with a tray of beers offering them out to thirsty flyers like myself.
The service was everything I expected and more.
Nothing really to add. They aren't a five star airline for nothing.
One tiny problem. I was cold on all four A350 flights. First time I've used an airline blanket. Next time I'll bring an extra sweater.
As long as their prices are competitive they will be the number one choice.
label: positive

text:
THE best way to travel to the USA from MANCHESTER end of story !!! I was blown away by the Aircraft the A350, It was fabulous

The attendants and service levels where Fantastic

What a way to travel to the USA
Lots of legroom and Im 6ft 5 inches
!0 inch seat back entertainment system
Beautiful helpful crew
And were always on view somewhere on the flight
Top class food....what else !

They just dont seem to still have any onward connections with the Alliance that they are in the USA, which is Poor as it could make them even more money and have more customers travelling with them

But still a fabulous airline to fly with
label: positive

text:
What an airline We have had the best experience flying SIA. Starting with check in we had Sara at Brisbane Airport. So friendly and helpful. I told her we always fly QF and that this was our first time. What a star! Please someone recognise this girl, she is amazing and set us off with a smile.
We were in Business on SQ976 on the 20th of December and the staff went out of their way to ensure comfort. They were all wonderful. Thank you SIA for the experience! After flying QF for over 20 years internationally, now I have to reconsider for our next trip! Also I spoke to Jessica in the call centre - another star - helped me immensely. I still love QF with all my heart but encourage you, if you haven't flown with SIA yet to try it. You will not be disappointed!
label: positive

text: 50/50 experience Have flown BA before and found the planes old and worn.  Recommended Singapore Air and was expecting a lot more.  Check in at Heathrow was good and easy.  Firat leg on 380 to Singapore was good.  Small P.E. area with its own washroom facilities and dedicted stewards.  Whole area was spotless and new.  The calf rest is useless if the seat in front reclines which also means leaving your seat requires a limbo manouvre. We had book the cook but the food was not good.  Regular food lookd better.  1.5 hr change in Singapore is a long, long, long walk.  Shall have assistance on return.  Singapore to Sydney was very old, very worn Boeing 777.  Had to go through  Economy to washrooms which was a long walk through narrow aisles on a very bumpy flight.  So many people using washrooms meant they became untidy.  The seats were not comfortable, calf rests useless as on earlier flight.  Seat pockets in front were broken and exposing sharp metal fixings.  Stewards on both legs were helpful and very pleasant.  I do not think we got Premium on the second leg, felt very let down.  Would definitely not do Singapore Air 777 again.  Not sure I would even do Premium Economy for the 380.  This is really NOT value for money.
label: positive

text: UNFORTUNATELY THE SERVICE WITH A SMILE HAS GONE Singapore Airlines was top of the pops as far as flying was concerned. On this flight however, the stewardess were just doing their job, going through the motions and nothing more. Felt like it was an imposition to ask for anything. Guess service has changed or maybe it was just the crew on this flight.
label: positive

text:
softly does it patience and brilliant smiles make this long flight a welcome experience
an atmosphere of warmth and care,
good selection of snacks for anyone who gets hungry (or bored :-))
great airline to fly with
label: positive

text:
Great service, but...... Flew round trip on their nonstop flight from LAX to Singapore in Business Class.
Wonderful service, really good food, but the lie flat seats were not acceptable for an 18 hour flight. We were on their new  Airbus A350-900ULR. I’m over 6 feet tall and there was very little room for my feet. One has to put them in a small cubby hole like opening on the right hand side of the seat in the lay flat position. Much more uncomfortable than traditional Business class seats on other trans Pacific flights.
I would think twice before using that equipment again but on such a long flight.
label: positive

text:
Good but still economy squeeze Melbourne to Singapore - 777 refitted plane. I last flew two years ago and was so impressed by the space of the seat and leg room I was happy to be going with them again, even if they were the more expensive choice. What a shock. They have reduced the seat and pitch size. 
We did depart on time and in row order. The teenager in front of me reclined as soon as we were airborne for the whole 7.1/2 hour daytime flight and my entertainment screen was a hands-length away from my face!  Ran out of everything but beef by the time they got to us (seat 47).  We arrived safe and sound however, but the whole experience was disappointing. 
Returning on A380 was better. We were on the upper deck economy which was roomier than the 777 plus has the added storage next to the window, plus there was just 2 not 3 in the row by the window (YAY).  The food was dire though and almost inedible but at least we had the bread rolls and cheese/crackers were okay. 
So ultimately it is okay BUT it is still economy and you will have the squeezed in experience with no real bells and whistles. Is it worth paying hundreds more than other carriers?  I won't go out of my way to book with them again unless it really suits or they have a deal going.
label: positive

text:
Premium Travel at Reasonable price A very comfy travel in Premium Economy at a vert reasonable price (compared to Local International Carriers). Service was excellent and food of good quality.
Have traveled Business Class before but value for money it is worth the change to Premium Economy. 
Will definitely fly this class again.
label: positive

text:
Flight on SQ 712 The flight was pleasant and the meal was tasty. The crew was friendly. This was only a short flight.

Luckily a wheelchair was available on arrival in Bangkok and a long walk was made easy for my wife. The wheelchair attendant even took her out to the taxi, great service.
label: positive

text: Great airline with excellent staff! From check-in to disembarking Singapore Airlines were wonderful. The check-in agent at ORT airport was so friendly. With my Dad making use of a wheelchair the cabin crew were great. On board service was efficient and seamless. Nothing was to much for them. We experienced the same outstanding service at Changi airport all the way back home to Johannesburg.
label: positive

text: Baggage claim I’m very disappointed about my flight last night SQ 968 SIN-CGK 06 october 2019, because my baggage still at SG. After i’m arrived at CGK arround 11 PM and still process my complaint to Jakarta Airport Service. Can you imagine how tired i am... FYI all SQ ground staff is already go home.. big applause for your service.. is this your services to passengers who choosing SQ  as full services airlines?? Definitely i’m not choosing your airlines for my next holiday... big surprise for me with your service but still have been rewarded by skytrax. Please improved this service if you want to be best airlines in world..
label: negative

text: Good airline Great service, free food and drinks. Average legroom. Plane was a bit older and there were a few issues with the seatback entertainment system, plug for earphones did not work well. Overall would recommend this airline.
label: positive

text:
Shocking, Nightmare & Worst service I've experience, worse than budget airlines Nightmare transfer followed by god damn aweful customer service on the flight. 

Experience began from leaving the aircraft. Despite the flight being later arriving and knowing I had a tight connection, I say this to everyone now. There is no assistance for business class customers transferring. 

You'd think the airline's operations team would pick up business class customers coming in late and on tight transfer windows. Nope nothing at the gate. 

I got a bus to terminal 2, then got lost nearly went through immigration. Asked for help and directions and got to the gate as the flight was boarding. 

On board, well again, the food was average and service was shocking. Having run to catch this connection, when dinner was being served, asked for a beer and wine to go with my dinner. The beer to quench the thirst and wine because I love my vino. Was told will bring to you shortly sir. Nothing. Asked again. Nothing. Asked again nothing. 

3 times and 20mins later. All too late. 

Sat there thinking should I travel Singapore airlines as this is some of the worst service I've had, similar to one of the budget airlines. but not they are actually better. 

Singapore Airlines will fail as a business if this is the level of service offered to premium customers.
label: negative

text: Very nice flight Its a very nice flight... we had to transit at Singapore... the staff is friendly... the flight meal is good.. the seat is spacious.. the entertaiment flight is up to date.. overall a very good flight..
label: positive

text: Great flights Exceptional service, great comfortable seating with lots of space. Good food. Very happy with everything
label: positive

text:
First impressions, pretty good First impressions of Singapore Airlines, pretty good. Decent food on board the flight and the flight attendants where really nice. Seats where a little uncomfortable but that what you get when travelling economy.
I think a bit of room for improvement when it comes to cleanliness of the plane. I know I was travelling in economy but some of the seats looks a little bit worse for wear. I'm sure they'll get upgraded soon enough
label: positive

text:
SQ38 Great Experience SQ 38 on 9th July 2019

Great long haul flight. The crew were fantastic. So welcoming and professional. They are always ready to serve and constantly looking out for our needs. Indeed best airline. The flight was smooth despite some bumpy times but the seats were so comfortable that you can just sleep over the turbulence. Put down the back rest and sleep with the bed. The biz class is so spacious. 

Well done Singapore Airlines.. and thank you.

Looking forward to our return flight.
label: positive

text: Awesome Service and Hospitality I was very happy traveling via SIA with kids especially. Their service level is first class and for those who are flying with kids in a long flight... don’t worry, they give priorities to kids. They are very fast and efficient. Great crews. Basically, it was an extremely pleasant flight.
label: positive

text:
Excellent !!! Last 28.04.2019  & 30.05.2019 we had a round trip to Dhaka-Narita-Dhaka. First time in Singapore Airlines. Beyond our imagination they provide extremely luxury service . Staffs were very cordial & helpful. All time they were friendly and smiling .
I am unable to  express all our gratitude and satisfaction to the crews. Always we will be with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Mixed Services The flight from Christchurch to Singapore was a bit disappointing as old technolgy in house entertainment, and the plane. Plane from Singapore to Barcelona much newer with touch control on the entertainment and seemed more movies etc. Long flight and was starving by the time they served breakfast about 1.5 hours from landing Barcelona. Flew over in August and came back in September and no updates on the movies so entertaiment was limited as had watched all the best movies on way over. London to Singapore modern plane, then back to old technology and poor service Singapore to Christchurch.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines..the best!! As usual difficult to beat the class, the care and sheer pleasure of unhindered, comfortable travel.
label: positive

text:
My preferred Airline As a seasoned traveler, I've flown with a few airlines, and have found all the airline staff great, however, in saying that I found that Singapore Air just provide that little more to make your travel a bit more remember able.
Nobody's the same and have their own preferences when traveling.
label: positive

text: Nice singapore airlines SQ8122 We was on board singapore airlines flight SQ8122 from Sydney to Singapore on 12th June 2019. Flight departed smoothly on time with nice take off and landing with good and nice service on board.  Very good cabin services staff providing frequent flow of drink and rendered service request promptly with a smile. We enjoyed the flight, thank you and regards.
label: positive

text: Long haul flight, Istanbul to Brisbane and return Have used Singapore Airlines on a number of occasions to fly to Australia, good service all round from check in to arrival. On board service excellent, cabin layout much better than similar airlines. Food and drinks service and selection well above average. Singapore Airlines also offer stopover breaks of varying lengths in Singapore which are excellent value for money, had a six night break on last trip, absolutely first class experience.
label: positive

text: First time and was very impressed  Flew from Phuket to Japan transiting Singapore. This was my first time flying SQ and I was impressed. The inflight entertainment, the Cain crew, the food. I will definitely rate them a top airline and perhaps even my newest favourite airline! Changi is a great airport
label: positive

text:
Very good - only too little legroom We are flying since many years with SQ. There are some changes which must be attributed to austerity measures - but it is still a great service. The only disadvantage is the small legroom - it is barely possible to leave the seat without bending the whole body and making artistic exercises to get out from the window or middle seat. 
Moreover, it is very unpleasant that there is now an additional fee for the seat of my choice - even if it is a very normal one (not, e.g., a seat with only two on the row or in front of the service room wall)..
label: positive

text:
Pleasant flight - Comfortable We were boarded efficiently onto the Airbus. However, the seats that we paid extra for, were not as we saw in the original seat map. The flight was not full. We brought the seat issue to a member of the cabin crew. She took our boarding cards and then a male cabin crew approached us. He offered us seats at the very back of the plane. Totally unsuitable and worse than our current seats. However, another female member smartly diffused the situation with a move to bulkhead seats. I think her name was Audrey (I think). She was professional and efficient. No don't get me wrong. We were not being awkward. We had ten flights to take over a three weeks with a four year old child and our seats were chosen with that in mind.

Anyway, the plane got away five minutes early and arrived 11 minutes early in Shanghai. The flight was comfortable. The cabin crew were courteous and the food was good.
label: positive

text: Confort The seat is not comfortable. You have to stand up to lay down your seat. When you are in the bed position you have to be in diagonal with your legs. The service is very good , people are very kind. But even in the 380 airbus the seats are in the same way...
label: negative

text:
Consistently good It has been a number of years since I last flew Singapore and the standard is still there. On a A380 so it was quiet as you would expect. The key elements of the flights were:
1. Staff were friendly and helpful
2. Seats were comfortable and a good size - slightly larger with more leg space. 
3. Food was enjoyable and catered for both Asians and western. 
4. Beverage - the wine list left a bit to be desired, they could improve here. Others such as Bloody Mary's etc were good.
5. Movies - there was an extensive list to chose from, however I felt they could have been better with a few more up to-date one. Also the TV shows were limited.
6. Comfort and safety - cabin was good temperature and the flight was good plus on time.

Overall I was happy with the service of Singapore and will fly again with them.
label: positive

text: Most comfortable flight ever. This was the most comfortable flight I have taken, and I am a frequent flyer. The seats were comfortable, the entertainment good, the cabin crew could not have been more polite and helpful. A great airline.
label: positive

text: Makes you feel welcome From check in to departure was hassle free. Friendly air crew & ground staff. Great choice of in flight entertainment.
label: positive

text:
Disgraceful service I paid an overinflated £1299 for an economy return to Singapore. Singapore Airlines is currently monopolising the market and overcharging customers brutally. 

Services were abysmal from stepping into the plane. Had to ask for BLANKETS  and PILLOWS for a long haul flight. Commencing the 12.5 hours journey, we were offered 1 meal within the first hour after take off then absolutely nothing, not even a beverage for the next 9 hours. Despite being a day flight, they switched off the cabin lights 3 hours after departure trying to get everyone to sleep so they don't have to work. I went to the galley to ask for food and was only offered a fun pack size chips and a glass of coke with ice, not the 330ml can. Never felt so dehydrated boarding a flight. We were then served a small breakfast meal just before landing. Only positive is the inflight entertainment with a wide selection of Western movies.

This is the worse Singapore Airlines flight I have been on with all the cost cutting measures yet overinflated flights. They do not deserve the 5 star skytrax rating. It feels more like a budget low cost airline. Absolute shambles.
label: negative

text:
Service Good But Baggage Damage I recently use Singapore Airline instead of Budget Airline, because I believe that they would take care of my baggage/asset more than budget airline or low cost airline. 
Eventually they treat me like I fly Low cost airline. Is this The Best Airline in the World? I just found out that my parts of my luggage are damage. I believe that it because of your baggage handler throw my bag. 
First I didn’t find out because every time I fly I will put my Luggage cover on so, I didn’t find out until I ‘m going to fly another flight. 
Let me tell you why I didn’t raise up this issue sooner it because when I unpack my back I didn’t see it. (It’s also my false that I didn’t check the whole bag. I just check front, back and handle). If there are just scratches to my baggage cover, it’s fine. I can accept that.
So, I just want to know how Singapore airline handle with baggage handling system for their customer.
label: neutral

text:
All good but not great After several years avoiding SQ (old worn interiors, poor service) I decided to give it another try. It was the best route on offer (MEL-BKK-SIN-PEN-SIN-MEL) for this trip.

Overall, the flight between MEL-BKK-MEL (via Singapore) was fine. The A380 and Boeing 777 interiors were vastly improved but the air was unbearably dry and uncomfortable compared to Dreamliners. Seats were tight and snug.
The food was over salted (yes I know they do that to make the food palatable) to the point it’s inedible.
Service crew were more friendly and pleasant than several previous trips. 
Terrible in flight entertainment.
I was offered the opportunity to bid for PE but I declined as there is no seat guarantee. I had already seat select during ticket purchase and wasn’t going to risk a middle seat at extra cost!
label: neutral

text:
Singapore Airlines What a great airline to travel with.
Very professional cabin crew and really clean planes with plenty of in flight entertainment.
Pre-booking meals is also a great feature through their website.
label: positive

text: What a difference! Having been disappointed with our Airbus flight SQ224 to Singapore it was a pleasure returning on Flight SQ215 Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner. Comfortable seat, good aircraft food, easy entertainment screen and friendly courteous staff. Enjoyed the flight.
label: positive

text:
Business Class Singapore to Perth Booked a J Class flight back from Singapore to Perth using United Airlines MileagePlus points.  Didn't need to check in as had done it at  Penang.  Spent a few hours at The Jewel after especially coming back through Immigration.  Went through to the BC Lounge and had a snack.  Lounge was quite comfortable although somewhat crowded.  
As the flight was to Australia, final security was at the Departure Gate which gave me a bit of a scare as the Duty Free Lady was late (probably because the gate was changed). She arrived just as final boarding calls were being made.
Flight to Perth was uneventful and reasonably enjoyable.  
Unfortunately the A330 had one of the old seating arrangements and was not a true lie flat but angled so that you continually feel as if you are sliding down to your feet.  At times I found I got better comfort by propping my feet up against the back of the shell of the seat in front (being a shell it is independent of the seat so you don't annoy the passenger in front).  About time that SQ finished their upgrade of the seats or retired the aircraft.  It certainly isn't up to scratch and detracts from the reputation of the airline for quality.
label: positive

text:
Awesome airline! We have always been happy with Singapore airlines, can’t fault anything! 
Only give it 4/5 for leg room because I’m 175cm tall, so most economy flights are a bit spaceless, glad 8m not 6ft +!
label: positive

text:
One of the best It is my first time to travel with singapore airline. I love how the staffs handled their customers. They are very generous and smiling. The check in counter has been very accommodating as well. The plane is huge and comfortable. The food is fine. 
I would love to fly again with singapore airline.
label: positive

text: SQ22 Service was very limited despite being 18 hours long. They rushed through the first service since the flight left at 11:30 pm. Then there was no service for another 11 hours. I know they brought around snacks and were happy to help me when needed but honestly wished we would've been pampered more. Food was average at best.
label: neutral

text: Wonderful experience The stewards were friendly and responsive, the food was exceptional and the extra space wonderful. Well worth the extra I paid. All together one of the best flights I have had.
label: positive

text: Amazing experience, definitely lived up to its reputation I really enjoyed the service provided on this airline. I never had such a comfortable flight - as compared to other airlines on the same route.
label: positive

text: Lost Luggage We flew to Singapore then a connecting flight to Cebu. On arrival at Cebu we found that our 2 suitcases were not placed on the connecting flight and were still in Singapore. The staff were very apologetic and said the luggage would be on the next flight the following day and it was delivered 25 hours later.No compensation for the inconvenience was offered.We had to buy cosmetics, underwear etc. After lodging a complaint online we were offered Aus $55 each as once and only final offer. we accepted of course just to end the matter but felt the offer was miniscule for the stress, inconvenience, lost time having to shop plus my Prescription only Gout Medicine was in the lost luggage and i had a gout attack. We had a friends on the flight to Singapore and they also did not place their luggage on the connecting flight to Thailand. Travelled the same route many times before and never had any luggage problems then.
label: positive

text: Deservedly top of the List We selected Singapore Airlines because of the good reviews they receive and they are justified. The flights (changing at Singapore) were really comfortable and all the facilities excellent. The service by the staff was absolutely spot on. Prompt, courteous and empathetic. When we are travelling to the far east and Australasia again we will be booking Singapore Airlines again
label: positive

text: Deteriorating airline Singapore Airlines used to rightfully be a favourite when it came to travel. However in recent years it's economy cabin is no competition to other incredible airlines such as Emirates and Qatar. It is easily the most expensive airline in the world while it has been evident through the years that their service and aircraft designs are strongly lacking. Although we flew on a newer aircraft this time, leg room was extremely tight - I couldn't put my chair back in fear that the parent and child in the seat behind would not be able to move or even eat. I just feel their services continue to downgrade, for example, the change of ear pieces for entertainment. SEVERAL years ago they used to offer a decent headset for in-flight entertainment, however now all that you are provided with is cheap earphones that do not even stay in the ear cavity due to poor design. A few years ago we changed our go-to airline to Emirates and within the first flight itself, you will be able to notice immediate upgrades in terms of comfort and overall services.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable flights with excellent in flight service. Another first rate travel experience providing delicious vegan meals and genuinely friendly, courteous and eminently professional in flight service. Always a pleasure to fly with this airline. One leg of the trip we enjoyed extra leg room seated in an escape row greatly enhancing overall comfort.
label: positive

text: Great Airline There isnt anything bad i have to say about this airline. The crew, the facilities, the food all extremely good. I will definitely be flying with them in the future!!
label: positive

text: Brilliant crew and great service. The business class seating is superb.  Everything you could wish for on a long flight or in our case 2 flights Melb to Singapore and then Singapore to Copenhagen.  We were in good shape when we arrived.  The crew were so obliging and the meals superb.  Entertainment was plentiful on the screen, but you could read if you wanted to or sleep. Recommend highly.
label: positive
