“Horror service in Istanbul and Singapore from sg 
Manila, Philippines
To make it short, had a flight with them going from istanbul to manila. On the way back i was denied to enter turkey due to corona virus( foreign passport holder restriction).
I went to the singapore airlines customer service, i was told that I either fly with them back to singapore or get my own ticket departing istanbul. I choosed the option to fly to singapore, booked therefore a connecting flight going to bali.
Short before departure I was handed out my boarding pass, showing that my final destination is manila, not singapore. 
Following this I had an argument with the staff, I was treated very arrogant, felt like I did a violation.
I was told then by another ground staff that she will email her collegues in Singapore so that I possibly can entry. 
Once arrived in Singapore I asked the the sg staff if they received and email or call- none.
The person in charge was even more arrogant denied any effort to help me or at least refund my travel ticket from sg to bali.
Following this I was forwarded to a deportation room, felt like a prisoner there. Was allowed to use my cellphone only for a limited time in a demarqued area. Wasnt allowed to sit during talking even I was deadly tired. 
The story went on until I reached Manila.
In short terms- desastrous communication, arrogant behaviour, chaotic
terrible airline& service, never again!
label: negative

text:
CTN VIA JHB TO CHANGI INT Airport, SINGAPORE The flight was on time, and all expectations were met. From inflight entertainment to inflight service. Food choices was okay. Friendly staff. Bathrooms/Toilets are okay, not the greatest.
Definitely will fly with Singapore Airlines in future.
label: positive

text:
NOT NO 1 People rave about this airline.
The only times I and my family have used it, we have had terrible service, both on the ground and in the air.
To the point we would not recommend it and go out of our way to use another carrier.
Very disapointed customer.
label: negative

text: Schedule is bruttal Oh! Never again to take this route. 5.20AM take off means you have to be at the airport at 4AM.  So tired... one stop in Singapore, another one in Sydney (apparently its not a direct one as SQ advertise!) spending 15 hrs door to door.... 😫 avoid. Get other alternative airlines/different route.
label: neutral

text: Disappointing Service I travelled on SIA flight to Santiago via Sydney on my birthday  and apparently my husband called the SIA office before our flight to ask if he can arrange for the crew to present me a cake as a surprise. He was told it can be done. However, the event did not materialise. Instead, when we had our connecting flight on Latam where he did not inform them of my birthday, the crew surprised her by wishing her happy birthday. I am really disappointed as if it cannot be done, the office should not have promised my husband.
label: negative

text:
Fantastic flights - great service Had a great overnight flight from Sydney to New Delhi with a 2 hour stopover in Singapore (2am their time)  Great flight, good food and service and fantastic selection of movies.
Singapore Airlines has always been a great airlines, but it is even better today.
The flight back was equally as good and I didn't sleep at all.  Too many new movie releases to see.
label: positive

text: The worst first class experience We flew Singapore to London in first class on 24 March We fully appreciate the cv9 impact however the cabin crew were great and did their best. It was however a very disappointing experience in comparison to other major airlines. Given their reputation we were expecting a fantastic flight and some real pampering. The cutbacks in terms of the extras that make the high cost of first class worth while was very evident. No pre take off drinks, food choice was limited and tasted abysmal, no pyjamas or amenity kit etc. This was put down to Cv9 however the cabin crew when pressed as I could not get the reasoning for this did say that it was now the company standard.  As a side note our outbound flight with Singapore airlines was ok however don’t expect champagne or any alcohol as a pre take off drink the crew told us that because of the tax at Heathrow they were no longer offering this....... Our advice don't waste your money choose another airline they cost less and offer a lot more.
label: negative

text:
First time with Singapore will not be the last Flew direct to Auckland via Singapore and decided to up to Premium - great decision.
All staff were so attentive and could not be faulted - regularly offered drinks of all types.
Returned from Christchurch with an overnight stop in Singapore and again an enjoyable experience.
In-house entertainment a great help for someone like myself who does not sleep on flights.
label: positive

text: Good Airline. Enjoyed flight with Singapore Airlines, they service on the plane was good and the food was excellent.
label: positive

text: First time with this airline  Travelled to Singapore on our way to Vietnam then returned to Singapore from Cambodia for return. Travelled premium economy very satisfied with food which was very good . Brilliant service and happy staff. Would not hesitate to travel with them again. Plenty of leg room and comfortable seats.
label: positive

text:
Excellent Airline ! Excellent Service ! Excellent Food on the Flight ! Excellent Airline ! Excellent Service ! Excellent Food on the Flight !

We flew LAX-NRT ( Tokyo Narita ), NRT-SIN & SIN-HYD, w/ a Break of Journey of 5 days at Tokyo, for a Vacation.

The Air Hostesses worked VERY HARD & Tirelessly to keep everyone Satisfied ! Even after working 3-4 hrs on their Shift, they Looked Fresh still !
Couldn't be Happier about everything :-) :-)

MINUS : As we did NOT want Paid Seats, we were Forced to Book our Seat Numbers 48 hrs BEFORE Each Flight. That was DIFFICULT in Tokyo, as we stayed there 5 Days.

MINUS : On the Return, The HYD-SIN Flight was 2.5 Hrs LATE, & would miss the Onward Connection from SIN-LAX. So, they Re-booked Us onto Cathay Pacific at HYD itself. LOTS of DELAY getting that done, at HYD Airport.
label: positive

text: Faster flight better services  I took singapore airlines for my business trip in business class it was my first time but not the last one I order on advanced a special menu (lobster) was amazing good. All the cabine crew are fabulous. Really enjoyed this flight.
label: positive

text: Attentive and friendly Staff was very friendly and alert. Food was not up to the expectation. Not tasety at all. Choices offered are not matching with the similar class of other famous airlines.
label: neutral

text: Good journey back to home Very relaxed journey back to home. Everything was good enough from check in to baggage handling. Good inflight entertainment.
label: positive

text: Excellent service onboard I flew Singapore Airlines yesterday and had a great flight. Cabin crew were lovely. Food good, and plentiful. Only negative was the air conditioning on Singapore to Amsterdam flight was too hot and extremely drying.   Otherwise a good flight.
label: positive

text: Great Flight We traveled from Mumbai to Hong Kong via Singapore and back. The flights were on time, the service was really good right from checking in to the in flight service, no room to complain. The food served was good too, being vegetarian causes problems on some flights but not with Singapore Airlines.The seats were comfortable and the in flight entertainment was decent. Will definitely recommend travelling by Singapore Airlines. Additionally, they had an offer running and we received 20 SGD vouchers to shop at Changi Airport, it was a cherry on the cake.
label: positive

text:
Lack of customer support and organisation. Originally booked a flight through Singapore airlines for my mother in law to fly from Melbourne to Frankfurt, several hours before her departure the Singapore to Frankfurt flight got cancelled. I spent a couple of hours on the phone talking to both Lufthansa and Singapore airlines to organise the re-booking of her flight, i was bounced back and forth between the two trying to organise it before she had to check in from Melbourne.

The calls took so long i made it to Melbourne airport and instead talked to the service desk and asked about the cancellation and they said it will sorted by the time she arrived in Singapore. Her direct flight got switched out for a Singapore -> Delhi -> Amsterdam -> Frankfurt.

After receiving the email of the change only half an hour before her landing at Singapore i tried to talk to Singapore airlines to her a replacement direct flight as due to medical and language barriers she would not be able to navigate the multiple stopovers.

Two hours on the phone got me nowhere and apparently every flight was booked for the destinations from Singapore to either Munich, Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Brussels, London or even back to Melbourne at which point a family member would be able to her get to her original destination without the insane amount of stopovers.

The staff just kept insisting there is no available flights even for the day after her arrival in Singapore.
label: negative

text: Singapore Premium Economy Our first flight in Premium Economy. It was an excellent experience. The seats were comfortable and commodious and the service was excellent. Highly recommend the experience.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing quality of aeroplane We flew back from Singapore on a night flight. We were in premium economy and were expecting a good quality plane, however the plane was horrible. The aisles were very narrow, which made it very difficult to move around to the toilet. The seats did not recline at all (3 of our 4 seats didn't recline). When we pointed this out to the air stewardess she tried to push it back by putting all her body weight on it and the person behind pulled it and it moved about 1 inch, and then she gave up and said it's quite tricky. The handset for the TV was broken and my son's laptray was broken. It made us wonder what else on the plane was broken.  There were only 4 toilets for everyone in economy and premium economy to use. At one point we had to wait 20 minutes to use a toilet, which for someone with medical issues is unacceptable. (& Made me very distressed)
Some of the flight staff were very polite, however others seemed brusque and irritable. We were looking forward to the flight as the plane on the way to Singapore felt luxurious, but this plane was awful and should only be used if people are told it's an old plane and the seats are much cheaper. We were very disappointed. I would not fly with Singapore airlines again if they continue to use broken and old planes.
The only reason I gave 3 stars and not just one is because the flight to Singapore was on a bigger newer plane and so was much better.
label: neutral

text:
High service Very high service on Singapore airline. We had pre-order vegan food and it was very good and we allways got our dinners before anyone else😊
Can highly recommed Singapore airlines
label: positive

text:
The bucket list way to travel As an expat living in Australia for this last 30 years, my wife and I have travelled this route a number of times (as well as many other destinations on business and pleasure). However, we treated ourselves to business class this time, and must say that we were made to feel like royalty.

Aside from all the usual trimmings of business class flights (lounge access, express security and boarding), the check-in staff and airline crew were absolutely marvellous and constantly looked after us. Our comfort and wellbeing was clearly their priority. The preselected three-course meals were on par with a first-rate restaurant, and they had a great choice of top shelf spirits and cocktails (which needless to say we sampled a great many).

Furthermore, I left my iPad on the final return leg (I blame the 16yo single malt scotch 😊) and was contacted by their cleaning contractor (dnata) on the day of my return to say it was found. Excellent service all round. The only major drawback, is that it is now going to be very difficult to ever do that trip again on economy (as we usually do), now that we’ve tasted this 😁

Highly recommended!
label: positive

text:
Tiring trip to Tokyo I have mostly had good experiences with Singapore Airlines. 
But recently I had to make a trip from Singapore to Tokyo
on Singapore Airlines, which was really bad.
The flight left Singapore Changi airport at midnight. 
Normally they serve one round of beverages, followed by a meal,
followed by another round of beverages.
This time, they served around half an ounce of Ginger Ale in a glass, which was around all that they served during the entire flight! 
(I looked around me and found that other passengers were being served
similar minuscule quantities too.) Maybe the cabin crew were in a bad mood that day...
I don't know....
Instead of "Dinner" they had a "Refreshment" which was a freezing cold
Kati Roll type thing which was around the size of a Mars Bar!
(I was being Polite by writing  "Mars Bar"  since it would be rude to write
what it Actually resembled, in a public forum like this.) 
Most of us would have preferred to have just gone to sleep, with the lights off,
rather than be kept awake for around two hours, just to eat this unpalatable dish.
The flight lasted seven hours and they started to serve breakfast, which wasn't
great either, when turbulence started and they didn't serve coffee or tea at all.
I had heard of some flight where the passengers seated  in economy and the ones 
in business class get the Same meal....but the difference would be, that the people in economy would have to eat whenever the cabin crew served the food, while those in business class could choose when to have their meal!  During this flight, I really wondered what would be the fare served in business class.
On another note, the facilities at Singapore's Changi airport are Fantastic!
When we scan our passport, the machine prints out our boarding pass, after which we just drop our suitcase on a conveyor belt at the check in counter and the suitcase is just whisked away!
The food options at Changi are really nice too.
My experience with The Coffee Bean And Tea Leaf in India has been mostly not all that great. But All their outlets that I have been to in Singapore have been Fantastic, including the one at Changi aiport. Be it their pizza, hot chocolate or cheesecake, the standards maintained are uniformly high.
Thanks to this joint and a really nice Sushi place at Changi, my Singapore/Tokyo flight became significantly less unpleasant. Thank you, Changi.
label: neutral

text:
Great service and comfortable flight We flew out of Brisbane on the 11.50pm flight landing in Singapore in the early hours of the morning with a 5 hour layover before our connecting Scoot flight to krabi. 
The flight was full but fairly comfortable although there isn’t a lot of legroom! We had an aisle and middle seat in the middle row which works for me as I like to get up and move around without disturbing or having to climb over people. The seats did have foot rests which was a bonus. The food was ok but not memorable. The flight attendants were polite and efficient and the entertainment selection was ok but I do prefer Emirates/Qantas inflight entertainment. The short connecting flight to Krabi was pretty good considering...the meal provided was very very average and in my case inedible although we did enjoy the Cornflake chocolate!
label: positive

text: Polite crews! PAL was delayed and we were offered a seat in Singapore airline. The crew were very polite and helpful. Superb customer service!
label: positive

text: flights from Wellington to Perth We flew to Perth stopping over at Melbourne, both flights were great, meals lovely and staff were good.  The seats were comfortable and the in house service was fine, no complaints at all.  We booked on Webjet early in the year and got a fantastic fare to Perth  from Wellington, NZ, $186 per person one way!!!!
label: positive

text: Good flight A380 to Singapore from London, good flight economy seats better than average, service excellent, food good for airline food, plane was really cold though
label: positive

text:
Last flight home of the holidays. Excellent service. This was our last leg of our flights home to Brisbane. 
We had a 12hr layover in Singapore Changai due to the connecting flight out JFK NY being 3hrs late and Singapore airlines rebooking us due to this. 
They emailed us the morning before the flight to let us know. Noy good having a 12hr layover but they did there best to get us a connecting flight which is good.
The flight left a few minutes late as they didn't open the lounge / gate until 40mins before the flight and everyone had to be screened to get through to the gate. We got off about ten minutes late but this was made up in the flight so we landed on time.
We were allocated seats 58A&B and were one of the last groups to board. It was a full flight but we still had some space for our bags above us in the overhead luggage bins. We had someone next to us so we couldn't spread out.
The crew were excellent and served the meal after taking off. After the meal, the lights were dimmed and I then accessed the excellent inflight entertainment system and watched some movies on it.
The staff were on the ball and were constantly bring water and juice around for the whole flight.
The only downside to the flight were some inconsiderate people sitting in front of us and putting seats back when you were trying to eat. The crew were excellent and pulled them up on this. Some people just need to be more aware of what they are doing and respect other passengers. 
Overall, the flight was good with little turbulence only.
I love flying Singapore airlines as the planes are clean and well serviced, the crew is fantastic, always polite and courteous and ensure the comfort of there guests.
this was highlighted by the flight stewardesses cuddling a baby when the mum was trying to get ready to get off the plane. The genuine care you could see from the staff was excellent. I cant recommend Singapore Airlines enough.
label: positive

text: Great Airline Great service in business class.  Excellent food and wine list with all the trappings you expect. It's hard to complain when seated in business class, however the small foot well is awkward when trying to sleep.  I also found the tray table was triggered by my resting arm quite often and when it's out it is on an angle.  Bit weird but this was on the 777 whereas the A380 was great.
label: positive

text:
Excellent, Except for the Scoot Leg of the Trip Imagine paying for a fine meal at a 5-star restaurant: A perfectly cooked Rib-eye steak and fine wine as a 5-piece string band quietly plays classical music.  Then, for dessert, pastry from a vending machine.  That's how we felt.

Six of the seven legs of our round-trip to Philippines were on SIA aircraft.  Nice meals/snacks/beverages, in-seat entertainment--even on their smaller planes. One leg was on their low-cost partner, Scoot (the Spirit Airlines of Asia).  It's OK for what it is--The staff was extremely friendly, and we felt safe on their aircraft.,, But we paid for SAI.

The Scoot leg aside, we had a wonderful experience. The meals, even in Economy, are top-notch. The seats were comfortable, in-flight entertainment was excellent and we can't say enough good things about the flight attendants and gate staff.  SIA will be our 1st choice on future trips to Asia, provided there is no Scoot-operated leg.
label: positive

text: Don’t choose extra legroom if you would to stretch out and sleep I was mislead on my choice of seat in economy using SeatGuru because I chose a seat immediately behind one of the bulkheads in Economy (A41) which was described as a preferential seat because of the extra legroom. However this was not the most comfortable row in which to travel. On the 13-hour Singapore airlines flight I was on in August 2021 there were only about 16 travellers in economy so every traveller had three seats. This meant that all the other travellers could lift up the movable armrests and stretch out and sleep on three seats; however I could not do that because the armrests on the seats immediately behind the bulkheads are fixed and do not lift up. Those ones with the so-called extra legroom are no longer preferential.
label: positive

text: First class service for economy passengers Disappointing for airline however a half full flight resulted in exceptional service. The cabin crew were amazing considering that they had to wear face masks to protect passengers from [possible infections. Must be very stressful for theme and their families.
label: positive

text: two legs we had two legs of the journey kansai o singapore we were in economy and it was only ok and equal or the same as most economy flights.singapore to manchester we were in premium economy which is much better.i have to say we didnt think it was as good as the same flight two years ago and again we think the competition has caught up which makes them now look ordinary and you can look for other carriers and expect the same.
label: positive

text:
Awsome service My wife and I are simply amazed with the quality of customer service displayed by the airlines.  From the ground crew to the airplane, the service de luxe displayed by the flight attendants, the airline atmosphere inside the plane was simply better than the rest of the airlines I have been flying with.  
I highly recommend frequent travelers to try Singapore Airlines...it’s simply awsome.  I’m scheduling my flight with them in the future!

Nobel2209
label: positive

text:
Bad service staff I have on behalf of my friend to purchase air ticket on 2nd Dec 2020.
Booking refer : 6RINUW

On departure date, my friend when to the counter to get the flight ticket, and counter staff keep on mention my credit card got problem can`t deducted on the Payment.
And asking to re-purchase for the air ticket. 

I did call bank to double check on my credit card, yet bank staff did check for me and say nothing wrong on my credit card and the payment of flight charges of amount have been deducted on my card for the amount of $943.50 ever provide me the refer number X00198, after the call, wanted to show the staff for the transaction number, yet they don't ever want to communicate to me. 

And my friend have re-puchase flight ticket and re-do blood and covid-19 test to get before back to china.

All of this is a extra cost. 

Very disappointed on singapore airline service.

Now asking for refund, it just reply me with check and get back to me, after 2 weeks still no reply yet
label: negative

text:
Great Service but Average Business Class Offering My wife and I travelled to Phuket Thailand via Singapore in November 2019 in business class on Singapore Airlines. The check in process was seamless and our bags were checked all the way to Phuket. Upon check-in we were advised we can use the Singapore Airlines Lounge in Sydney International Airport. The Lounge has is located on the Eastern Part of the Terminal and has a great view of the long runway, the service in the Lounge was good but my wife had to wait at the buffet for staff to replenish the scrambled eggs. The staff were very professional and cleaned the tables frequently.

We travelled on the B777-300 Aircraft and the business class seats are bit tired on this aircraft and also the seat when it is in flat position you have lay on an angle, if you like to watch TV. It did gave me a sore back and I had to get up an go for a walk every hour, which is not a bad thing on a long flight. The crew were very courteous and had attention to details. The service was faultless and the crew met every need in flight. When it came to make the bed, the crew had to help us as this is different to the seats on Qantas or Emirates, where you can make the bed by push of a button, where the Singapore Airline seats is manual click and the back folds into a bed. Which was new to us. 

Once we arrived in Singapore we changed the Terminal and our next flight on Silk Air was also good experience. We used the Lounge in Singapore and it was nice, the food was good and service was good, Lounge was clean and plenty of seating and the atmosphere was really great.  Our flight was at dinner time and I had dinner on Silk Air and their meal service was exceptional. 

On our way back, we travelled on A380 and the seats are newer but it is the same uncomfortable seats when in a bed position, I think Singapore Airlines should really listen to the customers and do something about the seats. As Business class is a major reason why we travelled in Business class, so we can rest and get some sleep on the long flights. I would definitely will travel with Singapore Airlines again but maybe not in Business Class.

Positive: Service, Lounges, Food
Negative: Angle seat when it is in a bed position, uncomfortable
label: positive

text:
My 16 year old son was stranded at LAX I always used to think that Singapore Airlines was a good airline until today. Even after submitting proof that one of their agents clearly stated that they would accept a PCR test 72 hours prior to Mt son's flight time, when my son checked in at LAX, the staff refused to let him board. 

They gave him a map and told him he had to get a new PCR test which meant he had to jump on a shuttle alone and find the testing station. He was charged $199 for a PCR test with a 45 minute guarantee. This is an insane amount of money! 

He then rushed back to LAX only to be told he was too late to catch the flight. They refused to issue him a boarding pass even though there was still 35 minutes to spare and he had no bags to check in. 

They did offer to rebook him on snap alternative flight which meant he would have to spend 14+ hours in the airport. Then he was told that he had to get a guardian to sign a permission form because he was under 18 and traveling alone. 

There was no humanity in the way staff dealt with this situation. Sll they cared about was following insane rules which ultimately made no sense since my son was only going to transit through Singapore en route to Jakarta. 

The fact that he submitted a voice memo of a staff member clearly stating he could definitely transit through Singapore with a PCR test taken 72 hours pretty flight made absolutely no difference to Singapore Airlines' staff. We believed that this woman had told us the truth, but ultimately my son paid the price as did I. The incredible stress and anxiety caused by Singapore Airlines policies and unwillingness to acknowledge this staff's recording as clear proof, has not only cost me financially, but emotionally and mentally. My son had to go through an ordeal which was incredibly stressful and challenging on all levels. 

Afterwards, I contacted Singapore Airlines asking for compensation. Several staff promised to get back to me but they never did. 3 phone calls later, I was told by Lloyd, a supervisor based in the Philippines, that Singapore Airlines would not compensate me. There was no accountability from SIA for their egregious mistake.

It's for these reasons and more, that my family nor I will never fly on Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text:
Stingy Rich Asians-lah We booked award travel tickets using Kris Flyer miles. Afterward we realized there was another flight available for award travel which would be a better fit for our schedule. Within an hour of original booking, we called Singapore Airlines to request that we change the booking to the more convenient flight. Even though only a short time had elapsed, the airline demanded $50 per person change fee. We asked for a supervisor to reconsider, but the supervisor also refused to waive the change fee.
This  airline offers a good in-flight product, on par with regional rivals EVA and Cathay Pacific. However, when it comes t extracting fees from travelers, they are just as smarmy as any other carrier. Be careful here, if you make a mistake you will pay for it. Lah!
label: negative

text: Very cold luxury It takes about 13 hours to fly from Istanbul to Singapore. Almost all services were satifying but the temperature in the plane was extremely cold. A couple of passengers warned the crew about the situation but the temperature has not changed, they only said "it is regulated as necessary". We could not be able to change their opinion despite all the passengers put their coats on and took blankets. Personally I've got cold and flu. This situation was exactly the same on the way back.
label: positive

text:
No improvement Good day,
                    No Improvement.
                   The food was worst than ever.
                   Dosed up on many pain killers, as seats are at a discomfort. My Back has not recovered, never ever again on the worst airline. I have tried emailing but to no avail. They are hiding from criticism. May I suggest fly with their opposition.
                   Norman Russell

text: Long haul flight Long flight, but meals were good, seats were fairly roomy and comfortable. Lots of inflight entertainment and very good cabin crew.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Service First time on Sinapore airlines and was very enjoyable, we will be using them again in March 2019 when we return to phuket
label: positive

text:
They'll get you if they can. I had already booked a seat in cattle class. A situation occurred and I wished to fly business. Well that was easily done but the only problem was that they would charge me for business and not refund any of the money that I had already paid for the cattle class seat. It wasn't like it was a couple of days before the flight but quite some time. The flights were very good and the new aircraft were fantastic. One thing that I did notice on investigation that all the flights were full, meaning that they had been paid for one seat twice. Not a bad scam. 
A couple of weeks before, I had flown business on Philllipine Airlines. The service was just as good and the food was just a bit better. You know that when they bring the food trolley around on Singapore the smell is always the same and turns you off.
I have mostly flown Singapore with family and friends but will look at alternatives in the future.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable flight good service Flight was good arrive ahead of time. Cabin crew staff was helpful with putting hand luggage in the overhead storage.  Had a nice inflight meal.Good selection of movies to pass the time
label: positive

text: Give everybody a chance to perform Pre-booking a child meal does not to ensure you get a good quality kids meal. Disgusting.I have no photos - but I am sure the catering department has and hopefully review what they send out. The same happened on our return trip to Singapore.
label: neutral

text: Back on track For the first time chosen for premium. Good choice, much better then the normal economy. Better selection  of food which can be chosen when you check in. Also a bottle of water is provided. Service was much better then the last couple of years. Husband is diabetic and is on Insuline. Boarding was right on time but once in the plane it took a  very long time before take off, didn’t get food or drinks in te meantime. Thats where it went wrong.  Although we did have a very good lunch my husband got problems with his diabetes. We managed to get some  coca cola to get his sugar level   very quickly right again. During the rest of the  flight they kept asking if he was OK or needed more foor or drinks. After he had the coca cola he was fine again. Although we always carry grape-sugar tablets, coca cola is the fastest thing to give to a diabetic in trouble. Staff was very thoughtfull after that incident.
label: positive

text: Sydney Heathrow Return Our trip to London required a stop in Changi Airport which is a destination in itself. We had three A-300 flights and one 777 they were all good with plenty of staff and options for meals too.
label: positive

text:
Economy bassinets right behind Premium Economy at Singapore Airlines on the A350-900 is divided with only a screen from the first row of Economy bassinets and we were lucky to have 4 creaming babies right behind us. 
This in contrast to Air NZ which has a wide galley between Premium Economy and Economy bassinets. We paid twice the fare and don’t consider it worthwhile. Furthermore the meals were the worst we had on any Premium Economy flight.
Singapore Airlines don’t even consider getting back to you when taking the trouble of writing a review.
label: negative

text: Dreadful customer service. My husband and I were to fly home from Houston on March 24 2020. The flights were ancelled because of Corona virus. We were notified 3 times of replacement flights only to have ach one cancelled literally at the last minute. We appreciate the problems at that time but when we tried to contact the airline we got a standard letter about how busy they were etc and would reply within 3 days. Of four or five emails we sent to them, we still have not had a reply to any one of them. Eventually we booked with American Airlines Houston to Dallas, Dallas to Heathrow, Heathrow to Manchester on May 10. The day before we were to fly the Heathrow to Manchester flight was cancelled so we got a train from Manchester.Trying to get a refund from Singapore Airlines for not using the return half of our tickets has been an example of dreadful customer service. We were obviously naive in thinking we should get half the return fare back each which would have been £240 each. The airline is giving us about half of that each, saying they have charged us for Manchester Airport taxes for landing and leaving and for other "taxes". We did not fly home with Singapore Airlines and we did not fly Heathrow to Manchester as the flight was cancelled. Trying to get an explanation of this has been impossible. We have not yet received any refund. We had also booked and paid for the same return trip to fly in September, these flights have now been cancelled but the promised e-mails to inform us of our options re moving the booking to next year or getting a refund have not yet turned up. Despite a flurry of emails from us to the airline to try and get this resolved we have been unsuccessful and have yet to see any refund. This is very sad as the planes, cabin staff, facilities such as comfort, food and entertainment are excellent and the route is very convenient for the UK to the USA. Just hope nothing goes wrong or you will lose out.
label: negative

text: 17 hrs non stop from Singapore to LA Best premium economy I have experienced.  The configuration of the plane actually separated Premium economy and business class completely from economy.  Separate boarding gates.  The seats were large enough to get comfortable in for the 17 hr flight.  It's clear why Singapore Air is always at the top of the best airline lists.
label: positive

text:
Don’t bother with Premium Economy on Singapore Airlines Paid for a Premium Economy ticket,  an extra $1000 per ticket. Narrow seats only wider armrest. Footrest not supportive and very uncomfortable during trip. 
To top it of they put us in economy from Singapore to Hanoi Vietnam.
No lounge for Premium Economy, only Business class.
Overall would not recommend the extra cost.
label: negative

text: Great airline Even travelling economy the service was first class the cabin crew really look after the passengers.my connection flight from Launceston to Melbourne was also very good this airlines was virgin.
label: positive

text:
Did Not Even Try to Help My Pregnant Wife Took a midnight flight from Singapore to Sydney with my pregnant wife. During the flight, the man in front of us was very aggressive for some reason and kept on reclining his chair and rocking it to annoy my wife who was sitting behind him. As my wife preferred an aisle seat, we asked if they flight attendants could speak to the man or switch my wife's seat with someone. They attendants said that because the man was so aggressive, there was nothing they could do. So I gave my wife the middle seat instead and which made her feel claustrophobic. I asked the attendants again if they could switch her seat but because it was a fully booked flight, there was nothing that they could do. I am quite disappointed with Singapore Air because we had heard such great reviews about their service.

I also contacted Singapore Air directly via phone, email and web form - all of which have been ignored.
label: negative

text: longest night flight ever Never have I been kept in darkness so long. Flight left around 09:00hrs local time and the lights were dimmed shortly after. Lights were raised for the two meals served but again dimmed after the fastest service I'd ever had. Staff were collecting trays within 10 mins of we received them. I accept that UK time was 8 hours behind so we left at equivalent of 02:00hrs but the lights were still dimmed 30 mins before we landed at 15:30hrs. Within an hour of landing it was dark again!  We had over 24 hours without daylight. Surely they should have raised the lights when UK time reached noon. The meals were about the best we've had on a flight and seat pitch and comfort was reasonable for economy.
label: neutral

text: The most convenient way of traveling from the middle of  Britain to NZ The journey is the least stressful way of traveling to South Island as if you chose a flight which doesn’t stop between Manchester and Singapore. It has. additional advantage if you take the 1100 flight from Manchester you arrive at Singapore at bedtime GMT.  Because there is 12 hours between flights you can have a decent sleep in the Transit Hotel in Terminal 3 without leaving the airport. On the return journey it isn’t quite as good as usually there is usually only 7 hours between flights. This is my 19th annual visit to NZ
label: positive

text: Old Faithful Always fly this airline when possible. Onboard food was quite tasty, seats as comfortable as economy seats can be, flight attendants are always polite,friendly and helpful.
label: positive

text:
Quality service Only safety video i have watched properly and understood correctly. the safety guideline video was extremely effective and eye catching. the staff was helpful and friendly. 
but the flight cleanness was bit average had some stain on the pillow but other than that the seats were comfortable and food was good too.
label: positive

text: Business Class ++ Sure, you pay extra, so you expect things to be good. Still, this airline gives more than good. The service is flawless, every customer and every request is treated as important.
label: positive

text: Perfect as always Service was excellent, flight was punctual, seats were spacious and with sufficient in-flight entertainment. overall another excellent flight experience with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: truly one of the best! So the hypes about SQ are real! It is that good! Having been a loyal customer of CX, another great airline in the world, I am hard to be impressed but I was! In this short economy flight, I was provided with a great meal with real cutlery, wonderful IFE system, both smooth and extensive. Cabin Crews were even handing out hot towels for passengers in our class and amenities were well stocked in bathrooms as well. So rare now!

text: Great service -poor  flat- bed We traveled Business Class on Singapore Airlines from Mumbai to Singapore in the new Airbus 380- excellent hospitality! But on the flat bed one has to sleep at an angle!! Not comfortable at all!! They need to figure out a solution!!
label: neutral

text:
The best...as always 14 hours on a plane is not something to look forward to. Though rarely flying that way, Singapore Airlines has always been our only carrier.
From stepping across the threshold into the plane, one is pampered..even in Economy. The attendants are so wonderful, always smiling and glide around like the Ballet Rambert.
The meals were great..mild S Easter Asian food. Drinks are free with meals, and every 20 minutes ir so they came around with water/ orange juice.
The video/ audio system is of a very high quality and 4 films later we were landing in Singapore. The return flight was equally pleasant.
