text: Hoping for change of menu Good service, though a change of menu and a better selection of entertainment would improve the whole Singapore experience. A reliable airline!
label: positive

text:
great service service is good.Good entertainment. My kids like the flight.Food is good.
Excellent cabin crew.Everything perfect.
label: positive

text: Amazing Airlines I tried Singapore Airlines several times and I consider it as a one of the best Airlines that take you to the places you love.
label: positive

text: smooth sailing we travel by Premium Economy mostly with our family, and its the best way, the seats are great, big and  you can sleep and if the person in front has put their seat down to sleeping you can get out quite easy. the service in this section is good as well
label: positive

text: Wouldnt Fly with anyone else The service from the check in to our arrival in London was faultless. The crew made you feel special from the moment you stepped on the Plane. Always someone about to help you at your with your request at any time, bit different to the Airline I flew with last year. Just a footnote I left a pullover at Changi in the Lounge and only discovered the fact when I was boarding the next plane so it was to late to retrieve it.On my arrival in London I reported it to a very helpful man who chased it up for me and the end result it was delivered to me at Changi Airport on my way home,now that is service with a smile.
label: positive

text:
Very disappointing We purchased a Round The World Fare with the Star Alliance. 
I was very disappointed with the seats and the level of service that Singapore Airlines provided. Given that we paid double the Economy fate, what we were supplied with was hardly better than economy.  There was no extra space to make a long trip more comfortable. There were no wee extras like Air NZ provided,  the lounge for Koru Club members was not available as it has a SG code- even though we booked with AirNZ . 
I would never pay extra for Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines again. A waste of good money.
label: negative

text:
New SQ Boeing 787-10 SQ started using their new Boeing 787-10 for one of their flights between Manila and Singapore and I was lucky enough to be on that flight which is the early morning flight to Singapore. I find it great how SQ has boarding sequence, makes boarding the plane less chaotic. On boarding the plane you are greeted nicely by the FA's and shown your seat (if they are not helping another passenger already). Before taking off they provide hot towels, it's a nice touch! 

The plane is new and beautiful outside and inside. I like the electronic window darkening. I'm a tall guy and I find the legroom to be good enough (Economy). The plane has a 3-3-3 configuration, but all the way at the back of the plane at row 74 and 75 there's 2 lovely seats for couples, so no third person in that row. I was not lucky enough to get it for me and my girlfriend (on return to Manila I managed to reserve it). 

This was an early morning flight. I had fish for breakfast and it was good, but I felt like something was missing from the meal, maybe yogurt would have been nice. The IFE is great, the new displays are bigger. I managed to watch a film before the plane landed in Singapore.

It was a short flight, but it made me really want to try their long haul flights in the future. Being one of the best airlines in the world, they surely did not disappoint.
label: positive

text:
Attentive Cabin Crew My wife and I were on our way home from a 6 week cruising vacation to Indonesia and Australia.  We now find that we need to have Mobility Assistance when we travel and we were looked after very well from check in to the lounge.  Whilst the food was not particularly to our liking in the lounge it did not bother us too much.  At an appropriate time we were collected and wheeled to the A380 aircraft departure gate and onto the aircraft; all this went very smoothly and we were welcomed aboard and looked after.
The seat arrangements vary so much on different airlines, especially when the seats are converted to beds and this is where I had a problem.  The 'cubby hole' where my feet would reside when laying down was too small for me so was a little uncomfortable but suited my wife very well.  It is a long flight and food and entertainment was very acceptable, but that is what I have come to expect from this airline.  On arrival at Heathrow, we were dealt with very proficiently by the waiting PRM service and soon gathered our baggage from the carousel.
We have always rated this airline and continue to do so after this flight.
label: positive

text:
Sheer disappointment  We have flown with SingaporeAir many times over the years. They have always been a pleasure to fly with, until now.

Firstly the Changi airport experience is very good. Other airports could learn a lot from them.

Boarding is easy.

My first complaint is that they have removed footrests?? On a long flight they are necessary, and because they were there on last flight I didn’t take my portable one.

This was a full flight in the a380. In March this exact same flight was a pleasure, the reason we paid the SIA, price.
So why the changes? 

Lights out for most of the flight?
Only two meals in 141/2 hours!
Food nigh on inedible.
No pre meal drink.
Crew little in evidence.

Regret to say true “cattle class”.

We had superior service and meals on the Silk Air flight to Phuket, shades of how Singapore Air used to be.

All very disappointing.
label: neutral

text:
Trip to UK Have used Singapore Airlines many times and cannot fault the airline at all.  They are very attenuative and nothing is a problem for the stewards.

The plane is clean and plenty of legroom.  I would strongly recommend using Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: EXCELLENT AIRLINES Singapore Airlines travelled to U S  A and it is very good airlines. Vegetarian Meals served was delicious. Airline crew were very polite and courteous. Flight schedule on time Staff is very helpful. I would recommend this airline for anyone who wants to travel      The fare is reasonable
label: positive

text: Great, fantastic and absolut professional service on board, should be an example for some other airlines. Nothing to citicize, absolut perfect service, very nice and professional staff on board. Always took an eye on me and on my medicine which had to be stored in the fridge of the plane. Very courteous staff on the flight, always very friendly. A good reason to take always a flight with Singapore Airlines whereever you can.
label: positive

text:
Food Had four fligths with Singapore Airlines, 3 times we couldn’t get the food, that was at the menu. Ond time there was not enough breakfast. We couldnt get the hot meal, some off us dont get youghurt, some didnt get bread later they came with food, which was left from other people.
But the staff was amasing.
I
label: neutral

text:
Singapore Airlines-definitely a cut above mediocre flight experience. My son and I flew to Nepal and back with Singapore Airlines. They are definitely set highly apart and a cut above the mediocre flight experiences that are now rife in this industry. I was pleasantly surprised to see that in this day and age there was still an airline carrier that gave so much baggage allowance at no extra cost. I was even more delighted with the efficiency of of their services from checking in -with no need to arrive ridiculously early at the airport, to prompt departures and early arrivals.
In flight we were well fed with plenty of snacks and meals that seemed to keep coming so much so I even opted out from having some and not to mention how generously they attended to with us with refreshments, all for no extra costs!!! This generous free service surely defines the true meaning of hospitality and it took me back to my younger days, to the positive experiences I enjoyed about flying. We also got nicely bagged packs with not just socks but toiletries as well and there was plenty more extra individually packed supplies in their bathrooms. Impressively the cleanliness of their bathrooms was meticulously maintained throughout the entire flight, that was pleasant indeed and made me relax when my son went to the toilet, knowing it was hygenically safe. 
Though I was in economy I seemed to have plenty leg room to relax and had a foot rest to angle myself comfortably. The inflight information and entertainment was vast and I enjoyed so many movies and so did my son. He even had games to play also. 
I would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines  in future and highly recommend them.
label: positive

text: Over booking !!! Pleasant flight.When we were booking our seats.we were told that the double cabins were booked up, We were suprised when we boarded that there were 3 other paxs in the single cabins like us, My wife and I were deprived of a double cabin thanks to overbooking!!! Apparently SIA allows advanced bookings of up to 9 months thus the business travellors book their seats ahead of any intended flights-whether they were flying or not,and the airline allows this till 1 month before the flight.!!!
label: positive

text: Taken ill on flight I had a Urinary Retention problem for the 13 hour flight. the crew were aware of this and moved me to Business Class so that I could lie down to help ease the pressure. They offloaded my wife and I first when arriving at Changi and arranged for me to see a doctor in their Medical Centre. their care and attention was first class.
label: positive

text: Trip to Hongkong Traveled to honkong last summer in a Singapore airlines flight via Singapore. Even though it was a long flight but my family and m were given the best service. We dint realize how the time flew. Kids were given toys to play. if flight services were amazing and i recommend everyone to fly and i too will fly in Singapore airlines in future also.
label: positive

text:
SIA Poor Business Goodwill Three of us arrived Jakarta airport 3 hours before our 6pm flight to Singapore and our flight was not reflected at the flight display departure. We requested the lady counter for an earlier 5pm  flight but was flatly rejected. Then we approached next counter guy and he helped us to check into 5pm flight but then wanted to charge extra fee for the change in flight.

So we decided to keep to our 6pm flight and to our dismay when we wanted to board at 5pm ; our 6pm flight was delayed for one hour.

Our friend who was flying to KL via MAS 6.25pm flight was offered to take 345pm at no extra cost and he has reached home while we are still waiting to board the plane.

SIA being a premier airline could be more gracious like MAS.
label: negative

text: Standards have really fallen The quality of the service has really dropped over the years especially when compared with Qatar and/or Emirates.  Our luggage was booked through from Zadar but Singapore airlines could not locate it when we finally got our boarding passes.  We were told to check before boarding.  Staff still could not locate our luggage and told us to check with ground staff in Singapore.  No toiletry bags were given on the flight and normally this would not be a concern however had we not received our bags some toiletries would have been helpful.  Our bags were located  once we landed.  The food was as bad as you would get in economy.  Had two mouthfuls,  that was enough.  Just slapped on a plate instead of a tray. Pretty poor.
label: neutral

text: Best airlines to travel with kids! The cabin crew were extremely friendly with my infant and preschooler. They made effort to interact with them, with magic show! When my infant was asleep, they kept her post weaning meal aside and serve when she woke up. My preschooler was very happy with all the goodies he received!
label: positive

text: Excellent service, staff , food and entertainment Our family of 4, 2 adults and 2 kids(16 and 12) were traveling from LA to Japan on a holiday in June 2019. Singapore airlines (Business Class) delivered. One of the best group of Staff we have encountered and best service of theirs till date! WE have traveled with SA in the past but this was our first business with them..The food was extra ordinary and so was personalized service..Worthy worthy worthy..will absolute use them again..
label: positive

text:
Airline Not flown with them for 15 years as usually fly Emerites or Qatar .
Singapore planes looked old to others now .
Service good and easy to find way around airport.
label: neutral

text: Wonderful service We flew business class with Singapore Airlines from Melbourne to London return in June/July this year. As we have found is usually the case, the service with this airline was fantastic- the staff are friendly and happy to accomodate any request. The food was also top class. The flights were comfortable, with a good range of movie options. This will always be our airline of choice for long- haul flights.
label: positive

text: Never again I had 2 Business Class flights with Singapore over the past month.  Both were unsatisfactory.  Firstly I could not operate lay flat seats.  I had to get out of the seat, ask the flight attendant to lay the seat flat then get back flat into it.  In order to get legs strait had to lay at an angle of 45 degrees as could not get them under seat in front.  When I wanted to sit up had to again get out of the seat and ask attendant to manage it.  The entertainment system was primitive.  Operated was by a handset attached by a wire.  No touch screen.  Had to ask attendant to operate it.  She said other passengers also had trouble operating it!  No late release movies and very limited and unsatisfactory selection of music. Meals were of a poor standard and badly timed. I was offered either French or Australian white wine without knowing what winery.  The crews were lazy.  I have travelled Business Class on a variety of other airlines in the last few years and this one is easily the worst.
label: negative

text: Always a pleasure to fly with Singapore Airlines! You know what you are getting with Singapore Airlines; good planes, great service on board and on the ground with trust and security for safe flights.  Never been disappointed with them in all my years of flying and always recommend them as a ‘great way to fly’.
label: positive

text:
Still top class This was one of the best airlines.  The space was great and I loved the foot rest for my feet when sitting up as I have short legs!  The service was the best.  The attendants are so genuine and caring.  My partner had so many problems working the systems out and his attendance was so patient!  

the food is as usual delicious and choice of wines and spirits excellent.  I think the video TV and movie selection is the best and also the easiest to use.  Will definitely fly with this airline again.
label: positive

text:
I expected more In general, SQ's service has always been good. Trusted by my family since the 80s. As much as I would like to support local, I would only take SQ if the price is right. There was a deal for this trip to HK that made flying with SQ more desirable than taking budget.

The seats felt awkward for me. I am 1.58m but I felt that that the table was too low for me. 

There was only noodles left by the time the service staff came to me & unfortunately part of the noddles was hard. So I only ate half of it. To my surprise, the coffee cup that came with my tray of food was broken. 

I was still eating the hot dish when the air stewardess was came around with ice cream. So I told her, "Maybe later." Without prompting, she came back after my meal to ask if wanted my ice cream now.

The movie selection was updated & I couldn't resist watching 2 shows on board.
label: positive

text:
She just needs to behave herself “Well, she just needs to behave herself” are words that should never be uttered to a parent concerned with their child’s safety. 

l’m usually very happy with SQ, on particular trip however, I was up to a boiling point. I was traveling with my 2 year old, we’ve had no issues traveling on business class with them in past on this route and are familiar with the type of aircraft they use as well as the type of seats. 

On this flight, they decided to change to an aircraft meant for longer haul (I usually get this aircraft when I fly to Tokyo, for example).This means that we have the cubicle type seats and I would not be able to reach or help my child should the situation arise. Every parent’s nightmare.

On ANA, the cabin crew will usually ask me to keep her on my lap on take off and landing, for safety reasons. What 2 year old can be expected to sit still for that amount of time. So, I thought to ask if I can do the same on SQ and the answer was no. Look, I understand that this is airline safety policy but what the crew said really angered me.
He said, “well, she just has to behave herself”. This just rude and unacceptable hospitality. 

I never write reviews like this, but this event was too upsetting not to share.
label: negative

text:
Excellent service, especially good for the disabled We’d flown to Singapore on Thai Airways, but decided to use Singapore Airline for the return, to avoid a long wait in Bangkok (Thai cancelled a good connecting flight).  We were much happier with the precautions against Covid-19 in Singapore compared to Thailand.
The flight was very comfortable, and we had adequate space in our seats.  There was plenty of TV entertainment, but the earphones were cheap and nasty (not as good as on Thai).  There were adequate toilets, and we didn’t have to queue for more than a minute or two.  I do wish airlines would state the number of passengers per toilet.  I’m disabled and this is very important for me.  When I checked the seating plan, I thought there were inadequate toilets, but there were more toilets than the seating plan showed!
Toilets and the whole plane were very clean throughout the trip.  It was a night flight, and we were offered drinks when we were awake on many occasions.  The food was tasty, with a choice of Western or Eastern meals.  The plane was modern.
After using Thai Airways, I was very impressed with the standard of care I received as a disabled person.  We were greeted when we entered the plane, and escorted to our seats, the stewardess carried our cabin baggage for us, and stowed it in the overhead locker.
Before landing, she came to our seats and explained the procedure (we stay seated until other passengers have left the plane).  She then came when the plane had emptied, collected our baggage and escorted us to the exit.
We’ve flown with Singapore Airlines repeatedly, and once again felt we had an excellent flight.
label: positive

text:
Why SIA is Rated #1 Beginning in 1977, we have traveled extensively with SIA. Our experience is always superb but on this recent flight, we must relay our utmost delight in the services of our cabin crew. While all flights have offered impeccable food and beverage service, this group of attendants were most courteous and friendly. We realize that it is a difficult task to serve many disparate needs over the course of many hours while maintaining a demeanor of grace, elegance and charm along with comfort and understanding. Our cabin crew completely fulfilled this role and deserve, in our opinion, to be individually recognized for their excellent performance.

    IMF Derrick, CSS Cyndi (Tan), LS Joseph, FS Gilbert, FSS Katherine, FSS JJ
label: positive

text:
Flight to Singapore and return by Singapore Airlines. Took Singapore airlines and paid £11 each way for ordinary aile seat. Plane was 777_300.i requested for aile seat. Normally it is free..Dont recommend what i had done.
The flight was very good,food and service is good. Flight very reliable.i recommend taking Airbus 380.
Crew are good, helpful and supportive.
Overall.....good
label: positive

text:
Rip Off Pay 3 times more for Less.
We are in Rome organising to return shortly to Australia. 
We have 2 choices - to spend the remaining 2 of weeks in Rome or go to Germany for 2 weeks.
So I did some research on airfares. 
Checked online with Singapore Airlines:
Rome - Frankfurt - Singapore 945.00 Euro
Frankfurt - Singapore 2700 Euro.
That cannot be right!! 3 times more for less??!! 
The Frankfurt - Singapore was the same flight on the same day in both examples - 26 March flight SQ325, so I rang Singapore Airlines. 
After much discussion with the operator without a suitable explanation, other than "that is what is in the system", I asked to speak to a supervisor as it didn't make sense.
The supervisor said the pricing was correct as they have different pricing schedules for different markets. Italians wont pay as much as the Germans.
I said "Can I buy a Rome - Frankfurt - Singapore ticket and only use the Frankfurt - Singapore leg?"
No! the ticket is void if I don't get on in Rome.
Checked with Lufthansa (Germany's own airline) and the same result. 
Talk about ripping off your customers!!
We have now booked with another carrier as we cannot trust Singapore or Lufthansa - how can we trust the other carrier?? - ignorance is bliss.
label: negative

text:
Disappointed with our Experience We have just returned from our first flights with Singapore. We were very much looking forward to flying with them in view of their recent number 1 rating. However, the service did not meet our expectations. The food was very good, and the cabin crew were really nice, but on both flights we found them to be very disorganised. On our way from UK to Singapore, the first meal came around, and we were asked what we wanted to drink, and both nominated G&T, and the reply was "That will take some time", and she explained they only carried wine with the food and we could have a G&T after all the meals were served. To be fair, we didn't wait long as we were the last to be served. On the way back, the crew were really confused, we had two trolleys serving , and both missed us, they were withdrawing when I pointed out we had no meals. Then they got the drinks wrong, and then the other crew delivered some more, which were different, it was a bit shambolic.
However, that was all a bit of human error, and as I said, they were very nice, but the real issue is the entertainment.  They were THE most rubbish selection of films we have ever experienced. They had what I would describe as two or three quality films, and the rest were awful. When we fly with Virgin, I watch good film after good film, but on this 14 hour flight, I watched one new film, and another B or C list  unknown, and that was it, the rest were unwatchable.
label: neutral

text: dissapointing to say the least flight from Philippines to Singapore to change planes for Australia, Flight was delayed over 3 hours , my connecting flights were disrupted they did make arrangements for other connecting flight to arrive to Mt Isa via Brisbane, however they forget about the loss of wages or income due to their flight delay no compensation forthcoming due to their flight delay, service and meals are among the best even as a gold member of Qantas,Qantas could learn a thing or too as far as customer service  especially in the Meal department
label: positive

text: Over all flying with. Singapore  Airlines is a lot better than other airlines . Few times we used Singapore  Airlines for leisure travel,  few occasions they were late , with the schedule  hours of flight  ,with  food and beverages  no problem  service were always great.
label: neutral

text: OLD FRIEND Revisited Been awhile since we flew SIA and our entire family decided to fly it when we went for our holidays, Everything went well from the time we arrived at the airport counter until we boarded our taxi at Changi. Service was courteous, efficient and seamless that other than our grandson's ears popping upon ascent and descent of the plane, we had another pleasant trip. The only thing we noticed was the quality of the catering has diminished. Thanks to everyone who served us.
label: positive

text:
In flight condition is getting poorer The boarding process is getting unbearable with poor coordination. certain boarding groups are extremely long while some are short. The in flight entertainment is not in good condition with certain movies having flickering screen. This is not happening in this flight but experienced the same in a couple of flights on singapore airlines already.

However the flight is still on time which is very important. There is a need to tidy up on in flight entertainment before losing its reputable status. Other than this everything is good.
label: positive

text: CANBERRA If you love winter, than visit Canberra and do stay at the farm especially at 1175, Towrang Road, Goulburn.  Owner is a wonderful lady.  Furthermore, go to Snowy mountain with kids, they love the snow.
label: positive

text: Best airlines in all terms They are the best when it comes to travelling with a baby or with a pregnant women! They take care of their guest the best. We got priority security check issues by the airlines, so that we could avoid long queues at Seoul.The airline stewards take good care of our toddler all through the long flight by checking if he was comfortable and wanted anything, to which our son took full advantage off.I would continue travelling Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text:
Pleasant flight but not really attentive My wife and I flew from SFO to HKG on Singapore Airlines. The flight leaves at 0100 AM so most people just wanted to board and then go to sleep. In PE you can book the cook option and we were served first about an hour after departure. Problem was, they served the meal but no beverage for another 30 minutes.

Since it was a late flight, the lights went out and we hardly saw a crew member for another 10 hours. They set up a snack area in the galley if you geot hungry.

The seats were leather and pretty firm. Calf support was good but the foot rest was useless. The foot rest is in the seat in front of you.
Over all, good flight and probably would take them again.
label: positive

text:
Boeing 777-300ER Old Aircraft! In our recent trip to Tokyo, we were flying with Singapore Airlines again and it was an old Boeing 777-300 ER aircraft (I will discuss that shortly).

While check-in was smooth in Changi Airport, the flight was delayed due to the "late arrival of the aircraft". It was delayed by 30mins. But somehow we managed to touch down in Haneda Airport just with a mere 5 mins delay, and the pilots did a great job. Both taking off and landing were perfect and so smooth and you won't actually feel anything. Kudos to the team!

Next, the aircraft was old though it was supposed to be a retrofitted version. Seat was generally ok as we sat in the "forward section". 

The in-flight system was old, slow and kept hanging from time to time. Remote was also insensitive and the flight path display was "2D" and look dated. The contents were somehow quite limited too.

As for the food, it was average but not hot when served.

The crew were friendly, attentive and did a great job, walking around constantly to serve drinks and clear the used cups etc.

Overall, the flight was satisfactory though can be better.

Return flight:

On our return flight to Singapore, it was an airbus A330-300, it was a better and newer aircraft as compared to the boeing 777. Seat and legroom were fine and inflight was better than the boeing 777 though can be better. The flight left on time from Haneda.

And again the pilots did a marvelous job, smooth took off and landing and in fact arrived at Changi about 20mins ahead of schedule!

As for the food, there was no choice as the more popular item "Japanese set" were all given out and many had to accept the other only option. I noticed some passengers didn't take but requested for instant noodles (either they didn't eat spicy food or pork). Food was average but the ice cream was yummy!

Cabin crew was overall friendly and attentive and polite (especially the Japanese crew who kept apologizing and thanking to accept the only other set meal). But the leading stewardess was not too friendly and when we asked about the collection of our purchased item (we did the order online) when announcement that Krisshop was available, she seemed impatient somehow and responded "wait for my colleagues to finish their work first" and walked off. Perhaps she had a bad day or being frustrated with some other passengers?

Hmm, is that the "right" or "political correct" answer? She could be more tactful and told us that her colleagues would follow up in a while after they had finished with whatever they were doing.

But the crew who later brought us the item was friendly and smileful though.

In both of these flights, there were "hits and misses" in the inflight system, seat, food and cabin crew service. But as for the pilots, they were doing a great job for these 2 flights and credit and compliments must be given to them!

I hope SIA will seek to improve and not being complacent and taking their passengers for granted, and if not, they will soon be overtaken again by other leading airlines!
label: neutral

text: Best sleep on a aircraft I’ve had Great airline, excellent service and the best sleep I’ve had on a aircraft, this must be because the noise of the aircraft is so quiet. We appreciated being served our food first with what we had preordered (not so on our onward flight with Air New Zealand).
label: positive

text:
Appalling Absolutely appalling service from cabin crew to the point we were ignored through the entire 13 and half hour flight.
Complaint put forward to Singapore Airlines who responded with a generic apology., not good enough especially when my husband experienced bad stomach pains following cold food onboard!!
label: negative

text: Good experience flying Singapore Airlines. Good meals and service. Comfortable seating with ample space. Inflight entertainment good. Cabin crew under pressure, maybe under staffed? Notwithstanding, crew were attentive.
label: positive

text: Suggestion: Please provide bottle of water to economy passengers. Everything was good....the food, service and entertainment. A major disappointment: they do not provide water bottles to economy passengers on long haul fights. Every time you ask they pour around 100 ml water in a small glass. By the time I reached Melbourne I was dehydrated and fell sick post the flight. I would suggest to buy your own big water bottle before boarding economy to avoid getting sick. Dear Singapore Airlines, you could have reduced some of the so many snacks, instead a good bottle of water would have been appreciated :)
label: positive

text:
Poor customer Service over phone Trying to find out about alcohol restrictions on checkin luggage. Nothing on the website. Tried calling customer service in London and in Singapore - automated messages and it is frustratingly circular - after having pressed numerous buttons it left me only with 1 option to send an sms to my phone with a link to the website which has no information on it!
Can't speak to anyone - that was 30 mins i will never get back. Please can someone tell me where to find this information??!!
label: negative

text:
Poor check-in and boarding logistics and service My trip had the following legs: OSL-CPH-SIN-AKL

In OSL there was a long struggle getting around the mandatory visa requirement in the system, which is incorrect, as Norwegians do not require visa to NZ. After some phone calls problem was seemingly resolved, and I was checked-in.

In CPH I was called at the gate where a long and tedious processing and questioning ensued as there was an issue with visa - again. They were unwilling to disclose what the problem was, but asked and acted like they tried to solve a new type of problem. After much tos-and-fros I was allowed onboard the SIN flight.

In SIN there was not much time between flights, but I made it just in time for boarding only to be denied entry as I did not have a visa. Again - not required. After some discussion the visa track was directed to flight/PNR out of NZ. This flight was never brought up in OSL or in CPH, if it had I would have been able to sort that out well before SIN boarding, and that is also the requirement of Singapore airlines to ensure all requirments of a traveller are met at the beginning of the PNR, meaning that boarding at first flight meets all requirements throught to the end destination. Instead my boarding processes were halted with a system malfuntion requiring a NZ visa.

As my NZ flight was booked separately by my travel partner, I had to get that from him. Problem was that he was on a different flight. There was no help from any of the staff in any manner whatsoever, and they did not accept responsibility for this requirement not being communicated to me in OSL or CPH. The only thing that was communicated to me throughout was the errouneous visa requirement.
Fortunately my partner had just landed in AKL and thus I got my out-of-NZ PNR and was allowed boarding as one of the last passengers..

He could also inform me that he was not asked for a return ticket out of NZ anywhere on his trip and entered AKL without having showed it to anyone - so this is quite disturbing. No best practices, no adherence to regulations, simply very random.

That said the CPH-SIN flight was excellent. Excellent food. Excellent staff. Wide flatbed seat, but it would be nice with a mattress.
label: positive

text: Amazing Experience What an experience when we had with the new A380 suite. From the check in - lounge til we got on the plane. We had the 1F&2F where it converts to a double room cabin. The service given by the crew was amazing. The cabin itself was spacious and the food was divine. You literally got what you paid for. Add this to your bucket list and youll never regrets.
label: positive

text: Let down Booked and paid for seats well in advance. Was told that seats were no longer available, and separated me, my wife and grandchildren when giving us other seats. Also left two of our cases behind on return.  No help or consideration..Left our house key in one case.(I know, very stupid) cost £245 for emergency locksmith...No sympathy from Singapore Airlines..if cases were lost. Then I could have claimed, but they had our cases and refuse to take any responsibility. Lots of other little things went wrong. Ruined a trip of a lifetime....I can honestly say, I can rough it with the best, and except that things can go wrong. But they could have been a lot more understanding with the situations....No more Singapore Airlines for me...
label: negative

text:
Great flight, excellent service The service o Singapore is excellent as it always is. I have flown with them many times and they never disappoint. They are attentive and you are treated with utmost respect and provide the service you wish for.
Premium economy is very nice ad almost make it not worth the extra for business.
label: positive

text:
Economy  Lite Fare ticket Bought Economy  Lite fare for 2 persons.
Was given separate  seats on the flt.
Customer  service informed that these fare ticket only entired you to a seat and does not guarantee seating together.
Need to buy seat selection and if not 48 hours before flight complementary selection is available. 
Well the airline should at least put us any Economy seats together.
label: negative

text: Professional service and comfortable flight  A really pleasant flight from Perth to Singapore. The inflight entertainment was top notch, the service excellent and the food was delicious. The comfort on the new A359 is also top quality - you barely feel the bumps it's that smooth! Highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Very professional and efficient staff; clean and tidy plane; prompt and timely. Very happy with all aspects of the flight - will definitely fly Singapore Airlines again. A lot more comfortable than expected in Economy. I am 185cm tall, and had plenty of room for my legs and elbows. The food was fine - much better than on many other airlines that I have experienced.
label: positive

text:
What has happened to Singapore Airlines My daughters flew Singapore Airlines from Sydney to LHR and return, arriving home today after a month in the UK. Over the last decade we have regularly flown with Singapore Airlines (SA) and have found them to be really good. Well, it seems things  have really changed and not for the better.  SA are now running Airbus 350s on the SQ241 route which have very reduced leg room in economy ( 18"). They do not provide a dinner meal on the SA 305 route from LHR to Singapore or the connecting flight to Sydney SA 241. Refreshments and snacks very available on the SQ 305 leg and the service was good. The SA 241 leg was unsatisfactory with poor meals very limited service in economy, no water and soiled toilets from early in the flight. They felt it was more like a budget flight..ie..Scoot with a SA logo. Seems you either pay for PE or BC or your really are in cattle class with Singapore..so very disappointing that SA has followed QANTAS down the cheap and nasty route!
Unfortunately, given past good experiences wit SA my Wife and I have booked with SA to go to Europe next year! Will have to review that decision!
label: negative

text: Flight from Penang to Singapore Short flight from Penang to Singapore was very good. Service was excellent and the aircraft very neat and clean. Only problem was checking in due to the very confusing terminal and lack of information on arrival.  This is not the airlines fault, but the very poor state of the Penang International Airport. This si an ongoing problem with no relief in sight.
label: positive

text: Reliable and good friendly service. The flight was most comfortable mainly due to the friendly service. A good choice of premium beers and wines complimented the excellent food. The reclining beds offered a comfortable sleep.
label: positive

text: A Curates Egg The trip over which this was was on an older aircraft (old airbus) and the seating was poor and service mediocre. The return trip from London to Melbourne was very good both in seating and service.
label: neutral

text: Seats were great - Service was Terrible. We upgraded to Premium Economy and found the seats to be excellent.  Made the long haul way more comfortable so worth it from that perspective.  However, really unimpressed with the food, they talk it up on the menu but it's no different to anything you would normally get in economy.  A breakfast sausage sitting in waiting for 6 hours is still going to be awful!  VERY poor service by the cabin crew.  They were literally nowhere to be seen during the flight, except when they had to do the bare minimum serving food.  There was no way of contacting them, no way to ask for a drink... I got given a thimble sized glass of champagne with my first meal and I for the price we paid to be in premium economy I wanted another one!  But there was just no-one around. So for this reason only will not fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: neutral

text: May Be The Best There Is First time in Singapore Business Class on a long flight.  The seat are fantastic once you figure out how to operate them. Slept very well.  The meals and drinks were fantastic.  Service was over the top.  Too bad I don’t fly thru Singapore much. The waste bin in the toilet was never full...how many times have I been on flights when it’s more than full.
label: positive

text: Bit disappointed Having flown with Emirates last year and being told Singapore Airlines was even better we were very excited about our flight. Our experience did not match expectation. Firstly, the seats were not as comfortable as Emirates. Secondly, the plane was a bit grubby. The toilets from the beginning heavily smelt or urine, which wasn't nice. Staff were fairly welcoming, but not massively. We both ordered a non fish meal. Our flight from Heathrow to Singapore meal was OK, but because special meals are served first it means you have to wait a long while for your drink. Our meal for our flight from Singapore to Bali was not good. The roll was not edible, and the rest of the meal was not very nice. We felt penalised for ordering a special meal, as other passengers received a Magnum, when we asked we were told we didn't have one as had a special meal. In fairness the air stewardess did give us a Magnum, although slightly begrudgingly! I have raised a complaint with SA, to which they have replied and are investigating. We're hoping our flight home is better. I wonder whether glowing reviews are from those that travel Business or First. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't the most awful experince, but it didn't meet expectation, and certainly didn't take the position of favourite airline in my opinion.
label: neutral

text:
Great way to fly SQ 915 on 14/11/2019
SQ 918 on 18/11/2019

Always great to fly SIA. The meal selection and inflight entertainment are always good. But the outbound checking in was a little bad. The staff was so confused thereby resulting in a longer wait (express lane for Gold and Biz class).. The spread in the lounges is always best among all the other airline lounges.
label: positive

text: 2hr delay We had a 2hr delay for a flight which caused a different linked flight and we couldn’t choose our own seats. We paid fir the choosing of own seats but when we tried to complain about it got no where. The 2hr delay meant it was over lunch time and all they offered was $14aus (£7) for refreshments not lunch. It which was not enough to cover lunch at airport prices so not good enough Singapore Airlines. Will not fly with them again. Wifi was at a cost too.
label: negative

text:
Not what it used to be We have used Singapore Airlines many times as it flies direct out of Adelaide. Our flight over was fine even though the food was truly awful. 
On our return flight our bag was being transferred from a connecting flight from Vientiane for our flight back to Adelaide. We made it back fine but no luggage.
Our bag has not yet been returned even though I have an air tag inside it and I have provided Singapore Airlines with a photo of where the bag is located in Changi Airport. It is so frustrating to know exactly where it is and has been since we landed there and yet still get the standard line...we are still trying to locate your bag. I wonder if any one actually looks? Our positive view of the Airline has collapsed as a result.
label: negative

text:
Inflexible and Lousy Service - Not worth your money (Especially Krisflyer Gold) I fly with SQ for my business flights every month and got to Krisflyer Gold Status but their service is so inflexible and poor. 

Totally not worth it, you’d be better off supporting Emirates, Cathay Pacific or any Japan airlines.

text: DONT MISTAKE They aren’t interesting to you. They look so angry to you. Maybe they are cool but they hate the person. Do not mistake

text: You can see why this is a top airline We flew Economy Manchester to Singapore and return plus some regional Silk Air flights to Cambodia and from Vietnam. text:
Best airline till now Singapore airlines is a great airline to fly.

text:
Brisbane to Singapore and return Have recently flown to Singapore and then on to Hong Kong to join a cruise back to Singapore,usually when flying to Europe I fly economy to Singapore then on to Europe Buisness . this time as was only to Singapore then on to Hong Kong and back by Ship I chose to do Premium Economy both ways and was not disappointed in any way .
The seats are comfortable and sufficient leg room and only having 3 rows in the cabin made it feel like your own private plane .and the in flight service could not be faulted including noise reduction head sets . 
Will definitely do Singapore Airlines Premium Economy from now on.

text:
Hassle free travelling making long haul no problem! I cannot praise the flight attendants enough working for this airline. Despite the length of flight, at no time was anything too much trouble. 

They ensured that refreshments arrived at regular intervals and the service was speedy, efficient and polite.

The standard of food served was pleasing and hot, and the range of drinks included was very much appreciated.

The only downside to my review is that I managed to get the last seat on this plane and was charged double the price which I found to be very unfair.
label: positive

text:
Best short break ever I have reviewed my hotel separately but the whole trip was enhanced tremendously by the service given by the staff of Singapore airways.  Automatic check in was straight forward and help was in any case available. Boarding was well organised and speedy. The cabin crew were terrific  (and the ladies beautiful). We were definately not treated as second class flyers despite being in economy. The meals were excellent and where appropriate, very hot. Drinks of all kinds were readily available. The entertainment was wide ranging and up to date.  On our outward journey I watched 3 films and listened to two albums. The two journies passed very quickly and relatively comfortably. 
A great experience and probably the best airline I have ever flown with. If able, I shall fly with them again as soon as possible.
label: positive

text: Great flight and service We now know why Singapore airlines were voted the best long haul carrier. The certainly live up to their accolade. every thing was perfect from start to finish!
label: positive

text:
Travelled with a 2.5 year old for the first time Actually quite comfortable and having own tv was a plus. He didn’t wear his earphones but was able to watch the picture. We had wifi which we could purchase on the flight so he could watch his iPad. They provide a pillow and blanket so no need to bring those extra items to lug around. Drinks and meals obviously provided. Loved the wine :) 
Service is great always smiling and the A380 is a smooth ride. Will definitely fly Singapore again.
label: positive

text: Lost baggage Flying home after 3 years to australia to visit family for Christmas and Singapore airlines loose my luggage and leave me with nothing for days. Customer service is appalling, no updates, no care that I have nothing to wear or can’t get my medication or christmas gifts I’d bought for family. I’m so appalled and I’m DREADING my flight back to london with them
label: negative

text:
Great service friendly staff 😀 First time traveling on Singapore airlines & we very impressed with how professional hard working and friendly they were. On the way from Singapore to Brisbane the crew were on the go the entire time serving meals drinks cleaning up keeping us humans safe and happy.
  Very happy and I would be booking again on our next trip.😀👌

text: Excellent! We flew from Bangkok to Singapore. The staff were friendly and helpful. The entertainment was excellent. The airplane was good. The food was good.

text: No quibble refund after we booked direct with airline I have seen so many bad reviews on major airlines as a result of COVID flight cancellations. I can only say that I have nothing but good things to say about Singapore Airlines from our own experience. We spoke with one of their representatives on the phone after they rang us and she was as pleasant and helpful as anyone we have ever spoken too. She processed the return of our ticket costs after they had cancelled 2 of the flights without any fuss whatsoever. We were told that the refunds could take from 2 to 6 weeks before they would be in our bank account, 4 days later we had the full amount refunded. When all this horrible situation is sorted there will only be one airline we will use to make our trip to see the daughter and grandchildren. Good service earns its own rewards.
label: positive

text: Flying SIA We travelled on the A380 to Singapore. The flight was comfortable as it has a bit more leg room than budget airlines. text: Outstanding Fabulous flight. Check in and boarding was fast and efficient. We left on time. My seat in Business class was huge and very comfortable. text:
Very Good flight to Bali!  We flew CPT-JNB-SIN-DPS with a chosen 10hr layover in Singapore to do some sightseeing.

text:

text: Very spacious Buisness Class Excellent service and very comfy. text:
Business trip to Australia Poor/low skilled attendance at the gate. It's already multiple times I experienced the chaotic scene and that passengers sent back again, due to wrong groupage.
Please repare the gate prior to arrival of the passengers in the hall and show your boarding procedure on a screen or signs! And keeep Priority Class passengers really separated, so people don't think the boarding actual is free entry again. Maybe by announcing in more languages

text:
Awesome airline No wonder Singapore Airlines are always voted in the top 10 best airlines in the world!
i flew on the Singapore Airlines A380 from Sydney to Singapore in Business Class.
Great plane, very good business class seat, very tasty food with lots of it, and the cabin crew and some of the best and friendliest in the skies.
Great service Singapore Airlines. I look forward to flying with you again.

text: Was SO disappointing Robotic cabin crew. REALLY uncomfortable seats for those who have bad necks, head Corder forward so got a headache within hours. Inedible food (Special chef orders just as bad too). Lights off at 3pm, yes 3pm so for 2 flights totalling approx 1 day of flying time, supposed to sleep .. Ummah, hideous for those who don't need hours and hours of sleep. Told to switch my 'night' light off so couldn't read and didn't want to watch any more movies. Return flight packed (This time in ECO as no room in PREM ECO), hot cabin, service stretched ... If you could call it service. I asked to borrow a pen to complete landing card and waited 30+ minutes. Had to ask again. Only thing I asked for in the 4 flights I took. I will NEVER fly this airline again mainly because the crew have zero empathy and the seats are SO UNCOMFORTABLE. If only I'd flown Virgin Atlantic ...
label: negative

text: Economy class was fine. Comfortable flight even in economy....only 5 hours tho.  Friendly, efficient staff...excellent food and service.  Always travel with SQ if possible.
label: positive

text:
Amazing.... Four flights with Singapore Air in a month and what can I say...all amazing. 
Flew Economy but everything great and service second to none. 
Changi Airport is amazing...had a layover for just under 4 hours on the way out from London to Melbourne and all shops great. Duty free is delivered to your boarding gate so no need  to carry liquor around whilst there. Picked up my free Changi Airport Dollar Vouchers courtesy of the airline whilst there...Two of us so  $40 SGD worth which we spent on our return trip....valid at most retailers except food and drink outlets.
Only one bar but managed a couple of local Tiger Beers...all good.
Return journey check in fantastic...self check in and all self bag drop...even printed a heavy label for our cases and off they went.
Never crowded  as such a large terminal (Terminal 3)...
Be careful to check boarding gate as can be a long walk. Only one minor thing....you cannot buy water to take on plane as you need to go through security prior to boarding at gate. You can take a water bottle through empty and fill at fountain in waiting area.
My father is elderly and walks with a stick....at all times we were ushered through early even though we were Economy passengers...never waited more than a couple of minutes queuing.
Very attentive at all levels...would highly recommend.
Looking forward to saving for my next trip Down Under and will definitely fly with this airline.
label: positive

text:
Flying back home with Singapore airlines the best flying experience with Singapore Airlines 

during the holiday break I bought a 1 way ticket from singapore airlines at their sales office in orchard and had to pay a 50 USD fee/person for the service but it was worth of flying and buying it. I was in luck because the ticket cause 1/2 price from Garuda and I got to fly on a B 777 - 300. and when the day come, we sat on the plane and it was so huge compared to Garuda because its a B 777 - 300. when it took of from the ground the plane went through a strong turbulence when it fly over between the batam and singapore straight.

text:

text:

text:
Outstanding service Very good comfort and exceptional service served by the professional SQ crews onboard. Foods quality is not bad but sleeping on the bed during the flight is nice. Enjoyed seating by the window. Enjoyed Singapore sling and lamb chops. Mee Siam is ok but needs improvement. Was hoping to book the cook - hainesese chicken rice but heard from friends that it's just average.  I wish to let you all at Singapore airlines know what can be improved for hainesese chicken rice - apparently more flavour?  🙏😃🇸🇬. The SIA lounge at terminal 3 was very good and got a lot of food choices to choose from. 

I would definitely recommend to anyone to try Singapore airlines as it's unique air experience. I have been flying with SIA quite a lot and will still use this airlines at some point in future.

text:
Singapore flight The flight was good there were no delays quick check in
Some food and drinks are not always available also the meals on the menu are short and you have to take what they have.
Some flight attendant don’t like people coming in the kitchen to ask for snacks
label: positive

text:
Pretty good, all things considered Flew back to AKL from SIN and after the flight up with Air NZ we were looking forward to comparing the service back with Singapore Airlines. We were in a B777-300ER which with Singapore's service has the cattle class seats configured in 3-3-3 meaning you have slight wider seats and better aisle room that some airlines which fly the B777 with the 3-4-3 configuration. 

Seats were comfortable and the in-flight entertainment system excellent. Seat recline was too much - the guy on the aisle seat across from me had a real issue with comfort as he was a big fella and had another big guy in front of him who reclined his seat full back, giving my neighbour virtually no personal space. That's probably as much to do with passenger flying etiquette as anything else, but a more restricted seat recline would certainly have helped.

Staff service couldn't be faulted, Meals were OK - So much nicer they at least have you eating with stainless steel utensils, and not the plastic knives and forks used locally - so much better environmentally,

We had a substantial tail wind coming back which was great given we had a tight transit time in Auckland. Much of this time saving was used up however as it took well over 15 minutes from stopping at the terminal to actually leaving the aircraft, as they let the higher paying passengers off first before the many in the back of the aircraft.

It was pretty good service but I still rate their SilkAir regional brand as a better airline.
label: positive

text:
3 hours of luxury  My gf and I decided to splurge and treat ourselves to a business class flight from Singapore to Manila in January 2020.
From the minute we walked into the airplane and graciously guided to our own personal business class booths, we knew this flight was going to be our favorite.
We've been on over a hundred airplanes before with numerous airlines around the world, but never in a business class seat with Singapore Airlines.
The courteousy, respect and professionalism the staff showed us was above and beyond anything I've experienced. We were constantly being checked on, our meals were incredible, we had bottomless drinks of our choice, cozy personal reclining seat /bed to relax in, the latest in entertainment on my own wide screen TV monitor and the bathroom was literally 4 feet away!
If you ever feeling like treating yourself or family and /or friends to luxury in the air, do it with Singapore's business class! It's totally worth it!
label: positive

text:
Departure lounge a scene from Benny Hill/ or Fawlty Towers In the departure lounge at Sydney it seems to us and other travellers that there was a problem .
One of the younger attendants seemed to be suffering from OCD. She moved and adjusted the chrome posts and the tapes, time after time after time . 
Then minutes later you’ve guessed it she did it all again. She was very good at no eye contact at all.
If Sydney caught this on CCTV it make a great “how not to reassure your passengers”
Boarding staff at Sydney sorry nil points .
We didn’t get a reply when we asked the guestion as to what was going on .

2nd flight in three weeks...and same disappointment This was my second flight to Singapore in three weeks. Last time, I reported about my check-in issues and the problem with the bed, where my neighbour kept waking me up by knocking on the separation wall....

The second came with the meal. I took the meat of the signature dish of George Blanc. Well, the meat was so hard that I could not eat it and had to send it back...

It really gives the impression of an airline trying to save in all directions, and it does not provide a great client experience, especially when you pay this price tag.

text: My favourite Airline! Okay so I may be biased ;) But I love Singapore Airlines! They always look beautiful, I love their uniform and the service is to 90% amazing. I only once had a stewardess that was not quite as attentive but still good. The rest of the time (and I've flown with this Airline from Zurich to Singapore, from Singapore to Perth and Sydney to Singapore - so all long flights). The service was always great! Even in Economy you have space. Their food is always yummy and they have Gingerale! <3 If you need anything the crew is always looking out to see if any guest has a request. They used to give out free kits with Sleeping Mask and tooth paste, etc. Unfortunately you don't get that anymore (at least not with Economy).

text:
Great service for a short flight We flew on Singapore Airlines B787-10 for this flight. The Economy Class cabin is further segregated into two sections, with 150 seats in the forward cabin and 151 in the aft cabin. Singapore Airlines uses three colours: brown, grey, and turquoise, for its Economy Class seats. In addition, the use of mood lighting for different moments of the flight, such as white lighting during boarding and disembarking and purple/orange lighting during the morning flight time, allows passengers to relax during the flight.

There are several lavatories dotted across the two sections of the Economy Class. The lavatory onboard is not exactly the largest, but it is very functional. The mirrors in the lavatory make the space appears larger than it is. The hardworking cabin crews on Singapore Airlines constantly kept the lavatory very clean for the duration of the fight. I like the touch-free features, such as the sensor-activated tap and the toilet flush to the step-activated trash bin cover, which provided convenience to passengers and were extremely important in this endemic period. Singapore Airlines is one of the few airlines worldwide that still provides toothbrushes in their lavatories other than the standard hand soap.

Economy Class seats on Singapore Airlines B787-10 are arranged in a 3-3-3 configuration. Each seat has a 32″ seat pitch and measures 17″ wide with a 5″ recline. Despite the very thin-looking Economy Class seats on Singapore Airlines, which do not seem to provide much cushioning, these seats are very comfortable for the short two-hour flight. In addition, the four-way adjustable headrest contributes to the comfort afforded by these Economy Class seats. The controls for reading light control and call attendant buttons are found under the IFE screen. There is also a sizable tray table on every seat. A standalone cup holder is fitted under the IFE screen, allowing passengers to stow their cups of drinks without needing to deploy the tray table. The seat pockets on Singapore Airlines are designed to allow passengers to maximise the usage of these pockets and also make it easier for passengers to locate the items they placed inside the pockets. 

An 11.1″ touchscreen TV is fitted in every Economy Class seat. There are many entertainment options on Singapore Airlines’ KrisWorld, ranging from the latest Hollywood blockbusters to TV shows. The intuitive menu options on KrisWorld are very well organised, making scrolling through them a breeze. Singapore Airlines provides earplugs for every passenger, though some might not find stuffing things in their ears comfortable. Singapore Airlines also provides complementary wifi for its KrisFlyer members (regardless of status) and passengers flying in Business Class or higher cabins. The wifi onboard is very stable but can only handle chats, email browsing and uploading to social media.

We were given two options for breakfast today – Singapore Fried Carrot Cake with Prawns and Scrambled Eggs with Chicken Sausage. I chose the Fried Carrot Cake for breakfast. I am not a fan of the take-out box design used in regional Economy Class, as it made the portion feel small and was challenging to eat from. Singapore Airlines only served its Economy Class passengers a yoghurt. The meal was delicious and full of flavours. My friend opted for the Scrambled Eggs and found the eggs to be a tad dry and the sausage bland.

Service onboard Singapore Airlines was impeccable, as always. We were greeted by the warm and friendly cabin crews. The cabin crew worked tirelessly to serve all the passengers and attended to their requests despite being a full flight. Despite the clear delineation of the duties of each flight attendant, cabin crews were ready to step in to help their colleagues should one be away from their station (during meal service) to top up food or handle other passenger requests not available on the food cart. The flight attendants’ felt happy in their job, which also translates to caring for their passengers.
label: positive

text:
experience I choose Singapore Air coz i know if not the best its 1 of the best. But our flight from Male to singapore is 11pm unfortunately it was delayed. So when we were in the plane we were so hingry coz we didnot have our dinner coz lots of passengers in the dep area & the line is so long. 
When we were flying we wrmere waiting to serve the food but after 3hours they didnot serve when i asked the flight attendant wheres our food theybdaid they already finish serving food & they cannot serve ot anymore. I asjed why we didnot get our food? They said we didnot ask for it! Huh omg... as kuch as i want to get mad... i will rate them 5- average... 

Only my flight from Male to Singapore but from other Singapore to Philippines it was great
label: neutral

text: Business Class Supreme I have over a million miles on two US Domestic Carriers. Singapore Business Class is by far the best premium class airline I have flown. The service was superior to anything I have experienced and the comfort of the seats, especially in the "bed" mode was very comfortable. Try the "Book the Chef" services for creating your own menu on the flight. I had lobster thermidor at 35,000 feet for dinner. If I get a chance to travel to Asia again, I will definitely select Singapore Air. I wish they offered service out of Chicago Ohare.
label: positive

text: After transit/change of aircraft From Copenhagen to Singapore, we were on A350 and premium economy was not comfortable. From Singapore to Sydney it was a 777. Great space. Worth the money
label: positive

text:
A great airline to fly with but the business class bed lets them down. Having had a connection from Madrid we arrived early into terminal two and the Singapore desks were not open but the desks in front were open and we were advised to use these as they could do exactly the same as the Singapore desks and we therefore saved about three hours waiting around for the gates to open, a good tip for anyone.
The lounge at Heathrow was a huge disappointment staff were more concerned about gossiping with each other than doing their jobs. Dirty plates were left on our table for an hour, the bar was often left unattended and when I went to use the showers I was shown initially into two showers that had dirty towels strewn on the floor.
 Checkin was quick and the welcome on board was friendly. The seat when in the seating position was the best I have flown on in business class but when converted into a bed was just too hard to get much sleep, hence the four not the five point rating. A mattress topper would have made the whole journey more enjoyable. I am 1m85cm tall and had no problem with the cubby hole space for your feet in sleep mode and this had been a concern prior to the flight. The meal service was excellent my steak from the book the cook menu was cooked to perfection for me and my partners duck was equally good. Drinks were topped up when needed and water was offered throughout the flight. Arrival in Changi was efficiency at its best. If the bed issue can be sorted out Singapore airways will become my go to airline.
label: positive

text:
Great Service as allways I recently flew with Singapore Airlines from Melbourne to Denmark through Singapore return trip with my 4-year old.

As it turned out, I got caught in the SAS pilot strike on a connecting flight when I had to return to Melbourne, and if it hadn't been for Singapore Airlines' brilliant customer service, I would have been stuck! Within 6 hours of emailing Singapore Airlines, I had a customer representative calling me offering me an alternative flight home, re-booked at NO EXTRA COST!! I am super impressed and grateful, and this is one of the reasons why I ALWAYS try to book Singapore Airlines before any other airlines!

Service and comfort on board the flights (MEL - SIN, SIN - CPH and AMS - SIN, SIN - MEL) were great with extra attention being paid to my pre-schooler with plenty of chats and making sure he was entertained. The child meals are also great, and I find it fantastic that they are served first, about 20-30 min before the normal meal service, giving a parent the chance to help feed the kid first and be able to eat my own meal while warm :-)
label: positive

text: FLIGHT FINE BUT IMPOSSIBLE TO CONTACT CALL CENTRE The Flight was fine but I had a query before flight and wanted to speak to a person at the Airline. I hung on the phone for ages and never did manage to speak to anyway, so never got an answer to address my concern - so was very stressed ahead of the flight  in case I'd encounter a problem at the check in desk and be refused boarding (fortunately it was OK in the end but stress would have been reduced if I could have spoken to someone).
label: positive

text: Bliss! Friendly, professional, comfortable environment. Odd large moulding of seats blocks partial view in window seats. Food service good, great entertainment selection, but would like to have 'Whose Line Is It Anyway?' on as before.
label: positive

text:
Safest Airlines I had been to Singapore during the coronavirus pandemic, when I arrived in Singapore the DRDO level was yellow and soon it was at orange levels.
My experience during this time was the airlines staff was well versed with the subject and they ensured necessary precautions. They also ensures that all passengers were made comfortable and sufficient care and service wA given during this flight
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight, plenty of entertainment and friendly staff! We'd flown with Singapore Airlines before Sydney to Thailand and were happy with the comfort and service so chose it for our long haul flights to London via Singapore. We were not disappointed. It was one of the cheapest flights with the shortest duration with transfers. We were very pleased that we could do International Check-in via our domestic airport in Newcastle NSW - only Singapore Airlines offers this so far. The flight was obviously long but comfortable with plenty of entertainment, food and refreshments to distract. Would definitely choose again!
label: positive

text: Premium Economy not worth the money Seat 33D. The extra room over an economy seat was marginal in terms of leg room. The meal service is economy class and the service was poor by Singapore Airlines normal service standards. I had to ask for coffee and extra wine was not offered. After experiencing Air New Zealand's service on the previous leg, SA offering was simply poor. It is not worth upgrading from economy.
label: positive

text:
Excellent in every way Singappre airlines is definitely a firm favourite of mine.
When you sit in economy class you are still treated as business class.
Friendly and attentive flight crew make the trip a pleasure. I have yet to have a trip with SQ that failed to live up to the high standards set.
I am 2m tall so, unfortunately, let room will always be an issue for me.
label: positive

text:
Surprisingly Disappointing The seat was only ok since it only reclines up to about 40 degrees. The leg room when the legrest was raised is rather small, and I'm not even very big (175cm 72kg).
When the seat was folded down into a bed, you end up lying diagonal to the screen and into an even smaller footwell. In the entire ~36 hours of flight time, I don't think I ever found a comfortable position to fall asleep in. Everything just felt very un-ergonomic and just wrong in general.
The only positive feedback about the seats would be the many compartments available to store your belongings.

I ordered the Halal meal, which ended up being tasteless Indian food (i.e. Tasteless briyani with Tasteless unrecognisable Indian bread and something they try to pass as Curry) for ALL the services. I am sorely disappointed that SQ is not capable of providing decent halal meals like Emirates, Qatar or Malaysian airlines. Heck, even KLM does better. I would think they would be better off just serving me Vegan food instead. Both the "halal" dessert and normal service dessert were very underwhelming.

The inflight entertainment was good and I liked that you're able to sync it to your account to resume on other SQ flights. However, both my seat and neighbouring seat had to have our systems reset TWICE on the flight, which takes about 10-15 minutes. Which left me uninterested to resume watching and just carried on with entertainment on my iPad.

Overall, for the price I paid for a Business Class ticket, I feel like SQ did not deliver as compared to my other experiences with other Business Class seats in other airlines including KLM, Turkish Air, Malaysia Airlines, Emirates and Qatar Airways.

Honestly, this will not be a flight I will ever be taking again. I'd rather have a transit anywhere else and enjoy my flight, rather than take a direct flight from Singapore and just be uncomfortable the whole way.

I did enjoy the Virgin Atlantic lounge in EWR but the lounges in KLIA and Changi T3 were a HUGE disappointment in terms of lousy food selection.

On a more positive note, the flight crew were attentive and pleasant. They were also very apologetic when we complained about the rather insulting "Muslim Meal".
label: negative

text: Best airline Best airline,best Check in , on flight services was the excellent. We think where ever & whenever we will fly we  will chose this airline
label: positive

text: Best flying experience I had the best flying experience with Singapore airlines. this was the first time i flew with Singapore Airlines. Crew, craft, entertainment system, service everything was top qualify
label: positive

text: great service, clean and professional Plane, crew and service just great.  *make sure you buy extra insurance with flight.  Refunds if your plans change.
label: positive

text: a hiccup for a very good airline let me start by saying i'm a big fan of SQ.  have flown this flt several times economy--and SQ economy is light years ahead of most transatlantic u.s. carriers.  have also flown SQ business class and it is very impressive.  BUT this is my first SQ premium economy and quite frankly, it was disappointing. the seats look better than they feel plus the trays are in the armrest reducing them further.  the food service is essentially economy plus bubbly.  the crew seemed lethargic and disinterested (thought i was on United for a moment) very unusal for SQ in my experience.  based solely on this flight, the added cost of premium economy was not close to worth it.
label: positive

text:
Smooth flight All flights are much the same, but with a slightly different flavour. In flight meals ok and film choice pretty mundane. The crew were beautiful and charming. Connection in  Singapore was a bit too tight and meant running through the terminal as well as a monorail ride.

Not much to choose between airlines.
label: positive

text:
Good service as always  Happy to be flying with SQ again.    This time took my son along - so that he can directly experience the service I have told him. 

Turned out, he was very happy.  He liked the movie selections and the sitting arrangement.   Furthermore, he had placed a request to be flying SQ again for future trips 😉

>>TK - August 2019
label: positive

text: Very good service as usual As always seats enabled me to get some 7 hours sleep. Very smooth flight. Used 'Book the Cook' to preselect my meal. Although the movies choice is now limited found a good movie. All in all a good flight with good service that one expects from Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text:
Comfortable in Economy plus My wife and I flew Singapore Airlines from London to and from SE Asia.
Arrivals were right on time allowing us to catch the tight connection to Chaing Mai on the way out and right I time arrival in London four weeks later.
We paid extra for the premium economy class and it was worth every penny... excellent service, good food and free drinks. ... making the 13 - 14 hour flight tolerable.
label: positive

text:
Good clean comfortable  SQ never fail to make our flights pleasant. Cabin crew all friendly, cabin clean, toilet clean, in flight entertainment very good. Good enough leg space for me (5ft 10, 1.76m). Food as usual, I didn't like. On board food is never nice, IMHO. Good red and white wines served. Will be flying again with SQ soon.

Wholeheartedly recommend.
label: positive

text:
They cancel flights with no explanation. Non existent customer service. We bought return tickets 7 months in advance with free flight change. We chose 1 stopover of 2hrs aswe have 2 kids 6 yrs old.
1 month after we booked we received an email saying one flight on each way has been cancelled.
The new flights assigned turned the 1 stopover into 2 stopovers each way. One of the connection allows only 15min between flights! Have they ever taken a connecting flight?!
I called multiple numbers, emailed to multiple email addresses with no t a single reply.
Simply shocking and extremely rude.
label: negative

text: Staff always helpful and friendly Always a pleasure to fly with, they always add the little nice things like toothbrush, socks, blanket and pillow to make you more comfortable
label: positive

text: Questionable service Prior to my flight, I was so excited to be flying with the world’s number one airline. But boy was I disappointed! Hubby and I asked for a drink soon after takeoff, which was not served until well after dinner despite numerous reminders to the cabin crew. Dinner was served on time, but the trays weren’t cleared for the next 45 mins for any of the passengers. Some people made their concerns known, to which the senior cabin crew advised they were working with a new crew and trying something new. But at the expense of the comfort of the passengers? Is it worth it I ask?
label: negative

text:
Best flight ✈️  I have been lucky enough to travel a lot in my life. 
I flew from Phuket to Singapore 🇸🇬 and from Singapore to London. 
I can honestly say that Singapore Airlines beat the others hands down in all areas. 
Economy travel very comfortable. 
Food excellent 
Air stewards attentive. 
Entertainment extensive. 

Well done and keep it up.
label: positive

text: Flight SQ 297 from Singapore to Christchurch on 29th April 2022 This flight was an absolute nightmare. Not only were the people who originally had pre-booked meals (which by the way their website did not allow me to do) were serviced almost immediately while the rest of us had to wait more than an hour for our meals. My wife's meal was already opened - and cold! The air hostesses also seem to spent more time with clients with babies than on the rest of us. Breakfast on the morning was also a disaster - the choices we were given were obviously not for a breakfast!
label: negative

text: Unpleasant uncomfortable new long haul planes What happened to Singapore  Airline? My flight out from  London to Christchurch was fine - very good for an economy class flight, as was the flight from Christchurch to Singapore, where I changed planes.  Then came the 14 hour flight to London. It was 14 hours of torture and discomfort punctuated with very poor food. ( Dry and overcooked pasta and chicken breast, no sauce, and veal sausages for breakfast.  No vegetarian options, and they ran out of white wine}. The seats in the new airbus  are tiny and the legroom is very limited, jammed up against the seat in front.  I’m 174 cm tall and not overly large. It was comparable to  China Southern, which is a lot cheaper and does not pretend to be a premium airline. I’ve done this trip several times on Singapore, but I think I have to reconsider using them. I’ve  had severe back pain all week, since this flight.  And when we got to Heathrow, there was a long wait for baggage as the airline didn’t have the resources to unload the baggage, so a 40 plus minute wait for most passengers, without explanation or assistance from the airline, and I had to pay an hours wait time to the car service I booked.
label: neutral

text:
Excellent Service I would like to commendate all the stewards, stewardess,pilot & captain of flight SQ8122, flying from Sydney to Singapore on 6 May at 12.45pm.

I was a passenger seated at economy class, seat 33A.

All members of the crew were attentive, diligent & provided service with a smile.

The Pilot & the Captain were very reassuring and gave us timely updates about the air traffic situation and had a safe landing too.

A special shout out to the male chief steward (he looks a bit like Jackie Chan),very friendly, professional & sincere staff who takes pride in his work.

Kudos! SQ8122 team and I wish all the new stewards & stewardess serving us all the best and keep up the good work!😁
label: positive

text: World class, excellent service, pleasant crew I always enjoy flying with Singapore airlines , never had a flight delayed, food is delectable and served hot, wine selection is good, toilets are sanitary, people are nice and the Singapore Sling is the cherry on top
label: positive

text:
SQ 325 We have delay from Gothenburg to Frankfurt with lutfhansa and connecting flight with SQ 325 to Singapore. This our first flight with SQ we can said thumbs up with service excellent crew. They wait us for last call, give good service for passenger, food taste good, but amenities for kids little useless  but the youngest get dumbo dolls that still can we keep it. 
 
SQ 325 its not really new one so the configuration seat 3-3-3 but still comfy with a good entertaining from kris world. Minus airplug not bit comfy better u bring self, If you need toothbrush u should ask cabin crew.
label: positive

text: Great airline - consistently so! After years of flying budget airlines all around the world, I have made the conscious decision to return to Singapore Airline. This airline is consistently good - not the cheapest but probably one of the most reliable
label: positive
