text:
I Can't Select Seats I live in France and am trying to select 2 seats in business class for my wife and me to travel from Toulouse to Melbourne on 10 December 2019. The Singapore Airline's website tells me: "Access denied". Why is this?
I am a KrisFlyer member.
label: negative

text:
Non-cooperation from airline Reps at check-in counter and in-flight When I did web check-in 48 hours before scheduled departure, there was no option of seat selection. For self and my wife, two seats were allotted in the middle row. Since my wife was not doing well and it was a long flight, I wanted to have at least one window seat. Hence I immediately cancelled my check-in. 
When I went to airport with the luggage for check in, I requested for a window seat. I was denied saying that the flight was full. Since that flight hops at Hongkong, I requested whether I could get one window seat beyond Hongkong. She said that no passenger was alighting at Hongkong and hence window seat couldn't be allotted. I accepted and travelled.
But inside the aircraft, I found at least one window seat was vacant. Further lot of passengers alighted at Hongkong and new passengers boarded. It shows that the staff at the counter had lied us.
With much difficulty, after traveling about 17 hours, we landed in San Francisco.
We booked Hindu meals for both of us for our entire journey. However, I only was given Hindu meals and my wife was denied. As our tickets were booked under one PNR, then I don't understand why Hindu meal was denied for her. When my wife didn't accept the other meal, another staff offered Hindu meal. 
We had such an horrowing experience during this time.
label: neutral

text:
Amazing airline! Amazing airline! Hot towel service provided with food provided
Food was so tasty and the seats were so comfy
Great entertainment system and clean plane and friendly staff
Will use them again for my next trip! 👍
label: positive

text: Less than expected Flew brisbane to singapore than singapore  to Phuket, this flight had no entertainment but it was a short trip.  It was a very bad desent worst pain ive had in my ears in a flight.  Food was good. But had to ask for drinks, its not a free flowing trolley
label: neutral

text:
Uneventful flight - just as it should be Nothing out of the extraordinary. Selection of the latest sitcom was good. I only found out they had the latest season of The Big Bang Theory too late and couldn't binge watch and finish up the entire season (I will remind myself to do that the next time). 

On a side note, just wished SIA will have more than one flight to and from Adelaide. Would have preferred to fly back to Singapore at a later time (This was a 10am flight).
label: positive

text:
MEAL IN THE FLIGHT ONLY ONE CHOICE AVAILABLE The meal in the flight only one choice available which is BIBIMBAP.
My son which don't eat spicy food and also don't like to eat BIBIMBAP have no choice to choose other meal. He did not eat the flight meal.
label: neutral

text: Service and comfort Singapore Airlines always delivers courteous, comfortable amenity.  Their meals offer choices for Asian and Western tastes. Staff are always keen to assist customers to have the best flight experience possible.  Singapore is a great stop over for Australians on their way to Europe and back, breaking the journey and providing lots of opportunities to shop, to dine, to rest and refresh.
label: positive

text: Comfortable & Pleasant! Guess we were fortunate to get the newly retrofitted A380. Good legroom space & comfortable seat, last us thru' 14 hrs despite only managed 5 hrs of sleep. Let's hope the return flight on B777 will be as good
label: positive

text: A pleasant experience Very customer orientated. Embarkation was smooth and welcoming. On board service was highly efficient and pleasant. Food was good standard -choice chicken mushroom ragout or quiche with generous glasses of wine. Seating was comfortable with sufficient leg-room and entertainment good. Toilets were spotless throughout. All in all a pleasant experience .
label: positive

text: Comfortable travel First time flying Airbus A380. Very nice flight. As always good service from the staff. Good food also. In my seat, the entertainment system was not so good.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Faultless travel experience, from booking, to phone enquiries, check-in and in-flight service. Staff were a amazing and we look forward to flying again with Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: amazing customer service one of the best airlines i have travelled with food was alright but the staff is so courteous and always have a smile on their face
label: positive

text: Great flight, both ways We upgraded our flight to Singapore, for no other reason than it was offered, paying $300  apiece, which was reasonable and got nice seats in front of the bulkhead, so nice leg room (being 5 foot nothing). We were not given the option, nor eceived an email at all about the return flights, which is their loss but I guess flights back to Oz do not have trouble being filled, so we plebs in economy don't get the offer. Anyway, the seats were still fine, those from Taipei back to Singapore (we cruised Singapore to there before having a week back in Singapore) and home, eventually were fine all round and they also organised transfers, although in shuttles. I'd pay for a car next time, as the shuttle driver was a bad-tempered jerk the night we got there from the cruise and ran us all over Singapore to get back at me for answering back when he was cross and nasty picking us up. Such is life. Food was as expected. Hosties are lovely and were kindly but firm when needed. Who would want their job, cleaning toilets? So, on balance, all was fine and we would always fly with them.
label: positive

text: Great Airline All services were great. I am elderly and got a bit stressed and was reassured and helped to check in. Cabin crew were great and.
label: positive

text: Not Good I have been trying to book an award ticket with KrisFlyer miles. Impossible! waitlist after waitlist. Unacceptable! Either redeem almost double the required miles or pay! Not good Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Comfortable On my return flight to Singapore from Taipei, there was a 2 hour flight delay. The ground staffs took care of the passengers really well and ensured that all passengers were comfortable in the waiting area.
label: positive

text: Singapore lovin Our first time to Phuket and we booked our tickets through our regular agency (Helloworld Fountain Gate)   We always pick a full service company and one with a good reputation.    Whilst not our first time with Singapore, have previously used them to fly to and from Vietnam, this is my first reviewing them.    Our flights one late afternoon from Phuket to Singapore and then Singapore to Melbourne.   The first is about 1 and half hours so barely time to reach our flight level before we were coming down but they offered a meal and drinks in that time, staff were attentive and efficient as expected.    The flight to Melbourne from Singapore, again everything you expect from this airline.   At least two meals offered during our flight both more than adequate.    As ours was late evening to early morning into Tullamarine, I was hoping that the lights would be turned off or lower than they were, so I could sleep a bit better, but apart from that my biggest issue is leg room being 180 cm, little hard to completely stretch out comfortably.    Well attended to by staff.   I have no doubt that we will fly with them again especially as I have joined their Kris Club, hopefully an upgrade at some stage.   Thanks Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Not world class Our overnight flight in business class was inferior to other airlines such as Emirates, Qatar, Etihad and Qantas.

Other airlines provide hot towels, pyjamas, amenity kits, mattress for fully flat bed and a turn down service and breakfast. Not Singapore air on this overnight flight from Singapore to Australia. Emirates premium economy is far superior to Singapore Business Class. 

Singapore air cannot blame Covid for these petty penny pinching measures, what are they thinking, sadly I have booked with Singapore Air for a trip to Europe in April next year, if things don’t improve, that will be my last.
label: neutral

text: Wedding Anniversary we were in Economy class but so far everything was OK. We can not expect a lot. You pay what you get, they provided drinks every time you requested. the flight entertainment system was very good. Overall , we were quite happy with the flight.
label: positive

text:
Only way to travel... Everything about Singapore Airlines, in our experience, cannot be faulted. 
From ground staff to airport lounges and flight staff, service is friendly and attentive. While this may be expected for Business Class, we have also flown in both economy and premium economy and apart from a distinct comfort factor between each class the human factor doesn't change: friendly, warm and service orientated to ensure your time with SAL is a rewarding one.
On this occassion we travelled, via Singapore, to and from Thailand (Phuket/Khao Lak) in Feb/March, during the the developing Corona Virus epidemic. We did investigate the options of cancelling our trip and at the time SAL were only offering cacellations for flights to China and South Korea where the epidemic was taking off. We understood their reasoning and had no issue with their policy on the matter.
Cleanliness and hygiene was never an issue where related to SAL: Aircraft cabins, toilets, lounges and booking areas were spotless and well maintained. All staff wore surgical masks to protect passengers as well as themselves.
label: positive

text: Mrs The best airline in the world . The cabin crew are so polite , helpful, nothing is to much trouble. 100% would recommend this airline
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines It was a really good Holliday and I was scary of the company I take for traveling but I really enjoy the fly . Thanks Singapore airlines !!!!
label: positive

text:
Great Flight Experience With a Stop-Over Mistake For a lengthy Intercontinental flight, Singapore Airlines had one of the most comfortable planes I have been on. Great amenities, complete entertainment systems, and incredibly friendly attendants. The one mistake I made was not knowing that a "stopover" in Seoul, South Korea was actually a layover even though it did not show up on the itinerary as such. 

Stopping in Seoul requires going through security while exiting the plane and another security check before reboarding. The airport itself is nice and there are several convenient places to eat or shop while waiting, but the hassle of multiple security checks and a lengthy sit in airport chairs made me wish I had flown from SFO straight to Singapore as opposed to LAX-ICN-SIN.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing Experience with SQ We were disappointed with the SQ for the following reasons:
1.  No amenities kit for business class. One has to ask for each item ( socks, slippers, ear plugs, eyes mask, lotion……..) individually 
2.  Only two meals were offered on an 18 hours flight. The rest are only snacks for you to ask
3.  Wi Fi were unstable on and off for the whole flight. It’s very frustrating to get any work done
4.  Lie flat seat need flight attendant to help set up
5.  The “chicken rice” meal I had was inedible. The meat was hard and dry. I guessed it’s because of being reheated too many time
label: negative

text:
Standard dropped so much! Took from trf/cph/sin&return. It has been years since i flew with SQ (since the early 2000s) so I tot ok give them a chance although their prices are pretty high compared to other airlines like KLM or Finnair or BA cos as a citizen we always support our national carrier. Back then the services were very good but now it's really dropped so so much! See below..

-Preflight-
The booking online did not confirm meals for children upon booking only that we will have to arrange it again come 2 weeks prior to departure. (WELL KLM on the other hand automatically register a child seat =a child meal) Then a month or 2 before I fly i received an email saying they hv changed the departure time and that is not good as we had to make arrangements again to ensure our connecting trip timings fits etc. And they said in the mail that we will need to click to agree with the changes as otherwise we will be kicked off the flight and no refunds will be entertained! Well left us with no choice right??!

-1st leg of flight(oslo/cph)-
Bear in mind cos it's code share, they partner with SAS or wideroe from the leg trf/cph. Sas do not serve snacks nor drinks but on wideroe they serve just beverage. And wideroe&sas planes have smaller overhead compartments so your hand luggage need to comply with their measurements instead of SQ's. But as compared to klm, klm's plames can accommodate bigger hand luggages as their overhead compartments are bigger and they do serve a sandwich/snack+beverage. And SQ's fare is usually more expensive than klm's.

-2nd leg of flight (cph-sin)
Actual flight was just normal. I like it that they hv 'milo' on request on board. But my husband noticed that the stewardess mostly didn't really know their products on hand and have to always go ask her seniors back in the gallery whenever. So this was some wasted time waiting for a simple question. Example I asked if I can have a silver sling drink but she was unsure and had to ask her senior and had to walk to and fro many times again when my husband asked if he can hv some certain hard liquor. And the amount of hard liquor they offer in the cup is much lesser than what klm offers. And they will take a note (really writing down) of that which seat passenger has already got their liquor. And comes mealtime my children were offered just adult meals and when i enquired they said i had to book a child meal in advanced. I was dumpfolded..klm or either finnair do let u choose when u book the tickets online. But the stewardess was nice though.

-sin/cph-
Return flight was almost the same service again but this time I encountered a rude steward who is very grumpy. As my children got their meals first than adults, they have finished eating (as it's a night flight they didn't eat much) while he was serving me my meals and I requested him to remove my children's meal tray away and he said he is serving still. But I insisted that he remove it else I do not have the space to eat and settle down my children at the same time. He relented but very apparently annoyed as he just took the tray from me and walked all the way back to the gallery. Is this service?? 

-others-
The children activity kit that SQ gives out now is pathetic. Just some random not good quality colouring set with very very thin tracing paper..
Klm on the other hand gave out a comprehensive children activity set which included child eye shade, klm colouring pencils/cardboard print, tic tac toe games, card game set, amongst other things I forgotten in a felt bag.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines - Simply the best Overall experience with Singapore Airlines was good. They provided good veg food and on time boarding, it was nice experience
label: positive

text:
Best as always Cannot get over the hangover
Travelling with Singapore airlines has always been our first preference.This time we travelled business class...
A smooth journey staff wearing warm smile the food quality the comfort ...U name it and u have it.
Can't explain in words
So one word
EXCLUSIVE.
label: positive

text:
The long journey home Excellent airline to fly with, they make you feel special without trying.
Flew to Singapore by Boeing 777 which was fine and had a five hour stop over then on to London in an Airbus 380 (quite an experience).

Overall the food and service on both legs of the journey were very good with very friendly and attentive staff.
The inflight entertainment was very good and varied as these are long flights and you cant sleep all the time, a good film will always work.

I would gladly travel with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Plenty of legroom, excellent service from the crew but the food was disappointing, particularly the breakfast. They make a mean G&T!
label: positive

text: Consistently good Have had the opportunity to fly with Singapore airlines a few times. Always been a pleasure. I order gluten free meals (I have Celiacs), they always have my meals on hand and they even try to find me something when ice creams are handed out on flights.
label: positive

text: Great service The service was great on Singapore Airlines. Staff were very helpful, the only complaint was the food. Because it was a night flight we were served breakfast and it was not a good selection, the bread roll completely dried out, the fruit extemely bland. Flew to USA last year with Qantas and food was much better, but then the service was not as good as Singapore Airlines. The inflight entertainment was very good, large screens and good selection of movies etc.
label: positive

text: SINGAPORE AIRLINES The SINGAPORE AIRLINE (SIA) was rated as the Airline in the yesteryears. It was the PRIDE of SINGAPORE, and services were EXCELLENT then as compared to most airlines globally. However over the years, the situation changes. The SQ 912 flight from Singapore to manila was nothing to talk about. The meal served was just an average type (eg, the salad consists of few leaves of lettuce and small flakes of CANNED tuna without any dressing !!! The main course consists of two choices and nothing to talk about. The dessert follows that of certain ASIA CARRIER consists of a bar of M ice cream NOT the HAAGEN D (?). The seats were too closed and reclining angle too low. That said, SIA should look into the service rather than cutting corner and loose the game to other Carriers !!!
label: neutral

text: Exceptional experience The most exquisite flight I have ever taken. Excellent facilities, service, and degree of comfort. Would highly recommend Business Class if financially possible.
label: positive

text: Relaxing Traveling  From the email reminding us to check in, to picking up our bags in Delhi the entire trip was relaxing and fuss free. The assistance for our bag drop, lots of helpful staff and the quality of the planes and inflight services was excellent.
label: positive

text:
airhostess behaviour IN flight behaviour of Flight Air hostess was wonderful 
The airbus interior is wonderful 
seats are really relexesing
label: positive

text:
Fantastic Airline to Fly with The flight was to depart at 12.00pm, they had started loading Passengers and the storm started, but they still kept loading.
Once al Passengers were onboard the Captain made an Announcement, that due to bad weather we were unable to take off. The Cabin Crew made sure we were comfortable, handed out drinks, and cool washers. They looked after us extremely well.
On arriving to Singapore, we still were unable to land due to bad weather, once again we were looked after very well.
Due to this we had missed our connecting flight into Bangkok, and they had arranged hotel vouchers, car vouchers, and food vouchers, but unable to stay overnight,and making my concerns of having to get to Bangkok, Singapore Ground Staff,  ent over backwards to ensure we got on a flight, of which we did, thanks to the The professionalism of Singapore Ground Staff.
We highly recommend Singapore Airlines for, Service, Food, Comfort, and most important cleanliness.
label: positive

text: Economy never again! The slightly more expense to fly Premium Economy rather than Economy is well worth it. If you are only 2 travelling together, then the 2 only seats on either side of plane are perfect. In the middle is a 4 seat configuration. A much smaller secluded seating area with seats more like recliners. Large Entertainment screens, wider seats with more leg room. The best is the Noise cancelling headphones (not the earbud type you get in Economy). Even left it on when having a snooze as it amazingly cuts out all other noise. Needed to take them off when speaking with flying companion as couldn't hear a word spoken. Also have the choice of selecting your own meals by booking on line before flight (Book the Cook). A lot less expensive than upgrading to Business. If you choose to risk it and book Economy, you may receive an email a week before the 1st SIA flight, inviting you to make an upgrade bid. You won't know if your successful until 48hrs before flight. Did that the 1st time (2017) and were succesful.  2019 trip didn't want to risk it so paid for Premium Economy up front. Wasn't much more than our first bid of $480 extra per long flight.
label: positive

text:
Long Haul Flight 13hrs Heard many great reports for this airline, but not as I expected on such a long haul flight, only glad I was not sitting in economy.
Food was average and strange time to provide food, woken up 5hrs before arrival for service after eating 1.5hrs after take off.
label: neutral

text: Good as long as nothing goes wrong - they don't care at all We were migrating to Singapore permanently work work. I was travelling with my whole family. Typically we fly business with Singapore, which is an amazing experience. In this case I was given my marching orders and I had to get on the first available flight. Given our pleasant past experiences with Singapore Air the decision was a no brainer. We arrived at the airport on time but Virgin Australia simply did not process us on time. We spent nearly an hour in the queue and the lady that was checking us in was new and needed support, to which none was forthcoming from the virgin team. Needless to say we missed our flight. Virgin were absolutely dreadful, lost our baggage, blamed us for being late even though we were waiting in their queue, then sold us it was not their problem, call Singapore Air, so we did. To make a long story short Singapore did nothing to resolve the issue, left our whole family stranded when I had a deadline to meet, charged us over $6000 and wanted to charge us more for missing the flight, and have not responded to our lost baggage claim or complaint. Put simply you are running a risk if you fly with Singapore because THEY DO NOT CARE AT ALL about their customers. I travel regularly, needless to say it will be with other cariers moving forward. It's a shame because I have nearly 200,000 kris flyer points with Singapore that will now be discarded. BE WARNED, IF THINGS GO WELL YOU MIGHT BE OK, THEY DON'T SINGAPORE AIR WILL NOT HELP YOU AND FIND REASONS TO CHARGE YOU ADDITONAL FEES. THERE ARE NO PEOPLE AT MAJOR AIRPORTS TO ASSIST YOU. FLY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!
label: negative

text:
Great service and friendly cabin crew Return from Bangkok yesterday evening .No complains about our  friendly and helpful cabin crews on board the flight. Excellent service. The only problem about this flight was the air-con doesn't seems to be working well. Initially, I thought it was me but the others (70A. 71 A, 72A) who was seated behind me and a few others on other rows also complained about the aircraft air-con. Hope Singapore airlines will look into it and do something about it. 
Thanks.
label: positive

text:
A nice and great flight Although I have written several reviews of Singapore Airlines (SIA) before, this review is the first in 3 years since the outbreak of the Covid19 pandemic as world travel had been limited and restricted since then.

As the pandemic has more or less stabilised and traveling has been resumed, I also have restarted my "walk around the world". And all the while, I have been flying with SIA, unless for domestic flights.

So I am sharing this recent flight where I flew in the business class of the A350-900 aircraft.

First, the ambience was great and cosy and seat was very comfortable. I always prefer the Airbus over Boeing as the seat seemed "larger and more comfortable". And indeed it was!

Food and drink wise, very good. I had made my order online and so the crew did not have to ask and served the food to us. They were tasty and nice and during our entire flight, crew kept on coming and asking if we required any more drinks or snacks and making sure we were "well fed". Kudos to the crew team, and of course they were very friendly and polite, not to mention efficient and smiles were always on their faces. 

Although the check-in and bording process were a little slow (not to blame on the airline itself but the local staff working attitudes and procedures), the service inflight was totally another story, it was outstanding!

It's a comfortable flight, and also a stable one too! Even my 80+ mum was very satisfied with the entire flight experience as she didn't like to fly.

It's good to be able to fly again and of course great to be back at the Business Class. Moving forward, in 2023, I have plans to travel more with the airlines and "it's a great way to fly, and whose service even other airlines talk about"!
label: positive

text:
from first to last minute it was a 5-star experience There is nothing negativ I could say about the flight. The crew was extremely friendly and helpful, also during the night flight there where 2 stewardess taking care of every whish, and this not only because it was their job, but with empathy.
Comfort and cleanlyness gave no reason for a complaint.
label: positive

text: Excellent in every way Everyone from check-in counter to crews is very friendly and genuine. The service is excellent and food tastes great compared to other airlines' I have flown. I can feel the airline really work hard to set themselves apart from competitors. They gave passengers warm towels in economy and premium economy class as well. Even though, we didn't order kids' meal on one of our flight, the crew came to offer us to serve the kids first. Little things like this goes a long way when it come to airline experience. I love Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Not bad Not much legroom, but otherwise not bad, my pre-ordered food was given to me way before anyone else got food, I loved that... I was really hungry
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines Strikes Again! Well well well… Singapore Airlines strikes again! 

After yet again another usual delayed flight with Singapore Airlines (FR208), from Heathrow to Singapore, the drinks service was non-existent, the only regular service was for business and premium economy classes. After almost dying of thirst, economy class passengers decided to start collecting their own drinks! Absolutely no effort was made by the captain to make up for lost time in the air, even though there was a tail wind for more than two thirds of the journey! 
This followed with a lack of communication between the Captain and the ground crew as a parking space for the aircraft had not been allocated on arrival,
causing further delays for passengers trying to disembark the aircraft for any further connection flights. Many passengers (about 45) had a connecting flight to bali from Singapore with the narrowest time window possible and yes of course the connection terminal was an early morning marathon as we all had to run from one side of the airport terminal  to get to the other side of a different terminal within Singapore airport. All 45 of us managed to board the connection flight but guess what…yes you guessed it…the baggage was not transferred to the flight ! Another outstanding stunt and lack of incompetence from Singapore Airlines. 
All 45 of us who were on the connecting flight are now on the other side of the world, after a 17 hour flight, with no luggage, having to buy clothes, shoes and toiletries out of our own pockets. Cheers Singapore Airlines, thank you so much for your lack of care, attention, support and customer service. You have ruined our holiday and cost us a lot of money. None of the 45  passengers with missing luggage are any wiser as to where our bags are, as you have washed your hands of speaking to any of us and have passed the blame onto someone else as usual. You do not care care for your passengers once you have had our money! 
PLEASE DO NOT FLY with SINGAPORE AIRLINES , unless you want to be treated like dirt. 
If there are any Singapore Airlines social media representatives out there who wish to manage their reputation by responding to this review with fake apologies, then please do not bother, instead, find our bags, compensate us for our expenses, ruined holiday and lost time. Do the right thing for a change and look after your passengers!
label: negative

text:
Premium Economy 13 hour flight First time I used the Premium Economy class on Singapore Airlines, chosen due to the long flight and me being not well suited to the small economy class seats for such a long flight.
The seats are a luxury compared to the economy class seats but still far from business class. As the trays are not mounted to the seat in front you could remain reclined whilst food is served and could remain asleep in requested.
Good leg room and the seats reclined back more than economy. 
Bigger tv screen and you get your own arm rests so no need to struggle with your neighbours. 
I upgraded to premium economy from economy class. My employer allows me to claim back economy flight tickets so I only personally paid the cost of the upgrade. For short flights of less than 6 hours I personally wouldn't bother to upgrade but the long flight made a world of difference.
It's by no means anywhere near a business class flight experience but better than economy.
Just depends if you feel you can justify the extra approximatley 30% higher price.
label: positive

text:
Positive feedback on services received in Singapore Airlines flight to Beijing We would like to share our positive experience while travelling in SQ 802 on 21 April 2019 ( A380) from Singapore to Beijing .

 The service received from the cabin crew in the upper deck was exemplary.  The team members Karrine Yap , Iver Tan and Alvin Tan were excellent and courteous. The service provided them is of a very high standard and should be an example for other crew members in any airlines. We would like to thank them for their fantastic hospitality and looking forward to similar services and experience.

 We would appreciate if you can pass on our sincere thanks to the above members of your cabin crew.
label: positive

text:
Excellent Airline I flew Singapore Airline for the first time a week ago and I must tell you I was impressed with the service.  I purchased a premium economy seat at the bulkhead window.  The seat was large and the recline was amazing.  When you couple that with a great foot rest, big pillow and blanket you can’t go wrong.  
They supplied noise cancelling headphones.  The movie, TV, game and podcast selections were fabulous.  They had a few of my favorites like Bohemian Rhapsody and Boston legal, not to mention Pac-Man.  This was a 17 hour flight from LAX to Singapore.  They served two large meals and passed through the cabin too many times to count with snacks (sandwich’s, fresh fruit, chips, candy bars).  They also supplied socks, a toothbrush and eye shades.  The bathrooms had mouthwash.  
Short of a first class bed, this is top notch.
label: positive

text:
Nice! I flew to Singapore with my family in 1964! We departed LHR from the Queens building and flew in a British Eagle Britannia turbo prop. It was my first ever flight and I still remember it to this day ... took almost 3 days and two stops. Roll on  almost 54 years...

Singapore Airlines A380 to Changi - departing T2 (Queens Building), completely new and have to say clean and efficient. SQ allows you to choose your seats at time of booking and there is no charge. I normally fly BA to Asia (2 or 3 times a year), but this time chose SQ because I got a bit of a bargin. PE seats there and back for a few quid more then Economy seats on BA.

From start to go the experience was an eye opener. Great seat, excellant service, meals very good. The cabin crew were round almost every hour with drinks and snacks. The difference with BA was night and day. They did thier best to keep everyone happy. I will definately fly SQ again. They deserve thier Best Airline rating.
label: positive

text:
Food not the greatest We have flown many airlines around the world and was looking forward to revisiting Singapore airlines as they had a new plane now in service from Adelaide.

The staff are lovely, there is no fault there.  As we were placed down the back (if you didn't pay extra to pick your seat on this already overpriced fare, being school holidays, the back is where you get placed) by the time the food got to us the best choice had already been taken and the only option was a fishy pasta with the most chewy, rubbery prawns I have ever had, which was disgusting.  I know airline food is not always the best but for the past 3 years of flying Qatar, Qantas, British Airways, American Airlines and more, this would have to be the worst.  My son was ordered a kids meal but was given an adults meal, which we didn't realise and then had to ask for his meal.

There is not too much leg room as with most planes, but the seats and entertainment were good.

On the flight coming home, it was supposed to leave Singapore at 11:10pm but was slightly delayed leaving.  They don't serve you anything, you have to press service to get drinks throughout the flight.  About 4:30am in the morning they wake everyone to eat an average meal.

The last time we flew with them (13 years ago) we were given a toothbrush, socks etc but nothing but a blanket and pillow this time.

If I was going to Europe again, it wouldn't be with Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Staff went over and above to help me During this 12-hour flight, I got my period, the toilets do have an amenities draw so I was able to utilise this. There was blood on my olive-green jeans that was very obvious. The staff of the flight gave me a dress to put on and then proceeded to clean the blood off my jeans. They did and then gave them back just as it was time to start preparing for landing. Who on earth would do this? The flight attendants were just so lovely and discreet. i cannot commend them enough for this as I had another 5-hour flight to go in my journey. Thank you ever so much Singapore Airlines, I highly recommend this airline for travel, economy was still very comfortable and we did no go hungry.
label: positive

text: Economy is not my favourite Could not fault the service.   Everything clean. Staff helpful.  Bathroom clean (tick). Food was okay.  Have not flown Singapore for about 15 years and I think the food was better last time.
label: positive

text: First time We chose Singapore because it had the friendliest flight times. It was a flight of two halves, SQ51 Manchester to Singapore was great with good service and good food. SQ245 Singapore to Brisbane was rather chaotic with haphazard service and yukky dried up food. How does that happen with the sane airline? Both planes were relatively new, very spacious and comfy.
label: positive

text: 5 STAR CUSTOMER SERVICE, AWARD WINNING FLIGHTS Easy to contact Customer Services with queries, and received a phone call from them to organise extra leg room seats (amazing!).  Check in for both flights quick, no queues and friendly staff. All on time, and landed earlier on both flights.  On board staff were exceptional - attentive and welcoming, and nothing too much trouble. the best airline food we have ever had.  Even arranged an anniversary cake with champagne for our return flight home.  Entertainment on board was varied and easy to navigate.  Toilets immaculate at all times.  No wonder they won Airline of the Year.  Virgin and BA  could learn a lot.   Awesome!
label: positive

text:
Express To or from Singa is the same. It should be counted as a express flight as it’s just over 6 hours either way.
They were supposed to serve us ‘lunch’ at midnight Singa time? Staff seemed a little disorganised with a new employee and a casual approach on way back to adelaide. Pretty standard run I guess - for them!
label: positive

text:
So disappointed I was happy to travel with SQ as it was one of the top airline. The advertisement shows always business or first. But for this trip I traveled in economy. I was surprised by the old plane A330. The Seat was uncomfortable and no space for legs. I am not a tall guy!! Impossible to touch the small meal. The only good thing is the air hostess with great smile. But a smile is not enough to satisfy a passenger. 
Next trip I will go Bangkok. Let see how will be SQ
label: negative

text: Very good airline Flew London to Manila rerun as family of 4.All flights on time,food and drinks good,great entertainment options,free wifi which worked some of the time,staff give good service,leg room ok,Singapore good stopoff airport ,all in all a very good airline
label: positive

text:
Additional Singapore Airlines Premium Economy Review Posted a review 2 weeks ago from SFO to HKG. This is the return flight from HKG to SFO. The previous flight didn't give me a pleasure experience. One of the reason is the flight is fulled, somehow it affected the service quality. This time, the flight is only half fulled so it's quite a different. 

I can occupied the whole row with 4 seats. Much more room for me, and I can slept across 3 seats that get me have 6 hours + sleep.

The book the chef meal quality is about same as before. Foods taste so-so, the snacks offer seemed better, also the flight attendants are much more friendly and helpful during the flight.

Otherwise, the priority boarding and baggage handling are good as before.

In addition so glad to see that the air mileage added to my account quickly within few days.

Overall, I will be glad to flight with Singapore Airlines again but better choose a good timing that have a better pleasure flight.
label: positive

text:
Overnight flight My wife, 2 year old son and I flew to Cape Town from Singapore, with a stop over in Johannesburg for an hour.

We were disappointingly underwhelmed by the experience. We were expecting so much more for the premium economy experience considering the level of quality they deliver in Business Class.

It was essentially flying economy class with a different seat. The food and beverage were average with small servings and served in cardboard boxes and plastic cups.

The seat, even though having one of the smallest pitch for that class in the industry, was quite comfortable, and we are able to get a reasonable sleep.

The inflight entertainment was suitable, but was turned on quite late, and unavailable for the hour we were on the aircraft in Johannesburg.

We would consider other options before flying premium economy with Singapore again.
label: negative

text: Excellent Service The Staff at Singapore airlines are all excellent, they go above and beyond to help customers especially families with kids, we choose to fly Singapore airlines as they always exceeds our expectations, not only the air hostess cater to all our needs but the airport staff also take excellent care of us and make sure that all our needs are met as we have two kids with Autism, i don't have words to describe their level of service, that is why whenever we fly each time abroad, we always fly via Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: Deserves its reputation as one of World’s Best Airlines Flying on an Airbus 380 with Singapore Airlines in Business Class is what I imagine travel with airlines was like 50 years ago in their golden age- only better. Legendary Singapore Air flight attendants live up to their reputation - beautiful people, men and women, who display great poise and are wonderful hosts. Seating in business class is st least a step or two above that of most other airlines. B-class seats are almost 2x the width of Delta One or United business class. And they turn into true lay flat beds, more than just fully reclining seats. And yes, the food. It’s really good, truly gourmet. In summary, it you have the choice to fly business class on Singapore air, and if the prices are even close to the same class of travel on other airlines, go for it- you won’t be disappointed.
label: positive

text: Great experience We had a very pleasant flight from London to Singapore. Service was attentive and the food pleasant. The cabin staff had discovered that we were celebrating a wedding anniversary and presented us with a congratulatory cake and bubbles. All in all a very enjoyable experience.
label: positive

text: RETURNING FROM SAN FRANCISCO VIA HONGKONG Everything was exceptionally fine.Food was good.Air Hostesses were helpful.The flight was on time.Economy class need improvement.
label: positive

text: A bit cramped Flew on the A350 which I can’t really say I’m a fan of. I’m only 5’8 but there is very little leg room on these planes.
label: positive

text:
Seriously among the best It's difficult to praise Singapore Airlines as much as it deserves. It has more than earned every single good review and definitely its spot among the best airlines out there.
New planes, comfortable seats even in Economy class, huge and diversified selection for in-flight entertainment, attentive staff (both ground and flight crew), good meals and no shortage of snacks in between them... The list goes on and on.
Keep up the good job, SIA. You're setting the bar high.
label: positive

text:
First time long haul traveller  I had my first experience with Singapore Airlines, I was going on my first Tour Group hoilday to Thailand. 
I loved Singapore airlines, the staff were lovely and helpful,  food was ok with 2 choices for dinner, I had breakfast and Dinner. Comfy seats with a pillow and blanket, hot towels before take off and landing, toilets were clean. 
A truly memorable experience.
label: positive

text: World Class Comfortable flight and excellent service. The flight attendants are polite and helpful. Will recommend/
label: positive

text:
Fantastic Service Despite a 6 Hour Delay. My first time traveling on Singapore Airlines suite class, and unfortunately there was a 6 hour delay because of a fueling issue. In spite of that, the entire travel experience was still memorable because of the incredible service and luxury. The crew was most understanding and apologetic and upon re-boarding, they had everything prepared for me to rest as soon as possible, then have a great meal before landing. Needless to say, the suite was fantastic, even if it was the older version. I felt as if I was traveling on my own jet. Helped a lot too, that there was only one other suite class passenger in the cabin.

PS: Praise must be given to the SQ First Class Lounge staff, who went over and beyond to ensure I was comfortable during the 6 hour wait.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Flight experience Singapore airlines is my preferred airline due to the experience you get when on board.
The recent experience in my Delhi to Singapore Flight was outstanding.
Zhang Yi the crew member was very caring and worked tirelessly with a smile. Provided regular drinks kept everyone hydrated and all with a big smile.
Well done Zhang the experience you provided stays as pleasant memory.
label: positive

text:
Best Airline 2018 I flew round trip from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to Zurich, Switzerland because I got a good promo deal. I was so impressed that this year I decided to fly to Italy again on SIA. It was a bit pricey (compared with a few other airlines) because I went during peak and also it was a weekend flight. It was worth it! Flight schedule suited me. I flew to Milan first, then went to Florence and Venice by trains. Embarked on a cruise from Venice which ended in Rome. Flew out of Italy from Rome. 
Even though I flew economy class, the seats were wide enough and spacious leg room. Service was good. There is an "in between meals" snack menu so I was never hungry. Anytime throughout the flight, you can ask for sandwiches, biscuits, nuts, chips, apples or instant noodles.
label: positive

text:
Best flight I have taken! We wanted to try the Singapore Airlines flight to NYC so we booked on this flight which seems to have only Premium Economy seatings.
The seats were great and legroom adequate. Service by the flight attendants were great as usual.
The in-flight entertainment was a great help as other than sleeping, not much you can do on the plane (to anywhere for that matter).
Will fly this route and airline again!
label: positive

text: Best Global Airline I have been a loyal SQ customer since I moved to Singapore over 25 years ago. In that time, Singapore Airlines has only gotten better year to year. The crew are the best I've ever flown with, helpful, always smiling, organized and relaxed boarding, fantastic media access, wi-fi. great equipment, clean comfortable cabins/seatts, arrival/departures always timely...I can go on and on! Of course there is a bit of premium over other airlines but then there is no apple for apple comparison.
label: positive

text:
How did they get Best Airline?? We flew Singapore Airlines flight SQ236 Brisbane to Singapore return, in business class. Honestly we have had better service on Jetstar economy.
The Singapore lounge in Brisbane was nice , small but modern and clean with great staff and that’s about the only good thing I could say regarding staff, once we hit the air it was downhill . 
The A350 is a nice plane, seats are wide and comfortable , but for $6000 a return ticket you would expect some service. We booked the cook pre flights , the meal was served mine and my husbands meals 45 mins apart. No drinks were offered during the meal service. 
I requested water and waited for 25 mins until I had to flag down an attendant and wait again.
The return flight service was just as bad , the staff look annoyed to be there.
Breakfast was not served flying into Brisbane and it seemed a bother to ask for a coffee.
If you could have the plane and swap the staff over with any budget carrier it might be ok.
Seriously rude staff, no amenities kits in business , wi fi didn’t work , dirty toilets.
Save your money and fly a budget carrier you will get the same service . 
Singapore is going downhill , charging for a presumed level of service you won’t get .
label: negative

text: Good flight Flew Singapore Airline Premium economy, the service was really good friendly and efficient. Really a good quality of service with good quality food. The seats are good and more space available. All in all a good experience
label: positive

text: Is Singapore Airlines Losing Its Edge???? Not sure if this was a one off but cabin service in economy was always superior to the other airlines food, service. However, on this flight it was clear some of the attendants did not want to come to work that day, one male attendant looked as though he was in a fowl mood and did not smile and was grumpy to traveler. I think his attitude rubbed off on some of the other crew as there was no smile on this flight, most unusual for Singapore Airline. Maybe it was just a one off the flight out was better, however, maybe Singapore has dropped the ball as there fell to No. 2 spot in rankings this year losing out to Qatar Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Terrible experience for Senior Citizens We have been traveling by Singapore airlines for the past 3 years and their service has always been great. Based on this experience, we decided to book our parents on this airline. Unfortunately, they had a terrible experience in Sydney. They were requested to stay in the flight till the wheelchairs arrived at the Sydney airport. But when the wheelchairs arrived and they sat on it, they were asked to get up and walk. This was completely unexpected and an insulting experience. Please make sure you hire people with the right attitude and who knows how to treat senior citizens with respect.
label: negative

text: First time flying Singapore Airlines We enjoyed our flight with Singapore airlines. The checkin was easy and the staff very friendly and helpful. We had a bit of a delay but were kept informed and the reasons explained. My husband is mobility impaired and staff ensured he boarded the plane first. The flight was not full so we had plenty of room with an empty seat between us.  Staff were smart and professional throughout the flight. Food and entertainment very good.
label: positive

text:
Better than others I heard a lot of good things about SQ from friends, family and office colleges. Experiencing SQ by myself really showed me that your airline is even in Eco a class better than others. 
The crew is extremely friendly, smiling and helpful. Even in the final hours of a stressful 12 hour flight. There is enough food and drinks. Also the crew was not tight on giving alcoholic drinks (this is what you want in vacation haha). Also a full and delicious meal on a 2 hour flight from/to DPS is just awesome compared to European carriers.Regarding cleanliness, I have never seen a cleaner long haul plane than this. The crew cleaned the restrooms all the time and refilled papers. Also, the crew kept an eye on cleanliness of the galley and aisle and removed papers or whatever trash was on the floor. I have not seen this before.
The IFE is basically perfect. The selection of movie, TV shows and music outstanding, also the program is up to date and the touch screen is very responsive.
Last but not least, the A380 is an awesome aircraft from a passengers perspective and offer the ultimate comfort for modern day longhaul trips. 
I will definitely choose SQ again rather than other carriers.
label: positive

text: first time but not the last First time flying Singapore Airlines.   The plane was an Airbus; good leg room in Economy seating; the free headphones were much better than the ones on other airlines.    Entertainment selection was good - listened to a BB King album, then George Michael.  Didn't watch any movies because it was a short flight, but there was a pretty good choice in different genres.s  The lunch was tasty - rice with ginger pork and chocolate ice cream for dessert.  Gate and cabin crews friendly and efficient.
label: positive

text: Good flight A360 nice to fly in Staff very pleasant, service was good, food was a good standard. Smooth flight A360 nice and quiet to travel in.
label: positive

text:
Best Way to Fly So glad that Singapore Airlines resumed it’s direct flights from Singapore to New York and back. The journey was smooth and seamless, always love the inflight service - Warm Asian hospitality, great wine selections and good food. Comfortable seats but service amazing. Great movie selection too. 

I love Singapore Airlines. ❤️
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline I had never flown  with Singapore  Airlines before now, but i can say its one of the best. The cabin crew were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble. The food was fine and the coffee was hot. The inflight entertainment would be my only complaint. There was not much to watch at all. Overall it was great.
label: positive

text:
disappointed with singapore airlines. Food  was  deplorable.      Reciprocity   non  existent  at  singapore lounge  for
virgin  gold/ platinum members.    Informed as on economy ticket no entrance to lounge.
In phuket with  local singapore airline also denied entry to lounge.
Took  forever  to disembark aircraft in sydney.
In flight movie selection was  limited.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Ruined All Other Airlines. I have flown Singapore for the first time in 2018 from JFK to Singapore with a short stop in Germany. It was a very long flight but I really did not mind it. Actually, it was really good.  This January, I couldn't find a cheap flight so I flew Cathay from JFK to Hongkong (heading to Philippines on both flights). It was like night and day. I'm traveling again in April so I picked Singapore this time. I think Singapore ruined all other airlines for me. The FA's are so friendly, neat looking, very courteous, clean restroom, and the food taste very good. Service is first class, even in economy.
label: positive

text:
Holiday Flight was on time check in was easy happy flight attendants had two seats together in the centre but would not have mattered where you sat all seats where good service was good with good bar service and food lots of movies to choose from but a lot where old . 
Ear phones on board where not much good had three pieces to choose from that kept coming apart .
Blankets where thin and not soft need replacements badly but over all a good flight would book again if it was a good price if not look for another airline.
label: positive

text: Best airline  I have travelled on other airlines and to me , Singapore Airlines is the best! The excellent cabin crew service, extensive inflight entertainment, toilets are clean, reasonable selection of beverages offered.
label: positive

text: Excellent Food and Service Superb service and food.  Always addressed by name which is very much appreciated.  Great flat bed for sleeping,  find the angle a little more awkward for sitting up, but the seat itself is lovely and wide.
label: positive

text: legroom nice but food isn't sufficient and crew doesn't look happy while serving The flight is nice with respect to legroom and cleanliness. They provide inadequate food in the flight. Even asking an extra butter by another passenger was responded as unavailable. They are highly limited with food and drinks. The crew also don't service happily instead they get agitated if you raise the light and ask them something. Good if you want to just travel from a source and destination without concerns on food or how crew behaves but not a good overall flight experience.
label: negative

text: Excellent service, comfortable flight, timely and smooth arrival Was with my family for a holiday in tokyo.   Took the  SQ flight.   Was greeted warmly by the SQ crews.   Food and service  by the crews were fantastic.  Enjoyed the seating arrangement whereby the inflight service is superb and comfortable. Took other airlines before, still prefer Singapore Airlines.  In terms of service, flight arrival and departure which is often on time,  food quality etc; compared to other airlines,  still prefer SQ. Well done to all the crews👍
label: positive

text:
The best airline in entire Asia Singapore airlines is one of the best and for just one reason. They actually are. Be it their aircraft, punctuality, service, check-in they are just better than everyone else. The seats are spacious and never uncomfortable for the 6ft tall person like me.

I would recommend to fly it every time you wanna travel and have a possibility to transit through Singapore.
label: positive

text: Great Airline! Ended up bidding for the upgrade on premium economy, and ended up getting it for $245/person. Totally worth it as we were able to pre book our meal through Cook the Book. Also, seat reclined pretty far back, the footrest extended out, and the bulkhead on row 31 was real nice. Super service, clean aircraft, and great legroom.
label: positive

text:
SQ877 The flight is delayed from Singapore. The boarding is quite smooth. The meal is served but without drink. Always has to ask.
Flight landed smoothly, and reach the bag belt quite fast. But bag take a long time to retrieve it.
label: neutral

text: Great airline  We flew to and from Bali with Singapore airlines flying from Tokyo/Japan! It was so nice getting the hot towels to freshen up and the meals were delicious and very filling! On our way to Bali the flight from Singapore to Bali was short and sharp the flight attendant was rushing we felt sorry for her! Then on our way home we got the partner airline silk air to Singapore this was a little disappointing as there wasn’t any entertainment but it was a short flight so that was okay. The flight was delayed I think due to Bali airport but the airline gave us a little food voucher to use in the airport at Singapore while we waited for our new flight that was rescheduled (3 hours was all we were behind so not bad)  and then from Singapore to Tokyo was amazing the best plane we had been on! It had nice TVs with very recent movies and it was a great experience to finish our holiday on! The options of food were amazing again and the flight attendant was so kind he gave us a few fizzy drinks and topped us up rather then just 1 cup like some airlines! Would definitely recommend Singapore airlines to people! Thanks so much for the great experience!
label: positive

text: Be happy if you never have to talk to a Singapore Airlines Customer Service representative Had to rebook my Business class flight and called Customer Service 5 times - and received 5 different answers. After call2, I asked for a summary of agreed actions of the call, which I was refund. Calling back, as Singapore was still not able to rebook me, I received completely different information about rebooking opportunities. Flying Singapore Airlines is joy, having to discuss any issues with a customer service representative a clear disaster!!!! Never again!
label: negative

text: The way flying used to feel I enjoyed my 24+ hour (per leg) flight with Singapore Airlines. From the pleasant hospitality, to the helpful crew, this flight was no problem even though it spanned so many hours with 2 layovers and 3 countries. From the hot towel at the beginning of the flight, to the continual beverage service, to the mid-flight snacks and meals, Singapore Airlines is definitely the way to fly on such long-haul trips. Thank you Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text:
Singapore airlines luxury! This was an upgrade we considered for a long flight from Amsterdam to Brisbane for some time before committing, and I am pleased to say this was a great choice, it was the most enjoyable long haul flight either of us had ever experienced. 
The seating is one plus one, no pesky middles with elbow wars... all very comfortable, and quite easy to sleep (if you feel the need).  The entertainment system allows time to drift away, and without doubt this is helped along significantly by the noise cancelling headphones supplied.  The A350 is a little louder than an A380 - not too bad though, and the majority of the flight I had headphones glued to my scone.  Definitely did not feel any noise issues, with or without the headset.  
In flight food was very good without quite being up to the Emirates gold standard.
Our final leg of the trip involved a switch to the front seats in this premium block, while still very comfortable, the screens are a little more distant, so what you gain in legroom you lose in entertainment standard, this worked in well anyway as I needed some beauty sleep, I am after all only here as eye candy.  
On the whole, an excellent trip, and well worth the upgrade.
label: positive

text: Ok, but overrated this time Started at airport when the ground staff tried to scammed me with overweight, i said im allowed to bring 40 kilo in business,the wieght scale desk counter was totaly wrong calibrated,and i told them when i showed my hand weight scale and they said i was wrong, and i told to check in another desk and there it was i told them 40 kilo exactly,pls how hard can it be to calibrate the weight scale, and wonder how many they scammed,the flight from Bangkok to Singapore was also a plane change with no flat bed, from Singapore to Copenhagen i felt the staff was stressed to give the food as quickly as they could so they could go sleep, no fill up red wine and no whisky to the dessert,, so nope it fails to be one of the best aircomp in the world will not book again,the wifi didnt work so No No
label: negative

text: Best airline in the sky Have flown many times with Singapore airlines and many others on long haul flights. Without a doubt the best airline in the sky.
label: positive

text:
Travel to Bali Fantastic flight. Couldn't fault in any way.
Looking forward to flight home (even though would like to stay longer).
label: positive

text: Good Trip Flight was good despite all the typhoons that were around the region. Good flight with no bumps. Service was good.
label: positive

text: Service, food, entertainment excellent Great airline.  Cabin crew could not be better.  Very good food, good choice of entertainment.  Aircraft itself was young model, very comfortable.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines - Adelaide to Singapore (Changi) Business Class On arrival at Adelaide Airport, the check-in staff we helpful and as a business class traveler received priority express check-in at the airport. Once clearing the security checkpoint at Adelaide airport i was able to quickly approach the immigration area. There was a priority express immigration lane for business travelers and i was the first traveler through immigration and into the secure international departures. Once you clear immigration you have access to a duty-free shop. The Singapore airport lounge at Adelaide Airport is small but has everything you need. There are drinks and a small selection of food. Access to the lounge is via a set of escalators down to the lower level. At the bottom of the escalators turn left and the lounge is right in front of you. When it was time to board, i left the lounge and headed straight to the gate and again received priority boarding past all the other travelers waiting in line to board the plane. Once on board it was a very comfortable flight. The flight was aboard A350-900 (9v-shd) which only entered service at the end of January 2019 so was all of 4 months old. The air crew were all very hosptiable and the food and drink service was very good. This new plane had a large touch screen with a very good selection of movies and tv shows. This is connected to a touch screen remote so you can access your media selections while reclined. There was a single mains outlet for any power you may need (laptop) and 2 x USB charging ports too, which i found very helpful. There was also on-board wi-fi for business travelers which was great. There is a complimentary 30MB of data which lasted me about half of the 7 hour journey. There is the option to buy more data for a small fee, but i opted not to use this. The aircraft had approximately 40 business class seats in a 1-2-1 configuration and only about 50% of the seats were occupied. I purchased my return ticket on sale in March 2019 for approximately $3000 AUD. Baggage allowance permits 40kg checked bag and 2 x cabin bags of 7kg each. Check-in staff did way the cabin baggage at check-in, which i thought was a little surprising, but although one bag was over the 7kg, the other was not and they were happy for me to leave items as they were and just suggested i remove my lap-top from the heavier bag when boarding. 

On arrival in Singapore the disembarking process was excellent. Within 30 minutes of touch-down, we had taxied to the gate, disembarked, cleared customs, collected bags and checked into my airport hotel (Crowne Plaza). Such a quick and painless process. Highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Still one of the better economy class seats People often expect to be provided the best service on Singapore Airlines, but feel that its service standards are not met in economy class. Definitely you cannot expect business class service while paying only 20% of the price. Product-wise it is still one of the best economy seats on the Boeing B777 are comfortable, but is smaller than the Airbus A380 on the alternate schedule. When the person in front of you reclines their seat, the back of the seat can get too close for comfort if you are watching a movie. In-flight entertainment is where Singapore Airlines shines, with various genres of movies, TV dramas and variety shows on the menu.
label: positive

text: Great service Really great personalised and friendly service. Anything you can need is on hand or as I did you can just pull on an eye mask and get some sleep. Excellent professional service that arrived early
label: positive

text: to fly, to serve OK, I know the above title is BA's tag line but in the case of Singapore Airlines it really feels sincere and authentic, at least at the front of the plane. The welcome, attention and recognition is quite extraordinary compared to Britain's flag carrier. Sure, prices are higher but the difference in customer experience is palpable at all levels - from the priority boarding which really differentiates and works, through the (old fashioned) provision of newspapers and periodicals on board and the outstanding service, to the quality of the offering in terms of seating space/equipment and the quality of the products (Dom Perignon for example - BA used to have Krug, now it's Perrier-Jouet). Is everything perfect ? No, for instance in the take-off/landing position I found the seats rather uncomfortable even if they're roomy but overall SQ is a class apart and it starts with the crew who come across as really caring about the passengers by comparison to the hit and miss standards of some BA flight staff nowadays.
label: positive

text: Very disappointed with the new A350 and premium ecconomy Last time I reviewed Singapore Airlines I gave them a excellent for their service and business class product. This time I tried their premium economy and what a huge disappointment. I can't for the life of me see where they can justify twice the price of economy for very little extra. Leg room is no better than the exit row in economy, seat room is slightly more than economy, service no better than economy and unlike other airlines there's no pre-takeoff drink. You do get noise cancelling headphones, (At that price though I'd rather use my own). You walk back through economy to use their toilet's, (what few there are), You aren't separated from economy as you are from Business. I experienced the same on the onward leg from Singapore to London on their A380. Use Air New Zealand for premium economy as they set the standard by being rated the best in that class. Honestly, never again. I'll avoid Singapore Air until it matches or betters Airlines like Air New Zealand, Cathay Pacific, Quantas, (Yes even Quantas).
label: neutral

text:
Rude ground handling, especially for my kids. This was the most traumatizing experiences with an airline for my family, especially for my two kids. 

On that day, it was our last day in Netherland after I finished my study there and we will leave for good. I already counted my luggages (many luggages) both checked in and cabin. All based on our past experiences with different major airlines i.e. Etihad, KLM, Emirates, Garuda, ANA Air, Qatar Airline, etc. That we will be okay.

So, at the airport as per our calculation all the checked baggages went it without problem. The rest is the cabin baggage, which were 1 cabin suitcase and 1 handcarry for each person (with additional kids backpack, for each of my kid). So, all went well until we were at the boarding gate. The ground officer there (male officer) said rudely that: "what are you thinking? Bringing that many luggages to the cabin?" And then he try weighing all my luggages based on his "instinct" and said that we overweight 30 kilos and must pay 856 Euro. I start panicked, my wife crying, my kids crying. So I choose to throw away all those luggages ans board the plane. But then, after almost entering the plane, they came chased us and yelled I cannot throw my luggages like that. So how I am supposed to do?!?!?! Then, I choose to pay. I had 400 euro in my saving and the rest by cash, so it should be enough. But then, they said they cannot accept debit and/or cash, only credit card! At that time my credit card was not enough to cover that amount. So ultimately, we were kicked out and all of our checked baggages were dropped off. Our flight then re-scheduled to the next day (thanks to the nice lady).

So, we sorted everything and throw away many important goods, memento from our life in Netherlands, etc. We wnet again to check in and met again with the male ground handling officer. All the baggages checked in and now they wanted to see our cabin carry on, we were treated like a criminal, my kids were scared to death. After long check, the male officer was pointing at my kids backpack, said that those too already too much for a cabin carry on, I mean...its just a 5 and 8 years kids backpack for god sakes! And, so I told the kids that we must throw their backpacks away. So we did that. Then we went through the boarding process all over again. We were separated from the rest of customer by the same male officer, again, like we were a criminal. He test each of our cabin baggage again with his instinct, after long tiring process, we can board the plain.

Interesting fact was, when we transit in Changi, we saw several person that brought three items to the plane, cabin suitcase, backpack and carry on bag (one of them I manage to took the picture). So where is the absolute strictness of 1 person 1 cabin baggage gone? Is it only applied to specific country, or what? So, I just told my children that I will get them a new bag, better than the bags they forced to threw away and also promised them that we will not fly with Singapore airlines again, ever.
label: negative

text: relaxing journey excellent service and staff fulfilled all our expectations. nothing was to much trouble. food and wine selection was great. had a good sleep between Singapore and Manchester.
label: positive

text: Smooth and easy, treated like a VIP Singapore Airlines treat every customer like a VIP. We sit, we are given a lovely warm towel to clean hands and face. Nothing is too difficult. The crew are polite, serene and they serve with deference and charm. A truly special experience.
label: positive

text: Customer Service Is Worthless Don't worry about contacting the airline because the dont exist. They have no customer service and don't care about anyone flying. I tried to change a flight and after spending more than 3 hours twice I never reached an agent. Just know that once you book your flight than you can't change anything ever. They don't have any customer service at all and will never take your call. I will never ever book with this airline again.
label: negative

text: Great flight Took this 18 hours direct flight back to singapore with family and relatives. Flight  depart on time and check in was smooth. seat reclining was really comfortable and leg room was good. Meal menu was awesome and wine selection were also plentiful. As this is a new A350 ultra, everything is new and cleanliness was tip top condition. SIA cabin crews always outperformed when it comes to service. Slept really well on this long flight without much disturbance. Pilot’s take off and landing’s skill was amazing .... make me felt real safe and willing to recommend all to take SIA. Try to book early to get a cheaper fare if you want to fly with SIA cuz i realized my fare doubled a month before the departure compared to when i bought few months earlier.
label: positive

text:
4.5/5 Safety: 5/5
Cleanliness: 5/5
Customer Service: 5/5
Quality of Food: 4/5
Value for Money: 5/5

SIA has always been my preferred airline worldwide, primarily for its safety track record. This time around we flew with our toddler of 16 months, and the ride was very manageable due to the friendly service staff, they were a great help to the 7-hour ride on the plane with a toddler. Kudos to the team!
label: positive

text:
No longer the best in the World My wife and I have recently returned from a trip to Cairns, QLD via Singapore with Singapore Airlines:

12/11/19 - LHR - SIN - SQ317
20/11/19 - SIN - CNS - SQ5339 (MIxxx) Operated by Silk Air
18/12/18 - CNS - SIN - SQ5340 (MI814) Operated by Silk Air
19/12/19 - SIN - LHR - SQ 306

Once upon a time Singapore Airlines had no competition in quality of service and in particular their inflight service. Having flown with them twice previously in the early 90's I have first hand knowledge of this.
Unfortunately, this is no longer the case, they are middle of the road at best and their Silk Air affiliate is at best a budget airline, and that’s saying something. 
I must point out that the aircraft and cabin/flight crew were excellent, one would expect nothing less from and international carrier. The problem lies with their inflight service, McDonalds would have been better, and I’m a vegetarian and there lies their problem. 
My wife and I are both Vegetarian (for health and NOT moral reasons) yet Singapore Air do not offer a Vegetarian in flight meal, they off a Vegan option - THIS IS NOT VEGETARIAN - I give the following example, on the Silk Air flight both to and from Cairns QLD whilst everyone one around us was being offered a Muffin and Small Cake we were give a dry, slightly stale bread roll, hmmmm.
So come on Singapore Air, get your act together, review your inflight service and offer some decent Vegetarian Food.
My final point relates to Silk Air inflight Audio/Video, if you don’t have a tablet or smart phone you just sit there for 6+ hours.
label: neutral

text: Great one way but failed us on return Wonderful service on our trip out to New Zealand via Singapore, flight left and arrived on time, check in was easy and smooth. Sadly, Singapore cancelled their flights from Christchurch, NZ, before we were due to leave due to the pandemic and we're still waiting for a refund (2 months on). If not for this, we would mark them up to 5 stars.
label: positive

text:
4 flights in 26 days! We had 4 different fligts in our trip to Turkey and found  Singapore Airlines to be first class with more leg room, fabulous staff who ensured all needs we met promptly and without a smile. Drinks were provided on a regular basis ensuring all arrived refreshed and hydrated.
Meals were served hot and enough variety for most palates. 
Thanks for the experience and will ensure we fly with Singapore Airlines in the future.
label: positive

text: smooth flight flight from singapore to shanghai was smooth, aboard the new plane - leg space was the same, but the new touch screen entertainment system was pretty cool
label: positive

text:
Nice flight from HKG to CHC We recently flew to Christchurch, New Zealand with Singapore Airline with a layover in Singapore. The flights were good across the board. 

Flights were booked online at the Singapore Airline website, email confirmations were received in a timely manner. Check-in at HKG was quick and easy. 

Our first flight between HKG and SIN departed and arrived on time and was comfortable. In-flight meal was ok, movies and other entertainment fine for a 3 hour flight. 

Layover at Changi Airport was as good as it gets. This is a great airport when it comes departure area and in-transit experiences. Orchard gardens, butterfly gardens, koi ponds, Osim chairs and other comfortable seating throughout the various terminals makes for a relaxing place to await outbound flights leaving Changi Airport. 

Our second flight from SIN to CHC was really good. Departure and arrivals were on time. Seats comfortable with plenty of leg space, allowing decent rest during the long flight. We slept surprisingly well during the flight. Meals served were decent, in-flight entertainment was sufficient with a good mix of movies and TV shows. 

Immigration processing was quick in Christchurch, luggage was received no longer then 20-25 minutes after we had disembarked, customs were cleared and we were picking up our rental vehicle in no longer than 40-45 minutes after arriving. 

Overall, this was a seamless and good overall flight experience with Singapore Airline.
label: positive

text: Amazing customer service This was the first time flying with Singapore Airlines and was very impressed. Flight attendants were very accommodating. I wasn't feeling well and didn't take a meal during serving time and they checked up on me a few times to ask me if I wanted something to eat during the flight.  Lots of leg room and in flight entertainment was good. I would highly recommend.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable flight comfortable seats, amazing service with drinks and fab food. Proper cutlery. 
Good films, excellent staff.. Would def fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Bad costumer service Very disappointed for the costumer service staff and help. We will don’t used this airlines anymore after this situation covid-19 getting better.
label: negative

text: Europe holiday Staff on Singapore Airlines is very professional. They are efficient attentive and very energetic. The meals are served quickly and very tasty. Toilet areas are frequently refreshed.
label: positive

text:
Best Flight to Hong Kong Bought my flight in December and it was a steal. That said there was no compromise on service and my family and I was well taken care of.

Enjoyed the flight.
label: positive

text: Surprised by the service for a long haul flight This is not the first time I took SQ for a long haul flight. But this is definitely the first time I have experienced such poor service on board. I do understand that there are definitely new steward/stewardess every year. I believe there would be ample training for them before they started to fly. But I don't know if they are the new stewardess or have been there for some time. There are about 2 main meal serving and 1 teabreak serving. I can understand if you make mistakes for the 1st meal serving. However, each serving was either short of some cutlery or the food was taken wrongly, or the stewardess were busy entertaining themselves while serving. It just makes my whole journey unpleasant. I also do understand that the walkway is a bit small and these stewardess can bump here and there. I don't see it in any other flight, at least. Everyone said it's the best, and I thought I should give a chance again. But, each flight in SQ just make me regret more.
label: neutral

text: coz i am a Filipino? i wonder why other nationalities were given and rendered more special treatments than me - I am a Filipino,  the cabin crew didn't even dare to ask me if i wanted a drink
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Can only congratulate Singapore Airlines on the great service. Soon after take off we were offered warm moist towels to refresh with. Followed closely by a snack pack and a drink. At regular intervals between meals the staff came through the plane with juice or water.  We can’t fault the meals they were great and nicely presented. We were also given a menu to read not long after boarding. At all times the staff were well presented and only too willing to help should it be needed. Even in economy the service appeared to be the same standard as Premium a Economy. Well done Singapore Airlines we appreciated your service.
label: negative

text: Charged twice for the extra bag This is our worst experience. We booked and extra baggage via online and paid for it. But the online system doesn't show that. We called customer care, and they assured us the booking went through and we won't be charged. But at airport they denied any booking and again charged us for the bag and told us to sort out the issue with customer care. We called the customer care multiple times and everytime we have to describe the. exact same thing and they ask for receipt and documents. We upload and they assured us we will be refunded. I AM NEVER FLYING WITH SINGAPORE AIRLINNES AGAIN, BAD SERVICE IS ONE THING, BUT THEY ARE SCAMMING PEOPLE FOR EXTRA MONEY.
label: negative

text: Excellent service The cabin crew was very customer oriented. Very convenient flight. A380. Food was excellent. We were very comfortable. But their boarding procedures at the gate was real messy. Always it is better to get a seat in the front zones.
label: positive

text:
