Safe flight to Shenzhen Took this flight to Shenzhen. Overall the service is good. The stewardess were very helpful. They tried their best to offer vegetarian food to a few monks on flight as prior to that they did not indicate their needs. 

However for tall European, economy will not be suitable as there are really little leg space. Even small size person like me find it challenging to move out.

The video clip that they plaued are quite nice though.
label: positive

text: EXCELLENT SERVICE AND GREAT FOOD I always enjoy the service on Singapore Airlines. I love the hot hand towels. The food was really good and flavoursome. I flew AKL-SIN-PAR then back again and I had no trouble on any of the flights. A very pleasant long haul journey.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline great serviece Travelled for a Christmas break in Singapore and then onto Perth. Flights were all on time. the A380 LHR to SIN was clean and comfortable. Last time we flew we were able to book the upstairs economy cabin, sadly seems this is not available anymore. Smooth flight and great service. Stopover in Singapore was worth it, 787 flight SIN to PER seats not so comfy. On the return journey we went straight though, the 13 hours SIN to LHR is gruelling but service again was attentive which made it a bit easier. We have flown this journey before with Singapore Airlines and would do so again. We booked our flights way in advance so cost was comparable to other airlines.
label: positive

text:
Makes Jetstar look like a1st class Airline Airbus 350-900 the latest cattle truck employed by Singapore Airlines. The economy section has the most uncomfortable cramped cabin of any plane in their fleet. SA has gone from one of the best airlines to a standard of a budget airline. Leg space has been reduced dramatically, seat width cut drastically, armrests... the next air rage front as one battles to share  the 25 mm wide armrest with your neighbouring passenger. The seats are the most uncomfortable I have experienced....like sitting on wooden bench....something that a Monk might  be forced to sit on as a penance. Over the course of a 13 hour flight I got an extremely sore bottom.
If you want an exit row seat then you have to pay up to US$120 per leg
To travel from Italy to Australia SQ245/246/355/356 return cost us an extra US$600 as I am 6ft 3in and in a normal seat my knees hit against the seat in front. In a flight the year before I had my knees gashed as the passenger in the seat in front slammed their seat fully back. I yelled in extreme pain called the cabin staff  and attendant said that the person in front was fully entitled to put their seat all the way back and I should have booked an exit row seat....what an attitude! I had a deep gash and severe bruising for over the next 10 days. The aisles are so narrow that if you dare to have your elbow on the outer armrest then it will be hit by the food trolley. The fit down the aisles is barely minimal. My wife had her elbow hit on all the legs we flew. In the exit rows 47  seats B and J have a stupid entertainment screen set up where the stem has a right angled bend that intrudes into the seat leg space. Why they chose this configuration is beyond me as the adjacent seat has a straight stem. 
Food.....or should I say "slops". Once noted for great food in economy class this has deteriorated to some of the most foul food I have ever tasted. Ordered seafood meals for all legs and did not eat all of the main meals as three of them consisted of a piece of  disgusting smelling fish in a sloppy gravy. The fish didn't even taste like fish.. The only saving grace was a breakfast that consisted of a smoked salmon omelette. 
We like to split our trips into sectors with an overnight stop over. I might try going with Emirates again but Dubai is not the best stopover destination if you have been there once.....Las Vegas on steroids! Unfortunately flying to Australia the choice of airlines is limited with a majority having hubs in either Asia or the Middle East. All in all I fail to see how this airline can be voted No1 in the world. If it were to  be rated on purely the economy cabin then if would be well down the list. It is interesting that first and business class which only make up 25% of the seating dictates the thinking of the groups that rate the airlines.
All in all this Airline and its A350 is really amongst the also rans.
label: negative

text: A comfortable journey. From the time I walked onto the plane, the seat was comfortable. Service was adequate, with good quality food. Friendly staff.
label: positive

text: Premium prices for Budget flight for Singapore Airlines I used to have an amazing impression of SQ, until now. I flew to Phuket from Singapore just last week. It was a total disappointment. The plane was small and don't have entertainment screen. The food was served in paper boxes. The only thing good was the service by the crew members. Why am I paying premium prices for a budget flight? The brand name of Singapore Airlines has totally gone down the drain after covid days.
label: negative

text: Superb Flight was great.  Service excellent.  Stayed over in Singapore for 10 hours and made use of the free sightseeing trip of Singapore and the SD20 voucher - which we used for the lounge - which was magic and great to freshen up before the long leg home.
label: positive

text: First time Premium Economy For the first time we flew Premium Economy, the seats are much wider and are leather and much softer than economy, you are given noise cancelling headphones on boarding, far more legroom and  footrest meals are very good plus more selection of drinks and larger screen to view movies, all in all it is worth the extra money to fly Premium Economy.
label: positive

text: my flights were the best i've ever experienced everything about the flights was very good , seating , crew, food. very helpful and respectful. entertainment very good .
label: positive

text: Good......but Well,first off I was excited to fly on Singapore Airlines because of their reputation and secondly i was excited about the “premium” in front of the cattle car economy section. The service was exceptional,just like a few other Asian carriers. Secondly the premium economy section was nice but you are locked in to the seat,meaning the arm rests are secured and cannot be moved. I had 2 empty seats next to me and could not utilize the space. It was frustrating. Premium economy is nice but........Have a safe journey......
label: positive

text:
First time with Singapore Airlines Our first time trying Singapore Airlines. Very happy with our experience overall  (as happy as you can be flying long-haul economy). Just some confusion over whether we had to choose our seats or whether they were already allocated.  So I called the customer contact centre who said they couldn’t tell if we were already allocated seating together. The staff member then chose our seats for us for both the outward and return journey. The cabin crew were very attentive and courteous. Unfortunately they ran out of both dinner options on Melbourne/Singapore leg so we could only have seafood or nothing! This happened also on the return flight when they ran out of the omelette option for breakfast and only had seafood on offer. Not much good if you don’t like or can’t tolerate seafood. The seats were ok, actually better on the shorter leg, (Singapore Melbourne, Melbourne Singapore.) 
Would fly with them again.
label: positive

text: No Problems, Economy Competent Airline with no problems. We travell;ed by economy and we got economy, Nothing broke, the food was ok and the seats were of a reasonable size for economy. Good value considering what we paid.
label: positive

text: Perfect!. 😊 It has been a perfect flight.  The staff is lovely, the business space is magnificent and the food fantastic.
label: positive

text: Great Airline A great Airline. I've never had any issues flying with them and if I can get cheap enough tickets I don't hesitate to book with them. Fantastic service.
label: positive

text: Professional attendantss The flight coincided with the airline's 70th anniversary and was comfortable, fully booked and departed on schedule. The food was average, the coffee terrible, but I enjoyed a Singapore Sling during linch. The staff were helpful.
label: positive

text: Disappointing  Business lounge at Perth Airport can only be described as a dated worn box. Airline from Perth to Singapore could be described as worn, tired and disappointing. Staff were friendly and helpful. Food average to poor for business class.  Flight from Changi to London was a slight improvement. No option as had to travel as an emergency so did make it to Uk in record time. No plan to travel Singapore airlines in future as value for money found better elsewhere.  Qatar or Emirates.  Emirates even provide car to and from destination within certain radius. A disappointed traveller.
label: neutral

text: Fab New Seats Loved the new A380 seat design. So much easier to decoy the bed. And even better we cauliflower the divider between us, down to squab level so that we could see each other & chat easily throughout the flight. This airline continues to provide great service & comfort. Been flying with them for 20+ years.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Great Flight Im using this airline soon to go to Maldives, great service on time just really  good the entertainment package is great.
label: positive

text:
Smooth flight matched with service Flying business ensures a bed for the night flights and this flight was no exception (warning Bus class AKL-SIN on SQ286 has offset seats so the bed is angled not straight on to the tv for those lying down watching films!).  Also take the option that SQ offers Bus class flyers in choosing your meals in advance of the flight.  Beware tho you may have changed your mind when you get on board!!  Not because of the food just your personal preferences.
Staff are attentive but not intrusive and always helpful IMHO.
The A380 upstairs has no central overhead lockers so it gives a spacy airy fell to the cabin.
Great way to fly!
label: positive

text:
singapore airlines Seats on both the A380 and Boeing A350 were very uncomfortable. 
Singapore Airlines was as usual excellent, but the food on both flights was awful.
label: neutral

text: Service is Too Good Excellent Service with courteous staff. Felt that Flat Bed system is inconvenient  and needs air hostess help every time.
label: positive

text: Food has gone down hill Flew from Bali  to Singapore on the new dream liner 787 10 very nice plane nice seats for economy but the food was of poor quality the lamb was very salty I’m not sure if this is just because it came out of Bali and they don’t know how to cook for premium airlines
label: positive

text: Care for each passenger Cabin crew show close attention to every passenger, their comfort, their special food needs, and for attending to disabled, physically handicapped using toilets.
label: positive

text: Shortest times to and from London Singapore Airlines offer the shortest flight times to and from London/Brisbane.  Seating is not the biggest available but is the best priced economy seating available.  You are not left trying to sleep in airports.  You simply land, change planes and your on your way again.  Extremely friendly staff, modern planes and good refreshments.  It is for these reasons I go out of my way to use Singapore Airlines where possible.
label: positive

text: Fantastic flight Flight left on time, arrived a little early! Seat back screens keep you entertained if you don’t want to sleep! Food was spot on. Service was excellent! Pillows and blankets for everyone!
label: positive

text: Big Mistake By Airline Having used a free upgrade from Business to Suites, I find it unbelievable that SQ can make such a big mistake in their new cabin. Nothing is aligned, very little storage, could fit my laptop case in the wardrobe. Seat positions dont work for comfort. However, if you ignore the seat, alignments etc, the service from the crew is still top class, but i would much prefer flying in the old configuration anyday over this new one.
label: positive

text: First Class Airlines Always feel good flying with Singapore Airlines, more expensive than other airlines but you pay for  peace of mind, safety.
label: positive

text: Service is simply impeccable I fly premium one way, economy the return journey. The first seats are comfortable however the eco seats are really no punishment: there's enough leg space, the chairs go back a fair way to make it comfy. The service is second to none. Cabin crew always serve with a smile on their face. My number 1 airline!
label: positive

text: Great airline The plane is new with very good entertainment facility. Lots of movies to watch. Food is very good with options. Service is also nice. Ofcourse the transit at Changi airport is a great experience.
label: positive

text:
Simply amazing  Although the lounge area was a little tired, we were fortunate to be on one of the new Singapore planes. The set up is fantastic, and leaves you wanting nothing. The food was very good and possibly too plentiful! We arrived very comfortable and well rested.
We were travelling on our honeymoon. At one point we were congratulated by the crew with a special cake. From that moment on, the staff automatically switched to calling me my married name. Amazing hospitality (and great memories!)
label: positive

text: Excellent Service in flight. Good Food. Seamless transfers to connecting flight to Borneo Singapore Airlines Airbus A 380 First time on this huge plane Seats good and decent legroom. Meals Good and service very good. Inflight entertainment excellent. We connected with out flight to Kota Kinabalu and return  at Singapore Changi Airport and our bags were transfered seamlessly both ways . Our flight to kota Kinabalu borneeo was on A 320 wityh Silkair. Also decent
label: positive

text:
Not so World Class! No so 6 Star Hospatility! I recently flew on flight SQ241 from Singapore to Sydney.

Being Thailand based, I fly very often on this route and the carrier I use are mainly Thai Airways or Singapore Airlines. On my several occasions flying on Singapore Airlines, I experience the same reoccurring nightmare on my inflight experience in economy class that I question their sequence of service in this cabin.

I am not a fussy nor needy traveler, but I have year of travel experience to give an opinion. This nightmare has become unbearable for me and want to share my experience.

We all know that crew members attend briefing, and all crew knows the flight profile of the flight. SQ241 & SQ211 flights, has lots of connecting passengers from India. Lots of special meals, babies & bassinet requests, and wheelchairs etc.

Flight often delayed due to connecting passengers. Understandable.

First meal service begins from the front of economy class cabin. Continental breakfast (no big deal) easy on the crew, drop food trays on tray tables, coffee/tea/juice etc. Special drinks request is still manageable as crew often don’t stock various soft drinks in their trolleys. The crew must run up and down the aisle to get stock for passengers. Yes, I get it when stock runs down during service but not every time a passenger ask for soda water and the crew keep running back and forth. This part I don’t get it. 

I have seen in other airlines that I have travelled with has one dedicated crew doing drinks cart (including mixers and cocktails) and one dedicated to doing meal trays. The crew that does the meal services cart than come back to help with drinks services once all the meals trays are on tray tables. 

Some airlines have some form of liquid to offer you with your meal tray i.e., sealed cup or bottle of water or a terra pack of juice (something small) to tie the pax for the moment until the drinks trolley comes to their section for more drinks or special drinks.

For the main meal before landing, the crew took a long time to sort out special meals. Seem like there was lots of confusion and missed meals for passengers. The plane was full of passengers from India. They are around me and I can hear their request/demands to why their meals are not served yet and are wrong meals. As confirmed by a crew member when we asked.

I was served my meal 40mins before landing. Being at the front of the cabin, you are being served last because the meal service begins from the back of the cabin this time. We could have been served in a timely manner if your senior crew is organized with their special meals request.

10 mins into my meal, the captain announces to crew to prepare cabin for landing. I had to rush thru my meal and finish quickly. My request for a soda water could not be fulfilled (can you guess why…. crew were trying to feed passengers and clear trays at the same time, plus they do not stock sufficient soft drinks in their trolley.) so I settle for an apple juice. No big deal.

It was in the last 20mins before landing that I saw 3 crew members from business class came to economy class to help the crew to prepare the cabin for landing. Stowing away passenger’s luggage/bags, bassinets, taking food trays away etc. Wonder where the co-operations amongst crews went in the earlier part of the crisis. We understand crews has specific duties to perform but it was a crisis in economy class but no sign of any camaraderie on that flight amongst crew.

So, with that said, we asked to speak with a senior member of the crew in charge of the cabin (red kabeya) but she did not turn up. It took a second request that she finally came to have a word with us. 

She knew everything that we had to tell her. She even said that we know more than her and the crew members.

Crew members attend pre-flight briefing, if you know that you have over demands for special meals request what would you do?

Crisis management, getting help from other cabin crew when there is a crunch in Economy class. Is the senior crew in red kabeya afraid that her integrity be questioned or will she loose face because she did not plan her workflow properly? Or that’s our (SQ) procedure and policy, we are adhering to it! (Heard that excuse from a crew member before on other SQ flights to Sydney)

So, in conclusion, Singapore Airlines over the years have hyped up travelers’ expectations when flying on Singapore Airlines. Even more now with this “world class” thing that we see advertised all over the world.

It is very difficult to be reasonable and forgiving even in the smallest glitch that may occur, be it the service or the hardware. It’s supposed to be “world class” and that is everything you do; it’s supposed to be perfection. It’s supposed to be 6-star hospitality.

With no help from social media, lots of good and bad comments are floating out there, some are legit, and some are just pure unreasonable. I am sure you have a team to look at those to decipher and respond.

Personally, I will refrain from flying this route on Singapore Airlines. One less passenger/s will not make a difference to your company’s profitability. One less passenger/s will not make any difference to how “world class” you want to be. It has been an experience/s over time that is unforgettable.
label: negative

text: Fantastic airline Fantastic new plane and great service throughout. Love the Singapore Sling and food was tasty and fresh. Good legroom and excellent entertainment system. Only gripe is that the alarm to call airline staff was very loud and woke me up repeatedly when sitting at the back.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines Cancelled my flight 2 days before my departure and they charged me a $800 cancellation fee ?!!! Worst customer service ever. Haven’t been able to reach anyone from Singapore Airlines customers support in 4 months!!! We lost more than $2,000 when they cancelled our flights!!
label: negative

text:
Very Disappointing We flew from Melbourne to Singapore Business Class on SQ218 which was and A380.  Very disappointing, when you book and pay for business class you expect a certain level of comfort and service.  
It all started at the Lounge in Melbourne - small and very average food and amenities compared to what is on offer in Singapore  The plane was old and tired.  My seat didn't work to recline properly.  The food was very average and so was the service.  The flight itself was good with not too much turbulence.  The in flight movie selection had very few new releases
label: negative

text:
Great airline!! Great service from check in to baggage claim. Crew was very courteous and nothing was too much trouble.
 I would definitely fly Singapore again and highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Attentive service and great food The crew are very attentive and friendly.  The stewardess servicing us are always caring and attentive to our needs.  The foods was good with fantastic Japanese cuisine, good choices of cheese.  This flight is one of the best I have ever encountered.
label: positive

text: Nice experience.. Travelled to Singapore on silk air....silk air flights are good compared to others like air Asia and all providing free meals ....from there to Bali went on Singapore airlines.....it was awesome really....charging port, free entertainment,free meals,snacks even more spacious...even economy class felt more like business class....would recommend Singapore airlines....
label: positive

text: Disappointing service With an 88 year old Mother and 1 hour 20 between flights you could imagine our surprise and frustration when the interplane traveller transfer arranged by our travel agent and confirmed in checkin in Beijing did not materialise. The flight attended said it was not far and she should be able to walk it.  two terminals later and a wheelchair we found in airport we made it with minutes to spare. Great customer service Singapore. As our flight of choice it is time to shop around
label: negative

text: Excellent service The counter and in flight service was excellent. Flight attendants were very pleasant and always willing to accommodate. I would highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines “UNIQUE TOUCH” Today I have decided to give my airline review a little twist of different.

We all rave about the caviar, champagne, recline of a seat, lighting, storage space, personal minibars and the whole sort. However, if we look a little closer what matters in creating a memorable experience and a loyal customer is to penetrate our hippocampus which forms a long term memory.

To stimulate that part of the brain we need unique “passager engagement.”  One avenue that could be explored is creating an amenity kit that is actually of value and strategically filled with products that enhance that experience. I will post the highlights (photographs) that In which I experienced throughout my journey but I will focus more on people engagement (crew) more so than the aspects of flying a given carrier.

 Upon arriving at Changi Airport for my “Suite Class” to check-in for my flight to Zurich, I approached the SQ counter and was directed to check-in at the First Class private room which I was given directions to.

 Upon walking around the airport with no First Classroom in site, I approached another SQ staff, and again a pointed finger directed me to a specific direction. { Customer engagement failure } twice already.

While in the SQ check-in I patiently waited for 10 minutes in front of 4 check-in desks that were empty while employees played with their phones { lack of customer engagement }.

 
With my luggage and handbag dropped in front of desks I walked outside of the terminal and asked the curbside agent if someone can assist in checking me in.
The agent did apologize, but at this point an apology was meaningless.

I was told that I “cannot" check my bags all the way to my final destination and only when I argued with him did he turn to ask the supervisor which she replies “of course.”

 From that point on I have to say the Singapore Airlines customer engagement which they are so fabled for in the industry started to flourish…

I was escorted through the private immigration formalities and on to the “Private Room Lounge“ where a whole army of staff was on hand to assist in every way possible.

 A lite bite was welcomed in the A la carte dining room while enjoying a few glasses of Krug.
 

Walking around another 10 minutes, I walked up to Qatar Airways counter, and that individual walked me over to the SQ First Class private check-in room.{excellent example of customer engagement }.

Upon stepping on board and handing the flight attendant my boarding pass, I was addressed by my surname and from this point on the SQ service shined.

 The bottles of Krug were popped and free-flowing throughout the flight.

Flight attendants were empathetic, engaging and most courteous. The inflight supervisor introduced himself and explanations from dinning, flight time, turbulence if expected, preference for sleeping everything and anything was so meticulously explained.
Inflight catering was orchestrated like a beautiful ballet but with an open script that can be manipulated ( or rewritten )to a passengers profile. Customer engagement was personalized, heartwarming and sincere.

No question or concern was ever too much of a task or a burden.
Passenger privacy was respected but at the same time engaging.
The crew was professional, and every passenger was treated according to their needs.

Ten hours passed gracefully - Flight attendants were never congregating in the galley, and when you did approach for any reason you were always greeted with a smile and sense of caring.
All crew was groomed as if they were on a runway fashion show, never did they let jet lag and long hours of duty affect their professionalism.

Customer engagement on this particular flight was exceptional, with many unique memories embedded in my brain.

 This is an excellent example of securing a loyal customer.

 Life is a journey, enjoy the adventure.

 Rome H Geragonis
label: positive

text:
Amazing airlines and top of the class service 

 On behalf of my family and myself I would like to thank you guys for the amazing services that you provide on board your aircraft. We had a chance to travel to Bali and Singapore on Singapore airlines as I would not settle for any other airlines and I must say you guys are very professional and courteous in your service..my daughter who is 4 years old was also well looked after and given due attention and she enjoyed the kids on board entertainment which kept her busy ..my wife and parents also enjoyed your flight and inflight entertainment. Though we did have a little issue with the food as there was a little confusion in the food that we had ordered and which was served..but it was promptly solved by the crew on board. No doubt that you guys are the No-1 airline in the sky. The entire process from check in till the end of our destination was smooth and without any hiccups. 
Thank you for an excellent experience on board your flights.
label: positive

text:
Do not live up to Star Alliance Partnership spirit A family of 6 travelling, 2 biz (paid), 4 economy (2 paid, 2 redemption). 
SQ doesn't offer LAX or SFO connection to ORD for 1 stop, hence we have to book separately on UA and upon check in, they failed to link up the final destination for our baggage and we have to re-checking through the counter again (instead of dropping off on domestic)

SQ web recommended 2 stop SIN-FRA-JFK connection with a non Star Alliance  JetBlue Airways, this is totally, this outrages that waste our time and our membership privileges were compromised. All your hard earned Gold Status are not put in good use.

Why could not they do a better SIN-SFO-ORD (1 stop) connection with UA? after all ORD is UA hub?  SQ do away with its own Kris Lounge in SFO.

I strongly recommend, do not fly with SQ to US, they are no difference compared to others.
label: negative

text: Unrivaled excellence Exceptional service on board, dedicated caring personnel, professional and always smiling, keeping the cabin clean and tidy all the time on this 12 hour flight, maintaining the toilets spotless. The seats are great, flat bed of course, lot of spaces 1/2/1 seating configuration, corridor access for all, excellent privacy, just one problem with the remote control on the side  is very sensitive and can be easily triggered inadvertently. The Airbus A380 makes the flying experience exceptional, smooth, silent flight. The food is within industry standards, nothing special,  boarding quick, flight on time. An excellent airline because of its committed people  and its great seats.
label: positive

text:
Competition catching up with Singapore Airlines Singapore Airlines is still at the top of the game for Business Class. However the competition is catching up fast. For example, Qatar Air's new business-class privacy shutter doors are a first in the class segment. And Emirates have their bar-lounge area in their 380 business class too. 

I would strongly recommend SQ to reconsider down-sizing and standardizing their business-class seats to the industry norm during their progressive "upgrading." Their current business class seats are the widest and most comfortable I have experienced, and should preferably be retained for long-haul flights on wide-bodied planes. Suggest to feature the narrower-width business class seats just for their narrow-bodied, single aisle planes covering short-haul regional flights.
label: positive

text: SQ 637 It was a A380 aircraft and my first trip. Huge aircraft but very comfortable indeed. Food was excellent with a wide choice of drinks. I had Singapore Sling. The inflight staffs were very attentive and caring.
label: positive

text: Best flight I have ever had it was a great experience with Singapore airlines.the legroom was great and the staff was also very helpful.
label: positive

text:
Forever spoilt by first class service Travelled in group of 5. Lounge before boarding was comfortable with halal food options. Long flight was very pleasant. Flight, take off and landing super smooth.
Very comfortable large seats that opens up as beds in seconds, clean pillows,blankets,socks,slippers provided for comfort. Great selection of in flight movies also sensational mix of easy listening songs.
Excellent service, flight attendants always attentive and friendly yet not intrusive. 3 apologised profusely when my meal came without gravy from the SATS kitchen,no fault of theirs and even though the meal was substituted with a comparably delicious one, I was given a $100 voucher!
Never felt more pampered than that 13hrs in the air.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service and comfortable A380 Great Service from Sing Air, one of our favorite carriers, super staff, efficient transfers at Changi
label: positive

text:
Another great flight We were lucky to get the upgrade from economy to premium via the bid system and it was great. We were seated in the first row of premium and had amazing leg room, you could fully stretch out with your feet resting on the magazine holder for a nice sleep.
The service is as usual the best, never a complaint with Singapore and their amazing staff.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing The seat was comfortable and flat bed very good. Entertainment was limited.
Dinner was good with enough choice of food and drink.
The service was a little slow and less thank enthusiastic.
Continental breakfast was appalling quality, tough bread and pastry and fruit.
No yogurt and no cooked option. Not what you would expect from business class.
label: positive

text: Always reliable and comfortable I can always count on SQ for a safe and efficient flight. In-flight food wasn't great though. Kris Flyer programmes were diverse and up-to-date; managed to catch movies like Captain Marvel, Bohemian Rhapsody etc.
label: positive

text:
The best plane trip ever  From the moment we got on plane till we arrived in Singapore it was like we were treated like royalty 
Every second we pampered and offered meals and snacks , ice cream , chocolate, chips , nuts meals hot cloths etc 
They made sure all our need were met and we were comfortable
label: positive

text:
Excellent hotel, mixed feelings about the restaurant They have a separate registering desk for non-economic classes. We got our luggage as soon as we arrived in paris, much earlier than the other passengers (1h earlier)
Excellent service on board. Staff nice and helpful
good choice of meals
excellent choice of movies
label: positive

text: Good service in economy Flight was full, but I have to reluctantly admit that the service throughout was very good. Reasonable food quality. Staff helpful & responsive. Adequate leg-room. Flight on time.
label: positive

text: TIMELY LINK Easy check-in, not too long a wait, the usual crush to board, despite clear instructions, pleasantly surprised at the space (A380, top floor).  Very comfortable flight, pleasant attentive staff, reasonable meal.  Despite our flight being late (we left ate) and our 1 hour between flights being swallowed up, we had time to transfer terminals and were not rushed when we reached the gateway.  Smaller aircraft for the shorter flight Singapore to Colombo squashy, and crowded.  But total time shorter even than Sydney - Melbourne - Colombo.  Will do again.
label: positive

text: Luxurious flying! Superb comfort and wonderful food ( actually too much food!) My criticism would be that they served meals in accordance with the time zone in Singapore, not where they had taken off from or where they were going! Not helpful to offset jet lag! Everything else was pretty much perfect!
label: positive

text: Good service and good food ! The Kochi -Singapore route is serviced by a smaller aircraft and it has its problems.the Singapore-Shanghai sector is serviced by larger aircraft with lots of space.The service, timings and food are very good.
label: positive

text:
Luxury Relaxation in the Sky So I was curious about all the hype and Singapore Airlines lived up to it and more.  The attendants were both sincerely interested in their customers and the service was exemplary.  

Given that this is the longest commercial non-stop, we were plied with excellent food, drink and snacks, as well as a good amount of constant refilling of water glasses and given several plastic bottles to keep at our seat.

The plane - the new A350ULR (Ultra-long range) was the best I've flown on since the A380.  I also did a flight on their 787 for a different route and while nice, was not as large or as nice a plane.

The time flew by and I didn't even have time to see a full movie.  It was wonderful!!
label: positive

text:
It’s still a long flight! Good flight with good food and service.
Still takes 24 plus hours but Changi airport is really great.
label: positive

text: Los Angeles- Singapore by Sq35 Premier Economy Recently i traveled to Singapore on its new direct 17 hour flight. I have traveled quite a bit  on AA, SAS & Turkish Airlines Premier Economy class in the past to Asia & Europe, always had a good experience. I thought SA new direct service should be on par with other carriers if not better.  I was wrong!  I used its "Book the Cook" online since there was  mixed review about in flight meals. On this long flight, SQ served two meals and a snack. I was a bit taken back and in fact shocked when they brought out the first meal. It was in a small plastic tray, with shrimp entree covered in a twisted foil paper, a salad and a desert.( It seems that it missing something like appetizer, since there is empty space on the small tray). It just looked unappetizing and entree portion is very small.  The second meal was served the same fashion. In between, they serve  donuts and small finger sandwich. I have not touched donuts for years ! But i was starving and had to grab a super sweet donut! Service lacks throughout the flight, though flight attendant seemed to work hard ( i think the flight was understaffed!). No napkin paper provided when serving a drink and nuts. Had to constantly ask for napkins,spoon(for that solid ice cream). Approached the flight attendant at galley for a hot tea, and assured that it would be brought to my seat. The tea never came!   The only saving grace is that i was able to grab one of the 6 solo seats at the back of cabin. My seat was comfortable and the plane is brand new.  On this same trip, i took a much shorter 3 hour flight from Bangkok to Taipei on China Airlines economy class, i was served one meal in much more respectable way (in terms of presentation, quality and portion). This is longest direct flight i have ever taken-17 hours total. I won't get on this flight again.  I work in travel industry and do not take this review lightly.
label: negative

text: A pleasant journy Very good air line. Clean and comfortable.Most of the facilities are common but the service was very good. the staffs were courteous ,obliging and attentive. It was a comfortable flight from Colombo to Hanoi through Singapore. The food was good but not very good or excellant.I am unable to say I enjoyed the food. It may be that I didnt get what I was looking for. Nothing to complaint.I will travel again in Singapore Air Line.
label: positive

text: Disappointed Customer service Singapore Airlines took five weeks to reply to my email about my flight that was two weeks after my arrival date 3 hours to check in took 45 minutes to connect customer service by phone flight was good customer service was terrible won't be using them again
label: negative

text: The long haul from Heathrow to Sydney No one enjoys 24 hours flying from the UK to Sydney but the Singapore air crew made it as pleasant as possible with friendly service and regular cups of water. Food was reasonable and the new A380 has a bit more legroom which makes a noticeable difference.  A few hours sleep does not prevent jet lag, but helps make you less grumpy.
label: positive

text: Holidays Flea on onan old A380. And found it very cramped, uncomfortable, and warm out! Luckily we had a night flight so slept most of the way. Very disappointing with flight and service
label: neutral

text:
Extra legroom seat without legroom A380 v3 layout with just 2 seats in the row each side of the galley. Seat 41C and 41H are ‘extra legroom’ at extra cost. However, these seats have a galley curtain that crosses the aisle in front of the seat and the cabin crew have to step into your leg space to enter and exit the galley. During the night with lights out your feet will be constantly kicked by cabin crew, or you be tripping them accidentally.
This is worse than a standard seat, uninterrupted sleep is impossible in this seat and it should not be sold as extra legroom.
label: neutral

text: No jet lag after 17 hours flight! Excellent service with lots of entertainment choose from, and movies you really wanted to see.  3 meal choices and champagne.  Relaxing time settled in.  Pleasantly surprised due to lighting and air circulation no jet lag either in Asia or back home in US.
label: positive

text: The best airline The best airline. The Service, food, comfort you name it. I never use any other airline when I fly to whereever this airline flies. I travel alone and feel safe. Their airport is a vacation in itself.  Orchids everywhere. The economy class didn't even feel like ECONOMY.
label: positive

text: Poor service Me and my partner have  been flying with Singapore Airlines for the last 10 years. Initially they were absolutely fantastic and faultless. Since flying after Covid the standard of the service including cleanliness of toilets and quality of the food served was poor. The vegan options were poor with no choice and all the other meals served were absolutely of the lowest quality. We were delayed 2 hours whilst sat on the plane and not  even offered refreshments. I had to pay an additional £500.00 to change my partners flight to fly back home with me due to her poor health. There was no reason in my opinion as the plane had plenty of spare seats. I would not recommend Singapore Airlines as they only care about Business class clients and those who buy there fancy Suites. Unfortunately They have lost there reputation for those in economy class flying internationally and i will not Singapore Airlines again as in my experience theres no point using an airline thats no better than any other and  a third more per ticket. I do not recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text:
What happened to their stellar reputation !😒 Just overall subpar airline , gone are their hay days. 
Food is atrocious and very cheap . The inflight entertainment is basic at best . Wouldn’t bother flying them again . Qantas kills them .
label: negative

text: Singapore airlines sucks I looked forward to travelling my first time with Singapore airlines as I heard good things. What a let down.  Delayed times, inedible food, broken seat, crappy inflight entertainment. The list goes on and on. I don’t even mention the trip coming back. You guys suck. Never again.
label: negative

text:
Excellent Service and overall experience Safe to say Singapore airlines is the best airline I have been on so far.
The staff on board are very nice and professional and they make sure passengers are as comfortable as possible.
Services on Singapore airlines make long flights much more pleasant & bearable!
label: positive

text:
Thrift Air I booked my wife and I on sq136 and 137 round trip to chengdu. At boarding we found the flight was a silk air cattle car complete with a decrepit plane and a useless cabin crew. I agree completely with the previous reviewer who felt the cabin crew was racially biased -  on our flights if a passenger were not Chinese you were ignored 

The return flight is the worst flight I’ve ever flown
label: negative

text: The only way to fly! Wonderful flight, I wish they travelled to the Caribbean. My best long haul flight. Lovely food and real stainless steel cutlery.....
label: positive

text: Excellent Economy flight from Dubai to Singapore  The flight left just slightly after 2000hrs, a little later than scheduled. Checking was orderly. We were given a hot towel and snacks (peanuts in a packet) shortly. I ordered a Kosher meal and that was promptly served as well. The Kosher meal was from Hermolis and it was good, much better than the meal I got from Stogel which was served by Ethiopian. They even had a enemies like toothbrush and toothpaste in the toilet for us to keep ourselves refreshed. The staff on the plane were friendly and able to make good conversation with me. I would recommend them again without hesitation.
label: positive

text:
First class Life is short everyone should try first class at least once in their life. It is awesome. The crew from Singapore airlines were fantastic and service was second to none. 
Like the Nike line says. Just do it!!
label: positive

text:
Commuter special I have been commuting to the US every three weeks from Singapore to the USA. I find that Singapore Airline's Premium Ecomony direct flight a good alternative to expensive Business Class.
I pay for my own travel and willingly paid for buiness class but I find SA Premium Economy much more than adequate and comparable to Business Class on some airlines. And flying direct into Newark (and avoiding JFK) is a bonus.
I did not see a lot of complaining about the long flight because service and seats very nice.
label: positive

text:
Good but has serious competition I had been looking forward to SIA's business class for some time and, overall, was not disappointed.  Whether it was the high expectation or the lack of delivery but it was not the greatest of experiences.
Istanbul - check-in 3 hours before the flight was excellent and we were directed to the Express Path for Customs/Immigration and into the Turkish Airlines Lounge within minutes.
Boarding was good - SIA only has the one flight from Istanbul daily so gets punted to a   very remote gate for a very long drive to the aircraft - premium cabin passengers do get priority and a separate bus but in adverse weather it would be an ordeal.
On-board - greeting and seating was excellent and I had no initial issues with the seat or cabin.  Travelling with my wife and she ended up with a Flight Attendant who was not having a good day and who then was quite curt/brusque with passengers - none of the Singapore Girl's charms on display here.
Dining - excellent - food and drink was really good and the Book The Cook option was a good one to explore.
Seat/Entertainment - very good but longer-term, the seat was uncomfortable.  SIA is often lauded for having a very wide seat but it is necessary as, when reclined, your feet are directed into quite a small cubby-hole towards the centre of the aircraft and you have to lie across you seat to get your feet in.  If the seat were any narrower I would not think that you would be at all comfortable.  The seat back flips forward to expose the mattress/bedding which is very good and overall the seating/sleeping is good but not great.  Etihad offer a more comfortable seat and sleeping experience.
To sum up - the best thing about SIA's business class was access to their excellent SilverKris Lounge in Changi Airport - so much better that the very tawdry and very ordinary Gold Kris Lounge.
Would I fly Business Class with SIA again? probably, but there are so many other (better) options now available for the sort of $$ that SIA expects - think Etihad, Qatar and the like.
label: positive

text: Great flights - Premium economy the best We flew Premium economy for the first time and will definitely be doing that gain. What a difference between that and normal economy. As always Singapore airlines provided amazing service which cant be faulted.
label: positive

text: The Best Lovely touches like hot flannels, plenty of drinks and food.  Delightful stewards on board.  Very clean.
label: positive

text:
Outstanding attention to detail Superb attention to detail from food to personalized service.
Outstanding food choices 
Could have chosen the chef!
Ultra-Clean cabin
All “trash “ picked up instantly 
SIA needs to update the App. Propensity to give incorrect information for connecting flights from SIN to LAX
The price of airfare was very reasonable compared to all airlines especially US airlines
label: positive

text: Best Airlines for travel to SE Asia Flew Singapore airlines round trip. Premium economy is well worth the extra fee. Not too much to pay for additional room and comfort on a long flight. Food is good and service excellent. Clean airlines. Have used before and will again.
label: positive

text: Relocation to UK Great seat and good service no delays and staff were excellent. Very good food as I am a veggie and they catered for me very well . Just great
label: positive

text: Read this first before booking Singapore hotel package by Singapore Airline or Changi airport SIA operates a great airline, but they don't do hotel packages very well. We recently book a Singapore Stopover tour on the Changi website. SIA is a partner of Changi and put together this package which include a hotel, SIM card, transportation to a hotel and breakfast a a fast food outlet, Ya Kun. Getting each of these was like pulling a tooth. Information desk at Changi airport had no information when we arrived. UOB bank was charged with dispensing SIM which they ran out of. The hotel asked for a voucher which was not in the email. And Ya Kun at the location on the voucher had no idea what the deal was and refused to honor it.  You may choose to fly Singapore Airline, but don't by hotel packages from them.
label: neutral

text:
Ridiculous Customer Service "Enjoy complimentary rebooking for ALL TICKETS issued up to 31. December 2021" . This is what Singapore Airlines advertises on their website. Well, it is not true !  When we changed (online not possible! ) our return flights (same flights, only 2 weeks earlier! )  and originally booked online with Singapore Airlines, we were charged extra. Asking why, they explained it with a different booking class..., on a flight to Singapore that was after all only about 10 % occupied, connecting flight from Singapore about 30 % occupied. After extra payment, new tickets were issued with a lower baggage allowance. Had to call them again, but you must know: The customer service is, if at all, almost not reachable by phone. On top of it, one suitcase did not arrive on time with our connecting flight.
Overall: Quite unprofessional service and defenitely one way to loose customers for the future.
Bye Bye Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: If the world was run by Singapore airlines it would be near perfect We have travelled with low cost airlines in the past in the belief we were saving money however on this trip is did a quick cost comparison and found I wasn’t saving very much at all so I returned to Singapore airlines. What a relief!checking in is a breeze and almost a pleasure. All the staff whether ground or cabin are courteous and knowledgeable. But get this - we had a late departure from Hong Kong due to weather which gave us less than 20 minutes to make the connection in Singapore which was achieved by us running flat out through the terminal. We made it just as the gate was closing and as we sat on the plane we decided our luggage would arrive some time next week as there was no way they could have loaded it from one aircraft to the other in such a short time. On arriving in Melbourne there was our luggage on the carousel ready for collection - effortless efficiency in every way. Thank you and well done.
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight Seat 17A left hand window single on a Boeing 777-300ER.   Singapore staff are professional, use paper lists to write down passenger's orders.  On this leg I got the feeling those who were pushy got served first.  Again, I gave entertainment a miss - no idea how to operate it and staff seemed to think that pointing at a button was the total answer - not!  Food, cocktail and wine choices wonderful and I slept well on this long haul flight.
label: positive

text: Felt like the old days, friendly, relaxed, great service This flight was like a balst from the past. The cabin crew seemed to be really enjoying their job; the drinks trolley came by shortly after we left Tokyo and was quick and efficient. The real highlight was the Japanese dinner option, probably the best aeroplane meal we have had. And new release films.
label: positive

text: Great trip! Excellent business class service - unobtrusive, helpful & polite.  Great seating arrangement on the A380 with single seating in a type of cube arrangement along the window side of the plane, which made it quite private.. Ample room to stretch out flat & sleep.  Very quiet for an overnight flight.  The usual high level Singapore Air service
label: positive

text: WHERE HAVE ALL THE SMILES GONE? Seat were good, food was good, entertainment system good, boarding good, but service with a smile gone. I use to value Singapore Airlines as one of the best airlines in the world but something has changed with the on board staff. Don't get me wrong, they do their job but the genuine smiles have disappeared.
label: positive

text: Welcome to Business-Class  -  MA Spoiled it for me! I was actually underwhelmed; the Araliya lounge was small and a bit crowded, on there way out, and on the way in, the Silver Kris lounge was a bit less special than roaming outside, outside where there where massage chairs. And so much more to do. The last Business Class lounge we were in even had rooms that we could have cat-naps in. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I would have expected more from SQ which is a very, very good airline - especially since we were at its home base!
label: positive

text:
Improved food and flight comfort on SQ31 San Francisco to Singapore Having flown this route a few times this year, can say it has improved food wise and comfort wise. Seated at 48K which has extra leg room but seat width restricted due to entertainment console in seat arm. Aisle access was supposed to be available but the passenger in front just blocked that off!. 
Flight time was 16.5 hours departing at 11a.m. local time in SFO. Lounge access for Star Alliance Gold is only United Club-the saddest and worse lounge for Star Alliance. Food choices limited, beverage limited, seating limited. 
Late lunch/early dinner served 2 hours into flight--which is tough if you planned on sleeping (to adjust to Singapore time which is exactly 12 hours ahead). There is ZERO chance of sleep in economy as service is LOUD. Managed to upgrade to business class for SG-Perth leg which was quiet and heavenly.
As noted over the past 9 months-cabin temperature is very warm. This can be good or bad-good as bones unfrozen, bad as not only are you bathed in old man's farts but also sweaty. Gross.
Food was so much better compared to last 18 months of flying Singapore Airlines ( I only fly Singapore Airlines for long distance). Make sure you order ahead of time vegetarian/muslim/kosher meals. You will be served about 30 minutes ahead of everyone else. It will be better and you won't be out of luck when they run out of your preferred option.
Amenities are good- even the blanket and socks for economy are comfy. Can't beat the weighted blankets in business though. 
Head on back fro snacks and water- the cabin crew are really good for that and will even make up pot noodles.
This was much better than my Premium Economy Singapore to London flight in June. for economy Singapore is 2nd best, the best would be Emirates. It is still a good flight. If you can, get business. It is way comfier.
label: positive

text:
Great Customer Service by Flight Steward Mr Rahim I was travelling on SQ  on 18 January 2019 and it was morning flight with my family.  I am very happy and to applaud Mr Rahim for his great customer service that he showed to my family member.  He will pop by to see us if we need anything and ensure that we are feeling comfortable throughout the journey. \
Keep up the great customer service Mr Rahim.
label: positive

text: Excellent and reliable Have made this journey several times always with Singapore Airlines, but not for a few years, wondered if standards had slipped, but no, excellent as before, cabin staff are superb, stopped over in Singapore.  All flights were on time, if we travel again it will be with this airline, highly recommend
label: positive

text: Nothing special. I'd heard many good things about Singapore Airlines so was looking forward to travelling with them but was sadly disappointed. We flew economy in a 777 and although we paid for extra leg room it still felt very cramped. The seat was so uncomfortable, the noisyest flight I can recall ment there was no chance of being able to grab a couple of hours sleep but the worst thing for me was the entertainment screen was not working despite 2 resets I was left staring at the bulkhead for 13 and a half hours. The lead stewardess took my E mail address and promised compensation for the broken screen but a week on an I've heard nothing from them. Hardly one of the world's best airlines I'm afraid.
label: neutral

text: Very good airline with superb service onboard The flight is full during this summer season and the crew manage to help out all the passenger needed. Food onboard is excellent in economy and the service is fantastic, among the best in the world.
label: positive

text:
Simply outstanding! This airline is simply outstanding. The service, food, comfort,  entertainment, cleanliness and every aspect is top class. The flight attendants always have a smile and do their very best. No doubt that I would always choose this airline if it suited my routed.
We flew Jnb to Sin and then Sin to HKT and return, so this was not just a one off experience. Good every time.
label: positive

text: First time with Singapore We had return flights Sydney to London with Singapore in May and June.  Lived up to expectations in terms of service and staff which was great and up there with the other good airlines we have used.  Had Airbus A380-800 on the Sydney - Singapore legs and Boeing 777-300ER on the Singapore-London segments.  The Airbus is far superior, larger and newer with better legroom for us.  Do not understand why we have the smaller plane on the longer segment.  Disappointing but would definitely use again.
label: positive

text: we have a good flight and the sevice too The service we have is very good..We request assit with my husband from Perth to Singapore because we celebrate our anniversary for 38 yrs together even though he had his stroke last  7 1/2 weeks before we fly they help us a lot..So appreciated.
label: positive

text: Amazing service, ultimate comfort Took the flight with family and it was really worth it. The level of service is impeccable, was traveling with my 2 kids and the flight attendants really made us all feel special.
label: positive

text: Excellent As Always Another excellent flight from Brisbane to Singapore and return. Food and beverage service excellent and very comfortable for economy class. Hard to fault this Airline.
label: positive

text: Excellent Absolutely amazing to travel with. I have a severe nut allergy and singapore airlines was the only company that happily provided me with nut free meals and snacks. The staff were kind and attentive and made me feel very comfortable. There was a huge range of activities to do inboard such as games, music, TV shows and movies. Would 100% travel with them again.
label: positive

text: Stupendous Singapore Airlines Food was little of a problem but overall experience is fantastic,,would like to go again.I watched movies and songs and played games to pass time,,speaker phones ,,pillow and sheets also provided,,All crew members were very friendly
label: positive

text: always reliable Always reliable and flight attendants are fantastic.  They are always pleasant and nothing is a problem.  The only down is the food, which I can honestly say has never been fantastic, but that is airplane food for you unless you fly first class. We choose to fly with Singapore whenever we travel to Europe.  Changi Airport is amazing, we could learn alot from other countries airports!
label: positive

text: Nice experience We took 4 flights in total. First 3 flights were pleasant but  Last flight from Singapore to Sydney  was not as expected. Seats were uncomfortable and the service was not up to Singapore airline standards.
label: positive

text:
Very terrible check in personal and costumer service!!!! Singapore airlines refused my boarding today.

I was at Singapur airline check in desk around 40 minutes today and my check in was still not complete. 

I asked the check in lady two times ... do we need to hurry up because the flight is soon leaving, right? I did not got any answer from her and trusted she will know. The fact is that 4 ladis where standing behind the desk working on one check in and could not provid proper service so I could board my plain is unbelievable?!?!?!  35 minutes before my plane was leaving they said the boarding is closed. What??? 35 minutes is not enough time to go from the check in to the gate???

Through this inconvenience from Singapor Airlines i missed my connection flights from Jakarta to Singapor, from Singapor to LA, from LA to Mexico City from Mexico City to Huatulco!! 4 flights missed!!! 

After complaining with singapor airlines management today they booked me the same flight 24 h later but only to LA. I am having additional expenses: accomodation in Jakarta, food, I need to pay another plane ticket from LA onward and I am missing out all my meetings in the following day. 

A few hours after this inconvenience I found out from my travel agency that my flight was canceled by Singapor Airlines although the plane was actually leaving from Jakarta - just without me. Very weird, right?!

I am traveling all my life but such bad check in service, costumer service I never experienced before. 

First and last time booked with this Airline. Definitely not recommended to use Singapor Airline Service!!!
label: negative

text:
Brilliant experience Booked extra legroom seats (41B and C) as my husband has long legs.
This was our second round trip experience of SA.  The stewards and stewardesses are handsome/beautiful to behold with smiley, welcoming faces.
Our seats were just by the entrance to the plane and next to a galley.
The standard of service was exceptional.  Nothing was too much bother and the food was wonderful and plentiful.
My only criticism was that my husband was served his special meal ( he is diabetic) first and I was served last of that sides service.  Surely it would not be too much to serve a meal to the accompanying passenger at the same time.
label: positive

text:
Flew via Melbourne from Wellngton We flew Wellington - Melbourne, Melbourne - Singapore.  Usually from Wellington we have to fly to Auckland or Christchurch for our international leg.  Since I travelled the  Airline has put newer planes on the route which will be an improvement.  Our Wellington to Singapore leg was awful, the plane older and the entertainment system was so poor it wasn't worth watching.  That made for very long flights.
As always the crew were lovely and food pretty good considering.  Our Singapore to London flights were good because we were on a bigger and more modern plane.
We did a stopover on our way to the UK, taking advantage of the stopover holiday benefits which are good.  On the way home we had 13 hours in Signapore, with an early morning arrival.  The stopover would have been better placed on the homeward journey.
label: positive

text:
Courteous team and excellent service Flying with SQ gives the best experience to a traveler.  Cabin crew are very courteous and hospitable.  Food is delicious and drink choices are varied.

Seats are comfortable and leg room is roomy.  Departure time is on time.
label: positive

text: Well done. Economy travel is rarely noteworthy, however when our connecting flight was delayed due to bad weather, it caused us to miss the next connection out of Singapore. Upon arrival the airline had already booked us on the next available flight and arranged for our overnight accommodation and meals at the Crowne Plaza Hotel at Changi airport. The efficiency and service from the airline for a delay which they technically had no control over, is to be applauded.
label: positive

text: Cramped conditions Food was okay, but the space is ridiculous.  We were crammed in like sardines with not much room to move.  By the end of the flights to and from Singapore the toilets were gross.  They need to clean them regularly during the flight.  A means to an end to get to where we were going, but nothing to write home about.
label: neutral

text: holiday flight I would reckon they have the best  airline food. the serving staff are all extremely polite and patient and didnt discriminate.
label: positive

text:
POOR SERVICE AND CUSTOMER RESPONSE we were denied boarding due to Visa issues and nobody from SFO singporeair staff responded to our questions/concerns. they just ignored us and our questions
  we reserved front row seats ahead of journey, they still deducted money even though we were denied boarding. when called customer care they said they dont refund whatever is the case
  we managed to get visa and move the trip to 2 days after with extra charges, the SFO staff made us waiting for almost 1 hour as their credit card system is not working. even though i offered to pay online they did not accept

flight is good but they dont serve food on time. they only served 1 meal and 1 breakfast for 17 hour flight. the first meal they served is after 10 hours after  flight started 

although flight is good, i do not recommend singaporeair as staff and response is very poor and in flight meals service is very bad
label: negative

text:
Singapore Airlines- Brisbane to Singapore Left on a guided tour to Vietnam with Singapore Airlines on 5-4-19. When it came time to bring around the meals it was discovered that Jill's dietary requirements ( Various allergies ) had not been passed on to the crew. 
After a brief, and cheerful, discussion the Chief Steward apologised. Jill generally carries some appropriate snacks for such occasions and as it was a relatively short flight it was no big deal.
Soon after, the Chief Steward appeared with a fresh omelette. Don't know how he managed it but Jill appreciated it just the same.
The aircraft had reasonable legroom,and the aircraft was clean.

I guess 'airlines are airlines' but this incident set Singapore apart through the ir desire to ensure their passengers are kept satisfied.
label: positive

text: An excellent airline to travel with!! We flew 2 12 hour flights with them and the flights were great. Meals were lovely, nothing was any trouble for the staff, and it didn't seem like a 12 flight, with meals, snacks, and drinks. In fact, my husband said it didn't feel like a 12 hour flight!!
label: positive

text:
Perfect evening flight from MNL Check-in : At the dedicated Business Class counter. Quick without any waiting involved. Keep in mind the long queues at the entrance though ( Our flight was at 18:30 )

Security / Immigration : No separate queue / Fast-Track. Clearance was quick though.

Lounge : SilverKris Lounge
Well laid out , with excellent views of the tarmac. Great F&B options as well.

Boarding : A separate area reserved for premium passengers , but made no sense , nor was it being followed. Priority boarding was enforced though.

Seat / Layout : Our aircraft was the A350-900. Business Class is divided into 2 cabins ( 1 large , 1 small ) separated by a galley. The layout is 1-2-1 in a staggered sense , with some seats towards the aisle , and the others away ( more private ). The seats are very comfortable , and thankfully the footrest is straight , not angulated as seen in the A380.

Service : Very courteous staff , who ensured that the service throughout the flight was incredible , and personalized.

Food & Beverages : 'Book the Cook' was unavailable. Pre-selected meals from the in-flight menu. 'Pan fried mahi mahi' was decent . but the 'Pasta with meat balls' was horrid
label: positive

text: Very Good Another top flight with Singapore Airlines the 5 one this year . Their service and food is and has always been great , the planes are always clean and this time we had the pleasure of flying on the 1st of their new 787s  which was a great experience . The only small downfall was the legroom the seats are very comfortable but myself being rather tall always find this a bit of a problem .
label: positive

text:
A great experience We took the flight from Delhi to Singapore and Visa-Versa. Both the time it was a great experience travelling with Singapore Airlines. From ground service till Cabin Service it was simply best. For us, the seats were comfortable. They provide all kind of amenities like a blanket, a pillow, earphones, earbuds etc. Cable staff were friendly and welcoming, and always ready to accede to your requests. Inflight entertainment was also excellent. As it is a Full-Service carrier, they offered complimentary Food and beverage as well. We got the option between Indian and Continental meal. I will suggest, post-booking the tickets, please update your meal preference so that they can arrange the same accordingly and you can enjoy your meal. They have multiple food options.

Few suggestions for Airlines.

1) Please make the TV screens angle adjustable so that any person can adjust the screen as per his/her need. Also, remote buttons are hard to press. Please replace those faulty remotes.
2) Add more collection in the Indian movies sections. 
3) I have booked 4 Indian Non-Veg meals, but both the time received only three as it was finished. Please have sufficient meals at least for those passengers who pre-booked their meals. 

Rest it was very good experience travelling with Singapore Airlines. In future, we would love to fly again with them because of their great hospitality.
label: positive

text: Price is the best part Oh My.  The flight was not bad since we paid for extra leg room.  The food was airline food, The service was very good.  But there website is horrible. We could not find any information on luggage restrictions.  We did find carry on info.  We could not confirm on line, site was under maintenance.  They could not find us in the computer for 15 min. to check in. They did however acknowledged that they were aware that there were problems and that they were working on them.
label: neutral

text:
Again a wonderful flight Another fantastic flight with Avery caring and excellent cabin crew. Nothing was to much trouble. We only traveled in premium economy but we did take the extra leg room seats at the bulk head, there was more than enough room to stretch your legs out.
The in flight entertainment was right up to date with all the latest movies, the food and drinks service was also very good.
This was are 3rd time we have used Singapore airlines and would recommend them to anybody.
label: positive

text: Awesome Flight  Airlines crew were super friendly and warm. Service was outstanding. Inflight food was good. Journey was about 2hours. There weren't any delay with the flight timings. There's entertainment panel for every passenger when you get your flight route details and you can also watch movies. Movies were updated with latest ones. Would love to fly with them again .
label: positive

text:
A great airline with excellent service. I flew Canberra to Singapore return. It was a great journey. Very comfortable!
The cabin crew were excellent and always on hand to assist.
label: positive

text:
LHR-SIN-MEL-SYD-SIN-LHR One of the main reasons I booked Singapore Airlines was because they operate the new Airbus A380 on London to Singapore & Singapore to Sydney routes. They are supposed to have more leg room, back support, adjustable headrest with foldable wings.  I also paid a premium to fly this airline & booked direct with them. However I was very disappointed to be traveling on very old aged A380’s instead. No touch screen entertainment, old bucket seats not comfortable & to be honest these old aircraft’s need a total refurbishment. Where is the new A380 fleet?  Well out of 4 flights on A380’s we were lucky to experience the last flight on a new aircraft finally Singapore to London. On the positive side Food, service & cabin crew was absolutely fantastic.
Food & Beverage Service takes too long. 
23.45 take off, 01.00 still not a drink or food. Such late flight they should rush the service so the passengers can get some sleep. I also found no salt & pepper in food tray & if you don’t ask they won’t offer tea/coffee even there is a coffee cup on the tray & milk. 

If I have known that I was traveling such long distances in old aircraft’s, my choice of airline would have been different.
label: neutral

text: World class airline I wouldn't usually book Singapore Airlines knowing the fact that it would be expensive traveling with a world class airline. But with a bit of patience awaiting for promotions from Singapore Airlines, I was able to book a flight from Singapore to Manila and vice versa for about S$270. Not quite cheap but considering that this is a world class airline with meals and 30kg checked in baggage on the side, it's well worth the price. But that's not all, this is during the peak period of December holidays. The trip itself was smooth, once you have boarded and settled on your seat, the flight attendants will soon hand over a hot towel for you to freshen up for the trip ahead. The aircraft was a Boeing 787-10, which is quite new and a little bigger that the usual Airbus A320 that goes through this route via budget airlines. I was seated at the very end with only two seats and I was lucky enough the window seat was not occupied though I still choose to sit by the aisle. The good thong about this is you would be near the toilet if you need to go quite frequently which was my case as I had too much water to drink prior to my trip. Another advantage is that you'll be in the first row served with food. Entertainment was good, they have the latest movies in the entertainment console in each seat. All in all the money that I paid for was worth every cent and I would highly recommend if you can accommodate a bit more dollars on top of your usual budget air costs.
label: positive

text: Topped Up Staff were super friendly, always on the go. Buzz for an attendant and they are there. No request is too difficult. Onboard entertainment is awesome, something for everyone. Drinks and snacks are served all night, without even having to call for an attendant. Nice airline and always make a point of using them when flying to Asia. An all round great flying experience!
label: positive

text:
In flight service is good and the office is terribly non-cooperative The inflight attendants are very good in service.  In flight entertainment is below average.  You don't have too many choices of movies. Cleanliness is good.
We had horrifying time till almost the day of departure due to change of name (expanded form of surname in place of initials).  The office people are merciless and not interested in cooperating to customers' requests in spite of agreeing to pay 50USD for the name change.  Had a very bad experience.
label: neutral

text:
Excited about going on an A380-800 but the plane was already delayed. I was excited about going on an A380-800 for the first time as Id never flown in one before, however that was tainted by already receiving an email at 6am that morning to say that they had rebooked our onward connection from Singapore Changai to Brisbane international into a 12 hour layover as the flight out of JFK NY left 3hrs late and we wouldn't be able to connect to our original flight.
We checked in ok and got a 15 euro meal voucher each to spend at the airport for food due to the delay.
The plane came in to Frankfurt on the new scheduled time and was turned around quickly by the ground crew and we were soon boarding for our flight to Singapore. We had booked seats as I wanted to be able to see the engines and the seat was excellent for this. We booked seats 43A&B which were forward economy seats so we were the last group to board.
The seat was a standard economy seat with the only issue being a small metal box cutting into the footwell for seat 43A. Not much but just enough to be a pain.
I really enjoyed take off and landing with the view of the engines.
The service again from the Air Singapore crew was excellent. Very attentive and professional. The inflight entertainment system, KrisWorld, is excellent and has something for everyone. It was a 12hr flight which is long when flying in economy.
The A380-800 was very clean inside.
One thing I did note on the bottom level window seat was the bulkhead is about 9 inches away from the seat so it makes resting the pillow against the window impossible to sleep on. When on the A350's, the gap is better for this.
Still, an excellent flight and great service from the Singapore team. Although we had a delay, they had rebooked everything and informed us every step of the way and helped everyone make connections when the plane landed in Singapore. Still not a fan of 12 hour layovers though, but they did their best for us. Will definitely fly these guys again.
label: positive

text: Pleasent journey Journey was enjoyable. Food was good. Accessories given were useful n appropriate. Hygiene was maintained well.
label: positive

text: Happy Holiday Excellent service and very comfortable on A350 900 plane very clean and good movies on the flight Crew very good giving water keeping us hydrated
label: positive

text: good excellent great and excellent. Highly recomment to all my friends. Singapore airlines is way best flight ever.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines always a safe bet On the way we had the emergency seats as we paid for the privilege.The only issue I had it was right next to the gallows and toilets.There were plenty of seats in premium economy but they chose not to upgrade.
label: positive

text:
Singapore holiday First class flight with all our food requierments met to a excellent standard.
Gluten free meals where excellent and service was also excellent.
Direct flight from Adelaide being only 7 hours 30 minutes.
label: positive

text: Great airline I love flying Singapore Air! Service is always so good and the flights are always smooth and on time. Connecting flights are also seamless. However, I recently flew their segment with a technical stop in Canberra and I was confused why they needed to have all the passengers leave the plane just to set down or pick up more passengers. They should have explained the reason for the stop. It seemed like it was more than just to pick up passengers. Still, the remaining flight was top quality! Love it 💕
label: positive

text:
Save for Business Class if you can. Absolute heaven.
After flying Singapore to Paris in Economy, the sheer luxury of the extra space in Business Class was pronounced.
After spending a few complimentary hours in the Singapore Kris Lounge at Heathrow, we were delivered to our boarding gate by buggy and ushered immediately to our seats (more like mini cabins). Champagne & orange juice were available, with drink order for after takeoff taken.
Just playing with all of the buttons and gadgets was fun, finding noise-cancelling headphones, a pack of slippers, socks, eyeshades and toothbrush, and a larger screen for watching the inflight entertainment.
The best bit, however, is the massive amount of room. No fighting with your neighbour for elbow room, no lack of room for your legs, and of course the whole 'pod' converts to a fully flat bed for a much better chance of sleep. Cushioning in the bed position is rather thin, but better than sitting up for 13 hours.
Dinner was served on real plates with real cutlery and glasses and never seemed to stop coming, with each course served individually, not all at once on one tray as happens in economy.
Service is provided quietly & competently, with ready assistance to set up the bed.
The cabin staff even use your name!
Longhaul flights are not fun, but business class makes the experience more enjoyable.
We wer not looking forward to the next leg, Singapore to Brisbane, in economy.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Very good service on the return flight to London and interestingly, much better quality food than on the outward flight. I wonder if Singapore Airlines use different caterers on flights from Changi? Vegetarian food was really very good. Service levels in general were excellent - even in the cheap seats where we were! Only disappointment was the limited choice of up to date movies.
label: positive

text: Disappointing! Very disappointed with amount of leg room compared to Air New Zealand who we had flown with from Auckland to Singapore.  The food was appalling - I have no idea how they could justify saying it was Premium Economy.  If that is the case I dread to think what they served in Economy.  The service was not wonderful and the bathrooms were pretty disgusting after a few hours.
label: negative

text: Great firendly service Found Singapore Airlines staff to provide excellent customer seervice, good food and drink service. Only regret I wasnt in business class!
label: positive

text:
Really disappointed  Must say I was looking forward to my first class seat to Singapore.
