However, the 777-300 has the old style first class seats. Bed was hard, could feel a number of joins in the seat. Wine was good, food was ok. For the price I wouldn’t do it again
label: negative

text:
Lapsing sometimes into the ordinary. I can't remember the flight number, but it was the 0720 from Changi.
It didn't start well after the Terminal of departure was changed from 3 to 1. The big problem with this terminal, is the gates have no bathroom facilities once you pass security.
As we are Kriss Flyer Gold members the boarding was fine and we were soon seated in a new kind of economy seat. They don't seem as deep as the previous ones, but in my opinion, were quite comfortable.
An added trial for the crew was the persistent turbulence for the first half of the journey and having to deal with passengers that think the seat belt sign doesn't mean them. This despite the entire crew being strapped in!
The meal was adequate and quite tasty, but due to the conditions, the tray remained on your table for a long time.
The meal on arrival has really deteriorated into basically a pie! Nothing else but a drink to go with it. Looking around the plane, there were an awful lot of them refused or left. I don't think it is adequate to dish up a dry pie in a cardboard box! It smacks more of Air Asia than a Premier Airline.
The crew were courteous and efficient, without being over friendly. Perhaps this is how they are told to behave.
Singapore Airlines is still one of the best, but cracks are beginning to show on some flights.
label: positive

text: As always too dark to read The Flight was quite alright , Meals had a good variety , You could order as many drinks as you wanted, we had to change flights in Singapore, enough time to buy too much at the duty free shops there and  there were lots of restaurants and food stalls to choose from - all in all we had  a good journey!
label: positive

text:
Upgrade to Premium Economy again Overall a good airline and staff are always very good. Premium economy though is a let down in comparison to Airnz.
On Singapore it a small section and annoying they keep curtains up separating economy as you use the same toilets.
Food and drink is the sane also unless you can use book the cook.
Ok seats are better and screen larger. But Airnz certainly win hands down with their offerings.
label: neutral

text:
Worst airline I traveled with this airline numerous times and I have never had good service. They are expensive, the luggage allowance is less than other airlines and the food is horrible. 

On one flight the staff didn't even serve me food. I was a  breasfeeding mother at that point which also meant my baby had less to drink that day. When I spoke to customer care they played it off as me being fussy over the food and dismissed my email. Hard to be fussy if you arent even served.

The check in staff is rude and don't seem to know what they are doing. 
 When I asked the flight attendant for warm water to feed my baby I waited 15min and she returned with  unwashed bottle and ice cold water. Everything seems to be to much effort for them. 

I am so tired of flying with an airline that treat you like they are doing you a favor. They seem to forget that their customers pay to be on their airplanes.

Avoid them if possible.
label: negative

text:
Cozy and comfy... Pros:
Had to travel to the Netherlands for a business trip. I have travelled on SQ before but that was a number of years ago.
I was pleasantly surprised by the content provided on the in-flight entertainment . Lots of movies; new and classics . Music content is enormous with a broad genre. There is also a vast selection of different news & documentaries available. Not to mention games for the kids, too...
Food; as with past experiences; is very tasteful & well portioned.

Cons:
- Was charged data roaming on the flight. Not the fault of the airline's; but would definitely appreciate more prominent "data on board" signage or even video instructions via the entertainment portal.
- Being an audio engineer, this is a pet peeve.... The quality of the provided ear buds is pathetic.
In the words of Caroline & Don Davies - "If bad sound is fatal, audio would be the leading cause of death" - And I certainly wouldn't want that... ;-)
label: positive

text: Very cramped and very hot I expected more. The lounge in Melbourne was pretty tired and needs a refresh. Seating was quite cramped compared to other business offerings. Also the seats need to be folded down which breaks up momentum when ready to sleep. Service was OK, but not over friendly. My colleague and I seated next to each other were served at separate times. No continuity. lounge in Singapore very good. My biggest gripe was the temperature on both flights. Roasting hot which made it very uncomfortable. If given a choice I would use others next time.
label: neutral

text: SQ 469 Had the worst flight ever with Singapore airlines. Service level and quality of the food have declined significantly. Even Srilankan is still better than sia.
label: negative

text:
Air travel Singapore Airlines Nice to travel.
Courtoeus staff.
Cleanliness and neatness in saloon of the plane.
Good Indian vegetarian food available.
Attentive crew members.
Recommended for  good veg indian food while on Singapore airlines
label: positive

text:
Excellent as usual from this carrier! First class service all round and up to the standard we expect from Singapore Airlines.
As we also required wheelchair assist this made our long trip much more comfortable
label: positive

text: Lovely customer service and quick refund:) I wanted to say thank you to Singapore airlines for a great refund experience. Straight after my flight was cancelled I was emailed with details on how to apply for a full refund. It was a quick and simple process which I wasn't used to for airlines! I called a month later to ask about the refund and a few days later had ALL my money back, a lot quicker than the 4-6 weeks they said it would take. Friendly and efficient. Hoping to fly with you soon!
label: positive

text: Great service and product Flew on the new first product. Service was amazing as usual, seat was good and the bed even better. A good first class product, highly recommended. Cabin is quiet and the new lalique amenities bag is great as are the pyjamas.
label: positive

text: Time to Fly Traveled back on Airbus A380- the legroom was great. Both husband and myself are near the 6 foot mark and the seats were not sitting on the knees. The staff were great and the service was fantastic.
label: positive

text: Long haul South Nothing was too much bother for the cabin staff and kept me well refreshed on all legs of my journey.Made the connections comfortably and the on board entertainment along with the comfortable seating and clean spacious cabin meant the journey was very pleasant given the distance traveled. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend them for anyone planning a long haul.
label: positive

text:
Just so inconsistent... This was my second trip from Australia to Europe and back with Singapore Airlines this year and just like last time, it was a very inconsistent experience. The flights from Sydney - Singapore and back were like flying with an entirely different, budget airline. Old, grubby, cramped planes (seriously, WHEN are they going to retire or at least refurbish these horrible old B777s!? They are such an embarrassment for a supposedly world class airline!), food basically inedible and very minimal. At 170cm I'm of average height, yet spent the whole flights with my knees jammed up against the seat in front of me. The European sectors were much better - new, clean A380s, much nicer food, a bit more leg room.

The staff were mostly pleasant, flights on time, boarding efficient, in-flight entertainment average. Either way, I'm going to choose a different airline next time.
label: neutral

text: Great service in Singapore Airline I have been flying frequently with Singapore airline. Their flight attendants are always very courteous and friendly. Flight often departs on time. Hope they continue to keep up with the good service on board.
label: positive

text: great service, nothing to much Flown with an airbus, seats maybe 1 or 2 inches wider than teh average economy seats, seats also slide to make it more comfortable, foodrest should be fitted on all airplanes. Excellent service, menucard, nightsnacks ( sandwich) good. on time with a smile.
label: positive

text: Comfortable plane, great Service Very comfortable flight, toilets always cleaned and ready for use by the next passenger. Their experienced pilot gave us a good and restful comfortable ride, by respecting our private space and need for maximum rest. Enjoyed their good selection of cheeses. Had Superb spinach frittata for breakfast. And was treated to a Delicious hot chocolate made with milk. And my entire journey was made special by Marcella Stephany, one of the flight stewards who was amazingly wonderful in all ways! She was sensitive to my requirements, most polite, gentle and superb and serving from her heart, in her responses to requests. Truly the embodiment of Singapore Airlines’ philosophy of service excellence!
label: neutral

text: Best flight experience Flew to Singapore & Back to New Delhi from Bangkok...most pleasant staff...guess the most comfortable economy seats...the food was very good(Indian)...in flight entertainment is excellent..be sure to take Kris flier membership to explore it to fullest...i booked 3 months in advance & almost saved 50%...truely a 5 star airline
label: positive

text: Excellent airline Very friendly and supportive.  I had forgotten some holiday paperwork at airport and the Singapore staff were amazing.  The flight itself was the usual excellent standard. Great food and drinks and lovely smiling faces
label: positive

text: When only the best will do I have only ever flown with Singapore Airlines as I find them to be the best whether it is Business Class or Economy they can never do enough for you.
label: positive

text: Good flights - very attentive and professional service. We recently flew from Sydney to Rome on Singapore Airlines. The first leg on an A380 was probably the best flight I have been on - helped by the fact that we had an empty seat next to us. The flight was so smooth my wife didn’t even realise we had taken off. The staff were excellent throughout the 8 plus hours. The second leg was on a smaller plane and wasn’t quite as good, although again, I couldn’t fault the flight crew. The only downside ( and the reason for the 8 rating) is the food. Like most airline food, it is fairly ordinary. Singapore is still a great way to fly!
label: positive

text:
Not what it once was I agree with a previous review. It is still a first class airline but it is not head and shoulders above the rest as it used to be. We flew Sydney - Paris return, a total of four legs.
The food was just average and again we had to wait for trays to be cleared, difficult when you want to use the toilet.
The aircraft didn't appear to be new and one had a lot of rattles and noises. It looked as though the upholstery was parting company with the seat shell on one aircraft.
Generally the cabin staff were very good, but again not really any more special than other first rate airlines in my opinion. The toilets were always clean and tidy when I visited them. I haven't flown SA for a few years and I must say I was a little disappointed really.
I would fly with them again as long as the price is right as I don't believe that I would pay a premium just to fly with Singapore Airlines. It was still a pleasant experience flying with Singapore Airlines, just not the great one I was expecting.
label: neutral

text: Friendly crews  Had an awesome, safe and sound flight with Singapore airlines (SG 452). Clean restroom and cabin helpful friendly crews. Delicious foods. With some entertainment from the cabin. There are iPad that you can listen music,watch whole the time of movies while flying, and etc.  Thank you for bringing us joy in our trip.
label: positive

text: Good experience Check in was fast and friendly. That left us some time to explore the shops at Narita airport. Cabin crew was attentive and polite, and the food quite good. There was a good selection of movies to keep us occupied, and pretty soon, after a six-hour flight we were collecting our luggage and clearing immigration.
label: positive

text: Premium economy is worth it The extra room in premium economy was totally worth it for me.  The seats along the windows had even more room than those seats in the middle of the cabin.  I had more room in the seat and leg room area.
label: positive

text: Beware  Extra Leg Room Seats We always fly SQ and generally have nothing but praise but on this occasion we payed for extra leg room seats.  The seats were situated adjacent to one of the galleys and it was hectic.  This was a night flight and the lights of the galley were annoying and the constant movement of people meant no rest.  This of course is a case of poor choice on our part but my issue is that you pay extra for these seats and they provide you with overall less comfort then a standard seat.  So this rating applies to the seats and having to pay rather then the overall airline experience.
label: negative

text: Comfortable flight Flight was very comfortable. With the Airbus 380 we had enough space for our legs even in the economy class. Also the multimedia was very nice. Service and food was great.
label: positive

text:
A great way to fly  From check in to the farewell, the service was fantastic. 
The seats were comfortable and fair leg room. 
The food was great and regular water offered. 
The choice of drinks also good. 
Highly recommend.
label: positive

text:
Disappointed I booked Singapore Airlines based on other people’s experiences and reviews.
My flight from Perth TO Japan was excellent but the flight FROM Japan to Perth was a disappointment. Vegan meals going to Japan we’re tasty but the return flights consisted of plain boiled vegetables for both the evening meal and breakfast. Yuk.
We had to change aircraft hubbing through Singapore and the last leg was in an old rattling aircraft. Not what expect from a “full service” first class airline.
Next time I think I’ll travel Cathay Pacific.
label: neutral

text:
Still one of the best Our first flight on an A350 and the seating was excellent, both the ‘normal’ seating and the lay flat bed.  The plane was almost brand new so everything on board was immaculate.  

The check in ar Düsseldorf was seamless and the checkin staff were efficent and extremely pleasant.

As always the service on board was all one could ask for and again, as previously the food was excellent with a good wine selection.

Singapore never fail to impress and they are definitely up there as one of the leading aitrlines if not the best.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic airline. A return flight from Brisbane to Bangkok for my annual holiday.
Departure and arrival times where good. In flight entertainment was fantastic although the audio on the return flight from Singapore was very loud even at the lowest level, plane looked rather new.
Easy check in at both airports. Check in and cabin staff where great.
Food was a little poor compared to past years, not all bad but the main meals where very below par.
Leg room in economy was ok, tall people might like to pay a little extra for more legroom though.
A solid 9/10 from me, lift your food quality for a perfect score .
label: positive

text: SQ324 Excellent This was our second leg of the flight from Auckland to Singapore and to Amsterdam. The service was excellent, we received priority boarding because we were travelling with kids. The food we excellent, the inflight entertainment was great and the aircraft was new and clean.
label: positive

text:
Best Customer Service, Best Onbopard Service The checkin, the boarding, the onboard service were all excellent and smooth. The most impressive were staff on board: kind, attentive, gracious and professional.
The food was good (the wine was ok). The entertainment system excellent and user friendly. 
Overall, business class is worth the extra cost (comparing to other carriers) our mileage (if you choose to use mileage for an upgrade). I recommend Singapore Airlines highly, especially on long flights.
label: positive

text:
Well oiled machine. Singapore Airlines have the customer service aspect down to a fine art. Hot towels for economy passengers are a bit of a rarity as are printed menus.
The plane on this leg was a rather tired 777. Attentive staff constantly offered water and juice through the trip and there was a snack bar to help yourself from down the back of the plane.
I was surprised by the excellent quality of the food. I wasn't expecting much from economy class food but it was really tasty. Very bravely, they served Brocolli as part of a starter and it was perfectly cooked. Even when I cook Broccoli it's tough or mushy.  They also have cracked serving bread that is edible.
Economy travel on 11 hour flights is more of an endurance test that a pleasure but Singapore does its best to make the experience as painless as possible.
label: positive

text: Family trip December Business class to Incheon. It was a morning flight. First time on the new plane. Find that the seat seems to be smaller compared to the ones I took previously. Still, the length and position of the leg room is not meant for people with slightly long legs and the slanted angle somehow is not good for long hours of rest should you have a long flight. But still cleanliness and service deserved a thumbs up.
label: positive

text: Really disappointing - go BA Had heard great things but service and quality of seating far inferior to that of BA. Food terrible and don't believe it was any different to economy. Poor and slow service. No flight socks, eyeshades, etc. Would not recommend on the basis of this flight.
label: negative

text: We see why they are listed #1 in the world! Outstanding from the moment we checked in at the airport  and including the Lounge. The service is terrific. The flight attendants are extremely helpful and caring. The food was delicious.
label: positive

text: Never again Have been waiting on a refund for more than 6 months and still nowhere. All communications have been through emails and responses have been just generic template responses delaying on the refund. Their international contact number is a joke which never connects.
label: negative

text: very good airline, excellent service and great food, very punctual airline. great flight, great service and excellent food, I have often travelled in Singapore airlines, and its a great airline to fly. they are very efficient and punctual. I even wrote a review for the crew on board
label: positive

text: Racist staff My family and I flew from Jakarta,Indonesia to Mumbai,India. The plane was predominately full of Indians as we were on a flight to Mumbai. The Singaporean staff were curt to the Indians on the plane, and seemed to think they were superior to the passengers. It was clear racism. As and Indian American I have faced many racist situations ,yet this was one of the worst. As I was heading back from the bathroom, the stewardess was in the middle of the aisle, I politely asked if she could move as I needed to get to my seat since the seatbelt sign was on, she curtly replied, “Wait your turn” as she turned back around. It almost seemed as if I was the staff and she was the paying passenger. The very same lady decided to act in a rude manner towards me the entire flight, from meal service, and even where I got of the flight. The flight itself was 5 hours long, and was hard to endure with an arrogant staff. While the facilities on the plane were alright, I would not recommend Singaporean Airlines to anyone who wants a pleasant racism free journey to their destination.
label: negative

text: Still waiting for refund They told me it only take 4-6 weeks for the amount to be credited back, its more then 6 weeks already and I still havent received the refund yet. So disappointed.
label: negative

text: Excellent flight experience On Dreamliner business class. High standard service! Wide variety of food and beverage selection. Pre-booked the cook, the food was great. Cabin Crew were attentive, efficient and genuine. They make me feel comfortable and at ease.
label: positive

text: Avoid Singapore Airlines giving 0 frequent flyer miles on long-haul economy flights;use another on same route with 100%! I am a frequent flyer with Star Alliance and have purchased as many as 3 round-the-world (RTW) tickets each year in economy.Last year, Air Canada wrote the ticket but one long-haul sector with Singapore Airlines yielded 0 frequent flyer miles. All other airline sectors gave 100%. This year using the Star Alliance online tool, it was Lufthansa who wrote the ticket and I deliberately chose other airlines ... e.g. Air New Zealand for Singapore to Auckland sector. But when I needed to change the date of that flight... one of the flexibilities of RTW tickets...the direct flight on Air New Zealand had no availability and I was booked to fly from Singapore to Brisbane on Singapore Airlines and Brisbane to Auckland on Air New Zealand. On all other sectors of this trip .. about 33,000 miles..I received at least 100% distance miles. Not so on Singapore Airlines which uses a special booking class category that yields 0 points. Twice burned, there is no further incentive for me to fly on Singapore Airlines! Tell your travel agents to beware of the various economy booking classes on Singapore Airlines which award 0 points and take another carrier flying that same route with 100%.
label: negative

text:
SINGAPORE AIRLINES --BANGKOK--SINGAPORE --ECONOMY 17 JAN--I had not flown SQ for some years and chose to see the Economy class for a change.
We were delayed on leaving due to the incoming flight being also delayed--no drama..
The Boeing 787-10 was immaculately clean and smelt so fresh.
Service was simply amazing -- so professional and polite - excellent breakfast served.
Luggage came very promptly..
SQ is always so reliable.
label: positive

text:
Great Onboard really crappy pre flight expereince Pre flight experience is a total mess. Lounges are crowded, dirty tables and empty food containers. It almost felt like I had come to free buffet and riots could break out at any tine. If you expect premium pre flight experience Singapore airlines has totally lost it. 

Same applied to pre boarding experience (maybe my exp is limited to flights to India) 
The staff is rude and ill manners and security and boarding is like herding cattle in a barn. The holding area is cramped with barely 1 seat for 3 passengers.

I had heard a lot about SIngapore airlines and the experience. This is definitely closer to the worst performing airlines and not best.
On-board product was great no issues with that
label: neutral

text: Singapore - My top pick I always try to fly Singapore airlines on a long haul flight.  Service is great and so are the amenities.  Entertainment is great too.  Leg room, like most flights, not enough but seats are pretty comfortable.  Staff have always been obliging and the food, like most flights, is ok.
label: positive

text:
Great flight! Good food, very good taste, timely offered.
Good collection of films to entertain during flights.
Helpful staff to respond to your needs.
On time flights - delay in departure is covered by on time arrival.
label: positive

text:
Flight service Touched by the service of SQ flight stewardess en route to Yangoon. One of the stewardess addressed me by my name without introduction. She actually over-heard another steward greeting me by my name whilst boarding and registered it in her mind. 

Although its a small thing only but its the small things in life which really matters, and makes your day great.

Well done SIA!
label: positive

text:
Lots of sweet talk in advert, zero action in reality Gave up. Sent 4 emails, filled in forms in their website, tried to call numbers in London and Singapore. Just need a simple clarification but couldn't get through to anyone. Multiple auto-replies :-(

Bought another ticket with another airlines. Grateful that there are other airlines. Wasted purchased ticket with Singapore Airlines but wouldn't risk not being able to fly as no confirmation regarding flight can be had.

Will not waste money buying their tickets anymore and definitely will not advise anyone to take their flight.
label: negative

text: it was a nice safe flight we were traveling with my family. I am with my wife and 2 daughters, one is below 2 yrs old. Since we have a kid we are given a bassinet seat. leg room is superb haha of course its because of the bassinet area :) boarding is ok everyone is helpful as always. Take off and Landing are smooth the kids didnt even bother the changes in their surroundings.
label: positive

text:
This is Nightmare!!!! We had!! a booking in Singapore to Lombok and back (on 10 February to 17 in February). A morning when I woke up, an email arrived, that somebody-somhow deleted our booking and we get back the money also, although we didn't want that!!!!
We have to fly there, because there are programs and accommodation reservations, what we cannot and don't want to cancel! 
Since then, two weeks have passed, we wrote more emails, but besides the automatic replay and they we asked for the patinece, I didn't get any answer and solution about what happened.
We need this tickets, but the price now much higher, like when we bought it. 
It is becoming a nightmare! We are about to go, on holiday and have no tickets, but we bought it on time....
Of course I could buy the ticket again, but at a much higher price! But I don't want, because I bought in the right time.
I will travel 10,000 kilometers to Singapore to travel to Lombok from there. But how can I get started?
label: negative

text: The best of the best!! What can you say that hasn't already been said - Singapore Airlines is a joy to travel with. The Business Class product is second to none - on a brand new A350, lie-flat seats, extremely comfortable, a very good inflight entertainment system, in-flight Wi-Fi (free for Business Class passengers), a very attentive & professional cabin crew (champagne and hot towel before take-off) and a very tasty inflight meal. There's a reason why Singapore Airlines is repeatedly voted the No.1 airline in the world - because they are!! Will certainly travel on them again and would recommend them to anyone else.
label: positive

text: Great flight with wonderful staff This was a daytime flight on a Boeing 777. This aircraft was fairly modern, with a large screen and lots of movies. The seats were OK, and the aircraft was clean. The outstanding feature of the flight was the service provided on board. The meal was great, and the service was friendly and efficient. I have never known an airline that collects your meal so quickly after it's finished. A big plus for us. We even took the time to E mail SIA and compliment the staff on their service. First time with SIA but not the last.
label: positive

text:
Return Itinerary  Having flown to Brisbane on the 31st August my wife and I made the return journey to Singapore on September 17th being seated in seat numbers 43a & 43b Economy cabin the care and treatment received by the cabin crew by far exceeded that of our next flight in Upper Economy long haul BA to London. 
We fully intend to use Singapore airlines for all future flights to the Far East and Australia it is plain to see how they achieve best global airlines status.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic as always We travelled on two different airlines on this business trip. Singapore was by far the 
pick of the 2 airlines. Great service,  nice meals and a lovely new modern plane. I have flown many times with Singapore both business class and economy, I have always had a great experience. They are my airline of choice.....thanks Singapore 🇸🇬
label: positive

text:
Love it It was my first time traveling with Singapore and I enjoyed it 
 The staff were very kind the meals were abit odd. I do definitely recommend this airline
label: positive

text:
Excellent Friendly service Welcomed on board with a smile. At my seat I was offered assistance with putting my carry on bags in the overhead locker and offered a beverage. The seats are spacious and comfortable...the choice of viewing on the consoles are varied, offering new releases and classic movies and TV. Like wise with music...
The crew were attentive through out the flight, regularly offering water and other beverages. Food options were very good, fresh and delicious meals, served with good quality range of wines. I would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again...
label: positive

text:
A happy customer I flew SQ890 from Singapore to Hong Kong on 16 August 2019.

I would like to commend your staff Mr Heidizayat & his team, for their remarkable customer service that leaves a fond flying experience which definitely captured my attention and loyalty to your brand. 

Despite changing three times on the headphone, problems still reflected on the sound output system in my seat.
While I was about to gave up enjoying the entertainment, Mr Heidizayat and his team patiently searched from empty seat to seats, tested on the audio system till perfection before guiding me to the new seat.  

Such patient, thoughtful & laudable customer service should be noted and I hope all you can emulate from Mr Heidizayat & his team.

SINGAPORE AIRLINES, you are WORLD BEST!!
Keep it up!!
label: positive

text: 12.5 hours is a long time when lie flat bed is uncomfortable Took an eternity to get in the A380 in the air due to traffic build up at Frankfurt and this resulted in us being 30 minutes behind schedule. Still on board staff were superb, meal and snack options were excellent, and drinks list was also excellent. Negatives were the poor movie choices and the poor layout of the seating capsules. Meant the space was quite crowded and the lay flat bed was a little uncomfortable. Will be interesting to compare to our last leg later this week in a Boeing 777.
label: positive

text: Not as expected No help what so ever, booked business no meals catered for me. Contacted them tens of times no assistance, no number to call localy in my area. NEVER Again, Scoot as well because it runs the flight from jeddah to singapore and its their fault I didnt get my meals though paid for them.
label: negative

text: Pleasant & Peaceful Flights It was a night flight to Singapore so we were served dinner. I opted for a fruit platter but noticed there were only 5 medium size pieces of fruit on the dinner plate. Wished they had given more. However the seats were comfortable, staff were friendly and we had a pleasant and peaceful flight.
label: positive

text: Amazing airline Wonderful airline.flight was delayed on first leg Sydney to Singapore,so we missed connecting flight to Phuket..Due to bad blustery winds in Sydney..Got to Singapore,airline put us up in Singapore overnight all free and meals included and next flight out next morn to Phuket..great treatment and friendly helpful staff..highly recommend Singapore airlines..
label: positive

text: Trip to China Smooth flights.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Food was good.  Boarding and disembarking easy no problems.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Airline We flew from Perth to Bangkok via Singapore on the 23/12/2018. We were in Economy class. Plenty of leg room and the seats were quite spacious. The cabin crew were very friendly and helpful. I have now flown with Singapore Airlines on a number of occasions and would recommend the airlines to anyone.
label: positive

text: Mrs Perfect flights. Wonderful crew. Even sang happy birthday to my husband. Received cake and candles. Highly recommend
label: positive

text: SIA demands client's credit card b/4 boarding the plane & AVOID seat 41C or 41H! My client in Japan purchased the ticket for me in August and I flew 1 Dec, SIN to Tokyo. Only 1 week prior did they tell me I needed to present the actual credit card on which the ticket was purchased. This had happened once before but only on SIA. Japan SIA told my client no need to present the card. I tried to verify with SIA in Singapore but they said cc was needed. Japanese client checked again with SIA in Japan... no card needed. Back @ SIA Singapore & guy in charge writes, I MUST have the card to board. Finally, I'm told the client paid cash. AHH...cannot show cash. 6 years ago with SIA same problem and the cancelled my ticket and I had to buy a new one at 3 times the fee from their ticket counter to get on the plane. Never with any other airline and I've flown over 2 million miles, ONLY SIA. Archaic, foolish system. At the airport, no one there to check for a card anyway! Never had this problem with Emirates, Oman Air, Etihad, American, Delta, Malaysian Air, Garuda, Air France, British Air, Namibian Air, South African Airways, Air Israel or any other airline... just SIA. One problem ON the flight. I paid extra for a bulkhead seat, 41H flying out of SIN and 41C on the return. BAD SEAT! The seat selection map shows the aisles are straight. They are NOT. No TV screen in front of me... it's folded down on the side. The aisle makes a dogleg to the window side. My feet ended up in the aisle and I had to keep moving them because the crew had to pull the cart over my foot area and people leaving the premium economy to use the toilets behind me kept stepping on my feet... both coming and going to the toilets. Why pay $32+ to have your feet walked on AND no overhead bin or place to store luggage in front?
label: negative

text: Professional, great service and comfort Flew economy from Manchester to Singapore and then onto Brisbane and back again. The professionalism of the staff was first class, friendly considerate and firm when they needed to be. The food was excellent and my wife whose gluten free also had good meals. The entertainment system is excellent with large touchscreen monitors and the latest films. The seats were comfortable and had decent relining and foot rests, it was easy to see why they have regularly been voted the best airline in the world.
label: positive

text: auckland to mumbai via singapore Flight was ontime for entire journey food and sevice was excellent,staff was coordial and housekeeping in flights was excellent.
label: positive

text: Disappointed faithful customers Having been more than happy with Singapore in the past we booked again - tickets that were more expensive than anyone else. The price did not justify the service. The seat was so cramped I couldn’t sit with my knees together. The toilet stank before we even took off (men’s urinal). Pre dinner drinks don’t exist anymore (on any of the recent 6 Singapore flights we took this only happened on the last one) and it seems that the serving of alcohol is being scaled right down - a gin and tonic was almost too much trouble and not readily available. The food was generally terrible and again been scaled right back - terrible white rolls, ice ctreams for dessert or nothing, gluggy tough meat courses, no fresh fruit or eggs for breakfast. I used to look forward to having a relaxing drink and a meal on Singapore - not on these flights. The staff were generally snappy and it seems, over all that the focus has gone to more expensive seats. Unfair and disappointing for the majority of us in economy as the seats were still damn expensive.
label: negative

text: Great dog-friendly service Started off shaky because of another airline delayed flight. The gate attendant actually called me to ask if I would make the flight. When I told them I wasn't going to make it, they changed my flight without charge. In San Francisco, they went to great lengths to help me with my ESA dog and seating. Ended up with whole back row to myself and Rousey. Flight attendants during flight were very helpful. Would recommend for anyone needing to travel with animals.
label: positive

text: Don't miss your flight on this airline We had purchased 2 tickets plus bought 20 KG baggage allowance for $130.31 to fly from Ho Chi Minh City to Singapore. This was late 2018. Instead of 14.50, I read 4:50 for departure time and we ended up missing our flight.  We were not able to purchase tickets at the airport and had to do it on our phone.  Unfortunately I kept getting stuck and in the end had to ask for help from one of the women behind the counter. She booked our flight and it cost us $614.  This was the same itinerary, just 2 hours later! A grave mistake that we paid dearly for!!  But I don't think I'll ever choose to fly Singapore air again.
label: negative

text: Top 3 Airlines in The World We have taken this Flight a Few times to Singapore,Always a Great experience.Due to Business Class ,we were able to use The Polaris Lounge at SFO,i have to say we were very surprised by the Lounge in US.we have been using the AA Lounge and PP Lounges all over But this was very Good.check in was Great,Service always Top Notch! Seats were Good ,Turn Down Service Good,Only Blemish may be the selection of movies.Food was the Highlight!
label: positive

text:
Premium economy the extra room in the seats was very good, only issues are the whole of economy walk past whilst you are trying to settle .
Priority boarding and getting your luggage along with ease at check-in really help mitigate the price you pay extra

One issue is that when everyone tilts their seats it is a little difficult to get out of your seat.

Again the age of the plane effects how the seats are laid out and the entertainment screen
label: positive

text:
Love it Service is great and seats are comfort. Airline staff is very nice and willing to help always. 
i took flight from Dubai to singapore and return both sides got the comfortable seat environment and food was great
label: positive

text: Excellent flight  Excellent flight to Singapore- new plane, exceptional service and decent food. Even in economy it felt good. Service streets ahead of many other carriers.
label: positive

text:
Awful What the hell happened to Singapore Airlines!? Used to be superb and I happily paid a premium over other airlines expecting a comfortable and enjoyable experience. 

Economy flight from Singapore to Melbourne was absolute torture. Incredibly cramped cabin, genuinely felt much worse than a Ryanair type configuration... simply not suitable for an 8 hour flight. Food was atrocious, completely inedible. Absolutely stunned they are charging top prices for this rubbish. Took a couple of budget Jetstar internal flights whilst in Australia and they put Singapore to shame.

I  had actually upgraded the long first leg, Manchester to Singapore to business class...food and service was top class for this and I actually found the seat pretty comfortable for sitting...but as you will read elsewhere, the bizarre angle of the footwell makes achieving a comfortable sleeping position nigh on impossible. If you're going to splash out you might aswell use Emirates or Qatar and get similar service but with a more practical bed.

Truly disappointing overall, cancelled my return flights and travelled back with Qatar. Never again SIA I'm afraid.
label: negative

text: Superb service We flew out at 9.30 am  bang on time. The cabin crew were fantastic extremely polite and ultra efficient. The onboard meals were excellent. As it was my mothers 80th birthday the crew surprised her with a cake with a candle, sang happy birthday and gave her a small gift. How very thoughtful. I would recommend this airline to everyone.
label: positive

text: Staff  Excellent, Plane Comfort Not So The staff were excellent, the plane spotless, if I had a complaint it would be about the uncomfortable seats 350-900 plane, no lumbar support, Glad it was only a 5 hour flight.
label: positive

text: One of my favorites  Everything about SA is well done.  On time service, quality of the airplanes, meals (!!!), and their personnel.  Really a great airline, probably one of the 3 or 4 best in the world.
label: positive

text:
Cancelled flight without notice Letting other travelers know to avoid Singapore Airlines after they cancelled one leg of my flight without any kind of notification. Now, 48 hrs away from travel date and school holidays starting, I have little chance of organizing an alternative. That's right, after hours on the phone they have no help/replacement and urge me to cancel the whole flight instead. Even though flights are available on their website - it is almost as if they would rather resell my ticket.
I booked the trip early November last year and expected disruptions. Sure enough, two of the six flights were affected by changes which resulted in longer layovers - this is what I am prepared to accept. However, to leave me high and dry just hours away from the trip, no notice and no help is unacceptable.
I have sent three messages to Singapore Airlines via their precious web form: no response; wasted time on the useless chat bot, can't open my booking online as they simply say 'to get in touch with an SA office'. Plus several calls and when I finally got through it became apparent operators are trained to deflect, not help.
label: negative

text: Joyful flight Once again had the most relaxing flight possible ,, always service with a smile ,,, up to date movies at hand ,,, landed feeling ready for the adventure ahead ,,,
label: positive

text:
Worst Experience Ever, Unlike The Usual Experience This is the worst experience that I have had with Singapore Airlines or any other Airlines. I have been part of the Travel Trade for over 25 years and have always vouched for Singapore Airlines. I never expected such carelessness & casual attitude from Singapore Airlines.

My bad experience started with the Singapore Airlines office in Ahmedabad. They personally know me as well as our company for over a decade now. We have been giving them business for almost 2 decades. Since, I was traveling myself, I requested for certain good seats, if possible. However sometimes the Airlines sell these seats (emergency row seats with more legroom) and hence I had only requested them to keep a small message in their airline system to allocate these seats to me if they are not taken till last minute. They promised the same but never did anything. In fact they blocked 2 seats for me & my wife on two separate rows !!!

I had selected special meals when I booked the tickets, almost a month in advance. It is also printed in my tickets - AVML meals. However when we boarded the aircraft they had no instructions about our meals ??? We are strict vegetarians and hence we said that we will not eat in this case. Later a junior air hostess came to us and told us that they have some different kind of vegetarian meals for us. She told me that some other guests refused to eat their meals and hence she was obliging us !!! 

I do not understand if the staff is trained to present the matter in better way ? We felt like beggars who were given food because someone else decided "not to eat". This could have been simply presented in a better manner 

I also don't know if the staff is trained to identify between veg. and non veg. food ??? They gave us lamb meat and presenting the same as vegetarian food. When I opened the food box, i realized that it was not vegetarian food and hence I asked the air hostess again to re-confirm. She showed the label on the box, which she claimed to mention that it was vegetarian food. However she was not ready to see the actual food.....only looking at the label and insisting that this was vegetarian food. I was still skeptical and hence I requested to call her supervisor. It took quite some time and in the meantime, my wife already started eating the food, trusting her word. The supervisor came and immediately understood the matter. He took both the food packets and confirmed after some time that it was lamb meat. My wife being highly religious and strictly vegetarian felt sick and was deeply hurt emotionally. She could not forgive herself for trusting the airline staff...........they later apologized several times but the damage was already done beyond their imagination.

We later tried to sleep to forget the entire episode. However it seems that blankets given by the airline staff were not properly washed or had some kind of bugs. Both of us 8-10 dark red rashes on our legs. Something bit us or there was something in the blanket which was allergic and we started to itch like crazy in both the legs. My wife was also bleeding in couple of places when we landed at Singapore airport.

These 3 incidents made it the worst experience of our life time. This review is based on my last experience and hence cannot to generalized for all other trips.
label: negative

text: Friendly Helpful Staff Flew from Heathrow to Singapore, then on to Melbourne with Singapore Airlines, staff always helpful and friendly, make you feel welcome and nothing is too much trouble.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable Flight I traveled First time with this Carrier but found them really Professional.
Truly Asian Flight gives Warmth and Comfort to the Travelers.
Service, Attention, Accessories everything is a Class of Next Level... Better than Jet or Air India
label: positive

text: Was upgraded to premium economy I am a Krisflyer Gold member and so I am able to pre-select seats in the forward zone free of charge. And I was pleasantly surprise when they offer to upgrade me when the economy class was overbooked. The seats are wider and more comfortable. The onboard was certainly better with better headsets, choice of meals,= & a whole bottle of water to myself. Plus SQ usually keep to their flight schedule  tightly. If we are delayed taking off, the pilots usually make up for lost time on the flight itself and we tend to land very close to the published eta or sometimes earlier.
label: positive

text:
the food was actually edible, the staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful.  the food timing from singapore to destination ( the same coming back ) was unusual. a light meal  two hours after getting on and then nothing not a drink for about 1o hrs. it was dark i understand , but people were away looking for food. 
the plane was very clean and the electronic equipment was well maintained
label: positive

text: Smooth flight from Perth to Singapore This was a red-eye flight which left Perth at 1.10 am and arrived in Singapore at 6.25 am. To allow passengers to get at least a bit of sleep it was important that everyone be settled as quickly as possible. This was done efficiently, pleasantly and without fuss. Breakfast, which was good, was not served too early and was cleared away promptly.
label: positive

text:
Quite disappointed After hearing good things about SA, I must say I am quite disappointed.

In all flights, I expected a meal or a snack more. My seat from Brisbane to Singapore was quite uncomfortable. 

Wifi on the way back didn't work because apparently krisflyers members don't get complimentary wifi anymore, although their app says they do. When I told the crew, they told me the app was out of date and they didn't really help nor offer alternatives.

At Brisbane airport I waited 1.5 hours to check in, and the app didn't let me check in online.

The app also doesn't really work, it's slow and it's very messy with a lot of hidden pages that are not east to find.

Lastly, Singapore airport is so bad. At 6am only a couple of cafes open (waited 25 minutes in a line to get a cappuccino) and not much space to sit.
label: negative

text:
Such a shame, they've gone from five star to criminal Asked for a refund on my flights in early November, after they quoted my £700 for an internal flight from Bangkok to Koh Samui when the price with Bangkok Air was £100 - so changed the whole thing to Qatar. 

Told it would be six weeks for a refund. Received confirmation on email. 

Have chased numerous times since and been told it was a delay with my bank. Having spoken with my credit card company, they've received no funds. 

The credit card company have refunded the original booking fee, but nothing from Singapore whatsoever. They're keeping customer money and not even acknowledging they're doing anything wrong - this is an illegal practice. Book elsewhere!
label: negative

text: Great service Great service as usual. Nice chat with some of crew as I wanted to stay awake in order to fight of jet lag when I reach home
label: positive

text:
1st Singapore Air flight On SA due to covid rules excluding non-tax from flying on their airline [Im a gold card customer, so thanks] 
Not bad in any way just a functional cabin, crew and journey. Some airlines and journeys are memorable, however this was so-so really. Food ok, service ok

I flew Prem Eco so certainly harder than flat beds for this long trip - but seat was ok not too much of a problem. Bits of tech didn't work though and some things hard to find. The instructions are online - and you have to register and perhaps pay to get online...its all to much of a fiddle so did not bother. Could watch film etc but this must really wind people up who want the full experience. Crew could have been asked and they did change a faulty headset but again it was not a most attentive cabin crew. Perfunctory.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines abandoned my son My son missed his connection to Singapore due to a delayed flight from Edinburgh. Singapore Airline staff told him he would need to stay in Frankfurt indefinitely and go to the airport each night at 7pm to try to get on an overbooked flight in the hope that someone would not show up! He could also not access his baggage so literally only had the clothes on his back. Staff were rude and unsympathetic even though it was not his fault. They refused to help him and stated that it was not their problem
label: negative

text:
Best Airline I have travelled with major airlines but Singapore Airline has always been my favourite. For the courteous service and pretty much on-time departure and arrival. And Changi is the best airport I been, in term cleanliness, spacious and neat. 

Highly recommended both Singapore Airline and Singapore Changi Airport!
label: positive

text: Excellent trip, very comfortable , good entertainment, food ok and lounge very good Yet again, very good flight, comfortable, food ok and entertainement very good..the lounge at Singapore, very good..thank you for making us feel, yet again very welcome..staff not as good this flight, have to say..but nothing to worry about..just not as friendly
label: positive

text: Great airline We always travel with Singapore airlines as it is a great airline and are very accommodating.  Service is great and staff amazing.
label: positive

text: best airline Put us in first class because we had a choice to be bumped with a tour of Soul and first class We took it and it was great.
label: positive

text: The very best !!! Our return flights with Singapore air were exceptional. Once again fantastic service all the way.They also took great care of us, on our return flight that was delayed, due to protests at Hong Kong Airport. Thank you!!  I do not want to fly with anyone else and go to extreme measures to fly with Singapore Air to some Destinations, that I know would be quicker and cheaper with other carriers but its Not Singapore Air. Just do yourself a favor and fly with them and you will know what I am talking about. It makes traveling an absolute pleasure. Your holiday begins once you are checking in with them. Thank you for your outstanding Service. Keep it up.
label: positive

text: Deceiving .. not anymore best on class Not anymore as good as it was .. business class actually deceiving.. the A380 is a blast .. but the level of service & quality is not as expected and certainly not anymore the best in class; entertainment offering limited and rather old (Netflix or other platforms offer more ..); food partly unavailable choices, quality rather average (for the remaining available) and wine choice very average. All in all very deceiving.
label: neutral

text:
Conmen Recently bought a flight for April 2019. Due to unfortunate circumstances I had to change the flight either into my partners name or move the date to fit my new plans. 

Both options were absolutely extortionate, therefore resulting in me having to buy a brand new flight and throw away this entire journey. 

Such a shame and waste of money that people just don’t have to throw away. And all for what? To line your pockets some more.
label: negative

text: Super Service  My flight from Zurich to Singapore was super. The new business class is good even the seats are set more dense as in the previous Business Class. Service was great and cabin crew very attentive.
label: positive

text:
Very Caring Cabin Crew and Excellence in Service in Sky Boarded for the 1st time a morning flight from Singapore to Shanghai. Normally I like to take midnight flights so that the day is not waste sitting on flight during working hours.
This A380 aircraft had the new Business Class Seats which are new on this sector. The seats were same Broad seat with lots of space for sitting but for sleeping you still need to sleep at an angle which is awkward and not a very comfortable position to sleep. The layout of the Business Class on Top Deck  was 1-2-1. The Center seats had a divider which can actually be pulled up and down to make it 100% private seat or if you are travelling with someone can be pulled down completely till the seat level giving it a feel of a joint cabin. The idea is nice when you are travelling with companion as this makes the whole cabin very cozy. The seats are all trimmed with Dark Beige/ Brown leather and had every possible thing a traveler would need. Proper storage area, charging points, headphone and lights at appropriate location made the cabin very comfortable for users. 
The Service was as expected by the Cabin Crew who kept their meal services very professional and as per customers request. This being a day flight, the entire time, the crew were busy in Service and from Champagne to Tea was served at a push of a bell.
Overall this cabin is better and more functional then the old designed cabin of A380 which SQ was using when they launched the new Business Class. However the sleeping angle is not very comfortable, even though the duvet, pillows and blankets are top notch quality.
label: positive

text: Great flight as always but English call center in Bangkok needs training. Needed help keeping my family seated close together, explained in detail how the SQ system automatically moved me (undersrandable) But then customer service representative suggested a seat  that was even farther away as if she wasn’t listening.
label: positive

text: excellent customer service Have travelled with singapore airlines on many occasions - we are returning customers.  New plane, attentive staff, roomy seats - great all round!  Boarding very smooth experience
label: positive

text:
Die beste Airline der Welt ???   Singapore Airlines Bangkok - Singapore  17.12.19  SQ975
Singapore - Christchurch  17.12.19 SQ 4295

Dear Mr or Madam,

Electronic Check-in at Bangkok:
It didn’t works.

Check-in Bangkok:
The Singapore Airline employee didn’t know that Swiss citizen don’t need a Visa for New Zealand.

Check-in Singapore:
Your employees were only an unreasonable demand. My partner and I had to wait over half an hour until they started with our tickets. Then the 1. employee, a man, gave our tickets further to a lady. I told her our continuation flight to Christchurch would be in 1 hour and she should now print out the boarding passes. She claimed my name is written wrong, even though the names on the tickets and the Travel Itinerary was written correct. She worked very slowly and called very long with an other persons. The same „game“ happened with the visa for my partner, even she could show it. Then we had to run 15 Min to A21 to get the plane.

Flight Singapore to Christchurch:
was good.

I don’t know what kind of education your employees have. In any case we cold this slowdown strike and plainly not the best service.

Yours sincerely

Hans Weber

Travel Itinerary
WEBER/HANS HEINRICH MR
EDMONDJONES/BANGOEN PHUNKET MRS
Booking reference: S2LOWJ 09 Aug 2019
Singapore Airlines
label: negative

text: 1st time flying with Premium Economy on a very short trip The seat was comfortable, decent leg space for a 163cm height female. Though the trip was short, I've enjoyed the seat.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Our family always love to fly by Singapore Airlines whenever possible though the price is higher than other Airlines. But this time we were rather disappointed by the A380, we didn't like the new seats configurations. They were narrower and way too short even for my height which is 160m . We had to sleep side ways so that our legs could stretch out to  reach the foot rest which is meant as an extension , this is the main disappointment , the book the cook food has fallen standard, way too salty and overcooked.
label: positive

text:
Return flight cancelled with no notice, no refund, call centre no help First time I've ever left a bad review:  
The email below and the title say it all- still unresolved after 1 month & 5 days, £600 lost- in essence stolen, with the cancellation of a return flight, no notice or valid reason given.

Customer services are very willing to talk, provided you wait for them to call back at an unagreed time.
Really wasn't expecting such hideous service, and theft, from a normally highly rated airline

Numerous proven lies, and excuses- now have the choice of writing this off, or going to a solicitor.  

Transcript form email below- 1 month , and circa 10 calls after flight was cancelled:

I need to discuss please:

1) why the return flight was cancelled without being informed- I found out by accident on December 26th-  this has taken 4 weeks to get nowhere

2) why I was told that by yourselves that the booking agent cancelled the flight, when in fact Singapore airlines cancelled the flight

3) why the first supervisor dealing with this committed to getting back to me by Friday 28th December, and did not.  In fact the commitment was never met- NO MISSED CALLS

4) why I was told there were no longer any spare seats on the plane for the cancelled ticket, even though online, both Singapore airlines and 3rd parties showed plenty of availability

5) on the day of the flight, I flew alone without my partner, and ... there were at least 5 seats unfilled  (I can guess the official answer to this)

6) Why it takes so long for you to get back- I think I am still owed a return call from the 2nd supervisor I spoke to, after the first did not return my call

7) why nobody in your organisation transfers details of this case to the person subsequently calling- the result of this is a large waste of time for all concerned

8) linked with question 7- why nobody in your organisation is able to progress this internally between calls and emails- it's a complete internal comms failure and massive customer disappointment.

9) Why was a return flight offered on 8th January, with a supplement that was never disclsoed,  which I had already said was too late and never agreed to- it would have resultant in circa £1200 in cheap hotel fees and lost income.  AT NO POINT DID I AGREE TO THIS
label: negative

text:
Lost the Plot Now tried for 3 days to log in as Kris Flyer. Changed my password etc multiple times. Still cannot log in and my experience mirrored by countless others it appears. No customer service. My last flight left late which meant my luggage didn't make my connection at Changi so arrived in Hanoi with no hold baggage. Had to return to airport next day to collect. No a word from the airline re apology etc.
Will never use Singapore Airlines again.  They are apparently in deep economic trouble which is ONLY due to poor customer service/ management and NOT because of Covid, world current economic climate etc.
label: negative

text:
Still Worlds Best Airline All aspects of the flight were great. Boarding friendly and efficient, departure on time, very modern and immaculately clean aircraft, best legroom, excellent on board entertainment system, cabin crew were friendly and efficient, good menu, excellent drink selection, smooth flight, arrival on time.
We would highly recommend.
label: positive

text:
Absolutely atrocious customer service experience Such terrible service from the outset! After making the booking which included a code share arrangement for 2 adults with an infant, everything started well with a bassinet being requested. From that point I had to call at least four times with apparent issues with the names on itinerary even though they were correct from the outset. This issue arises again upon attempting online check in which wasn’t at all possible because one adults name was somehow written in twice, once as a Mr and one as a Mrs. called and requested a business class upgrade. Was told due to code share it wasn’t possible (hello I’m trying to give you my money)! 
Thereafter we arrived at the airport to a very rude staff member once again telling me the names were incorrect in the system, even though the night before I had the itinerary emailed to me after the initial attempt to check in failed, which confirmed names were correct, I showed this document as proof, lady appeared uninterested. codeshare 2nd leg of journey had tickets produced at Melbourne airport and after being flushed by this too and fro at check in I didn’t bother to check the seat allocation on the 2nd leg which didn’t have bassinet allocation. To our horror we discovered the Singapore Airlines check in lady had allocated us seats in different rows on opposite sides of the plane with a one year old! How can they be so unprofessional? The worst part, when transiting through SIN I approached the transfer counter of the codeshare airline, and this helpful assistance then was able to pair us together, making the MEL - SIN Singapore employees actions even worse. To top it off we cannot purchase additional baggage online due to once again the codeshare arrangement and furthermore we arrive at our final destination and discovered both our suitcases were broken with the wheels coming off before we exited the airport. Having flown many major international airlines overseas, I will never fly with Singapore again. If going Aus to Europe, I highly recommend you consider a Middle East airline that shows accountability and pride in their responsibility to fare paying passengers. My wife and I are absolutely appalled By the service we received from Singapore Airlines. We have made this same journey to Europe 7 times as leisure travellers in the last 8 years and this was by far the worst experience.
label: negative

text: Best I've been fortunate enough to fly Cathay Pacific, EWA Air, Japan Airlines, ANA, United, American, Delta, Alaska, SWA, the last 5 year, but none of them beat Singapore airlines.  Our flights were Bali to Singapore (2.5 hours) and then Singapore to LA (15 hours).  Their economy section is equal to most other airlines economy plus.  Their service was the best, seats, entertainment, cleanliness, food, you name it.  I will pay extra money to fly Singapore Airlines especially on a long flight.
label: positive

text:
call centre was dreadful Waited 45min on the phone to get a first class tkt , gave up and went with Emirates. The most annoying part of this .is  the voice message saying  that you are next in line after 1 minute (absolute rubbish).
sorry Singapore you've lost a very good ex client..
label: negative

text:
Service par excellence  Our last flight of our holiday, SQ322 Singapore to London. An organised airport is probably the best way to describe Changi. Just two people ahead of us at check in; extremely efficient and polite staff there to help with the process.
Had already been to the GST refund service, which, if GST refundable items are in your hold luggage and there’s a spot inspection, must be done prior to check in. Security check was slightly different than in Europe, as in the physical body scan and cabin bag search is done at the boarding gate. Once thru passport inspection, it’s into the retail, lounges and dining experience that puts Changi above so many other airports. Singapore Airlines Business lounge was pretty hectic, as usual. Decent variety and quality of food and drinks. Went thru for boarding as soon as flight showed as it’s quite a long trek to the B gates where flights to the UK usually depart. Absolute chaos at the gate; staff seemed over critical and pedantic. Lots of agitated parents, sweating travellers and crying children for the 23.45 departure.
Once onboard, in to the upper deck business class area, it seemed a different world. Calmness and serenity oozed from every smile and gentle word of the cabin team. No sooner were we all seated, hot towels to all to remove the sweaty stress of check in and boarding. As soon as they were cleared away, our pre take off champagne or soft drinks arrived. No delay in takeoff, we were soon airborne. Next came the dinner orders, had we preordered? Oh yes, just to confirm that you still require the lobster Thermidor? White wine with that? Champagne? Red? Soft drinks? Nothing was ever too much effort or a problem for this team. They all worked so hard, so together, so effortlessly. Whilst eating a superb lobster Thermidor, a film from the huge selection was in order, along with a glass or two of bubbles. Meal cleared and following a quick visit to the restroom, I came back to my seating pod to find that my lay flat bed had been prepared for me, complete with duvet and pillows. Plenty of leg room and could lay 100% flat! During our 14 hour flight back to London the cabin team were constantly on the go. Had a good three or four hours solid sleep before being shaken from our slumbers by air turbulence. Shortly afterwards, once back on a level flight path, we (husband and I) were approached by the cabin team, all smiles, despite the hour. ‘We believe it’s your wedding anniversary today’ they said in unison. ‘Sorry we could not upgrade you to first, but as you know (well, I did as I’d tried for the surprise upgrade at check in) all the suites are full, but as it’s been our pleasure to serve you on this flight, we have a bottle of champagne from first, plus a few gifts for yourselves and your grandson who you spoke about earlier.’ We were then given a carrier bag of goodies along with a beautiful card and bottle of champagne. 
Breakfast followed shortly after accompanied by our champagne, then our decent into London. 
An amazing flight and excellent service 
Thank you all!
label: positive

text: Smooth and relaxing. Well organised check in on both sides made for stress-free check in and also good on board service made the flight enjoyable.
label: positive

text:
Nightmare experience with a flight journey operated by Singapore Airlines/ Silk Air A flight journey of 22 hrs 35 minutes involving a single stop, became a 46 hrs 22 minutes involving 3 stops eventually. 

Our original flight was from Hyderabad to Seattle via Singapore.
* Hyderabad -> Singapore: Silk Air
* 3:15 layover in Singapore 
* Singapore -> Seattle: Singapore Airlines
Total journey time: 22 hours 35 minutes

The initial flight from Hyderabad -> Singapore operated by Silk Air was delayed by more than 3 hours and 25 minutes, and hence our entire flight needed to be rebooked. No one gave us a specific reason why the flight got delayed, except the statement: "the incoming flight got delayed".

So the new itinerary that was booked for us was:
* Hyderabad -> Singapore: Silk Air
* 8 hrs lay over in Singapore 
* Singapore -> Hongkong: Singapore Airlines
* 1 hr stop in Hongkong, where we had to deplane and go through security checkin again.
Hongkong -> San Francisco: Singapore Airlines
* 2 hrs stop in San Francisco where we had to finis our immigration, customs, and then go through the security again.
San Francisco -> Seattle: United
* Here, due to the incompetency of Silk Air/Singapore Airlines staff, United refused to board us (18 passengers) as the tickets were not be "endorsed" correctly, even though our baggage got into transported in to the plane, and they had enough seats for all of us.

Finally, some of us got rebooked to a 05:30 flight and some of us to a 06:35 flight in the morning, where most of us spent the night in the Airport.
label: negative

text: Quite possibly the worst airline company in the world Chaotic scenes and hysteria among the staff at SYD due to downgrading of the aircraft. What’s the point in providing contact information if the company chooses not to communicate with the customers in case of cancellation? No compensation, no lounge access, no upgrade, no apology, no meal vouchers, no nothing, except just go away and wait for five hours.  Best airline of the World my ass.
label: negative

text:
Poor luggage service We flew with Singapore airlines from Copenhagen to Singapore, then from Singapore to Cairns on a Sunday. One of our luggage was lost. At Cairns airport, we have been told not to worry : when the luggage would be found, it would be delivered to us, wherever we may be. We insisted on the fact that we were on a 3 weeks road trip and would be moving every day, a little further to Sydney, but the staff at the airport reassured us they would send the luggage wherever we may be. 

We had a first call with an employee of Singapore Airlines, named Suzan, on Monday, saying that the company lost the luggage. She promised to call again the next day to inform us about the ongoing investigation to find it. We insisted again on the fact that we were on the move and Suzan said it wouldn't be a problem to send the luggage at a specific address.  

Unlike what was promised, we had no news on the next day. We then tried to reach Singapore Airlines on the next day, without success. That’s indeed when we found out that the number she used to call us was only one way: we couldn’t call it, only it could call us. Suzan finally called back on the evening of the Wednesday saying that our luggage was found.  

When we said that we would be in Ingham the next day, we were answered that it was too far to deliver the luggage! We were very surprised by this answer and started arguing on that topic, since we've been told the exact opposite since the beginning. When we asked if there could be a compensation linked to the loss, Suzan laughed at us, which we found very disrespectful. She even ended up hanging up on us!  

As we were wondering about what just happened to us (maybe it was the “Australian way” to deal with customers), another employee of the company called us back right away. We then found a compromise: since we were passing by the city of Innisfail on the next day (Thursday), we agreed to meet a courier there to get our luggage back. We gave our itinerary of the next days: after visiting the falls of Milaa Milaa and Elinja, we would be heading to Mamu Tropical Skywalk. We were almost sure not to have phone reception there and informed them that we would only be reachable when arriving closer to Innisfail, around 12 (lunchtime), time at which we agreed to meet the delivery person. 

The driver was supposed to have been given our contact details and to call us when leaving Cardwell in the morning to set up a meeting point in Innisfail. We arrived at 11.30 AM in Innisfail and then waited for the driver’s call to head up to a specific meeting point. But we received no call, and we waited for 1h30 in Innisfail for the driver to call us. We even tried to call Singapore Airlines, but every person we were speaking to had no idea of what the situation was, neither who to re-direct us too, they simply advised us to send another email. Since we had to be in Ingham at the end of the day (we had a hotel reservation there), we couldn't stay any longer and had to move. During our trip to Ingham, we took time to write an email to the email contact we had received in Cairns to explain the situation. We had Wifi that night and the next morning but received no answer to our email. At that moment we were very stressed because we had no idea what could have happened to our luggage. 

The next day, Friday, we had to reach Townsville because we had a ferry booking to go to Magnetic Island. When we were on Magnetic Island (with poor reception), we received a call at 11 AM – the exact time he was supposed to call us the day before.

What happened during that call was beyond disrespect. The person pretended that he tried to call, and email us the day before without success. He even mentioned having sent at least 10 text messages to both our numbers. Which is very strange because we had reception for sure from 11.30 AM, since we managed to contact Singapore airlines helplines ourselves. We received no text message nor email! He also said that since he couldn't contact us, he went up to Mamu Tropical Skywalk and consulted the register (that everybody is supposed to sign but we never were asked to at any time) to find out we never went there. We were so shocked because it meant that he was calling us liars. We went to Mamu Tropical Skywalk, we have pictures of the place and we have hotel reservation in Yungaburra and Ingham to prove our itinerary too. So we can’t understand why he would use this excuse.

On top of that, he said that he had money compensation with him, but since we didn’t show up in Innisfail, he wouldn’t give us the money anymore. Which means that since this day, we didn’t receive the compensation mentioned. And to finish the call, the driver informed us that we had no other choice than going to Townsville's airport to collect our luggage in the afternoon, otherwise, they wouldn’t take care of our file anymore. So in the end, the promise to deliver the luggage wherever we were was never met. 

We were so angry and frustrated during the call, that we stopped arguing and just wanted to get the luggage back not to waste our holidays with stress anymore. Another really strange thing: following this call, we both received a text message from him, from Suzan and also an email to confirm where the luggage would be sent, and we received all text messages, calls and emails sent at that time on both phones. We wonder why we didn’t receive anything the day before.

To sum up, it took Singapore Airlines 5 days to get us the luggage back. We received only 150 Australian Dollars to cover this loss, which was clearly not enough to cover 5 days of clothing / hygiene product / snorkeling equipment / ... that was in the luggage. We waited 1h30 in Innisfail for nothing. We had been charged for international calls with both our phones several times due to the poor communication of both companies. We had suffered a great deal of stress and frustration, we had been laughed at and disrespected and we had been called liars!
label: negative

text: Great Service! The airbus A350 is really good. Seats are quite good. The entertainment is also good with a good variety. Food is good Service is excellent.
label: positive

text: Still good tho minor issues Flew on the 777 and 380. Enjoyed the 380 more for its legroom. However the audio on the entertainment system needs balancing as the announcement by crew is much too loud
label: positive

text: Short flight experience Though it's just for a short flight, I really love it. In flight entertainment is up to date, food is delicious, seat is really comfortable. Check in process is good.
label: positive

text: Very efficient Singapore Airlines crew are always very pleasant and happy to help you.  We were lucky to secure seats with more leg room (at a further cost) which was great on such a long flight.  The cabin was clean and kept clean constantly by the crew.  The toilets were checked by the crew very frequently.  Food was good.
label: positive

text: Business class the way to go Never flown business class before but we decided to this time to London and back.  Great crew on board great meals and able to sleep most of the way.
label: positive

text: Well Expected From The SIA Quality! Every holidays/overseas trip start from the air flight. It is a flight that all should try, experience and get pampered before landing.
label: positive

text:
No Food for 9 Hours We flew Singapore Airlines in 2018 in Premium Economy and I found it overall a good experience. However, this time the experience was a little disappointing. In 2018 we had been offered an aperitif before our meal. Not this time. I had expected the food to be between Economy and Business quality; but no, definitely the same as Economy. In fact the staff almost threw the food at us - dessert served about 2 minutes into eating the main course. The worst thing was - on a 12 hour flight - we were given a meal then NO FOOD for about the next 9 hours when breakfast was served. We were so hungry I went to the back of the plane and begged some snacks.
Liked the extra space and the better headphones, but will not be using Singapore Airlines again. The accountants have moved in and a previously semi-luxurious experience is now very much an economy affair. Emirates next time I think.
label: neutral

text:
A350-900 Business Class Singapore to Adelaide Just experienced the New A350-900 Business Class. The Seating and space is First Class almost as big as Emirates First Class Suite but without the Bling Bling Gold and Wood grain. Very Spacious great onboard entertainment. Food was great as always with Singapore have flown the same route many times in A330 which were old and getting tired this is a big step up.  Only negative is (but some may like) is that its very private and High seating but you can't really view anybody or any distance in front of you or behind so its like your in a private cocoon.

A big mention to Allison the Singapore duty manager at Adelaide she sorted out a very stressful few days regarding my Wife's Kris Flyer Account that was suspended due to a glitch. 17 Phone calls to Kris Flyer in Singapore everyone making promises but no one coming through it wasn't until last day that my wife even knew she had a return flight! Shame on you Kris Flyer appalling for a world class airline.

Allison sorted and did things outside of the Square and above and beyond her duties. I shouldn't have had to go through Australia or Adelaide to sort it but was left with no Choice if we didn't my wife would be stuck in Malaysia as account unlock didn't come through until 6 days after return flight.

But this review is about the flight not the Airline or Krisflyer. Hence 5 Star
label: positive

text: Service !! Always count on the friendly service with a wide smile with singapore airlines. I have flown a number of airlines, and I rank Singapore airlines for a pleasant trip, short or long haul. The food is good as well and the entertainment system caters to a wide range of ethnicity.
label: positive

text: Incredibly good service & good for vegetarians & those that do not drink alcohol Outstanding service throughout. Ease of ticketing, great app, online customer service is helpful, great ability to pick seats & meals prior such as the Book the Cook option, great seats, great inflight service, smooth check-in. Very good for vegetarians. Many non-alcoholic drink options in flight.
label: positive

text: Excellent Services Good foods, perfect flight connection, friendly and helpful services from the flight attendants. Typical SQ Standards.
label: positive

text:
