we’ll done We traveled on the 3 September 2018 in the morning, on the day the typhoon was predicted. Singapore Airline brought forward the time of departure from Perth and there by was not affected by the typhoon. A couple of hours later the Kansai airport was under water!
The service was great and the meal from Perth to Singapore offered Salmon as well.
label: positive

text: Meet expectation The boarding procedure was well organised and hence there is no bottle-necked jam. I felt there are enough cabin crew on hand to assist the passengers, hence the smooth boarding. Well, the food are acceptable. The more experienced cabin crew are able to engage the passengers and do pay attention to the passengers' needs. I only find one younger crew member that seems a little stress and she just "shoved" the food and ice-cream to the passengers (It was a full flight), not like the more experienced ones who seems to offer rather than just put it down for the passengers.   I believe with a little more time, the particular cabin crew should be able better herself. One more thing, the safety video is very innovative and engaging. Overall, I have an enjoyable flight.
label: positive

text: Best economy class I have taken a lot of other economy class flights and by far the best is Singapore Airlines. They have wide seats than most economy seats that I can put the pillow on my side, and their pillows are softer and fluffier that other economy class pillows, and not feel squished in my seat. They also have longer leg room than other economy class seats. The window seat person can access their seats without the aisle and middle person getting up. Isn’t that amazing? The entertainment is also better, with bigger screens and a wide selection of entertainment to choose from. This is where I watch the movies that I missed. The food is unbelievably palatable, not dry and tasteless. The bread is soft and chewy, just how I like it. I always look forward to the ice cream for dessert. The economy class flights of Singapore Airlines is comparable, if not better than the business class seats of other airlines. And I have taken several business class flights for comparison. My next goal is a business class flight on Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Good service  in flight Food needs improvement 
Shame no direct flights was delayed but positive a great lounge good selection  incredible service clean showers etc
label: positive

text:
Wonderful This is my second time fly with SQ in CGK-NRT route

In general it was wonderful experience fly with SQ
(+) On Time flight
(+) Cabin is clean & comfortable for economy class
(+) Superb in flight entertainment (wide selection of movie)

But I have a bit bad experience with the cabin crew (JKT-SG flight)
(-) a bit rude
(-) give me a wrong description about the meal
label: positive

text: Worst service ever I am very very very upset with Singapore airlines and it's staff. The treatment my mother and I have received at the Auckland airport from Linda Gu and Laura Yip was beyond disappointing. We have everything in order for my mother to travel to Malaysia vis transit in Singapore today at 1.15am. They made us wait at the counter standing for 2 hours while they went back and forth wondering if my mother held a valid visa. I have advised them I have confirmation from immigration prior to the booking of the flight to ensure everything will be done smoothly. They we unsure and kept snapping pictures of my mothers visa and sending it via WhatsApp to God knows whom to enquire if it's acceptable- is that standard process? Snapping pictures of personal identification /passport and forwarding then on an unsecured platform?. They made us wait until the last 10 minutes and denied her boarding getting an executive decision from the manager NOT Malaysian immigration, who I have just gotten off the phone with and they have confirmed that the visa IS valid and she IS entitled entry into Malaysia. I am unable get in touch with anyone from your contact center to have this matter looked into as they have wrongfully denied my mother boarding. This has given us so much stress and anxiety and this is so appalling for what is touted to be a world class airline! If they had told me upfront that they will not be boarding her as they are unsure and given us some notice we could have gotten immigration on the phone and done something. Instead they waited untill the last moment and just walked away. This is beyond belief
label: negative

text:
Experienced warmth n care  when I was unwell While flying Singapore  Airlines..I experienced  a very good service from all the staff.They were so polite and always had a smile .
I want to especially  mention one particular  air hostess..Her name is Penny.
After  I boarded my flight I began to feel unwell..I started getting a migraine ..a very throbbing pain in my head and even vomiting...I was not in a position  to turn my head or even speak.. 
Penny noticed this and gave me comfort without  even asking for it..she gave me warm  water and I asked her for a headache  pill.....
I want to thank Penny for her warm caring nature.
Thank you Singapore airlines
label: positive

text:
Friendly service above the sky It was my first long haul flight and also first time using Singapore Airlines. I love the friendliness and of the crews. They really work very smooth and fast during the take off and landing. 
They also know how to greet the passengers when the passenger were sleeping. 
I also like the food they, eventhough I didnt take all the sidedish because its too much. 

Beside the food, what matter most in long haul flight is the entertainment on board. SQ has so many variation of movie and I really love it. 
If you take young kid with you, there’re some movie and games for them to play too.

Overall, I really satisfied with the service and I would like to fly another trip with SQ.
label: positive

text:
very good experience We flew Sydney to Copenhagen via  Singapore in Premium Economy . We paid for extra leg room seats to provide extra comfort to stretch out and this was worthwhile. Premium Economy  seats are definitely wider and more comfortable than economy although still somewhat lacking in comfort padding. Having the option of book the cook where one can choose pre described dishes in advance is an advantage. I did feel that the Book the cook choices were somewhat limited  although they were tasty and adequate. 
Service was very good - attentive, polite  and efficient.  Crew came through many times with water through the flight not just  at set meal times and they were very responsive to calls in between.The planes were well maintained and clean and the toilets appeared to be serviced during the flight.   Having to walk through several sections to get to the toilets in economy was a nuisance but there seemed to be adequate facilities for a full flight. 
There is a general feeling that the crew are working together and information provided from the cockpit was efficient and informative. 
All in All we were satisfied with Singapore Airlines and would continue to use it as our preferred airline.
I FIND THE 5 STAR RATING BELOW RESTRICTIVE.  I WOULD PREFER TO RANK GOOD not AVERAGE OR VERY GOOD
label: positive

text: Flying with Singapore Airlines We priortise to take Singapore Airlines whenever we go for overseas trip unless we got to know that other airlines offer cheaper price than SIA.  Everything is perfect eg services, food, entertainment and etc. Smooth and safe journey. If happens their tickets on sale, we quickly compare and purchase first although we are travelling in 10 months time and that's what we always do.
label: positive

text: Faultless Flew BKK to Sing and Sing to Perth. Food on both legs was adequate, champagne before take off and nice wines during the flight. More than enough leg room and privacy if needed. What made the legs special was the outstanding service, nothing was too much trouble. All staff I encountered were lovely, but must point out Chia from BKK to Sing and Kat from Sing to Perth; better than I've ever come across.
label: positive

text: Always a good and safe Airline SQ has a good record and that is why we fly it.  Premium economy can be a little cramped but well worth the extra $$. My partner is gluten free and it seems if one has "special" dietary requirements they are sat in the front row.  This is ideal as there is miles of leg room and no problems getting up for a stretch. And, the meal looked Ok to me ! The service is so much better than Qantas and not quite as good as Virgin. We fly Virgin to the US and SQ to London.
label: positive

text:
Vomit covered seat and floor, causing us all to get Gastro! We flew the SQ 322 flight from Singapore to London Heathrow on Tuesday 2nd august 2022 arriving at London Heathrow at 6am. 

When we got on the flight the seat part of my daughters chair was missing. She was seated in 54k next to the window. Somebody came and replaced it so she could sit down. We all fell asleep immediately as it was almost 1am in the morning Sydney time. Half way through the flight my daughter realised her socks were wet. We had a look at them and realised they stank of vomit. We then checked all of her toys and our bags that were on the floor and they were all damp and stank of vomit.

All of her things, shoes, socks and bottom of her trousers just absolutely stank of vomit and the ground was soaking wet.

I can not believe that after such a terrible pandemic my daughter was allowed to sit in an area where someone had so obviously recently been vomiting. Not to mention how disgusting it has been travelling to our hotel in a car with bags all covered in sick and smelling absolutely terrible. 

I complained to the air steward and asked her to make a note as it was such a disgusting way to have to sit on a long haul flight.

We then of course all began vomiting the day after the flight, having been sat in clearly a gastro covered area.   Our short UK holiday absolutely ruined, not being able to see my terminally ill father for 8 days in fear of passing it to him, which his immune system could not have handled.   This after not seeing him due to the pandemic for 3 years! 

I understand we flew economy, but at the very least we expected the seats to be clean and sanitary. 

I emailed the airline through my husbands official Singapore Airlines account, and we heard nothing.  I emailed several times, nothing.  I only got a response from the airline when I involved a third party resolver government site that helps consumers.  They told me nothing had been reported, and that the airline staff deny this even happened.

So at the very least they are not logging and recording the changing of seats which must be a safety issue.  I find very hard to believe the air steward doesn't remember covering the vomit floor with a blanket and spraying ai freshener over it for us.  I also asked her to log it all, and she said she would.  The airline said all the attendants had been interviewed but they all deny this even happened.  

 It's not so much what happened, it is more the absolute  denial that it even took place.  Had I of known they had not logged my complaint on the flight, I would have asked fellow passengers for witness statements - but who would ever imagine they would need to that! 

Plus it has taken 3 months for them to look into this for me!!

We will never ever fly Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: Handling of COVID situation appalling I thought we were making a safe choice booking flights with Singapore Airlines in January before COVID blew up.  However, on reflection I will not use them again.  We are due to fly in 5 weeks time, which we obviously will not be doing, and they dont want to release any flight schedules or provide credits to people who booked before COVID.  Never get a real response from a person, just the same copy paste reply saying they will review their schedules and to keep checking....schedules make no difference to us, we wont be going on our holiday regardless.  Expected more from this world renowned airline.  Really disappointed.
label: negative

text:
The best way to fly to Singapore Flawless from start to finish, Singapore Airlines has indeed upheld it's reputation as one of the top airlines in the industry. What I loved the most was their attention to detail to provide passengers with comfort throughout the flight - from the updated in-flight movie selection, to the delicious meals, the comfortable blankets accompanied with a pillow and the free mouthwash in the lavatory!

I barely felt the burden of the 3 hour flight thanks to Singapore Airlines! 🌟
label: positive

text:
Premium Economy on Singapore Airlines, is it worth the price? Recently flew premium economy on Singapore Airlines on an Airbus A350-900. An overnight flight.
Seat configuration on this aircraft is 2, 4, 2. in premium economy. 
We have flown economy with Singapore Airlines numerous times and have been very happy.  Decided to treat ourselves and go Premium Economy. This was a huge disappointment!!  
We were seated in the centre group of 4 seats. Found the seating extremely cramped and really no better than economy. We had expected slightly more space in this class. Perhaps the 2 window seats may have felt less cramped. 
Food was nice but nothing special. 
Service was efficient but no better than economy. In fact there was no special service at all in premium economy. 
This is definitely not worth double the price of an economy ticket on this airline. 
Would definitely not recommend Premium Economy on Singapore Airlines. The space in the centre row needs substantial improvement!  Suggest configuration should be 2, 3, 2   NOT 2 4 2. 
Not looking forward to return flight
label: neutral

text: Standard of food has deteriorated  I found the food on SIA Economy class to and from Ho Chi Mingh is so bad. Tasteless and poor quality. Only the beer and wine helps to recover a few points so that I can give a neutral recommendation rating.
label: neutral

text:
Enjoyable Flight but Reservations on Silverkris Lounge Offerings and Hanakoireki The Silverkris Lounge in Terminal 3 certainly is in need of some sort of upgrading and improved of F&B services. The offerings seems to get getting very limited and boring, and there wasn't even 'live stations' at time of visit. Since it is crowded, perhaps this is why the not so exciting offerings during lunch. Nonetheless, still good with premium items like TWG tea etc. 

On the flight itself as this was a daylight, around 6hours plus, hence, have more time to experience the service on board the Dreamliner (comparing to previous BKK trip on the same aircraft). 

Food & Beverage: 
Interestingly and again, no satay as canapes:(. Think is just me. Not from Sydney, not to Osaka:(. 
As business class passenger can choose their inflight meals prior, and hence, went for the famous Hanakoireki  option. Presentation wise was good, but taste very interesting with most items in cold/room temperature and acquired taste. Was not very satisfied though but it's must try (the return leg from Osaka is much better though). Would probably select some other book the cook meals next time or try their latest Keisuke ramen offerings. 
Also noticed the cocktail selections seems to be reduced as I wanted to try a few from other flights I saw. Nonetheless, still good. 

Comfort 
As per last review, the seat is pretty comfortable and good legroom. Though no bedsheets or amenity kit given for this day-flight (not even the midnight ones). 

Service
Good in general. Stewardess by name of Veera was friendly and engaging. 
The inflight Manager, obviously someone very senior was quite interesting in the sense that throughout the flight, he did not address business class passenger by their surname and service was sort of jaded. Though not rude or whatsoever, but you can tell he has been doing this for 20, 30 over years and seems to be going some form of motion, like offering chocolates just zooming right in front of your eyes etc. Bless him.
label: positive

text: Flight experience A very long flight with a change at Singapore, modern aircraft with excellent cabin crew and service. Good variety of meals and drinks, clean and spacious aircraft
label: positive

text:
Business as usual For a long and endured trip,  need little legs room ? 
You can pay a little extra to sit by the exit door and 
Order your meal ahead ( without flying firstclass ) 
Not to mention the professional and the service From the counter to the fly attendants no tasks is to big ( just do it ) attitude! 
We are very impressed! 
The food on other hand , nothing to bring home about!
label: positive

text:
MY NIGHTMARE CAME TRUE... Flight bumped I had booked a flight with Singapore airlines to depart from London to Sydney via Singapore, which was leaving in 2 days time... It was only yesterday when they had called me to confirm I had all of my relevent documents for my flight e.g. passport so it seemed very positive. My flight was all "confirmed" on my Singapore airlines account.  Not even 24 hours later, I received a call and a guy advised that I was bumped off my flight, which was only 48 hours before I was meant to fly off. They then advised the next available flight will be in 2.5 weeks..... this was not an option for me as I need to get home for work.
They were not apologetic at all and gave no sympathy over my situation. 
This has left me very distressed and I will NOT ever be flying with Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: Great experience, on time, attentive flight attendants Boarding process was smooth and efficient. Had window seat in row 52. Good recline, fluffy pillow and entertainment on the 787 was really good. Nice screen, super clear and nice sound from the freebie headphones. Even given a local paper on boarding and hot towels before takeoff. Smooth takeoff and landing. Nice flight!
label: positive

text:
Faultless Having arranged 4 premium economy seats we were very happy with whole process.
Check in at Heathrow was exceptionally smooth and quick. Seats were comfortable with adequate leg room. In flight food and entertainment also very good, but attentiveness of stewards along with maintaining cleanliness of long haul flight was a big plus. Although not frequent fliers we used 3 other airlines for long flights over 5 week period and this service provided us with the best overall experience.
label: positive

text:
Pleasant flight We boarded the aircraft and was welcomed with warmth smile. Seats were comfortable with sufficient leg space.
The 5 hour journey seemed short with very good inflight entertainment.
Food served was good and the crew were all friendly except for one stewardess who had an unfriendly face, didn’t smile. 
Most importantly we had a safe flight and had never doubted taking our home brand anytime.
label: positive

text: Good This is my first time of travelling this Airline and I must say it was just ok, I had to ask for ear phones several times before I was eventually given one, the air craft itself was spacious and in flight entertainment was quite extensive, the food to Tokyo from Singapore was great but breakfast from from Tokyo to Singapore, international menu was bad, dry potatoes and too much scrambled eggs and little to eat it with, please check that.
label: positive

text: Best ride to the Far East Seating was comfortable, my special meal arrived before the rest of the economy class meals and was cooked to perfection.  No problems at all
label: positive

text:
You get what you pay for. I haven't reviewed Singapore Airlines in a while. I recently went on a business class flight to Tokyo and back from Singapore. The flight was almost 7 hours long. The cost of the flight is not cheap in comparison to other airlines but SQ offers much more. Their seat size is huge compared to other airlines business class. 

This trip I found that SQ has removed all their novelty gifts for business class and first passengers. I actually enjoyed receiving a little gift from them even though its probably already paid for in the cost of your ticket but it was nice to receive a perfume or something or rather. They have just removed that element completely. My husband who is a frequent flyer says they removed it a while ago. 

I also found service was just average. The staff on the airline I went on on both ways did their job as much as was required from them. I didn't get the extra conversations, the small talk that I used to get on their airline. When I entered the plane, the staff who I passed greeted me and I went to my seat. After that I only saw staff members if it was time to serve a drink or dinner. I remember a time when a staff or two will strike a short conversation with you making you feel a lot more welcome. Maybe it was just my luck, but I felt you can take service to a whole new level with a bit of conversation.
label: positive

text: RB via SIA flight to US in December 2010 Long way to travel with comfortability and excellent services by flight crews.Breakfast,Lunch,Dinner are provided with good foods and drinks during the travel.Great Airport service for SIA First Class travellers at loungers during my flight to the US sometime back in December 2010.
label: positive

text: Always on time or early with amazing service , food quality This flight is always on time and reach the destination always early. Food quality , Hygiene is excellent. Leg room is very good and seat comfort should improve further. Entertainment is good. Service is excellent.
label: positive

text: By far and away the best there is. We were shown to our seats , which were comfortable and roomy. The food was very good as was the service. Flight entertainment was excellent. I cannot recommend this airline enough.
label: positive

text:
Good services crews Crews are well trained and services is good indeed. But, sitting in front of a kids is really bad experience. Don't understand why are kids sitting in the centre row (47J) instead of front row where normally baby, kids and elderly are located.
He been talking loud and clapping hands when watching some cartons I think. Hope SQ should look into and arrange properly for kids sitting.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable non-stop flight Great that SQ added the non-stop flight between Singapore and Seattle. Judging from full flight, it must be really popular and there is a demand for it. Whilst the premium economy seats do not recline fully, it was great that I had the first row (row 31) where there is ample leg space. Food wise, no difference from economy other than having option for champagne and a 3rd food choice. I like the fact of not having a layover.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Flight Differ between SIA and budget airline, other then the price, is that you able to get more comfortable rest while enjoy the various assistance when on flight. the long journey flight will not make you feel tired if taking SIA such airline. Of course the price can be cheaper will be better.
label: positive

text: The best airlines by far.  Very pleasant experience indeed. Courteous staff, quick check in, great food, great punctuality, nice entertainment system, clean and comfortable seats. Very impressive service. Wish you guys the very best.
label: positive

text: Great airline I have started flying with Singapore as a means for seeing my boyfriend. It is the only flight that gets me from england to Texas without layovers. The meals provided are good and movies, etc are available which is great for the long-haul flight of 10 hours. Makes the flight seem less boring. Theyre a great airline and I always enjoy flying with them!
label: positive

text: Fabulous flight and service It was a fabulous experience to fly Singapore Airlines business class on this flight.  Everything about the food, service, in flight entertainment and actual flight was so enjoyable. We don't usually fly business class but this flight will make us consider the advantages of arriving refreshed (at a cost of course)!!
label: positive

text: good service from air hostesses/hosts. Seats spacious but Beds at an angle, not as comfortable as it looks. attentive service, selection of food & beverages good.  left Singapore at an awkward time 01:30, declined refreshments & had a good few hours sleep without interruption.
label: positive

text:
Organized and comfortable We bought the extra legroom seats in economy and had such a comfortable flight. We almost upgraded to business but honestly, I'm so glad we didn't because it looked like we had more room with the extra legroom seats compared to the standard business class seats. The movies and music choices available were good and pretty updated. 
 The food was good and flight staff was friendly and helpful.  I think our transfer were very smooth.
label: positive

text: Comfortable in Economy This was probably the most comfortable economy flight I have taken.  The menu and the standard of food was good. The staff were attentive and came round very regularly with drinks. Would certainly recommend.
label: positive

text:
A bit disappointed but not unpleasant  Ok so we paid to have exit row extra legroom seats - we were next to the toilets which wasn’t the end of the world, because the TVs come from between the seats during take off and landing there is no entertainment available.
The extra leg room was great!
Unfortunately upon take off we were the last to be served food so of the 3 choices we were told we were having beef, drink service was hit and miss, my wife said staff seemed to ‘look busy’ to avoid getting drinks. When the snacks came round as a bank of 3 chairs we were basically given 3 items between us - 2 crisps and a sandwich. They did to be fair come around after they had finished elsewhere and offered us another item.
The ice cream was a similar story being told they had run out but finding what I suspect was the ice cream from either premium economy or business which took about 15 minutes to thaw enough to tackle and served in a nice china bowl! This ice cream was top draw I have to say!
Staff were friendly enough and quick with a smile. There were earphones provided and hot towels at the beginning and end of the flight.
I had expected a great flight and paid extra for a seat that had the bonus of leg room but suffered as a result. We will be making the reverse journey so will see if this was a one off with the food options.
Fingers crossed the next flight is the 5 star we had expected!
label: neutral

text: Most Enjoyable flight Allways a great experience flying with Singapore airlines. The staff were extremely helpfull as upond looking for our seat my Husband and I discovered we had been separated for seating. A airhostest was unable to help us as the plane was fully booked, she came back to us after the plane and taken off and appoligised and the gave us special treatment with giving us first option for lunch service and other special help throught out the flight.  The seating was very comfortable and the entertainment as well.  I would certainly fly again with Singpore airlines.
label: positive

text:
B787 economy The seats and legroom on this aircraft was much better than the following flight on the A350. Very comfortable.
In-flight entertainment screens were clear and very responsive.
Only a short flight but will look for B787 aircraft to fly on in the future.
label: positive

text:
Flight SQ52 Singapore to Manchester & Huston Flight left Singapore Changi Airport and arrived in Manchester exactly on time, the only down side is that’s the flight departs at 02.05

Hassle free and very quick boarding,  30kg hold luggage allowance in economy plus good hand luggage allowance.

Check-in opens 48 hour prior to departure and allows free of charge seat selection at that time.  KrisFlyer members may pre-purchase seats with air miles or credit card or a mixture of both anytime once the flight tickets are paid for and issued.

Excellent service from cabin crew, very helpful to passengers requirements.  

Menu choice for main meals was very good plus great choice of snacks and drinks in between meals from the galley.

Nice selection of movies & TV shows on demand plus inflight (chargeable) WiFi for those who need to communicate with the outside world during the flight

USB Power points on all consoles, pillow and blankets also provided

In-ear headphones supplied FOC and are yours to keep at the end of the flight. Two pin aircraft adapter also provided FOC to connect your 3.5 personal headphones

Passengers Transiting through Changi on a Singapore Airlines/SilkAir ticket can collect $20.00 per person vouchers from the iShop in any Terminal, these vouchers can be used anywhere in the airport for airside food or shopping including duty free products. There is also a free three hour city tour for passengers with a minimum 5 hour stopover again this is only for passengers transiting through Changi on a Singapore Airlines/SilkAir ticket.
label: positive

text: Hong Kong trip This flight was up to Singapore Airlines usual high standards. Flight left on time and arrived in Singapore on time. The on board service was excellent and the Air Hostesses were ever attentive. The food and beverages were all very good.
label: positive

text:
Singapore airline review Just brilliant.  I went to Bali with my family (all over the age of 12).  Service was courteous, friendly - making us feel they went that extra mile for us.  We had Hindu vegetarian food which was excellent.  I;m tall, so legroom for the journey was ideal for me. The flight was also on time.  
If I had the choice, I would chose Singapore Airlines where ever I can, having experienced some other airlines.
label: positive

text: Unbelievable Booked a flight for my family and my self for the 12/4 2022 from London to Bangkok was sent conformation so ordered a taxi and traveled to air port . After queuing for to hours got to the checking desk only to be told they had no record of my booking. I showed them the conformation and invoice from SingaporeAir they showed me the screen to confirm we were not booked in and as there was no one at the airport from SingaporeAir and no one answering the phone we had to order a taxi home . After calling them everyday for more than a week and being told they would get back to me still waiting . We have now lost the hotel money plus the test and Go . Thai visa and taxi fares not to mention the loss of work .
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines - Simply Amazing! Booked an isle seat while my friend booked the window seat with the hope that no-one landed in between. Found on take-off that the seats in the middle row were totally unoccupied and the hostess encouraged me to move there so I put all the arms up and slept all the way to Singapore. That is all I can say about that flight. Then - from Singapore to London. I had 'made an offer' ($900.00) which was 'unsuccessful' so my friend paid over $1,000 for the next leg so she could upgrade to premium economy and I had paid about $30.00 for a specific seat (I really wanted an isle seat as being a bit (OK a lot) older I didn't want to have to climb over two people each time nature called Then...Waiting to board the plane,  for the second leg of our journey I said to my friend "I am going to be the last person on so they have to page me and I will record it on my mobile, just for fun." Then they paged me! After asking for my passport, they advised that they had a family travelling together who wanted my seat and was I prepared to give it up. Given that my girlfriend had abandoned me to go premium economy I now wasn't worried about keeping my seat so I agreed to give it up. THEN They put me in a 'premium row' with additional leg room!! The other two people advised that they were 'platinum flyers' but didn't upgrade because they wanted to use their points to fly their whole family on holidays. However, the hostess treated them like VIP's and it rubbed off on me. I got a complimentary goodie bag and lots of attention from the hostie. I may have drunk nearly a whole bottle of Baileys on the trip to London (OK I did) and stocked up on chocolate bars, chips and muesli bars for later consumption. It was an EXCELLENT experience.
label: positive

text: Good and comfortable flights The trip went smoothly, and the entertain,ent system worked well.  Foodwise, it was okay, but not extraordinary.
label: positive

text: Comfortable and clean We first time long haul flyers chose Singapore airlines as our main carrier due to reputation. Our first leg from Akl to Singapore was with Airnz and have to say we were impressed with their service, food and drinks. Expecting even better from Singapore airlines we were a little disappointed. Staff were friendly, food when served was plentiful (cant please everyone's palate) and water was offered regularly. Our first leg was a 13 hour plus flight and after being served the first meal we were then left wondering after 6 to 8 hours when the  next meal was coming. When we finally asked when the next meal was to be served found out about 2 hours before landing. Was then told we could help ourselves to snacks ( sandwiches, muffins etc from galley). Have to say sandwiches very nice but if these snacks had been offered earlier or regularly would've given a higher rating. Seating in economy was what you would expect and the 3 of us being around 5 ft tall was ok. Blankets and pillows were on all seats when we boarded but felt compared to Airnz movie selection was a bit poor. The hot flannels handed out after takeoff and before landing was nice as was bag with socks and toothbrush and paste. A bit more information as to meal times and offering snacks ( without feeling a nuisance for asking), would be a positive move. Toilets were generally clean considering the usage and mouth wash, toothbrushes, sanitary products, hand lotion and cologne a nice touch. 8/10 for efficiency and timeliness.
label: positive

text:
***AVOID AT ALL COSTS*** ***AVOID AT ALL COSTS***

An absolute scam of an airline company, I wanted to change my flight ticket on 20th of April and was rushed to send a confirmation for a flight change before 21st of April which involved a payment of 300 SGD which I agreed to. Upon calling back a few days later after checking that my flight has not been booked over the website, the agent over the phone tried to salvage the situation by LYING to me insisting that my original flight change booking flight was cancelled and instead, I now would have to pay SGD 1700 to rebook the flight change. There was no such cancellation of flights as the flight number of the "cancelled" flight was the exact same flight as the one that he proposed. I tried calling on multiple occasions and even though Singapore Airlines admitted their fault for SCREWING UP my booking and LYING to me, they would not change my flight at the original price that was agreed upon. As a result, I had to miss my other travel plans to London. Kudos to you idiots at Singapore Airlines for this.

My main issues are these:

1) After rushing me to confirm the flight changes before 21st of April, which I did on 20th of April, why was the flight not booked at the original agreed price of SGD 300. Is it a lack of competence that your staff can't operate a computer? The agent responsible for this is Shifana Khan, Customer Service Executive at Singapore Airlines.

2) When I called to enquire about the unconfirmed flight change, why did your agent lie to me and say that the original flight that I was supposed to change to was cancelled, and try to scam me for SGD 1700? IS IT ETHICAL TO LIE? Unfortunately I do not have the name of this agent as I was too shocked over the phone when I heard this.

In summary, if you want to get overcharged for non existent customer service and want your travel plans to go up into flames, use Singapore Airlines. 

And also do check out their Facebook page to see a log of unhappy customers who are facing/ faced similar issues as me, who had their travel experience spoilt because of their incompetency.
label: negative

text: Connecting flight for second job Typical Japanese accuracy on boarding procedure, entry and departure schedule/time. Seat was comfortable, pitty they don't have 'in between class' seat sa. Economy Comfort. Animation and selection of movies is sufficient. Service on board is perfect. Only strange thing was, that the crew only presented drinks 1 time!
label: positive

text: Outstanding customer Service I purchased two nonrefundable business class tickets NZ-AMS return before the coronavirus stopped our plans. We notified Singapore Air that we did not want to fly. Received an immediate reply with instructions on how to apply to get our money back. Full repayment into my account on the day we should have flown. Excellent service.
label: positive

text: Very good Love Singapore 🇸🇬 and of course Singapore Airlines is amazing 😉 don’t have to say anything about it the best of the best!!!
label: positive

text:
A REASONABLE FLIGHT Cattle class is cattle class no matter what airline you fly and a  bit disappointed after requesting an aisle seat at time of ticket purchase was allocated a window seat for part of journey
Food on the flight Sydney to Singapore was spicy I could not eat but return flight Delhi to Sydney food was reasonable. After all it is airline food which I find quite palatable except for the melted cheeses and over abundant use of spice.
I love the air buses as there is room at the end to really stretch out as the seats are so cramped and this reclining thats all well and good except the person behind who then cannot use table or watch the movie Personally I think one should not be allowed to recline
Air crew very pleasant check in a pleasurable experience
I would fly with Singapore Airlines again
label: positive

text: Singapore adventure We have flown many times with Singapore Airlines, always find them very efficient, good cabin service and a comfortable flight.  We went to Singapore for a week.  Singapore Airlines at Changi now has a self service check in procedure - couldn't print our boarding passes in advance - we managed but not easy for Seniors who are technically challenged.  Once you have your boarding pass, and your luggage label, you move to the next automated system which is to check in your bag.  Again, fortunately quite a simple procedure, but if we had been stuck, there was no one around to help us.  Cabin staff on the flight home to Sydney were excellent, very attentive, I stood up with them in the preparation area for a while, all of the crew were so friendly, and good to talk to.
label: positive

text: Very unhelpful customer service STAY AWAY FROM THESE JOKERS! They are terrible with customer service. I booked a flight on their website from Houston to Manchester. When I got the reservation, it had me going to Manchester, but then returning from Dublin! Dublin was never even on the site and I double checked. I called the customer service when I noticed this and they wanted an extra $1800 for us to change our tickets. Now we have to find a way to get to Dublin just to turn around and fly right back to Manchester to get back to Houston. It also stuck me in economy after we selected economy plus.They showed no remorse or willingness to help us. I'll stick with United from now on.
label: negative

text: Amazing experience  Excellent service , nice staff . Very comfortable chairs. Amazing experience travelling with Singapore airlines. Best part was vegetarian food !! Authentic Indian food offered in Singapore airlines flights .
label: positive

text:
Pleasant Flight Experience and Excellent Service Travelling with Singapore Airlines has always been a pleasant experience as it the journey was a comfortable one and the in-flight meals are pretty decent too.

The in-flight staff were professional and attentive to details and always serving you with a smile.
label: positive

text: On route to Kaula Lampur Flights stewardess  was absolutly fantastic. Mom on board with crying baby and they went out their way to help the Mom. Food was good and overall a pleasant flight. Good inflight entertainment. And the toilets where kept clean threw out the flight.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Layover Services The crew are just amazing. I eventually planned a long layover to go for sight seeing in Singapore. At the airport, they offer free tours, or you can just use the train connected to the airport and go for a quick peek to famous spots. The place has more to offer and will definitely be back for a longer period.
label: positive

text: Great fight Very good flight on time very helpful staff and loads of smiles plane clean and tidy was given a good choice for lunch and snacks offered drinks throughout flying time lovely smiles and goodbyes when we were at our destination have flown with them before several times and will again
label: positive

text:
Poor lounge.. Prêt à manger has better layout Dear Singapore Airlines, 

I was looking forward to become a Gold Member (as my company only allows me to fly economy and premium economy) and it’s the highest I can get... I have to say that I’m VERY disappointed with the lounge you offer us. Crap layout, unattractive work space and confortable seatings..  I was a Gold and Platinum member (yes even on economy i could get to Platinum) on Cathay Pacific before moving here and the comparison of lounges aren’t even close by 10001 miles ! Even regular passenger have better seat option within the airport. Simply go check in front of Wolfgang Puck restaurant where I when after experiencing this cheap offer of a lounge. (Don’t get me started of drinks and food offer) PLEASE I BEG YOU ! Make improvements. At the very least a few decent working space and comfortable chairs.

Sincerely... Disappointed
label: negative

text: Excellent Flight Experience Which Meets Full Expectation Excellent Flight Experience Which Meets Full Expectation of mine. It was awesome, wonderful, amazing flight experience for me. I had a big expectation from The Singapore Airlines and it meets my full expectations with all level of satisfaction.
label: positive

text: Best airline in my view! I have travelled several times to Australia with this airline and on every occasion the service has been exemplary. The cabin staff are polite courteous friendly and efficient. The choices of food are reasonable considering they have to cater for a wide variety of tastes. The airline is also very reasonable on pricing compared with other airlines. I will definitely use them again.
label: positive

text:
Family trip with a trusted airline A beautiful experience. Everything about the flight was good. Staffs were professional and treated with care. Food was delicious except the snack which was not good as per my opinion. Inflight media system was pretty good as it had quite a lot collections. Finally, the flight was on time and it was a smooth flight experience.
Highly recommended....
label: positive

text:
My visit to South Africa When booking my trip for the flight to South Africa, I had a few options, direct with SAA, via Dubai or via Singapore. I chose the flight with Singapore Airlines and repeated the same flight in October due to the fantastic service by the airline staff.  The whole way from Perth and again from Singapore the staff were tirelessly working the cabin. Right through the night they were offering water, juice and nibbles and no request seems to be too much to handle.

Although a bit longer than the direct flight, I will time and time again prefer this way rather than the much longer route via the Emirates.
label: positive

text: Best flight ever! As a family we fly a lot, and this was the best flight we ever had. New and comfortable plane, awesome flight attendants, very child friendly crew, child meal for no extra charge served first. I can't complain at all
label: positive

text: Terrific Service Service was fantastic. Crew members were extremely helpful and did all they could to make the trip as comfortable as possible. The extra you pay is worth it to go Premium Economy, especially for ththe long haul.
label: positive

text: Poor food We have flown with Singapore several times and each time we note the economy class food has deteriorated. We thought the dried out servings and horrible Chilean wine needs addressing. However, we were pleased they have ditched the tired 777 for a new A350 plane, which is a nice plane to fly in.
label: neutral

text:
Holiday Time My wife and i flew with Singapore Airlines for the first time in March 2020. 
Check in was really really good. The lady at check in was really friendly and helpful. She  told us about up grades and helped us with the seats we wanted.
The flight was awesome. Little turbulence and again really friendly crew. The food was really nice and even an ice cream was offered to customers. 
It's no wonder they are at the top of Airlines in the world.
Will fly again for sure in the future.
label: positive

text:
Choose yr flight from Brisbane Carefully The problem with this flight was the equipment (an "old" Boeing 777) and the arrival time in Changi. On previous flights (at different times) we have had newer aircraft..which have a few more features...such as USB ports for charging phones etc. If going to Europe - the arrival time in Changi leaves you with about 6-8 hours for connecting flights.  Even tho there are transit hotels - they are always booked out. So you have to try and find a comfortable chair to get some sleep.
With an arrival of 00:15 - I cannot understand why SQ wants to serve a "full" meal just before landing. The actual meals offered were not so so special. Why not just offer a sandwich or wrap?? Faster and easier to serve, no need for utensils etc etc - so no single use plastics involved. Of the airlines serving the destinations I visit - SQ is still the best of the bunch...
label: positive

text:
Very disappointed We flew at 1am in the morning from Tullamarine to Singapore. 
The plane was very tired and shabby. There was four in my group and one of the tables was only attached on one side so it just fell on to the persons knee. The food was just ok and as we had heard that they were the number 1 airline, so our expectations were very high. 
We were overall disappointed and will not fly them again.
label: neutral

text:
Simply the best! Everything about this airline is amazing. Once travelled during Christmas and the plane was decorated inside. It was lovely. 

Highly recommended!
label: positive

text: Great food Best food, plenty of films, legroom ok, flew out economy flew back premium economy, not worth the upgrade tho cant exactly lie flat to sleep, for the extra money, really just more room, and a choice from the cook book, yes champagne, didnt see any extra personal service than economy, i think i would go again for long flights short flights dont bother
label: positive

text:
Not the best Always used to be top drawer. What happened ? We travelled from Adelaide and then after a night stop in Singapore on to London
Both legs similar.Food seriously average and the service matched the food.whatever happened to that great attention to detail.service was rushed and not attentive at all
By comparison Qatar in a different league and really superior on every level

Time for a fast review and bring it back it back to the previous standard
The A380 make your bed is a joke. Ever tried. To do this with a bad back?
BA in the 90’s had a better concept and superior comfort

text: Nice airline reputation but economy is very similar to the rest. Economy s very similar to other airlines in spite of reputation of the airline as a step up. I was clean, the personnel was attentive and the price was right.

text: Surprisingly uncomfortable I had been told that Singapore was the best in the world. I didn't think so. I found the seats quite uncomfortable, especially the 3 point harnesses. Food on board was not good (luckily it was only a short flight so it didn't matter). Service was, however, impeccable.

text: Lovvveeee As usual, service was great. Loved the food, the drinks (gin and tonic), in flight entertainment. Usually would use SIA as I book early thus cheap. Only thing is that the plane going there was older so more worn. Need a little touch up
label: positive

text:
Still no. 1 to me Having tried Emirates and years ago Qatar Airways..
This time trying Singapore airlines on this route, though have used SingAir umpteen times.
The Asian airline is always better in service. Singapore or South East Asia is then another class above.

Most of their planes are are also relatively new as before, having one of the youngest non budget airlines in the world.

Service was good and they were promptly appearing when you need them.
label: positive

text:
Top Notch Service We had just finished our long haul flight from the US to Singapore and had to switch airlines for our final leg. Let me say, the service was excellent from the moment we walked up to the counter to recheck our bags. The agents were friendly and polite, recognized our Star Alliance status without issue, and gave us lounge passes after our long flight to relax. The boarding process was quick and seamless with smiling and helpful flight attendants. 

The standard amenities on Singapore Air were nice... All passengers are served a meal, and boy there are plenty to chose from during online check in (Kosher, Muslim, Vegan, etc.) They were quite tasty.  In flight entertainment in all seats, with several international movies and shows to choose from. All of the seats had power outlets to recharge. Our seats weren’t cramped like some US airlines either.
label: positive

text:
excellent reputation delay caused plane to arrive at 230 AM
good service and food
could not check in until 2 hours before flight
label: positive

text:
Excellent but with some flaws Singapore Airlines is still the best airline worldwide, but I have to notice that some service and features have worsened over the years.
The seat is now much closer to the next one. It is still a flat bed but  you have to slide transversally, with limited space for the legs. 
The overall comfort is reduced.
Menu for dinner and breakfast, appear more limite they used to be.
