text: ground service their ground service and agents are very bad. when i bought the ticket i called singapore airlines. They told me call 72 hours before the depture which i did. They told me no it is not 72 hours it is 48 hours for complimentry seat. call tomorrow after 10 a.m.. which i did now they are saying now when you get on  singapore airlines 48 hours from that time. I am realy harashed by singapore are lines. it is hoks , they don't want to gave any complementry seat. even you have medical condition. this is very bad bad public relation for such a big airlines. they costantly try to sell you staf which you don't need. i tolked with kristal claimed as supervisor.
label: negative

text:
Premium Economy is the New Economy I was excited about the non-stop flight from Singapore Airlines which we always have had incredible experience with. However, with the newly launched non-stop flight to Singapore, there are several misses which I felt degraded the overall experience I had come to expect from Singapore Airlines. 

While I have no complains with the seats on Premium Economy ("PE"), I am less than enthusiastic with the service on the flight compared to what I used to experience with the A380 on Singapore Airlines from JFK. SQ021 only has business and premium economy seats on the flight. This basically means PE is the new Economy, and it does feel a little that way for the flight as the basis for comparison is just between PE and Business. 

The plane is definitely smaller than the A380 and it feels that way despite the slightly higher ceiling. There really isn't much room to wander around since the PE class is all the way at the back of the plane, compared to the A380 where there is a galley area to hangout during the long flight, and a much larger economy class area to roam about. 

Amenities kit is limited to socks and eye mask, but on the bright side, they do serve decent champagne like Moet & Chandon. The Krisworld entertainment is amazing with the touchscreen and full of movie/tv/music options. Service wise, the crew was very attentive, though I feel that there seems to be less interaction with the passengers than the usual flights, perhaps due to the long journey. 

While the non-stop flight did shaved a couple hours off the journey, I think I would go back to the regular Frankfurt route with the stopover as it was nice break, and being to stretch and walk about for a bit was great.
label: positive

text: Sister's 30th Birthday The best airline ever.Excellent service.Delicious food.Friendly & helpful flight attendants.Comfortable seats.
label: positive

text: It was an experience It was an experience to fly with Singapore Airlines. I have no words to discribe how nice was everything. I'm honestly amazed, hope I can afford it more times to choose them.
label: positive

text: Good service but really poorly designed business class seats. The flight Sydney/Singapore on an A380 was much quieter than the noisy Boeing 777 Singapore/Paris CDG. The seats on both are really big boxes and you have to lie and even sit at an angle to get your feet to squeeze into the wee box that is meant to accommodate them. It is almost impossible to get a reasonably comfortable seated recline. The pre-ordered food was good. Service was good. The choice of entertainment is extraordinary. Singapore Changi business class lounge was mobbed as seems usual and not really comfortable.
label: positive

text:
Expected More So disappointing!
However the good things with flying on this B777-200 flight was that 
1)it left right on time
2) the space between your knees and the seat in front was more than ample. 
It was a smooth flight and arrived on time.
Then the disappointing things mounted up :-
1) my seat had little stuffing in the seat
2) my monitor failed to work after 30 mins
3)the movies choice was old
4) the remote was not user friendly
.... disappointing
The meal of BBQ chicken was horrible.
1) green vegetables were grey, over cooked
2) rice was soggy
3)the sauce was highly composed of sweetness
The hostess didn’t give the elderly woman beside me a chance of a drink but gave her tea without offering a wine. Plus gave her pasta and not offering a BBQ chicken.
Poor service
..... disappointing
Flying from NZ I would have expected a reasonable good NZ wine but no it was a South American wine!!
....disappointing
Finally with 30 mins before landing I still had not been offered Customs Declaration to fill in.
I had to go and ask for one. First time in all my travel this has happened.
My low score was given as this flight at least got us safely to our destination.
My Singapore flight to Wellington a week earlier was outstanding.so I wonder what happened to make this Tuesday flight  so poor?
label: negative

text:
Singapore Airlines SQ361/SQ362 - ARN/SIN SIN/ARN Transit via Moscow DME [Update] [This is an update to my earlier post regarding Singapore Airlines SQ361/SQ362 - ARN/SIN SIN/ARN Transit via Moscow DME]

When I posted that earlier review I didn't mention that I was travelling business class on SQ361/2, and that I was unable to find a convenient business class lounge for the DME layover. Now that I have travelled this route again here's what I can share with you if you too are travelling business class on SQ361/362 via DME. There is a lounge that business class travellers can use. Its called бизнес зал аэропорта (Airport Business Lounge). Its location and directions to it are actually printed on the reverse of the transit boarding card that you receive at DME. (I only realised that the directions to the lounge were printed on the back of the transit boarding card after my trip was over - easy to miss, and nothing to indicate business class lounge availability  after passing through transit security)

As you exit from the Transit security area immediately turn left and ascend the escalator (instead of walking along the corridor straight ahead to gate at which you will re-board SQ361/2) to the level above and follow the signs to a corridor on your right that indicates the location of the Airport Business Lounge (there are a couple of other lounges along that corridor). The lounge offers food and drinks and a place to relax. It's about 5 minutes walk back to the departure gate.
label: positive

text:
going back home I almost forgot, my flight schedule was horrible. but its not the airlines fault of course.
but I prefer take morning flight from Japan to back home.

everything was good, as your expected as 5 stars airlines.
I got muslim meals again, kebab as appetizer and rice set for main course.
I loved more the movies option from this flights than the 1 before.
label: positive

text:
Light and Shadows - between SQ 25 Premium Economy (FRA-SIN) and SQ 938 (SIN-DPS) ... cattle transport SQ 25 in Premium Economy O.K., the following SQ 938 a 'cattle transport' with lousy servive.

On the return voyage DPS-SIN Oct. 6 pleasant atmosphere abourd SQ 943 - Boeing 787 Dreamliner - followed by an absolutely disastrous experience on SQ 26 SIN-FRA in Premium Economy, totally disorganized crew, champagne (warm) only offered after insistent request - about two hours into flight - lousy food and very neglicent service throughout the long night to FRA. Have to reconsider my long standing attachment to SQ.
label: positive

text:
Singapoor, yes poor, Airlines  Lousy help desk at Terminal 3. I flew in from Brisbane. Went to the connecting help desk. She couldn't even tell me which terminal I landed and which terminal my connecting flight is from. 
The business class didn't even have a choice of food. Only vegetarian. This us after paying $8000 for the trip.
label: negative

text:
Comfortable Primium Economy The SQ Primium Economy seats are 2-4-2 configuration, seats are quite wide with adjustable foot rest. One of the better PE I experienced. Two meals are being served, dinner - about an hour after takeoff and breakfast - about an hour before landing. Stanard airplane food and nothing extraordinary ! 
Being Singapore Airline, services are attentive and courteous ! 
The inflight restrooms need more cleaning though !
label: positive

text: Best Pandemic flight service Really impressed by the service I got during my flight back from Phnom Penh to Jakarta via Singapore. I like their green and safe concept of in-flight meals. They also provide us with sanitary kit.
label: positive

text:
Very Good Flight It seemed to take a very long time to get the dinner service.We were row 58 in economy but it was midnight before we had dinner. take off was 10.30 pm.

Entertainment was very good, only disappointment was the food, which was okay, but only ate parts of it especially the breakfast. 

The flight attendants were all very friendly and overall the flight was a pleasant one.
label: positive

text:
best economy experience had a great flight for both sectors and after flying i can say that yes SQ is perhaps the best airlines in world, their economy class services were way better than any other say emirates, etihad, ethiopian, china southern etc.

would always recommend SQ over any other airlines
label: positive

text: Clean,friendly and professional we have always used Singapore Airlines when we go to the Philippines and can’t really fault them compare to other airlines we have used going to other places.
label: positive

text: Did not provide priority luggages for star alliance gold Checked in at the premium economy counter in Auckland. Was about to report for luggage lost in Singapore when we spotted our luggages coming out without priority tag. The counter didn’t know what service to provide to star alliance gold members and they didn’t even bother to ask, too.
label: negative

text: Ticks all the boxes Top class airline. Plenty of legroom in economy and enough pitch in the seat to get comfortable. I am 5.11’ so not small (and not big either I suppose). Food was great and service excellent. And finally, good value for money. Would definitely recommend for long haul flights.
label: positive

text:
SQ-469 - A Complete Disaster from Check-in to Deplaning! Check-in, after we had checked in on the web, took the best part of 20 minutes with staff telling us it was 'system trouble' when they were clearly nonplussed about the meaning of the term 'indefinite' against the column 'Expiry Date' of my Philippine visa. They were unable to see that I had entered the Philippines a dozen times in 2018 on the strength of my permanent retiree visa, nor did they ask to see my visa-linked identity card issued by the Philippine government. 
The seat surroundings were filthy - stains left behind by previous passengers had not been cleaned and there was grime everywhere. When we spoke to the Purser, she brought wet wipes to clean the filth herself but to little avail - the stains and grime had accumulated over time, and there was little that wet wipes could do.
The seats themselves were touted as angled lie-flat. The reality is that you keep sliding off the seat given the angle - it wasn't worth complaining since these seats have been around for at least 15 years and Singapore Airlines hasn't bothered to replace them despite their obvious shortcomings. Aircraft with these seats are typically used for routes to and from South Asia and, occasionally, Southeast Asia. They cannot be seen on routes to Europe and North America.
The business class section had two toilets, one of which was unserviceable for the duration of the flight. Shockingly, two of the economy class toilets were also unserviceable. And it was a full flight. Imagine the discomfort of the passengers lining up in the few serviceable toilets. 
All in all, a very poor experience that was completely unexpected from the so-called 'leading airline of the world'. This flight suggested that 'leading from the behind' was probably a better title for Singapore Airlines to wear.
label: negative

text:
Always good We have used Singapore airlines a few times now. The service is so much better than the other long haul airlines.
My only niggle is that the vegetarian food is very repetitive, not everyone likes to have curry for breakfast, lunch & dinner. 
We are using them again in December & are very excited to be one of the first to fly on the new airbus.
label: positive

text: Delay, no apology . Rude staff, no toilet paper The flight was delayed and delayed, I was told I had no seat, then I did. Finally when I boarded, the last one on we sat for another hour, some passengers sat for 2 hours on the plane. When we finally left after 4am staff were rude, not helpful as many were worried about connecting flights no announcements were made. The food was almost thrown at us, no toilet paper in the toilets, staff talking loudly throughout the night. Generally a very I enjoyable experience, Singapore airline used to be a pleasure to fly with now I would never do so again.
label: negative

text:
Best airline in the world, no doubt! This is the best airline in the world, or maybe I'm just biased :) As a Singaporean, I am proud that our airline always makes it to the top of the list. Well, it is definitely not hard to see why. From the check in, to the lounge, to the cabin, the whole flying experience was top notch. We had a few check in counters dedicated to business class passengers, boarding was priority for us, seats were extremely comfortable with ample legroom, lots of in-flight entertainment, crews were friendly and helpful, the food (there were a few courses including dessert!) was nicely plated and to-die-for (we can choose our meals online prior to the flight), toilet was well stocked with mouthwash, toothrushes, body mist etc and everything was EXCELLENT. 

You will not surely not regret flying with Singapore Airlines, because they are the best for a reason!
label: positive

text: Good seats but service below expectation Flight was on a new A350 which was an improvement on the 777 they used to run on this flight. Everything was on time and we landed a bit early and our luggage was on the belt by the time we cleared immigration. The seat was comfortable and plenty of legroom. For some reason, I could not check-in online and wasted a lot of time with their website and app without success. I was a bit disappointed with the food quality and I could not connect my own headphones to the entertainment system (others around me had the same problem). Overall not bad but I expected a bit better based on past experiences.
label: positive

text: Old plane with bad video equipment and beverage I picked Singapore Airlines over others because of its top airline reputation but found out that it's all hype and exaggeration. Although the inflight service was good, the plane was so old that the seats and fabric were discolored and frayed, cabin looked tired and the video equipment did not work in half of the seats in my row and the row next to me (the attendant had to hand out about four S$75 compendation vouchers). The beer they served was a mere 4 oz (much less than a regular 12 oz can) in a small plastic cup so I had to sipped it slowly like fine wine. When I asked for the whole can, the attendant was puzzled and brought me another 4 oz teeny weeny cup. I have flown on worst airlines like Indian airlines, etc and did not get any voucher compensation but Singapore Air is supposed to be No. 1.
label: neutral

text:
Singapore Airlines the preferred airline, especially for long-haul flights. You may have to pay a premium for Singapore Airlines, but with that comes world-class airline services that sets a very high standard for inflight entertainment, choice of meals, and other ad-hoc requirements. 

As a PPS (SQ business class travel card) member, I still get preferred services, whilst traveling economy class. Although I'd recommend for longer flights to upgrade, even paying more for Premium Economy or Business Class, if you want the full SQ experience, Still ahead when compared many international world class airlines from Asia, Europe, or America.
label: positive

text: loved my flight had fun travelling with kids...they loved watching the kids movie and also received goodies from SIA.
label: positive

text: Sydney to Singapore with a stop in Canberra I have flown this route many times on various airlines but Singapore Airlines is my preferred due to my SQ FF status. I get to use the lounge and have better access to preferred seating. This was my first flight on SQ288 departing Sydney daily at 9:30pm with a brief stop in Canberra. The full flight routing is Singapore-Sydney-Canberra-Singapore. May travellers get off in Canberra after a stop in Sydney. The route is serviced by a B777-300ER with First Class if you want. Loads out of Canberra are generally lighter. On this over night flight arriving one hour early at 4:00am I had 3 seats to myself and was able sleep for a while. However, the woman in front of me kept reaching back and touching the touch screen which turned it on and woke me up! What reach back all the time?? I had to keep turning if off in the dark cabin. We are at a hight alert level with the Corona Virus and all fight crew wore masks. They did not have to smile I guess but they said it with their eyes.
label: positive

text:
Always Good to Fly with them Always good to travel Singapore.  My travel agent rates them highly and I admit, I have to agree.
I usually fly Singapore when I am all over Asia.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines We recently flew with Singapore Airlines although not for the first time. We had no problems with the booking, the flights and the punctuality. The only thing that was annoying was trying to book suitable seats. We were told different things and didn’t realise that when you book the flight you can also book the seats. However when we got on we had perfect seats. The seats don’t seem as squashed as some airlines, the staff were lovely and helpful. One way was an older plane and my headphones didn’t work properly but everything else was fine.
label: positive

text:
Most generous airline Singapore Airline is Best airline I have travelled and in 25 years around the world. Crew is very generous in service.
Planes are extremely clean.
label: positive

text: Perfect flight Flying solo and for the first time in a number of years I wasn’t looking forward to my journey but I was soon at ease and was so pleased with the comfort of the seat the service was excellent and I really couldn’t have wished for a better journey to Australia. I felt very happy to be travelling with Singapore airlines and I shall definitely fly with them next time.
label: positive

text: Treated like a King/Queen A trusted source had always raved about Singapore Airlines to me. It remains my only flight with them, a return one in 2016, but I can say the customer service is second to none, and I have Qatar Airways and Cathay Pacific top of my list. They make sure you are hydrated and well fed, constantly bringing around drinks and snacks and walking up and down the aisles to collect your rubbish. I had a special meal so I wasn't entitled to the ice-cream dessert for the standard meals, but the lovely air stewardess remembered and gave the spare one leftover to me. Not only do they have metal cutlery, but the air steward I asked many questions to answered them all. Changi Airport is familiar to me and rates highly on my list of best airports in the World and they did not disappoint. Instead of an hour until boarding for my connecting flight, I had twenty minutes due to the pilots arriving late at Heathrow: as soon as we set foot in Changi airport, there was one staff person waiting to tell us where to go and they gave me very clear instructions. I did not miss my flight.
label: positive

text: Take ear plugs and an eye mask Chose to fly with this airline again after a good experience on our last long haul more than 20 years ago. the staff were as attentive and helpful as they were last time, but the food was disappointing. Not much legroom in Economy and if the passenger in the seat in front puts their seat back you will find  your tv screen too close for comfort. The facilities were clean and we were regularly offered refreshments and snacks
label: neutral

text: Roomy, Pleasant Flight Our first flight on Singapore Airlines was a pleasurable experience. We flew economy class and yet our seats were comfortable with plenty of leg room for my six foot husband. The head rests were comfortable; food was tasty. The female stewardesses were beautifully attired. And the price was exceptionally economical. We were very pleased with our flight.
label: positive

text:
From check in to Landing its all very easy From checking in on line, to queing to get onto a delayed flight, due to some pretty horrid weather, I was glad to be on the ground rather than flying through that storm.
Checking bags in, was improved by the Singapore staff stopping a 6 males who decided they could push to the front of the queue and check in at their timings. They were sent to the back to the amusement of other passengers. The flight was fantastic, the staff could do no more and every request was greeted with a smile and fantasic service. Nothing was to much trouble and the service is so subtle, it works amazinly well. The seat was comfortable and so well designed to allow free movement and the ability to change seating positions and angles. The selection in in flight entertainment was adequate and plenty to choose from, films to music to games enough to keep anyone amused.
label: positive

text:
The Best Airlines!!! Fantastic flight with very comfortable seats, and facilities. With a great selection of in flight entertainment movies it was a pleasant experience. ”Staff were very attentive and thoroughly enjoyed flying with Singapore airlines. 
Food - yum, bathroom facilities - spotless, accessories - new or very well cleaned and repackaged. Blankets - clean and fresh. Pillows - clean and fresh. Seating area - clean and fresh, aisles clean.
label: positive

text: great airline and fabulous staff We have flown several times with this airline and the reason for this is that they have a good safety track record, the A380 is a bit more spacious and the crew are so nice and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble and its always service with a smile.
label: positive

text: Poor value Paid a lot extra to fly home premium economy.  The seat was as expected, the food and service was extremely poor.  Would not recommend as good value.  Took ages to be offered refreshment.  Champagne was offered but was awful.  When we flew Emirates the service was 100% better
label: neutral

text: Full flight, yet not bad experience I had travelled with Singapore Airlines business class before and this time on economy they still did not disappoint. The flight was full, but the crew did everything they could to make it a pleasant experience to all. There are certainly cheaper airlines, but I sincerely recommend them as they make me feel safe with their professionalism.
label: positive

text: Attention to Detail? Always a pleasure to fly in Business Class with SIA.  The choice of food and drink is good and it is served correctly. They understand in Business about service. Not so in the lower classes! The seats are comfortable and there is a lot of legroom. They knew my name, but my younger son Oliver was called Olivia, even though he looks like a young boy.
label: positive

text:
Disappointed We had high expectations, as I had heard good things about Singapore Airlines, but unfortunately we were left disappointed.  We would normally fly Jetstar business class and I wish we had of stayed with them, as Singapore airlines was more expensive. 

The set up of the plane was poor compared to business class on Jetstar, the toilet situation was undesirable because unlike on business class Jetstar you are only sharing the toilet with about 28 other passengers. On Singapore premium economy you are sharing it with the whole plain. The service was poor. We we not offered refreshments prior to take off and I imagine this was because of the layout of the plane. When we were offered refreshments and food it took forever for the flight attendants to come round and collect the rubbish and empty trays. 

Overall I would rate Singapore Airlines as poor and would not fly with them again, and I definitely would not recommend them.
label: negative

text: Lost passport found and delivered - Thank you, Vish! Full marks to Vish of Singapore Airlines at Auckland!  My wife lost her passport and the Airline found it on the aircraft.  Luckily my wife has dual nationality and so could use her other passport to enter New Zealand, but a few days later Vish called to say the lost passport had been found and so arranged for it to be delivered to us (at MIQ in Auckland).  Excellent service!
label: positive

text: bulkhead seats for business class traveling with wife for an anniversary trip, it was great to find a "sale" price for business class seats on this airline that I thought had one of the best reputations.  I paid less than twice the cost of coach seats.  The lounge at JKF is Swissair (okay, nothing special).  The seats for business class on this older A380 double decker are as wide as first class seats.  Food was ordered online many weeks before and was the best I've had in the air.  Overall an excellent experience that I'd repeat in a heartbeat.
label: positive

text: exceptional service getting injured overseas was a nightmare - getting home with singapore airlines made my nightmare fade - the ever helpful staff - superior seating - can we help with anything at all attitude - made what could have been a horror flight into a very pleasant one . need i say any more
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Excellent care and service. From check in to baggage claim. The seat was a wee tight but the good food and videos made up for it. I liked the assortment of food, but the little snacks were not too good.
label: positive

text: Service Great comfort and food. But the attitude of the staff leaves something to be desired. I know every airline has a problem with Indian passengers, and most of it is justified. But not everyone is like that. So a little less arrogance by the staff would have been nicer. On the Kolkata to Auckland sector where we traveled Silk Air and Air New Zealand, we did not face this negativity. Especially Air New Zealand had wonderful staff
label: positive

text:
One of the best airlines Service was very attentive and the food was delicious. It had a Spacious toilet. :) 

We received a cleaning pack and a comfortable warm socks.Their pillows are second to none. 
This flight wasn’t the first flight for us with this airline and we definitely will use them again.
label: positive

text:
LS PHEE KIM MENG - SQ 805 22nd sept 855am I've flown with Singapore airlines numerous times. Yes there has been good service most trips however with this one... you will definitely have trouble finding someone to TOP the EXCELLENT SERVICE LEVELS of LS PHEE KIM MENG. 

1) As per usual SQ style, all guests were greeted with a smile. LS PHEE did not greet guests as if it were part of his job to greet us.. LS PHEE greeted us as if he was truly glad to have us on board. The smile and greeting was so sincere and genuine you could not help but feel that the flight was going to be an exceptional one. 

2) LS PHEE must have noticed my slight limp. Due to my medical situation, my feet swell up a lot and it makes it hard for me to walk so I hobble. They also hurt a lot. However due to the flight being booked at the last minute (change of flight due to typhoon heading to HK last week) I was stuck in economy. It would have been ideal to have gotten a seat where I could elevate my legs... and then I was greeted with LS PHEE's big friendly grin telling me that he will keep a lookout for me on a particular row which could possibly be empty. If it all goes well, he will let me know so I could move. With lady luck on my side and LS PHEE, it was available and I moved forward to the empty row. Like that wasn't enough, LS PHEE offered to take my carry on for me and asked if I needed reading material since my bag was stored on top.. and if there was anything I needed before take off. After the seat belt sign was switched off, he quickly came over to ask if I need help with my bags and proceeded to ensure i was good and comfy... and entertained (got my earphones reading material etc). 

3) during food service, LS PHEE ensured to look out for me as well making sure I got my meal as I liked and proceeded to check everyone else as well. This was so helpful as I was due for my next round of meds that I needed to take after meals as well. 

4) now this is all my own experience but being an editor of a senior management magazine who also does reviews, I was sure to look out for other observations too. LS PHEE was friendly and helpful to all passengers and as you know, that always makes for an extra special flight. 

5) last but not least, LS PHEE is equally polite, caring, and helpful to his fellow crew mates. Now dear Singaporeairlines, you have a gem of a staff here and I truly hope that you realise that:). 

I do sincerely hope that this email is shared with LS PHEE as well as put on his record. I'll be sure to share this on my platforms too. LS PHEE to me is the epitome of SQ serviceexcellence that I've felt has dipped over the past few years. LS PHEE has once again revived my love for the airline and faith that your service levels will keep going only one way.. UP Yours truly Sadie-Jane NUNIS Krisflyer 8230650646Seat 41H
label: positive

text: Was I in coach? Everything about this flight was right. Two bags were included with a carry on.   Check in was efficient.  The full flight was boarded quickly and took off from the gate right on time.  The food was included and was great and filling.  Service was prompt and friendly.  There were plenty of bathrooms so you didn't have to wait.  Entertainment was wonderful and also included.
label: positive

text: Good airline to travel with Long haul flights are never that great, but this was as good as could be. Nice service, pretty good food, a way better selection of movies than air nz had on my preceding flight, and if you wanted an extra snack you needed only to ask. The toilets are surprisingly big and stayed nice for the flight.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines to the UK Flew from Canberra to Singapore then on to London. Night flight out which is excellent. I put in bid for an upgrade for a premium economy seat which I got for the first leg. Best move. I had the front row by the emergency exit so no-one in front. Had a meal and slept for most of that leg.

Economy for the long leg from Singapore to London. Couldn’t bid for an upgrade as that leg was full. While it was ok, it made me realise that premium economy is definitely the way to go. Sitting in economy for 13 hours was hard going.

I’ve flown Singapore Airlines a few times and the food has always been excellent. This time it was ok but not up to the usual high standard.

Two recommendations - if you can afford to fly premium economy do it. Especially if you can put in a bid for an upgrade.
 
Check the seating plan for the A380. I booked a seat that showed on the seating plan as three seats behind the bulk head seats with one seat not having a seat in front of it. I was very happy to think I was going to be able to stretch out.  Much to my dismay, I got to my seat only to find that the seating plan was wrong. The seat by the window had the legroom. Not mine. Check the seating plan and check with the airline. The passenger beside me also confirmed that she had seen the same seating plan that showed my seat with nothing in front of it.

I would definitely fly Singapore Airlines again - good time going into London, late in the afternoon. I would definitely try to fly premium economy and if I couldn’t I would recommend getting a seat with extra legroom but confirm that with the airline.
label: positive

text: Holiday With Singapore Airlines We used Singapore Airlines 26 Dec 18 returned 29 Jan 19.  We used premium economy. Leg space was good although the leg support is useless.  Sydney-Singapore leg my partner's seat wouldn't recline, the attended had to climb on and force the seat back.  The attendants missed us twice to provide a meal, I had to remind them on both occasrion.  The last meal Singapore-Sydney was disgraceful.  One mouthful vegetables spat them out, no flavour and tasted like they were cooked in dirty water.  There were aspects that were satisfactory and expected however we were very disappointed as we had greater expectations.
label: neutral

text: Great airline but Tripadvisor is very difficult to work with When I tried to change my review for Dream Native resort, Tripadvisor made it nearly impossible.  Thanks for nothing.  I probably will not write any more reviews for you.
label: positive

text: Mean spirited bunch of ****’s The airline is regimented and inflexible. Don’t ask for anything extra or anything out of the extraordinary. Just pay the money, sit in the seat, shut-up and do your time. Or, consider taking Qantas, Virgin or a myriad of better and friendlier airlines
label: negative

text: Airbus A380 from Zürich to Singapore This was the best flight we ever had . The A380 is amazing , best plane ever !!!!! I dont like smaller planes , in turbulences they often shake a lot . The Airbus A380 seems to be much more comfortable in These situations . Everything was great . Good Food , fast Service , very friendly !!!!! Very Good Airline !!!!!
label: positive

text: Pretty good Best thing about Singapore airlines is the hot towels provided during the start of the flight which freshens you up. Legroom is pretty average but comfortable. Service is good, meals provided in the flight are pretty good. In flight entertainment options needs to be improved. Most of the apps are not working during the flight.
label: positive

text: Great airline Singapore Airlines takes service to the next level compared to most airlines and the food and presentation is better than a lot of restaurants I have eaten in. Window seat is not to all tastes as you have to sleep at an angle, centre aisle seats are better for night flights.
label: positive

text: Usual high standard maintained No fuss. The usual high standard from SIA. They are accommodating enough not to turn away passengers in the later boarding group. But steward/stewardness are well organized that these minor hiccups are not a hindrance to on-time departure.
label: positive

text: Great Airline Great airline,great service,great planes and good all round service,food and entertainment and very clean
label: positive

text: The Singapore Airlines A350-900 is not a comfortable aircraft The legroom is small and the seat seems to be narrower than the other aircrafts operating by Singapore Airlines. The seat configuration or layout is rather peculiar. Seat No: 41C and 41H (seats with better legroom) are practically blocking 1/3  or 1/2 of the passage when coming from Premiun Economy class to Economy class. Sitting on these seats, you have to be careful to avoid any passenger or food cart from knocking into your leg.
label: neutral

text: Can't fault it ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ I was happy with the flight, in-flight entertainment. The plane was clean as a whistle, I checked it. The embarking process is interesting as I thought it would ease settling in. However, I had a window seat but found people already occupying isle seats. When flying long haul its always important to wear comfortable shoes and clothes and keep warm.  If you don't have the airline provides slippers and socks on request as well as blankets and pillows. They also have tooth brush for those who don't have in their carry-on luggage. Water is always avail for the dry throat.
label: positive

text: Singapore Air is Price Gouging for people who rebook due to Covid I am disappointed that Singapore Airlines is price gouging and taking advantage of people who need to rebook flight due to covid. I had an oringinal booking from Osaka to Singapore for Dec 23, 2021. I could not travel due to covid and I wanted to push my flight back one year. Singapore Air would not let me do this so I pushed it back to April of 2022 with the intention of pushing that one back to Dec 23, 2022 when I intend to fly. I am now trying to  rebook from April to December 2022 and my travel agency (Expedia) told me it will cost over $2000 per ticket to rebook!!! This is outrageous!!! The fares online for that date are $679 USD per person. I paid $569 USD for my original ticket and $130 USD to rebook to April the first time for a total of $699 per ticket. So although the website says its $679 to purchase a ticket in December of 2022, I am being told its the amount I have already paid plus over $2000! This is taking advantage of your customers. I have never flown with Singapore Air and I was excited to experience and see what was behind all the good reviews online. However, thus far, the experience has been much worse than any other airline we have booked through for this trip. Why can't you give me the price that someone booking online would get? This is not fair.
label: negative

text: better than most... A better than most airline... I woud say ona par with Emirates to be honest.. loved the singapore slings in economy class and the food is about the same as emirates to be honest... biggest plus... you don't traansfer through Dubai.. personally can't stand that place for transfers!  Other than It's a sexist misogynistic city with a horrific human rights record, it's also huge and hard to find gates!
label: neutral

text:
Awesome Flight We had a great flight to Singapore with the Airline really nice plane extremely clean really comfy seats with foot rests. The service was excellent by all the flight crew we had really nice food and a few Singapore slings along the way even got ice cream after our meal.
I will definitely be flying with them again.
I highly recommend Singapore Airlines 👍😃
label: positive

text: Cramped Seat What a difference to our previous flight. We were seated in 44H and J on the B787. Now I'm on the larger size and I cannot recall ever experiencing such cramped seating on a flight. Legroom was not a problem but the space between seats was. I could not fully deploy the table for the meal service, a half table had to suffice. When the passenger in front reclined the seat, it was very uncomfortable. We did enjoy the services of an excellent cabin crew, a delicious meal served, quality amenity kits distributed, and juices/soft drinks/water served at regular intervals. Felt safe throughout the flight although there was heavy turbulence on occasions.
label: positive

text:
Great seats and service, below expectations for food The business class seats are some of the widest I have experienced. Very comfortable flat flat with a slight negative comment on the funny angle one needs to place it’s legs. Great entertainment system. 

I fly Air France often, the seats are much narrower.

However my expectations for the food on SQ quickly had to be tamed... little flavours. Below average carrot cake. Needless to comment in the cake.

Overall great experience. The A350 900 is a stunning aircraft. Quietest I have been in on. Better than 787.
label: positive

text: Weird term on not able to use Lounge I booked full trip with Singapore airline from Hong Kong to Singapore, then connecting flight from Singapore to Mauritius. Transit time is 2.5 hours which is acceptable, however, while transit in Singapore, I approached to SQ lounge. I was rejected to use the lounge travelling on business class as said Sin to Mauritius is a code share flight, but my ticket and boarding pass are said it is SQ6051. Well, this is the first time I didn’t be able to use lounge while travelling business class worldwide with all other airlines. Weird policy and there is no lounge at all for this route. I find it fairly ridiculous and the two SQ ladies in the lounge in T2 are neither helpful even I’m feeling fairly tired. I can’t believe this is SQ service claimed to quite professional and quality service in airline industry.
label: negative

text: Mr Nice airline,plenty legroom, neat & clean, friendly pretty air hostess, clean toilets, refreshments given on request at all times,good latest movies,did not encounter any problems & will fly with them again.
label: positive

text:
Flights from NZ to Paris via Singapore Amazing movie and entertainment selection, food and drinks. Plenty of toilets so waiting time minimised.
Able to stretch and go for a walk around plane on this long flight. Hostesses very polite and helpful.
Boarding well organised. Could do with a little more legroom but otherwise very comfortable.
label: positive

text: Top Class Singapore Airlines is up there with the best airlines of the world in terms of safety, service and quality of aircraft. What else do you need to say, everything was as expected.
label: positive

text:
A good Airline but not as I was led to understand This was billed as THE AIRLINE - well  top deck A380 it was going to be good - and sure the boarding was good - the crew friendly and the seat first class - the movies were plentiful - the seat made a good bed and the pillow and cover were of a high standard - my issue comes from the fact it is billed as one of the three best well - I would question that - it is good - the food lets it down - its not great  -the lamb was dry - difficult to get right - and the Breakfast was pretty dire - the egg was awful and the veal sausage un eatable  - Drinks were served but no refills - this was a 13 hour flight - you did not get an amenity kit you had to ask for the items you wanted - socks, slippers etc - I have to say that on the same route to Europe Finnair would be as good if not better.
They have like most airlines reduced costs and it shows.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy Used SA flying to and from Amsterdam/Auckland. We were quite happy with our choice (Pre,ium Economy. Lots of free leg space and very relaxed (2 window seats). Very nice personnel and good food with very nice selections (mostly rice/Nasi). We loved it. Frequent visit by cabin crew with additional food and drinks during the 4 flights (forth and back). We will definately choose for Premium Economy again next time when flying long distances.
label: positive

text: International flight This particular trip was very stuffy, it was far too warm in the plane and triggered my claustrophobia so I was very uncomfortable, the next flight from Singapore to Brisbane was better
label: neutral

text:
Missing luggage  Here we go again. After 5 days we have still not received our luggage and SA will have nothing to do with this, although it is their responsibility to ensure that the luggage is safe
No response from SA we don’t understand what is going on.
label: negative

text: Lived my dream I would love to recommend Singapore Airlines Suites to the traveller as it gives a privacy with personal touch. The crew is the best ever. That’s why they are best in business.
label: positive

text:
Still the best airline in the world! Been using Singapore Airlines for years.  I have tried Emirates for comparison purposes occasionally but it leaves a lot to be desired. Basically a poor imitator when compared to Singapore airlines. I once flew from Sydney to Auckland on Emirates A380 a few years ago. The plane was old and worn. Toilet had no hand soap for the entire flight. How unprofessional! The crew is always professional and treat passengers well. The food is usually wonderful as well. If there are any issues or feedback, just let them know. They do take comments seriously as well. 

Keep it up!
label: positive

text: Business class lights from Heathrow to Singapore and return Still one of the best business class airlines - comfortable seats, lots of space and good on-board food.  Check-in staff at Heathrow were most helpful in reallocating seats so my husband and I could sit together and once on the plane, the cabin crew in our section could not have been more professional, attentive or charming.  We travelled out on a 777 and back on an A380. I have to say that when lying down, I thought the business class seats on the 777 were more comfortable than those on the A380.  Having said that, both were extremely comfortable to sit in. If you have the time, to try make use of the Book the Cook facility where until 24 hours before departure you can make your choice of your main course on the flight. This worked well and we enjoyed our choice of food. Although Singapore airlines have withdrawn their amenity kits in business class, you can still find most of what you would have found in an amenity kit on-board. Certainly, there were plenty of toothpaste and toothbrush sets which I made use of.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline Refund I had to cancel my ticket as I had to go for an emergency to Colombo well before the date I was planning to go. I have cancelled my ticket in 20th Dec 2021 and today is 31st Jan 2022. I still haven't received my refund. When I called them they said that it will take 4 months to refund my money. Is this fair according to the Australian consumer law? Or Is Singapore airline taking the advantage of travellers like us.
label: negative

text: Good service Check in was good, especially as we had golf clubs with us. Premium gave a little more room for stretching out, service was very good, couldn't complain about food or drinks. Had plenty of choice in entertainment.
label: positive

text:
Service Level  Service level for SQ is good.
The staffs is very friendly, the leg room and the seat is big enough. The prawns noodles is nice. 1 of their signature dish. 
Singapore Airlines always is our first choice.
label: positive

text:
Poor service We thought that by paying more than a alternative flight with a different carrier we would have a better service.
How wrong we were! On 4 flights we only got our first choice of meal on 2 occasions with no real apology.
It was very much 'take it or leave it's
Not quite what we expected from Singapore airlines.
label: neutral

text:
Deserved the best airlines in the world Singapore airlines deserved get title the best airlines in the world... 

Aircrew                                 : 9/10
Facility                                  : 10/10
Premium economy class   : 9/10
Entertainment                      : 9/10
Food, snack, drink               : 9/ 10
Ontime                                  : 10/10

I like it n worth it 👍
label: positive

text: Always the best I try a lot of Airlines but Singapore is my favorit , Always the Best service, realy Nice staff, and Always on time.
label: positive

text: They don’t allow seat selection in advance It is really upsetting that they don’t allow for advanced online seat selection. Thus I have to reach airport 3 hours before the flight just to secure a seat which I prefer. Sigh. And their leg room is smaller than other flights like Emirates which is a bit uncomfortable for long haul fight.
label: negative

text: Always a pleasure Always a pleasure traveling Singapore airlines. Comfort comes first for us and this airline always delivers it. Delicious food and a lot of options are available to suit families dietary requirements. Good hospitality and the Info/Entertainment system keeps updating every other year I travel in this airline which is a plus. Fresh fruits and other snacks/drinks are available upon requests anytime during the flight, which is very convenient. As we fly long hours of 10 hours and more, we get served two big meals. In-between the meals the movies/music would keep the travelers entertained and won't feel bored. Headphone jackets do not need a converter which is an added advantage. Some flights do come with USB outlets for charging devices and Wifi for an extra fee.
label: positive

text:
Great Flight from Singapore to London The Singapore Airlines A380 flight from Singapore to London, UK offers excellent service and value for your money in Premium Economy Class.

The flight staff were attentive, professional and friendly and the long direct flight of 13 hours and 35 minutes seemed to go by quickly. I highly recommend Premium Economy Class for this flight with wide and comfortable seats in a 2-4-2 configuration especially in the window and isle combination (2). You do not have to share an armrest, you have extra legroom and an additional recline angle for your seat that allows for sleeping on this overnight flight to London.

The food was well above average and there is a wide range of entertainment options for movies, TV shows, news and music for those who do not want to sleep. For those who do choose to sleep after the main meal and before breakfast, Singapore Airlines offers large blankets and reasonably comfortable pillows.

This A380 flight is great for those that have business or tourism in London. Compared with many long haul flights, Singapore Airlines flight SQ306 is one of the better options available and it lives up to the Singapore Airlines ranking as one of the best airlines in the world. It certainly met with my needs and expectations and I would book this flight again.

Put it on your list of options as it offers competitive cost, good service and the quality of a first class airline from Singapore to London. While you can ask for a sleep mask and earplugs, Singapore Airlines, should include these for everyone who chooses to fly in premium economy class on a flight of this duration.
label: positive

text: First trip On my first trip to Asia I chose to go Singapore Airlines.  It was recommended by the travel agency I used to book the trip. It was first class (no pun intended) all the way except for the food.   Plenty of it but lacking in taste.  Hence only 4 out of 5.   Great service and accommodations, though.
label: positive

text:
Bag drop at Heathrow took far too long A disappointing start when finding the queue for bag drop was shared with other airlines, so after tagging our own bags - queued through a well-snaked line for 25 minutes to drop our bags at the counter. not good enough for an airline of SQ reputation. 
Rest of the flight pretty standard - but disappointing start. In other trips Emirates and Qantas have had better check in experiences at Heathrow.
label: positive

text:
Great flight I flew a late afternoon flight to Singapore and it was good.  I was lucky enough to have an aisle seat and it had a decent amount of leg room.  The seats were comfortable and certainly wide enough.

The inflight entertainment had a very wide range of viewing options, ranging from the latest movies to BBC comedies and documentaries.  A lot of Asian and Indian content too, so more than enough to keep you entertained on the flight.

The cabin crew were superb (As always with Singapore Airline).  They could not be more helpful, cheerful and efficient.  A big thumbs up to them.  

The food was certainly a highlight of the flight for me.  I was lucky enough to have, I think it was called Bombo chicken with rice.  It was an Indonesian meal and was superb.  I mean really tasty and well cooked.  For desert was Mrs Beer vanilla ice cream which was certainly a high grade ice cream.

The flight was smooth and certainly could not be criticised in any way or form.  I will definitely be flying with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Unfair Charges Due to Government border shutdowns, I decided to bring my flights home forward by 2 days.   Supposed to be no rebooking charges, but they charged me an extra $520 AUD to do so, with a far worse delay at Singapore Airport!   This was far more than double what the original flights cost.
label: negative

text: Downward Spiral Actually there were four flights including returns with Singapore Airlines on a recent trip to Japan. Over the last few years I have noticed the decline in standards of what was once my preferred airline. The one constant was the staff were always polite and friendly, but beyond that even the service was noticeably less efficient. Of the four flights at least once on each flight I was given either the wrong meal or staff didn't follow up a service request. On at least two of the flights I know alcohol is normally given, none was offered, and on inquiring was told non was available. Cost cutting? less effective training? The worst observation was the standard of food was really poor other than one evening meal of Nasi Goreng which was fantastic. I think they have forgotten what reasonably fresh bread rolls are? I would MUCH prefer cold hand towels and warmed bread rolls instead of the 3 day old hard fare being served. Will seriously think about whether i will fly with them in future.
label: neutral

text: The most beautiful and friendly airhosstess,s ever Very relaxing trip considering I left Perth at 1am. The food was great and the seats where comfy. decent range of movies to choose from.  By the time I finished the second movie and the 5th Singapore sling, I was there.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing Disappointed with the service.
Was a late evening flight so they wanted everyone to go to sleep. Even though some were watching videos or reading there was little/No cabin service.
Breakfast service started a couple of hours out. Breakfast menu limited to one Asian and one European selection. Omelette was dry, chicken sausage tasteless. Pastry selection limited to a  selection of rolls only. Apart from the extra legroom business class was not worth the extra money on this flight..
label: neutral

text:
Very good service, seat/bed uncomfortable for tall people I know that Singapore Airlines is regularly rated one of the best airlines and was anticipating this flight a lot. Service on board was friendly, quick and efficient. Their „book the cook“ option is good way to chose your dish in advance from a really comprehensive menu. Unfortunately, my steak was extremely chewy. But this can happen.
The reason for my poor rating is that although their seat is one of the widest, for tall people it’s just too small. When turning the seat into a bed, feet have to fit into a small cube. I‘m 6.1 tall, and is was kind of hard to put my feet in there. Best way was sleeping on the side with bend legs. 
IMO other airlines have a way better seat/bed, like Air Canada or Oman Air. So from a service point of view SQ is definitely doing it right. But their seat just isn’t made for tall people to sleep relaxed. And on long-haul flights to me it’s more important to get a good sleep than to have decent meals. Bottom line is: I wouldn’t fly SQ again.
label: negative

text:
Singapore Airlines On time departure, good food and a great aircraft flying from Dhaka to Singapore. Transit at Singapore was a great experience and it was a great time pass.
Flying from Singapore to Melbourne on the A380 was a new experience for my family (which included my wife, my son and daughter) and myself and it was a quiet cabin all the way into Melbourne.
Overall Singapore Airlines is a great airline to fly with and the experience leaves you wanting for more.
label: positive

text: Safe and secure Crews are always smiling and courteous, efficient in their work. Craft is clean and safe. Stable despite a little bumpy flight. In flight entertainment is good. Price is reasonable for all these factors.
label: positive

text: On a trip to Vietnam via Singapore Great Airline . Nice new 787 . Clean , comfortable, quite, Hi tech large windows with electronic darkening systems. Movies all in HD on large screens. Great food and service Paid a bit more to fly Singapore but it was worth it.
label: positive

text:
Superb from start to finish As always, a warm welcome from cabin staff. Good seating facilities in terms of comfort and quality of in-house entertainment. Great range of movies, music etc which was easy to navigate.
The meal was the best we have ever had on any flight and better than many restaurants - very hard to achieve on a plane journey.
label: positive

text: Pleasant Flight to Geneva Had a pleasant flight on the Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Zurich. Had to transfer to a Swiss Air flight to Geneva.
label: positive

text: Great attention from the flight attendents Plenty of flight attendants on duty for the whole flight, particularly with water and juice during the whole journey. Nothing was too much trouble. Not flown with Singapore Airlines for a few years but will definitely be doing so next time.
label: positive

text: whats all the fuss about! Other than the seat there is nothing "better" about this airline.  Infact, I can't work out why they get rated best in the world.  The staff smile - so do others, the food is ok, lots of choice but doesn't quite live up to the reputation of being excellent, service is average, you don't see the cabin crew any more than any other airline...they magically disappear mid flight to that place in the sky that cabin crew seem to migrate too.  If you want comfort then yes, this airline does have good seats but beware, it's not straight forward when it comes to "sleep"...you'll need the assistance of a member of staff...if you can find one!
label: neutral

text:
Frequently Number One Pretty obviously why.
Booked online and you don't need to pay to pick your seat. A generous 30kgs baggage allowance.
Many extras you don't get with other airlines. 
Food is very good, I can't see the justification to moan about food when you're eating so high up!
Professional service.
label: positive

text: Don’t travel Singapore Airlines or you have sick parents Flight SQ 241 - I was treated so rudely by the flight staff when we landed in Singapore. I had booked wheelchair assistance for my 76 year old dad has acute asthma and hip problems and my 73 year old mum with both knee replacements. I was told I need to walk to the buggy area as there didn’t have the staff to assist with the wheelchair. My dad ended up having an asthma attack and my both my parents were distress with high blood pressure. After such a long day for Dehli to Singapore we had to catch a flight to Sydney with two unwell highly distressed parent where no one cared to give them wheelchairs or any empathy. I am utterly disgusted with the way I was spoken to by the flight crew (a guy - I don’t remember his name) however the ground staff was not very helpful either.
label: negative

text:
Brilliant Service  The Airbus 350 was excellent and in economy I had plenty leg room with TV in the seat back, charging point for my phone, internet access if you paid. So much to watch.
From the moment I boarded to leaving the service and attitude of staff was fantastic.
label: positive

text: Brisbane Travel Expo Spoke to Consultant on Singapore Airlines Stand at Brisbane Travel Expo who advised we could book brochure flights Brisbane - London departing Brisbane 18th June returning mid July @ Expo Special price. Have tried to contact Singapore airlines over the last two days to book flights, put on hold, transferred to other departments, then voicemail. Very disappointing it appears this Brisbane Travel Expo Special is incorrect.
label: negative

text: My 1st experience in Singapore Their service was great. I had a great time and it was my first time to ride in a plane. The food that they offer was delicious.
label: positive

text: Well looked after with my wheelchair Excellent service as I travel with a wheelchair. Very well looked after. Assisted to bathrooms and first on the plane, last off, met by attendants who took me through the formalities and made travel easy.
label: positive

text:
Extremely disappointed I was told by many people how reliable and fabulous this airline was, so I booked my flights through them.

I travelled from Melbourne to Singapore and then Singapore to Melbourne aboard Singapore Airlines.  I was bitterly disappointed on my journey home as, despite travelling with my partner, they decided to separate us.  Not just a row or two but, 10 rows and a wall separated us.  When we mentioned it to the crew in India, the male staff member basically told us it was too bad and we would have to arrange something ourselves once we arrived in Singapore (the 2nd leg of our flight home).  

Upon arrival in Singapore we were shocked and horrified to find that we would have to speak with the passenger ourselves to sort something out.  The airline made an  error and we have to sort it out!!!  Long story short, we managed to sort it with the fellow traveller but it should never have been left to us to sort.  

Staff are friendly, food is reasonable and seats are uncomfortable for long haul flights.  

I would fly Singapore Airlines again but, only if they could ensure me from the get go that when two people are booked together, that they are actually seated together.
label: neutral

text:
Europe stopover We travelled to Singapore on our way to Europe to visit family. We flew a number of different airlines, all Star Alliance members. If I rated them they would go like this;  Singapore 10, Air New Zealand 9, Swiss 6, Lufthansa 4. We also flew with Air Lingus. I’d rate them at 7.5 - this was short haul though while all others were over 11 hour flights. In future we’ll pay a bit more and fly Singapore the whole way. 

On Singapore Airlines we were treated extremely well. Staff were really friendly and helpful and it felt like they genuinely wanted to make you feel looked after. Food was good and snacks available anytime. The plane seats were modern and comfortable and we weren’t too cramped.
label: positive

text: Always superb We’ve flown Business on SIA a few times. The service, hard product and food are always excellent; you cannot best SIA for consistency. Would highly recommend. Yes, it’s more expensive than other airlines, but we prefer to pay a premium for this exclusive product so that it remains exclusive to a certain type of clientele.
label: positive

text: Great flight and excellent service Very professional, friendly staff, service and food served was very good a choice was given and was hot and tasty. Looked after very well was our third time flying with them and will again
label: positive

text: Soooo very disappointing After being upgraded to business class by Emirates on our last trip back to the UK and being blown away by the service,seats and food we decided that business class was for us, on this trip we were recommended to fly Singapore by our daughter because all business classes are the same right ?, in truth it was a big mistake. We paid to go business class but other than the leg room we may as well saved the extra $10,000 it cost. On two legs especially the London to Singapore when we were on an A380, it was shabby with torn and worn armrest and seat but worse it had not been cleaned even though it left over an hour late, there was rubbish and even an old banana down the gap between the window and seat, the choice of food for the most part was not up to standard, not everyone wants a rice dish or an over elaborate omelet which was under cooked..We contacted the airline prior to departure to see if we were allowed a guest in the business lounge, we were informed by email that And I quote, Kris club and kris flyer gold flyers were allowed to bring a guest, our daughter was going to be on the same flight on our return journey and we wished to take advantage of the business lounge. We duly arrived at the Business lounge to be told a guest was not allowed as we were Kris flyers, we showed the lady the email from their customer service dept, she explained that it should have read Kris flyer gold and Kris cub gold members only. As you can imagine we were deeply embarrassed. We will never fly them ever again. I must say the cabin crew were very good but on our next trip we will definitely be flying Emirates
label: negative

text:
Not what we wanted Cramped and stuck in the middle row with awkward people either side , we asked to sit together with a window set and were given middle aisle and the two middle seats.
I had a very tall person next to me who could not get comortable and my wif a father of 3 annoying children.
We would not fly Singapore airlines again because they did not supply the service we would have expected.
we asked for extra legroom seats at checkin but they said all were taken but after every one had boarded they moved people to empty legroom seats
label: negative

text:
Good but not the best A very short review. The standard expectations from a known club like Singapore airlines were well met. The service and food were quite good. The toilets were clean and the flights were more or less on time. 

My flight was in two parts, from mumbai to Singapore on Airbus and from Singapore to Auckland in a Boeing. While the Airbus journey was superbly comforting even in seating, i faced some seating issues in their Boeing aircraft. Although i had opted for an extra legroom seat, the seat itself was quite cramped for a long 8-9 hour flight as compared to their Airbus. Plus, i had to push my luggage into the overhead cabin quite down the aisle from the place of my seat as there wasn’t room left on top. This made it hard for me to go and get my things especially at night when others are sleeping and you might not want to disturb them.

Apart from that, nothing stood out to be exceptional. It was a decent flying experience.
label: neutral

text:
Worst Airline Ever with customer service at the airport in Singapore I recently traveled with Singapore Airlines on a trip from JFK to Bali, Indonesia in March 2023, reservation number 4DRFLW. As an avid traveler, I feel compelled to share my experience in order to provide an accurate account of my time with the airline.

To begin with, I opted for a coach class ticket, which turned out to be a regrettable decision. The seating arrangement in coach was extremely cramped, leaving very little legroom. The close proximity of the seats made it challenging to read or move comfortably, especially when the person in front reclined their seat. This often resulted in an uncomfortable experience, with their seatback practically on top of my knees, and I am only 5' in height. Even a simple trip to the bathroom became a cumbersome task, as I had to rely on holding onto the seats in front of me for support.

During our layover in Germany, my travel companion and I decided to upgrade to business class, which offered a considerable improvement in comfort and space. However, upon our return journey, we requested an upgrade to business class for the Singapore to Germany leg, but we were informed that we could only upgrade for the entire itinerary. This policy seemed inconsistent, as we were allowed to upgrade on our way to Bali. The lack of flexibility in this matter left us puzzled and dissatisfied.

Furthermore, I must express my disappointment with the attitude and behavior of the staff at Singapore Airlines. Throughout my interactions with them, I found them to be rude and unhelpful, which was surprising considering the airline's reputation. Curiosity led me to inquire about the experiences of my Asian friends who had traveled with Singapore Airlines in the past, and to my surprise, they echoed similar sentiments, sharing that they preferred non-Asian airlines due to concerns about service quality and aircraft standards. This realization only deepened my disappointment.

In addition, I found the process of dealing with Singapore Airlines' customer service to be daunting. Their staff appeared unable to think creatively or go beyond established protocols, which left me questioning their effectiveness and ability to address customer concerns.

It is important to note that my experience with Singapore Airlines encompasses merely the tip of the iceberg. While I understand that every airline can have its flaws, it is disheartening to encounter such issues with an airline of Singapore Airlines' reputation.

Based on my experience, I would advise fellow travelers to consider investing a bit more to ensure a better flying experience. While Singapore Airlines may have its merits, my encounter leaves me hesitant to recommend them wholeheartedly.
label: negative

text:
Despicable behaviour to loyal customers Are you considering Krisflyer as a Star Alliance loyalty programme? Forget it!

As a Krisflyer gold member for the past few years I haven't redeemed many flights through Singapore Airlines because they make the process so complicated and tedious. Since they are gradually introducing other Star Alliance airlines to their online redemption searches - about 10 years behind other leading airlines - I decided to book a reward flight on SAS from Copenhagen to Oslo. 

The flight cost 12,000 miles plus US$25. But, since I can no longer travel during this period, I gave advanced notice and attempted to cancel the booking online. Over one week later I get an SMS saying that I need to call them, only to discover that I must pay a US$75 fee to cancel the flight. The only explanation is that it was in the terms and conditions. 

I have a Oneworld Emerald and Skyteam account with other airlines, and neither of the airlines through which I have redeemed flights in the past charge such ridiculous and unexplained fees. In fact, the entire process is automated and refunds are processed promptly, sometimes immediately.

How Singapore Airlines seeks to penalise loyal members for its own outdated practices and systems is unreal. It's a complete disgrace. A single attempt to cancel a reward flight that ends up costing you 30 minutes on the phone to Singapore and US$75. That's loyalty punished right there!

I plan to draw down my Krisflyer account and cease flying them altogether. I'll look into a better Star Alliance airline programme and suggest you do the same.

Dreadful customer service both in flight and on the ground. Fed up of it. No more!
label: negative

text: Pleasant enough, great movies Very smooth flight, pleasant staff and flight crew.  Selection of inflight movies was terrific. Food not bad for aeroplane food!
label: positive

text:
Worst Customer Experience I couldn't make a simple booking change. I need to postpone the ticket, but couldn't do online. This is not the first time and it is the second time and in both the times, I got the same message "	
We are experiencing an outage to backend booking engine. Please try again later". There is not any planned outage posted on their website. It is very annoying, when such a big airlines couldn't manage their website and this is happening not the first time and it is the second time.

I couldn't reach their customer service representative. I have been waiting on the call (calling only the local office in SFO) for more than 2 hours, but no one picked off. 

I even tried sending emails to their US reservations email id and also to their feedback and inquiry form. I don't expect quick response on this, as I can get response within 72 hours.

I couldn't do it online. I couldn't reach the customer support.. Worst customer service|booking  experience
label: negative

text:
Badly let down by Singapore airlines We had always been told that Singapore airlines was a 5 star airline, so we were delighted to find out that’s who we were flying with on our holiday. Getting to our destination was great, but & this is a big BUT, our return home was a totally different story, we checked in at our destination airport, got given our transfer boarding cards & went on our way.
Nothing was mentioned that when we get to our 1st stop off we were going to have to wait nearly 24 hours in Singapore airport, then after that we were going to have to wait another 18 hours in Frankfurt for our final flight. None of this was on our original itinerary & we weren’t informed until we got to our 1st stop off, this change of flights was all done by Singapore airlines & no one informed us on check in.

Really poor customer service & no thought of our well being at all by Singapore airlines.

I would dread to fly with Singapore airlines & would advise against.
label: negative

text:
Holiday before holiday I was lucky enough to travel business class to Singapore. I was on the flight for 14 hours and I didn’t want to get off. Imagine someone says to you, have yourself a duvet day, don’t worry about what to eat or drink, we’ll bring you anything you want to drink including champagne and some lovely food at well placed intervals. iPad charger, vanity light to top up your make-up is at hand as is the remote to watch films, tv programmes you may have missed or listen to music. Adjust your reclining chair into a bed when you want to sleep and snuggle up in your duvet. The delightful and exceptionally efficient staff will see to your every need as though you’re a vip and then when you finally reach your destination they bid you farewell as though you’re a personal friend. 
What’s not to love about this first class airline.
label: positive

text: Resheduled Departure It was rare that SQ's flight was rescheduled three times in a row. The check in counter staff said that it happened because the parking area in Juanda International Airport & Changi Internatinal Airport are crowded -.-"
label: positive

text:
A350 economy Singapore Airlines are a very good airline in the air. Their business class lounges in Singapore are terrible and  fail dismally compared to other airlines business class lounges.

The A350 is a lovely smooth quiet aircraft and the interior is clean, comfortable for economy and the aircraft is modern and very smooth.

It was an overnight flight so service was rather limited as was the food more of a snack, but the cabin and crew are pleasant friendly and attentive.

I wish Singapore airline improved their lounges as they are such poor quality but in the air they are a very good airline and always an enjoyable trip. I have flown business and economy on Singapore Airlines A350 and they are both good products and clean, comfortable and this is a good airline to fly with.
label: positive

text:
Still very disappointing.... Unfortunately, still an unpleasant experience on a first class flight with Singapore Airlines...in view of the price paid of course. 

As usual with Singapore Airlines, as a first-class passenger you are only granted access to the business class lounges both in Geneva and in Frankfurt...very disappointing. No way you can get the highest rating with such a policy. There was also no pre-boarding for first-class passengers in Frankfurt.

Also hurting my rating is the cabin, which was quite old on this flight in an Airbus 380. It is actually not much better than a new business class cabin on a A350 of Singapore Airlines. Service was ok but very "stereotyped". The menu looked appealing but was not that great in reality. They have a "Georges Blanc " tasting-menu but apparently they are struggling to make it ready in the plane. The meat was totally overcooked and could not be eaten. 

Champagne (Dom Perignon) and wines are quite good. The movie selection is really not great. This is unfortunate, as the headsets and the screens are great.
The flight was on time
label: neutral

text: Good service As always fly with SQ is well known for their excellent full service (meals onboard and entertainment). Perhaps on last flight (at night)is not the luckiest time from me. From jakarta I got delayed for 1 hour due to bad weather in singapore, then it cut off my time for transit. And the flight to Melbourne from S'pore is really full and a little bit crowded, many baby's were crying all night.
label: positive

text: Absolutely fabulous airline An absolutely fabulous airline. From staff at the check-in to staff on-board the level of service was absolutely excellent. Singapore Airlines are now my favourite airline for long haul
label: positive

text:
Your holiday starts here ! We chose Singapore Airlines to fly from Perth to Haneda Airport to meet up with a cruise on the Diamond Princess and to return post cruise form Narita to Perth. Looking at all the airfares and routes on offer it was a no brainer to pick Singapore Airlines whose fares were not only competitive but the connections in Changi excellent.. Furthermore we are part of the Kris Flyer programme  and the incentive to gain more Fly Miles was a bonus.
The staff from Check in to destination were all friendly and efficient. The On Board staff could not do enough to provide Service with a Smile. They are indeed an asset to SQ and we appreciated their efforts to make our journeys with them so very pleasant.  Thank you  to all the lovely girls on our flights.
label: positive

text: Top class airline Singapore Airlines is by far the best in my opinion. Nothing skimped on. Looked after impeccably, as it tends to be a long flight to S.E. Asia.
label: positive

text: Great flight Good leg room and great flight crew- food and drinks service was timely and being a day flight no annoying sleep disruption.
label: positive

text:
Swissport Sydney Australia Swissport Sydney Australia represents AirAsia and other airlines for counter checking in. Bad decision ever make from airlines who uses Swissport for checking in their passengers. These Swissport staff in Sydney are the worse of a kind especially a try hard guy name BAS rude and arrogant. He definitely need training on how to care for customers especially customers that doesn’t even belong to Swissport. If airlines are reading this reviews Swissport is damaging your airlines brand by the poor and horrible customer service they are doing and providing to your passengers. You airlines paid millions of advertising dollars and only to be service by arrogant and rude Swissport staff especially a guy name BAS at Sydney international airport.

Asking a simple question like “does my flight go direct, will you be issuing 2 boarding pass?” Simple question but this particular guy nam BAS is so rude and arrogant that he say if you ask that kind of question I have the authority to send you to the back of the queue. I said wow! Seriously!, this guy is in serious mental illness? I think in my personal opinion he need serious help or Swissport should review his employment because he is Damaging all the airlines Swissport represents.
