text:
SQ Ultra-long flights SQ38/37 I was a bit apprehensive about taking these flights due to the length (15 hours outgoing & 17 hours return) as I have major difficulty sleeping on planes (even on flat beds), but the promotional offer that they had beat the next best fares by US$700 which made this a no brainer. I made some adjustments for this trip and bought a neck pillow (firm as opposed to soft) and took a sleeping medication which I usually avoid.

Check-in and boarding was quick and easy as there were only 160+ passengers due to the configuration of the A350-900ULR aircraft. Bio-metric boarding was used in both Singapore and Los Angeles. Once settled in after take-off, drinks and dinner were served. Those who reserved their meals using the "Book The Chef" were served first, and I finished omg meal before the rest of the other passengers were served their meal.

On the outgoing, I ordered the roast chicken rice and considering that Singapore is their home base, I was disappointed with both the quality and the portion. I was left feeling hungry. There were mid-flight snacks available later but it was western biased. I brought my own instant noodles (comfort food for many Asians, and SQ should seriously consider making it available on the flight - and I was not the only one on board who brought my own instant noodles). The 2nd main meal which was first served about 7 hours into the flight has now changed to 2 hours before landing based on passenger feedback. I agree with this change) and I ordered a nasi lemak this time. Again the quality and portion were disappointing. On the return flight out of Los Angeles, I ordered the prawn sambal rice and dim sim, and they were much better and portions were slightly bigger. 

The crew were excellent and were proactively going round to ensure we were well hydrated, and happily prepared the cup instant noodles when asked.

The seat was comfortable. I was able to select the individual seat at the back which had its own hand luggage compartment. I was not disturbed by anyone else. Even the single seat in the last row was able to recline to its max and was not hindered by the wall behind.

I was able to get about 3-4 hours sleep on the outgoing and about 6 hours on the return, which was a first for me. This was definitely helped by the A350 carbon fuselage technology which allowed a higher cabin pressure and more humidity compared to the traditional aluminium fuselage. I felt more refreshed and less tired compared to 8-hour flights in conventional planes.

Flight was on-time on the outgoing but was delayed on the return due to a passenger fainting in the cabin during boarding. This delayed the flight by an hour but it was not the airline's fault. The captain kept the passengers informed on the progress during the delay, which was good. The only negative was that a number of fellow passengers were more keen to take photos/videos of the incident and blocking the passageway of those who were trying to help (cabin crew and other passengers).

I would definitely consider SQ's ultra long flights as a serious option if I were to travel to the USA.
label: positive

text:
Professional service and pretty comfortable flight A very good airline with a known good reputation. 
Pro's: 
1. Service on board: very attentive friendly attendants and very clean toilets. 
2. Food on board: generous amount and delicious. Varieties are also very good. 
3. Ground service: very well prepared to handle flight transfers at delays. Their ground staff were already waiting for us to whisk us through the airport to catch our connecting flight when our previous flight was delayed. 
4. Baggage allowance of 30 kg per person which is a lot more than (most of) Western airlines. 
5. Transit at Changi airport which is for us one of the most comfortable airports. 

Contra's: 
1. The site for Online check-in did not work properly. It hung lots of time and didn't give clear messages when there was any issue (for example when the online check in of the connecting flight was not yet available or had to be done on their partner website). This has happened lots of time to us. 
2.No information on the lack of meal/drink when work with a partner for a connecting flight (e.g. with Brussels Airlines) who does not offer free meal/drink during the flight.
3. Choices of modern (Western) movies were rather limited.  
4. Leg room in a normal economy class was rather limited.
label: positive

text: great price, great experience I flew US - Asia - Europe - US for an amazingly small amount of $'s.  Singapore Airlines doesn't disappoint: really spacious seats, great service, and Asian calm.  Seemingly small details make the difference: very clean bathrooms (serviced en-route I think), timely and flexible food and sleep options.
label: positive

text:
bad flight on return journey We flew Bribane to Tokyo via Singapore. The Brisbane  Sigapore flight in the A350 was early in arriving but the food in business class on this route both ways is always bad. The crew on the way to Tokyo were very good.The food Singapore to Tokyo was 5 stars.
The return Osaka to Singapore was 5 stars . The B787 on business class was small seats and was very cramped but he food was 5 stars
The Singapore to Brisbane had bad food as usual and the crew were the laziest I have ever experienced. A passenger heard them say get the meal done with and turn off the lights.There was not a drink given after takeoff as usual on all Singapore Airlines flights. Ther was no water bottles given to passengers after the first meal. The second meal wa very rushed
label: positive

text: Fantastic service and great business class amenities We recently flew with Singapore Airlines in business class due to a back injury my husband sustained a few years ago. This particular flight had a short stopover at Changi airport in Singapore which suited us as my husband could walk around a little. Having never flown business class before we were looking forward to seeing to being able to sleep a bit better and longer. The flights attendants were very attentive and friendly and we were able to preselect some meals which meant we were served a delicious lobster dish and other meals of a very high standard. The seats were easily converted into our beds and we slept well, arriving in Tokyo feeling fresh and relaxed. We also had a great range of current movies to choose from and lots of space within out allocated seating area. Highly recommended if your budget allows.
label: positive

text:
Disappointed Business Lounge Aspire Flew from Manchester Terminal 2 with SQ Business Class, we have Lounge facilities, which is very disappointing :  Aspire Lounge.
Our Flight around 11.40 in the morning, so the breakfast food still on the buffet counter,.. everyhting is dirty, the cups for tea and coffee are not clean, the food, the baked beans dry up, .. everything looks so awfull, all the tables not been clean properly...the interior is very sad. , can't believe Singapore Airlines using this Aspire Lounge as their business lounge.  
Lounge in Singapore changi Airport was awesome, the food always new, a lot of different choice of food and beverage..everything spot on.
label: neutral

text: Flying to Asia We have flown with many different airlines (ANA, Korean, Hong Kong, China Southern, Sri Lanka Airlines, VietJet) going to Asia and I have to say that our experience with Singapore Airlines has been the best so far.  The seats are more comfortable and you can recline more than other airlines.  The flight attendants are extremely nice, Korean's were really good as well.
label: positive

text: Bangalore - Singapore flight Good spacious leg room and comfortable flight..  have electronic entertainment material to pass the time
label: positive

text: Very helpful staff Friendly staff. Comfortable flight, with lots of inflight entertainment, which was great as it was a day flight. Travel agent forgot to tell airline about GF diet but the staff russled up a really nice meal for me. Ever so grateful for that. Would recomend as an airline.
label: positive

text: A reliable airline to fly with I travelled to Mumbai from Sydney on 25th December 2018 (on Christmas day). The seating was comfortable, and so the other facilities. The crew were friendly and helpful. The food and the beverages served were quite nice. All in all, I was quite happy with my flight. I returned to Sydney from Bangalore via the same airline on 1st February 2019. The important thing I want to mention about the Singapore Airline is their punctuality.
label: positive

text: Good airline The service on the flight was amazing but the seats in economy were very small. The entertainment was good and the food was lovely. I would definitely fly with this airline again
label: positive

text:
Very helpful Traveled with my elderly Mother in law. Singapore Airlines where extremely willing and helpful to assist with boarding and transfers. They organized a wheelchair and friendly staff to assist at each stop.
Would recommend and will fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Not worth the money Having booked with Air New Zealand for a round trip to the UK we enjoyed our flight over with Air NZ and Virgin Atlantic and looking forward to our first trip all the way back with Singapore Airlines.  Oh what a disappointment, paying the extra for premium economy was just not worth it.  The only advantage was a bigger seat and priority baggage collection, no welcome drink, same food as served in economy, no nice glasses just the usual plastic, the white wine served was warm and the comfort pouch for overnight did not even include an eye mask.  Sorry Singapore Airlines you have a lot to learn from Air NZ and Virgin on how to treat your premium economy customers who have paid a lot extra for their travel.  We will not travel with you again.
label: negative

text:
THE MOST DREADFUL AIRLINE BREAKFAST EVER While not expecting haute cuisine, the breakfast aboard SQ295 was just inedible. It consisted of a very highly spiced chicken sausage, greasy roast potatoes and a dish called bread and egg pudding with Swis cheese that had the consistency of rubber. There is no excuse to serve such poor quality food. To their credit the airline staff were charming and attentive and gave me a ham salad bun which was tasty and fresh.
We booked early and were able to secure seats of just two but this was an older plane and the seats weren’t particularly comfortable.
Sadly I don’t think Singapore Airlines is the airline it once was.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airline - always a great experience The trip from SYD to SIN absolutely met SQ high class standard.  Punctuality, comfort on board, top service, friendly crew; all the reasons why SQ is a top airline.
label: positive

text: Top service Service was excellent - staff always ready to assist. Aircraft exceptionally clean, food was more than enough. Would certainly travel with Singapore again
label: positive

text: My all time favorite airline This is one of the best airlines in have ever traveled on. They have the best hospitality, best food options and a varied in flight entertainment options
label: positive

text:
Booking process and communication issues Difficult and time consuming booking process. Online was broken so we had to call up and were charged extra $186 for booking online. 
The call took 47 minutes to complete and still we were unsure as the confirmation email never arrived.
All because one leg didn’t have premium economy available and the web site is not designed well enough to submit the booking without it. 
The flight itself was ok.... food was horrible. Staff were nice. Plane was so so old.
label: negative

text:
#1 for a reason Singapore airline is rated the number 1 airline in the world and it shows. The staff on board are the most accommodating and professional I have ever saw. The airport is immaculate and the plane is just the same. Everyone gets a pillow and blanket. There are TVs located behind every seat with enough movies and shows to keep you busy during such a long flight. The in flight food is pretty good also. They feed you what seems like every 4 hours lol you also get free alcohol and snacks whenever you want. The flight was smooth to Germany then to Singapore everything went well no hold
ups or delays. The flight staff were well dressed and polite to everyone on board. I can’t recommend this airline enough when traveling abroad. Like I said they are #1 for a reason and it really shows. I’d pick Singapore airline everywhere I go and I wish airlines in the United States would model themselves after them as they are the pinnacle of flying right now.
label: positive

text:
Best South East Asia Airline 360° well manicured well taken care passenger Service.
Super Courteous Staff.
Changi airport it’s a pleasure to stop over.
Singapore used to offer 3 days stop over the City is Awesome.
Best Food Ever.
label: positive

text: Excellent service and comfort flying business Wow!  What an amazing airline.  So comfortable with complete privacy in the pod.  The service was exceptional.  The food was excellent.  Very clean.  Flying like this is a dream.  I flew this leg as part of a round the world ticket, so it was great value.
label: positive

text:
A good airline - Let down by inability to manage bookings thoughtfully We flew in April this year and again in August.

Both times managing the booking at ION has been less than satisfactory.

The issue is the staff are unable to provide seats to accommodate toddlers.

My wife wanted us to purchase a seat for our 1year old.  They fly free in the basinet/your lap but my wife wanted to bring the baby seat on board.

After the April trip, we discovered that if we use this the seat in front cannot recline.  

So i went in with plenty notice to get the front seat, i was told that there were no seats available?  Although booking online i could get a front seat with a bassinet.

But when i tried to book with a child under 2 the system has a hissie fit and cannot submit the ticket online.

So anyway the consultant said no seats available in the front row.

When we boarded the plane to Perth we were 2 rows back in the centre, the guy in front was not able to recline his seat.  he was annoyed but what could we do sadly...

The thing that bothered us was that ABC row 41 was occupied by 2 single folk, with a bassinet in front.... Seat b was empty...

I cannot understand how they were given this seat when we had a child, paid for an extra fair and doing our best not to inconvenience anyone...

Singapore airlines you really need to sort this out..

The second debacle was when we checked in on our flight home.  By this time we had flown 3 flights with the same car seat, it says flight approved.. that was good enough for everyone before.... This time the guy wanted to see approved by who??

It's not stated on the seat however he could see the brand and make and google if he wished.
label: positive

text: Mishandled baggage, poor food, poor inflight experience Our stroller wheel was broken and the cupholder tray was scratched. Food was very sub starndard. No vegetarian baby post weaning meal was available for my baby. Restrooms were dirty. Food plates were not removed immediately after service. May not fly with them again.
label: negative

text:
Its a 5 star airline The crew is very attentive, good service, tasty food, latest in-flight entertainment systems.

Additional perks if flying through Singapore is the free city tour and 20$ coupon to shop at Changi airport
label: positive

text:
Got us home Thanks to government alert email got to know Singapore closing travel and Singapore airlines went out of their way to get us home safe and well asap. Can't thank them enough, as they also helped another 4 Airlines to get there passengers home on the last flight out of Melbourne before lockdown.
So many staff losted their job after getting us home.
Will never forget this and will hopefully fly again one day? Especially back to Australia to finish our holiday off and use Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Great experience flying with a baby  We had a great experience flying with Singapore Airlines. This was the first trip we have taken with our 8 month old. The staff onboard all of our flights went above and beyond to make our trip as easy and as comfortable as possible.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy Seating on Singapore Airlines not worth the money! Premium Economy Seating on Singapore Airlines has narrow seats and poor leg room compared to Air NZ or Virgin.  Drinks served in plastic beakers, roast chicken tough as was the meat in the noodle dinner.  Orange juice concoction was not a premium offering.  Toilets - we had to walk half way back down the Economy cabin to queue for the toilet.  One toilet on the plane was not working. Having flown with Air NZ the day before the difference in amenities and poor value for money was apparent with Singapore Airlines.  Poor Kris Flyer website if you wish to upgrade it doesn't work!
label: negative

text:
Great service We had multiple flights booked with Singapore Airlines. I had never flown with Singapore Airlines before, I was told by so many people how fantastic the airline and it is advertised as the best airline in the world! So maybe I already had too high expectations of the airline and I found them no better than other airlines I have been with in the past. 

Flights were a reasonable price and the service of the staff was second to none, nothing was too much trouble, the food was very average and on the plane you actually seemed very squashed in your seat more so than other airlines.

It is very expensive to upgrade your seats too in comparison to other airlines. We tried to upgrade in the bid and told unsuccessful but yet half the premium economy seats were left empty.

I would fly with Singapore again it was not a bad experience at all but not the excellence I was expecting over and above other airlines. I found it just the same as Quantas, Virgin, British Airways, Thomson flights I have been on and not as good as Emirates.
label: positive

text: Always the best Orderly boarding. Warmly greeted even at the plane door. Comfortable seats even in economy. Service is top class, fast and efficient. Superb on board flight entertainment.
label: positive

text:
Worst possible customer service after canceling the flight  Tonight, the flight SQ 325 from Frankfurt to Singapore was canceled. We also had a connection to Denpasar, flight SQ 948, so one day of vacation less! 

When the flight was canceled, nobody from Singapore Airlines took any care about the passengers. 

First of all, we were handed over to security staff from the airport at 11:30 PM. They kept us waiting for 15 minutes in a hallway, without anyone knowing why. Then, all the Singapore Airlines staff just DISAPPEARED, like magic. Nobody told us anything about when the flight will be rescheduled, or at least when they will let us know about the new flight. I literally had to carry our asleep son throughout the airport in my arms (and Frankfurt is a big airport) together with the carry on luggage, because nobody even asked if we need a trolley. After about one hour after deplaning us, we also had to wait (at midnight) with our son asleep in my arms for half an hour in the cold, outside of the airport, for the bus to the hotel.

Until now, it's the worst experience of my life flying business class, the level of customer care was even lower than low cost airlines.
label: negative

text:
Singapore rocks A380 JFK-FRA-SIN. great as always 
B777 SIN-MNL-SIN -OK
B777 SIN-INC-LAX - ok. 
Can’t fault anything Singapore does. There is a reason they are always number one rated.
label: positive

text: Even the delay wasn't a problem This was the third tome we'd flown SQ to Singapore then on to Brisbane. Nothing seemed too much trouble for the staff or Business Crew, and they went out of their way to make our journey as stress free as possible.
label: positive

text: Wonderful attention On the way to the airport I had a nasty fall and almost cancelled, but I told the Singapore staff and they were absolutely amazing, ice bags appeared, wheel chairs at Singapore and Bangkok.  They were very attentive during the flight as well.  I have not given 5 stars as the plane had the seating arrangement I dislike, the diagonal feet area which I find so uncomfortable but on the first flight they later gave me a bulkhead seat where one's feet go straight out.  I cannot thank them enough.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable flight even in Economy Seats of Singapore Airline planes have more leg and width space then other carriers that I have tried.  I like that they have individual entertainment screens with lots of choices to view.  

Crew are all very helpful and friendly with big smiles on their faces always that made me feel relaxed.  They deal with both the passengers and their follow crew with courtesy and with the attitude of willingness to serve.
label: positive

text: Super! Once again had a very pleasant flight with Singapore Airlines to Copenhagen and also on the return trip from Heathrow London.  I prefer the window seat in business class, it seems to be more comfortable.  Service from the cabin crew is excellent.
label: positive

text: No complaints Good airline. Plane was not as new as AirNZ planes, but service was good and it was on time. It was a code-shared flight and as a result I didnt get my AirNZ points which is disappointing. Just be aware of this if you are an AirNZ points customer. I complained to AIrNZ about this, since its really their issue.
label: positive

text: An efficient well run airline A comfortable flight run with precision. The staff are almost robotic not getting too personal which is not that appealing. I would have preferred a more friendly approach.  The seats were comfortable and the entertainment was adequate. It is not that easy dealing with the Singapore office in Johannesburg who were not very compassionate when I had a problem.
label: positive

text: An unexpectedly comfortable red-eye flight This flight was the first of a two-legged itinenary from Singapore to Brussels (via Milan Malpensa), and left Changi Aiport close to midnight.  Concerned with a slightly tight connection (time-wise) in Milan, I had opted to pay a little extra for a seat in the forward zone of the economy section.  And I lucked out as no one occupyied the seat next to me in the final row of the section.  With that extra space to stretch out during the flight, I managed to get a better-than-expected stretch of rest as the flight travelled through the night.  The service of the staff was very good - engaging without being unncessarily obstrusive when passengers preferred to sleep.  Supper and breakfast were fine, although I have to admit that portions seem to have become smaller recently with the disappearance of an appetiser and fruits, respectively.  And the loss of hot towels being handed out before meals is also rather disappointing (perhaps COVID has something to do with it).  Overall, a rather comfortable flight.
label: positive

text: Great Airline The staff are very friendly and make sure you understand, all the operations on the very comfortable chair. Food was a good variety and very tasty.
label: positive

text: Disappointing Yes, Jetstar give better service. Poor attitude by some stewardess. I expected better than that, especially paying for business class.
label: negative

text: Smooth and relaxing Excellent Service and seats, outstanding. Entertainment on board is more than enough. Food and Service is heart warming.
label: positive

text: Singapore plus upgrade  I received an email a week prior to our flights asking if we would like to bid for an upgrade. We did this in good faith only to be charged both bids then receive an email telling us our bid was unsuccessful. The charges are still on our credit card. I am currently trying to get these charges removed. As usual you can’t talk to anyone about it. All communication is via email and you will have to do all the leg work to get these charges removed. Not a good start to a holiday. I have since canceled all further offers as it’s not worth the hassle. We went with Singapore Airlines because we thought they were the best. 🤔
label: negative

text: First flight on a SQ Dreamliner I recently had a short flight on Singapore Airlines to Bangkok, a flight that utilised a B787 Dreamliner.  The check-in process was easy and straightforward, with the automated luggage belts working much more efficiently than when I last used them.  Boarding was smooth even though the flight was at least 80% full.  I was actually most eager on this flight to check out the plane's windows.  Designed to dim or lighten at the press of a button, the windows have not attached sliding shades.  Furthermore, the Dreamliner's windows are some of the largest, if not the largest, in the business, allowing for an improved view outside the plane. Unfortunately, as the flight was in the early evening, testing of the automatic dimmers had to be shelved.  The airline's Krisworld IFE was excellent with a super-extensive range of movies, shows, music and games as usual.  If anything, perhaps the only thing missing is a camera mounted outside the plane to allow for a different view during take-off, landing and in flight.  Food options were decent although I tend to find that the mains offered in economy somewhat dull, which turned out to be the case again although I was plesantly surprised that the meal came with brown rice, a healthier option compared to white rice.  Service standards were also definitely very good.  Overall, a good flight where everything worked although it will need another, preferably longer flight, to decide if the Dreamliner's my kind of aircraft.
label: positive

text:
Great flight with SQ to Manila From Singapore to Manila on the new Boeing 787-10, I already flew in this plane before with SQ so I knew it was going to be a good flight. I managed to get the nice private seats (2 seats instead of 3 in the row) at the back of the plane for me and my girlfriend which was great. Legroom is excellent. FA's are friendly as always. The whole 3 hr flight was very comfy, I wish it was even longer so I could sleep a bit. 

The food was good, but we asked for fish and got chicken instead, I think the same happened to the person in the seat in front so there was a mix up with the meals. I had white wine with the meal, I don't drink wine often but that was nice. Even though there was some sort of desert in the meal, they did give ice cream also afterwards. I had Heineken beer for the rest of the flight, I totally forgot to ask for the Singapore Sling!

The short flight was great and I really want to try their long haul flights in the future.
label: positive

text:
Will never fly again ! Don't recommend to anybody! 1) Our ticket had for just 1 hour transit at Hong Kong airport before going to Singapore. Singapore airlines sold the tickets without mentioning that we will need transit visa at Hong Kong airport. 
2) Singapore airlines called us just a day before the flight and changed the flight to a direct flight and assigned seats as we had paid $40 for seat selection earlier. When we went online for check in, the seats were actually not assigned. 
3) Singapore Airlines says seat selection will open within 48 hours from departure. The online never allowed that. We had to go through multiple calls and wait times just select a seat. Very INCONVENIENT and TIME CONSUMING process.
4) The customer representatives are very rude and not willing to help.
label: negative

text: Great start to holiday Friendly check in and luggage check in and from then on all else went well. Spare seat between us was a bonus. Service was great during flight and always informed of updates and timetable. Entertainment system state of the art and worked well whole time.
label: positive

text: Hassle free with good service, just what passenfers are looking for when flying. After checking my bag in, I remembered I had left my epilepsy medication in this bag. Upon notifying the staff they were excellent in retrieving my bag & going thru the process of getting me back into the flight lounge. Very professional & will definitely fly with them again. Great service on the flight both ways.
label: positive

text: Still the BEST! Singapore Airlines never cease to amaze me. Great service, great staff and I know Changi Airport is a different company, this whole experience of flying via Singapore is always a pleasure. The aircraft and crew are always immaculate, the service beyond reproach and while some airlines might be rated better - they really don't come close.
label: positive

text: Awesome  Fly from Singapore to Melbourne for my family holiday trip. Singapore airlines, absolutely awesome. Crew are very efficient, polite and helpful. Provide delicious meal and seats are comfrontable. Look forward to my next SQ flight to NZ in Feb 2020 for my next holiday trip. I will definitely continue to fly SQ.
label: positive

text: Our favourite airline As always our preferred airline and Singapore Airlines did not disappoint. The cleanliness on board is second to none and the hostesses work hard to maintain very high standards. Service throughout the flight excellent. We paid extra for exit row seats and it was well worth it. Will always book Singapore Airlines whenever we can
label: positive

text: Good travel experience Friendly staff but not going out of their way to make you or kids happy.  No special attention or gifts for kids (other than getting the meal first, but this is done by ALL airlines) . everyone got a special treat with a pair of socks and toothbrush. we used the Planepal- no problems
label: positive

text: Benchmark of hospitality and comfort Travelled through SQ several times, I am glad to say that it always fulfilled the expectations. The are always on schedule, travel with well trained crew, have comfy seats with reasonable leg room at reasonable price and well maintained.
label: positive

text: Almost perfect I have enjoyed their services over the years, and took this for the CNY festival. Service, food, entertainment, seat etc were good. Took the A380 plane which is going to be discontinued! The one blight is probable food poisoning with nausea. Later, another passenger also had the same issue and required medical attention. There was a commotion due to the emergency.
label: positive

text: Outstanding service from 1 person made up for really poor service from 2 Booked to fly HCM to Singapore to Auckland. Requested a change to fly Siem Reap to Singapore to Auckland. Told no. Followed original plan. Flight into Singapore on time, but then told a delay to Brisbane/ Auckland as no plans. Probably 2 hours but no guarantee.This would then have compounded for us and caused an additional 6 hour delay in Brisbane so at least 8hr delay. Asked service desk 1 for option. Told nothing they can do in a very rude way. Changed terminal asked at service desk tthere and same rude attitude and no options offered. On the office chance walked to service desk at other end of same terminal. Guy couldn't have been more helpful. PUt us on a flight to Sydney connecting through and we got home at original time. Now that is service
label: positive

text:
Great Service - Awesome Airlines I want mention that I am really Impressed by Service Offered by Singapore Airlines. On August 15th, I had to book Flights from my Parents from Delhi to JFK in emergency when Emirates Cancelled flight (Horrible Airlines) & offered no support on Rebooking.

Singapore Airlines Call Center staff was awesome. They quickly accommodated wheelchair and meal request at very short notice. My Parents informed me that they have never seen in their 40 year travel history such a friendly & caring staff. Flight from Delhi to Singapore was very very good. Also Flight from Singapore to JFK is the Longest. My Parents informed that Crew was so good and they took care of them So well. I am now getting tempted to Fly Singapore Airlines during my Next travel.
label: positive

text: Best airline Super service, entertainment & cabin comfort. Very courteous crew, great seats with plenty of leg room, fantastic entertainment with all the choices you can imagine. It is such a pleasure to fly with them, that I always look forward to this sector of my journey. This is my third trip in the one year.looking forward to the next flight with you.
label: positive

text: Love the small touches on the Premium economy flight We booked a holiday package travelling from HK to Male transiting at Singapore both ways.  We paid a few extra to experience the PE class on both HKG-SIN and SIN-HKG legs.  It had changed my frightful feeling of taking planes and it was the first time I hope the plane doesn't arrive so soon!  The seat give you a very spacious and comfortable feeling.  The noise-cancellation headphone is provided (although I also brought my own).  I took a newspaper and was able to finish reading it without messy page flipping that disturb my husband.  My husband is also impress with the wide and high definition tv screen which he can binge-watch the good selection of movies.  We had arranged the book-the-cook service and the food quality is quite good!  Overall, I enjoy this experience so much that I would love to travel on SIA PE class going forward.
label: positive

text: A comfortable way to travel to Australia 22 Dec 2019 trip from Singapore to Brisbane, economy class. Include filling supper and lunch of your choice (2 options to choose from. Flight was smooth and on schedule. The in-flight movie and music entertainment for each and every seat was very entertaining-I couldn't wait for the return Singapore Airlines trip on 1 Jan to continue watching the Korean thriller 'Parasite' as well as listen to music of many genres, pop being my favourite. The music and movie selections were plentiful. The attendants' service was first class and they were attractively groomed too! My young adult daughter enjoyed herself on this first Singapore Airlines trip-more enjoyable than her budget flights thus far. Would love to travel Singapore Airlines flight again!
label: positive

text: Seats are comfy. Screens are old My seat was comfortable and I had an okay sleep. The inflight monitor display, however, was very fuzzy and grainy compared to premium economy. Since I was needing sleep it wasn’t an issue but if I’d been on a longer flight I might have been annoyed. Staff were excellent.
label: positive

text:
Nothing special  When checking in for our flight the agent wanted us to check our hang-up bag.  After some pleading they let us take it to the gate and said it might have to be gate checked.  Never had this issue with United Airlines.   There was no pre-ck line at the airport even though it’s marked on the boarding pass.  The airline makes no effort to work with airport authorities on providing special handling of business class passengers. 
For the flight itself we were not impressed.  Asked for 2 different wines that were on the menu and they said they did not have them.   When we travel business class on other airlines I’ve never arrived hungry.   We did with Singapore Airlines.   You have to ask for any food or drinks on the second half of the 16 hr. flight.    When we host a party our guess don’t have to ask for there needs.  Didn’t feel like Singapore Airlines are good hosts.     When using lavatories we had to wait.   When we arrived in Singapore our bags were the last to come out even though our bags had priority tags.  When we left the airport we looked at each other and both thought how could Singapore Airlines be voted the world’s best airline.  🤷‍♂️
label: negative

text: Excellent Crew and Service making a 13-hour flight a nice and comfortable experience is saying it all. The service and the attention of the crew are excellent. The premium economy is worth the extra money. the only minor point is the quality of the food and the frequency of meals and snacks offered. It is still good but I have the impression that SGP Airlines is on some cost saving here. Please keep your high standards and do not lower them following the competition's trend as this is for us the reason why we always will choose Singapore Airlines above the others.
label: positive

text: Best airport deserves best airline Notwithstanding my latest flight on SIA, a review is overdue for me - they have been my favorite airline for about 20 years now. It started with my yearly Frankfurt-NY flights, and I've been upping my quota of SIA flights significantly ever since moving to Singapore. Just about everybody who travels a lot knows that Changi Airport in Singapore is in a class of its own - the new Jewel mallvaganza its crowning achievement, for now -  but Singapore Airlines is a befitting counterpiece. Great service, surprisingly decent food (I always enjoy the breakfast), great entertainment, on time most of the time (once I had a long delay and they refunded most of the ticket), really a class act. Can't wait for my July nonstop SG-San Francisco flight and many more beyond that...
label: positive

text:
Great Service My wife and I recently flew to the UK with Singapore Airlines from Adelaide due to there being direct flights via Singapore. As we are currently resident in Hobart In the past 2 years we have flown with Qantas from Melbourne and British Airways from Sydney.

We only travel Business Class on international flights and what a difference an airline makes. The best description for our QF flights was "chaotic" and for our BA flights is "indifference", compared to the smooth, professional and efficient service you get on SQ.

We will definitely got to extra lengths to ensure that we only travel on SQ in future.
label: positive

text: Melhor voo This flight was the best flight I have ever made. For a 12 hour flight, in this flight the time passes very fast. they have nice food, nice entreteinment,
label: positive

text:
Pleasant Journey Hospitality of Singapore airlines and its wonderful support crew were upto the mark.

Meals provided were of good standard and the journey was smooth.

It was a pleasant experience 

Charles wijesinghe
label: positive

text: Great service as usual Wonderful service by the cabin crew and a smooth and safe flight from the start to the end of the flight.
label: positive

text: Best Five Star Airlines Singapore airlines really made me comfortable during the flight with the best service  from your cabin crew, best taste with the breakfast, lunch and dinner menu with the high quality. This is first time I'd try your Airbus A380-800 route Singapore - Hongkong.
label: positive

text: Great flight, great crew and great product My first ULH flight in premium economy. The hard product was excellent. Seat was comfortable and had good pitch. Entertainment was better than the the standard SQ LH flight. Food was good, especially as the BTC option was available. The crew were excellent, friendly and hospitable. By the end of the flight, it felt like we had made new friends!
label: positive

text:
Shoddy service and poor quality of aircraft My wife and I have been extremely disappointed at the deplorable quality of service of the airline in general as encountered throughout the REP-CCU route in Jan 2020. We chose Singapore as we had heard lots of wonderful things about the airline.  Our experience was worse than any cheap quality bucket-shop airlines and we thought Singapore was a world standard airline.

On the REP-SIN Route my seat had a broken table which I was informed only on the way to the boarding the flight when I was suddenly being pressurised by their ground staff. Although I was waiting at the airport near the gate for over an hour none of their ground staff bothered to discuss this matter with me. It was as if I was being pressured and coerced into accepting their deplorable service. Furthermore the table was only secured with sticky tape which kept falling on my lap and on a couple of occasions fell on my watch!

To cap it all having a disgusting experience from REP to SIN we then received further shoddy service from ground staff at Singapore on the Kolkata flight. Ground staff in SIN are rude and egoistic and do not treat customers with respect. We observed this behaviour of their ground staff with other passengers on the same flight. I made the mistake on relying on the name of this airline without realising how miserable their service has become from 10 years ago when we did fly with them to Singapore for the first time and were very happy with the service. Having paid USD 700 for our one-way ticket from REP to CCU I was shocked to be downgraded to an airline with filthy seats, filthy cabin no TV no leg space and in general badly in need of an uplift. You can see in the photo the filthy water trickling out of the toilets into the kitchen area behind the aircraft! To cap it all the cabin staff offered me gifts worth SGD 75 on the plane.  This offer got progressively downgraded by their head office to a few miles on their shoddy airline.  I refused the offer.
label: negative

text:
Our holiday in Australia  We decided 10 months ago that we'd visit family in Australia.We looked at a few airlines, eventually deciding on Singapore Airlines,and we were not disappointed.There was more than enough room for us in economy,with more than enough leg room and extremely comfy seats.The cabin crew were amazing and worked so hard to make sure that every passenger was looked after whatever class you were travelling.Food and refreshments were constant,and if we needed anything extra than that, it was brought to you straight away.It was so professional and we were so happy with everything, that's the reason for this great review.When we go on our next trip to Australia,Singapore airlines is the ONLY airline we would consider travelling with.
Pillows,blankets,flight socks,toothbrush and toothpaste was all supplied on board.10 out of 10 for the cabin crew,comfort and the aircraft we travelled on.See you on our next trip to OZ.Thankyou Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Good Air Line to travel It was a family tour with friends to China for 7 days. It was a pleasant travel up and down.
The service was really good and the cabin crew were very friendly. We had a one hour stop over in Singapore and we got late check in as we had to use the wash rooms in the morning. It was last minute check in by us and I think they delayed few minutes till we checked in. If they did not do our entire trip have been a mess. Food was good. And it was a smooth take off and landing.
label: positive

text: wonderful inflight experience! Half way into the evening flight to Haneda, casually chatted with one of the Japanese crew about sake recommendations in Tokyo. She returned shortly later with a hand written list of premium sake brands, where to get them as well as Tokyo restaurant recommendations! What a delightful service experience, thank you Masako-san!
label: positive

text: Terrible customer service Horrible customer service. Suddenly they announced that transit is not allowed for Indians. No one responds. Beware booking with them as they may hold your money and not give any information and ask you wait until ur travel date to finally say your booking is cancelled. I had good experience with other airlines like Lufthansa even during pandemic.I will never take this airline.
label: negative

text: The greatest company I have ever flown!!! Fantastic flight, great service, nothing can beat this company. I strongly recommend to book directly through their home page. You can choose your seat, your meal, and do the check in online before departure. The staff are always smiling despite the long hours and always ready to answer any question you might have. A great company indeed. Thank you
label: positive

text: Seats uncomfortable Try to travel business class on long haul for flat beds. These seats were wide but quite firm and after a long time sitting got very uncomfortable. Also to get the flat bed you can’t just recline but need to flip seat so you either have flat bed or chair. It’s not easy to flip between the two so not ideal. Much prefer the reclining type like Emirates or BA. food was excellent and service ok.
label: neutral

text:
A joy to travel with My third holiday this year to Asia and again I only want to fly with Singapore airlines. 
I always like to pay a little bit extra to get the baggage, entertainment and food included. The staff are always smiling and helpful, a credit to Singapore airlines. 
I'm a nervous flyer who suffers from anxiety in general so I need to feel comfortable in my surroundings. I never feel anything but comfortable flying with Singapore.
Food was delicious as usual and plenty to fill the space in my belly. The only downside which I always find is the tea is not as hot as I'd like. By the time you add the milk it's lukewarm but apart from that small thing everytime I fly with Singapore airlines it's perfect. 
I've booked for Phuket next August 2020 with Singapore but my trip back to Glasgow in Mar/April 2020 is with emirates as they fly direct to Glasgow and the cost was much better.
label: positive

text: flight experience My bags were left at Singapore and arrived only the next day although there was plenty of time to load the bag from one flight to another terrible
label: negative

text: Good inflight service, flight delays Recently travelled from Malé to Hanoi and return, via Singapore. Noticed a delay of about 30 minutes on each leg of the trip, which is something not that frequent on Singapore airlines. The food, inflight entertainment was good. Cabin crew very helpful and smiling as always
label: positive

text:
Cabin staff are very friendly Always great staff, nothing is too much trouble.
Pity other carriers cant learn from Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Harrased by the the ground staff at Changi Airport A ground staff member was extremely rude and misbehaved with us yesterday at Changi Airport around 7:30 pm at T3 gate A19. His name was Shiva or Shivam, and he was most likely of South Asian descent. He kept making rude gestures to my parents and me, both senior citizens, and after confronting him, he said he had every right to do so. He kept on changing the queue and continuously harrased us. We were tired and exhausted after 10 hour flight from Christchurch which was delayed. As a passenger I have paid the full price of my economy class ticket. We deserve the same amount of respect and courtesy to be extended to us as given to those in first and business class passengers. This discriminatory classist and racist behaviour has left a bitter taste in my mouth. We deserve an apology. I am very upset and disappointed with the world's leading airline.
label: negative

text: Poor customer service We received an email from Singapore airlines notifying us of a slight change of time for our flight. After trying to log in to manage the booking, we were unable to do so. We contacted Singapore airlines to be told that our domestic flight had diverted to a different city meaning that there was a chance we could miss our international flight back to the Uk. After asking Singapore airlines to change our domestic flight to an earlier flight or to a flight the day before to give us more chance of catching our international flight, we were told they couldn’t change our flight to any of the ones we suggested. Extremely poor customer service, especially as their flight prices are extortionate now. If this journey doesn’t run smoothly we won’t be using them again.
label: negative

text: Class and comfort a!nd royalty Wow! The customer service level is world class, seamless and royalty. Food is amazing. The service I loved the most is those warm hand towels given to passengers  before the meals are served. I will fly Singapore anytime
label: positive

text: Nice experience flying with Singapore Airline Food was good, in-flight entertainment was excellent. Flying more than 8 hours was very enjoyable. Crews were helpful, Legroom is OK. Quick boarding
label: positive

text: This is Economy? I would never have expected warm towels and meal on the flight.  But both were there .  Passengers were treated a guests and welcomed.  I look forward to another flight.
label: positive

text: Sweetest, most attentive service  Haven’t flown SQ for about 20 years, as it’s typically one of the more expensive airlines, and it still remains as one of the best experiences to date.  The food was good but not great (a little too salty) but the service from the flight attendants was truly warm and sincere.  I prefer the 777-300 over the A380 as I feel the A380 upper deck is a bit low.   Really a great product!!!
label: positive

text:
my comments were heard? This is the return leg of my trip to bangkok. The first leg, there was a feedback request via email sent to me by SQ. I mentioned about the bread rolls to be warmed up instead on wrapping them in cold plastic bags that bloated up once we are up there in the sky. And also commented that the air stewardess asked me, "what would you like?" when i saw no menu in the poach in front of me and there was no form of any communication as to what food were available.

Immediately on my return flight, i was served warm bread from the basket instead of the plastic bags. And of course, was handed a menu before i was served lunch. If these two matters were not coincidental, i would say that i am truly impressed with how serious SQ took their customers' feedbacks.

As for the rest of the items on offer like in-flight entertainment and leg room, still the best that i had. Always if possible, booked my flights with SQ if the options were available.

Thanks for the great flight!
label: positive

text: Top Notch! Flown with several airline-companies during the last 30 years and I must say that business class with Singapore Airlines was the best experience so far. Remarkable service, very good food and superior wine-list including champagne. Not cheap, but worth it!
label: positive

text: Whenever you get the chance, fly Singapore Airlines! A long flight made shorter by very comfortable seats, excellent food, outstanding service and very good entertainment options. We have flown on all of the Middle-East airlines and most of the Asian ones and nothing can match Singapore. The European and American airlines aren't even comparable. The planes are modern, the Business Class seat arrangement is 1-2-1 and compare that to an Emirates or Turkish 777 (both of which we have flown recently) which use a 2-3-2 configuration. The extra room makes for a much more comfortable 17 hour flight. This is how to run an airline!
label: positive

text:
There are better airlines!  Poor food, with snacks served instead of meals. 

Crew very pleasant, but you have to chase them for a drink! 

Neither ground crew nor onboard crew will let you upgrade, when you’re more than happy to pay; each says you must speak to the other. 

I would never book with them myself.
label: negative

text: GREAT AIRLINES Their service was excellent and friendly, for go inside they do the best with group boarding pass, in-flight entertainment good, with good leg space, sitting area was comfortable and the cabin was clean. great airlines
label: positive

text: Review on Singapore airlines The Singapore airlines A380 flight is very good. The service of the flight attentands is quick and good too. If you travel on the A380 I would recommend you to travel in business or first class as the experience is scintillating.
label: positive

text:
Premium Economy great Flight leaves 11.50 which is great.  Seats good 32 d & 32e and no one was beside us. They do serve a meal not long after takeoff, and then you can get snacks through the night and breakfast served before landing.

Seat recline so you can have a good sleep.  Staff excellent.

The only thing I don’t like is not having toilets in the premium economy section.
label: positive

text: Highly recommended  Minor differences between Economy abd Premium Economy but it is these differences that make your journey more comfortable. Bigger seats with more legroom and deeper pitch for sleeping are awesome options to have. The food was good and the service was exceptional. Also boarding early is a bonus
label: positive

text: Great Service, good  food The staff are helpful and very welcoming. The food is great. Its always a pleasure flying with Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: What's happened to Singapore Airlines? What has happened to Singapore Airlines? I used to enjoy flying with this airline. My last flight was abominable. Flights were delayed. The food was terrible, just a doughy bit of pizza for dinner. The staff stressed. The seats on the plane were very cramped and im not even a large build person. Not the quality we used to expect from this airline.
label: negative

text:
Not good for travel to Singapore and beyond from New York City Years ago Singapore Air had a direct flight from Newark/New York to Singapore. It was great! But they stopped that fight when they got rid of those planes. Now if you fly from New York to Singapore, you have to deplane in Frankfort, wait, and then get back on the plane AFTER going through German customs! A real pain. Last time flew I was flagged for drugs on the way home to New York. I am a photographer and had lots of equipment with me. They tore me apart, opening and emptying every bag of photo and computer stuff, making me remove every piece of equipment I had - only to realize that my sleeping pills were showing up as drugs. They were beyond nasty...
And Singapore Air's Frequent Flyer department is terrible. I wanted to upgrade from Premium Economy to Business. I was told to transfer the miles and it would be done closer to my trip.The part of my trip from Bangkok to Singapore and back was upgraded, but the Singapore/New York portion was not. When I got to Bangkok from Laos and tried to do the upgrade, I was told that it had to be done in Singapore. When I got to Singapore, I was told that it had to be done in Bangkok and they wouldn't do it.There were plenty of seats available in Business. I lost 40,000 miles because they wouldn't accommodate me! I haven't flown them since. I used to fly them on a regular basis.They lost a good customer! P.S. I traveled before 2018, but had to put a date on this review.
label: negative

text:
Flight from Dublin to Brisbane The first leg of our code sharing flight from Dublin was cancelled at the last minute to Frankfurt.
Got an email short time later from Singapore Airlines saying we were booked on an Emirates that night. Retrieved our luggage from another terminal and waited at Emirates counter for over 3 hours until their counter closed as Emirates said they never received authorization for our alternative flight tickets. Told to go to Swissport in Dublin who were great and arranged a hotel for the night. After getting to the airport hotel at 11-00pm we rang our travel agent back home shortly after who said she had to converse with Singapore Airlines for over 2 hours to arrange alternative flights. Finally got another flight home later the next day which went off without any problems albeit a day later. Our previous experience with Singapore Airlines has been great but this flight was incredibly stressful and we had a feeling of abandonment in Dublin due to a lack of communication from Singapore Airlines. Hopefully just a one off experience.
label: negative

text: Horrible experience in Business class By traveling Singapore airlines is my worst experience all my travel history.  I never experience such uncomfortable business class seats the bed is so hard while traveling i developed pain in my back there is no space to straight your legs one has to sleep on a angle i could not sleep in my journey.  There is very limited menu for the food specially for a vegetarian.  The Delhi Singapore staff is rude and service is very bad. I want Singapore airlines should refund my fair.  This my first and last time traveling in Singapore airlines.  Will never travel or recommend any one. Raghu vyas well known imaginary realism painter in India.
label: negative

text:
Not what it used it used to be...shame shame Singapore used to be one of the best but has been going more and more down.
Tickets are sold a fortune but the food and service are only going down.
Luggages upon arrival wasn't there, got it next day, ok can happen, but I have learnt since then that Singapore airlines has actually been bumping luggages every day for a while and passengers each and every day are missing their luggage upon arrival (same thing happened on the same flight to a friend of me 3 weeks later and other 20 passengers, my flight we were about 15 not to have it)
This is not acceptable at all
Food who used to be good is very average to not good at all now.....
I couldn't even eat breakfast last time as it was really bad.
And when you want to change ticket, they are trying to force you to pay the highest rate and the rates are insane.
I don't like to travel with them anymore...it's really a pity.
Speaking to other passengers from other destinations and they told me also they this airline has been going way down and they do not wish to travel anymore with them.
See the only thing they want is to make money on the back of the customers.....
Get a hold of yourself Singapore Airlines....we are not money machine
label: negative

text: Great lunch on board The Japanese chicken with rice was such a great choice! The set came with cold soba and chicken meatballs, alongside some salad. The whole journey was comfortable, and the pilot landed relatively smoothly despite the poor weather.
label: positive

text: Sneakily booking people on Scoot I'm so angry, Singapore Airlines used to be good, but when booking a ticket to Vietnam, they sneakily put you on Scoot - for an 8 hour flight! I paid for a full price, full service ticket - they clearly must have put operated by Scoot in very small writing somewhere, to say I'm upset is an understatement. I could have booked a Scoot ticket for $200, not the $800 I paid to not have to sit for 8 hours on a horrible plane. My whole trip is ruined, I've been having a really hard time and now I'm stuck on what is going to be a miserable flight. To cancel costs half the ticket price. The same has happened for my return leg! Shame on you Singapore Airlines, this is the last time I will ever book with such an unethical and untrustworthy company! Thank you for ruining my first holiday in years!
label: negative

text: A380 Economy is great! Naturally I wasn't looking forward to the 12 or so hours in economy!  I was very pleasantly surprised by the comfort and comparative spaciousness of the A380 Economy cabin.  As usual the service from the Singapore Airlines cabin crew was exemplary, the meals offered good choices and were tasty and we arrived in Singapore on time which is a bit of a bonus departing from LHR.
label: positive

text: Never Again Received a bottle of water at the start of the 16hr flight, and finally had to walk to the back of the plane to ask for another bottle of water, this after about 7 hrs. Food? One meal at the start of the flight, and as i sit here writing this 11 hrs into the flight, no more food, i.e. meals or snacks. Oh, no stewardesses either. I get better service on a 1 hr flight on southwest!
label: negative

text:
Very comfortable flight Their staff is helpful and friendly.
Their seats are pretty comfy and spacious. 
In Flight Entertainment is great.
In Flight Meal is great.
Worth the money.
label: positive

text: Singapore to melbourne Picture this, Had the left two seats at the rear of the mid seats, we were concerned about this arrangement, but it was not necessary. Great seats, really good service, cannot go back to economy.
label: positive

text:
A long flight from Heathrow to Bangkok via Singapore A good service with smiling cabin crew.  Food was fine for economy class.  Did have a choice from 2 options on the main journey.  It is the timing and serving of meals that won't suit everyone.  Flight left at 11:50 PM and the dinner served after an hours of flight.  So the body clock is at 1:00 AM.  Sleep for 6-7 hours and breakfast is served.
But apart from that the crew try to make your flight as smoothly as possible.
label: positive

text: Great service, unusually decent food Excellent onboard service; and the food served in economy - for which I had low expectations based on other airlines - was unusually tasty.  Granted, Darwin is not a busy airport, but the ground staff were extremely helpful and efficient.
label: positive

text: As usual, great quality onboard SGA offers, as usual, a great quality onboard: this time we were on an A350; seat are comfortable, the full flat bed is also very relaxing and allows to sleep well. The dinner -alongwith the list if wines- was very good, and the crew extremely nice. I recommend.
label: positive

text: Excellent !!! I flu from London to Singapore and everything was perfect. Excellent service and very tasty food , clean toilet and comfortable seats. Very good entertainment.Absolutely fantastic .Highly recommend
label: positive

text:
Brisbane Trip Its a long trip so we booked business class with Singapore Airlines based on reputation. This was not misplaced judgment. I am not a fan of airline food for the last 35 years or so and although the food both out and back was not to my taste, it was beautifully presented and served. I have to say that I could not speak more highly of the cabin crews. They were very pleasant, courteous and attentive. They made the unpleasantness of long haul flying as good as it could be. Well done to all of you both out and back. Seating was comfortable and allowed sleep which is a bonus for me.
Highly recommended and would be first choice for another trip.
label: positive

text:
Best and most comfortable airline in the world Seats are roomy (unlike the wishbone coffin like seats of Cathay and other carriers). Aisles, seating area, and toilets are spotless (unlike Cathay and other carriers). Staff is extreme hospitable, gracious, polite and willing to look after passengers as their chargé d’affaire. This amount of painstaking detail cannot be found in any other carrier period. 

The pilots need to be commended most of all. The reason being is they arrived early not to chit chat but to speak with ground control across their path and to other arriving pilots which in turn helped them map out a proper flight path that was free of turbulence. In today’s day and age it is erroneous to blame turbulence on anything other than the pilot as it can be mitigated. We have ample satellites and monitoring stations that can outline the pockets of turbulence. Therefore on other carriers it is the pilot’s fault for plotting a rubbish flight path. As the pilots arrived too late adhering to their clock-in rather than their passion for flying. They never bothered to check with ground control along their path or with other pilots on said path. And so they just plot the quickest flight path that will garner them their additional incentive for saving fuel and arriving early; and that is much to the demise of passenger comfort. It is clear those pilots of other carriers such as Cathay have no business flying as they are not passionate about their vocation and are simply there to collect a pay cheque. They are for a lack of a better word - Dead wood that needs to be let go. 

The pilots of Singapore Airlines are TOP GUNS. They are passionate about their craft (pun intended) and put passenger comfort upfront and above their incentive.
label: positive

text: Very comfortable flight Flying on SQ from Singapore to Perth was a breeze. The seats were comfortable. I was impressed by the little touches to enhance the comfort of travelers. On the seatback in front of me was a small pocket in which I could put my glasses. I always have trouble finding a place to put my glasses when I fly with other airlines. SQ's attention to detail and little touches enhance my flying experience. Kudos to SQ.
label: positive

text:
A1Service The stewards on the flight were friendly and helpful. The food and refreshments were to our liking. At no time did we feel uncomfortable, however, the passenger sitting in front of my husband reclined his seat, cramping the space that my husband had available, which he found annoying!
When we arrived back in Melbourne still on board the plane, our disembarkment was delayed by 15 minutes, due to a passenger requiring specialist medical attention. At no time during that flight were we aware that a passenger was experiencing health issues. Full marks to the stewards for attending to that person’s needs and protecting his/her privacy, without causing unnecessary stress to other passengers
label: positive

text: Disappointed Singapore Airlines has always been one of our most favourite airlines, but our last trip in September to Singapore wasn't too good and disappointed us considerably. We often go business class but because it was a sort flight during the day, we thought we would go economy and pay extra for extra leg room seats. We bought the ticket a number of months before our trip and selected our seats, then shortly before the trip they placed us further back in the plane.The service was terrible and I'll give you an example. About an hour or so before we landed my wife asked to be served a cup of tea. The attendant said they were about to serve a snack and my wife told her we didn't want the snack. She then walked away and came back to us with two cups of black tea and a milk. She then called for service and asked for super. She went away again and a few minutes later returned with the sugar. My wife then call for service yet again and asked for a teaspoon. All this could have been taken care of in a more efficient manner. The attitude was not consistent with SIA mantra of good service. The final thing which we have never experienced was when we were a short distance from our destination and an announcement came over the intercom telling us the immigration cards were required by Singapore visitors. Nothing happened in our section until I asked an attendant for a card for my self and my wife. He then left and a few minutes later the senior attendant informed us they ran out of the cards. Why didn't they say anything? No good Singapore Airlines. Came back to Sydney in Premium Economy and service was very good.
label: neutral

text:
entertainment has plenty options. kids was kept busy seat was not as comfy as expected. not enough legroom. but food served is ok. flight entertainment has plenty of options - movies wise. they gave drawing books, crayons and other stuffs to my 9 yr old. she kept herself busy the whole duration of flight. but on our flight back, my child fell of her gift from the airline, we tried searching on the floor, we believed a passenger in our back (fellow Filipino) got it and never gave it back. 

over all, flight was ok. we had a smooth take off and touch down to and fro. thank God and to the pilots and crew
label: positive

text:
Great flight to Colombo (06 DEC 2019) Upon boarding the flight to Colombo, I was pleasantly surprised by the interior of the brand new A359 (9V-SHJ). Excellent crew. NOTHING was too much trouble. Very professional and courteous when dealing with passengers. Very friendly and warm. 
Food was out of this world. Slept for the remainder of the flight and watched a couple of movies prior to landing. 
The Krisworld entertainment system is decent. With a fair selection of the latest movies. 
SQ has a very classy feel even in economy which not a lot of other airlines have.
label: positive

text: never disappoints Singapore airlines is one of my best airlines, the service, food is always really good. The planes are clean, spacious and comfortable.
label: positive

text:
For me the best airlines what I choose :-) I love Airbus 380-800. flight was great.I slept well good.Love entertainment.Snacks and meals were very good.Service just perfect.

Singapore team are  were very nice and helpful.Smile and had a lot of patience.I choose often Singapore Airline.
label: positive

text: holiday trip to malasia with singapore airlines. arrived wellington airport, went directly to singapore airlines check in desk, where we were met by a very nice efficient check in girl, who made us feel very welcome. as i required a wheel chair it was promptly bought to me,the service was really great. escorted to the plane I was met by 2 air hostesses who took me tomy seat and helped me buckle in. the meals and the service was supberb. on reaching Canberra  I was again assisted to a wheelchair and taken to the lounge. onreturn to the plane Iwas again looked after in a very efficient way being made to feel that I was a VIP again onthe flight to singapore i was well looked after as was my travelling companion.. on arrival in singapore I wastaken by wheelchair to baggage claim, custom etc.andto the taxi ranks where they got us acab to our hotel. I wll definitley be flying air singapore on my next trip over seas.
label: positive

text: Looking  forward  to fly again It was a very good experience flying  in Singapore  Airlines.  The crew members  were very cordial . It had a fantastic  collections  of all types of movies.My family enjoyed on the whole. The food was good too.

text:

Lucky to have one seat empty in our row, so we can stretch our leg and rest comfortably.

text: Authentic Japan Although Economy Class is not well rated, I’ve found Singapore Airlines’ Cabin Staff to be quite helpful always. Have been so lucky over my years of travel not to encounter pesky travellers nor crying babies. text: Trip to Melbourne Being in Premier Economy you also get fast checkin and boarding also, Luggage also get Priority Tags in Mumbai, Seats are comfortable and food is also better. They should have seperate Toilets for Premier economy.

text: Singapore to Melbourne Service on the aircraft is fine .Lovely to travel during the day as opposed to the overnight flight to Adelaide.
label: positive

text:
Overpriced for its service and food I usually fly SQ to support local whenever it's within my budget.

Since we have a 2 month old in tow and we will be living in BNE for number of years we decided to bite the bullet and stretch our budget to make our 7.5 hour journey a little more bearable.  

PAID, $3,987.8 for Economy for 3 return tickets, $174 for baby. 

BOOKING process was fairly simple and quick. Love the look and feel of the website. Calendar view with the prices, departure and arrival dates were very helpful.

SERVICE 
1. SIN to BNE Service was fantastic. Air stewards and stewardesses were extremely attentive. Our call bells, even accidental ones were attended to within 2-5 minutes. Meals were served to parents with infants first. This was especially helpful because cranky parents make bad customers. 

2. BNE to SIN Service was fair. There was an air stewardess serving our zone that was curt and sometimes rude. Didn't get her name but she was a little stubby. The second air stewardess that served us was very polite and personable.  Wasn't served first in this flight but it's not expected, I'm just comparing it with my previous flight. 

FOOD both flights served tasty food and the snacks were edible. I remember the pie from my BNE to SIN. The pastry was super tough to bite. A sandwich would've been better. But the taste was not too bad. It is a shame that the pastry was tough. 

DRINKS I love that SQ always have a wide selection of drinks. Wine, spirits, beer, soft drinks and juices.

TOILETS they are clean and maintained throughout the flight by the flight attendants. It is very commendable that they try their best to keep it fresh amongst the myriad of other responsibilities. Both flights were consistent in this.

AUDIO/ENTERTAINMENT love the entertainment sets provided. Movies were loaded rather quickly. There was a good variety of movies, tv series, documentaries and games.  

AMENITY KITS we were given face towels before takeoff and an Amenity Kit. It includes a toothbrush, toothpaste and a pair of socks. The pouch looks good.     

Qantas/Emirates VS Singapore Airlines
I flew SIN to BNE on 30 June 2019 and I was stunned at the value that was given to us by Qantas vs SQ. We paid $1230.4 for 3 return tickets, $43 for the infant. Granted that we are flying in an older aircraft but the price difference is CRAZY. And I will be flying 4 times a year. Think about the savings I am getting by choosing Qantas. It is a sad because I really want to support local, but in Singapore, we are taught to be savvy. 

Before takeoff, we were given face towels and 3 packets of baby Amenity Kits (Blanket w toy, Pouch w Pigeon wet wipe, spoon and a disposable changing mat) and a small elephant backpack) WOW!

Food was tastier than the ones served in SQ both meals and sandwich were superb. But SQ serves their bread rolls warm (this is a super plus point). The Qantas flight attendants were not as attentive with call bells left unanswered for more than 15 minutes. But they were super friendly.

Toilet amenities were similar to the ones in SQ. Entertainment sets were fully loaded with so many things. 

CONCLUSION
My experience with SQ was great. But why should I fly SQ when I'm getting tickets from Qantas at less than half the price. With similar service and entertainment. Qantas wins the food category hands down.

I would stay with SQ once they start pricing right.
label: positive

text: As economy travel goes, pretty good For a three-hour regional flight, I doubt if we could have done better. The leg-room wasn't great, but the food was edible and the wine drinkable. We left on schedule and the timing was good, getting us to Singapore late afternoon. My only complaint would be that we didn't get the seats we had booked online. For our return leg, checking in online a good 36 hours before departure, all aisle seats were already booked. Still, I'd choose SQ over Cathay every time!
label: positive

text: First time It's my first fly with Singapore Airlines and Im excited to experience their service. And for me it's amazing it didnt let me down I'm just an economy passenger who availed a promo rate airfare but still the service for me was like I'm in a first class hehehe and I really enjoyed the food even the entertainment they provided..it's even my first time not to take a sleep..since most of my flights I will be dozing off right after the aircraft's take off but no way Im still fully awake and enjoying my movies hehehe like a kid..keep it up guys the flight attendants are all polite😊😊😊..God bless you all hopefully on my next vacation I will be flyung with you guyz..Big thanks to all the crew from the pilot to the flight attendants...once again God bless you all!!!

text:
Never feels like economy class Unlike the disaster I had a week earlier via Air Canada , I've test to experience a bad SIA flight .The staff always make you feel welcome and are extremely attentative to the passengers needs.   

I will continue to Support SIA and will always select them ahead of other airlines.

text: Airline Punctuality Departure & arrival time were puncture. Service was decent and Meal was good. Check-in was a breeze because we reach the airport early about 2 1/2 hrs ahead of fight schedule.
