text: 12 SEPT 2018 One of the smoothest international flights we have experienced over many years travelling in both classes. Changing flights at Changi was straightforward and exiting Frankfurt Airport was simple as well. A word of warning though regarding Franfurt Airport from a tour guide in Frankfurt .Pickpockets have increased so such an extent that it is regarded as the most unsafe area in Franfurt.
label: positive

text: First class experience. I choose to fly KL to Mumbai via Singapore on first class in order to experience the world renowned airline. The flight from KL was on airbus 330 business class. It was short 45min on time flight. I had to change terminal in changi airport via shuttle inside the airport. Then proceed to lounge. There was a private room section in the lounge. Very few people were there and most of them were there for a short time. I had 5 and half hour lay over in the lounge. Wow! What an experience. Best wine and dine experience I’ve had. Then the flight from Singapore to Mumbai was an A380. It was a 5 hour flight. The first class was located on the lower deck of the aircraft. It was the second A380 of the Singapore Airlines. The first class cabin was old style. But the service and food were impeccable.
label: positive

text:
Oldest aircraft on the Singapore - Kolkata sector Despite charging premium fares (which I do not mind paying), Singapore Airlines has been deploying the oldest aircrafts on the Singapore - Kolkata - Singapore sectors for the past 25+ years.

Travelling every month on this sector for more than 26 years, I feel shortchanged. What SQ does not realise is that the moment another airline starts regular service on this sector, they will lose many premium passengers like me. I have been a PPS Solitaire passenger for more than a decade and it is sad that SQ has been under serving this sector for so many years.

These aircraft should have been retired a long time back.

Having said that, SQ is still the best airline in the world.
label: neutral

text: What is all the fuss about? I was looking forward to trying Singapore Airlines after it being rated so high. So I have to tell you, this is United with another name and equipment that is not as comfortable. First I was traveling only for a few days. I ALWAYS do carry on. When I checked in, they took my carry on away and told me that it was too heavy. New regulations. Ok. I didn't fuss too much but during board when others had bags almost twice the size of mine and obviously much heavier, I was upset. Next, the seat! Ok, it is nice and wide however the way it is structured you can only use part of it comfortably. Time to sleep...lie flat??? Oh yes, manual fold down which makes a HARD wooden bed for you to sleep on. I need to wash my hands. Ok...but no towels or anything in the washroom so I had to wipe them on my pants. All in all, not a stellar 5 star experience.
label: negative

text:
At last, Singapore Airlines! Overall, very good service.
PROS: The toilets remained clean all throughout the flight. Flight attendants were helpful and attentive.
AVERAGE: Somehow I expected better food; this experience was only average in quality, in hotness arriving to your seat. No cheese, no bread, except for breakfast.
CONS: The bag of amenities was not at all exciting--a pair of orange socks with non-stick soles, a toothbrush, a tiny tube of toothpaste, and ear plugs.
Choice of films so-so.
label: positive

text:
Disappointed  My husband and I were looking forward to our flight to New Zealand in Singapore airlines, however we were left somewhat disappointed. 
Although the crew were smartly turned out the service and care was left wanting. 
Rushed and inattentive. Drinks seemed to be sparse, food very average and when I was suffering with a headache and pressed the button to ask for some water, I waited over half an hour for someone to come and then they didn’t seem to understand and came back with some warm water! 
Airplanes were quite tired too. 
Found New Zealand airline far superior.
label: neutral

text:
Bad service from SQ - Asked for extra pillow. No reply from the crew if it is available.
- Asked for Peppermint Tea and the reply i received: Peppermint Tea is only available in Business Class
- Asked for warm water, cold water was served.
- Pre-order items from Kris Shop, no proper carrier was given. Lucky i have a bag which is big enough to keep the items.

text:
airlines with the best services? Services by the crew were not as good as I expected - despite promoting themselves as having the 'best services'. the food was not terrible but not great. the seats were not comfortable - I would say seats for Ryanair was better. 

I was also sitting next to the break room (?) for crew members so they were opening a bright lit room every few minutes throughout the 13 hrovernight flight, and I was unable to sleep. 

additionally, while the millage for my return flight was added, the millage to Singapore was not added so I contacted them only to get an answer 4 weeks later that the flight is 'not millage applicable'. Terrible wording of the whole email, no respect at all. I will never fly with them again.

text: On time and safe Whenever I travel, SQ is always my 1st choice of Airline; the plane is new, on time schedule and good service. Online booking of SQ flight and online check-in process is easy, inflight entertainment is great too. Highly recommended. :)
label: positive

text:
A perfect start to a long distance holiday This was the first leg of our holiday in New Zealand, a stop off in Singapore. Although we hadn't flown with Singapore Airlines before, they came well recommended. The reviewers didn't lie! This was one of the best long distance flights we've had. The aircraft (Boeing 777-300) was reasonably spacious, the food very good and the cabin crew excellent.

An overnight flight of 12 hours + was never going to be a sinecure. However, the staff made the whole trip very enjoyable. The in-flight entertainment was very good, with new-rease movies, and satellite box-sets available. We arrived safe and well in Singapore, ready to enjoy what this amazing city has to offer.

Thank you to the crew aboard SQ321!
label: positive

text: Great entertainment system, great seats (economy) Flew SQ361 and SQ362 Stockholm - Singapore - Stockholm with the Airbus Industrie A350-900. I was sitting in economy but I had reserved a seat with extra leg room as I am 6 foot 3 (193 cm). However, space was fairly good even in the ordinary seats. Entertainment system was great, large clear touch screen with over 90 english spoken movies, lots of other stuff to watch. Kids enjoyed all the video games controlled by the wire remote that is located in the seat. USB charging available. Headrest is moveable. Food was good for being airplane food, mostly asian dishes. Only down side with this fligth was the stop in Moscow where everyone including hand luggage had to leave the aircraft and pass through security. Felt like an unneccesary stop as not many new people left or entered the airplane. Stop was fairly fast, estimation 60-90 minutes. Overall, I will fly Singapore again when I am travelling to far east asia.
label: positive

text: The size of this aeroplane was amazing On booking we selected and paid extra (minimal cost) for upstairs seats.This gave us peace of mind for a long overnight flight back home. No problems with the flight seats a bit hard but expected in economy. I have flown with Singapore airlines a number of time and always rated them very high but the food was not up to expectation neither my wife nor I ate anything. FA's were as always excellent in fact we hardly saw them as it was overnight. I would not do their job for any salary.
label: positive

text: Average experience. Our flight into Singapore was delayed and we missed our Air New Zealand connection to Auckland. Rebooked direct to Christchurch on Singapore Airlines in Premium Economy. Staff on the flight were great as usual but the seats were just economy with leather covering. The food also was nothing startling. First time Premium Economy with Singapore and not the best experience.
label: neutral

text: Poor disclosure and terrible service We booked a flight to SIN on Singapore Airlines (SA) in economy class from LAX for 11/2018.  A few days before we departed, we received an email from them encouraging us to bid on an upgrade to economy plus.  Even indicated what was a “low” bid with less chance of getting the upgrade, so we paid a higher bid that gave us a “fair” chance.  Shortly before our flight we received an email that we were approved and could book our seats.  We immediately went to the seat selections and found only 4 seats available, none together or even close.  We called SA but they said there was nothing available and our prior seats in economy were now taken.  We again asked at the counter when we checked in but same answer - no seats available.  We are in our 70’s and had to sit rows apart on different sides of the aircraft for this very long flight.  One of the seats was in the last row of economy plus and was so cramped it was very difficult to get in and out to use the restroom.  We suffered.  When we returned home, we found out SA would not even give miles for the flight since it was initially booked in economy.  We requested our money back as we felt taken and deceived with the charge, lack of disclosure, and the unacceptable and poor quality service provided.  They said “no”, terms and conditions protect them.  Beware of SA’s offers as they may not be what you expect, especially for an airline that touts their reputation.  We were extremely disappointed in their offer, service, and response!  First and last time we will fly with them.
label: negative

text: An excellent flight from beginning to end with exceptional customer service Exceptional airline with top service.  No complaints and the attendants were engaged and willing to do whatever they could to accommodate.  Smooth flight with great legroom even in economy.  Nice touches for economy that are often only seen in first class.
label: positive

text: Fantastic long haul flight Was dreading a long haul flight but it was really comfortable and easy. The food was surprisingly good and the cabin crew were gracious and unfailingly helpful. The plane was very clean and the change of planes at Singapore was simple. Thank you Singapore Airlines I would certainly fly with you again
label: positive

text:
Underwhelmed! After hearing so much about Singapore Airlines, I was so looking forward to the flight (especially the meal). I found the attendants to be ok, not overly gracious.
The meals were ordinary, pide as a snack was sourced from vendor (& curry puff from Singapore to Sydney also sourced from a vendor) and it was lacking in flavour. I had heard about the wonderful meals even in Economy but...disappointing!
Overall an average experience sad to say.

text: Singapore Airlines  Outstanding service - the crew were always wanting to get you food/drinks/anything,  outstanding entertainment - your own little playstation/movies/shows for free, top quality - well worth the money and time.

text:
the art of making time fly Singapore airlines really sets the standard in making flying an elevated experience. Their staff are proactive, smiling and work hard to make you feel cared for. We had a young child and the staff spent a lot of time taking care of her. Food could be served at a restaurant on the ground and people would come back.

The business class hardware is solid but not extravagant as Qatar or Emirates- its the service and food standard that still gives them an edge

text: Always happy to fly on SQ Always happy to fly on SQ. Service and planes are always good. Although slightly pricey, you get your money worth. I stopped over in Changi so that I could visit Jewel and it was impressive. I would reccomend SQ to my friends if its within their budget.

text: Better than last time Was heading to KL from Colombo, Sri Lanka this time for a holiday with SQ. It was a disappointment when I flew with Singapore airlines last time but have to say that this time it was way better. The flight crew was friendly and helpful. The meals were average and didn't have better options to choose with. Liked the effort that the team have put in to decorate inside the flight for Christmas. Small things makes a huge difference in the industry. Hope it improves up to the glory they had few years back.

text: DIFFICULT TO CHANGE FLIGHT DATE BY PHONE We had a booking for 06 sept to fly to Paris and return to Melbourne from Rome. We needed to change the first leg Melbourne to Paris via Singapore date which you can only do via their call centre. It took approx 1.50 hours to change the date. The first person couldn't understand what we wanted so after 1 hour trying to get it sorted we hung up and called back again - different person who grasped what we wanted and sorted it out for us. The first girl wouldn't transfer us to anyone else and said there was no supervisor we could speak to - very poor service and I'd think twice about booking through Singapore airlines again - changes are just far too difficult.
label: negative

text: One of the best airlines Staff was very helpful, polite and friendly air hostesses. Great services and great food... comfortable seats and best inflight entertainment selection.. baggage was handled very efficiently. Checking in was smooth.. overall experience was excellent..
label: positive

text:
Disappointing Singapore Airlines Premium Economy Singapore Airlines generally have a reputation for providing excellent service, and so we booked a Premium Economy flight SQ308 from Singapore to London, on 18 September 2023. Prior to this flight, we took a Scoot flight Melbourne to Singapore, again in Premium Economy, which was excellent, sitting in seats 1A and 1B.

The Singapore Airlines flight was disappointing in a number of areas.
We were not offered a glass of champagne on boarding, no flight menu was offered, no amenities kit, and very sparse service of drinks, in plastic cups (not glass). We had pre-ordered meals, my wife’s meal was first given to another passenger who opened it, realized it wasn’t theirs, and returned it to the hostess, who then read the correct seat number and offered it to my wife, opened!
I had to request more wine during the meal, it was not offered.

All in all, a most disappointing flight. We have Premium Economy flights booked on our return journey, not really looking forward to those.

I would chose QANTAS Premium Economy in the future. Not good enough Singapore!
label: neutral

text: Not very good No drinks were offered, meal was inedible, service was brisk and impersonal. Only snack offered was carrot sandwich. Reluctantly a G & T was brought, no sugar free tonic and the gin was very weak. Breakfast was dreadful. In summary 15 hours with 1 alcoholic drink and 3 bites of watermelon.
label: neutral

text:
Great Flight Good comfortable flight. Food was surprisingly good. Even the vegetarian meals tasted great. Not over seasoned. Seats were comfortable though once again would like a bit more space between rows.
This was a full flight and the staff could not be faulted.
label: positive

text:
Very nice flight Had a great flight. Everything on time and the staff were very helpful.
The plain was nice and clean & legroom good.
Food was above average - I don’t really like Airline food but this was nice. Served with a choice of drinks plus beer or wine also.
Will definitely use Singapore Airlines again.

text: Simply the best! Prior to retiring I was in the travel industry and had the opportunity to travel with many airlines, however Singapore Airlines evaded me.  About 10 years ago I travelled with them for the first time, I was hooked.  Every year I travel to Paris with them, reason being they are sooo seamless, always the same efficient service in all areas.  Best online booking portal, checkin always well organized with a lot of staff, ontime departures and arrivals, and as for the food, drinks and service the total time onboard, awesome.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing I knew SG airlines are considered the best out of all but it was rather mediocre or sub par actually.
Food was rather bad and they never heat up bread so it was always cold. The stewardesses seemed annoyed when I asked for a beer or any other additional small service.
One girl didn't even understand the word "butter" and when I made a gesture of spreading on bread and she thought I was after jam and told me "bread already sweet enough lah"and walked off
I wasn't angry or anything and took it as it is what it is but I was a little surprised. 
Well COVID changed everything and this probably is new normal. 
At least all my 4 flights arrived on time and I safely returned.
label: negative

text:
Mr Well here is a sad tale of an oft recommended airline now ferociously mining for money rather than service .
20 years of patronage out of my own pocket , unpropped by corporations and tax relief , recently accepted my bucks for business class tickets for this route .
Owing to family sickness the date couldn’t be kept . Despite gold status the additional cost was 600 pounds per passenger  for what purported to be different class seats in , wait for it , the same business class seats that had already been paid for .
When asked to describe the actual difference in seats in this subclass there was no difference . Simply a penalty for circumstance and no room for the long term and previously loyal customer . And no , flyer points could not be used .
The impersonal , computer bound inflexibility when you are already paying top whack reduces Singapore to no better than the pack they purport to strut above .
I hear qantas has improved of late , they can take my money in future , and that of those I have encouraged to try Singapore in the past .
And I have been compelled to tell the world .this contrivance where there are an array of subclasses in business class calculated to trap the unwary and milk the unfortunate is quite scandalous . Naively thought they were better than that , nope , moneygrubbers .
label: negative

text:
Great experience I've flown with this airline before but my partner hasn't so he didn't know what to expect, he was very happy with the whole experience, boarding no hassle, staff very friendly, he liked the hot towels that they came round with, food was OK and the drink choices too, even when plane was in "sleep mode" they quietly did rounds with fruit juice and water for those that were still awake. The entertainment screens were of a good size, seats, well typical airline seats but there is more room than budget airlines I've flown!!.
Definitely use again for my next trip
label: positive

text: Holiday Flew Singapore airlines from Manchester to Singapore for family holiday the flight was long but was enjoyable the crew on board were really good looked after us really well the food was excellent and was served with drinks for such a long flight the airplane was very comfortable good all round flight wood fly Singapore airlines again
label: positive

text: Comfy seats, great service for  flight Australia to Singapore Always a good option for longer flights. Seats way more comfortable than other budget Airlines and food also far better. Staff are friendly, and service is excellent.
label: positive

text: Fly either standard economy or business Seats are terrible, small, hard and uncomfortable. Vegetarian food is terrible. Fly either standard economy or go business. If u want to fly premium economy  get Air New Zealand or Cathay Pacific. Their product is much better.
label: negative

text:
Fraudulent Charges on my Credit Card I book 2 tickets in expedia for S$ 1248.  Expedia charge my card S$ 624 per ticket and total sum of S$ 1248 but then Singapore Airlines fraudulently charges S$ 1248 again.  I called UOB Bank and bank staff Sanju who was handling fraudulent transaction help line tells me that I need to ask Singapore Airlines to send the message to not to charge this amount.

I just hope Singapore Airlines stop this policy to charge again for the booking not made on their website instead made on OTA website.  Singapore Airlines can contact me on +65-91808379 to resolve the issue and arrange the refund for the amount not charged or authorized on their website.
label: negative

text: trip to singapore very helpful cabin crews and keeping right  time or early landing easy baggage facilities and comfortable fly
label: positive

text:
Red-eye flight DEL-SIN Departing 945 pm Delhi time. Boarding was a little chaotic, with Krisflyer Gold and Premium Economy boarding at the same line as Economy - don't know why they didn't queue separately. Flight was on A380 version 1, which has Suites in front, premium economy in the middle, and economy in the rear (both lower and top deck). Flight appaeared to be completely full. Crew were patient and friendly despite the normal chaos from an entirely full flight. As usual, a hot towel service pre-departure. We departed on time, and meal service started almost immediately - again, the crew coped pleasantly with somewhat demanding passenger load. IFE was the older KrisWorld system without touch screen, but adequate. Seats had adjustable headrests, and legroom was adequate. Cabin was noisy, though, as there were quite a few young children travelling with the ensuing noisy crying this sometimes entails. It was difficult to get enough sleep in Economy. Just prior to landing (about 40 mins), attendants did a quick sweep through the cabin to offer refreshments, which was much appreciated. Arrival on time, and with a very quiet landing.
It was difficult to get enough rest, but at the end of the day, this was a reflection of the passengers and full load rather than SQ. If you are lucky to get a much emptier plane (e.g. my Vistara outward flight), you may have a better experience. Nonetheless, score is for the product, not the experience. I have to say, though, that this leg was much more expensive than Vistara, so it depends whether you feel the premium is worth it.
label: positive

text: you are a great way to fly nothing short of perfect... except that the business class on the A380 is the oldest although they are going to upgrade the plane soon!
label: positive

text:
Comfortable. I flew Singapore Airlines to Munich on a cold, wet morning. I felt pretty grumpy due to the weather and the fact it was so early. 
Well Singapore Airlines turned that frown upside down.

Between the very comfortable seats, great entertainment in the seats and the lovely complimentary breakfast on board my mood changed for the better.

Nice job guys!
label: positive

text:
First class food Travelled from Man to BKK via Singapore and return. Outbound flight was on an Airbus 590 with the skewed sleeping arrangement which I found to be most uncomfortable. Although the seat was wide it lacked support for the lower back and I thought that the TV screen was much too close to the seat. The flight from Singapore to BKK on the B787 was little better as the seat was very narrow and the partition dividing the seats made it feel very claustrophobic. Again, I found there to be a lack of lower back support. This time the TV screen was further away. The return flights were very similar.
However, where Singapore airlines does score highly is in the way that the cabin crew look after the passengers; service was superb and nothing was too much trouble. Food also was so much better than any other airline we have travelled on, especially the Book The Cook option. Also, the lounges, with the exception of the one in Manchester, were first class with an excellent choice of food available. Despite my criticism of the seats I would definitely fly Singapore again.
label: positive

text:
Worst travel experiences for family with toddle. My 2 years old baby was too tired after nearly haft day discover the terminal so he slept right after enter the airplane. But then he was asked to sit up for landing off. Though I tried to explain that he has just slept and we already set the belt on him or I hold him with me but all the crew don’t care about that and still ask me to keep him sit up. My boy then cry out lound for nearly 15mins while the plane go around before landing off but the crew still don’t care at all. Later, he awake and can’t sleep again.

Don’t understand  why a 5 stars airlines have that stricky way to deal with baby. 
This might be the first and also the last time me and my family flight with Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text: Flight Enjoyable flight. No problems at all with the booking or checkin from either end. Very pleasant cabin crew.
label: positive

text: Best  Simply the best airlines of this era. Good food. Nice comfortable seating. Take off n landing on time. Best behaviour of crew
label: positive

text: Excellent service but the A380 is a old product We though this flight has two stops, Frankfurt and Singapore, the ability to sleep on flat bed was wonderful (we scored bulk head which make a large difference). The A380 used on the leg NYC to Singapore is old and showing it's age - the screen was big but was worn out resulting in hardly able to view in unless in complete darkness, this contrasted to the Singapore Sydney leg with a Boeing 777 which was near new and a more comfortable product. Service was impeccable and preordering meals is a great service
label: positive

text:
Just OK I was on the premium economy from Japan to Singapore and business on return.
The Premium economy is just economy plus by a slightly extended seat. It is fine but not terribly impressive.  I took the night flight and booked the business to sleep well. But the seat is very strange. Huge in width but short when making flat position.  This forces passengers to sleep diagonally.  I tried to make it a couch position, but it was not possible. It was a very strange experience, and naturallly I could not sleep well.
label: neutral

text: A Long flight from Houston to Singapore For a long trip (22.5hrs there and 23.5 hrs return) we chose Premium Economy... We made the correct choice.. wider seats with good leg room... service was excellent food very good with good selection of beverages ... snacks and water where offered ... good movie channels... would / will fly again...
label: positive

text:
Beware I paid for a business class ticket. Was surprised to find that there were scoot passengers on the same flight that paid a fraction of the price. 
 Apparently this happen very often. Scoot will cancel their flights when there is not enough passengers and put them on SQ flights. Scoot will give the reason as engine problems but 2 weeks in advance they informed their passengers. They can predict that they will be engine trouble 2 weeks in advance. 
The same is also happening in the economy class.  Wake up SQ.
label: negative

text:
best flight to japan This was a wonderful flight.  We flew from LAX to Tokyo Japan.  The flight is 12 hours. 
 It honestly didn't feel like 12 hours with all the meals, snacks, movies, and hot towels. We were served two meals and numerous snacks.  The crew was awesome!  They were very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed.  It was a little cramped but not unbearable.  I was able to get comfortable and nap so not to bad.  I would definitely fly on Singapore again.
label: positive

text:
Nice sized business class seats The seats were a nice size with ample storage, service was good and we were well looked after. the one critisiem I would make is that being 6' tall the leg space to lie down flat was off set which for me made it slightly uncomfortable on a 14 hour flight.
However much better than some other airlines.
label: positive

text: Flight Experience on SQ37 Direct Flight LAX to Singapore i've travelled on SQ dozens of times and this is one of my best experiences. it is a long haul and the Chief Stewardess Ms Audrey is really warm and helpful. She is passionate about her job despite being in it over 25 years. She takes initiatives to replace a meal immediately.
label: positive

text: Excellent Flight Excellent service, excellent food, excellent entertainment choice, will fly again. The flight crew were very friendly, the seats and leg room was good. Good to fly with family.
label: positive

text:
" SINGAPOOR" Dont Fly Singapore if you are Coeliac or want to use the club lounge Having flown many airlines the expectation was high that Singapore would live up to the hype, they failed on all fronts, First  despite having checked when we joined, before we left and whilst we were away that access was available we were not allowed into the Kriss lounge at Heathrow as we were not Gold, but assured yes you can use the one in Singapore, Not the case.  "Meals" thats a joke if you are a coeliac, refer to the picuture of what was actually provided vs the claimed menu as provided by Singapore airlines.  As I don't drink alcohol it was necessary to chase up a soft drink as nothing was supplied at the time of the meal.  Surely they could have supplied some rice or something for the flight.
CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST
•	Fruit Appetiser: Seasonal fruit. 
•	A portion of margarine
•	Diabetic jam
•	Non-dairy creamer
•	Sugar
DINNER 
•	Hors D'oeuvre: Buckwheat salad, canned pear slices, sliced roasted chicken thigh and shaved pink radish
•	Main course: Beef, thyme and onion stew, roasted rough cut potato, roasted pumpkin and sautéed peas and onion
•	Dessert: Exotic puree with lemon verbena jelly and poach pineapple with lemon verbena. 

Finally the Seating was not cleaned properly rubbish in the seat pockets and food left on the seat from previous flight.

Still waiting for some clarrification from Singapore as to the menu fail.  Sorry but very disappointed in the flight and treatment of issues raised.
label: negative

text: Peace of mind on Singapore Airlines As a fairly frequent traveller, I always look forward to peace of mind when doing so, especially as the world is trying to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic. Singapore Airlines gives me that much needed peace of mind, without worries about inefficiency or poor service etc. I really enjoyed my two-way flight between Singapore and New York. The food was amazing on board and the service was excellent as expected. I look forward to flying with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text:
A game of two halves We have flown Singapore Airlines many times and think is a great airline. This review is about the first and last legs on a trip to the Maldives via Singapore . We went  Premium Economy and were fortunate to be upgraded to Business Class on the return. The contrast between the two Is huge. If you think of the pricing (Premium Economy is double Economy and Business is double Premium Economy), you might expect the value to reflect the same. But it doesn’t. Flights attendants are great in all classes, so it’s not about the quality of service. The standard of food offered was the biggest difference. Inedible in Premium Economy, delicious in Business. Second is the seating for overnight travel. Sort of OK in Premium  Economy, fantastic in Business.  So, if your doing the Australia - Singapore flight do it during the day and fly Economy. If you are travelling further overnight and can afford it, go Business - if you can’t afford Business go Premium Economy. 
For all airlines offering Premium Economy, the offering needs to be upped a bit to match the price point. Having said that I’ll opt to fly Premium Economy most times for that little bit of leg room and a quieter section of the plane. 
Still love Singapore Airlines, just a little (probably very expensive for them) tweak would make a huge difference.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable long haul trip  The trip was made in 23 hours.
Comfortable seats 
Enough space around you 
Very good entertainment system with large selection of new movies and big screens for watching 
Great service and champagne:-)
The a380 is more quiet though 
Good headset is provided if you don’t bring your own.
Food is average and you get enough
label: positive

text: Flying in comfort Singapore airlines has the best food and largest business seats of any carrier. Flight staff was extremely nice and accommodating.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines My husband and I have only ever travelled Economy class, and found this suitable in the past, even though we put in a bid for $1,500 to be upgraded to Premium economy, but our bid was not successful. Therefore we paid a little extra for extra leg room as husband is quite tall, which was just OK.
Nowadays all flights are heavily booked, so travelling "cattle class" is just not comfortable for me, and long queues waiting to use rest rooms is not ideal either.
We cut our long trip to Europe by an overnight stay in Singapore, the only way I could manage the long flight.
label: neutral

text: Great Service As Always Thank you Singapore Airlines for your continued high standard of service. Your staff are always friendly and accommodating. We wanted to extend our thanks to all of you as we travelled during a difficult time for all across the world and we appreciate your dedication and commitment to your passengers.
label: positive

text: Still worth the trip! I recently flew Singapore Airlines from Houston to Manchester England then on to Aberdeen Scotland and took advantage of the low fare. It was hundreds less than British and American Airlines. The flight was 3/4 full so was able to sit alone. Seats are comfortable and planes are clean. Food is ok if you enjoy Asian cuisine. This flight goes to Singapore so if you don’t like Asian cuisine, then bring your own food.  The staff is not as friendly as other cross Atlantic airlines.  I could be wrong but it is as if they don’t appreciate UK travelers.  Manchester airport is over crowded during holiday season so give yourself enough time between your flights.  If your UK flight is with FlyBe be forewarned if you have carryon luggage. They changed their policy so it is comical how they charge extra for those bags that typically can be carryons on other airlines.  If prices increase, then I will not fly Singapore to UK!
label: neutral

text: Disappointed with ground arrangement! We were being informed that flight delayed due to technical issue, without estimate time to resolve. Told them we need to catch next connecting flight but no arrangement being made, just asked us to wait. Fine. What i am disappointed with SQ is that they did not prioritize on travellers with kids, i pity the lady travel alone with his son (around 3-4yrs old) and with language barrier being unattended even though she had attempted the staff numerous times to ask for status, she even video call her husband to speak with the staff but still no staff trying to help her. Next, the person in charge even asked all the staffs to leave the station by leaving all the frustrated passengers unattended (refer to the picture, no staff at the counter). I am really surprised this happened to SQ, one of the best airlines in the world. Disappointed..
label: negative
